Advanced Smartform - Set expressions on Is properties on controls
Description:
This test will step through the setting of expressions against the "Is.." properties on controls in advanced SmartForms, and then checking that they behave as expected at runtime.
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Advanced SmartForm - Consume expressions in properties on controls
Description:
This test will have a pre-configured package that can be used to quickly test various configurations of expressions that have been set in the "Is..." properties on controls in Advanced SmartForms
 
 
Note: 
To switch on logging for all expressions. In your log4net.xml make sure you
(a)  are outputting to the debug stream…
 
        <!-- This logs to the SysInternals.com DebugView tool and should only used for troubleshooting -->
        <appender-ref ref="OutputDebugStringAppender" />
 
(b) and enable expression logging…
 
    <logger name="Aderant.Framework.Presentation.Converters.ExpertExpressionConverter">
        <level value="DEBUG" />
    </logger>
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Set Condition in Expression Editor in SmartForm Wizard
Description:
Test the usability of the expression editor
 
Can select data bindings
Used for simple expressions, if a more sophisticated expression is required, where/how is this entered?
Steps: Step 1: Open Expression Editor where available | Expected: Defaults with one condition || Step 2: Check the contents of the Property search box | Expected: Drop down shows all data items in your SmartForm AND its associated atttributes/properties (For strings, the only propety that should be available is Length. For datetimes, the properties that shoud be available are: Date, Day, DayOfWeek, DayOfYear, Hour, Kind, Millisecond, Minute, Month, Second, TimeOfDay, Year. For ViewModels, the properties .. || Step 3: Check the pop up opened from the Property ellipsis | Expected: Window should have tree with your data items and its associated attributes/properties... || Step 4: Check the operators that are available | Expected: =, !=, >,=, || Step 5: Check the data that can be entered in the Value box - for a String property on LHS | Expected: Data only valid if it is in double quotes ("xxx"). For the In operator, must be format: "x","y","z"(82 onwards, the format is ["x","y","z"]) Otherwise a validation icon should be displayed, and meaningful info is in the icon's tooltip.Null value is pickable from the variable tree (opened from the ellipsis) || Step 6: Check the data that can be entered in the Value box - for a String.Length property on LHS | Expected: Data only valid if is a positive integer. For the In operator, must be format: x,y,z   Otherwise a validation icon should be displayed, and meaningful info is in the icon's tooltip. || Step 7: Check the data that can be entered in the Value box - for an Int32 property on LHS | Expected: Data only valid if is a positive integer. For the In operator, must be format: x,y,z   Otherwise a validation icon should be displayed, and meaningful info is in the icon's tooltip. || Step 8: Check the data that can be entered in the Value box - for a Boolean property on LHS | Expected: Data only valid if it is true or false (irrespective of case). Otherwise a validation icon should be displayed, and meaningful info is in the icon's tooltip.True/False values are pickable from the variable tree (opened from the ellipsis) || Step 9: Check the data that can be entered in the Value box for a - DateTime propety on LHS | Expected: Numerous formats are valid: Date only formats (match regional settings on workstation): dd/mm/yy, dd/mm/yyyy, dd-mm-yyyy, 1st May 2012. Date AND time formats: dd/mm/yy 15:30 (= 3:30:00 p.m.), dd//mm/yy 15:30:00 (=3:30:00 p.m.), dd/mm/yy 3:30pm, dd/mm/yy 3:30 pm. If Time ONLY is entered in the value, the date component in the value will be set to the date that the expression was created/saved. || Step 10: Check the data that can be entered in the Value box for a - DateTime.Date | Expected: Valid values for DateTime.Date: (match regional settings on workstation): dd/mm/yy, dd/mm/yyyy, dd-mm-yyyy, 1st May 2012 || Step 11: Check the data that can be entered in the Value box for a - DateTime.Day (Return the day of the month (0-31)), DateTime.Hour, DateTime.Minute, DateTime.Month, DateTime.Second, DateTime.Millisecond, DateTime.Year, DateTime.DayOfYear (Return the day of the year (1-366)) property on LHS | Expected: Valid values for  DateTime.Day: 0-31, For DateTime.Hour: 0-23. For DateTime.Minute, 0-59, for DateTime.Month 1-12, for DateTime.Millisecond: 0-9, DateTime.Year: YYYY, for DateTime.DayOfYear (1-366) || Step 12: Check the data that can be entered in the Value box for a - DateTime.TimeOfDay,  DateTime.DayOfWeek (Return the weekday index of the argument) property on LHS | Expected: Valid values for  For DateTime.TimeOfDay: 15:30 (= 3:30:00 p.m.), 15:30:00 (=3:30:00 p.m.), 3:30pm, 3:30 pm.. For DateTime.DayOfWeek (0-7), || Step 13: Check the data that can be entered in the Value box for a - DateTime.Kind property on LHS || Step 14: Save expression, then re-open editor | Expected: Condition is retained || Step 15: Add New Condition | Expected: New condition added to bottom of list || Step 16: Set condition, save, then re-open editor | Expected: Condition retained || Step 17: Remove last condition, save, then re-open editor | Expected: Condition that was removed is not there

Title: (smoke test) create advanced smartform
(Smoke Test) Upgrade Existing Environment
Description: Ensures that an environment that has been deployed with an earlier release, can be successfully upgraded to the current release under test without any breaking changes. Verifies that running workflow instances and timers survive upgrade.

Title: (Smoke Test) Deploy Expert for customization workstation in Brand New Environment
Description:
This test validates that Expert can be deployed and customized on brand new environment. Deployment of a new customization workstation is the only iteration covered here. 
Everytime after a successful deployment, it is a must to see if there is a deployment.log file created in the Deployment folder in the source location. Usually if the deployment action is performed using Deployment Manager, the file kept missing.VS Install:VS should be installed with following options SQL Install:Open SQL setup.exe and go to Installation tab,Select New SQL server stand alone installation,SQL should be installed with following options:Product key: Free Evaluation,Default instant,
Steps: Step 1: Note: this test needs to be performed on either vminf301 or vminf303 Restore the VM before starting the test using VMPortal || Step 2: Prerequisite: Install software required for the Expert version you deploying such as .Net, SQL and Visual studio(See summery for more details) | Expected: Required software installed correctly || Step 3: Create C:\AderantExpert\Binaries, Get the Expert release(can be found in file://dfs.aderant.com/SCMPosting), place it in there and extract it | Expected: Binaries folder should have ExpertSource and DeploymentManager.msi || Step 4: Create new database and Restore it with the Expert DB backup(Should ask Release team for backup for Expert you deploying) | Expected: Database created and restored || Step 5: Create logins for DB owner, service users and TTQA. SQL > Security(Tab after Databases) > Logins > New loginsDb owner – cmsdbo SQL Server Authentication Login Name = CMSDBO Password = cmsdbo [Case sensitive] Enforce Password Policy = Unticked Server Role = Sysadmin  Service user – ADERANT_AP\service.expert.qa (Should be available from the search dialog window, shouldn’t need to change anything else)  TTQA1 – Aderant_ap\TTQA1 Server Role = Sysadmin | Expected: Logins added || Step 6: Check if Service.expert.qa exist in Expert db you createdSELECT * FROM HBM_PERSNL WHERE LOGIN LIKE 'SERVICE.EXPERT.QA' If not add it:DECLARE @NextKeyP as int DECLARE @NextKeyN as int EXECUTE [dbo].[CXP_CRMNEXTKEY] 'HBM_NAME', 1, @NextKeyN OUTPUT; INSERT INTO HBM_NAME (NAME_UNO, FIRST_NAME, LAST_NAME, NAME, NAME_SORT, INTERNET_ADDR) VALUES (@NextKeyN, 'SERVICE', 'EXPERTQA', 'EXPERTQA, SERVICE', 'EXPERTQA, SERVICE', 'SERVICE.EXPERTQA@aderant.com') EXECUTE [dbo].[CXP_CRMNEXTKEY] 'HBM_PERSNL', 1, @NextKeyP OUTPUT; INSERT INTO HBM_PERSNL (EMPL_UNO, LOGIN, NAME_UNO, EMPLOYEE_NAME, EMAIL, PRIVILEGE_LEVEL, INACTIVE, EMPLOYEE_CODE) VALUES (@NextKeyP, 'SERVICE.EXPERT.QA', @NextKeyN, 'Service, ExpertQA', 'SERVICE.EXPERTQA@aderant.com', 1, 'N', 'SEQ') | Expected: Service.expert.qa exist in Expert db || Step 7: Set owner as cmsdbo and Set new broker and trustworthy for Expert DB--Change DB owner to cmsdbo EXEC sp_changedbowner 'cmsdbo' --Set new broker and trustworthy ALTER DATABASE CURRENT SET NEW_BROKER WITH ROLLBACK IMMEDIATE; ALTER DATABASE CURRENT SET TRUSTWORTHY ON; EXECUTE [dbo].[SyncExpertUsersWithDatabaseUsers] | Expected: Runs successfully || Step 8: Check if you already in Expert DBELECT PRIVILEGE_LEVEL, EMAIL, * FROM HBM_PERSNL WHERE EMPLOYEE_NAME like '%<First>%' If you aren’t in the db then use the following SQL to hijack an existing user in the database:UPDATE HBM_PERSNL SET PRIVILEGE_LEVEL = 1, EMAIL = '<First>.<Last>@aderant.com' WHERE NAME_UNO = <###> If you aren’t in the db then use the following SQL to hijack an existing user in the database. --Update HBM tables, USE YOUR NAME  UPDATE HBM_PERSNL SET LOGIN = '<First>.<Last>',  EMPLOYEE_NAME = '<Last>, <First>',  EMAIL = '<First>.<Last>@aderant.com', PRIVILEGE_LEVEL = 1, INACTIVE = 'N' WHERE NAME_UNO = '<###>' UPDATE HBM_NAME SET FIRST_NAME = '<First>', LAST_NAME = '<Last>',  NAME = '<Last>, <First>',  NAME_SORT = '<Last>, <First>', INTERNET_ADDR = '<First>.<Last>@aderant.com' WHERE NAME_UNO = '<###>' | Expected: User exsit || Step 9: Create CMS connection file according to environment details using file attached and add place it in C:\AderantExpert\Binaries\ExpertSource\dbgen | Expected: CMS file created and saved in dbgen folder || Step 10: Use CMS tools(from ExpertSource)  and run the necessary UPDs for the current build/release on the Expert database:a) DBPREPARE.exe and prepare the database to Expert version eg. 82b) DBGEN.exe and run the latest UPD's (C:\AderantExpert\Binaries\ExpertSource\Database\CurrentVersion) | Expected: DB prepared and UPDs are run successfully without any errors || Step 11: Add the service account to the admins group on your machine Hit the Windows key and search for User Accounts (Or find it in the control panel) Click Manage User Accounts Click Add Click Browse Enter ADERANT_AP\service.expert.qa Click Check Names Click OK Click Next Click Administrator Click Next Click Finish | Expected: Service account added to the admins group || Step 12: Install Deployment Manager from the following location: C:\AderantExpert\Binaries | Expected: Deployment manager installed || Step 13: Run Application Prerequisite scripts:Open Powershell as admin and runcd C:\AderantExpert\Install\ApplicationServerPrerequisites; Set-ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned –Force; Import-Module .\ExpertApplicationServer.ps1 –Force; Install-ApplicationServerPrerequisites –expertServiceUser 'ADERANT_AP\service.expert.qa' -windowsSourcePath 'C:\Windows\WinSxS' | Expected: Script should run successfully, if any error solve the errors and run again || Step 14: Create the folder C:\ExpertShare and Allow Full Control for Service.Expert.QA by  Right click on ExpertShare > Properties > Security > Edit  > ADD > Enter Service.Expert.QA > Check Name > OK > Allow Full Control || Step 15: Follow steps 1-3 from the link to Set SSRS  report serverhttps://aderant.sharepoint.com/sites/Iknow/Expert/Lists/Posts/Post.aspx?ID=3020 || Step 16: Create new environment manifest for Customization Workstation using steps from the link bellowhttps://tfs.aderant.com/tfs/ADERANT/ExpertSuite/_workitems?id=82230&_a=edit | Expected: Deployment Manager is updated with details for the environment || Step 17: Click Validate to validate environment | Expected: Validation should pass || Step 18: Press the Deploy button | Expected: Deployment completes without any errors, services are succesfully started. FYI - Check the Deployment folder for deployment.log file and see if the Date and Time modified matches the time of your deployment time. || Step 19: Extract, build and deploy template workflows | Expected: all workflows are deployed succesfully || Step 20: Create a new domain customization via DBEditor, and apply in domain wizard | Expected: Domain customization successfully created || Step 21: Apply customization in deployment manager | Expected: Customization successfully applied || Step 22: Sanity test some of the Expert apps | Expected: Expert apps can be used

Title: Workflow Tasks-  Launch & Accept
Description:
This smoke test checks basic workflow functionality including:
- Core task functions such as accepting, saving, and completing tasks, viewing the workflow status 
- Basic administrative functions for workflow processes such as suspending and canceling workflows
Steps:
Step 1: Double click on task in Expert Assistant | Expected: Ensure the task gets opened within 5 seconds. If there are multiple task performers, the Task should open in an unaccepted state. || Step 2: If the task is in an unaccepted state, click the accept button | Expected: Ensure the task becomes editable, and the correct user name is stated as the performer. || Step 3: Select "Unaccept"  in ribbon bar | Expected: Ensure the task goes into an uneditable state. || Step 4: Accept the task || Step 5: Attempt to complete the task when there are validation errors (if there are no validation errors, create one by either removing data from a required field, or selecting "decline" and not filling in a comment) | Expected: The task is unable to be completed when there are validation errors. || Step 6: Complete some data within the task form, and choose to save and close the task. Re-open task. | Expected: Ensure that your data did save. || Step 7: From the task window, launch the Status window | Expected: Ensure the diagram opens correctly and indicates the correct status of the workflow. More details expands the milestones and includes task status || Step 8: Enter a note in the task embedded notes container of a task (A little button in the bottom right). Set this as high priority and attach a file with size < 20 Mb. Select "Save task" and choose to post the note | Expected: Open the notes manager from the notes option in the toolbar. You should see the previously created note. || Step 9: Append another note to the notes conversation | Expected: Ensure this is saved. Close notes manager. || Step 10: Fill in all mandatory fields and complete the task | Expected: Check that the task has been successfully completed. || Step 11: Launch Expert Assistant from Start menu (CO/MSI install), and navigate to Task Inbox | Expected: Ensure WF tasks appear in your "My Task" List of your inbox. Title states the display name, and the started date in PC time. || Step 12: Reassign one task to another user with  different priority | Expected: Task is reassigned with correct priority || Step 13: Refresh the task list and check the task | Expected: The task should be disappeared in the task list || Step 14: Share a task to another user , with different priority | Expected: Task is shared with correct priority || Step 15: Navigate to the processes list | Expected: Ensure there is a list of Processes with the appropriate start date. || Step 16: For a running process that has open tasks, suspend the process by right-click "suspend". | Expected: Ensure that the icon changes to suspended and any active tasks are no longer visible in any task lists || Step 17: Resume the suspended process | Expected: Ensure the icon changes back to running. and the task is returned to user's task list. || Step 18: Select a process and cancel it. | Expected: Ensure this is performed correctly, and the icon changes to canceled. Open the status window and ensure the state is cancelled (may change to "complete" but must state the workflow was actually cancelled). Navigate to task list, and ensure that the task is removed. || Step 19: Pre condition - Workflow running on environment .                                                                 Run the following script: select*
from WFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARY s
inner join WFM_ACTIVITY_EVENT_TRACK e on s.WORKFLOWINSTANCEID=e.WORKFLOWINSTANCEID and e.CUSTOMTRACKRECORDNAME='WorkflowReferencesTrackingRecord'
where
s.PUBLICDATAVALUE1 is null and
s.PUBLICDATAVALUE2 is null and
s.PUBLICDATAVALUE3 is null and
s.PUBLICDATAVALUE4 is null | Expected: No results should be found.  Public data values in  WFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARY should not be null.

Title: (Smoke Test) Test that Administration tasks can be performed on Workflows using the Expert Assistant Process plug in
(Smoke Test) Customisation workstation pre-req setup
(Smoke Test) Deployment to Customisation workstation
(Smoke Test) Framework Applications
Steps: Step 1: Launch Security Manager from the Expert Share folder as a P1 user | Expected: Security Manager launches and help icons load correct pages User can be seen in the Administrators group on the Users tab || Step 2: Check navigation of the module policies, data policies, resources, users, search | Expected: Able to navigate the tabs and screens without errors || Step 3: Set yourself to be able to act on behalf of the TTQA3 user. | Expected: Able to assign proxies. When using EA, you can switch user between your account and TTQA3. || Step 4: Give yourself the Advanced Workflow License and TTQA3 the following policies: FileOpeningWorkflowStarters EmployeeIntakeWorkflowStarters | Expected: TTQA3 is able to run File Opening and Employee Intake workflows. NOTE: you should log in as the TTQA3 to test it. Do not use the proxy user function. || Step 5: Launch Configuration Manager from the Expert Share folder as a P1 user | Expected: Configuration Manager launches without any errors, and displays ALL config, regardless of user, user group etc || Step 6: Add a config setting:All Settings | Technical | Framework | (Right-click)| AddName = TestDatatype = TextValue = 'Hello World!'Description = 'This is Test application' Package:- Pre 80SP3 - Assign to the package you created- Post 80SP3 - Package not required | Expected: Pre 80SP3 - Accepts setting changes and assigns to the package without errorPost 80SP3 - Accepts setting changes without error || Step 7: Close Configuration Manager || Step 8: Check Security is working by attempting to launch Configuration Manager using non P1 user | Expected: Configuration Manager does not open, permission error message || Step 9: Launch Configuration Manager from the Expert Share folder as a P1 user || Step 10: Delete the Config setting you just created | Expected: Configuration no longer appears in Configuration Manager || Step 11: Pre 803 onlyLaunch MTI Manager from Expert Share using the administrator login | Expected: MTI Manager launches without any errors || Step 12: Pre 803 onlyConnect to integration service - Right-click on service connections and connect, then select activity monitor | Expected: connects and runs activity monitor || Step 13: Pre 803 onlyOpen SQL Server and open the Expert database. Edit the record in HBM_PARMS table: Change CLNT_NUMERC to 'Y' and CLNT_LENGTH to 8. | Expected: Updates are reflected in the activity monitor. Open Configuration Manager and go to 'All Setting' => Business => Hub=>ClientCode. Click on the config values in ths folder and ensure the values are: MaxLength=8. RESET to original value when finished this step. || Step 14: Launch Expert Assistant from the Expert Share folder as a P1 user || Step 15: Search Clients, Matters, and Employees | Expected: Searches return results as expected || Step 16: Detach EA | Expected: EA continues to function in the same way || Step 17: Launch Expert Administration from the Expert Share folder as a P1 user. || Step 18: Expand and load all the plugin pages for all the applications (you may need security for Budgeting and Collections - SP2).  Check packages are required for all pages except some Time and Expenses pages.  On one page, edit some settings, save and check the changes follow through on the respective app. | Expected: All plugins and pages load without errors. A package must be selected before you can save any changes made on most of the pages. Any edits made to the settings follow through to the app the changes relate to. || Step 19: Post 82SP2 Be sure to check pages that use a boolean expression editor load as expected. E.g. WIP Aware -> Configuration Options. Then click Advanced.Inquiries -> Constraint Sets -> Working Timekeeper (Not Available in 811)

Title: (Smoke Test) MTI Manager
DONT USE (Smoke Test) Customization End-to-End 01 - Create Basic SmartForm
Steps: Step 1: Pre-Req: You need to have Advanced Workflow License rights in Security manager Please make sure you have local deployment of the build you are testing. You will need it in test 04 to import package. || Step 2: Go through the wizard and select 'Create New SmartForm' then Enter details for the SmartForm.Name: 'CustomizationTest'Category: Create a new category - 'CustSmokeTest'Description: Enter a simple descriptionType: Leave default of 'Single Form' || Step 3: Customization Package: Pre 80SP3: Create new package - 'CustSmokeTest'Post 80SP3: Leave the field blank | Expected: Pre 80SP3: The new package is created and selectedPost 80SP3: Package is not required (Optional) || Step 4: Configure the smartform:Leave Display Columns default as 'Two' (post 80 only) Leave Scripting Required unchecked || Step 5: Use Add/View parameters to add data contracts: a) Client b) String (name = 'Name', desc = 'Your name'), c) Boolean (name = 'AcceptTandC', desc = 'Accept terms and conditions'), d) Datetime (name = 'StartDate', desc = 'Commencement Date'), e) Int32 (name = Quantity, desc = 'Number of children'), f) Decimal (name = 'Balance', desc = 'Bank balance'), g) String (name = 'MoreInfo', desc = 'More information about yourself')Post 82SP2:h)  A custom Entity (e.g. PRIORITY_LIST)(Note: If the custom entity does not exist already in the environment you are using for testing, you will have to create a new table for it in DBEditor, add that table to the model via domain wizard, and then apply customizations in deployment manager) | Expected: Contracts added should appear on the list || Step 6: Expand Client and check, 'DisplayName', 'DepartmentId', 'OfficeId', ProfitCenterId' | Expected: Client can be expanded and its properties can be selected || Step 7: Configure smartform controls using the data contracts:Name - TextBox (default), set: Prompt = "What is your name?" (freeform text), IsRequired=True || Step 8: AcceptTandC - Checkbox (default), set: Label to "Accept T & C", Tooltip "Check this box if you accept the Terms and Conditions" (freeform text) || Step 9: StartDate - DatePicker (default) || Step 10: Quantity - NumericBox, set: Decimal Places=0, Minimum=0, Maximum=30, Tooltip="How many children do you have?" (freeform text) || Step 11: Balance - NumericBox, set: Decimal Places=2, LeadingText=$ || Step 12: MoreInfo - AdvancedTextBox, set: ColumnSpan = True, Minimum Lines=3, Maximum Lines = 5, SpellChecking=True, ExpansionCodes=True || Step 13: Client - SearchBox, set: Data Provider=Client, BindTo=SelectedItem || Step 14: ClientOfficeId - SearchBox, set: Label=Office, DataProvider=Office, BindTo=SelectedItemId || Step 15: Client.DepartmentId - DisplayText, set: Label=Department, DataProvider= Department, DisplayFormat = Standard || Step 16: Client.DisplayName - TextBox, IsReadOnly='True' || Step 17: Client.ProfitCenterId - SearchBox, set: Label=Profit Center, Data provider = Adhoc list Create new, Click on ... next to Adhoc List Items and add few times to list. eg PrimaryText: Auckland, SecondaryText: New Zealand, CodeText: AKL  You should add several items in the same style. Save list by adding meaningful name and description. New list name should show in Data provider, make sure to select it AND that its bound to SelectedItem and not SelectedItemId || Step 18: Arrange the order of the Visible Items using the UP/DOWN arrows. Order should be: Name, AcceptT,StartDate,Quantity, Balance, MoreInfo, Client, Client.OfficeId, Client.DisplayName, Client.DepartmentId', Client.ProfitCenterId || Step 19: Add a Divider: Click on the DOWN arrow on the Add/View Items button and select Divider. Once you see a Divider item in the list, move it so it is after 'MoreInfo' and before 'Client' || Step 20: Press the Save button || Step 21: Press the 'Preview'button | Expected: The preview pop up should look like the attachment to this test called: 'BasicSFPreview.png' || Step 22: Finish the SFWizard without any other changes | Expected: SF is saved, view in Configuration Manager Technical.Presentation.SmartForms.

TextBox (default), set: Prompt = "What is your name?" (freeform text), IsRequired=True || Step 9: AcceptTandC - Checkbox (default), set: Label to "Accept T & C", Tooltip "Check this box if you accept the Terms and Conditions" (freeform text) || Step 10: StartDate - DatePicker (default) || Step 11: Quantity - NumericBox, set: Decimal Places=0, Minimum=0, Maximum=30, Tooltip="How many children do you have?" (freeform text) || Step 12: Balance - NumericBox, set: Decimal Places=2, LeadingText=$ || Step 13: MoreInfo - AdvancedTextBox, set: ColumnSpan = True, Minimum Lines=3, Maximum Lines = 5, SpellChecking=True, ExpansionCodes=True || Step 14: Client - SearchBox, set: Data Provider=Client, BindTo=SelectedItem || Step 15: ClientOfficeId - SearchBox, set: Label=Office, DataProvider=Office, BindTo=SelectedItemId || Step 16: Client.DepartmentId - DisplayText, set: Label=Department, DataProvider='Department, DisplayFormat = 'Standard' || Step 17: Client.DisplayName - TextBox, IsReadOnly='True' || Step 18: Client.ProfitCenterId - SearchBox, set: Label=Profit Center, Data provider = Adhoc list Crate new, Click on ... next to Adhoc List Items and add few times to list. eg PrimaryText: Auckland, SecondaryText: New Zealand, CodeText: AKL  You should add several items in the same style. Order should be: Name, AcceptT,StartDate,Quantity, Balance, MoreInfo, Client, Client.OfficeId, Client.DisplayName, Client.DepartmentId, Client.ProfitCenterId || Step 20: Add a Divider: Click on the DOWN arrow on the Add/View Items button and select Divider. Once you see a Divider item in the list, move it so it is after 'MoreInfo'and before 'Client' || Step 21: Press the 'Preview'button' | Expected: The preview pop up should look like the attachment to this test called: 'AdvancedSFPreview.png' || Step 22: Finish the SFWizard without any other changes | Expected: SF is saved || Step 23: Back in the editor in Visual Studio, save the SmartForm || Step 24: Add custom controller logic: In Solution Explorer, right-click on the SmartForm in Solution Explorer and select 'Add Custom Smartform Logic' | Expected: CSharp file is created with name like 'STAdvancedSF.Custom.cs'. See sample in attachment(Note: if you getting error for using Aderant.Framework; you will have to add the reference manually, can be found in ExpertShare) | Expected: This replaces what was previously stored in SFW scripting points in IronPython controllers that are genereated for BASIC SmartForms. i.e. OnLoaded, OnValidate, OnDataChanged, OnChange || Step 26: Right-click on the SF Library, build, and re-generate all SmartForms | Expected: Progress bar indicates all SmartForms are re-generated || Step 27: Right-click on the SmartForm project and select 'Publish SmartForms to Local'. Title: DONT USE (Smoke Test) Customization End-to-End 03 - Consume SmartForms in workflow
Steps: Step 1: Create workflow in Visual Studio (POST 80, add the workflow to the same solution with your advanced SmartForm created in test 02). This can be done by right clicking your solution in Solution Explorer,  going to Add -> New Project,  and adding a new Expert Flowchart Workflow project under Visual C# -> Expert ->Expert Flowchart Workflowa) Name: "SmartFormTest"b) Category: "CustSmokeTest"c) Product: "Expert Workflow"d) Description: "Workflow Smoke Test" Workflow || Step 2: Add the following variables to the workflow by clicking the Variables tab on the bottom left hand corner of your Workflow.xamlx file with the Flowchart selected and then click Create Variable a) Client (type: Client), default to: New Client(). b) Name (type: String). c) AcceptTandC (type: Boolean). d) StartDate (type: DateTime), set default to: DateTime.Now. e) Quantity (type: Int32). f) Balance (type: Decimal). g) MoreInfo (type: String)Post 82SP2:h)  Custom Entity DP (e.g. PRIORITY_LIST) || Step 3: Add a SmartForm Task activity onto the design surfaceSelect the Basic AND Advanced (post 80 only) SFsNote : “SmartForm Task activity” option can be found after expanding the Toolbox (Clt +Alt +X ) > Expert > “SmartForm Task activity”. Smartforms can be added by clicking the Edit Smartforms button, selecting the relevant smartforms from the drpo down list, then clicking save. | Expected: All the variables should be mapped, and check that 'Show Title'is checked.Note : To verify this expected result, click on “Edit SmartForms” botton , in the right pane under “form parameters” section, mapping is checked for all parameters/variables. || Step 4: Set the TaskName to "Single SmartForm Test" and the workflow initiator as the task performerNote : Click the “Edit Security Plan” button located under the TaskName to assign workflow initiator || Step 5: Copy the SmartForm task activity and paste below the first one and change the TaskName to "Single SmartForm - Check data" || Step 6: Connect lines from the play button to Single Smartform Test, and then connect the lines from Single Smartform Test to Single Smartform - Check Data.  This makes it so the tasks will execute sequentially. || Step 7: Run workflow in Visual StudioNote: To run workflow mark SmartFormTest as startup project and click on run button(Ctrl+F5) on VS and click on start new in popup window.Then open Expert Assistant and double click on new task created. | Expected: First task is created || Step 8: Open task and check name control in BOTH SmartForms | Expected: Name control is required, required count on form = "2". Name control has prompt when there is no value, and it is not in focus: "What is your name?" || Step 9: Check tool tips in BOTH SmartForms | Expected: A tool tip appears when you hover over "Accept T and C" and "Quantity || Step 10: Check Start Date in BOTH SmartForms | Expected: Date Picker control allows manual entry and use of picker, default date = today's date || Step 11: Check Quantity in BOTH SmartForms | Expected: Only allow values >= 0 and <= 30 (should get validation icon etc when outside this range). Task cannot be completed if value is outside the allowable range. || Step 12: Check Balance in BOTH SmartForms | Expected: Only allows 2 decimal places, and a "$"character is prefixed to any value entered after exiting the field || Step 13: Check More Info in BOTH SmartForms | Expected: More info - Spans BOTH columns. More info - Expands up to 5 rows if more than 3 rows of data is entered (afterwhich a scroll bar appears). More info - SpellCheck and Expansion codes are enabled. Test by F7 (SpellCheck) and "="for expansion codes || Step 14: Check Divider in BOTH SmartForms | Expected: Separates Client, Office, Display Name, and Department from the other fields above || Step 15: Selecting a Client in BOTH SmartForms | Expected: Populates the Office, DisplayName, and Department || Step 16: Check Department in BOTH SmartForms | Expected: Data is displayed in format PrimaryText (Code) || Step 17: Check DisplayName in BOTH SmartForms | Expected: Is a read only TextBox control (can highlight and copy text) || Step 18: Check Profit Center in BOTH SmartForms | Expected: Is a searchbox, items in drop down come from the new ad hoc list you created. Check primary, secondary and code values for items. || Step 19: Enter/select values in all fields except 'Name' and press the 'Save & Close' button | Expected: Receive validation error prompt for missing data. Watch EventViewer as the task is saved. There should be ERROR log entries for the advanced SmartForm: 'OnValidate script for Advanced SmartForm' and 'OnDataChanged script for Advanced SmartForm' (there will be an OnDataChanged for each root level data item that was changed). 'ClientChanged' (if the Client was changed) || Step 20: Re-open the task | Expected: All values that had been entered should still be there In Event Viewer, there should be ERROR log entries for OnLoaded... || Step 21: Check the tab sequence in BOTH SmartForms by pressing tab and checking the order in which elements on the form gain focus | Expected: Default sequence should be down the first column and then wrap back up to the top of the second. || Step 22: Fill in the name field. Press the 'Complete' button and watch DebugViewer as the task is completed || Step 23: When the next task appears, check the data in BOTH SmartForms | Expected: The data from the first task is still visible

Title: DONT USE (Smoke Test) Customization End-to-End 04 - Create customization package to Import to production environment
Steps: Step 1: PRE 80SP3: a) From VisualStudio toolbar, export customization package created in previous testsb) In Deployment Manager, import the same package to the same environment | Expected: -Package is exported - Zip file created and is output to location specified in export window-Package is imported - Check that a new module security resource is created for the workflow in Security Manager under: Framework.Workflow.StartProcess.SmartFormTest/Execute || Step 2: POST 80SP3:a) In DesignStudio, navigate to Expert System -> Packages and create a new packageb) Enter name - 'CustSmokeTest'c) Using the Components window, add all the items you have created in previous tests:- Basic & Advanced smartform- Workflow- Adhoc list(Which was created for Profit center)- Custom entity If you created it in test 1d) Export the package(Note: if package export fails then see bug 239569 for work around)e) Import the package | Expected: -Packaging is available in DesignStudio-New Packages can be created-Customizations you created can be added to the package-Package is exported - Zip file created and is output to location specified in export window-Package is imported - Check that a new module security resource is created for the workflow in Security Manager under: Framework.Workflow.StartProcess.{YourCustomTestWF} || Step 3: Create a new module policy via Security Manager that has: a) The resource for the workflow is checked: > Module:Framework.Workflow.StartProcess.YourCustomTestWFb) TTQA1, TTQA2, TTQA3, and TTQA4 assigned to it as members. c) (PRE 80SP3) Select Package 'CustSmokeTest' | Expected: Note: Do steps 3, 4 and 5 on WS where you build your VS project. If you do not do these steps on Dev environment step 6 will fail as this is not allowed. (80 GA - 80 SP2): Use the Action WizardWorkflow Name: select your workflowSecurity Resource: Module:Framework.Workflow.StartProcess.SmartFormTest/Execute Package= 'CustSmokeTest' (PRE 80): Add to Configuration Manager Path: Technical>Applications>ActionsName: StartSmokeTestWorkflow Package: 'CustSmokeTest' Value: (Copy from the attachment for this step)(POST 80 SP2): Use Design Studio and create an action under Expert Assistant -> Actions MenuUse 'Workflow' activity and select the workflow you just importedClick the grey area above the workflow activity, then in properties go to Menu Item > Is Visible > Advanced, input: IsAuthorized("Module:Framework.Workflow.StartProcess.{YourCustomTestWF}/Execute") | Expected: (PRE 80 SP2) Action is visible in Configuration Manager under: Technical>Applications>Actions (POST 80 SP2) Action is visible in Design Studio under ExpertAssistant -> Actions MenuThe Action is also visible in Expert Assistant Actions menu for only the following users: TTQA1, TTQA2, TTQA3, TTQA4 || Step 5: POST 80SP3: In Design studio, add the items you created in step 3 & 4 to CustSmokeTest package you created in test 2 || Step 6: Export the customization package again || Step 7: Import the customization package into another (production) environment, Note: Post 822 before doing this you need to make sure that the custom entity you created is also present in the environment you are importing to. You can either create this manually following the same steps used to create the custom entity in the initial deployment in db editor, or instead export a gen file for your customisation and apply it using DBGen. Afterwards you would need to run domain wizard and add the table to your model, and then run apply customization in deployment manager. || Step 8: In the production environment, launch EA as a user OTHER THAN: TTQA1/TTQA2/TTQA3/TTQA4 | Expected: Action to start smoke test workflow is NOT available in the Actions menu || Step 9: In the production environment, launch EA as either TTQA1/TTQA2/TTQA3/TTQA4 | Expected: Action to start smoke test workflow IS available in the Actions menu || Step 10: Start the workflow using the actionNote: if Smart form launched with error see bug attached 222216 | Expected: Ensure that the workflow starts, and that it behaves exactly the same as it did in the customization workstation

Title: Create SF with validation rules and consume in runtime (End to End)

Title: Framework - Workflow - Tasks - Smartforms can be displayed as either Continuous or Tabbed in Approval and Smartform Tasks
Description:

- SmartForm Task Activity 
 
Check different types of SmartForm
- SmartForms

- SmartForm Grids
- Advanced SmartForm
Steps:
Step 1: Create new workflow and add an Approval Activity to it. || Step 2: View the properties for the activity | Expected: There is a property called 'Display Form As' in the Appearance section, which has a default value of Continuous. || Step 3: Add a mixture of SmartForms and SmartForm sets to the activity and leave the 'Display Form As' property as 'Continuous' || Step 4: Add another Approval activity to the workflow and set the 'Display Form As' property to 'TabPage'. Add a mixture of SmartForms (column and grid) and SmartForm sets to the activity || Step 5: Add a SmartForm task Activity to the workflow. | Expected: There is a property called 'Display Form As' in the Appearance section, which has a default value of Continuous. || Step 6: Add a mixture of SmartForms and SmartForm sets to the activity and leave the 'Display Form As' property as 'Continuous' || Step 7: Add another SmartForm task activity to the workflow and set the 'Display Form As' property to 'TabPage'. Add a mixture of SmartForms (column and grid) and SmartForm sets to the activity || Step 8: Run the workflow and check each of the tasks | Expected: SmartForms are displayed in tab format
Navigation and interaction within the SmartForms is the same as continuous format
Required count and validation/scripting work as expected
NB: We do not expect to see SF Summaries when viewing in tabbed format

Title: Set Action items to be non-proxiable

Title: Workflow permissions- proxy &  non-proxy
Steps: Step 1: In Security Manager set proxy All user setting for P0 user (i.e. TTQA1, TTQA2) . In EA  Settings, add the same user  in Manage Proxy screen | Expected: Your user account can not proxy on behalf of P0 user which has all workflow permissions on web and Apps. || Step 2: Start a workflow then re-assign the task to yourself and your proxy users (i.e. TTQA1, TTQA2) || Step 3: In EA Pro, Switch to proxy user, and open the workflow task from My Tasks widget on Dashboard | Expected: User should have access to open the workflow and make changes workflow || Step 4: In EA, switch proxy to TTQA1 and open the same task | Expected: User should have access to open the workflow and make changes workflow. App should open as proxy mode || Step 5: In EA, switch to your user and open the task | Expected: User should have access to open the workflow and make changes workflow. || Step 6: Switch proxy back to yourself then go to security manager and un-check Reassign and UnrestrictedReassign then save || Step 7: In EA, switch proxy to TTQA1 and verify changes have been applied | Expected: Re-assign and Share options are no longer visible on right click the menu, other actions are not effected. || Step 8: Switch proxy back to yourself then re-enable Reassign and UnrestrictedReassign in security manager || Step 9: In EA, switch proxy to TTQA1 and verify changes have been applied | Expected: Re-assign and Share options are enabled again || Step 10: Complete steps 1-9 which all different types of workflows (Billing, matter etc) || Step 11: Complete steps 1-9 which all different types of workflows (Billing, matter etc)  with proxy user that has p1 permission, and with no access to wokflow | Expected: 401 error should be displayed for unauthorized user

Title: Set application components to be non-proxiable
Description: Does this relate to navigate to give views, or, the ability to perform functions within those views?

Title: Ensure security resources are proxiable by default
Description:
All security resources should be proxiable by default. So unless the resource has been marked as non-proxiable via Security Manager, there should be no restrictions in the UI that prevent a user from performing an action on behalf of another user.
 
Exceptions:
In the Actions menu in EA, there are two other factors that may influence the visibility of actions when proxying other users
1. User-based config will be displayed for the actual user, not the user being proxied
2. If an action is secured, this may restrict the action being available to a proxy (e.g. the person being proxied may have security. but the proxy does not. In this case, the proxy will NOT see the other user's secured actions).

Title: Consume Expressions in Expert Web Time Card

NOTE:

Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Basic Smartform - Consume expressions in properties on controls
Description:
This test will have a pre-configured package that can be used to quickly test various configurations of expressions that have been set in the "Is..." properties on controls in Advanced SmartForms
 
 
Note: 
To switch on logging for all expressions. In your log4net.xml make sure you
(a)  are outputting to the debug stream…
 
        <!-- This logs to the SysInternals.com DebugView tool and should only used for troubleshooting -->
        <appender-ref ref="OutputDebugStringAppender" />
 
(b) and enable expression logging…
 
    <logger name="Aderant.Framework.Presentation.Converters.ExpertExpressionConverter">
        <level value="DEBUG" />
    </logger>
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from SmartForm Wizard folder earlier).

Title: Overwrite basic SmartForm expressions using context controller
Description:
Can the expression itself be overwritten in a custom controller?
Or, is it more likely that the data used in an expression is changed? Or is this not likely either?

Title: Set Not In operator in expression for Is property in advanced SmartForm
Set Not In operator in expression for Is property in basic SmartForm
Description: The Not In operator can be used for writing expressions. When evaluated at runtime, the expression is true if the data in the left-hand side of the expression is not in the set of data in the right-hand side of the expression.

Title: Use fallback properties for Is properties when expression can't be resolved - advanced SmartForm
Description:
When evaluating expressions for the "Is" properties on SmartForm controls, fallback values should be used when the expression cannot be evaluated. For example, if the expression is dependent on a property of a Client, but the Client has NOT been defined.
 
When an expression cannot be evaluated, the fallbacks for each of the IsProperties should be used:
IsRequired=FALSE
IsEnabled=FALSE
IsVisible=TRUE
IsReadOnly=FALSE

Title: Use fallback properties for Is properties when expression can't be resolved - basic SmartForm
Description:
When evaluating expressions for the "Is" properties on SmartForm controls, fallback values should be used when the expression cannot be evaluated. For example, if the expression is dependent on a property of a Client, but the Client has NOT been defined.
 
When an expression cannot be evaluated, the fallbacks for each of the IsProperties should be used:
IsRequired=FALSE
IsEnabled=FALSE
IsVisible=TRUE
IsReadOnly=FALSE

Title: Perform task actions on a SINGLE smartform task in EA task inbox
Description:
Actions performed via right click menu does the same job as the corresponding function in the smartform ribbon, but in background. 
This allow users to quickly perform actions such as Accept, Complete to single or multiple tasks without having to open the task first.
The focus of this test case is to go through the smartform actions via right click menu.
Steps: Step 1: Start FileOpening WF, Assign the intake task to yourself and another proxy user (i.e. TTQA1) | Expected: The task should appear in both of your inbox with an unaccepted state (No Icon next to the task) || Step 2: As you, right click on the task and select "Accept" | Expected: The task is accepted and is removed from TTQA1's task inbox || Step 3: Right click on the task and select "Un-accept" | Expected: The task is un-accepted and is available in both you and TTQA1's task inbox || Step 4: Right click on the task and select "Accept and Open" | Expected: The task is accepted then opened , and is removed from TTQA1's task inbox || Step 5: (Not working in 80sp2)Close the task then right click on it and select "Complete"You need manually add "Complete" this action via Action Wizard. | Expected: And error dialog pops up saying task cannot be completed due to requirements have not been met || Step 6: Open the task again then fill in all required fields then Save & Close || Step 7: (Not working in 80sp2)Right click on the task and select "Complete" | Expected: The task completes without error and move on to the next task in the workflow

Title: Multi select & actions - Common smartform task actions
Steps: Step 1: Start 5 Fileopening WF, Assign them to yourself and another proxied user (i.e TTQA1) || Step 2: As you, select all 5 tasks in the inbox then right click and selet "Accept" | Expected: All 5 tasks are accepted in a reasonable time (If it takes longer than 3 seconds, a progress bar should appear to inform the state of process) and is removed from TTQA1's inbox || Step 3: Select all 5 tasks then right click and select "Un-accept" | Expected: All 5 tasks are un-accepted and is available in both you and TTQA1's inbox || Step 4: Select all 5 tasks then right click and select "Accept and Open" | Expected: All 5 tasks should be accepted then opened, if the process took longer than 3 second, a progress bar should appear || Step 5: (Pre 80sp2)Close all the tasks, select all 5 tasks in the inbox then right click and select "Complete" | Expected: After 3 seconds, a progress bar should appear and inform that the tasks cannot be completed due to requirements have not been met || Step 6: Select all 5 tasks then right click and select "Open" || Step 7: Fill in the required fields for all of the tasks then Save & Close. || Step 8: (Pre 80sp2)Select all tasks then right click and select "Complete" | Expected: After 3 seconds, a progress bar should appear and all tasks are completed without error

(freeform text) || Step 10: Balance - NumericBox, set:Decimal Places=2, LeadingText=$ || Step 11: MoreInfo - AdvancedTextBox, set:ColumnSpan = True, Minimum Lines=3, Maximum Lines = 5, SpellChecking=True, ExpansionCodes=True || Step 12: Client - SearchBox, set:Data Provider=Client, BindTo=SelectedItem || Step 13: ClientOfficeId - SearchBox, set:Label=Office, DataProvider=Office, BindTo=SelectedItemId || Step 14: Client.DepartmentId - DisplayText, set: Label=Department, DataProvider='Department, DisplayFormat = 'Standard' || Step 15: Client.DisplayName - TextBox, set: IsReadOnly='True' || Step 16: Client.ProfitCenterId - SearchBox, setData provider = new ad hoc list (assign to same package as SF) || Step 17: Arrange the order of the Visible Items using the UP/DOWN arrows. Order should be: Name, AcceptT&C,StartDate,Quantity, Balance, MoreInfo, Client, Client.OfficeId, Client.DisplayName, Client.DepartmentI', Client.ProfitCenterId || Step 18: Add a Divder: Click on the DOWN arrow on the Add/View Items button and select Divider. Once you see a Divider item in the list, move it so it is after 'MoreInfo'and before 'Client' || Step 19: Press the Save button || Step 20: Press the 'Preview'button | Expected: The preview pop up should look like the attachment to this test called: 'BasicSFPreview.png' || Step 21: Finish the SFWizard without any other changes | Expected: SF is saved, view in Configuration Manager Technical.Presentation.SmartForms.

Title: (Smoke Test SP4) Upgrade existing environment

EA - EA Task inbox actions and UI behavior
Steps: Step 1: Start 10 Workflows (Eg. File Opening) || Step 2: Open EA task inbox and press CTRL + A on keyboard | Expected: All tasks are selected (Selected tasks are highlighted in blue) || Step 3: Right click then select Un-accept (N.B. this will not be available if you have more than one type of task selected) | Expected: All selected tasks are un-accepted (Open a task to verify) || Step 4: Select the first task on the top of the list, then scroll to the bottom of the list and HOLD SHIFT then select the last task | Expected: All tasks are selected || Step 5: Right click then select Accept | Expected: All selected tasks are accepted (Open a task to verify) || Step 6: Select the first task on the top of the list, then HOLD CTRL and select the 3nd, 5th, 7th and 9th task. | Expected: Only the tasks we choose are selected || Step 7: Right click then select Unaccept | Expected: Only the selected tasks are un-accepted (Open each task to verify) N.B. the unaccepted ones are group below the accepted ones

Title: Customize database connection string for Expert services
Steps: Step 1: This test requires an environment with no deployment || Step 2: Start Deployment Manager || Step 3: Go into edit mode and navigate to Database - Custom Connection Settings field under Environment tab || Step 4: Enter Max Pool Size = 100; | Expected: No error/validation message || Step 5: Enter Timeout=30000; after the semicolon | Expected: No error/validation message || Step 6: Enter invalid input i.e. MaxTimeouts and special characters (#?:;/@) | Expected: Field is highlighted; Accept button is disabled on ribbon; Error message saying invalid input. || Step 7: Enter un-modifiable setting i.e. Server=local; PWD=123; UID=123; Addr=local | Expected: Field is highlighted; Accept button is disabled on ribbon; Error message saying input contains un-modifiable setting. || Step 8: Remove invalid inputs added in step 6 and 7 | Expected: No error/validation message; Accept button is enabled || Step 9: Hit Accept on the ribbon | Expected: Changes are saved and visible in the field; Check your Environment manifest in Advanced edit mode, verify that the changes are saved in under expertDatabaseServer, MonitoringDatabaseServer and workflowDatabaseServer. || Step 10: Deploy Expert || Step 11: Post deployment, verify that changes have been applied to instance.config. Check under ExpertShare, C:\AderantExpert\Services and C:\AderantExpert\LegacyServices | Expected: Changes made in DM have been applied. e.g. <repository name="Release" server="wsakl001051" userid="cmsdbo" password="eozBzG3osa/FNS5EzgQb3Q==" customSettings="Max Pool Size = 100; Timeout = 30000;" />

Title: Modify DB connection settings in instance.config POST deployment
Steps: Step 1: This test requires you to have a deployment of Expert || Step 2: In the following locations, look for instance.config: C:\ExpertShare C:\AderantExpert\"Environment Name"\Services | Expected: instance.config file exists || Step 3: Edit the instance.config filesInside tag <repository name ...> add an INVALID entry: customSettings="aaaaaa" at the end of the lineYou should have something like this: <repository name="..." server="..." userid="..." password="..." customSettings="aaaaa"> Save the changesOpen Visual Studio and then open Expert Assistant | Expected: Changes made to this file should be picked up immediately and you should get errors logs in event viewer and unhandled exceptions caught by visual studio when trying to open Expert Assistant || Step 4: Edit the instance.config files againChange customSettings to a valid value: <customSettings="Max Pool Size = 999"> Save the changes and open Expert Assistant | Expected: Changes are picked up and should get no more error/exception message. || Step 5: Use system default value by removing customSettings="Max Pool Size = 999" | Expected: System picks up default setting, no error/exception.

Title: Add workflow notes using quick capture
Description:
Notes may be embedded at the bottom of workflow tasks.  Adding a note from this box, should add the note to the default conversation for that task.
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: Start a new workflow that has a task where Embedded Notes is enabled (e.g. File Opening Intake task). Open the first task. | Expected: NB: This tests does not apply to product-specific tasks e.g. Prebill Markup tasks || Step 2: Click into the Quick Capture box at the bottom of the task | Expected: Text box expands to 11 rows in heightButtons down right are enabled: Important, Attachments, Notes windowButtons below text box are enabled: Post Note, Cancel Note || Step 3: In the Quick Capture box at the bottom of the window, enter a note then press the Post Note button | Expected: On the task ribbon, the Workflow Notes button now shows a '...' on the icon instead of a '+' to indicate that there are in fact notes for this workflow. || Step 4: Enter another note using the quick capture at the bottom of the window, flag as important, then press the Post Note button. || Step 5: Enter a third note using the quick capture at the bottom of the window, and add an attachment. E.g. Word document, then post the note | Expected: Note added to top of list of conversation notes with paperclip icon to indicate attachment existsPressing the attachment icon, opens the attachment || Step 6: Start entering a fourth note, and misspell a word | Expected: Spell Check identifies as spelling error, can be replaced with suggestions or added to dictionary || Step 7: Cancel the Note || Step 8: Click into Quick Capture box again and press the Notes button | Expected: Notes window opens - defaults to opening on the default conversation for the taskPressing the Topics button (next to the Home button): shows the conversation(s) are linked to the workflow process || Step 9: Select the default conversation for the task (may be a specific name (e.g. 'Intake'), otherwise 'General' | Expected: The first 3 notes added in the quick capture of the task are visible in the conversationThe second note is marked as ImportantThe third note has an attachment which opens when you select the attachment iconThe fourth note (with misspelling) is NOT visible in the conversation || Step 10: Close the Notes window using the 'x' | Expected: No errorsOn the task ribbon, the Workflow Notes button now shows a '...' on the icon instead of a '+' to indicate that there are in fact notes for this workflow. || Step 11: In the Quick Capture box, enter some text in the box, then attempt to Save&Close or Complete the task without pressing the Post Note button | Expected: The user is prompted to save the notes change. - Yes saves the note, - No does not save the note. || Step 12: Run a workflow where the Notes Embedded property is False on an Approval Activity or SmartForm task activity, | Expected: At runtime, the quick capture box is NOT displayed at the bottom of the task.

Title: Test you can spell check in a variety of languages within smartforms
Description:
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: (1) In MSWord 2010,2012,2013, go to options-proofing-custom dictionaries, add a series of new custom dictionaries for French, Spanish, German, Hungarian, Italian and Dutch. (property may be in another location on other versions of Word) OR (2) Go to Admin App and navigate to System> User Experience > Spell Checking <Spell Checking is Available> and add custom dictionaries | Expected: Changes in (2) should be reflected in CM || Step 2: Create a new Basic smartform, include a new string-AdvancedTextBox for each of the languages created. || Step 3: Within the AdvancedTextBox properties, allow spell checking and specify the dictionary required (FR-French, ES-Spanish,DE-German, HU-Hungarian, IT-Italian, NL-Dutch) || Step 4: Create another String-TextBox called UserChoice, and a String-AdvancedTextBox called UserText - Bind the Spell Checking Language Code to the value in UserChoice. and enable Spell Checking. || Step 5: Save the smartform and load it within SmartFormation | Expected: Smart form should load as expected || Step 6: Input a phrase in each of the languages into their respective boxes (use attached doc for examples) | Expected: Each language will be recognised in its respective box and running spell check within each text box will show that spellings are correct and will also correct capatalisation. || Step 7: Input the phrases into boxes that do not match their language ie. Hungarian into the Italian | Expected: Will highlight most words as spelling errors as these are not recognised in the dictionary. || Step 8: Using the UserChoice Textbox input a language code (FR, EN, HU etc) | Expected: the spell checking in the UserText field should reflect your choice || Step 9: Add a word to one of the text boxes that is in English | Expected: Will recognise that the word is not of the chosen language || Step 10: In the spell checker add this word to the dictionary | Expected: This word is added to the default custom dictionary, as such will become a recognised word in ALL of the text boxes || Step 11: (For release prior to 80SP2) Ammend the language mapping config file (config manager-Technical-Applications-SpellChecker-Dictionatires) by creating a new config value that does not include any dictionaries | Expected: Spell checking falls back onto the default English dictionary, will no longer recognise the other languages but will still be able to spell check English. || Step 12: (For release 80SP2 and post) Ammend the language mapping in the Administration Application under the System> User Experience > Spell Checking | Expected: Spell checking falls back onto the default English dictionary, will no longer recognise the other languages but will still be able to spell check English. || Step 13: Delete the user level config value | Expected: Will be able to spell check in the above languages again.

Set the following:Data provider: OfficeFilter property: CurrencyCodeFilter value: !USD, EUR || Step 5: Add SmartForm to workflow and check searchboxes at runtime | Expected: (Attached SQL can be used to verify results)

Title: SmartForm Wizard - Usability of data provider filters in the SmartForm Wizard
Description:
Note: If a data provider already has defined filters inside Configuration Manager, these are overwritten by SFWizard generated filters (based on sequential code processing inside the Controller)
 
 
Question raised, should review ...
> Which data providers should have filters?
> What are the expected filter properties for these data providers...?
Steps: Step 1: Pre-req- Install Aderant.DesignStudio.vsix plugin from ExpertSource - Start visual studio as Administrator.- Right click on Visual Studio ribbon bar and select Aderant- Assign AdvancedWorkflowLicense policy in Security Manager to account which will be used to run the test | Expected: Aderant DesignStudio toolbar should appear. || Step 2: Pre 82SP2:- Open Smartform Wizard from Visual Studio toolbar, Design Studio or ExpertShare82SP2:- Open Smartform Wizard from Visual Studio toolbar only || Step 3: Select 'Create New Smartform' || Step 4: Enter name in SmartForm NameCreate new category in SmartForm Category || Step 5: Click Add/View Items | Expected: Parameters & Local Variables window should appear || Step 6: Search for ClientAdd client and IsAllowedSubsidiariesAdd a local boolean || Step 7: Click Done to close that window || Step 8: Click on Client Select SearchBox in control type Select Client in Data Provider || Step 9: Click Save | Expected: Smartform should be generated and saved || Step 10: Open Design Studio.Expert>Menus>Action Menu > Right Click > Add menu itemEnter item name and codeSelect Form as ActivityIn the properties menu click on Forms under Appearance pane and map the Smartform created || Step 11: Save the menu itme || Step 12: Go back to SmartForm Wizard | Expected: SF Wizard displays two new properties for the Search Box control: Filter Property, Filter ValueThe two properties are disabled until a data provider is selectedWhen a data provider is selected, the two properties become enabled ONLY IF the data provider has filter(s) available If the data provider is changed, the state of the two properties is updated to match the selected data provider || Step 13: Change the Filter Property type | Expected: Ensure that only one can be selected at a timeEnsure you cannot enter anything else in the Filter Property field except by selecting from the picker || Step 14: Check that the filter value does not permit expressions | Expected: Expressions cannot be entered in the filter value || Step 15: Where a data provider with filter types has been selected, Set Filter Property = AllowSubsidiaries for a data provider instance,  Set Filter Value = New local variable created in steps above (click on ellipsis to open window to select filter from tree of available filters for the data provider) | Expected: Start Expert Assistant | Actions | New created menuAt runtime, the search should return result which match with the result from this query when we tick the boolean itemSELECT * FROM HBM_CLIENT WHERE HAS_SUBS = 'Y' || Step 16: Where a data provider with filter types has been selected, Set Filter Property = StatusCode for a data provider instance,  Set Filter Value = New local variable created in steps above (click on ellipsis to open window to select filter from tree of available filters for the data provider) As local variable is boolean and StatusCode is string this will be invalid value | Expected: Start Expert Assistant | Actions | New created menuAt runtime, the search should return no results || Step 17: Remove the selected Filter Property | Expected: Start Expert Assistant | Actions | New created menuAt runtime, the search should all results

Title: Set filters on data provider
Description:
**Note: updated the test to be using just "OPEN" for the matter field instead of "!OPEN" as the use of the ! to filter OUT statuses (or anything) hadn't been implemented, and most likely will not be implemented** In step 3 of the SF Wizard, there are two new properties on Search Boxes that accompany a data provider. These will be used at runtime to provide a subset of the results normally returned by the data provider selected.
 
- Filter Property:            The attribute type that you may filter this data provider on
- Filter Value:                The values that will apply to the filter property selected
 
These properties will only be enabled for specific data providers for which filter properties have been allowed for. For some data providers, the available filter properties are generated, while others are specifically coded for. (What are the rules behind which data providers have filters and which ones do not?)
E.g.
- Client (specific)
- Matter (specific)
- Employee (specific)
- Office (generated)
 
 
Most filter properties only allow a single item which is either a literal value or a variable. 
> If a VARIABLE value is selected, the filter value applied to the data provider CAN be dynamically updated at runtime. Having selected a filter property that only allows single values, set the Filter Value using by which the data provider will be filtered. This property will accept values, but not expressions.
> If a literal value is selected, the filter value applied to the data provider cannot be dynamically updated at runtime. The same filter value will always apply. Having selected a filter property that only allows single values, set the Filter Value using by which the data provider will be filtered. This property will accept values, but not expressions.
 
Further examples of data providers that allow multiple filter values
Data Provider                            Filter Property 
Employee                                     EmployeeIds (expects comma-delimited list of empl_unos from hbm_persnl) 
Matter                                          Statuses (expects comma-delimited list of status_codes from hbl_status_matt)
Client                                           EntityTypes (expects comma-delimited list of db_value from cxl_code_lookup where lookup_group='EntityType')
Client                                           Statuses (expects comma-delimited list of status_codes from hbl_status_clnt)
 
 
 
 
Question raised, should review ...
> For particular filter properties, how do we know what the filter value expects?
                   a. Single/multiple values
                   b. Data type expected for filter values
                   c. Format required (codes? unos? strings? comma-delimited list? etc)
Steps: Step 1: Run SmartformWizard.exe from ExpertShare and create a new smartform || Step 2: Add a data contract of type "Client" and "Employee". For the above items, select Client, Client.OfficeId and Employee, then change control type to "SearchBox":-Client: set Data provider to Client, bind to SelectedItem-Client.OfficeId: set Data provider to Office, bind to SelectedItemId-Employee: set Data provider to Employee, bind to SelectedItem || Step 3: Use VARIABLE as filter for Employee SearchControl: a.Set FilterProperty to OfficeId - Pick property by using the ellipsis or hand type in the fieldb.Set FilterValue to Client.OfficeId - Pick property by using the ellipsis or hand type in the field | Expected: -You are able to enter text in the field or use ellipsis to pick an item from the data contract list-Filter value must match the same type to the filter property for it to worke.g. OfficeId on Employee, expects an Integer, Statuses on Matter expects a comma-delimited list of appropriate Status codes for Matters (from HBL_STATUS_MATT)-If the type of Filter value does not match Filter property, in runtime the filter is not applied || Step 4: Use VALUE as filter for the second Employee SearchControl: Add a second data contract of type "Employee" and change control type to Searchbox, set data provider to Employee and bind to SelectedItema.Set FilterProperty to OfficeId - Pick property by using the ellipsis or hand type in the fieldb.Set FilterValue to TOR - type in the field || Step 5: Use VALUE as filter for Matter SearchControl: Add a data contract of type "Matter" and change control type to Searchbox, set data provider to Matter and bind to SelectedItema.Set FilterProperty to Statuses - Pick property by using the ellipsis or hand type in the fieldb.Set FilterValue to OPEN - type in the field || Step 6: Use VARIABLE with MULTIPLE VALUES as filter for Office SearchControl:Add a second data contract of type "Office" and change control type to Searchbox, set data provider to Office and bind to SelectedItemAdd a data contract of type "String", change its name to "ListOfFilterValues" - This will be used as a variable to hold filter values for the Office Searcha.Set FilterProperty for Office to CurrencyCode - Pick property by using the ellipsis or hand type in the fieldb.Set FilterValue for Office to ListOfFilterValues - Pick property by using the ellipsis or hand type in the field(Note: we will set the value for "ListOfFilterValues" later on) || Step 7: Use MULTIPLE VALUES as filter for the second Office SearchControl:Add a data contract of type "Office" and change control type to Searchbox, set data provider to Office and bind to SelectedItema.Set FilterProperty to CurrencyCode - Pick property by using the ellipsis or hand type in the fieldb.Set FilterValue to USD,EURO,GBP,ITL,SGD,SIC - type in the field || Step 8: Save the smartform Run SmartformAtion.exe from ExpertshareLoad the smartform using "Configure Forms" buttonIn the "Data" panel, set ListOfFilterValues = "USD,JPN,NZD,ZMK,NLG" || Step 9: Select a Client and Client OfficeCheck the results of Employee search 1 (Filtered by variable) | Expected: The results should be filtered by only showing employees that has the same office code as the selected Client.OfficeVerify the results in DB: SELECT * FROM HBM_PERSNL WHERE OFFC='XXX' || Step 10: Check the results of Employee search 2 (Filtered by value) | Expected: The results should be filtered by office code TORVerify the results in DB:SELECT * FROM HBM_PERSNL WHERE OFFC='TOR' || Step 11: Check the results of Matter search (Filtered by value) | Expected: The results should be filtered by matters that status code IS openVerify the results in DB: SELECT*FROM HBM_MATTER where STATUS_CODE ='OPEN' || Step 12: Check the results of Office search 1 (Filtered by variable) | Expected: The results should be filtered by office that have currency code in: USD,JPN,NZD,ZMK,NLGVerify the results in DB: select*from HBL_OFFICE where CURRENCY_CODE in ('USD','JPN','NZD','ZMK','NLG') || Step 13: Check the results of Office search 2 (Filtered by value) | Expected: The results should be filtered by office that have currency code in: USD,EURO,GBP,ITL,SGD,SIC Verify the results in DB: select * from HBL_OFFICE where CURRENCY_CODE in ('USD','EURO','GBP','ITL','SGD','SIC') || Step 14: Change filter value after setting value in data provider (blank out if no longer within subset of current filter) | Expected: - Check data provider is fitered accruately each time the filter VALUE is changed - test changing while still in the same form

Title: Less common runtime behaviour of data provider filters

Description:
If a data provider already has defined filters inside Configuration Manager, these are overwritten by SFWizard generated filters (based on sequential code processing inside the Controller)
 
(Not such a common scenario, getting into advanced use cases, where they are more likely to create their own data provider registrations via config)

Title: Display name from HBM_NAME instead of HBM_PERSNL
Description:
One particular client (Skaddens) only have initials and last name in the HBM_PERSNL.EMPLOYEE_NAME field, but the full name details are stored in HBM_NAME.NAME, HBM_NAME.FIRSTNAME, HBM_NAME.LASTNAME etc; 
Our employee data providers display the name from HBM_PERSNL.EMPLOYEE_NAME for the search results, so when Skaddens use our employee search, the search results are not very meaningful to them.
 
This behaviour represents how the tables are designed, but to suit Skaddens situation, a new property 'IncludeNameFromNameTable' was added to the employee data provider, that is FALSE by default. This is not surfaced in the SmartForm Wizard etc, but may be consumed if required by folllowing one of the two methods below.
If the property is set to TRUE, the expected result is that the employee search will display search result names using the HBM_NAME.NAME column, instead of HBM_PERSNL.EMPLOYEE_NAME.
Note: This property only applies to search results in the drop down. Once an item is selected, the selected item will display name from HBM_PERSNL.EMPLOYEE_NAME

Title: Runtime test - Consume Data Providers Filters
