Title: Add note when re-assigning workflow task
Description:
When re-assigning a task, there is an oppotunity to add a note. This note is added to the workflow notes and will be displayed at the top of the task that it was added on. Test this functionality for a generic workflow task (SmartForm task activity or Approval activity).
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: Pre-requisites:1. Launch EA for yourself on one PC2. Launch EA for another user on another PC 3. Set up workflow with approval task, ensuring that both yourself and the other user are task performers || Step 2: Pre SP2 - Kick off the workflow from VS. SP2 & Later - Kick off the workflow from Design Studio V2 On behalf of yourself, accept and open the task from EA || Step 3: Click on the Assign button in the Task ribbon In the window that pops up, select the users you wish to re-assign to and enter a note in the text box Press the OK button || Step 4: Open the task on behalf of the other user that the task has been assigned to | Expected: The task should display the note added via the re-assign window at the top of the task window - below the ribbon and above the task header details in: (a) The Home tab (b) The Task tab The details should be: (a) 'Reassign' (b) 'Assigned to:" followed by the names of the users it is assigned to (c) The note that was entered as part of the re-assign || Step 5: Check note viewable in other features: (a) Workflow Notes button in task ribbon (b) Right-click on task in BackStage Inbox (c) Right-click on task in EA Inbox (d) Right-click on task in EA Process list | Expected: The note should be available in all of the places that Workflow Notes can be launched for that workflow (under the 'General' conversation)

Title: EA - Launch workflow notes from EA task and process list
Add custom column to domain as boolean data type
Description:
Boolean data types are now specifically supported as part of domain customization.  Previously, the Domain Wizard treated such custom columns as strings and were supported by use of a YesNoBoolean converter. Now, custom columns that are recognised as booleans may be integrated specifically as a boolean data type. A new page has been added to the Domain Wizard to provide users with the options of adding custom columns to the domain specifically as boolean data types.
 
Note:
A custom column is recognised as a boolean if is of type String/Char and has a length of 1.

Title: Set up SSRS features during deploy
Description:
During deployment, a few features are set up to enable the integration of SSRS reports:
 
??? PRE-REQUISITE CHECKS ???
- SSRS is pre-requisite???? Should deployment check it is installed before proceeding? Just show a warning??? Not be concerned??
- User specifies SSRS Web Service Url  in environment manifest - Should this be required? NO
 
- Path to SSRS Report server is registered as Reporting Server endpoint - added to clients.config file
- Path set up in SSRS with the name of your environment. Within this folder, there are three folders: Data Sources, DataSets, Reports (these are the default paths that will be used by Expert applications) 
- 'Expert' data source is set up (so you do not need to include in package, will just refer to the one for that environment). Can be used for all Expert data. 
- Default reports imported and installed via packages e.g. Licensing report
- If a path is specified, and the path does not exist --> Fails deployment and rolls back
- If a path is specified, but not available --> Deployment succeeds, no errors or warnings?
 
QUESTIONS:
- When creating reports, are we going to advise creating reports using the 'Expert' data source as a shared data source, or an embedded data source? (If the data source is specific to the report, should be embedded, otherwise use the shared data source?). 
Before exporting, connection details for data source must exist in production
               (a) Either the report must be associated with data source that is already on production server (same name AND connection details) OR 
               (b) If the report's data source name is same but connection details are different, ,must update to production details 
               (c) If the report's data source name is different to anything on production, it must be exported in package with report

Title: 05. Export SSRS reports using shared Expert datasource
Description:
Once an SSRS report has been created/customized, it can be transferred between environments using Expert customization packages. A new plugin has been added to packaging to support this.
 
PRE-REQUISITES/SET-UP:
- Create SSRS report - on server 
- Create SSRS report - file available
- Report uses 'Expert' data source (& datasets?)
 
 
--> No need to include Expert datasources/datasets in package
--> Items in FWA_PACKAGE_SSRS_ITEM that are assigned to the package being exported are defaulted into SSRS Items grid (ready for export). Looks up /Path table for matching package name and if physical path and file exists, exports file otherwise exports from server
--> Items manually added via 'Add from File' option --> Path defaults to package name but can be changed
--> Items manually added via 'Add from Server' --> Path defaults to same path as on server
--> Add From Server:  Lists ALL items deployed to the SSRS Server (not from our list in database). including reports, shared data sources, and shared data sets
--> Add from Files: Any file on system. Reatrticted to files of type .rdl, .rsd, .rds, ALL
--> On export, items are added to database FWA_PACKAGE_SSRS_ITEM
 
- If a report uses a shared data source or data set, do we need to check/warn whether it also needs to be exported? Or just rely on user's knowledge? Compare adding from server vs add from file
 
 
QUESTIONS:
What happens if:
 - SSRS Web Service Url path not specified in deployment - from file = fine, from server=nothing to export
 - SSRS Web Service Url path specified in deployment is invalid --> should have been caught in Deployment Manager
 - SSRS Reporting not installed/set up - --> should have been caught in Deployment Manager
 - Items default from DB, but don't exist in Reporting Server --> test and see what happens? Exception?
Steps:
Step 1: Pre-requisite Tests:* 03. Create action to run simple SSRS report* 04. Create action to run SSRS report with parametersPost 802 - run tests 95300 and 95307 || Step 2: Create a simple SSRS report that is NOT under the SSRS folder created for your environment by deployment. || Step 3: Pre SP2 - In Design Studio, press the Export Package button.
SP2 & Later - Design Studio V2 - Export the package from here | Expected: The Export Package window opens, and there is an SSRS Items section || Step 4: Create a new customization package || Step 5: Click on the Add from Server button | Expected: The two reports that have been deployed under the environment folder appear in the Reports data provider
The report that was NOT deployed under the environment folder does NOT appear in the Reports data provider
No data sources (including the 'Expert' data source) are in the list || Step 6: Select the reports you created using the Add from Server button | Expected: The two reports appear in the grid, 
The Item Path defaults such that:
- The report added from server has same path as on server || Step 7: Use the Remove button to delete the files and export the package | Expected: The reports are not included in the customization package || Step 8: Re-open the Export Package window and select the same package || Step 9: Again select both reports from server || Step 10: Pre SP2 - In Design Studio, press the Export Package button.
SP2 & Later - Design Studio V2 - Export the package from here | Expected: The customization package includes the files for the SSRS Items, and the Path matches the Item Path that was entered in the Export Package window, BUT excluding the environment name.
A row is added to FWA_PACKAGE_SSRS_ITEM for each of the SSRS items exported where:
         - Path matches the Item Path that was entered in the Export Package window (including the environment name)
         - Physical path is path for file if item added from file 
          - Item Path is either .rdl (for report) or .rds (for data source), or .rsd (for dataset) || Step 11: Pre SP2 - Return to Visual Studio and select the Export Package button again. When window opens, select the package previously exported.

SP2 & Later - Design Studio V2 - Select the Export Package button again. When the window opens, select the package previously exported. | Expected: - The SSRS items previously exported as part of that package are listed in the SSRS Items box
- The Item Path for these items comes from /Path column in the FWA_Package_SSRS_Item table for matching package name || Step 12: Pre SP2 - In Design Studio, press the Export Package button.
SP2 & Later - Design Studio V2 - Export the package from here | Expected: Package is created and includes items and paths as were previously exported.
For each item, if the physical path and file specified in the Physical Path column of FWA_Package_SSRS_ITEM table exists, the SSRS item is exported file otherwise the item is exported from server || Step 13: For a report that has been previously exported (i.e. appears in the SSRS Items list), delete (or move) the the report in SSRS so it no longer appears anywhere below the folder created for the environment, || Step 14: Pre SP2 - In Design Studio, press the Export Package button.
SP2 & Later - Design Studio V2 - Export the package from here | Expected: Report not listed in Add from Server window

Title: 07. Run SSRS report in production environment
Description:
SSRS reports that have been set up should run in a distributed production environment 
 
To run an SSRS report, user must have:
- Security on the action that initiates the report
- Site permissions to access the report site (individual report or at folder level?)
- Read permissions on the database
 
NB: Data within the report may be secured at row-level. The report should not display such data that the user does not have row-level security to see.
 
 
Test scenarios:
- Shared data source does not exist (does not already exist in prod environment, or has not been imported along with report) --> Action works, browser opens, then exception handled by SSRS
- Shared data set does not exist (does not already exist in prod environment, or has not been imported along with report) --> Action works, browser opens, then exception handled by SSRS
- Security for action granted/not granted
- Site permissions granted/not granted
- Database read security granted/not granted

Title: Specify SSRS Web Service Url in enviroment manifest
Description:
For any of the SSRS reporting features to be enabled for your Expert deployment, the Expert deployment needs to know about where the SSRS server is located.
 
There are two ways to make your deployment aware of your SSRS location:
- Set path while creating new manifest using Environment Wizard
- Add/edit path while in edit mode of Deployment Manager
 
 
NOTES:
SSRS is not a pre-requisite for Expert deployment, so deployment will not fail if this property is not set in your environment manifest (field not required when creating/editing manifest)
What if SSRS is installed after deployment? Is there any way of notifying/updating the Expert deployment? --> User Story 78867
Steps: Step 1: On a CUSTOMIZATION environment where SSRS is installed, but does not have an Expert deployment, launch the Environment Wizard from Deployment Manager | Expected: SSRS Web Service Url property is available in step 2, but is NOT required. || Step 2: Enter details for a customization environment and navigate to where you set the SSRS Web Service Url. Enter a path that is in an invalid format e.g. abcdef | Expected: Validation error on control, cannot proceed to next step Validation checks that url is in http format (starts with http or https), and does not contain "localhost" (should use full machine name) || Step 3: Enter a path that is in a valid format but does not exist e.g. http://wsbrl000867:80/ReportServer_SQL2008 | Expected: No validation errors, environment manifest can be saved || Step 4: Enter a path that is in a valid format but is not available e.g. http://wsakl000666:80/ReportServer_SQL2008 | Expected: No validation errors, environment manifest can be saved || Step 5: Enter a path that is in a valid format and uses localhost e.g. http://localhost:80/ReportServer_SQL2008 | Expected: validation error telling localhost has to be changed || Step 6: Enter a path that is in a valid format and IS available e.g. http://wsakl000666:80/ReportServer_SQL2008 | Expected: No validation errors, SSRS Username and password become REQUIRED || Step 7: Enter username and password for a user that has the default schema set to CMSADM for the Expert database. | Expected: Environment manifest can be saved || Step 8: In Deployment Manager, open the saved environment manifest | Expected: The SSRS path, user name and password set in the Environment Wizard is visible in the SSRS Web Service Url property || Step 9: Click on the Edit button in Deployment Manager | Expected: The SSRS Web Service Url property is enabled, and can be changed. Same validation as previous steps when entering valid/invalid paths. || Step 10: Create an environment manifest for a PRODUCTION environment where SSRS is installed on another server. | Expected: SSRS Web Service Url property is available in step 3, but is NOT required. || Step 11: Enter a SSRS Web Service Url path that is in an invalid format e.g. abcdef | Expected: Validation error on control, cannot proceed to next step Validation checks that url is in http format (starts with http or https), and does not contain "localhost" (should use full machine name) || Step 12: Enter a path for the SSRS Web Service Url property without the domain e.g. http://wsakl000666:80/ReportServer_SQL2008 | Expected: validation error telling localhost has to be changed || Step 13: Enter a path that is in a valid format and uses localhost e.g. http://localhost:80/ReportServer_SQL2008 | Expected: Validation error. Environment manifest cannot be saved || Step 14: Enter a path that is in a valid format but does not exist e.g. http://wsbrl000867.ap.aderant.com:80/ReportServer_SQL2008 | Expected: No validation errors, environment manifest can be saved || Step 15: Enter a path that is in a valid format but is not available e.g. http://wsakl000666.ap.aderant.com:80/ReportServer_SQL2008 | Expected: No validation errors, environment manifest can be saved || Step 16: Enter a path that is in a valid format and IS available e.g. http://wsakl000666.ap.aderant.com:80/ReportServer_SQL2008 | Expected: No validation errors, environment manifest can be saved || Step 17: In Deployment Manager, open the saved environment manifest | Expected: The path set in the Environment Wizard is visible in the SSRS Web Service Url property || Step 18: Click on the Edit button in Deployment Manager | Expected: The SSRS Web Service Url property is enabled, and can be changed. Same validation as previous steps when entering valid/invalid paths.

Title: Set Recognise Decimal parameter for duration picker
Description:
A new parameter 'RecogniseDecimals' has been added to specify what format to treat data ENTERED by a user in the duration picker. It is only applicable if the display mode for the duration picker is HH:MM. So assuming display mode is HH:MM, and the the parameter is TRUE, the data entered is treated as decimal, however if the parameter is false, the data entered is treated as HH:MM. If the display mode is decimal, the ''RecogniseDecimals' data entered is ALWAYS treated as decimal.
 
Currently, the 'RecogniseDecimals' parameter can only be maintained in Configuration Manager (there is no other UI to set this):
>Technical > Presentation > Windows > Controls > DurationPicker > RecogniseDecimals (default=true)
 
* Display mode: HH:MM, RecogniseDecimals=True
Data entered by the user is treated as being entered in decimal mode. 
In this case, if a user enters 
     1.5         this equates to 1.5 hours or 1hr 30 m
     1.5         this equates to 1.5 hours or 1hr 30 m
     1:5         this equates to 1.5 hours or 1hr 30 m
     1 5         this equates to 1.5 hours or 1hr 30 m
 
 
* Display mode: HH:MM, RecogniseDecimals=False
Data entered by the user is treated as being entered in HH:MM mode. 
In this case, if a user enters 
     1.5         this equates to 1.83 hours or 1hr 50 m
     1.5         this equates to 1.83 hours or 1hr 50 m
     1:5         this equates to 1.83 hours or 1hr 50 m
     1 5         this equates to 1.83 hours or 1hr 50 m
 
 
NOTE: This parameter only applies to the WPF version of the duration picker, so will not affect the duration picker on the web etc.

Title: Add Policy to a User
Description:
Verify that a user can be added to a policy.
 
1.  Open Security Manager
2.  Select Users tab
3.  Start typing in the "Select User" box as filter for the search
4.  Existing user filtered accordingly should appear
5.  Select the user
6.  In Policies, open the dropdown in the 'Add New Policy' box or type in a filter to search the policy to be added.
7.  Select the Policy.  The Policy should be successfully added.
8.  Save the changes.
9.  Reload the user and verify the added policy/policies.

Title: Copy User Security
Description:
Verify that users' policies can be copied to another user.
 
Pre-req: Verify the policies of the user to be copied to.
1.  Open Security Manager
2.  Select Users tab
3.  Start typing in the "Select User" box as filter for the search
4.  Existing user filtered accordingly should appear
5.  Select the user
6.  Select the "Copy" button
7.  In the Copy User Permission window, search for the user to copy to by typing a filter
8.  Select the user.
9.  Click "Copy Permission"
10.  Search for the user to whom the policies are copied.
11.  Verify that the policies are copied over without deleting his previous policies.
 
Verify the same when "Reverse" is selected in the "Copy User Permission" window.

Title: Search Users in Security Manager
Description:
Verify that users can be searched.
 
1.  Open Security Manager
2.  Select Users tab
3.  Start typing in the "Select User" box as filter for the search
4.  Existing user filtered accordingly should appear

Title: Security Policy, Allow, Deny, and Overriding Deny
Description: Users may be granted/denied security for security resources from more than one policy. This test covers how conflicting permissions are prioritized at runtime.
Steps: Step 1: For a given resource: deny on one policy, allow on another | Expected: At runtime, the user SHOULD have permissions to perform the function || Step 2: For a given resource: allow on one policy, overriding deny on another | Expected: At runtime, the user should NOT have permissions to perform the function || Step 3: For a given resource: allow on more than one policy | Expected: At runtime, the user should have permissions to perform the function || Step 4: For a given resource in step 3 remove from one of the policy | Expected: User should still have permissions to perform the function.

Title: Export search results
Use Filter in Resource Search
Description:
Select ClientPluginController in the Resource pane and type 'Timer' or 'Client' in the Search Result Policy filter field.
 
Test also using Data Resources.
Steps: Step 1: Open Security Manager and go to Search tab || Step 2: Filter Policies: In "Select Resources" pane, locate and select Applications.ExpertAssistant.Plugins.Controllers.ClientPluginController.Then in "Search Results" pane, type 'Timer' then type 'Client' in the Filter Policy field. | Expected: Type "Timer", the search results should not find anythingType "Client", the search results should show all policy with word "Client". || Step 3: Filter Resource: Select the highest level in the tree (Modules), then search for 'Configuration' in the Resource filter field in the Search Result pane. | Expected: All the Configuration resource remain in the search result || Step 4: Filter Users and Groups: Select the highest level in the tree (Modules), then search for any user or group in the Users and Groups filter field in the Search Result pane. | Expected: The search results will be filtered based on the user or group you typed. || Step 5: Select one of the search results and right-click then Go to Group. | Expected: Go to users tab and show all the policy for that group. || Step 6: Select one of the search results and right-click then Go to Policy | Expected: Go to Module Policies and show all the resources and members for that policy. || Step 7: Select one of the search results and right-click then Go to User | Expected: Go to users tab and show all the policy for that user.

Title: Create firm policy
Description: Firm policies ALWAYs apply, regardless of which Golden Gate application you are using.

Title: Create template policy
Description:
Template policies apply as they are consumed in specific areas. It does not make sense to set members on such policies via Security Manager. Users/user groups should only be assigned to the policies when they relate to a specific area/instance.
 
For example, several of the policies created for workflow security are template policies. Users will be assigned to these policies when they are consumed in a specific workflow. They should not apply to all workflows.

Title: Copy and link a Module Policy
Description:
Rules for linking a module policy:
1. Linking of policy only works for when a Template policy is copied as a Firm policy. Copying and linking of a Firm policy will not have any relationship between the copy and the copied versions. 
2. By Retaining the link to the original template policy:
a. only additions or deletions on the resource on the template policy will be reflected to the linked Firm policy but not the other way around
b. only additions or deletions on the members on the template policy will be reflected to the linked Firm policy but not the other way around
Steps: Step 1: Rules for linking a module policy:1. Linking of policy only works for when a Template policy is copied as a Firm policy.  Copying and linking of a Firm policy will not have any relationship between the copy and the copied versions. 2. By Retaining the link to the original template policy:  a. only additions or deletions on the resource on the template policy will be reflected to the linked Firm policy but not the other way around  b. only additions or deletions on the members on the template policy will be reflected to the linked Firm policy but not the other way around

Title: Copy Module Policy
Description:
Verify that an existing module policy can be copied.
 
1.  Open Security Manager
2.  Select Module Policies tab
3.  Click on the dropdown and select an existing module policy
4.  Select Copy
5.  Enter new Name and Description, select 'Firm' as policy type, click OK.  Save the changes.
6.  Clear the dropdown for the policy name then load the new policy.  The new policy should exist.
 
Do the same for "Template" type of policy.
Steps: Step 1: Verify that an existing module policy can be copied.1.  Open Security Manager2.  Select Module Policies tab3.  Click on the dropdown and select an existing module policy4.  Select Copy5.  Enter new Name and Description, select 'Firm' as policy type, click OK.  Save the changes.6.  Clear the dropdown for the policy name then load the new policy. | Expected: The new policy should exist. || Step 2: Check a user with this security policy, that can't proxy for any other users, can access the things this policy gives them access to

Title: Create New Module Policy
Description:
Verify that a new module policy can be created.
 
1.  Open Security Manager
2.  Select Module Policies tab
3.  Select New
4.  Create 'Firm' type of policy
5.  Enter Name and Description, click OK.  Save the changes.
 
Do the same for "Template" type of policy.

Title: Delete Module Policy
Description:
Verify that an existing module policy can be deleted.
 
1.  Open Security Manager
2.  Select Module Policies tab
3.  Click on the dropdown and select an existing policy
4.  Select 'Delete'
5.  Confirm delete in the dialog.
6.  Try to select the deleted policy.  Should no longer be present.

Title: Edit Existing Module Policy
Description:
Verify that an existing module policy can be edited.
 
1.  Open Security Manager
2.  Select Module Policies tab
3.  Click on the dropdown and select an existing policy
4.  Edit the Resources (check or uncheck the resources)
5.  Save the changes (a confirmation dialog should appear)
6.  Clear the Policy name and select the edited policy again.  Changes should be reflected.

Title: Maintain Module Policy Members
Description:
Verify that members old an existing module policy can be maintained (add to and removed from the members).
 
1.  Open Security Manager
2.  Select Module Policies tab
3.  Click on the dropdown and select an existing policy
4.  Add a new member by searching a user or group then selecting them
5.  Delete a member (user or group) by selecting an existing member then 'Remove'.  Save the changes.
6.  Try to search and load that policy again and verify the changes in the members.

Title: Package test for linked policies
Description: Linked policies can be exported, removed and imported.  Verify that no resource, member nor connection is missing when policies are exported and imported.

3.  Start typing in the 'Select Policy' box as filter for the search
4.  Existing policies filtered accordingly should appear
5.  Select the policy

Title: Secure workflow definition - start process
Description: Workflows can be secured so that sites can control which users can initiate particular workflow definitions. When a workflow is published, a resource is created and this is visible in the sercurity resource tree in the Module Policies tab of Security Manager.
Steps: Step 1: Export customization package including workflow || Step 2: Import into separate test/production environment | Expected: Security resource is created for workflow imported. In module policies, it will appear under > Framework>Workflow>StartProcess>xxxx (where xxxx is workflow name) || Step 3: Create security policy for workflow starters - assign to the same package as the workflow i. The only right that needs to be ticked is the one under Framework/Workflow/StartProcess/xxx (xxx is workflow name) ii. Add users/user groups || Step 4: Create action menu item via Action Wizard - Secure the action with the resouce created by the import - assign to the same package as the workflow || Step 5: Launch EA as a user that is in the security policy created | Expected: Action menu item is available Selection action initiates workflow || Step 6: Launch EA as a user that is NOT in the security policy created | Expected: Action menu item is NOT available

Title: Maintain User Proxy
Description:
Verify that users' proxies can be maintained.
 
1.  Open Security Manager
2.  Select Users tab
3.  Start typing in the "Select User" box as filter for the search
4.  Existing user filtered accordingly should appear
5.  Select the user
6.  Select the "Proxy" button
7.  In the "Maintain Proxy" window, search members to be added in the left side "Can act on behalf of ...", select multiple users
8.  Click OK
9.  Verify the added members by selecting each member then opening Proxy.  The selected user in step 5 should be present in the right-side of the maintain proxy window "... can act on behalf of"
 
Verify the same by using the right-side of the Maintain Proxy window and verifying the changes in the left-side of the added members.
Verify the proxies can be viewed in the proxy bar in EA for the appropriate users

Title: [Pre 80SP3] Package plugin command line functions
Description:
From the package manager command line, it is possible to list the contents of a package.
 
Command    Required switches                            Description
List                 /list, /PackageFile                                    Lists the content of a package file. A package file must be specified.
Steps: Step 1: Open CMD and change directory to ExpertShare location.e.g. cd C:\Expertshare || Step 2: List all the available commands by enter PackageManagerconsole.exe /? | Expected: This should list all the available parameters || Step 3: List contents of package: /list, /PackageFile | Expected: Lists the content of a package file. A package file must be specified.

Title: [Pre 80SP3] Create package from different applications
Description:
A package definition is the package metadata which consists of a set of attributes describing what a customization package is about. A package definition must be created before associating customized data to the package and exporting the package. A package definition is stored in the following tables:
GGRelease(.Net 3.5): FCM_CustomizationPackage table in the framework database
GGSP1RTM (.Net4.0) onwards: Configuration.FWM_Package table in the Expert/Framework database:
80 onwards: FWM_PACKAGE
 
Details:
The package metadata is stored in FWM_Package, and contained in the Manifest.XML on export:
Id                                    Customization package GUID id
Name                              Customization package name
Description                     Full description of the customization package                
Version                          Version string of a customization package (The version format is enforced) - generated during package export
Create Date                    DateTime stamp indicating when a customization package definition was created - stamped when package definition is created inUTC time
Import Date                     DateTime stamp indicating when a customization package was imported into the system - stamped during package import - UTC time
OwnerId                         This is the site owner who owns the package - site owner info is entered via the site owner plugin in InstallationManager)
Steps: Step 1: Create a new package in the following applications:a) Configuration Managerb) SmartForm Wizard for BASIC SmartFormsc) When creating ad hoc list for a SmartFormd) Smartform wizard for Advanced SmartForme) When creating new workflowf) Security policy via Security Managerg) Domain customization via Domain Wizard | Expected: The package metadata is stored in FWM_Package, and contained in the Manifest.XML on export: Id Customization package GUID Name Customization package name Description Full description of the customization package Version Version string of a customization package (The version format is enforced) - generated during package export Create Date DateTime stamp indicating when a customization package definition was created - stamped when package definition is created in UTC time Import Date DateTime stamp indicating when a customization package was imported into the system - stamped during package import - UTC time OwnerId This is the site owner who owns the package - site owner info is entered via the site owner plugin in InstallationManager)

Title: [Pre 80SP3] Packaging Part 1 - Export package with different type of items
Description:
The only place in the UI that any user should be able to export from is the Export button in Design Studio. It must be possible to export configuration that is assigned to a customization package.
 
Things to Test:
1. Export a package that contains configuration
2. The package is placed in the directory that was specified as the 'Output Path' in the export dialog
 
Package layout:          Root directory:                                    - package manifest file (manifest.xml, see Manifest format below) 
                                                                                               - other package metadata related files (eg. license agreement.txt) - packaging plugin subdirectories 
                                    Packaging Plugin Subdirectory:          - Each type of customization data that can go into a customization package will reside in its own subdirectory in a package. The subdirectory is 
                                                                                                the base location used by a packaging plugin participating in the package import/export process. 
                                    E.g. 
                                    Package Manifest                                  \ 
                                    Other plugins                                         \AdhocList\
                                                                                                   \CustomizationMetadata\
                                                                                                   \Workflow\
                                                                                                   \Configuration\
                                                                                                   \Security Policy\
Steps: Step 1: You will need 2 environments for this test, 1 environment where you create the package, and another one to import the package.Include different type of items to a package:a) Smartforms - Basic and Advancedb) Workflowsc) Category for smartform and workflowsd) Config values - Create config with different valid from and valid until dates (NOTE: Machine/User scope config does not get exported)e) Security policy and resource - with users and user groups as membersf) Adhoc list | Expected: a) In each of the listed areas, there should be a packaging control, which allows you to create new package or select an existing package, the item would then be included in the selected package. To verify this, reopen the application and check in the package control that the correct package is selected.b) When exporting workflows, you need to have the workflow.xaml opened in Visua studio in order to successfully export the workflow. || Step 2: Include domain customization to the package:a) Use dbeditor to add a custom column to HBM_CLIENTb) Add the customization to Expert using Domain wizard -> Extend existing entity -> select the same package you used in #1 | Expected: Customization data will be added to FCM_CUSTOMIZATION_METADATA table, this will the data that gets exported || Step 3: Include database updates (UPD) to the package:a) Open export window from visual studio toolbar, select the package you used in #1 and #2b) In the "Database updates" section, select a UPD file (e.g. from ExpertSource\Database) | Expected: When you export a package that contains a UPD file, all script referenced in the UPD will also be exported. || Step 4: Include SSRS items to the package (Your environment has to be configured with SSRS):In the export window, go to "SSRS Items" section and add SSRS reports | Expected: You should be able to view & select the reports available on your SSRS server || Step 5: Include Additional files to the package:a) In the export window, go to "Additional FIles" section and add any type of files (Scripts, assembly, config files etc)b) Specify installation folder, by default if you leave this as blank, the file will be installed to the ExpertSource folder. You can specify the name of a sub folder in ExpertSource. || Step 6: Include other packages to the package:a) In the export window, go to "Packages" section and add other packagesb) The order in the list will be the order when importing the selected packages, you can use the up/down arrow to change orderc) Specify installation folder, by default if you leave this as blank, the package will be installed to the ExpertSource folder. You can specify the name of a sub folder in ExpertSource. || Step 7: Export the package from design studio toolbar | Expected: You should get a dialog saying "the package X has been exported to location Y", when the package export is completed || Step 8: Check the content of the exported package zip | Expected: The package should contain all these items:a) Smartforms - Basic smartform should be a set of config values and advanced smartform should be a .dll fileb) Workflows - the workflow project bin folder should be packagedc) Category for smartform and workflows - should be a set of config valuesd) Config valuese) Security policy and resourcef) Adhoc listg) Domain customization metadata - should be the same as FCM_CUSTOMIZATION_METADATAh) UPD & Scripts - Should contain all scripts referenced in the UPDi) SSRS reportsj) Additional filesk) Other packagesl) Manifest file that contains info about the package and info on UPD/SSRS/File/Package items

Title: [Pre 80SP3] Packaging Part 2 - Import package with different type of items
Steps: Step 1: Import the package from Part 1 to another environment using deployment manager, then check the following items | Expected: a) Package can be imported using Deployment managerb) The package definition is created in FWM_PACKAGE table || Step 2: Smartforms - basic and advanced | Expected: a) Basic smartforms are added to config, under Technical > Presentation > Smartforms > [CategoryName] > [SmartformName]b) Advanced smartform .dll files are added to ExpertShare location and regesistered under config as well.c) Basic smartforms can be accessed from smartform wizard || Step 3: Workflows | Expected: a) A new instance of the workflow should be created under IIS > Expert_Local > Workflows > [WorkflowName] > [VersionNumber] b) If you imported the same workflow multiple times, the version number will increment by 1 everytime you do so.c) Existing IIS instances of the workflow are not affected or removed d) A workflow definition record is created in the WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION table e) Security resource is created under Module Resources > Framework > Workflow > StartProcess > [WorkflowName] || Step 4: Category for smartforms and workflows | Expected: Imported categories can be selected from the category dataprovider (From workflow properties window or smartform wizard) || Step 5: Config values | Expected: Should be created with correct path. If the path does not exist prior, they should have been created. || Step 6: Security policy and resource | Expected: Security policy and selected resources and member should be created and available in security manager || Step 7: Adhoc list | Expected: Imported Adhoc lists should be available in smartform wizard, data provider setting or Expert Admin app > Expert system settings || Step 8: Domain customization | Expected: Domain customization metadata should be added to FCM_CUSTOMIZATION_METADATA table || Step 9: UPD & Scripts | Expected: The UPD should be ran against the environment, check the db update records in CMS_DB_UPDATE table to verify that UPD has been ran || Step 10: SSRS reports | Expected: Imported SSRS reports should be added to the SSRS site and viewable || Step 11: Additional files | Expected: Should be installed to the correct location || Step 12: Other packages | Expected: Other packages should also be imported to the Expert system

Title: Export customization package - multiple workflows
Description:
The only way that multiple workflows can be exported in the same package is if you 
- first export workflow (while active and open in Viisual Studio)
- import the package that was exported
- open the second workflow
- export package again while second workflow is active and open in Viisual Studio

Title: [Pre 80SP3] Export package from Design Studio Toolbar
Description:
The only place in the UI that any user should be able to export from is the Export button in Design Studio. It should not be available from the Deployment Manager.
 
(a) The 'Export Package' button should always be available in Design Studio
(b) If a workflow.xamlx is open at the time the button is pressed, the default selection in the 'Package' search control in the export dialog should be the package on the selected workflow.
(b) If NO workflow.xamlx is open at the time the button is pressed, there will be no default selection in the 'Package' search control in the export dialog
(c) In the export dialog, you should not have the abiility to create new packages
(d) In the export dialog you should not have the option to export
(e) The 'Output Directory' is the path that the zipped up package will be placed
(f) The Ad hoc files controls (listbox, Add/Remove buttons) allow the user to add miscellaneous files to be included in the zip
(g) Check help content makes sense

Title: [Pre 80SP3] Export package more than once - different items
Description:
A deployment should be able to handle the exporting the same package more than once. 
Each time, the contents may change depending on what is CURRENTLY assigned to it, and the previous package may be overwritten if it is saved to the same location.

Title: [Pre 80SP3] Export package - Category test
Description: There are several scenarios around the exporting of a package that contains categories (which may have been added from SmartForms etc). This tests how the categories are added to the package on export.

Title: [Pre 80SP3] Import package - workflow
Description:
Add Workflow Definition
Check the workflow has been published. 
(a) It should be viewable in IIS, under:
Sites/Default Web Site/Expert_local/Workflows/xxx/yyy
xxx - name of workflow
yyy - published version number
(b) The workflow should be added to WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION TABLE. If there is already a published workflow by the same name, the version number will increment for the next one that is imported.
 
Add milestone and SmartForm metadata for workflow definitions
When a package containing a workflow is imported into an environment (i.e. the workflow is published), metadata will be added to the database for the milestones and SmartForms in that workflow.
1. Import the workflow package for the template FO workflow 
2. Check the FWM_WORKFLOW_MILESTONE and FWM_WORKFLOW_SMARTFORM tables to see that there is a row in the table for EACH milestone and EACH SmartForm contained in EACH published workflow
(a) To get workflow definition uno:
select * from WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION
(b) Substitute workflow definition uno into the query below and run. There should be a row in the table for EACH milestone contained in EACH published workflow
select * from FWM_WORKFLOW_MILESTONE where WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION = 'xxx'
(c) Substitute workflow definition uno into the query below and run. There should be a row in the table for EACH SmartForm contained in EACH published workflow
select * from FWM_WORKFLOW_SMARTFORM where WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION = 'xxx'
 
Import multiple versions of workflow definitions
A workflow definition is created EACH time a package containing a workflow is published (i.e. imported). 
E.g. There may be 4 published workflow definitions for File Opening in the WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION table
In this case, workflow metadata should be added for EACH of these definitions
For each row in WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION, there should be corresponding rows in 
(a) fwm_workflow_milestone
(b) fwm_workflow_smartform
1. Import version 1 of workflow (FOV1Unchanged.zip) - imports workflow names 'MatterIntakeV1Unchanged'
2. Import version 2 of workflow (FOV1Updated.zip) - imports workflow names 'MatterIntakeV2UpdatedMilestones'
3. For EACH of the imported workflows
(a) Get workflow definition uno:
select * from WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION
(b) Substitute workflow definition uno into the query below and run. There should be a row in the table for EACH milestone contained in EACH published workflow
select * from FWM_WORKFLOW_MILESTONE where WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION = 'xxx'
(c) Substitute workflow definition uno into the query below and run. There should be a row in the table for EACH SmartForm contained in EACH published workflow
select * from FWM_WORKFLOW_SMARTFORM where WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION = 'xxx'

Title: [Pre 80SP3] Import package - Category test
Description: There are several scenarios around the importing of a package that contains categories (which may have been added from SmartForms etc). This tests how the list of categories in the FWM_CATEGORY table in the database is updated on the import.

Title: [Pre 80SP3] Packaging use case - Import package from another owner
Description:
Test that you can import a package that has a package owner that is DIFFERENT to the system owner on the environment you are importing to. This is important for support, when our clients send us packages for issues they need us to investigate.
 
To find out who the owner of the package is:
Details are in the manifest.xml in the <owner> tag
 
To find out who the system owner for an environment is:
SELECT NAME,* FROM SECURITY.FWM_OWNER WHERE IsSystem = '1'

Title: [Pre 80SP3] Packaging use case - Import package more than once
Description:
Item should not be added twice
 
E.g. For SP1, security policies were getting duplicated with each import, so a new one was added each time....should only be ONE..
Need to also check other elements like configuration etc..

Title: Remove Customisation Package - Domain View Component
Description:
Domain View/Component Packaging Plugin responsible for handling import, export and upgrade logic
 
- If a package has domain customization metadata attached, when the package is removed via Deployment Manager, the customization metadata will be removed from the FCM_CUSTOMIZATION_METADATA table, but, the update Aderant.Query.dll and associated changes made to stored procedures, SmartForms that have since been modifiied but belong to different packages etc, will need to be cleaned up independently.

Title: [Pre 80SP3] Packaging use case - Remove multiple content types in package
Description:
A package uninstall process attempts to remove a customization package from a system. This involves calling packaging plugins to handle the removal of customized data associated with the package for all package content types and unregistering the package from the system by removing the package definition record. This process could leave existing data in an inconsistent state. This would need to be fixed manually.
 
Package that is removed should include:
- Configuration
- SmartForms
- AdhocLists
- Security Policies
- Domain Customizations
 
Items that will not be removed:
- Workflows
- Additional files
- Categories
- Advanced SF assemblies
 
NOTE:
- Cannot remove published workflows - must be removed manually from IIS
- The 'Remove'  button for packages in Deployment Manager does not remove any workflow definitions
- NB: Running instances in a workflow authoring environment can be removed via the Run Wokrflow dialog window when you press the Start without Debugging button in Design Studio

Title: SSRS Licensing Report exists
Description:
A default SSRS Licensing Report is installed via deployment. This should be found in the Reports folder created specifically by deployment.
(This license is installed with the Common Applications role, so ALL Expert deployments with SSRS should get the licensing Status Report installed) 
 
E.g. In SSRS: 
{EnvironmentName}\Reports\Licensing\StatusReport
Steps: Step 1: Drill down folers LOCAL \ REPORTS | Expected: There is a folder called 'Licensing', which contains a report called 'StatusReport'

Title: Install License for single resource
Description:
A license may be created for a set number of users, which is shipped to clients as a package that they install via our packaging mechanism.
This test will verify a license that is managed by the number of users, and does NOT have a fixed duration or time component.
 
When a license package is imported, 
1. An license record is created in Configuration Manager
  (a) Configuration path for item: Technical.Licensing.License.{LicenseName} 
       (The LicenseName is derived from the name of the module in which the licensed resources reside)
  (b) Contains the following details: Licensee name, Secured Resource, User Limit, User Type (User/Timekeeper) , Expiry Date
  (c) Has scope of System, and has Aderant package assigned to it (which one?)
  (d) Should be digitally signed so it cannot be edited on site by our clients. It should only be created (& updated?) by Aderant services
 
2. Which then kicks off a status update, resulting in a status record in Configuration Manager
   (a) Configuration path for item: Technical.Licensing.Status.{ResourceName} 
   (b) Contains the following details: 
               ResourceName, IsLicensedStatus, BreachTimeStamp
               Licensee name 
               List of licenses that the resource is contained, current user count, and violation message if currently in breach
               Signature information (to ensure the record cannot be manually overwritten)
 
NOTE:
A user is classified as a timekeeper if:  TIME_OK ON TBM_PERSNL = 'Y'
 
Pre SP2 - Configuration Manager was a separate element and could be launched from the Expert Share folder.
 
SP2 & Later - With the Design Studio project, Configuration Manager will be clubbed with other wizards (like Security Manager, Action Wizard etc) and hence wouldn't be able to launch separately. It could be launched/accessed from Design Studio.
Steps: Step 1: Import attached license package via Deployment Manager for: - n users - unlimited time period | Expected: An item is created in Configuration Manager   (a) Configuration Path for item: Technical.Licensing.License  (b) Configuration Name: User15UnlimitedCollections  (c) Contains the following details:                 Licensee: Clifford, Maximillian & Scott                Resource: ExpertCollections.ExpertCollections                Expiry Date: unlimited                User Limit: 15                User Type: User  (d) Has scope of System (no package visible)  (e) Should be digitally signed so it cannot be edited on site by our clients. It should only be created (& updated?) by Aderant services. || Step 2: Check the status record created for the resource within the license: | Expected: Status record is created in Configuration Manager.   (a) Configuration Path for item: Technical.Licensing.Status  (b) Configuration Name: ExpertCollections_ExpertCollections  (c) Has scope of System (no package visible)  (d) Should be digitally signed so it cannot be edited on site by our clients. Title: Create & import new license for single resource
Description:
NOTE: SP2 and later, only need licenses for Collections, Expenses and OTG. Instead of creating licenses for Prebill, use ExpertCollections.ExpertCollections OR Expenses.ExpensesApplication
 
LicenseGenerator.exe is a console application that generates a license package that can be imported into a target deployment.
 
NOTE:​ The machine on which LicenseGenerator.exe is run must have the Aderant code signing certificate installed in the Trusted Publishers store.​
(The certificate can be found in Source Control: {BranchName}\Modules\Build. Infrastructure\Src\Build\aderant.pfx, and installed by double-clicking on it. When going through the wizard, ensure you select to store it in the Trusted Publishers location).
 
PARAMETERS:
/licensee:<string> License owner, must match target system owner i.e. /l:[Expert System Owner]. (short form /l) 
/module:<string> License module, the name of the module being licensed i.e. /m:ExpertTimeOnTheGo. (short form /m) 
/resource:<string> Security resource path i.e. /r:ExpertTime.ExpertTimeApplication, ExpertTimeOnTheGo.ExpertTimeOnTheGoApplication (short form /r) 
/expiry:<string> License expiry, the expiry date of the license, unlimited if not specified i.e. /e:31-03-2016 or /e:unlimited or /e:"1 May 2016". (short form /e) 
/userlimit:<string> License user limit, the number of users allow under this license, unlimited if not specified. (short form /ul) 
/usertype:<string> License user type, the type of user this license covers. "user" or "timekeeper", "user" if not specified. (short form /ut) 
/outputfolder:<string> The destination folder for the output, default is the execution folder. (short form /of)
 
EXAMPLES:
​​​Limited Expiry and limited Timekeepers license
LicenseGenerator.exe /l:"foo, foo and bar" /m:ExpertTimeOnTheGo /r:ExpertTimeOnTheGo.ExpertTimeOnTheGoApplication /e:"30 Jun 2014" /ul:150 /ut:timekeeper /of:c:\temp
Unlimited Expiry, Unlimited Timekeepers using defaults
LicenseGenerator.exe /l:"foo, foo and bar" /m:ExpertTimeOnTheGo /r:ExpertTimeOnTheGo.ExpertTimeOnTheGoApplication /ut:timekeeper /of:c:\temp
Unlimited Expiry, Unlimited Users with explicit parameters
LicenseGenerator.exe /l:"foo, foo and bar" /m:ExpertMatterPlanning /r:MatterPlanning.MatterPlanningApplication /e:unlimited /ul:unlimited /ut:user /of:c:\temp
​Unlimited Expiry, Unlimited Users with explicit parameters
LicenseGenerator.exe /l:"foo, foo and bar" /m:ExpertMatterPlanning /r:MatterPlanning.MatterPlanningApplication /e:"30 Jun 2014" /ul:150/ut:user /of:c:\temp
Output:
 
Using the last example the output would be a package named "ExpertMatterPlanning_license.zip" and a license xml named "ExpertMatterPlanning_license.xml" in folder C:\temp.
 
The package contains a configuration import of the content of the license xml to the path "Technical.Licensing.License"
Steps: Step 1: Create a license for a limited number of users, for an unlimited time period.In a command window, navigate to your License Generator location and enter:LicenseGenerator.exe /l:"Clifford, Maximillian & Scott" /n:ExpertCollections /r:PaperlessPrebill.ExpertPaperlessPrebillApplication /ul:10 /of:c:\temp\Licenses\NumberUsersUnlimitedTime | Expected: Zip file created for license:Location:  as per "of" parameter set in the command lineName:      as per "m" parameter set in the command lineConfiguration file within the zip has details to match what was entered in the command line. For this test step:Path:        Technical.Licensing.LicenseName:      ExpertPaperlessPrebill Licensee:  Clifford, Maximillian & Scott     Resource: PaperlessPrebill.ExpertPaperlessPrebillApplicationExpiry:       unlimitedUserLimit: 10UserType: User || Step 2: Create a license for a limited number of timekeepers, for an unlimited time period. In a command window, navigate to your License Generator location and enter:LicenseGenerator.exe /l:"Clifford, Maximillian & Scott" /n:ExpertMatterPlanning /r:MatterPlanning.MatterPlanningApplication /ul:15 /ut:timekeeper /of:c:\temp\Licenses\NumberTkprsUnlimitedTime | Expected: Zip file created for license:Location:  as per "of" parameter set in the command lineName:      as per "m" parameter set in the command lineConfiguration file within the zip has details to match what was entered in the command line. For this test step:Path:        Technical.Licensing.LicenseName:      ExpertMatterPlanningLicensee:  Clifford, Maximillian & Scott     Resource: MatterPlanning.MatterPlanningApplicationExpiry:       unlimitedUserLimit: 15UserType: Timekeeper || Step 3: Create a license for a limited number of users, with an expiry date. In a command window, navigate to your License Generator location and enter:LicenseGenerator.exe /l:"Clifford, Maximillian & Scott" /n:ExpertRates /r:Rates.ExpertRatesApplication /ul:15 /e:"30 November 2012" /of:c:\temp\Licenses\NumberUsersWithExpiry | Expected: Zip file created for license:Location:  as per "of" parameter set in the command lineName:      as per "m" parameter set in the command lineConfiguration file within the zip has details to match what was entered in the command line. For this test step:Path:        Technical.Licensing.LicenseName:      ExpertRatesLicensee:  Clifford, Maximillian & Scott     Resource: Rates.ExpertRatesApplicationExpiry:       30-Nov-2012UserLimit: 15UserType: User || Step 4: Create a license for a limited number of timekeepers, with an expiry date.In a command window, navigate to your License Generator location and enter:LicenseGenerator.exe /l:"Clifford, Maximillian & Scott" /n:ExpertFoundTime /r:ExpertTime.FoundTimeApplication /ul:10 /ut:timekeeper /e:"30 November 2012" /of:c:\temp\Licenses\NumberTkprsWithExpiry | Expected: Zip file created for license:Location:  as per "of" parameter set in the command lineName:      as per "m" parameter set in the command lineConfiguration file within the zip has details to match what was entered in the command line. For this test step:Path:        Technical.Licensing.LicenseName:      ExpertFoundTimeLicensee:  Clifford, Maximillian & Scott     Resource: ExpertTime.FoundTimeApplicationExpiry:       30-Nov-2012UserLimit: 10UserType: User || Step 5: Create license for an unlimited number of users, unlimited time periodIn a command window, navigate to your License Generator location and enter:LicenseGenerator.exe /l:"Clifford, Maximillian & Scott" /n:ExpertAssistant /r:Applications.ExpertAssistant /of:c:\temp\Licenses\UnlimitedUsersUnlimitedTime | Expected: Zip file created for license:Location:  as per "of" parameter set in the command lineName:      as per "m" parameter set in the command lineConfiguration file within the zip has details to match what was entered in the command line. For this test step:Path:        Technical.Licensing.LicenseName:      ExpertAssistantLicensee:  Clifford, Maximillian & Scott     Resources: Applications.ExpertAssistantExpiry:       unlimitedUserLimit: unlimitedUserType: User || Step 6: Create license for an umlimited number of timekeepers, limited time periodIn a command window, navigate to your License Generator location and enter:LicenseGenerator.exe /l:"Clifford, Maximillian & Scott" /n:MatterPlanningAdmin /ut:timekeeper /r:MatterPlanning.ExpertMatterPlanningAdministration /e:"31 Januray 2103" /of:c:\temp\Licenses\UnlimitedTkprsWithExpiry | Expected: Zip file created for license:Location:  as per "of" parameter set in the command lineName:      as per "m" parameter set in the command lineConfiguration file within the zip has details to match what was entered in the command line. For this test step:Path:        Technical.Licensing.LicenseName:      MatterPlanningAdminLicensee:  Clifford, Maximillian & Scott     Resources: MatterPlanning.ExpertMatterPlanningAdministrationExpiry:       30-Jan-2013UserLimit: UnlimitedUserType: TimeKeeper || Step 7: Create license with more than one resourceIn a command window, navigate to your License Generator location and enter:LicenseGenerator.exe /l:"Clifford, Maximillian & Scott" /n:Collections /r:ExpertCollections.ExpertCollections, ExpertCollections.CollectorSearch /ul:150 /ut:timekeeper /e:"30 June 2014" /of:c:\temp\Licenses\MultipleResources | Expected: Zip file created for license:Location:  as per "of" parameter set in the command lineName:      as per "m" parameter set in the command lineConfiguration file within the zip has details to match what was entered in the command line. For this test step:Path:        Technical.Licensing.LicenseName:      CollectionsLicensee:  Clifford, Maximillian & Scott     Resources: ExpertCollections.ExpertCollections                  ExpertCollections.CollectorSearchExpiry:       30-Jun-2014UserLimit: 150UserType: User || Step 8: Import license package via Deployment Manager for:- n users- unlimited time period | Expected: An item is created in Configuration Manager  (a) Configuration Path for item: Technical.Licensing.License  (b) Configuration Name: User15UnlimitedCollections  (c) Contains the following details:                  Licensee: Clifford, Maximillian & Scott                 Resource: ExpertCollections.ExpertCollections                 Expiry Date: unlimited                 User Limit: 15                 User Type: User  (d) Has scope of System (no package visible)  (e) Should be digitally signed so it cannot be edited on site by our clients. It should only be created (& updated?) by Aderant services || Step 9: Check the status record created for the resource within the license: | Expected: Status record is created in Configuration Manager  (a) Configuration Path for item: Technical.Licensing.Status  (b) Configuration Name: ExpertCollections_ExpertCollections  (c) Has scope of System (no package visible)  (d) Should be digitally signed so it cannot be edited on site by our clients. It should only be created (& updated?) by Aderant services || Step 10: Check details within status record are accurate. | Expected: If the current count is greater than user limit, the resource is in breach, and the config item should contain the following details:                  IsLicensed: false                 failuretimestamp: date/time the status record was updated/created (and was in breach)                 Licensee: Clifford, Maximillian & Scott                 License name: User15UnlimitedCollections (with current Usercount as per Security Manager)                 Violation: Messasge detailing nature of license breachIf the current count is less than or equal to the user limit, the resource is not in breach, and the config item should contain the following details:                  IsLicensed: true                 Licensee: Clifford, Maximillian & Scott                 License name: User15UnlimitedCollections (with current Usercount as per Security Manager) || Step 11: Import license package via Deployment Manager for:- n timekeepers- unlimited time period | Expected: An item is created in Configuration Manager  (a) Configuration Path for item: Technical.Licensing.License  (b) Configuration Name: Timekeeper10UnlimitedCollections  (c) Contains the following details:                  Resource: ExpertCollections.ExpertCollections                 Expiry Date: unlimited                 User Limit: 10                 User Type: TimeKeeper  (d) Has scope of System (no package visible)  (e) Should be digitally signed so it cannot be edited on site by our clients. It should only be created (& updated?) by Aderant services || Step 12: Import license package via Deployment Manager for:- n users- specified end date | Expected: An item is created in Configuration Manager  (a) Configuration Path for item: Technical.Licensing.License  (b) Configuration Name: User15Jun302014Collections  (c) Contains the following details:                  Licensee: Clifford, Maximillian & Scott                 Resource: ExpertCollections.ExpertCollections                 Expiry Date: 30-Jun-2014                 User Limit: 15                 User Type: User  (d) Has scope of System (no package visible)  (e) Should be digitally signed so it cannot be edited on site by our clients. It should only be created (& updated?) by Aderant services || Step 13: Import license package via Deployment Manager for:- n timekeepers- specified time period | Expected: An item is created in Configuration Manager  (a) Configuration Path for item: Technical.Licensing.License  (b) Configuration Name: Timekeeper1030June2014Collections  (c) Contains the following details:                  Licensee: Clifford, Maximillian & Scott                 Resource: ExpertCollections.ExpertCollections                 Expiry Date: 30-Jun-2014                 User Limit: 10                 User Type: TimeKeeper  (d) Has scope of System (no package visible)  (e) Should be digitally signed so it cannot be edited on site by our clients.
