Title: Update License Status Records
Description:
First
- create/updated on license  - one per resource
- on access (if earlier than today, then update record considered out of date --> Update the existing status records IF not updated today OR the any of the LICENSE records have been updated since the status record 
UNLESS update today was from import license package
--> updates all resources in license
 
 
Cf. Security Manager - updates ALL status records for ALL licenses regardless of then last status update was
 
 
 
 
To check whether resource is in breach (for standard Users):
Launch Security Manager and go to the  Search tab. 
Select the ''PaperlessPrebill_ExpertPaperlessPrebillApplication'' resource in the Module tree. In the search results, you should see a list of the users that have permission for that resource. 
If this count is > 10, then in breach
If this count is <= 10, then not in breach
 
 
To check whether resource is in breach (for Timekeepers):
Launch Security Manager and go to the  Search tab. 
To identify users that are considered timekeepers, look at the timekeeper on time entries created in the last 3 months (TAT_TIME)
From this list, 
Select the '''' resource in the Module tree. In the search results, you should see a list of the users that have permission for that resource. 
Of this list, count the number that are timekeepers (also appear in the list above) 
If this count is > x then in breach
If this count is <= x then not in breach

Title: Update Status Record for number of users
Description:
If an application resource is licensed, but in breach, users will be able to use application uninterrupted, but the status records will indicate that license is in breach. This would apply in all of the scenarios below:
 
Scenarios
* License x users, unlimited time --> Number of users exceeded
* License x timekeepers, unlimited time --> Number of timekeepers exceeded
* License unlimited users, with expiry date --> Past expiry date
* License x users, with expiry date --> Number of users exceeded, expiry date not breached 
* License x timekeepers, with expiry date --> Past expiry date, number of timekeepers not exceeded
* License x timekeepers, with expiry date --> Past expiry date, number of timekeepers exceeded
 
First
- create/updated on license  - one per resource
- on access (if earlier than today, then update record considered out of date --> Update the existing status records IF not updated today OR the any of the LICENSE records have been updated since the status record 
UNLESS update today was from import license package
--> updates all resources in license
 
 
Cf. Security Manager - updates ALL status records for ALL licenses regardless of then last status update was
 
 
 
 
To check whether resource is in breach (for standard Users):
Launch Security Manager and go to the  Search tab. 
Select the ''PaperlessPrebill_ExpertPaperlessPrebillApplication'' resource in the Module tree. In the search results, you should see a list of the users that have permission for that resource. 
If this count is > 10, then in breach
If this count is <= 10, then not in breach
 
 
To check whether resource is in breach (for Timekeepers):
Launch Security Manager and go to the  Search tab. 
To identify users that are considered timekeepers, look at the timekeeper on time entries created in the last 3 months (TAT_TIME)
From this list, 
Select the '''' resource in the Module tree. In the search results, you should see a list of the users that have permission for that resource. 
Of this list, count the number that are timekeepers (also appear in the list above) 
If this count is > x then in breach
If this count is <= x then not in breach
Steps: Step 1: Pre-requisites:- There are no other license status records for ExpertCollections_ExpertCollections in Configuration Manager:Technical.Licensing.Status.ExpertCollections_ExpertCollections.- There are less than 20 grantees for the ExpertCollections.ExpertCollections(You can check this using the search tab in Security Manager) || Step 2: Import attached license package (allows 15 users to run Expert Collections for an unlimited time period). Check status record in Configuration Manager (Pre SP2): Technical.Licensing.Status.ExpertCollections_ExpertCollections. | Expected: Status record created has: islicensed=true user count = less than 15 || Step 3: Using Security Manager, add a few grantees to the 'CollectionsUser' module policy, but NOT so many that the number of grantees for ExpertCollections.ExpertCollections is more than 15. || Step 4: Via Security Manager, run Update Current Licensing Status Records Check status record in Configuration Manager: Technical.Licensing.Status.ExpertCollections_ExpertCollections. | Expected: Status record is updated and has details: islicensed = true, user count = increased by the number of users added || Step 5: Using Security Manager, add a few grantees to the 'CollectionsUser' module policy, so that the number of grantees for ExpertCollections.ExpertCollections is EQUAL to 15. || Step 6: Via Security Manager, run Update Current Licensing Status Records Check status record in Configuration Manager: Technical.Licensing.Status.ExpertCollections_ExpertCollections | Expected: Status record is updated and has details: islicensed = true, user count = 15 || Step 7: Using Security Manager, add a few grantees to the 'CollectionsUser' module policy, so that the number of grantees for ExpertCollections.ExpertCollections is more than 15 || Step 8: Via Security Manager, run Update Current Licensing Status Records Check status record in Configuration Manager: Technical.Licensing.Status.ExpertCollections_ExpertCollections | Expected: Status record is updated and has details: islicensed = false, violation message = appropriate to breach of number of users allowed user count = increased by the number of users added

Title: Create and import License with more than one resource
Description:
A license may be created for a set number of timekeepers, which is shipped to clients as a package that they install via our packaging mechanism. This test will verify a license that is managed by the number of timekeepers, and does NOT have a fixed duration or time component.
 
When a license package is imported, 
1. An item is created in Configuration Manager. This 
  (a) Configuration path for item:
  (b) Contains the following details: ClientId, Secured Resources, Number of Timekeepers allowed
  (c) Has scope of System, and has Aderant package assigned to it (which one?)
  (d) Should be digitally signed so it cannot be edited on site by our clients. It should only be created (& updated?) by Aderant services
2. Which then kicks off a status update. This results in a status record in Configuration Manager for EACH resource:
   (a) Configuration path for item: Technical.Licensing.Status.{ResourceName} 
   (b) Contains the following details: 
               ResourceName, IsLicensedStatus, BreachTimeStamp
               Licensee name 
               List of licenses that the resource is contained, current user count, and violation message if currently in breach
               Signature information (to ensure the record cannot be manually overwritten)
Steps: Step 1: Create license with more than one resourceIn a command window, navigate to your LicenseGenerator location and enter:LicenseGenerator.exe /l:"Clifford, Maximillian & Scott" /n:Time /r:ExpertTime.ExpertTimeApplication,ExpertTimeOnTheGo.ExpertTimeOnTheGoApplication /ul:150 /ut:timekeeper /e:"30 November 2012" /of:c:\temp\Licenses\MultipleResourcesNote: The attached package has an updated version of this license 18/06/2014. Either import the attached packed or change the date when creating the new license. | Expected: Zip file created for license:Location:  as per "of" parameter set in the command lineName:      as per "m" parameter set in the command lineConfiguration file within the zip has details to match what was entered in the command line. For this test step:Path:        Technical.Licensing.LicenseName:      TimeLicensee:  Clifford, Maximillian & Scott     Resources: ExpertTime.ExpertTimeApplication                  ExpertTimeOnTheGo.ExpertTimeOnTheGoApplicationExpiry:       30-Nov-2012UserLimit: 150UserType: User || Step 2: Import license package just created | Expected: An item is created in Configuration Manager  (a) Configuration Path for item: Technical.Licensing.License  (b) Configuration Name: Time  (c) Contains the following details:                  Licensee: Clifford, Maximillian & Scott                 Resource: ExpertTime.ExpertTimeApplication, ExpertTimeOnTheGo.ExpertTimeOnTheGoApplication                 Expiry Date: 30-Nov-2012                 User Limit: 15                 User Type: TimeKeeper  (d) Has scope of System (no package visible)  (e) Should be digitally signed so it cannot be edited on site by our clients. It should only be created (& updated?) by Aderant services || Step 3: Check a status record exists for EACH resource in the license | Expected: Status record is created in Configuration Manager  (a) Configuration item: Technical.Licensing.ExpertTime_ExpertTimeApplication, includes "Time" license in config value  (b) Configuration item: Technical.Licensing.ExpertTimeOnTheGo_ExpertTimeOnTheGoApplication, includes "Time" license in config value

Title: Install More Than One License for Same Resource
Description:
If more than one license is installed for the same resource, the one that allows the resource that wins. In this situation, 
 
* A license record is created for EACH license
* One status record will exist for the resource, with ONE overall status at the top of the record. It also contains details of the status for each license.
Steps: Step 1: Import first license (attached) with resource - 30 users, expiry date 3-Nov-2012.Check status record in Configuration Manager:Technical.Licensing.Status.Framework_Configuration_ConfigurationManager.Note: the second attached package is an updated version - 15 users, expiry date 10-Jun-2014 | Expected: Should not be licensed because expiry date is in the past. i.e. islicensed=false || Step 2: Import second license (attached) with same resource - 20 users, no expiry date Note: the second attached package is an updated version - 15 users, no expiry date | Expected: Should be licensed because no more than 20 users, and no expiry date. i.e. islicensed=true || Step 3: Check status record for resource in Configuration Manager:Technical.Licensing.Status.Framework.Configuration.ConfigurationManager | Expected: Although first license is in breach, the overall resource is NOT in breach i.e. islicensed=true || Step 4: * In Security Manager, add members to the the ExpertApplication policy consuming this resource so that there is more than 20 members (use the Search tab in Security Manager to count number of users).Run Update Current Licensing Status Records via Security Manager then check status record in Configuration Manager:Technical.Licensing.Status.Framework_Configuration_ConfigurationManager | Expected: Overall resource is now in breach islicensed=false

Title: Update Status Record for number of timekeepers
Description:
If an application or feature is unlicensed, users should not be able to run the application.
 
Scenarios to Test:
* Application resource requires license, but client site does not have any license for it
* Application resource requires license, client site DOES have license for it, but different type of user tries to access. 
   E.g. License issued for timekeepers, non-timekeeper tries to run
Steps: Step 1: Pre-requisites:- There are no other license status records for Rates_ExpertRatesApplication in Configuration Manager: Technical.Licensing.Status.Rates_ExpertRatesApplication.- There are less than 5 timekeepers that are grantees for the Rates_ExpertRatesApplication (You can check this using the search tab in Security Manager and comparing with )Note: to use updated packages, change all "Rates_ExpertRatesApplication" to "ExpertCollections_ExpertCollections" || Step 2: Fetch list of timekeepers (this is a dynamic list that consists of timekeepers that are on time entries that have a transaction date in the last 3 months:). To see this list, replace the dates in the following SQL to reflect the last 3 months and run:select * from hbm_persnl where empl_uno in (select distinct (tk_empl_uno) from tat_timewhere tran_date > '2002-08-27 00:00:00.000'and tran_date > '2002-11-27 00:00:00.000')order by employee_name | Expected: Keep this list handy/visible || Step 3: Import attached license package (allows 5 users to run Expert Rates for an umlimited time period).- Check status record in Configuration Manager: Technical.Licensing.Status.Rates_ExpertRatesApplication | Expected: Status record created has: islicensed=true user count = less than 5 || Step 4: Using Security Manager, add a few non-timekeeper grantees that are to the 'RatesUser' module policy, but NOT so many that the number of grantees for Rates_ExpertRatesApplication is more than 5 | Expected: Status record updated, has details: islicensed=true user count = same as before || Step 5: Via Security Manager, run Update Current Licensing Status Records Check status record in Configuration Manager: Technical.Licensing.Status.Rates_ExpertRatesApplication | Expected: Status record updated, has details: islicensed=true user count = same as before || Step 6: Using Security Manager, add a few grantees that added time more than 3 months ago, (i.e. should not be in the timkeeper list) to the 'RatesUser' module policy, so that the number of grantees for Rates_ExpertRatesApplication is still less than 5 || Step 7: Via Security Manager, run Update Current Licensing Status Records Check status record in Configuration Manager: Technical.Licensing.Status.Rates_ExpertRatesApplication | Expected: Status record updated, has details: islicensed=true user count = same as before || Step 8: Using Security Manager, add a few grantees that are in the timkeeper list to the 'RatesUser' module policy, so that the number of grantees for Rates_ExpertRatesApplication so that the number of grantees for Rates_ExpertRatesApplication is still less than 5 || Step 9: Via Security Manager, run Update Current Licensing Status Records Check status record in Configuration Manager: Technical.Licensing.Status.Rates_ExpertRatesApplication | Expected: Status record is updated and has details: islicensed = true, user count = increased by number of timekeepers added || Step 10: Using Security Manager, add a few grantees that are in the timkeeper list to the 'RatesUser' module policy, so that the number of grantees for Rates_ExpertRatesApplication so that the number of grantees for Rates_ExpertRatesApplication is EQUAL TO 5 || Step 11: Via Security Manager, run Update Current Licensing Status Records Check status record in Configuration Manager: Technical.Licensing.Status.Rates_ExpertRatesApplication | Expected: Status record is updated and has details: islicensed = true, user count = 5 || Step 12: Using Security Manager, add a few grantees that are in the timekeeper list to the 'RatesUser' module policy, so that the number of grantees for Rates_ExpertRatesApplication is more than 5 || Step 13: Via Security Manager, run Update Current Licensing Status Records Check status record in Configuration Manager: Technical.Licensing.Status.Rates_ExpertRatesApplication | Expected: Status record is updated and has details: islicensed = false, violation message = appropriate to breach of number of users allowed user count = increased by the number of users added

Title: Update Status Record for license with expiry date
Steps: Step 1: Pre-requisites: * There is no license or status record for Rates.ExpertRatesApplication in Configuration Manager (Pre SP2): Technical.Licensing.Status.Rate_ExpertRatesApplication. || Step 2: Create a license for a limited number of users, with an expiry date (change the date in the command below to one that is a couple of days in the future for you)In a command window, navigate to your LicenseGenerator location and enter:LicenseGenerator.exe /l:"Clifford, Maximillian & Scott" /n:ExpertRates /r:ExpertCollections.ExpertCollections /e:"30 June 2014" /of:c:\temp\Licenses\NumberUsersWithExpiry || Step 3: Import license created | Expected: Status record created in Configuration Manager, with details:Name: Technical.Licensing.Status.ExpertCollections_ExpertCollectionsIsLicensed=true || Step 4: Move the date in your environment forward (will have to be on the server so best to test in a customization environment, DON'T test on an ITE) || Step 5: Run the 'Update Current Licensing Status Records' in Security Manager (Pre SP2)Note: this button may come back after SP2 release. For now, the best way to get this to update is to remove the status record in Config Manager, re-launch Security Manager and then refresh Config Manager - the status record will be recreated with the new details. | Expected: Status record created in Configuration Manager, with details:Name: Technical.Licensing.Status.ExpertCollections_ExpertCollectionsIsLicensed=false || Step 6: View Status report | Expected: Resource displayed as not licensed: ExpertCollections_ExpertCollections

Title: Update Status Record When More Than One Resource Exists in License
Description:
A license may contain more than one resource.
 
Because each resource has its own status record, if one resource is in breach, but another is not, only the resource that is in violation should be treated as a breach, not everything in that license.
Steps: Step 1: Pre-requisites: * There are more than 15 users with the PaperlessPrebill.PaperlessPrebillApplication resource, and less than 15 users on the PaperlessPrebill.EditTime resource (check using the Search tab in Security Manager) * There are no license or status records for the MatterPlanning reources: PaperlessPrebill.PaperlessPrebillApplication PaperlessPrebill.ExpertPaperlessPrebillAdministration (Check in Configuration Manager - Pre SP2 under: Technical.Licensing. || Step 2: Import the attached license package (SP2 - The updated license. Replace all "Prebill" with "Collections") || Step 3: Run status report from 'Update Current Licensing Status Records' in Security Manager. | Expected: PaperlessPrebill.EditTime resource is in breach PaperlessPrebill.PaperlessPrebillApplication is NOT in breach

Title: Proxy user - License by Timekeeper
Description:
CLOSED THIS TEST - Proxy behaviour only comes into effect when running an application. Whether or not the feature is in breach will only be determined by looking at the number of grantees for the resource, not the number of users running the application.
 
******************************************************
If your license applies to a number of timekeepers, and a non-timekeeper proxies a timekeeper, security of the person being proxied should apply when running the application feature that is licensed..

Title: Update Status Record When Resource Exists in More Than One License
Description: CLOSED - duplication of test cases 79308

Title: Run Application that is Licensed, User does not have any security
Description: Even if a product/feature is licensed, a user that does not even have security in Security Manager should still receive the standard security message that is received of you do not have security permissions.

Title: Delete License Record from Configuration
Description: If a client no longer wishes to use a product they can just delete the license record. If a user subsequently attempts to launch an application that requires a license, they will not be able to launch it.

Title: Update All Licensing Status Records & Generate Licensing Report - SSRS installed
Description:
Note: the config manager being in Design Studio V2 has not been implemented as of SP2 release. Possibly in a future release.
 
To monitor licensing statuses at client sites, there is a new function in Security Manager called 'Update the Current Licensing Status Records'. This is available in the title bar of Security Manager.
 
- Forces an updated of ALL license status records
- Generates licensing report

Title: SSRS  row-level security
Description:
When an SSRS reports is created, row-level security should be honoured if your report dataset sets the auth context, and uses Expert views. Because the 'Expert' data source uses Windows Integrated Security, the user context should automatically be passed through to the report.
 
If proxying another user, the security of the person being proxied should be used when running the report.
Steps: Step 1: Add TTQA4 to the SSRS Security || Step 2: Security Manager - UsersYourself - Proxy :TTQA4 can act in behalf of youYou can act in behalf of TTQA4 || Step 3: Via Expert ClassicMatter Management > Matter DetailsClient = 10901Matter = 3Security = Custom - Deny view rights for TTQA4 | Expected: Matter is secured for TTQA4 - no matter 3 in SQL (exec Security.SetContextByName 'aderant_ap\TTQA4'SELECT MATTER_NAME, MATTER_CODE FROM MATTERMODEL.MATTERWHERE CLIENT_UNO= 1) || Step 4: (a) Using the Action Wizard (Pre SP2), create an action for extension point: Expert Assistant Actions MenuAction Type: Execute a ReportReport: Select report createdShowOptionsDialog=False.SP2 & Later - Launch Design Studio V2 - Action Editor - Create action appropriate to this test(b) Save report || Step 5: Run EA as yourselfrun action | Expected: Report shows all 3 matters || Step 6: Change proxy to TTQA4run action | Expected: Report shows all 3 matters || Step 7: Open EA as TTQA4Run action | Expected: Report without matter 3 || Step 8: Change proxy to yourselfrun action | Expected: Report without matter 3

Title: Install More than One License with Same Name
Description:
When multiple versions of a license package with the same name exist, the last one imported wins, by completely replacing all license/status information that existed from previous versions.
 
NOTE - 
With the Design Studio V2 project, all the customization elements are clubbed together (like security manager, action wizard etc) in a single product.
 
And hence the launching of configuration manager/security manager wouldn't be the same as Pre-SP2.
Steps: Step 1: Pre-requisites:In Configuration Manager, there are none of the following:* License records: Technical.Licensing.License.TimeApps* License status records: Technical.Licensing.Status.ExpertTime_ExpertTimeApplicationTechnical.Licensing.Status.ExpertTime_ExpertTimeOnTheGoApplication.Note: If using the updated license packages, replace Time applications with Collections (ExpertCollections and Collector Search) || Step 2: Import license package attachedi.e. v1 of "TimeApps" license with resources: a,b || Step 3: Import license x (v2) with resources: ai.e. v2of "TimeApps" license with resources: a || Step 4: Check status of resource b in Configuration Manager/Status Report: Technical.Licensing.Status. | Expected: There is a status record in config for: Technical.Licensing.Status.ExpertTime_ExpertTimeApplication There is NOT a status record in config for: Technical.Licensing.Status.ExpertTime.ExpertTimeOnTheGoApplication

Title: Update All Licensing Status Records & Generate Licensing Report - SSRS not installed or running
Description:
SP2 - If SSRS is not set up in the environment, button to open Status Reports is disabled in Security Manager. Cannot launch reports. Only able to see license details in Configuration Manager.
 
To monitor licensing statuses at client sites, there is a new function in Security Manager called 'Update the Current Licensing Status Records'. This is available in the title bar of Security Manager.
 
- Forces an updated of ALL license status records
- Generates licensing report
 
 
What if:
- No licenses? Is only information that relates specifically to licenses sent back?
- No connectivity?
 
What is the automated method of Aderant receiving this info?
 
NOTE - 
With the Design Studio V2 project, all the customization elements are clubbed together (like security manager, action wizard etc) in a single product.
 
And hence the launching of configuration manager/security manager wouldn't be the same as Pre-SP2.

Title: Install Invalid Licenses
Description:
License packages could potentially contain details that are invalid for an environment (e.g. Licensee issued for a different client, license contains invalid resource). 
In the first situation, the license will still be imported, but no status records will be created (license ignored if it has not been created for the system owner).
In the second situation, the license will still be imported, but the islicensed flag in the status record should be set to false.
Steps: Step 1: Import the attached license package (which has an licensee name that will not match the system owner i.e. SELECT * FROM FWM_OWNER WHERE ISSYSTEM='Y') | Expected: License record created: Technical.Licensing.License.InvalidLicensee No status records will be created for licenses that are imported but do not belong to the system owner || Step 2: Import the attached license package (which has resource that does not exist) | Expected: License record created: Technical.Licensing.License.InvalidResourceStatus record created: Technical.Licensing.License.Applications_UnknownApp (SP2 - This is not created in SP2 when licenses/resources are invalid) Status record has: islicensed =false, violation message has appropriate message

- Test rendering in WPF only
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Basic SmartForm - Consume expressions on Is properties in Grid controls
Description:
Package containing different configurations of validation expressions that can be run in w workflow to test the runtime behaviour.
 
SF  - Three sections - Is Invalid When, Is Valid When, BOTH. Each section will have one of each control but the same expression. The header of the SmartForm will hold controls to change the validation state.
 
SF - One for each primary data type (data type being tested in the expression). Includes different  configurations of expression for each data type). Focus on String, Int, DateTime, Boolean, Collection
 
Incorporate complex expressions (multiple conditions, multiple groups) etc into SFs for each data type

SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.

SF - One for each primary data type (data type being tested in the expression). Includes different  configurations of expression for each data type). Focus on String, Int, DateTime, Boolean, Collection
 
SF - Complex expressions (multiple conditions, multiple groups)
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Using "Most recent used" or MRU lists in data providers
Description:
We can now persist MRUs on the server in FWA_MRU_LIST and FWA_MRU_LIST_ITEM.
 
Offline storage is located in the roaming profile, where MRUs that were created offline are queued for batch processing when the user goes back online.
 
The MRU is retrieved on application start, or when the user changes to a proxied user.
 
Deleted MRUs are marked as inactive as we need to account for updating older MRU lists stored elsewhere.
Steps: Step 1: Check that search controls and filtered controls have MRU enabled:You can add an item to MRU or remove a MRU item by right clicking on an item in a search result and choose add/remove to recent usedExample: Search for Arden in client data provider, right click on the result and add it to recent used | Expected: -You can have upto 1000 MRU items. When you exceed the limit the latest MRU will replace the oldest one.-MRU items will be shown when you click on the search control (if you do not have a search criteria) (Styling: Bond text, light yellow background color) || Step 2: Check that items are added to MRU after you have visited them.Example: Search for Central bank in client data provider, right click on it and open notes | Expected: An item will be added to MRU list after you clicked or made an action to it || Step 3: Check that you can pin an item to the MRU by right click - pin this item | Expected: -Pinned items have higher priority than MRU and will always display above MRU lists-Pinned items have a "green pin" icon to the right-Pinned list stays until you remove them || Step 4: Check that MRUs are saved to database and synced across different apps and client machines.a) Pick out two machines from the client machine pool (http://ttwiki/wiki/index.php?title=QA_Environments#Client_Machine_Pool)b) Log into the machines, connect to your test environment and make sure your test user does not have any MRU. || Step 5: On machine 1, open EA, go to the client tab and search for arden. Select the returned client | Expected: a) Entry has been logged in the database tables FWA_MRU_LIST and FWA_MRU_LIST_ITEM. b) Also check in your appdata folder e.g. C:\Users\franklin.liu\AppData\Roaming\Aderant\Local\MruLists that a 'dateLastChecked.*.xml' has been created; this contains the date we last checked the database for MRU items. c) Any MRUs created after the date in this xml file will not be visible to the user until they restart the application. || Step 6: Now open Expert Rates and go to the clients tab. Open the search dropdown. Choose another client so you have two MRU items. | Expected: The Arden MRU you created from EA is available here also. || Step 7: On machine 2, open EA, and go to the client tab. a) Look for the MRUs you added in machine 1b) Remove one item from the MRU list | Expected: a) The MRU list has the two items you viewed from machine 1; confirm this with the list stored in FWA_MRU_LIST and FWA_MRU_LIST_ITEM. b) The MRU you removed is not set as inactive in FWA_MRU_LIST_ITEM. || Step 8: Go back to machine 1 and restart EA. Check the Client search MRU list | Expected: The MRU you removed is no longer on the MRU result list in the client search area.

Title: Update Status Record for license with user limit and expiry date
Description:
NOTE - 
With the Design Studio V2 project, all the customization elements are clubbed together (like security manager, action wizard etc) in a single product.
 
And hence the launching of configuration manager/security manager wouldn't be the same as Pre-SP2.
Steps: Step 1: Test on a customization environment || Step 2: Pre-requisites: * The number of users as grantees for the ExpertCollections.ExpertCollections resouce is less than 15 (Use the Search tab in Security Manager to check this)* There is no license or status record for ExpertCollections.ExpertCollections in Configuration Manager:Technical.Licensing.Status.ExpertCollections_ExpertCollections || Step 3: Create a license for a limited number of users, with an expiry date (change the date in the command below to one that is a couple of days in the future for you)In a command window, navigate to your License Generator location and enter:LicenseGenerator.exe /l:"Clifford, Maximillian & Scott" /n:ExpertCollections /r:ExpertCollections.ExpertCollections /ul:15 /e:"30 June 2014" /of:c:\temp\Licenses\NumberUsersWithExpiry || Step 4: Import license created | Expected: Status record created in Configuration Manager, with details:Name: Technical.Licensing.Status.ExpertCollections_ExpertCollectionsIsLicensed=true. || Step 5: Using Security Manager, add a few grantees to the 'CollectionsUser' module policy, so that the number of grantees for ExpertCollections.ExpertCollections is more than 15. || Step 6: Via Security Manager, run Update Current Licensing Status RecordsCheck status record in Configuration Manager: Technical.Licensing.Status.ExpertCollections_ExpertCollections. | Expected: Status record is updated  and has details: islicensed = false, user count = increased by the number of users added || Step 7: Remove the users that were added earlier from the policy || Step 8: Via Security Manager, run Update Current Licensing Status RecordsCheck status record in Configuration Manager: Technical.Licensing.Status.ExpertCollections_ExpertCollections | Expected: Status record is updated  and has details: islicensed = true, user count = decreased by the number of users added || Step 9: Move the date in your environment forward (will have to be on the server so best to test in a customization environment, DON'T test on an ITE) || Step 10: Run the 'Update Current Licensing Status Records' in Security Manager.(SP2 - no such function in Security Manager. To refresh the status record, remove the config value in config manager under Licensing.Status and then re-open Security Manager. Refresh Config Manager to get the updated status value. | Expected: Status record created in Configuration Manager, with details:Name: Technical.Licensing.Status.ExpertCollections_ExpertCollectionsIsLicensed=false

Title: Allow import of multiple patches at once
Description:
- The order in which packages within the big package are imported is important for patches. Must be run in the order in which they were released. Are they imported according to alphabetical order of package name, or, the order in which they are added to the package?
- What happens if the some of the sub-packages have been previously imported. Should they be ignored/re-runnable/excluded from package before running?
- What if UPDs need to be run between sub-packages?
- Must the Owner parameter that is set match the Expert Firm name at the time the package is exported or when it is imported?
- What if same item(s) included in more than one package?
- When importing, can we see instructions for each individual patch contained in the package?

Title: Create package with multiple licenses
Description:
When issuing licenses, we allow multiple licenses to be rolled up into a single package. To enable our sales team to do this, they can use the command line utility for PackagePackager.exe, which will be included in builds for the LicenseGenerator.exe. (They will not have the access to the Visual Studio mechanism as they will not have Expert deployments).
 
When exporting, the packager has no knowledge of existing packages or items. So if the package name entered on the command line matches an existing package with items attached to it, none of these will be included in the package output.
 
On importing into a target environment, 
- the main package is added to FWM_PACKAGE
- each of the sub-packages are registered in the FWM_PACKAGE table, and the 
- each of the sub-packages are registered in the FWA_PACKAGE_FILE table
- A copy of the sub-packages imported is placed in the ExpertSource\ImportedPackages\{PackageName} folder of your binaries location under the Installation Path specified in the package
- Packages = last plugin to be imported, followed by additional files
- Packages within package imported in the order in which they are listed in the manifest (same order as added in command line/Visual Studio)
 
Test scenarios:
Package together all licenses in the same folder 
Package together all licenses in the same folder - What if licenses are in sub-folder of specified folder?
Package together only specified licenses from a folder 
Package together licenses from different locations 
Package together licenses for different licensees - will not cause an issue for export/import, but status records will have isLicensed=false. - risk of overwriting your own with another's ???
Package together licenses where licensee is different to owner on new package (and different to the system owner on environment you are importing to (i.e. the system owner according to the IS_SYSTEM column in the FWM_OWNER table) - owner will be added to FWM_OWNER table on import, the the licensee on the license will be used to determine the status on the resource (rather than the owner on the container package). should not cause a problem for the export or import. However, after importing into the client's environment, they may not be able to select the package for other functions of customization).
Package together more than one license by the same name  - overwrites earlier with later... test and see what happens? throws exception?
Package together the same license more than once
Package together by folder, folder contains items other than licenses, possibly even zips (only Aderant packages should be included, anything else will not. Are different versions of package manifest files recognised?)
Package owner does not match the system owner on environment you are importing to (i.e. the system owner according to the IS_SYSTEM column in the FWM_OWNER table). If this does not match, it should not cause a problem for the export or import. However, after importing into the client's environment, they may not be able to select the package for other functions of customization).
Package contains installation path that does not exist on target environment (environment you are importing package on) - creates installation folder in ExpertSource/binaries location, and puts a copy of the sub-packages in there
Output folder already exists - overwrite/don't overwrite.
 
 
NOTE - 
With the Design Studio V2 project, configuration manager is clubbed together with other customization elements (like security manager, action wizard etc) in a single product.
 
And hence the launching of configuration manager wouldn't be the same as Pre-SP2.

Title: [Pre 80SP3] Packaging use case - Create package containing other packages from Visual Studio
Description:
The Export Package feature in Visual Studio has been enhanced to support the packaging of packages. Exporting via this method will continue to function as it always has, but with the inclusion of packages as another packageable type/plugin.
 
Package items that are added should be added to the FWA_PACKAGE_FILE table (although they are not necessarily pre-selected when you go to export the package again)
 
Test: Create package with: 
- Specific packages from same/different locations
- Packages with different installation paths - when imported, each installation path should be created in the ExpertSource/binaries, and the associated package(s) copied inside
- Packages with more than one level of installation path
- Packages with installation path with invalid format
- Select Non-package items in the Package section - these should be excluded from the package output
- Existing package that has other non-package items attached to it (e.g. Config, SmartForms, security policies, ad hoc lists, workflows, etc) - these should also be included in the package output
- Packages containing packages - should not be allowed. Maximum of 2 deep only is permitted.
 
 
Note:
 
 
Is the patch flag applicable in the Export Package window? yes, standard functionality

Title: Create package containing customization packages - from command line
Description:
Test:
- All packages in folder
- Specific packages in folder
- Packages from different locations
 
Notes:
From the command line, exporting
Question: 
- Does the package name and description get added to the FWM_PACKAGE table? Not from command line, only from Visual Studio.
-  Is there any validation/check against this table? no, packaging is just another sub-folder -->
 NO connection to database
- Does the installation path get created on import if it does not already exist? Yes
- Can existing packages be exported? If so, are other non-package items included in the output? Or can it only be used for new packages that are created on the fly? --> Will have no knowledge of package already in database
- There is validation to ensure that only packages can only be included --> checks manifest
 
 
On import,
- Packages = last plugin to be imported, followed by additional files
- Packages within package imported in the order in which they are listed in the manifest (same order as added in command line/Visual Studio)

Period - How often (in minutes) EA will poll

Title: Client Search
Description:
There is a client search menu in Expert Assistant
 
Expected Results:
1. Enter search criteria which will return data from the expert DB. Ensure that Clients are returned and they display the correct details.
2. Navigate to the expanded view, and ensure that all the data is available for the client.
3. MRU should be enabled and the righ-click menu should have 'Add/remove  to/from recently used' and 'Pin this Item' options
4. The same results should be returned as the client search in the FO smart forms, and the format of search results should also be the same
5. The right-click menu for a selected client should have the 'Open New File' option which launches a new workflow specific to that client
6. The right-click menu 'Notes' should launch the Notes window with the selected client as a topic. Any existing conversations for that client should also be available
 
 
 
Things to Test:
Quick Search
- Names beginning with...
 
Deep Search (BrowseAll in EA)
- Names including..
- Includes words beginning with...
- More than one word - with spaces in search criteria
- Includes special characters - apostrophe's hyphens
- Codes/partial codes
- Other criteria e.g. address details....
 
 
-- What results are expected?
-- Order of results?
 
 
****Related BUG, 68679 In EA, searching office location in Client & Employee tab only return the results in MRU
Steps:
Step 1: Enter search criteria i.e. Arden. Also using criteria with special characters i.e. Ard!@#e | Expected: Ensure that Clients are returned and they display the correct details. || Step 2: Check that MRU functionality is available on search results | Expected: MRU should be enabled and the righ-click menu should have 'Add/remove  to/from recently used' and 'Pin this Item' options || Step 3: Compare searches in the FO Intake Client search with the Client search in EA | Expected: The same results should be returned as the client search in the FO smart forms || Step 4: Check the right-click menu for a selected client | Expected: - 'Open New Matter' which launches a new fileopening workflow specific to that client
- 'Client Notes' should launch the Notes window with the selected client as a topic. Any existing conversations for that client should also be available
- Edit Contacts which launches a new Fileopening.Contact edit workflow specific to that client
- 'Add/Remove from recently used' and 'Pin/Unpin this item' || Step 5: Search is automatically executed in the following cases: | Expected: - Only 1 characters entered --> Search executed after 3 seconds
- Only 2 characters entered --> Search executed after 3 seconds
- 3 or more characters entered --> Search executed after 1 seconds
- Any number of characters followed by ENTER key - Search executed immediately || Step 6: The following types of searches should find results:- Client names- Matter names (Only able to search matter names in the matter search, not the client search)- More than one word - with spaces in search criteria- Includes special characters - apostrophe's hyphens- Codes/partial codes- Other criteria e.g. address details....

Title: EA- Changing EA settings under Proxy should not affect the Proxy user
Description: Test that if a user is acting as proxy for another user, that when they update any assistant settings, that the settings relate to and are only updates to the actual user, not the proxy user.

Title: Manage Proxies for Expert Assistant
Description: A user can maintain his own list of proxies (users that can act on his behalf) via Expert Assistant. He cannot make himself proxy for another user here.

Title: Start Process as proxy user
Description:
Even while proxying another user, the Actions menu reflects the real user not the proxy. So the current behaviour is that starting a process from the Actions menu is treated like the ACTUAL user kicking off the workflow
If you start a workflow from an action, the workflow initiator is deemed to be you (not the user being proxied)

Title: EA - Use EA searches as proxy user
Description: When proxying another user in EA, the row-level security on the Client/Matter searches uses the credentials of the user being proxied.

Title: View & Manage Tasks as Proxy user
Description:
Test that users can switch views to be able to work on behalf of a proxy
 
Details:
o       Workflow users may have been granted proxy rights for another user.  If so then we support the selection of their proxy from the menu and toolbar.
§       User may select a proxy from a list of users who have granted them proxy rights.  The list of users is accessed from a toolbar proxy function and sorted alphabetically; but current user is always at top and visually apparent and easy to select.
§       If user has no proxy rights then toolbar option is not visible.
o       Changing application into proxy mode introduces a banner to the top of the screen detailing proxy status.
§       Banner supports changing proxy user, including switching back to current user - in which case banner will be removed.
 
Things to test
Test that adding a removing proxy users is updated in the workflow client, and all users that have proxied can be accessed.
Test that when the proxied user has specific security limitations, that these are also applied to the user acting on behalf.
See Design Document for Proxy menu behaviour - ensure behaviour is the same as the wireframes.
 
Test that all inbox views are correct when a user is actingt on behalf of a proxy
 
test that only the correct tasks are displayed in the views
Test that the assigned to column displays the proxied users details
 
Ensure for the following views:
Manage Tasks
Manage Users
Process Tasks
View My Important Tasks
View My Tasks

Title: View Process Instance List as Proxy User
Description:
Test that a user acting on behalf of a proxied user, can View the process instance list
 
Test:
That this can only be done when the proxied user has the correct permissions. The user acting on behalf of the proxies permission will not count.
Test that all other behavior is the same as if this was done by not a proxy user.
***For reference see the tests sitting in the view View Process Instance List Use case

Title: Actions in proxy mode
Description:
When proxying another user:
1. You should see all of your user-specific own configuration, and NOT any user-specific configuration for the user being proxied
2. If an action is secured, the security of the user being proxied is applied.
 
UPDATE: From SP2 iteration - For all the proxied users, the proxy user's actions should be visible in EA and not your own (user) actions.

Several of these actions are secured by appropriate security policies but most are available to users in the Everyone group.

Title: Filter task list
Description:
Check that the task  list has filters (in the drop down) 
 
- My Tasks

Title: Custom 1-to-1 table usage - UserData
Description:
This method revolves around using the UserData object which each Domain model object are accompanies with. Both this and the WF variable method allows us to simulate one-to-one mapping between the custom table and linked / FK table. The example below shows how a custom table might be used to capture data from a modified FileOpening workflow.
 
The example below assumes you've created a custom table with two custom columns: Description and Location, both of string type, as well as the mandatory columns required for customization.
Creation of mandatory columns and deploying customization in general is covered in another section.
 
Assuming you've created the custom table and deployed customization, do the following:
 
1. Determine firstly which smartform will have the input that you want to capture. If linked to the client model, you can use any of the smartforms shown along the FileOpening task sequence, and in particular the smartforms such as FileOpening.ClientAdministrative that are encapsulated within FileOpening.ClientSet are good candidates for use.
2. Open Smartform wizard, and edit your chosen smartform; activate the Advanced section by ticking the 'Advanced' box from the Form level smartform properties pane. Entering the script below at the Form level -> Global Declarations:
 
import clr
clr.AddReference("Aderant.Workflow.Activities")
clr.AddReference("Aderant.Query")
clr.AddReference("System")
clr.AddReference("WindowsBase")
from Aderant.Workflow.Activities import WorkflowScript
from System import DateTime
from Aderant.Query.ViewModels import CUSTOMTABLE
 
Then insert the following section in the 'Additional Functions' section
 
def SetClientUserData(self):
    if(self.Data.Client != None and self.Data.Client.CUSTOMTABLE != None):
        if (self.Data.Client.CUSTOMTABLE.Count == 0):
            custom = CUSTOMTABLE()
            self.Data.Client.CUSTOMTABLE.Add(custom)
        self.Data.Client.UserData.Description=self.Data.Client.CUSTOMTABLE[0].DESCRIPTION
        self.Data.Client.UserData.Location=self.Data.Client.CUSTOMTABLE[0].LOCATION
 
Where CUSTOMTABLE is the name of your custom table. When the table is imported, it is done so as a collection hence it is pluralized and requires an index when assigning value to its properties.
DESCRIPTION and LOCATION are the two columns I wanted to gather user input from. NOTE this is only the case if you do not assign a unique index on the foreign key column.
UserData.Description and UserData.Location will be created in the steps below. Basically we are accounting for an 'Edit' situation so that we retrieve from the Custom Table properties when displaying information.
 
3. Then in the OnLoaded section, add the following script:
 
self.SetClientUserData()
 
This is so that the custom fields are populated with any existing data we may have in the custom table.After PendingSave phase the client will never change, so we will need to retrieve the persisted data from PendingSave to populate in the forms for the rest of the FileOpening workflow.
 
4. In the On Data Changed section, add the following script:
 
if(dataName == "Client"):
    self.SetClientUserData()
 
This is so that during Intake phase where the client is picked for the first time, the fields are properly set with existing data (if any), or otherwise create a new empty collection item if there was none.
 
5. Now we need to create UserData items. To do this, open the 'add/edit items' dialogue box, open the Client model, then browse down to Client.UserData. Right click on UserData, and select 'Add Item'
 a. For each field of data you want to capture, add a corresponding item inside UserData.
 b. Repeat until you've created enough fields for capture. Be sure to tick each item to display them on the form.
 
6.For each UserData item added, add the script below to the Scripting->OnChanged section. 
 
self.Data.Client.CUSTOMTABLES[0].DESCRIPTION=self.Data.Client.UserData.Description
 
Where CUSTOMTABLES is your custom table collection name and UserData.Description is your UserData item name.
 
7. Open up the FileOpening workflow in Visual Studio / Design Studio, and find the 'ClientExpand' string variable from the variable list. Modify the end of the string to contain ", CUSTOMTABLES" where CUSTOMTABLES is the pluralized name of your custom table. This is so the script utilizing the ClientExpand string will know to pull back the data for your custom table during the data retrieval process.
 
 
For reference, below is an earlier approach using UserData which gets around the custom data being wiped after the pending save phase (but the above is the ideal approach)
 
1. Determine firstly which smartform you will enter the input that you want to capture. If linked to the client model, you can use any of the smartforms shown along the FileOpening task sequence, and in particular the smartforms such as FileOpening.ClientAdministrative that are encapsulated within FileOpening.ClientSet are good candidates for use.
2. Now we need to create UserData items. To do this, open the 'add/edit items' dialogue box, open the Client model, then browse down to Client.UserData. Right click on UserData, and select 'Add Item'
 a. For each field of data you want to capture, add a corresponding item inside UserData.
 b. Repeat until you've created enough fields for capture. Be sure to tick each item to display them on the form.
4. Add the script below to a separate script / or embedded inside a dynamic script activity:
 
import clr
clr.AddReference("Aderant.Workflow.Activities")
clr.AddReference("Aderant.Query")
clr.AddReference("System")
clr.AddReference("WindowsBase")
from Aderant.Workflow.Activities import WorkflowScript
from System import DateTime
from Aderant.Query.ViewModels import CUSTOMTABLE
 
class Workflow(WorkflowScript) :
 
    def DynamicScript(self):
        if (self.Data.Client.CUSTOMTABLES.Count == 0):
            custom = CUSTOMTABLE()
            self.Data.Client.CUSTOMTABLES.Add(custom)
        self.Data.Client.CUSTOMTABLES[0].DESCRIPTION=self.Data.Client.UserData.customDescription
        self.Data.Client.CUSTOMTABLES[0].LOCATION=self.Data.Client.UserData.customLocation
 
 
As the custom table is imported as a collection, the object is pluralized and we refer to this when assigning values to the columns. Simply replace the CUSTOMTABLE(S) portion with your own table name.
Also, DESCRIPTION and LOCATION refers to the fields of the custom table - replace them with your own.
 
5. After creating the above script, ensure the script is placed at the first save point inside your workflow. In the case of FileOpening, place this inside the PendingSavePhase, before the PendingSaveSetups activity. The reason for this is that if you had placed the script above inside the SaveSetups.py script, it will be run twice and your custom table will be inserted twice with the same data.
6. You should now be able to run and save data to your custom table successfully within a FileOpening workflow!

Title: Custom 1-to-1 table usage - WF variables
Description:
This method revolves around using Workflow variables to capture user input. Both this and the User Data method allows us to simulate one-to-one mapping between the custom table and linked / FK table
 
To do this:
 
1. Create the workflow variables for the data you want to capture, preferably named the same as the columns in the custom table that you will be populating against. In this case, I've created customDescription and customLocation
2. Create a new smartform formed solely of the workflow variables you've created.Add this smartform to a task activity, or modify an existing smartform. I recommend adding this at the beginning i.e. IntakeForm. Remember to start smartform wizard from within Visual Studio for WF variables to be visible in smartform wizard. Remember to also refresh the smartform(s) modified so the data contracts are refreshed.
 
**Updated section*************
 
Each of the composite activities are isolated and so we need to create arguments to take in and pass on the workflow variables throughout the workflow. So for each composite activity you will need to define arguments (in our case, customDescription and customLocation). These arguments must be set to In/Out if the workflow variable must be passed back from the Composite Activity to the workflow.
 
Then, for each smartform activity that uses the modified smartform (if you take this approach), you will need to refresh the smartforms so the contracts are updated. You'll need to then assign the workflow variable/arguments to the custom fields you've added to the smartform.
 
After this, you will need to rebuild the solution so the composite activities display the newly added arguments in the property grid.
 
After rebuilding the solution, you will need to assign the workflow variable to the composite activity arguments so that the workflow variable is properly passed in and out of the composite activities.
 
**End of Updated section*************
 
 
3. Add the script below to a separate script / or embedded inside a dynamic script activity:
 
import clr
clr.AddReference("Aderant.Workflow.Activities")
clr.AddReference("Aderant.Query")
clr.AddReference("System")
clr.AddReference("WindowsBase")
from Aderant.Workflow.Activities import WorkflowScript
from System import DateTime
from Aderant.Query.ViewModels import CUSTOMTABLE
 
class Workflow(WorkflowScript) :
 
    def DynamicScript(self):
        if (self.Data.Client.CUSTOMTABLES.Count == 0):
            custom = CUSTOMTABLE()
            self.Data.Client.CUSTOMTABLES.Add(custom)
        self.Data.Client.CUSTOMTABLES[0].DESCRIPTION=self.Data.customDescription
        self.Data.Client.CUSTOMTABLES[0].LOCATION=self.Data.customLocation
 
 
As the custom table is imported as a collection, the object is pluralized and we refer to this when assigning values to the columns. Simply replace the CUSTOMTABLE(S) portion with your own table name.
Also, DESCRIPTION and LOCATION refers to the fields of the custom table - replace them with your own.
 
4. After creating the above script, ensure the script is placed at the first save point inside your workflow. In the case of FileOpening, place this inside the PendingSavePhase, before the PendingSaveSetups activity. The reason for this is that if you had placed the script above inside the SaveSetups.py script, it will be run twice and your custom table will be inserted twice with the same data.
 
5. Open up the FileOpening workflow in Visual Studio / Design Studio, and find the 'ClientExpand' string variable from the variable list. Modify the end of the string to contain ", CUSTOMTABLES" where CUSTOMTABLES is the pluralized name of your custom table. This is so the script utilizing the ClientExpand string will know to pull back the data for your custom table during the data retrieval process.
 
6. You should now be able to run and save data to your custom table successfully within a FileOpening workflow!

Title: End to end - Add custom 1-to-1 tables and link to standard tables
Description:
This test covers an end-to-end scenario whereby a custom 1:1 table is added to the database, then consumed in a workflow. The test verifies that such custom data can be persisted to the database. 
 
To maually create the 1:1 table (if the attached script does not work):
1. Launch DBEditor from your CMS binaries
2. Navigate to the SQL instance and database for your environment. 
3. Double-click on your database and enter owner username and password (normally cmsdbo/cmsdbo)
 
 
 
=============================================================================================
 
In order to use custom tables, the custom table needs to link to a standard table in FKEY (foreign key) relationship.
 
The following tables are heavily used by the Domain Models:
 
Aderant.Bill
Aderant.BusinessEntity
Aderant.Client
Aderant.Disbursement
Aderant.Employee
Aderant.Firm
Aderant.Marketing
Aderant.Matter
Aderant.Time
 
IMPORTANT NOTE:
When adding a new custom table to the Expert database, the columns that you add for that table should NOT be prefixed with an '-'.
If the columns do start with an '_', the customization 'Build All' will fail with an error similar to this:
The type 'Aderant.Matter.Models.MATTER_EVIDENCE' already contains a definition for '_EVIDENCE_DESCRIPTION'

Title: End to end - Add custom columns and 1-to-M custom tables
Description:
This test covers an end-to-end scenario whereby custom columns and tables are added to the database, then consumed in a workflow. The test verifies that such custom data can be persisted to the database. 
 
Test includes:
Custom columns on HBM_CLIENT
Custom columns on HBM_MATTER
Custom 1:M table attached to HBM_MATTER
 
 
 
 
=============================================================================================
The following tables are heavily used by the Domain Models:
 
Aderant.Bill
Aderant.BusinessEntity
Aderant.Client
Aderant.Disbursement
Aderant.Employee
Aderant.Firm
Aderant.Marketing
Aderant.Matter
Aderant.Time
 
Test that each of the above can be customized and consumed successfully
 
NOTE:
When adding new columns via DBEditor, remember to set the 'Nulls' checkbox accordingly. If the field is not a key (Primary or Foreign), then the convention for the Expert database is to allow nulls, and thereby the database columns do not always appear the same in SQL manager as they do via the data dictionary. So a non-key column that you set to NOT allow nulls, will appear this way in the data dictinoary, but in SQL, will appear as nullable.
When the view models are customised to include custom columns, the model is updated according to the data dictionary. If a new columns does NOT allow nulls, you may need to update workflow etc to accomodate otherwise you may get caught out by query service etc if it expects fields etc to be non-nullable.
 
 
Note: RE: 'Text' data type
Technically it is still supported, but should be viewed as deprecated functionality which will be removed at some point.
The majority of long character based columns within the Expert data dictionary will be defined as a STRING(LONG) which maps to sql as a VARCHAR(MAX) in 75SP3HF01 and to TEXT for pre-hf01 sites. 
LONGTEXT is mapped directly to the TEXT data type, but is rarely used. 
 
Text and varchar(max) are viewed as compatible types within the DD post 75SP3HF01. 
All new development should use STRING(LONG) where long character based columns are needed.

Currency database columns convert from 4 decimal places to 10 decimal places during upgrade

A list of database columns have been identified as requiring the change from the currency data type (which allows 4 decimal places), to the expcurrency data type (which allows 10 decimal places).
 
Pre-upgrade:
- For the relevant database columns, check the data is stored to 4 decimal places and verify how it is displayed in UI (number of decimal places according to the relevant currency)

Post-upgrade, we need to check:
- Data type changed in the database
- Existing data unchanged, but has extra 0s appended to fill the extra number of decimal places
- Existing data that was previously stored to 4 decimal places still displays as expected in UI (number of decimal places according to the relevant currency)

Title: Use Local Variables in basic Smartform
Description:
Currently, all the items in a smart form contract must be provided by a workflow task. This means that users end up having to store data in the workflow and send it to the task when it is only ever used for display purposes.

Ideally we should be able to also specify data that can be fetched from the client for display purposes but is not part of the contract. For example, I want to display the client details but I want to supply a client id. The Smart Form would fetch the data client-side and display it to the user. This avoids a full client object having to be sent down when it does not need to be.
Steps: Step 1: Click on the Add/View parameters button and add the following variables and tick the 'Local Only' option: Client (name = 'Client') String (name = 'Name')Boolean (name = 'AcceptTandC')Datetime (name = 'StartDate')Int32 (name = 'Quantity')Decimal (name = 'Balance')String (name = 'MoreInfo') || Step 2: Back in the Parameters window, check 'Client', expand Client and check, 'DisplayName', 'DepartmentId', 'OfficeId', ProfitCenterId' || Step 3: Set control type & properties for each added data contract:Name - TextBox (default), set: Prompt = "What is your name?" (freeform text), IsRequired=True || Step 4: AcceptTandC - Checkbox (default), set: Label to "Accept T & C", Tooltip "Check this box if you accept the Terms and Conditions" (freeform text) || Step 5: StartDate - DatePicker (default) || Step 6: Quantity - NumericBox, set: Decimal Places=0, Minimum=0, Maximum=30, Tooltip="Enter a number between 0 and 30?" (freeform text) || Step 7: Balance - NumericBox, set: Decimal Places=2, LeadingText=$ || Step 8: MoreInfo - AdvancedTextBox, set: ColumnSpan = True, Minimum Lines=3, Maximum Lines = 5, SpellChecking=True, ExpansionCodes=True || Step 9: Client - SearchBox, set: Data Provider=Client, BindTo=SelectedItem || Step 10: ClientOfficeId - SearchBox, set: Label=Office, DataProvider=Office, BindTo=SelectedItemId || Step 11: Client.DepartmentId - DisplayText, set: Label=Department, DataProvider='Department, DisplayFormat = 'Standard' || Step 12: Client.DisplayName - TextBox, IsReadOnly='True' || Step 13: Client.ProfitCenterId - SearchBox, Data provider = new ad hoc list (assign to same package as SF) || Step 14: Arrange the order of the Visible Items using the UP/DOWN arrows. Order should be: Name, AcceptT,StartDate,Quantity, Balance, MoreInfo, Client, Client.OfficeId, Client.DisplayName, Client.DepartmentI', Client.ProfitCenterId || Step 15: Add a Divder: Click on the DOWN arrow on the Add/View Items button and select Divider. Once you see a Divider item in the list, move it so it is after 'MoreInfo'and before 'Client' || Step 16: Press the Save button || Step 17: Finish the SFWizard without any other changes | Expected: SF is saved, view in Configuration Manager Technical.Presentation.SmartForms.
