SmartForm editor should open. || Step 3: In the editor, press the Edit button | Expected: SmartForm Wizard is launched. || Step 4: Click on the Add/View parameters button and add the following variables and tick the 'Local Variable' option: Client, String (name = 'Name'), Boolean (name = 'AcceptTandC'), Datetime (name = 'StartDate'), Int32 (name = 'Quantity'), Decimal (name = 'Balance'), String (name = 'MoreInfo') || Step 5: Back in the Parameters window, check 'Client', expand Client and check, 'DisplayName', 'DepartmentId', 'OfficeId', ProfitCenterId' || Step 6: Name - TextBox (default), enter Prompt = "What is your name?" (freeform text), IsRequired=True || Step 7: AcceptTandC - Checkbox (default), change Label to "Accept T & C", enter Tooltip "Check this box if you accept the Terms and Conditions" (freeform text) || Step 8: StartDate - DatePicker (default) || Step 9: Quantity - NumericBox, enter Label=Quantity, Decimal Places=0, Minimum=0, Maximum=30, Tooltip="How many children do you have?" (freeform text) || Step 10: Balance - NumericBox, enter Decimal Places=2, LeadingText=$ || Step 11: MoreInfo - AdvancedTextBox, ColumnSpan = True, Minimum Lines=3, Maximum Lines = 5, SpellChecking=True, ExpansionCodes=True || Step 12: Client - SearchBox, Data Provider=Client, BindTo=SelectedItem || Step 13: ClientOfficeId - SearchBox, Label=Office, DataProvider=Office, BindTo=SelectedItemId || Step 14: Client.DepartmentId - DisplayText, Label=Department, DataProvider='Department' || Step 15: Client.DisplayName - TextBox, IsReadOnly='True' || Step 16: Client.ProfitCenterId - SearchBox, Data provider = Adhoc List: Create New. In the 'Adhoc List Items: add the following items - Firm, Main, Null. (assign to same package as SF) || Step 17: Arrange the order of the Visible Items using the UP/DOWN arrows. Order should be: Name, AcceptT,StartDate,Quantity, Balance, MoreInfo, Client, Client.OfficeId, Client.DisplayName, Client.DepartmentId', Client.ProfitCenterId || Step 18: Add a Divder: Click on the DOWN arrow on the Add/View Items button and select Divider. Once you see a Divider item in the list, move it so it is after 'MoreInfo'and before 'Client' || Step 19: Finish the SFWizard without any other changes | Expected: SF is saved, view in Configuration Manager Technical.Presentation.SmartForms. || Step 20: Back in the editor in Design Studio, save the SmartForm || Step 21: Right-click on the SF Library, and re-generate all SmartForms | Expected: Progress bar indicates all SmartForms are re-generated || Step 22: Right-click on the SF Library and select 'Publish SFs to Local' (EA must be closed unless open from CO or MSI install) | Expected: Right-click on the SmartForm project and select 'Publish SmartForms to Local'. An assembly (dll) should be created and copied into your local ExpertShare folder. The dll name will be the same as the SmartForm library project name. Configuration addded to Configuration Manager under path: Technical.Presentation.SmartForms.xxx.yyy.ControllerFactoryType where xxx = SF catgeory, yyy = SF name, value - namespace, dll name for the SF

Title: Consume smartforms that use Local Variables
Description:
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Convert  Workflow Variables to Local Variables in existing smartforms
Description: When converting an existing variable to a local variable. Should the previous data contract be removed from the smartform?

Title: Client deployment calls home with environment details
Description:
When a deployment is completed for a production environment, the client's environment details should be sent back to a Registrations database set up at Aderant.
The details should include:
 
- Environment: General environment details
- Roles: The roles that have been deployed to that environment
- Packages: Packages that have been imported to the environment and are owned by Aderant
- Customizations: Names of any customization packages created by the client
 
Note:
We are only interested in collection environment information from production environments, not any customization workstations.

Title: Elect to send environment details home from Deployment Manager
License status report calls home with client license details
Description: **** 16 JUNE 2014: CALL HOME FUNCTIONALITY HAS BEEN REMOVED *****

Title: Import license calls home with license status
Description:
**** 16 JUNE 2014: CALL HOME FUNCTIONALITY HAS BEEN REMOVED *****
 
When a license package is imported, the status of that license should be sent to the Aderant registrations database. This only occurs the FIRST ime the license is imported into an environment.

Title: Disable calls home for license status
Description:
A backdoor has been created in case we need to disable the call home to Aderant for licensing status updates. This is controlled via a new configuration item that can be manually added. The call home will therefore be disabled if the config value is True.
 
Technical.Licensing.DisableLicensingStatus
 
Note:
This configuration value does not disable the calls home for general environment information (it only affects licensing status updates).

Title: Allow mass approval of workflow task
Description:
As a workflow designer I want to be able to nominate which tasks can be mass-approved.  When I mass approve the task will not be opened, and hence I have to accept that any form validation may not be executed.  Hence add a flag to approval based tasks to allow mass approve, and when changed to yes, warn the user that form validation will not occur if someone uses the multi-select mass approve facility.  
 
This allows the workflow designer the discretion to enable this function only when it is safe to utilise it, and avoids framework from having to load each task individually and both the performance and usability cost of doing this.
 
The warning is to remove any functional expectation or ambiguity.

Title: Multi select & actions - Mass approve (Review) approval tasks
Description:
A mass approval can be initiated from the Inbox in Expert Assistant for tasks where mass approval has been allowed by the activity's properties in the workflow designer. The option is only available if the selected tasks have exactly the same approval choices, and, the activity has the 'Can Mass Approve' property set to True in the workflow designer.
 
 
 
 
Change step 11:
 - Approval Choice
 - Approval Reason
 - Task Name - 
 
to
 
- Task Name (in disabled state)
- Options (this should be set to required)
- Comment (only enabled if Option in the same row is 'Declined')
Steps: Step 1: In any workflow, add an approval activity and a SmartForm task activity that uses the approval options (use any SmartForm for now). Assign each task to more than one person including yourself || Step 2: Set the 'Mass Approval' property on both activities to True || Step 3: In the workflow, add a workflow reference activity, and set the first 4 values using different items of data. Set the labels/values using a mixture of static and variable text (e.g. workflow variables, VB functions etc) || Step 4: Kick off at least 6 workflows, leave 3 on the approval and 3 on the SmartForm task activity || Step 5: From Expert Assistant, select the 3 approval tasks (ensure they are in a non-accepted state first) || Step 6: When the Mass Approval is available, select this option | Expected: A mass approval window opens that lists each of the tasks that were selected in a grid || Step 7: Check the window details | Expected: Grid columns: - Task Name (in disabled state) - Options (this should be set to required) - Comment (only enabled if Option in the same row is 'Declined') - Workflow Reference 1 (in disabled state) - Workflow Reference 2 (in disabled state) - Workflow Reference 3 (in disabled state) - Workflow Reference 4 (in disabled state) || Step 8: Check variable text in task names/workflow references | Expected: The variable text is correct for the workflow instance || Step 9: Close window without making any changes | Expected: Tasks have not been updated except that they have been auto-accepted by the user that initiated the mass approval || Step 10: From Expert Assistant, select the 3 smartform tasks and when the Mass Approval is available, select this option | Expected: A mass approval window opens that lists each of the tasks that were selected in a grid || Step 11: Check the window details | Expected: Grid columns: - Task Name (in disabled state) - Options (this should be set to required) - Comment (only enabled if Option in the same row is 'Declined') - Workflow Reference 1 - Workflow Reference 2 - Workflow Reference 3 - Workflow Reference 4 || Step 12: Close window without making any changes | Expected: Tasks have not been updated except that they have been auto-accepted by the user that initiated the mass approval || Step 13: In the mass approval window, do not select options or comments for any of the rows, then select 'Complete Tasks' from the ribbon | Expected: Tasks cannot be completed || Step 14: Enter options and comments in a couple of rows but not all, then select a combination of rows with and without the options and comments populated | Expected: None of the tasks are completed || Step 15: Select rows where an option (and comment if required) is populated, then select 'Complete Tasks' from the ribbon | Expected: Selected tasks are completed and removed from the window Option and comments are Workflow instances for selected tasks move on || Step 16: Select rows where an option (and comment if required) is populated, then select 'Complete Selected...' from the right-click menu | Expected: Selected tasks are completed and removed from the window Each workflow instance is updated with the value from its own instance of approval (this can be confirmed by a subsequent activity displaying the approval choice and comment)

Title: Mass approval UI
Description: This tests the various usability features and functions within the mass approval window.

Title: Complete mass approval for approval activity
Description:
From the mass approval window, more than one approval activity may be completed at once, so long as they have exactly the same approval choices.
 
- Approve some, decline others
- Complete without providing response for all tasks
- Approval comments do not overwrite each other ? One for each instance

Title: Initiate mass approval of workflow tasks from AppShell Inbox
Description:
A mass approval can be initiated from the Inbox in Expert AppShell (e.g. Paperless Prebill) for tasks where mass approval has been allowed by the activity's properties in the workflow designer.
This test just checks that from a Framework perspective, the mass approval can be initiated from the AppShell Inbox. Mass approval tests that are specific to the application under test (e.g. Paperless Prebill) should be covered by the product tests.

Title: Validate tasks when completing mass approval
Description: The mass approval window only validates approval choices and comments, but not SmartForm content (this content is not "loaded" into the mass approval window). This is the reason behind the warning that is displayed at design time when the 'Can Mass Approve' checkbox is ticked.

Title: Add x workflow references to workflow
Description:
Prior to 8010 SP, workflow definitions only permitted 4 workflow references. Now more than 4 workflow references can be set and these additional references will be displayed is in the mass approval window. (Expert Assistant Inbox grid and tasks will still only display the first 4 workflow references).
 
NB: 
Workflow references are stored in the WFM_WORKFLOW_REFERENCE table in the Expert database
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Approval Task - Mass approval activity with customized choices and comments
Description:
Default choices are provided for approval activities, however, these can be customized to the client's own options. If a client uses custom options, these should still be supported for mass approvals.
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Approval Task - Open task from mass approval window
Description:
Individual tasks can be opened from the mass approval window. At this point, the task should be in an accepted state for the user that is performing the mass approval, and the task data can be changed in the task window. Only the approval choice and comment will be directly updated back in the mass approval window. Any other data in the task will only be saved if the task window itself is saved & closed or completed.
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Deploying/Removing Golden Gate with Visual Studio On
Description:
The Pause Break implementation in Deployment Manager pauses the deployment if any discrepancies are encountered and allows the users to rectify the discrepancy and then try deploying once again. 
 
When a discrepancy is encountered, the Deployment Manager automatically rolls back to its previous step and display's a pop-up window with a brief description of the error encountered and 2 options - Retry and Cancel.
           - Hitting 'Retry' continues the deployment process from the last step before failure.
           - Hitting 'Cancel' forces the user to start the deployment process from the beginning.
 
By this way, the users could save sometime in their deployment process.
 
-- The Deployment Manager runs through the Pre-requisite check and the Environment Validator check before deploying. Closing all the Visual Studio applications is one of the pre-requisites for a successful deployment. This test confirms that with the implementation of 'Pause Break', the deployment manager stops the process of deploying when an error is encountered and then continues the process as it is fixed.

Title: Deploy/Remove with the incorrect URL for SSRS
Description:
The Pause Break implementation in Deployment Manager pauses the deployment if any discrepancies are encountered and allows the users to rectify the discrepancy and then try deploying once again. 
 
When a discrepancy is encountered, the Deployment Manager automatically rolls back to its previous step and display's a pop-up window with a brief description of the error encountered and 2 options - Retry and Cancel.
           - Hitting 'Retry' continues the deployment process from the last step before failure.
           - Hitting 'Cancel' forces the user to start the deployment process from the beginning.
 
By this way, the users could save sometime in their deployment process.
 
-- The Deployment Manager runs through the Pre-requisite check and the Environment Validator check before deploying. 
The incorrect URL for SSRS should stop the deployment process and force an error. After fixing the SSRS field to the correct URL, the deployment should resume.

Title: Delete a file from the Expert Source folder and Deploy/Remove
Description:
The Pause Break implementation in Deployment Manager pauses the deployment if any discrepancies are encountered and allows the users to rectify the discrepancy and then try deploying once again. 
 
When a discrepancy is encountered, the Deployment Manager automatically rolls back to its previous step and display's a pop-up window with a brief description of the error encountered and 2 options - Retry and Cancel.
           - Hitting 'Retry' continues the deployment process from the last step before failure.
           - Hitting 'Cancel' forces the user to start the deployment process from the beginning.
 
By this way, the users could save sometime in their deployment process.
 
-- The Deployment Manager runs through the Pre-requisite check and the Environment Validator check before deploying. 
Delete a file from the Expert Source folder and start deploying. The deployment process should fail and once the file is put back in its original folder, the deployment should resume.

Title: Mass approve same task from different workflow versions
Description: When more than one version of a workflow has been published, you should still be able to complete a mass approval for instances of the same approval task from different workflow versions (assuming the approval choices/comments are unchanged).

Title: Approval Task - Mass Approval Base Runtime Test
Deploy without installing the IIS Rewrite Module for Query Service
Description:
The Pause Break implementation in Deployment Manager pauses the deployment if any discrepancies are encountered and allows the users to rectify the discrepancy and then try deploying once again. 
 
When a discrepancy is encountered, the Deployment Manager automatically rolls back to its previous step and display's a pop-up window with a brief description of the error encountered and 2 options - Retry and Cancel.
           - Hitting 'Retry' continues the deployment process from the last step before failure.
           - Hitting 'Cancel' forces the user to start the deployment process from the beginning.
 
By this way, the users could save sometime in their deployment process.
 
-- The Deployment Manager runs through the Pre-requisite check and the Environment Validator check before deploying. 
Product changes in Main have introduced a new dependency on a thrid party IIS module. You will be unable to deploy Main until the IIS Url Rewrite module is installed. Without this installed on the system, try to deploy the branch. It should fail apparently. Try to install the third party IIS Module and then redeploy once again.

Title: Add a column in hbm_client table and consume it in File Opening smartform
Description:
As a part of MultiCurrency testing for new currency type - ExpCurrency (decimal(25,10)), a new column is to be added to an existing table with currency as a datatype. Reflect the addition using Domain Wizard in the GoldenGate applications.
Consume the added column in a smartform and see if the values are stored correctly to the database.
Steps: Step 1: Make Sure you close all the aderant application first || Step 2: Open DBEditor from the bin folder of your CMS source location. Login as a CMSDBO user and select the right version of your database. || Step 3: Double click on the Tables under the database and right click on the hbm_client table and choose to 'Revise' || Step 4: Click on the columns and right click on it and choose 'Add Column' option. | Expected: A new screen is displayed || Step 5: Create a new column with column name as '_CUST_MONEY' and set the datatype to 'currency'. (Remember to set the id anywhere between 900 and 999 for customised columns and tick the Nulls checkbox).  Save the settings. || Step 6: Open DomainWizard.exe from your Expert Share folder and begin the wizard. Choose the second option 'Extend an existing entity to add a new column or child table'. || Step 7: Select hbm_client table and a customisation package and go through the wizard to complete it. | Expected: The wizard completes without any errors. || Step 8: Open Deployment Manager from your Expert Source location and navigate to the packages tab. Select Build All. AFter Build All is successful, select Deploy All.(For new version , Open deployment Manager and open the Packages page , and click on Apply Customizations button) | Expected: Build All and Deploy All should be successful. || Step 9: Open SmartFormWizard.exe from your Expert Share folder and select 'FileOpening.ClientDetails' smartform to edit it. || Step 10: Add the newly created column '_MONEY' to the smartform and set the control as Numeric Box and decimal places to 3 and save the setting. | Expected: The setting gets saved. || Step 11: Open a new File Opening workflow from your Expert Assistant actions menu and fill in the required fields. In the money field, add a amount with decimal like (100000.545) against a new client/existing client. || Step 12: Complete the File Opening workflow. | Expected: The workflow gets completed without any errors || Step 13: In SQL Serer, check the value of Money field that was added in the workflow process. | Expected: The values should not be rounded. It should display the same value as that was entered in the workflow (in this case, 100000.545).

Title: CM_00. INFO, READ FIRST -  Aderant is System Owner
Description:
The test cases assume that the System Owner for your evironment is NOT Aderant. If the System owner IS Aderant, the scope for configuration is always the scope that is provided by the user. There is no login to automatically create 'Firm' level config etc.
 
Note: 
To find out who the system owner is for your environment, execute the following SQL against your database.
 
SELECT * FROM SECURITY.FWM_OWNER WHERE IsSystem = 'Y'

Title: CM_01. Launch Configuration Manager
Description:
Launch Configuration Manager 
Test that you can only open Configuration Manager if you have security. Can use the Adminisrators usergroup to test launching Configuration Manager from the ExpertShare folder
    (a) If not in Adminisrators user group, get message that no permission
    (b) Add yourself to the Adminisrator's user group, Configuration Manager launches
    (c) Check that you can navigate the configuration tree

With the Design Studio V2 project, configuration manager is clubbed together with other customization elements (like security manager, action wizard etc) in a single product.
 
And hence the launching of configuration manager wouldn't be the same as Pre-SP2.
Steps: Step 1: Launch Configuration Manager with the following conditions || Step 2: None Adminisrators user group users | Expected: Error message saying that the user has no permission. || Step 3: Add yourself to the Adminisrator's user group | Expected: Configuration Manager launches || Step 4: After App launches, check that you can navigate the configuration tree

Title: CM_02. Add Configuration - THIS TEST NEED TO REWRITE TO BE ACTION TEST
Description:
Add new item. 
Navigate through the tree to create a new config item: Technical.Applications.Actions
    (a) Right-click on Actions and select 'Add' --> Edit Configuration window opens
    (b) Path should default to Technical.Applications.Actions
    (c) Scope should default to 'Firm'--> leave as is
    (d) DataType should default to 'Text'--> Change to 'Xml'
    (e)Name is blank by default --> Set name to 'LaunchFavouriteWebsite'
    (f)Enter Value of:
<Action displayName="Fav Website" description="Launches Google Website" resourceDescriptor="" imageUri="" imageKey="">
        <Script>
import clr
from System.Diagnostics import Process
process = Process()
process.StartInfo.FileName = "http://google.com"
process.Start()
        </Script>
</Action>
    (g) Enter description: Launches your favourite website 
    (h) Check that Package is a required field, you should not be able to save config without setting it --> Create a new Package called 'ConfigTest and select it'
    (i) Press the OK button
                - The new config item is displayed in the tree: Technical.Applications.Actions.LaunchFavouriteWebsite
                - The new config item is currently in focus - has green circle icon in the tree
                - The Valid From date is set to today
                - The Value displays in the Preview section of the Config Mgr window
                - You can see the "Fave Website" item in the Action menu of EA, description = "Launches Google Website"
                - Check that double-clicking on the Action menu item launches the Google website
 
Create Future Dated configuration value
Navigate through the tree to the new config item you created above: Technical.Applications.Actions.LaunchFavouriteWebsite
    (a) In the grid on teh RHS, right-click on the config item and select 'Edit' 
In the Edit Configuration Value window, change the following:
    (b) Enter Value of:
<Action displayName="Fav Website" description="Launches Yahoo Website" resourceDescriptor="" imageUri="" imageKey="">
        <Script>
import clr
from System.Diagnostics import Process
process = Process()
process.StartInfo.FileName = "http://nz.yahoo.com/?p=us"
process.Start()
        </Script>
</Action>
    (c) In the Advanced section, select a ValidFrom date of one week from today
    (d) Select package of 'ConfigTest' and press the OK button
                - Check that the Valid From date is set to the date you set in the Edit window
 
    (e) Launch Expert Assistant and ensure you see the Google action menu item but not hte Yahoo one
    (f) Change the calendar setting on your test machine forward so that it is later than the Valid From date
    (g) Check that doubcle-clicking on the "Fav Website" Actions menu in EA should now launch the "Yahoo" (may need to right-click 'Refresh') 
    (h) Set your calendate setting back to current date and time
 
Create machine specific values. 
Right-click on the FIRST config item you created on the grid in the RHS and select 'Create Machine Specific'. In the Edit Configuration Value window, change the following:
     (a) In the Value box: displayName="My workstation link" ... description="only for my workstation" ... process.StartInfo.FileName = "http://www.nzherald.co.nz/"
     (b)  In the Advanced fields, change the Computer name to your own workstation or one of the test client PCs (e.g. WSAKL000599).
     (d)  Select Package of 'ConfigTest' and click OK.  Note that another Configuration value entry is added and when that is selected, an entry to User and Machine Specific grid is also present.
     (e) On that machine, launch ExpertAssistant and go to Actions menu.  There should now be an Action menu item for "My workstation Link" instead of "Google". NOTE: YOU MAY NEED TO REFRESH AND REMOVE "GOOGLE" FROM MRU(Recently used) to see WORKSTATION action menu item instead of Google
     (f) Double-clicking on "Fav Website" action will proceed to the NZ Herald site rather than the Google website.
     (g)  Log into the same machine as a DIFFERENT user and ensure that user can also see the Action menu item in EA
     (h)  Log into another client machine using your own login, and check that you CANNOT see the Action menu item in EA
 
Create User specific values
Right-click on the FIRST config item you created on the grid in the RHS and select 'Create User Specific'. In the Edit Configuration Value window, change the following:
4.  In the Configuration Value Edit window, change the following:
    (a) In the Value box: displayName="My own individual link" ... description="only available for me on any workstations" ... process.StartInfo.FileName = "http://www.stuff.co.nz/"
    (b) In the Description box: Open Stuff Website
    (c)  In the Advanced fields, change the User or Group field by clicking on [...] and selecting your username or another (ie TTQA1)
5.  Select Package of 'ConfigTest' and click OK. Note that another Configuration value entry is added and when that is selected, an entry to User and Machine Specific grid is also present.
6.  Launch ExpertAssistant and go to Actions menu.  The newly defined action "My own individual link" should be present in the Action list and double-clicking that will proceed to "stuff" wesbite. You should not see the action menu items for Google or for NZHerald.
7.  Log into your machine as a DIFFERENT user and ensure that user CANNOT see the Action menu item in EA
8.  Log into another client machine using your own login, and check that you CAN see and use the Action menu item in EA

Title: CM_03. Edit configuration
Description:
Edit System Value
1. Navigate to Technical.Applications.Actions.AderantExpert in Configuration Manager - should have scope of 'System'
2. Double-click on the item in the RHS to open the 'Edit Configuration Value' window
4. Check that the scope is 'Firm' and the Package field is blank and REQUIRED
3. In the value, change the displyName from "Expert 7.5" to "Expert Client Server"
4. Select package of 'ConfigTest', then press the OK button
5. Check that a NEW item (with same path and name) has been created, but has a scope of 'Firm' and Valid From date of today
6. Re-open the original 'System' value, change the scope to 'Firm' 
7. In the value change displayName from Expert 7.5" to "Expert AppShell", select package of 'ConfigTest' and press OK
8. Check that a ANOTHER new item (with same path and name) has been created, but has a scope of 'Firm' and Valid From date of today
 
Edit Firm Value
Each time you manually edit a Firm config item via Config Manager, its own details are overwritten, a new config item is created.
Back in path Technical.Applications.Actions.AderantExpert in Configuration 
2. Double-click on the first Firm value you created in the RHS to open the 'Edit Configuration Value' window

Title: CM_06. Delete configuration
Description:
Delete Configuration
 
Delete Firm Value
1. Add a new config item anywhere in the tree with min details
2. Add two more config items underneath it with min details by right-clicking on it in the tree and selecting "Add"
3. In the RHS grid, right-click on the last one created and 'select 'Delete
4.Check you get confirmation message and select 'No'--> config should still be there
5. In the RHS grid, right-click on the config item again and select 'Delete''
6.when you get confirmation message, select Ýes'--> config should be removed
7. Ensure that config item is no longer visible in EA (may need to clear cache)
 
Delete All Configuration Below Tree Node

9..Check you get confirmation message and select 'No'--> the selected config and the item below it should still be there
10.In the navigation tree, right-click on the config item again and select 'Delete''
11. When you get confirmation message, select Ýes'--> both the selected config and the item below it should be removed
 
Delete System Value
1. Navigate to a config value that has a scope of 'System'
2. Right-click on it from the grid on the RHS and select 'Delete
3. Check you get confirmation message that you have selected a system owned value and deleteing it may vause instability. Select 'No'--> config should still be there

Title: CM_07. GUI Functionalities
Description:
1. Verify that users can easily navigate by collapsing and expanding folders.
2. Verify that config values can be opened when double-clicked
3. Refresh can be done using the menu (View menu) or right-click option in the config tree
4. Search for configuration items using the edit menu
  a. Can launch 'Find' window using Ctrl+F or selecting 'Find' from the Edit menu
  b. Search for configuration using the 'Path' control
  c. Search for configuration using the 'Name' control
5. Test that when creating config values that are XML type, that the editor prompts user of any formatting issues.
  a. When a formatting issues is discovered the app should underline in red.
  b. When a user tries to OK the configuration, the user should be prompted of the errrors location, and should be not allowed to save.
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: CM_04. Export Configuration
Description:
Export package containing configuration
 
1. Launch Visual Studio
2. In the Design Studio toolbar, select 'Export Package' button
3. Select 'ConfigTest' package and a location to export the package to
4. Ensure you get confirmation that package is created
5. Double-click on the package in the location it was exported to and open the configuration xml file.
6. The config.xml file in the package should contain the following items:
                  (a) The original Firm value created for: Technical.Applications.Actions.LaunchFavouriteWebsite   --> launches Google website
                  (b) The machine-specific value created for: Technical.Applications.Actions.LaunchFavouriteWebsite   --> launches NZ Herald website
                  (c) The Firm value created for: Technical.Applications.Actions.AderantExpert --> has a displayname for the Action menu item of "ExpertAppShell"
                  (d) The user-specific value created for: Technical.Applications.Actions.AderantExpert --> has a displayname for the Action menu item of  "My own individual link"
 
RULE:
For a config value of a given path and name
- The CURRENT value WITHIN EACH scope for that package (no Valid From date included in package. if there was a Valid After date, it would be stripped out during export)
 
Other
EXPORT DOES NOT CARE WHO THE OWNER IS
FUTURE dated values are NOT exported

Title: CM_05. Import configuration
Description:
Into another environment, import the package you have created from the previous test ('Base test 04 - Export configuration)
 
Rules:
Within the same scope, if the config in the package has a future effective date,
(a) A new config entry will be created, effective dates as per the package
 
Within the same scope, if the config in the package does NOT have a future effective date, and has:
(a) A different package to existing values (with same path and name) -->  a new config entry will be created, and the Valid After date will be set to today
(b) A different value  to existing values (with same path and name) -->  a new config entry will be created, and the Valid After date will be set to today
(c) The same package and value (with same path and name) --> no update will take place
 
ENSURE YOU ALSO TEST 
- NEW DATABASE
- UPGRADE FROM EARLIER RELEASE
- MORE THAN ONE DEPLOYMENT
- CONFIG AT DIFFERENT SCOPES E.G. System (Aderant=package owner)/Firm/User, etc...

Title: Create config from system packages
Description:
This test relates to packages that are in the Packages folder in yur GG binaries. These are imported via Deployment Manager to create configuraton which should be visible in COnfiguration Manager
 
Rules:
Within the same scope, if the config in the package has a future effective date,
(a) A new config entry will be created, effective dates as per the package
 
Within the same scope, if the config in the package does NOT have a future effective date, and has:
(a) A different package to existing values (with same path and name) --> a new config entry will be created, and the Valid After date will be set to today
(b) A different value  to existing values (with same path and name) --> a new config entry will be created, and the Valid After date will be set to today
(c) The same package and value (with same path and name) --> no update will take place
 
ENSURE YOU ALSO TEST 
- NEW DATABASE
- UPGRADE FROM EARLIER RELEASE
- MORE THAN ONE DEPLOYMENT
- CONFIG AT DIFFERENT SCOPES E.G. System/Firm/User, etc...

Title: Create New SmartForm
Description:
When a new SF is created via SF Wizard, config is created under the paths below. These should all have a Scope of 'Firm'
 
Technical.Presentation.SmartForms.XXX.YYY
>ControllerLanguage
>ControllerSource
>DataTemplate
>Description
>FormType
>HelpLinkId
>IsCollapsable
>IsCollapsed
>IsCustomizable
>IsReadOnly
>IsVisible
>NotesConversation
>ShowTitle
>SummaryDataTemplate
>Title
 
Technical.Presentation.SmartFormWizard.XXX.YYY
>Contracts
>SmartFormModel
 
 
XXX = SmartForm Category
YYY= SmartForm Name

Title: Deploy more than once
Description: e.g. After deployment, check if services are okay and SmartForms are okay at runtime

Title: Deploy with new database
Description: e.g. After deployment, check if services are okay and SmartForms are okay at runtime

Title: Edit existing SmartForm
Description:
SmartForms are stored in configuration and for the most part, they behave like all other config. However, SmartForms should predominantly be maintained via SmartForm Wizard, so here are a few subtle differences between SmartForms and other configuration.
 
(a) Create by copying from existing System SmartForms via the Wizard will create a Firm SmartForm that does NOT have a Valid From date (normal config does)
(b) Entering the SmartForm Wizard thereafter, when selecting a SmartForm to EDIT in the Wizard, the Wizard maintains the Firm version of the SmartForm not the System SmartForm (only ONE appears in the list of available SmartForms)
(i) Assuming no changes, no new config created
(ii) If any values or the package is changed, NEW config item is created with Valid After date set.

Title: Hierarchy of configuration scope
Description:
Configuration items may have different values depending on the scope of the config. 
 
The hierarchy of the scopes that determines which value will be used is:
(a) User-specific
(b) Machine-specific
(c) Firm
(d) System
 
To test:
For the same config item, set up values with each type of scope, and check to see that when in the appropriate context, the correct config value is used. 
 
To do this you can: 
(a) Import the package attached to this test 
(b) Under each of the following conditions, launch EA and double-click on 'Aderant Support' in the Actions menu
           (i) Log into WSAKL000500 as yourself --> launches 'Wises' website
           (ii) Log into WSAKL000500 as TTQA1 --> launches 'Google' website
           (iii) Log into any other machine as TTQA1 --> launches 'Google' website
           (iv) Log into any other machine as yourself --> launches 'NZ Herald' website
(c) Launch Configuration Manager and navigate to Techincal.Applications.Actions.AderantSupport.Delete the three config items for 'AderantSupport' tha have scope of either 'Firm', 'Machine', 'User'. Clear cache. Under each of the following conditions, launch EA and double-click on 'Aderant Support' in the Actions menu
           (i) Log into WSAKL000500 as yourself --> launches 'Aderant Support' website
           (ii) Log into WSAKL000500 as TTQA1 --> launches 'Aderant Support' website
           (iii) Log into any other machine as TTQA1 --> launches 'Aderant Support' website
           (iv) Log into any other machine as yourself --> launches 'Aderant Support' website

Title: Import config via customization packages
Description:
This test relates to customization packages that clients may create, and import via the Packages tab in Deployment Manager
(includes SmartForms)
 
Rules:
Within the same scope, if the config in the package has a future effective date,
(a) A new config entry will be created, effective dates as per the package
 
Within the same scope, if the config in the package does NOT have a future effective date, and has:
(a) A different package to existing values (with same path and name) -->  a new config entry will be created, and the Valid After date will be set to today
(b) A different value  to existing values (with same path and name) -->  a new config entry will be created, and the Valid After date will be set to today
(c) The same package and value (with same path and name) --> no update will take place
 
ENSURE YOU ALSO TEST 
- NEW DATABASE
- UPGRADE FROM EARLIER RELEASE
- MORE THAN ONE DEPLOYMENT
- CONFIG AT DIFFERENT SCOPES E.G. System (Aderant=package owner)/Firm/User, etc...

Title: Smartform Wizard - Fetch currently valid firm value
Description:
SmartForms may have different effective dates depending on the Valid From date of the config. 
 
To test:
When editing/copying existing SFs, 
(a) If there are no firm/user/machine specific values, the CURRENT system value should be used 
(b) Where there ARE firm SFs, the CURRENT firm value is used (e.g. test if there is more than one firm version of a SF)

Title: Update config via roles files
Description:
This test relates to role files that may update existing config.
 
Rules:
Will update the current value with same package (regardless of value)
 
 
ENSURE YOU ALSO TEST 
- NEW DATABASE
- UPGRADE FROM EARLIER RELEASE
- MORE THAN ONE DEPLOYMENT
- CONFIG AT DIFFERENT SCOPES E.G. System/Firm/User, etc...
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Use currently valid configuration
Description:
Configuration items may have different effective dates depending on the Valid From date of the config. 
 
To test:
(a) If there are no firm/user/machine specific values, the CURRENT system value (according to the Valid From dates) should be used 
      e.g. 'Aderant Support' action in Expert Assistant --> Launches Aderant Support website
(b) Within the firm/machine/user hierarchy, if there is only one value that does not have a Valid From date, this should be used
     
(c) Within the firm/machine/user hierarchy, if there is more than one value, the current value (according to the Valid From dates) should be used

Title: DataProvider picks up newly added items to existing enumerations
Description:
Fixed lookup lists(enums) can be customised by clients. These are commonly used for lists that are also used by the Expert Application but do not have their own database tables.
 
1. Add/edit an item to an existing enumeration in the database by directly updating the dbo.CXL.CODE_LOOKUP
2. Verify that this new item is visible in the search results in the relevant smart form control.
3. Ensure that values selected in the search control on the SmartForm are saved when the task is saved and closed, and re-opened, and between tasks
Steps: Step 1: Navigate to Hub Setup -> Firm Setup -> Departments and create a new Department Code:a. Enter Code: TTT then Tab outb. Enter Description: Test Dummy Departmentc. Set yourself as Department head then save | Expected: A new Department record is created in database table HBL_DEPT || Step 2: Navigate to Employee Management -> Employee Details and create a new Employee record:a. Enter Code: NZ999b. Enter name details: TTQA999, Testc. Save the changes | Expected: A new Employee record is created in database table HBM_PERSNL || Step 3: Run SmartformWizard.exe, create a new smartform and add a contract of type Department and EmployeeChange control type for both to SearchControl, then set DataProvider to Department and Employee accordingly and save the smartform || Step 4: Run SmartformAtion.exe, use Configure Forms to load the smartform created previously || Step 5: In the search controls, search for the entries you created in step #2 and #3 || Step 6: Select the new entry, then save and close the task.Re-open the task and check that the entries are still selected. | Expected: The value selected in the search control on the SmartForm is still visible in the control.

Title: Custom Data Provider - Create config based custom Data Provider in XML
Description:
GOAL: To create new custom XML data providers and implement in an existing smart form and ensure data is passed correctly between workflow tasks.
 
FOR FURTHER INSTRUCTIONS:
http://ttwiki/wiki/index.php?title=Creating_Generic_Lookup_Search_Data_Providers
Steps: Step 1: Run ConfigurationManager from ExpertShareCreate a new entry in Technical.Presentation.DataProvider.Framework:a. Name = CourtDataProviderb. DataType = XMLc. Copy the content of the attachment file from the test step and paste it into the value fieldd. Save your changes || Step 2: Create another entry in Technical.Presentation.DataProvider.Framework:a. Name = Jurisdictionb. DataType = XMLc. Copy the content of the attachment file from this test step and paste it into the value fieldd. Save your changes || Step 3: Add framework referencesa. Run SmartForm Wizard from ExpertShareb.Create a new SmartForm and navigate to step 3 c. Switch to "Forms" tab, check "Advanced" and expand the XAML property. Then click on the ellipsis for "Additional namesspaces" d. In the editor that pops up, paste the following:fpc="clr-namespace:Aderant.PresentationFramework.Converters;assembly=Aderant.PresentationFramework"e. Click into "Resource" and paste the following:<fpc:IdentifierToUnderlyingConverter x:Key="IdentifierToUnderlyingConverter" /> || Step 4: Consume CourtDataProvider DataProvidera. Add a data contract of type Int32 and change control type to 'SearchBox' b. Set DataProvider to "Court", Bind to "SelectedItemId"c. Click on Advanced button and modify the XAML, add the following in section <C:SearchBox.SelectedItemId> on <Binding Path> after NotifyOnValidationError=True parameter:Converter="{StaticResource IdentifierToUnderlyingConverter}" | Expected: The section should look something like this:<c:SearchBox.SelectedItemId> <Binding Path="Data.courtId" NotifyOnSourceUpdated="True" Mode="TwoWay" NotifyOnValidationError="True" Converter="{StaticResource IdentifierToUnderlyingConverter}" /></c:SearchBox.SelectedItemId> The Properties section will show as "empty" with the addition to the properties. || Step 5: Consume Jurisdiction DataProviderUse data contract of type String and repeat the previous test steps in #4, setting the data provider to "Jurisdiction Cust" instead of "Court", then save your changes || Step 6: Test the DataProviders in the Smartform in runtime:a. Use SmartformAtion.exe from ExpertShare and load the smartformb. Add the smartform to a Task activity in a Workflow project | Expected: Court data provider: -Data provider is SEARCH mode (Unlike Filter mode, search results only appear when you have entered search criteria)-Results match: select * from LMM_COURT (and takes search criteria into account) Jurisdiction data provider: -Data provider is FILTER mode (Unlike Search mode, search results are always displayed)-Results match: select * from LML_COURT_JURIS || Step 7: Test the data is persisted in Workflow by:-Save and close the task. -Then re-open task. | Expected: Values that were selected for the 2 data providers are still selected

Title: Custom Data Provider - Create config based custom Data Provider in Python
Description:
GOAL: To create new custom IronPython data providers and implement in an existing smart form and ensure data is passed correctly between workflow tasks.
 
FOR FURTHER INSTRUCTIONS:
http://ttwiki/wiki/index.php?title=Creating_Generic_Lookup_Search_Data_Providers
Steps: Step 1: Run ConfigurationManager from ExpertShareCreate a new entry in Technical.Presentation.DataProvider.Framework:a. Name = APAttorneyDPb. DataType = IronPythonc. Copy the content of the attachment file and paste it into the value field(Python is very sensitive with Syntax, so make sure the spacing for each function is correct)d. Save your changes || Step 2: Consume python DataProvider in SmartForm a. Run SmartForm Wizard from ExpertShareb.Create a new SmartForm and navigate to step 3 c. Switch to "Forms" tab, check "Advanced" and expand the XAML property. Then click on the ellipsis for "Additional namesspaces d. In the editor that pops up, paste the following:a="clr-namespace:Aderant.Framework.Presentation.MarkupExtensions;assembly=Aderant.Framework.Presentation" e. Add a data contract of type Int32 and change control type to 'SearchBox' f. For the search control, click on the Advanced button under "Control" tab and add the following line to the SearchBox properties:DataProvider="{a:PythonDataProviderFactory Technical.Presentation.DataProviders.Framework.APAttorneyDP}" g. Save SmartForm || Step 3: Test the DataProviders in the Smartform in runtime:a. Use SmartformAtion.exe from ExpertShare and load the smartformb. Add the smartform to a Task activity in a Workflow project | Expected: In runtime:-Data provider is SEARCH mode (Unlike Filter mode, search results only appear when you have entered search criteria)-Results returned match search criteria and is subset of: SELECT * FROM HBM_PERSNL WHERE DEPT IN ('ADM', 'AUD', 'LIT', 'TAX') AND INACTIVE = 'N' -Values selected in the search control on the SmartForm is saved when the task is saved and closed, and re-opened, and between tasks || Step 4: Test the data is persisted in Workflow by:-Save and close the task. -Then re-open task. | Expected: Value that was selected for the data provider is still selected

Title: Consume default ad hoc lists
Description:
Three ad hoc lists are created by default during deployment. 
 
1. AdHocListTrueFalse
2. AdHocListYesNo
3. AdHocListYesNoUnsure
 
Test:
1. In step 3 of the Smart Form Wizard, the above 3 lists are available for selection in the 'DataProvider' property for 'SearchBoxes', 'DisplayText', and 'RadioButtonGroup' controls
2. The list can be selected and Smart Form successsfully generated
3. SmartForms that use these lists can be succesfully run in a workflow and the data from selecting items from these lists is persisted to the database accordingly

Title: Create new ad hoc list
Description:
A new ad hoc list data provider can be added via the Smart Form Wizard, in step 5. They are also only supported for attributes that are of a type 'String'.
 
Available for the following control types:
- SearchBox
- DisplayText
- RadioControl
 
Test:
1. For a SearchBox, the DataProvider property has the option 'AdHoc List: Create New
2. For each of the above control types, there is a new property called 'Data Provider Item'
3. Clicking on the ellipsis for the new property pops up a 'List Editor' window, where new items can be added/removed
4. Add/remove new items using the List Editor. Note that none of the fields are required, and there are no uniqueness constraints. However, the 'Code' represents what will be saved to the context data/database.
5. When the Accept button is pressed, the Save Adhoc list' window pops up
6. If the Accept button is pressed, and the list has not been previously saved, a 'Save Adhoc list' window pops up
 In the 'Save Adhoc List' window, the user must enter a Name, Description, and Package, all of which are REQUIRED
7. The 'Data Provider' property for that control is updated to include the ad hoc list you have just created, and the list also defaults as selected
8. Check that for each ad hoc list created/maintained in the Smart Form Wizard, there is one row in the FWA_AdhocList  able, and one row for each list item in the FWA_AdhocListItem table, each of which is linked to the FWA_AdhocList table.
9. The new ad hoc list data provider should be available for selection in the Data Provider property in step 5 of the Smart Form Wizard for 
               (a) the same control that the list was added in
               (b) other controls/items in the smart form that are selected without existing step 5 after the ad hoc list was added
               (c) Any time thereafter (e.g. after Smart Form wizard is exited, creating new smart forms etc)
10. Repeat test for DisplayText control
11. Repeat test for RadioButtonGroup control

Title: Export ad hoc list using packaging
Description:
Ad hoc lists have a plug in to packaging, so a list can be exported and imported within a package. Test that Ad hoc lists can be Exported from 1 environment to another as part of a package export.
 
Pre req's:
Create ad hoc lists, and have these defined against a package
 
Test:
1. From the UI Export a new list with n attributes - Ensure data has all data , ie primary, secondary and code.
2. From the UI Export an list already exported that has some new attributes added
3. From the UI Export an existing list that has existing attributes changed, ie change secondary test to a new value
4. from the Customization Package Manager command line, ensure a simple export can be performed containing ad hoc lists. Ensure that the versioning can be used.
 
In all tests, the function finishes correctly, the information is added to the list

Title: Import ad hoc list using packaging
Description:
Ad hoc lists have a plug in to packaging, so a list can be exported and imported within a package. Test that Ad hoc lists can be imported from 1 environment to another as part of a package import
 
Pre req's:
Create ad hoc lists, and have these defined against a package
Export that list from one environment.
 
Test:
1. From the UI Import a new list with n attributes - Ensure data has all data , ie primary, secondary and code.
2. From the UI Import an existing list that has some new attributes added
3. From the UI Import and existing list that has existing attributes changed, ie change secondary test to a new value
4. from the Customization Package Manager command line, ensure a simple import can be performed containing ad hoc lists
 
Consumption:
Test that the imported list is available to be selected in the data provider search in the smart form wizard, and can be consumed by a smart form, then further used in a workflow.

Title: Maintain ad hoc list
Description:
The new ad hoc list data provider should be available for selection and maintenance in the AdhocList Data Provider property in step 5 of the Smart Form Wizard for SearchBoxes, DisplayText and RadioButtonGroup controls for any new/existing smart form.
 
Pre req's:
Ad hoc lists have been created
 
Test:
 
1. The ad hoc list data provider is available for selection and maintenance in the AdhocList Data Provider property in step 3 of the Smart Form Wizard for SearchBoxes, DisplayText and RadioButtonGroup controls 
2. List items can be added/edited/removed using the List Editor via the Adhoc Data Provider Item List in the same step and press the Accept button, and the 'Save Adhoc List' pop up appears
3. Change the list name
4. The change to the list name should be visible in the AdhocList Data Provider property in step 3 of the Smart Form Wizard for SearchBoxes, DisplayText and RadioButtonGroup controls
Note: Any existing smart forms that have controls that use this list
5. The changes made to the list are reflected in all smart forms that use the list
6. When data using the updated list is persisted to CMS, the updated value is saved

Title: Use ad hoc list in smart form
Description:
The new ad hoc list data provider should be available for selection in the Data Provider property in step 3 of the Smart Form Wizard for SearchBoxes, DisplayText and RadioButtonGroup controls for any new/existing smart form.
 
Available for the following control types:
- SearchBox
- DisplayText
- RadioControl
 
Pre req's:
Ad hoc lists have been created
 
Test Workflow:
Package: System Test WORKFLOW' 
Workflow: 'AdHocListsInFO' in category 'QA System Test' 
 
Test:
1. In step 3 of Smart Form Wizard for SearchBoxes, DisplayText and RadioButtonGroup controls, the Provider' property lists ad hoc lists that have been created (including ones that you have created in the same step)
2. An ad hoc list can be selected and is saved on the control when the smart form is saved
    2a. DisplayText controls only: Select an item in the DisplayFormat property, this should determine how the data is displayed on the smartform
    2b: RadioButtonGropus only: Set the properties 'Display Member Path' and 'Selected Value Path' : 
                  Valid values for Display Member Path: PrimaryText, SecondaryText, CodeText
                  Valid values for Selected Value Path:  CodeText   
    2c: SearchBoxes only: The 'BindTo' property must be set to 'SelectedItemId'           
3. For each control type, check that where the ad hoc list is used in a smart form, the list is correctly displayed with all its current list items
4. When an item from an ad hoc list is selected in a smart form control, code for the item selected is saved in the context data, and that value is visible in other smart forms/controls that are bound to the same context data item
5. The display of list items will depend on the control:
    5a: DisplayText - will depend on the DisplayFormat selected in step 3 of the wizard
    5b: RadioButtonGroups: depends on the Display Member Path property selected in step 3 of the wizard
    5c: SearchBoxes: List items will have PrimaryText(Code) in the first row, and SecondaryText in the second row, and the selected item, will just display PrimaryText(Code)
6. Where context data is bound to a control with an ad hoc list, and the context data item has a value (either set during the course of the workflow or after being fetched from the database) that exists in the list, the correct item is displayed in the control on the smart form
7. When the data is persisted to the database, the correct value is saved

Title: Phase task data providers
Description: These can be tested from Matter Planning adding resources in the plan tab

Title: Client search with different combination of search criterias
Description:
Quick search and deep search have now been combined.
 
                Quick Search 
                if search string contains only a single word
                                finds Entered search string like HBM_NAME.Name, HBM_NAME.First_Name, HBM_NAME.Last_Name
                                finds Entered search string equals HBM_Client.Client_Code.
                if search string contains more than one word 
                                finds Entered search string like HBM_NAME.Name, HBM_NAME.First_Name, HBM_NAME.Last_Name
 
                Word in Text Search
                Builds Words list from Entered search string.  (takes the Entered search string, strips out non alphanumeric characters, splits out words into Words list. Removes noise words from Words list)
                Uses Words list to find any word in text in HBM_NAME.Name, HBM_NAME.First_Name, HBM_NAME.Middle_Name,  HBM_NAME.Last_Name, HBM_NAME.Name_Sort, HBM_Client.Client_Name,  HBM_Client.Client_Code
                
 
NOTE 1: Inactive clients are not returned
NOTE 2: Alias can be owned by firm or employee. If owned by an employee that is not the logged on user then that alias will not be returned. 
NOTE 3: Security is respected
NOTE 4: There is a sort order ranking on returned items: ?
NOTE 5: A multi word search will not look at client code or matter code
NOTE 6: Max 200 items returned
NOTE 7: The expanded view, and ensure that the data is correct for the client.
NOTE 8: MRU should be enabled and the righ-click menu should have 'Add/remove  to/from recently used' and 'Pin this Item' options
Steps: Step 1: Client search should have consistant behaviour across all apps (EA, Time, MatterPlanning etc.) || Step 2: Using the master database, test with the following criteria. || Step 3: Enter Client code:a) 10901b) BECKTRC) 50CRCLT01 | Expected: Appropriate results returned || Step 4: Enter Client Name: a) Underhill Contructionb) Becky's Bakeryc) Propriétés De Chambre D'Îled) Propriétés De Chambre D'Îlee) Colour Design Inc. *f) SIMP-CORE-NTAX-USD-SICg) Whitesell (TUD) Corp. | Expected: Appropriate results returned || Step 5: Check that in-active clients are not returned, check with clients are inactive by query database:Select * from hbm_client where INACTIVE = 'Y' | Expected: The search should not return any inactive clients || Step 6: Check that clients with very long names (40 characters) can be searched:a. Check in database if you have such clients with long name: Select * from hbm_client order by CLIENT_NAMEb. If you don't, create a client record via CMS or FileOpening workflow | Expected: Clients with longs names should be presented on the UI appropriately

Title: Employee search with different combination of search criterias
Description:
Quick search and deep search have now been combined.
 
                Quick Search 
                if search string contains only a single word
                                finds Entered search string like HBM_NAME.Name, HBM_NAME.First_Name, HBM_NAME.Last_Name, HBA_NAME_ALIAS.Name
                                finds Entered search string equals HBM_PERSNL.Employee_Code, HBM_PERSNL.Login
                if search string contains more than one word 
                                finds Entered word like (this differs from a deep search in that the word order is important e.g. for 'Lawson, Jan' entereing 'Law Jan' will find a match but 'Jan Law' will not) in  HBM_NAME.Name, HBM_NAME.First_Name, HBM_NAME.Last_Name
 
                Word in Text Search
                Builds Words list from Entered search string.  (takes the Entered search string, strips out non alphanumeric characters, splits out words into Words list. Removes noise words from Words list)
                Uses Words list to find any word in text in HBM_NAME.Name, HBM_NAME.First_Name, HBM_NAME.Last_Name, HBA_NAME_ALIAS.Name, HBM_PERSNL.Initials, HBM_NAME.Middle_Name, HBM_NAME.Name_Sort, HBM_ADDRESS.Address1, HBM_ADDRESS.Address2, HBM_ADDRESS.Address3, HBM_ADDRESS.Address4,HBM_ADDRESS.City,HBM_ADDRESS.Override_Name
 
NOTE 1: Inactive employees are not returned
NOTE 2: A name can have multiple aliases and multiple names can have the same alias
NOTE 3: Inactive aliases are not returned
NOTE 4: There is a sort order ranking on returned items: ?
NOTE 5: Max 200 items returned
NOTE 6: The expanded view, and ensure that the data is correct for the employee.
NOTE 7: MRU should be enabled and the righ-click menu should have 'Add/remove  to/from recently used' and 'Pin this Item' options
Steps: Step 1: Employee search should have consistant behaviour across all apps (EA, Time, MatterPlanning etc.) || Step 2: Using the master database, test with the following criteria. || Step 3: Enter Employee code:a) 0060b) 666666c) CCd) RODDYMe) W535f) NZ80 | Expected: Appropriate results returned || Step 4: Enter Employee Name: a) Barrowb) Le Grove Smithc) Chester, Lanet W.d) O'Neal-Trickeye) HEMNATHf) Levèsque, Réne | Expected: Appropriate results returned || Step 5: Check that in-active users are not returned:a. Check in database for inactive users: select * from HBM_PERSNL where INACTIVE = 'Y' | Expected: Inactive users are not return by the employee search || Step 6: Check that users with very long names (40 characters) can be searcheda. Check in database for user names: select * from HBM_PERSNL order by EMPLOYEE_NAMEb. If you do not have a user with long name, create a new user in CMS or EmployeeIntake workflow | Expected: Users with long names should be presented appropriately on the UI

Title: Alias and Inactive
Description:
Quick search and deep search have now been combined.
 
If the Entered search string does NOT contain a single separator character (dot or pipe)
                Quick Search 
                if search string contains only a single word
                                finds Entered search string like MatterAlias, MatterName or ClientName.
                                finds Entered search string equals MatterCode or ClientCode.
                if search string contains more than one word 
                                finds Entered search string like MatterAlias, MatterName or ClientName.
 
                Word in Text Search
                Builds Words list from Entered search string.  (takes the Entered search string, strips out non alphanumeric characters,      splits out words into Words list.  Removes noise words from Words list)
                uses Words list to find any word in text in MatterAlias, MatterName, LongMatterName, MatterCode, ClientName or ClientCode.
                
If the search string does contain a single separator character (colon, dot or pipe)
                If single pipe  or colon separator found, treat dots as text.
                If dot separator is on second character then ignore (i.e. treat entry as initials such as 'H. Robins')
                If multiple dots are found then all dots are treated as text
                Search string is split into Client Search string and Matter Search string
 
                Quick Search 
                if Matter search finds matter search string like MatterAlias, MatterName or equals MatterCode.
                    AND
                if Client search finds Client string like ClientName or equals ClientCode.
 
                Word in Text Search
                Builds Matter Words list from Matter search string
                Builds Client Words list from Client search string
                uses Matter Words list to find any word in text in MatterAlias, MatterName, LongMatterName, MatterCode
                uses Client Words list to find any word in text in ClientName or ClientCode.
 
NOTE 1: Inactive matters are not returned
NOTE 2: Alias can be owned by firm or employee. If owned by an employee that is not the logged on user then that alias will not be returned. The alias should always show in the result lists in red bold italics (regardless if part of the user's MRU list or not). Hover over the alias should display the full client/matter name/descriptions. For multiple aliases the search should search across all alias names but return one matching result using the last created alias name. 
NOTE 3: Security is respected
NOTE 4: There is a sort order ranking on returned items: ?
NOTE 5: A multi word search will not look at client code or matter code
NOTE 6: Max 200 items returned

Title: Create & Query user level Matter alias
Description:
From the Matter Search the user will be able to create an Alias, therefore adding a row to HBA_MATTER_ALIA (as depicted in the wireframes above). Select the right-click menu option 'Create Alias' on the Matter that it is to be created for. The alias created is for that user only.
 
See page 8 of Time Entry Wireframes for wireframes
Steps: Step 1: @Application Matter search can be found in Expert Assistant, Expert Time or Matter Planning || Step 2: In a Matter Search control, search for any Matter (i.e. Central Bank General) and right click on it | Expected: "Create Alias" option is available on the right click menu || Step 3: Select "Create Alias" | Expected: Check that the pop-up window matches with the attached screen || Step 4: Enter analias (i.e. Foo!) then check in SQL:SELECT TOP (1) [Extent1].[Id] AS [Id], [Extent1].[EmployeeId] AS [EmployeeId], [Extent1].[LastModified] AS [LastModified], [Extent1].[MatterId] AS [MatterId], [Extent1].[Name] AS [Name]FROM [ExpertQuery].[MatterAlias] AS [Extent1]WHERE ('Foo!' = [Extent1].[Name])ORDER BY [Extent1].[Id] ASC | Expected: Alias is added to HBA_MATTER_ALIA table in the database and check that EmployeeId matches the current user. || Step 5: As the same user, search for matter using criteria that matches the matter name/code | Expected: Matter is found, displaying:1.Alias name in bold italics in red font2. Followed by the actual client name in black font 3. The matter name is shown below Alias/client name || Step 6: As the same user, search for matter using criteria that matches the matter alias | Expected: Matter is found, displaying:1.Alias name in bold italics in red font2. Followed by the actual client name in black font3. The matter name is shown below Alias/client name || Step 7: As a different user, search for matter using criteria that matches the matter name/code | Expected: Matter is found, actual matter name and code displayed in grid view for search || Step 8: As a different user, search for matter using criteria that matches the matter alias that was created for the first user | Expected: Matter is not found || Step 9: Right click on the Alias and select "Remove Alias" then check in SQL:SELECT TOP (1) [Extent1].[Id] AS [Id], [Extent1].[EmployeeId] AS [EmployeeId], [Extent1].[LastModified] AS [LastModified], [Extent1].[MatterId] AS [MatterId], [Extent1].[Name] AS [Name]FROM [ExpertQuery].[MatterAlias] AS [Extent1]WHERE ('Foo!' = [Extent1].[Name])ORDER BY [Extent1].[Id] ASC | Expected: 1. "Remove Alias" option exists2. The alias entry is removed from database || Step 10: Try to search for the removed alias (Foo!) | Expected: Matter not found || Step 11: Try to search for the matter name/code (Central bank) | Expected: Matter is found and the result no longer shows alias in red italic font.

Title: Create & Query Matter alias in Proxy user mode
Description: When creating, removing and searching for aliases in the matter search in EA under proxy, the functionality should be the same as if the user that is being proxied is actually logged in.
Steps: Step 1: Open Expert Assistant and proxy another user. || Step 2: Search for a matter and then create a new alias | Expected: Alias applies to the user being proxiedSearching for the matter again displays the alias name instead of the client name and code. || Step 3: Return to acting on behalf of yourself and search for the matter that an alias was created for | Expected: The alias is not seen, only the original matter name and description details are displayed.

Title: Matter Search - concatenated search
Description:
Matter Search - Search concatenation of client and matter
In the matter search, it is now possible to search for a matter by entering its client and matter details with a '.' in between.
E.g.
ClientCode.MatterCode
ClientName.MatterName
ClientCode.MatterName
ClientName.MatterCode
 
Notes for concatenation search: 
(a) You can enter partial names/codes. e.g. 109.1 will find Client with code 10901 and matter code 1000
(b) If there are '.'s in Client Names or Matter Names, we basically take the last '.' entered in the search criteria as the separator between the client criteria and matter criteria on the presumption that periods are more common in client names than matter descriptions. 
E.g. K.Mitthal Inc.1000 è client criteria = "K.Mitthal Inc", matter criteria = "1000"
(c) Quick Search - looks for client criteria AND matter criteria 
      Deep Search - looks for client criteria OR matter criteria

Title: Create & Query firm level Matter alias
Description:
The matter search plugin in Expert Assistant should include searching on matter aliases. If an exact match for the alias is entered before exiting the search criteria, the matter should be listed in the search list box.
 
Things to Test:
1. Aliases that belong either to the specific user or that are not user-specific should be found. Aliases set up for other users should not be found.
2. If there is no Alias for the Matter the display will be consistent with the display today (Client and Matter Codes and Descriptions)
Steps: Step 1: Create firm-level matter alias via alias maintenance in Expert classic (CMS.net):Matter Management > Alias Maintenance (do not select an employee when entering data) || Step 2: In Expert Assistant, enter search criteria that matches the matter name/description/code or alias for the matter that was maintained in the previous step. | Expected: Matter is found, displaying:1.Alias name in bold italics in red font2. Followed by the actual client name in black font3. The matter name is shown below Alias/client name || Step 3: Log into Expert Assistant as another user and enter search criteria that matches the matter name/description/code or alias for the matter that was maintained in the previous step. | Expected: Matter is found, displaying:1.Alias name in bold italics in red font2. Followed by the actual client name in black font3. The matter name is shown below Alias/client name || Step 4: Try to remove the alias | Expected: Users should not be able to remove firm level alias
