Description:
Objective:  
 
One particular client (Skaddens) only have initials and last name in the HBM_PERSNL.EMPLOYEE_NAME field, but the full name details are stored in HBM_NAME.NAME, HBM_NAME.FIRSTNAME, HBM_NAME.LASTNAME etc; so when they use our employee search, the search results are not very meaningful since our data providers display the name from HBM_PERSNL.EMPLOYEE_NAME. 
 
This behaviour represents how the tables are designed, so as a gesture to Skaddens, a new property 'IncludeNameFromNameTable' was added to the employee data provider, that is FALSE by default. This is not surfaced in the SmartForm Wizard etc, but may be consumed if required by folllowing one of the two methods below.
 
TWO ALTERNATE METHODS TO USE NEW PROPERTY:
 
1.      ADD CONFIG VALUE, can select in SF Wizard without further changes required
 
<DataProvider DisplayName="Employee display HBM_NAME" Description="Default data provider for retrieving and displaying Employees" Type="Aderant.Query.DataProviders.EmployeeModel.EmployeeDataProvider, Aderant.Query, Version=1.8.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=41b332442f1101cc">
  <Template><aderant_employee_dpr:EmployeeDataProvider 
        IsMruEnabled="True"  
        IncludeNameFromNameTable="True" >
     </aderant_employee_dpr:EmployeeDataProvider> 
</Template>
  <Column property="Id" title="Id" propertyType="Id" isVisible="false" />
</DataProvider>
 
2.      Use existing registered Employee data provider, add OnLoaded script for smartform in SF Wizard
self.DataProviders.Employee312.IncludeNameFromNameTable = True
 
Note: This is only for the search results. The name displayed in the control after selection from the results will as held in HBM_PERSNL
 
 
Pre-requisites / Data Setup: 
FilterDPs.zip 
DPFilters.zip

Title: Display name from HBM_NAME instead of HBM_PERSNL
Description:
Objective:  
 
One particular client (Skaddens) only have initials and last name in the HBM_PERSNL.EMPLOYEE_NAME field, but the full name details are stored in HBM_NAME.NAME, HBM_NAME.FIRSTNAME, HBM_NAME.LASTNAME etc; so when they use our employee search, the search results are not very meaningful since our data providers display the name from HBM_PERSNL.EMPLOYEE_NAME. 
 
This behaviour represents how the tables are designed, so as a gesture to Skaddens, a new property 'IncludeNameFromNameTable' was added to the employee data provider, that is FALSE by default. This is not surfaced in the SmartForm Wizard etc, but may be consumed if required by folllowing one of the two methods below.
 
TWO ALTERNATE METHODS TO USE NEW PROPERTY:
 
1.      ADD CONFIG VALUE, can select in SF Wizard without further changes required
 
<DataProvider DisplayName="Employee display HBM_NAME" Description="Default data provider for retrieving and displaying Employees" Type="Aderant.Query.DataProviders.EmployeeModel.EmployeeDataProvider, Aderant.Query, Version=1.8.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=41b332442f1101cc">
  <Template><aderant_employee_dpr:EmployeeDataProvider 
        IsMruEnabled="True"  
        IncludeNameFromNameTable="True" >
     </aderant_employee_dpr:EmployeeDataProvider> 
</Template>
  <Column property="Id" title="Id" propertyType="Id" isVisible="false" />
</DataProvider>
 
2.      Use existing registered Employee data provider, add OnLoaded script for smartform in SF Wizard
self.DataProviders.Employee312.IncludeNameFromNameTable = True
 
Note: This is only for the search results. The name displayed in the control after selection from the results will as held in HBM_PERSNL
 
 
Pre-requisites / Data Setup: 
FilterDPs.zip 
DPFilters.zip

Title: Filter employee search results by type
Description:
Objective:  
 
A new filter has been introduced to allow employee to be filtered by personel type. This tests that the smart form filters on a value of BL but that the applications where filtering is not applied will still return other employees.
 
Pre-requisites / Data Setup: 
FilterDPs.zip 
DPFilters.zip

Title: Type code is avail as employee search filter
Description:
Objective:  
 
A new filter has been introduced to allow employee to be filtered by personel type. This tests that the employee personel type is available to be selected as a filter in the smart form wizard.

Title: Browse All
Description:
Where deep Search is NOT available, the behaviour is as follows
 
·      Browse All is ALWAYS available
·       Initial search returns limit of 100 results, but clicking on 'Browse All' displays FULL list of results (without any difference in search performed) . So for most filter-type data providers that have less than 100 potential restults, the result set will be exactly the same as befpre the Browse All was pressed
- Note that filter-type data providers do NOT required any serach criteria to be entered before results are made available
 
NOTE: Currently, only the Client, Matter, and Employee data providers have a "Deep Search" capability. All other data providers will display Browse All, all of the time
 
 
Example:
SIC in File Opening Client Marketing SF has an available list where the total list of potential results is 1,231. Initial search (without any criteria entered) returns 100 results, Browse All should return 1,231 results.

Title: Help - AppShell
AppShell window size and position on launch
Description:
There should be no UI or layout issues when the AppShell is viewed in different window sizes
 
Screen resolution greater than 1024 x 768 
- Open first time
- Close window maximised and re-open
- Close window at non-full size and re-open
- Open after maximised on 1024 x 768
- Open after not full-size on 1024 x 768
 
Screen resolution is 1024 x 768 
- Open first time
- Close window maximised and re-open
- Close window at non-full size and re-open
- Open after maximised on smaller resolution
- Open after not full-size on smaller resolution
- Open after maximised on larger resolution
- Open after not full-size on larger resolution

Title: Copy to Clipboard
Description: The Copy button may be enabled in the AppShell ribbon. If you click on this link, the contents of the error (also seen when you click on More Information), should be copied to the local clipboard. Test that you can then paste it into other applications e.g. Email, Notepad, Word etc.

Title: OK button
Description: Clicking the OK button should close the exception window and the application that raised it.

Title: Proxy bar
Description: Consumers of the AppShell can elect to display (or not display) the proxy bar. This allows users to act on behalf of other users while using that application. During this time, the security of the user being proxied is applied.

Title: Change decorator color for required fields in smartform apps and tasks
Description:
We have the ability to override the required filed decorator colour by setting a configuration value in CM. This is a global change and effects all products and workflows.
To make this change we need to create the following entry (it does not exist by default) "Technical.Presentation.Windows.RequiredDecoratorColor" and set it to a valid XAML colour value. If no entry is found then the color will be set to ORANGE by default.
We have a list of hard coded colors such as Green, Blue, Red etc.
We also allow hex values such as #FFF8AB69 (Green)
 
Requirements
IMPORTANT: Close all running instances of EA and other product apps before each step !!
The changes we make will not take into effect until we start a new instances of the apps.
Also have a FO workflow with intake task (1st task) ready in EA task inbox.
 
To Test:
1. Add "Technical.Presentation.Windows.RequiredDecoratorColor" in Configuration Manager and give it a value of "Red" and leave it as a type of text, then save.
        open EA and Rates app.
        in EA, open the intake task and check that the required fields are highlighed as Red
        in Rates, click on New -> Timekeeper Rate on the ribbon and check that the required fields are highlight is Red
        close EA and Rates
 
2. Go back to CM and change the value to "#FFF8AB69" (This is the hex value for color green)
        open EA and Rates app.
        in EA, open the intake task and check that the required fields are highlighed as Green
        in Rates, click on New -> Timekeeper Rate on the ribbon and check that the required fields are highlight as Green
        close EA and Rates
 
2. Go back to CM and Delete the configure value we added
        open EA and Rates app.
        in EA, open the intake task and check that the required fields are highlighed as Orange (default color)
        in Rates, click on New -> Timekeeper Rate on the ribbon and check that the required fields are highlight as Orange (default color)
Steps:
Step 1: Add "Technical.Presentation.Windows.RequiredDecoratorColor" in Configuration Manager and give it a value of "Red" and leave it as a type of text, then save. After that open EA and Rates app.
**REMEMBER to close EA and Rates after each step** | Expected: i) in EA, open the intake task and check that the required fields are highlighed as RED
ii) in Rates, click on New -> Timekeeper Rate on the ribbon and check that the required fields are highlight as RED || Step 2: Change the configure value to GREEN (Hex)Go back to CM and change the value to "#FFF8AB69" (This is the hex value for color green) then open EA and Rates app. (Bug 83873: SP2, this step fails but there will be no fix as this is as designed for now) | Expected: i) in EA, open the intake task and check that the required fields are highlighed as GREEN
ii) in Rates, click on New -> Timekeeper Rate on the ribbon and check that the required fields are highlight as GREEN || Step 3: Delete the entry and restore to default
Go back to CM and Delete the configure value we added then open EA and Rates app. | Expected: i) in EA, open the intake task and check that the required fields are highlighed as Orange (default color)
ii) in Rates, click on New -> Timekeeper Rate on the ribbon and check that the required fields are highlight as Orange (default color)

Title: Decision DIalog - Allows keyboard navigation
Description: The decision dialog should allow keyboard navigation to select options once it is open.

Title: Dialogs and Windows - Standard UI
Description: There are standarad expectations for dialogs and windows used in Expert applications. This test guides you through verifying these expectations in different situations.
Steps: Step 1: For any dialog or window, consider the following generic features. This is a guideline only, some properties may or may not be applicable in a given instances. | Expected: Check that the following work as expected: - Minimise window - Maximise window - Close window ('X), from FIle Menu, from Orb (should get prompted to save changes if data has changed) - Save - Save and Close - OK/Canel buttons - Does window resize if required? If so, is it tidy - Hover hints OK - Move window - SHort -cut keys (e.g. Ctrl-S to save, Ctrl-C to copy, Ctrl-X to cut, Ctrl-V to paste etc, ENTER key, ESC key, Home, End) || Step 2: Check the window in different screen resolutions | Expected: Window layout OK Functions still behave in the same way || Step 3: Check window in the following client workstation configurations:XP, Office 2003 (SP2 Onwards - No longer support Office 2003)XP, Office 2007VIsta ( SP2 Onwards - No longer support/test Vista)Windows 7, Office 2010 | Expected: UI renders without any issues, and consistently across different OS

Title: View and hide Help Links
Description:
Users have an optional setting in the Help menu to hide or display Help Links (that have been individually configured for each control), on their tasks . This setting should be retained for that user (even after closing and reopening Expert Assistant), until they choose to change it.
 
Test:
1. is an option in the task-level Help menu 
2. Setting this option to ON, results in the display of Help Links when hovering over controls for which they have been set up
3. Setting this option to OFF, results in Help Links being hidden when hovering over controls for which they have been set up
4. The setting (On or Off) is retained for that user when the task is closed and re-opened
5. The setting (On or Off) is retained for that user when Expert Assistant is closed and re-opened

Title: View and hide tooltips
Description:
Users have an optional setting in the Help menu to hide or display ToolTips (that have been individually configured for each control), on their tasks . This setting should be retained for that user (even after closing and reopening Expert Assistant), until they choose to change it.
 
Test:
1. 'ToolTips' is an option in the task-level Help menu 
2. Setting this option to ON, results in the display of ToolTips when hovering over controls for which they have been set up
3. Setting this option to OFF, results in ToolTips being hidden when hovering over controls for which they have been set up
4. The setting (On or Off) is retained when the task is closed and re-opened
5. The setting (On or Off) is retained when Expert Assistant is closed and re-opened

Title: "Find and Replace" behaviour & user experience
Description:
Find - words "beginning with" search criteria
 
Is it always enabled? 
Or is it optional/configurable?
Or is it only enabled if SpellCheck is? 
Should it be optional in the SF Wizard?
 
To activate:
1. Right-click on Advanced Text Box and select 'Find'
2. Find pop up opens
 
Find (Find tab):
1. Enter search criteria and press the Find Next button
2. The first word that begins with the criteria entered is highlighted in purple
    (a) Can change word found directly in the UI where it was found
    (b) Can press Find Next button - see next step
3. Pressing the Find Next button again should highlight the next match it finds by iterating through all of the Advanced Text Box controls in order on that screen
4. When the bottom of the screen is reached, a dialog will appear that says 'No more matches'. Start at beginning again?
    (a) If no is pressed, dialog closes, and current word is left highlighted
    (b) If yes is pressed, dialog closes and search returns to find firsts matching word at beginning of screen
5. Closing the Find dialog at any time will remove any highlighting (Close button or 'x')
 
Find and Replace (Replace tab):
1. Enter search criteria in the Find What box and press the Find Next button
2. The first word that begins with the criteria entered is highlighted in purple
3. Enter text in the Replace With box 
    (a) Press the Replace button --> The text of the highlighted word is replaced and the find jumps to the next match
    (b) Press Find Next button --> The find jumps to the next match and highlights it
3. Pressing the Find Next button again will highlight the next match it finds by iterating through all of the Advanced Text Box controls in order on that screen
    (a) Press the Replace button --> The text of the highlighted word is replaced and the find jumps to the next match
    (b) Press Find Next button --> The find jumps to the next match and highlights it
4. When the bottom of the screen is reached, a dialog will appear that says 'No more matches'. Start at beginning again?
    (a) If no is pressed, dialog closes, and current word is left highlighted
    (b) If yes is pressed, dialog closes and search returns to find firsts matching word at beginning of screen
5. Closing the Find dialog at any time will remove any highlighting (Close button or 'x')

Title: Perform Spell Check on Entire Form
Description:
SpellCheck can now be performed on an entire task rather than just an individual control at a time. This occurs if SpellCheck is invoked using F7 or the Spelling option in the right-click menu and applies only to Advanced Text Boxes that have Spell Check enabled.
 
Test:
1. Pressing F7 or selecting 'Spelling' from the right-click menu on an Advanced TextBox control that has SpellCheckEnabled invokes the SpellCheck feature
2. When the user has either corrected or ignored all of the misspellings in the control that the Spell Check commenced, the SpellCheck moves on to the next Advanced Text Box control that has SpellCheck enabled. 
3. Check that the sequence is logical, e.g. move downwards from the first control, and when it gets to the bottom of the task, move to the top of the task. Where there is more than one column, it should complete one column before starting the next column.Note that AdvancedTextBox controls that have SpellCheck enabled, but no misspelings etc are skipped.
4. The control that Spell Check is currently being performed on has a yellow outline.
5. Continuing from step 2, the Spell Check should work its way through all the Advanced Text Box controls that have SpellCheck enabled until it reaches the control that it started with. When it has completed all this, the SpellCheck will close.

Title: Spell Checker behaviour & user experience
Description:
1. Find misspelled word - highlighted in yellow, right-click has SpellCHeck menu including suggestions, can launch SpellCHeck....
2. Replace with suggestion in right-click menu
3. Add new word e.g. a person's name to the dictionary
Steps: Step 1: Press F7 on an Advanced TextBox control that has SpellCheckEnabled | Expected: Spell Check is invoked The control that Spell Check is currently being performed on has a yellow outline. || Step 2: Select 'Spelling' from the right-click menu on an Advanced TextBox control that has SpellCheckEnabled | Expected: Spell Check is invoked The control that Spell Check is currently being performed on has a yellow outline. || Step 3: Add new word e.g. a person's name to the dictionary | Expected: If you enter that new word/name in any control with Spell Check enabled, this is not identified as a spelling error || Step 4: Correct/ignore all misspellings in the control that Spell Check commenced | Expected: The SpellCheck moves on to the next Advanced Text Box control that has SpellCheck enabled. || Step 5: Check that the sequence is logical | Expected: e.g. move downwards from the first control, and when it gets to the bottom of the task, move to the top of the task. Where there is more than one column, it should complete one column before starting the next column. Note that AdvancedTextBox controls that have SpellCheck enabled, but no misspelings etc are skipped. || Step 6: Check control that Spell Check is currently being performed | Expected: The control that Spell Check is currently being performed on has a yellow outline. || Step 7: Continue spell check on various controls in the same form | Expected: The Spell Check should work its way through all the Advanced Text Box controls that have SpellCheck enabled until it reaches the control that it started with. When it has completed all this, the SpellCheck will close.

Title: Expansion Codes
Description:
Expansion codes are a legacy feature that allow commonly used blocks of text to be entered into narratives etc without having to type the entire text each time. Intead, a code is assigned to the block of text and in Expert GG, this can be used to quickly add the block of text to an advanced text box (where expansion codes have been enabled).
 
Note:
Expansion codes can exist for all users (firm-level), or be employee-specific. In the Expert GG applications, only employee-specific expansion codes can be added/maintained, although both types can be consumed. Firrm-level expansion codes must be maintained in Expert Classic under: Hub Setup > Firm Setup > Expansion Code Maintenance

Title: QBE - Ctrl+Delete
Description:
Short-cut key description:
<Ctrl> + <Delete> combination key is used to delete all items including operators in the current searchBox/DatePicker.
 
Ensure that:
1. By using this short-cut, all items within the current field are deleted.
2. Both left and right ctrl works.

Title: QBE -Add an item
Description:
Things to test:
1. Add an item by clicking on a blank spot
2. Add an item by clicking on the downArrow/calendar/magnify button

Title: QBE -Change an item
Description:
Things to test:
1. Test that items in the controls can be changed by clicking on a item once to select it, then click it again to bring out the dropdown menu to select another item.  (Alternitively, double click on an item would also select & bring out the dropdown menu)
2. Test that after selecting an item, type in search criteria would show correct results and selecting the result items would replace the old item.

Title: QBE -Delete and Backspace
Description:
Short-cut key description:
<Delete> or <Back Space> key is used to delete the currently selected item. 
If there are no items selected, this would move the input focus to the previous item.
 
Ensure that after pressing delete/backspace:
1. The currently focus item is deleted.
2. The previous item in the field is selected if there weren't any input focus, and press delete/bs again will delete that item.

Title: QBE -Down Arrow Key
Description:
Short-cut key description:
<Down Arrow> is used to show dropdown menu appropriate for the item at the input cursor position. 
(eg. SearchBox or DatePicker)
This can be used for adding a new item or editing an existing item.
 
Ensure that when pressing the <Down Arrow>:
1. Change selected item - a dropdown menu should appear below the currently selected item. (Aligned to the first letter)
2. Add an item - If the input cursor is at the end of all items, the dropdown menu should appear below and aligned to the current input cursor position.

Title: QBE -Insert Key
Description:
Short-cut key description:
<Insert> key creates a new item at the end and moves the input cursor to that location.

Title: QBE -Left and Right Arrow Key
Description:
Short-cut key description:
<Left Arrow> <Right Arrow> keys are used to move input focus. This is similar to Tab key, however the input focus only moves between items within the current field.
 
Ensure that when pressing left/right keys:
1. Only moves with the current field (up to first/last item)
2. Only moves between existing items
3. Can change/delete the current focus item using double mouse click or down arrow key.

Title: QBE -Right click menu
Description:
1. Right click menu
When right clicking on a control, ensure that the following options are available and functional:
Add - Insert
Remove - Delete
Clear All - Ctrl + Del
 
2. Dropdown menu Item right click menu
When right clicking on an item in a dropdown menu, ensure the following options are available and functional:
Select this item
Add/Remove from MRU
Pin this item
Create Alias(Only for Matter Search)

Title: QBE -Tab Key - Not editing
Description:
Short-cut key description:
<Tab> will always try to resolve the current input or selection via dropdown menu and if it's the last item in the list, moves the input focus and places it ready to create a new item. 
 
Ensure that:
1. In the dropdown menu, select an item and press <Tab> would select and resolve that item then create a new item and move the input cursor to that location.
 
2. In search box, type in a search criteria and press tab. This will have 2 outcomes:
    a. If the criteria has an exact match in DB, the matched item will be resolved:
        Type in timekeeper searchbox for 851 then press tab, this will return Egger, Ron
 
    b. If there are no match in DB for the search criteria, the input would still be resolved but will be highlighted in red, informing user that the input is invalid.
Steps:
Step 1: In the dropdown menu, select an item and press "Tab" | Expected: This would select and resolve that item then create a new item and move the input cursor to that location. || Step 2: In search box, type in a search criteria and press tab. This will have 2 outcomes. | Expected: a. If the criteria has an exact match in DB, the matched item will be resolved:
(Type in timekeeper searchbox for 851 then press tab, this will return Egger, Ron)
b. If there are no match in DB for the search criteria, the input would still be resolved but will be highlighted in red, informing user that the input is invalid.

Title: QBE -Tab Key - while editing
Description:
Short-cut key description:
<Tab> or <Shift + Tab> key moves the input focus item to the left or right. Unlike Left/Right Arrow keys, <Tab> will move out of the control or to the next/previous control when you get to the first or last item. 
 
Ensure that:
1. <Tab> behaves the same as Right arrow key and <shift + tab> behaves the same as Left arrow key with a control.
2. Input focus will move out or to the next avaliable or to the previous control after it reaches to the last/first item.
3. Can change/delete the current focus item using double mouse click or down arrow key.

Title: Automatic search vs forced search using ENTER key
Description:
The ENTER key may be pressed to initiate the search immediately rather than have to wait for the set delay between characters. Otherwise a search will only be automatically executed following a set delay after entering search criteria.
 
 
(a) If delay not complete, pressing the ENTER key will kick off the search immediately
(b) Guide for set delay (if ENTER has not been pressed):
- After first search character is entered, search automatically commences after 3 seconds
- After second search character is entered, search automatically commences after 3 seconds
- After third search character is entered, search automatically commences after 1 second
(b) If search has already commenced, pressing the ENTER key will select any item that is currently highlighted. E.g.
     (i) If there is only one matching MRU item, that item is selected
     (ii) If there is more than one matching MRU item, no item is selected
     (ii) If there is only one matching item (and it is not in the MRU), that item is selected

Title: Browse All and Deep Search
Description:
There is a new ability for data providers to have a "deep search" that is more detailed than the regular search. This is currently only enabled for Client/Matter/Employee data providers. You are no longer required to select Deep Search in order to initiate it. The default behaviour is to do a deep search but this is executed immediately after the non-deep search (without user intervention). Only the first 100 results are returned, however if you press Browse All, the remaining results are also displayed. 
 
·       New search feature "Deep Search" allows searches to distinguish between a quick search and one that is more detailed. Data providers and stored procedures must be updated to add this capability. For now, only the Client, Matter, and Employee searches will have this capability. Where "Deep Search" is available, it will replace the "Browse All" link that is displayed in the search .
·       "Browse All" (or "Deep Search"  if the data provider caters for this) is ALWAYS available 
·       "Browse All" and "Deep Search" ALWAYS clears cache
·       "Browse All" or "Deep Search" may be pressed before the delay is complete (i.e. before auto-search commences)
·       If "Deep Search" is not enabled and "Browse All" is clicked, the search is no different from the initial search except that it returns the full list of results if there is more than 100
·       If "Deep Search" is enabled and it is clicked, a more detailed search (according to stored proc) is performed. The result set is limited to the maximum set by the stored procedure
- A few key differences between non-deep search, and deep search:
         (a) Non-deep does a "starts with" search on the beginning of the string/field it is searching (not the beginning of each word in that string
               Deep search does a "contain" search on EACH word in the string
         (b) FTI
               Non-deep search does NOT do an FTI search 
               Deep search DOES do an FTI search
         (c)  Noise words:
               Non-deep search does NOT ignore noise words
               Non-deep search DOES ignore noise words
 
NOTE:
The Matter search used in Timer Gadget and the TimeCard uses a custom control, and although it has been modified to have the same capability, it may not be completely in sync with the UX toolkit SearchBox
Expert Assistant: Does not use the same Client/Matter/Employee data provider as the products e.g. File Opening, Matter Planning. However, the EA plugins should essentially behave the same as the "Deep Search" version of those data providers used by the products.

Title: Exact match on code - search not commenced
Description: If the user enters search criteria that exactly matches a CODE for a search result, and then presses either the TAB or ENTER key before the search has commecnted, that item will be selected, and focus will move to the next control.

Title: Search control behaviour & user experience
Description:
Generic behaviour around search box  
 
·       Drop down now opens as soon as user starts typing criteria, and drop down says 'Press ENTER key to start searching'
·       Delay after typing first character before searching: 3 seconds
·       Delay after typing second character before searching: 3 seconds
·       Delay after typing third character before searching: 1 second
·       Pressing ENTER key after entering criteria, and before delay is complete, executes search immediately. First 100 returned first.
·       When search commences (either due to pressing the ENTER key or the appropriate delay), the text in the drop down changes from 'Press ENTER key to start searching' to 'Getting Data...', and the busy indicator is displayed in the bottom left hand corner of the drop down (rotating circle)
·       Once the search commences, any MRU items are filtered and displayed first, followed by any non-MRU items that are found as search results
·       Changing search criteria (e.g. adding/removing a character) refreshes control to remove previous search results and change the text in the drop down to 'Press ENTER key to start searching' then as above, when the search actually commences
Steps: Step 1: Client/Matter search should be consistent across all products || Step 2: Temporary names (In ExpertTime, client/matter/phasetask) is now an option in the dropdown (80SP2) | Expected: On selection, pops up a confirmation of what you entered before saving. || Step 3: Temporary names and MRU (Most recent used) items are available for proxy users:1. As youself, create a temp name for a matter.2. Add different type of matters to MRU (Temp name, Alias and standard matters) 3. Launch app (i.e. Time, EA) as TTQA1 then proxy yourself | Expected: In the matter search data provider, you should be able to see your proxy user's MRU list items and you should be able to search for the temp names your proxy user created. || Step 4: Add more matters of different type (>10) to MRU | Expected: MRU only show top 10 hits. || Step 5: Search for any Matter and then create an Alias for that matter | Expected: 1. Alias now shows client name/code and matter name/code (80SP2)2. Matter Alias should NOT be available for proxy users, i.e. if someone proxying you, they should NOT see your matter alias (Unless the Alias was in MRU) || Step 6: Search with Client.Matter criteria (clientcode.mattercode, clientcode.mattername, clientname.matterncode, clientname.mattername)Search with Client name Matter name i.e. Arden GeneralSearch for Sub-Matters | Expected: The search will treat everything before dot as client criterion and everything after as matter criterion.Wildcard searchs like (ard.ge, 10901.1, 10901.gen, ard.1) should bring back Arden Industries - General matter || Step 7: Search criteria restrictions and filtering:1. Search with a criteria thats less than 4 characters, i.e. SCE2. Search with 4 characters then enter more criteria to filter down the list i.e. SCEN -> SCENARIO -> SCENARIO 7 | Expected: 1. If search criteria is less than 4 characters, the search will only be performed against matters, SCE should not bring back any result, SCEN should bring back matters from client Scenario 12.Filtering only happens when the initial search is more than 3 characters. Filtering does NOT make additional query calls. || Step 8: Search results are sorted alphabetically by default | Expected: Other sorting options, depending on the data provider: Client, ClientCode, Matter, MatterCode, Employee Name, Employee Code || Step 9: Search results and Browse-all option (Hotkey: CTRL + Enter) | Expected: By default, searches only return up to 100 results. Searching with browse all option return up to 1000 results. || Step 10: Expand search is now a pop-up screen for advance searching (80SP2, Hotkey: CTRL + Space) | Expected: This new popup will allow better sorting, filtering, etc. This same popup will be inline inside Expert Assistant as it is at the moment. (you can get to popup with CTRL-Space) (as an aside this change will provide a slight improvement on memory and speed for the apps that have a lot of lookups/searches) || Step 11: Home, End, PageUp and PageDown keys should now navigate you through the results list (80SP2) | Expected: 1. Home brings you to the top of the list2. End brings you to the bottom of the list3. PageUp/Down, scrolls through the list. || Step 12: Parent matter name and code is shown in business card hover and expanded search grid || Step 13: Using Client search box in Matter Planning as example. || Step 14: Start typing client names | Expected: 1. Drop down opens as soon as user start typing criteria. 2. Drop down says 'Press ENTER key to start searching' || Step 15: Check delays after typing in criteria | Expected: 1. Delay after typing first character before searching: 3 seconds 2. Delay after typing second character before searching: 3 seconds 3. Delay after typing third character before searching: 1 second || Step 16: Before delay is complete, press ENTER key after entering criteria | Expected: 1. Executes search immediately. First 100 results are returned. 2. When search commences, the text in the drop down changes to 'Getting Data...', and the busy indicator is displayed in the bottom left hand corner of the drop down (rotating circle) 3. Once the search commences, any MRU items are filtered and displayed first, followed by any non-MRU items that are found as search results || Step 17: Change search criteria (e.g. adding/removing a character) | Expected: Refreshes control to remove previous search results.

Title: Search - searches multiple criterion
Description:
When conducting a search, the criteria entered may be applied to more than one criterion. For example, the client search checks both name AND address details.
 
Expected Result:
Each criteria entered will be used to perform a search on BOTH Name AND Address details
 
Things to test:
Search using complete and partial names/addresses
Check that results returned:
(a) match the criteria entered  (see Note below)
(b) display the correct attributes (HBM_NAME.NAME_UNO, HBM_NAME.NAME, HBM_ADDRESS.CITY)
 
Note: 
The following Expert tables/attributes are searched for the name:
HBM_NAME:                     FIRST_NAME, MIDDLE_NAME, LAST_NAME, NAME, NAME_SORT
HBM_NAME_PEOPLE:      TITLE, SALUTATION
HBM_NAME_ALIAS:         NAME
HBM_CLIENT:                    CLIENT_NAME
HBM_ADDRESS:               OVERRIDE_NAME
 
The following Expert tables/attributes are searched for the address:
HBM_ADDRESS:               ADDRESS1, ADDRESS2, ADDRESS3, ADDRESS4, CITY

Title: Selecting items - Search mode search
Description:
Search results may be selected by a number of means. Assuming the search has commenced, 
 
If there is 
(a) only ONE matching MRU item, that item is selected, or
(b) only ONE matching item (and it is not in the MRU),
 
pressing the TAB or ENTER key will select the item that is currently highlighted.

Title: Decimal symbol derived from regional settings
Description: In the numeric control, the user is able to enter the decimal symbol that is specified in the environment's regional settings (regardless of where it is placed in the value). They will not be able to enter OTHER symbols that may be used for decimals if it is not defined in their regional settings.

Title: Digit grouping formatting from regional settings
Description:
The formatting for digit grouping in the numeric control will come from regional settings. The 
 
Control Panel > Region and Language > Formats Tab (Additional Settings button) > Customize Format > Numbers TAB  (Windows 7)
 
* Digit grouping symbol
* Digit grouping

Title: Generic control properties
Description:
Test that the following generic control properties:
 
* Prompt
* HelpLinkId
* IsRequired
* IsEnabled
* IsReadOnly

Title: Negative symbol and format from regional settings
Description:
In the numeric control, the negative symbol and format that is used is specified in the environment's regional settings (regardless of where it is placed in the value). They will not be able to enter OTHER symbols that may be used for decimals if it is not defined in their regional settings.
 
Control Panel > Region and Language > Formats Tab (Additional Settings button) > Customize Format > Numbers TAB  (Windows 7)

Title: Paste data into control
Description:
Users can paste data into the numeric control, however, if pasting the data will result in an invalid value (e.g. exceeds minimum/maximum constraints as set on control or data type), has more decimal places than are allowed, os has disallowed characters (e.g. alpha characters), the data will not be pasted.
 
Things to Test:
* Entire value in focus (e.g. Tab into field or click in control to left of value), paste will result in valid value --> paste allowed
* Entire value in focus (e.g. Tab into field or click in control to left of value), paste will result in INVALID value --> paste NOT allowed
* Part of value in focus (e.g. highlight some but not all characters using mouse or arrow keys), paste will result in valid value --> paste allowed
* Part of value in focus (e.g. highlight some but not all characters using mouse or arrow keys),paste will result in INVALID value --> paste NOT allowed
* Cursor between characters in value (e.g. click into field and position cursor using arrows or mouse), paste will result in valid value --> paste allowed
* Cursor between characters in value (e.g. click into field and position cursor using arrows or mouse), paste will result in INVALID value --> paste NOT allowed

Title: Restricted characters allowed
Description:
Only the following characters can be typed/pasted into the numeric control:
 
(a) Any number
 
As defined in the client environment's regional settings:
Control Panel > Region and Language > Formats tab - Additional Settings > Numbers tab
(b) Decimal separator
(c) Thousand separator (also referred to as Digit Grouping Symbol)
(d) Negative sign symbol

Title: Set maximum value
Description:
The numeric control can be configured so that you can set a maximum value that is valid. This does not constrain what can be entered in the control, but if the value exceeds the maximum value when the control loses focus, 
(a) the control is highlighted with a red outline, 
(b) the validation icon is displayed to the right of the text box
(c) hovering over the validation icon displays the message:
'Validation Error! 
The entry must be less than or equal to xxx'
 
Things to Test:
For the following types of maximum values,
(a) Positive maximum value
(b) 0
(c) No value or NULL
(d) Negative minimum value
 
test entering these value into the control
Type in number lower than maximum value but higher than the minimum value that is set - no errors
Type in number higher than maximum value but less than ultimate maximum value (79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335) - validation error
Type in number higher than maximum value, also higher than maximum ultimate value (79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335) - prevented from entering
Paste in number lower than maximum value but higher than the minimum value that is set - no errors
Paste in number higher than maximum value but less than ultimate maximum value (79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335) - validation error
Paste in number higher than maximum value, also higher than maximum ultimate value (79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335) - prevented from entering

Title: Set minimum value
Description:
The numeric control can be configured so that you can set a minimum value that is valid. This does not constrain what can be entered in the control, but if the value exceeds the minimum value when the control loses focus, 
(a) the control is highlighted with a red outline, 
(b) the validation icon is displayed to the right of the text box
(c) hovering over the validation icon displays the message:
'Validation Error! 
The entry must be less than or equal to xxx'
 
Things to Test:
For the following types of minimum values,
(a) Positive minimum value
(b) 0
(c) No value or NULL
(d) Negative minimum value
 
test entering these value into the control
Type in number higher than minimum value but lower than the maximum value that is set - no errors
Type in number lower than minimum value but less than ultimate minimum value (-79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335) - validation error
Type in number lower than minimum  value, also lower than ultimate minimum value (-79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335) - prevented from entering
Paste in number higher than minimum value but lower than the maximum value that is set - no errors
Paste in number lower than minimum value but less than ultimate minimum value (-79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335) - validation error
Paste in number lower than minimum  value, also lower than ultimate minimum value (-79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335) - prevented from pasting

Title: Set number of decimal places
Description:
The number of decimal places can be set to validate the data that is entered. How the control behaves against this setting will however depend on the data type
 
E.g.
Decimal: 
Decimal - EDIT
Most often the number of decimal places in the control will be the same as the number in the data...
User enters more digits after the decimal symbol than the control has been set up to allow --> Entry of value is not prevented, however a validation error appears
User enters less digits after the decimal symbol than the control has been set up to allow --> When the user exits the field, the value is padded out with '0's so that the numer of digits after the decimal places is the same as the number allowed
When focus is set in a numeric control that has a value with deimcal places, the control only displays the characters that were entered by the user, not any padding that was displayed when the control was not in focus
 
Decimal - FETCH INTO EDITABLE
Most often the number of decimal places in the control will be the same as the number in the data, but if different......
--> Leave this behaviour as it is, and wait to see if we get any feedback
 
Decimal - FETCH INTO READ-ONLY
Makes sense to round the data if the number of decimal places on the control is less than the number of decimal places on the data
 
Decimal - SAVE
Data saved as displayed in control, any trailling zeros will be truncated when saved.
 
Integer:
Regardless of the number of decimal places are allowed, and the number that is entered, the data is always rounded to the nearest whole number. However if a number of decimal places has been set on the control, padding of '0's are displayed in the control to represent this.

Title: Ultimate maximum and minimum values
Description:
The maximum value that this control will allow is constrained by the data type. If the maximum value for the data type is exceeded, the control will appear as invalid (red oultline) and display a validation error that comes from the data binding.
 
Decimal: the maximum value is 79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335.
Int16: the maximum value is 32,767
Int32: the maximum value is 2,147,483,647
Int64: the maximum value is 9,223,372,036,854,775,807

Title: Decimal mode - enforce time increments rounding
Description:
The data item that the duration picker is bound to may require support for time increments. If this is the case, values entered may be rounded according to the type set for time increments.
For example, if looking at the duration for a time entry, if the time increments for that time entry is Tenths and you enter 2.27, this will be rounded to the nearest 10th, resulting in 2.30 (2 hours, 18 minutes).

Title: Decimal mode - Enter value in different formats
Description:
The duration picker supports selection of values in a number of different formats. In addition, the control can be configured to specifically display in decimal mode.
 
Notes:
- Can support entry in decimal AND HH:MM mode
- The duration picker supports negative numbers (from scenario 55401)
- Time Entries are limited to 24hours maximum whereas summary levels can be very large, (e.g. 6000hours+) therefore a duration control needs to handle this menually entering lnumbers larger than 24 hours. The duration 'picker' does not need to be used (i.e. make the user type the value). (from scenario 55401)
 
Examples:
Duration entry conversion:
4:45 = 4h 45m
45 = 45m
4:0 = 4h
Decimal entry conversion
.25 = 0.25
0.25 = 0.25
25 = 25.00
.2 = .20

Title: HHMM mode - enforce time increments rounding
Description:
The data item that the duration picker is bound to may require support for time increments. If this is the case, values entered may be rounded according to the type set for time increments.
For example, if looking at the duration for a time entry, if the time increments for that time entry is Tenths and you enter 2:16, this will be rounded to the nearest 10th, resulting in 2:18 (2 hours, 18 minutes).

Title: HHMM mode - enter value manually in decimal format
Description:
The duration picker needs to be able to support negative numbers (from scenario 55401)
Time Entries are limited to 24hours maximum whereas summary levels can be very large, (e.g. 6000hours+) therefore a duration control needs to handle this menually entering lnumbers larger than 24 hours. The duration 'picker' does not need to be used (i.e. make the user type the value). (from scenario 55401)
 
Duration entry conversion:
4:45 = 4h 45m
45 = 45m
4:0 = 4h
Decimal entry conversion
.25 = 0.25
0.25 = 0.25
25 = 25.00
.2 = .20

Title: Sync CMS parameter settings to Configuration
Description: Synchronization of parameters between Expert Classic and Framework should take place at the time the Classic value is changed.
Steps: Step 1: (Note: Post 8030 we removed dependency on MSMQ, you need to uninstall it from your testing environment before running this test!)We currently map the following from Expert tables to Configuration: HBM_PARMS -> HubParms (Business.Hub) TBM_PARMS -> TimeBillingParms (Business.TimeAndBilling) TAM_PARMS -> TimeAccountingParms (Business.TimeAndBilling.Time) GLM_PARMS -> GeneralLedgerParms (Business.GeneralLedger) BLM_PARMS -> BillingParameters (Business.Billing) || Step 2: Test with the following SQL and check in Configuration manager that the corresponding config has been updated:updateHBM_PARMSsetCLNT_LENGTH= 11 | Expected: Business.Hub.ClientCode.MaxLength config is updated with a new firm value || Step 3: updateTBM_PARMSsetHAS_AP='N' | Expected: Business.TimeAndBilling.IsAP.IsAP config is updated with a new firm value || Step 4: updateTAM_PARMSsetDAILY_HRS_MAX='200.00' | Expected: Business.TimeAndBilling.Time.MaxDailyHours config is updated with a new firm value || Step 5: updateGLM_PARMSsetCUR_PER= 201505 | Expected: Business.GeneralLedger.CurrentSettings.CurrentFiscalPeriod config is updated with a new firm value || Step 6: updateBLM_PARMSsetAUTO_OAD_ALOC='Y' | Expected: Business.Billing.General.ProcessFlag.AUTO_OAD_ALOC config is updated with a new firm value

Title: Sync with deployment
Description:
With an Expert deployment several parameters in Expert Classic are synched with the equivalent Framework parameter which is stored in configuration.
There is only a ONE-WAY synchronisation from Expert Classic to Framework, it does not occur the other way around.
 
NOTE:
With the Design Studio V2 project, configuration manager is clubbed together with other customization elements (like security manager, action wizard etc) in a single product.
 
And hence the launching of configuration manager wouldn't be the same as Pre-SP2.

Title: Sync with full synchronisation
Description:
Full synchronizatoin of all identified parameters should take place periodically according to parameters in configuration in:
Technical > Framework > Integration > Application > CmsIntegration
 
NOTE:
 
With the Design Studio V2 project, configuration manager is clubbed together with other customization elements (like security manager, action wizard etc) in a single product.
 
And hence the launching of configuration manager wouldn't be the same as Pre-SP2.

Title: Admin functions on current workflows
Description:
Test the following admin actions while there are users performing functions on the same workflow (e.g. users have tasks open when workflow restarted by admin etc)
 
1. Start a workflow
2. Restart workflow
3. Suspend/Resume workflow
4. Cancel workflow
5. Generate workflow context data
6. Performing functions in Solution Designer
7. Performing functions in Security Manager
 
(Note: It is best if this is tested by two different people/logins/machines at the same time)

Title: Logging - Client-side logging
Description:
Specific client-side logging can be switched on from Expert Assistant. It will continue to log until the user turns it off.
 
Expert Assistant - Help-ABout from EA settings
Steps: Step 1: In an ITE environment, launch Expert Assistant from a client workstation || Step 2: Navigate to Settings > Expert Assistant, then click on the About button | Expected: The About window has a 'Logging' button || Step 3: Press the Logging button, then click Start || Step 4: Perform some actions e.g. open and complete task || Step 5: Go back into the About window for Expert Assistant | Expected: Start button is greyed out, Stop button is enabled || Step 6: Press the Email Diagnostic Information button | Expected: Presented with window to Send Diagnostic Information. Window has:- Log attached- Your own email address defaulted in the From field- 'To' field is required- Boxes to enter email subject and body || Step 7: Enter something in subject and body and a recipient address (for a user you can check the email for), then press Send | Expected: Email arrives in Inbox of recipient, log is attached and has appropriate content

Title: 00. Setup necessary if translation is required
Description: In your customization environment (database), you need to ensure the cms_module table in your database is up to date (i.e the latest UPD has been run against it and any custom modules the client has are in your dev database.)

Title: 01a. Create and consume new basic SmartForm, no translation required
Description:
When creating SmartForms, the labels (and some other text properties) can be interpreted from the language files (rather than just directly from the SmartForm), and can therefore be translateable. TO support this, when a Smartform is saved, a message key is listed against each label, and at runtime, this is used to look up the correspodning text in the language file. If the message key is not found in the language file, the default text in the SmartForm will be used instead. For example, this may occur if the SmartForms have been created in a customization environment, and the associated messages have not been added to the master database to update the messsage file. 
 
Assuming module on SF category is the default module of 110010 (Expert Workflow), use messages that are higher up in the hierarhcy
 
110010: Expert Workflow (Default Module)
110000: Expert                 (Parent of 110010)
1:           CMS.Net              (Parent of 1)
 
110000:    Reminder Email, More Detail, Task Priority, Future Milestones, 
1:              PARTY STATUS, PROJECT CODE, AFFILIATION, PROJECT MANAGER, RESPONSIBLE DEPT
 
 
NOTE: Not case sensitive. When looking for existing messages, the case is ignored
 
 
Things to Test:
1. Module on SF category does not exist in runtime environment
2. Message on SF does not exist in message file for runtime environment
 
NOTE:
With the Design Studio V2 project, SmartForm Wizard is clubbed together with other customization elements (like security manager, action wizard, configuration manager etc) in a single product.
 
And hence the creation of SmartForms wouldn't be the same as Pre-SP2.

Title: 01b. Create and consume advanced SmartForm, no translation required
Description:
NOTE:
With the Design Studio V2 project, SmartForm Wizard is clubbed together with other customization elements (like security manager, action wizard, configuration manager etc) in a single product.
 
And hence the creation of SmartForms wouldn't be the same as Pre-SP2.

Title: 02a. Update ENGLISH message file
Description:
By default, messages created via SmartForm Wizard will be added to the current Expert database in your deployment. In order to deploy and view your internationalised messages in your production environment, the messsages must be combined with your message files (cmsmsgXX.msg ). 
 
Manual Manual method:
Open MessEdit.exe for your master message database
Manually add messages for the labels/messages you have created in your SmartForms (ensure the message_name and module match what you had in your SmartForm). Set the user_message to something different to the message itself.
Generate language file from MessEdit.exe

Title: 02b. Update SPANISH message file
Description:
By default, messages created via SmartForm Wizard will be added to the current Expert database in your deployment. In order to deploy and view your internationalised messages in your production environment, the messsages must be combined with your message files (cmsmsgXX.msg ). 
 
Manual Manual method:
Open MessEdit.exe for your master message database
Manually add messages for the labels/messages you have created in your SmartForms (ensure the message_name and module match what you had in your SmartForm). Set the user_message to something different to the message itself.
Generate language file from MessEdit.exe

Title: 03. Export and import SmartForms -  no modules
Description:
To transfer your SmartForms from a test/customization environment to a production environment, there are a few pieces that you must transfer.
 
No translations required: Process
1. Create SF in customization environment
2. Export SF from customization environment
3. Import SF into production environment
4. Run SF in production environment --> default messages displayed
 
Translations required: Process
1. Create SF in customization environment
2. Add messages to master database (via one of the accepted methods)
3. Translate messages into another language (e.g. ES) using MessEdit.exe
4. Generate CMSMSGEN.msg and CMSMSGES.msg files
5. Export SF from customization environment
6. Import SF into production environment
7. Copy generated message files into your production environment ExpertShare folder
8. Run SF in production environment for user with ES (Spanish) as preferred language --> translated messages displayed

Title: 04a. Use default msg in SF if not in msg file
Description:
If the message used by a SmartForm does not exist in the cmsmsgXX.msg file for a runtime evnironment, the default message should be readable directly from the SmartForm itself. For example, this may occur if the SmartForms have been created in a customization environment, and the associated messages have not been added to the master database to update the messsage file. The SmartForms may then be imported* into a production environment without the relevant modifications to the message file.
 
* Still waiting for work to be completed for exporting/importing SFs with the new internationalisation components (modules, default messages etc) - SCENARIO 65873
 
Things to Test:
1. Module on SF category does not exist in runtime environment
2. Message on SF does not exist in message file for runtime environment

Title: 04b. Use msg from updated ENGLISH message file
04c. Use msg from another language file
Description:
If a client site supports languages other than English, and a user has its own default language set to one of these, the user should see labels (not necessarily data) etc translated into their preferred language.
 
SmartForm messages may be translated into another language using MESSEDIT.exe (included with Expert CMSNet binaries).
 
Note: 
For in-house testing, a test Spanish language file may also be generated using a command line tool. This will translate all English messages in your CMS_MESSAGE table to a dummy Spanish language and generate a CMSMSGES.msg file which can then be manually positioned in your ExpertShare folder.
 
Things to Test:
1. In your customization environment, 
    (a) Generate a Spaniish language file  (more detail required here...)
    (b) Add the Spanish language to your ExpertShare folder
    (c) Check SFs at runtime for a user that has the preferred language set to 'ES' (select language, * from hbm_name_people where ....)
2. In production environment, 
    (a) Import SFs
    (b) Add the Spanish language to your ExpertShare folder
    (c) Check SFs at runtime for a user that has the preferred language set to 'ES' (select language, * from hbm_name_people where ....)

Title: Replace message file at runtime
Description: If a messsage file is updated and replaced in a runtime environment, any applications that have internationalised messages will need to be closed and re-opened after the message file is replaced to pick up any changes.

Title: Translateable properties on SmartForm controls
Description: For each SmartForm control, there are different properties that may be translateable.

Title: 01. Default modules for Aderant categories
Description: Several categories (used by template SFs, workflows etc) are added via deployment. From 8.0, these will all have modules associated with them that will be used for the purposes of internationalisation of messages. These modules will be be added via UPD.

Title: 02. Default module for categories
Description: A default module will be created for categories to simplify the experience of creating SFs etc for those that do not care about transalation of messages. (So that they are not forced to create and select a module).

Title: 03. Create new category in SFW
Description: New categories may be created for SFs. For the purposes of internationalisation, a module must now be specified when creating a new category.

Title: 04. Existing categories survive without module
Description: If clients have created their own categories prior to 8.0, the module_id may not be populated.

Title: Translation reqd, create new module
Description:
If you intend to translate the labels etc on your SFs, you may wish to create new modules for grouping of messages to control where the messages will be consumed/viewed. 
If translation is not required, you should just use the default module Expert Workflow (110010)
 
In order to assign a module to a new category in SmartForm Wizard, the modules must first be created using the Expert tools  
 
To create module:
1. Launch ...
 
--> Added to CMS_MODULE table
 
Recommendation:
- If translation is not required, use the default module Expert Workflow (110010)
- If translation is required, 
                 (a) If you do not care about grouping messages (e.g. ALL SFs will pick up the same messgaes)
                 (b) If you DO care about the grouping of messages (e.g. Client may have different terms in different products), create 
                                                           i. one module per category
                                                           ii. The parent module for any new module that you create for SmartForm categories should be  'Expert Workflow (110010)

Title: Add arguments to existing SmartForm
Description:
1. Launch smart form wizard and select "Edit existing smart form".
2. Progress to Step 5 and add new argument/s to the smart form.
3. Open the newly edited smart form and ensure it has been updated regarding your changes.

Title: Change existing attribute control properties
Description:
Change existing attribute control properties
 
1. Launch Smart Form Wizard and select "Edit existing smart form"
2. In Step 5, ensure that the existing attribute control properties are all displayed as expected.
3. Change some of the control properties and progress to the finish.
4. Open the newly edited smart form and ensure it has been updated re: your changes.

Title: Run current version of SmartForm
Description:
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: View script for IronPython property on form
Description:
SF Wizard: If a scripting property actually contains a script (IronPython OR XAML), the property pane in step 3 of the Wizard should show the first line of the script.
 
(Previously, the property pane view always displayed '(Edit) ' regardless of whether or not a script had actually been added).
 
Test:
View the IronPython script property in the property pane for a FORM, for each of the following situations:
(a) No script --> the property pane value field will appear blank
(b) Script exists --> property pane displays first line of script
(c) Add script - one line  --> property pane displays first line of script
(d) Add script - more than one line --> property pane displays first line of script with a '...' at the end of it
 
--> Test both default and advanced properties on different controls
 
Note: 
Check how it looks if the first line of the script is longer than the size of the text field...

Title: View script for XAML property on form
Description:
SF Wizard: If a scripting property actually contains a script (IronPython OR XAML), the property pane in step 3 of the Wizard should show the first line of the script.
 
(Previously, the property pane view always displayed '(Edit) ' regardless of whether or not a script had actually been added).
 
Test:
Applies to the 'Additional Namespaces' and 'Resources' (non-grid SFs only) properties in the Advanced section for the FORM
Viewing the XAML script property in the property pane for a FORM, for each of the following situations:
(a) No script --> the property pane value field will appear blank
(b)  Script exists --> property pane displays first line of script
(c) Add script - one line  --> property pane displays first line of script
(d)  Add script - more than one line --> property pane displays first line of script with a '...' at the end of it
 
--> Test both default and advanced properties on different controls
 
 
****EXCEPTION****:
The above does NOT apply to the Advanced Xaml Override property in the BUttonBar section for a grid SmartForm. In this case, there will ALWAYS be content if the client has added content to the button bar. In this case, the property will show any generated Xaml, it does not necessarily represent script that the client has MANUALLY added/overridden.
 
Note: 
Check how it looks if the first line of the script is longer than the size of the text field...

Title: Smartform Wizard - Pre-requisites to use
Description:
To ensure you have appropriate security rights to customize and consume SmartForms, you need to:
 
(a) Add yourself to the Administrators user group (can launch SmartForm Wizard)
(b) Add yourself to the Advanced Workflow Licence policy (can consume FIRM's own SmartForms).
Steps: Step 1: SmartformWizard is secured by Security resource: Modules.Framework.Workflow.SmartFormWizardGive an user access by adding the user to ExpertApplications policy in SecurityManagerOr add the user to Administrators user group in CMS || Step 2: Run SmartformWizard.exe from Expertshare | Expected: -If a user does not have access to SmartformWizard, they should be notified when trying to run the app-Users with access can launch SmartForm Wizard from ExpertShare || Step 3: By default users are not allowed to make customizationsTo give an user rights to customize, add the user to Advanced Workflow Licence policy in SecurityManager | Expected: -If the user is not in AdvancedWorkflowLicense policy, they are not able to create or copy smartforms

Title: Smartform Wizard - Create New Smartform
Description:
Estimated Duration: 2 minutes
 
1. Launch SF Wizard from Visual Studio
2. Press the Begin button and in step 1, select 'Create New SmartForm'. Press the Next button
3. In step 2
   (a) Check the 'Expert Owner' displays the firm name from: SELECT NAME FROM FWM_OWNER WHERE ISSYSTEM = 'Y'
   (b) SmartForm Name: Enter  'BasicSmartForm' (check no spaces allowed in name)
   (c) SmartForm Category: Create a new category called 'SFSmokeTest' and select
   (d) SmartForm Description: Enter a simple description
   (e) SmartForm Type: Leave default of 'Single Form'
   (f) Scripting Required: Leave default as checked
   (g) Customization Package: Create new package called 'SFBaseTest' and select
   (h) Check the individual help links work
   (i) Press the Next button
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: Step 1 a.Select 'Create New SmartForm'. b.Check all descriptionsc.Go to next step | Expected: In Step 1, the following options are available:-Create New Smartform-Create Smartform by copying from existing smartform-Edit existing SmartformAll descriptions should have correct grammar and make sense. || Step 2: Step 2a.Check 'Expert Owner' displays the firm name from: SELECT NAME FROM FWM_OWNER WHERE ISSYSTEM = 'Y'b.Check Mode displays Create New Smartformc.SmartForm Name: Enter 'BasicSmartForm'd.SmartForm Category: Create a new category called 'SFSmokeTest' and selecte.SmartForm Description: Enter a simple descriptionf.SmartForm Type: Leave default of 'Single Form'g.Customization Package: Create new package called 'SFBaseTest' and selecth.Check all help links worki. Check all descriptionsj.Press the Next button | Expected: Smartform Name does NOT allow:-Starting with numbers-Spaces in between words-Special characters like: #, @, /, &, %All descriptions should have correct grammar and make sense.All help links should work and directs to the correct help page || Step 3: Step 3a. Check Smartform Name is the same as what you created in step 2b.Check Smartform Category is the same as what you selected in step 2c. Check Smartform Instance is emptyd. Check Expert Owner is the same as Step 2e. Set Display Columns as 'Two'f. Click on Add/View Items and add a Stringg. Click on the dropdown of Add/View Items and add: Blank, Button, DisplayText, Divider and Hyperlinkh. Use up/down arrow to reorder itemsi. Use Preview button to Preview the formj. Check all help linksk. Check all descriptionsl. Use the Save buttonm. Press the Next button || Step 4: Step 4a. Check Expert Owner is the sameb. Check Smartform Category is the samec. Check Smartform name is the samed. Check Smartform instance is emptye. Check all help linksf. Check all descriptionsg. Press the Next button || Step 5: Step 6a. Check Expert Owner is the sameb. Check Smartform Category is the samec. Check Smartform name is the samed. Check Smartform instance is emptye. Check Expert Release refers to the current release levelf. Check Configuration Path is validg. Check User or Group is for All Usersh. Check all help linksi. Check all descriptionsj. Press Finish | Expected: You should get 3 options after clicking on Finish:-Yes: Create or edit another Smartform-Continue: Continue editing the same Smartform-No: Quit the Sameform Wizard

Title: 01b. Create new SmartForm - Step 3
Description:
Estimated Duration: 5 minutes
 
In step 3
   (a) Leave Display Columns default as 'Two'
   (b) Click on the Add/View Items button
   (c) In the Parameters window, in the Select Item search box search for and select:
              i. 'Client' 
              ii. 'String' with details: name =  'Name', description = 'Your name', IsReadOnly/IsNullable - leave default as unchecked
              iii. 'Boolean' with details: name = 'AcceptTandC', description = 'Accept terms and conditions', IsReadOnly/IsNullable - leave default as unchecked
              iv. 'Datetime' with details: name = 'StartDate', description = 'Commencement Date', IsReadOnly/IsNullable - leave default as unchecked
              v. 'Int32' with details: name =  'Quantity', description = 'Number of children', IsReadOnly/IsNullable - leave default as unchecked
              vi. 'Decimal' with details: name =  'Balance', description = 'Bank balance', IsReadOnly/IsNullable - leave default as unchecked
              vii. 'String' with details: name =  'MoreInfo', description = 'More information about yourself', IsReadOnly/IsNullable - leave default as unchecked
    (d) Back in the Parameters window, check 'Client', expand Client and check, 'DisplayName', 'DepartmentId', 'OfficeId'
    (e) FORM tab, set:
               i. Title='Simple SmartForm'
               ii. Help Link Id=
               iii. OnLoaded = self.LogWriter.Log(LogLevel.Error, 'OnLoaded script for Basic SmartForm')
               iv. OnValidate = self.LogWriter.Log(LogLevel.Error, 'OnValidate script for Basic SmartForm')
               v. OnDataChanged=self.LogWriter.Log(LogLevel.Error, 'OnDataChanged script for Basic SmartForm')
    (f) Control tab     
               i. Name - TextBox (default), enter Prompt =  "What is your name?" (freeform text), IsRequired=True
               ii. AcceptTandC - Checkbox (default), change Label to "Accept TC", enter Tooltip "Check this box if you accept the Terms and Conditions" (freeform text)
               iii. StartDate - DatePicker (default)
               iv. Quantity - NumericBox, enter Decimal Places=0, Minimum=0, Maximum=30, Tooltip="How many children do you have?" (freeform text)
               v. Balance - NumericBox, enter Decimal Places=2, LeadingText=$
               vi. MoreInfo - AdvancedTextBox, ColumnSpan = True, Minimum Lines=3, Maximum Lines = 5, SpellChecking=True, ExpansionCodes=True
               vii. Client - SearchBox, Data Provider=Client, BindTo=SelectedItem
               viii. ClientOfficeId - SearchBox, Label=Office, DataProvider=Office, BindTo=SelectedItemId
               viii. Client.DepartmentId - DisplayText, Label=Department, DataProvider='Department, DisplayFormat = 'Standard'
               ix. Client.DisplayName - TextBox, IsReadOnly='True'
               x. Arrange the order of the Visible Items using the UP/DOWN arrows. Order should be:
                              Name, AcceptT&C,StartDate,Quantity, Balance, MoreInfo, Client, Client.OfficeId, Client.DisplayName, Client.DepartmentId
               xi. Add a Divder: Click on the DOWN arrow on the Add/View Items button and select Divider. Once you see a Divider item in the list, move it so it is after 'MoreInfo'and before 'Client'
Press the Save button
 
5. Press the 'Preview'button --> The preview pop up should look like the attachment to this test called: 'BasicSFPreview.png'
6. Press the Next button --> Step 4, make no changes
7. Press the Next button --> Step 6, summaised SF info
8. Press the Finish button --> Prompted to continue (Yes/Continue/No)
 
Confirm Creation
For each SmartForm defined, parameters should be saved in configuration under the path Technical.Presentation.SmartForms.<SmartFormName>, where <SmartFormName> is the SmartForm name with spaces removed. 
e.g. SFSmokeTest.BasicSmartForm
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
All info below is from deleted tests, need to rewrite
 
Blank
Button
Columns
Divider
Span
 
 
Tab order
The rules for tab order in a 2+ column layout for a SmartForm is:
 
Test:
1. Default sequence is tab down the first column and then wrap back up to the top of the second.
2. Breaks in tab order will be done manually using a divider, new form…
3. "Blanks" can be inserted into a "cell" and will be skipped over by User tab ('Empty Cell 'control).
4. Spanning goes left to right.That means that, in a 2 column layout, only items in the 1st column can be spanned.If an item in the second column has been set to span, the span will be ignored.This rule will be outlined in the instructions and possibly in the wizard interface using validation feedback or instructional text. 
5. Contents of a cell will always be top aligned to maintain visual appear when the content of the horizontally attached cell are taller than standard.
 
Confirm Creation
For each SmartForm defined, parameters should be saved in configuration under the path Technical.Presentation.SmartForms.<SmartFormName>, where <SmartFormName> is the SmartForm name with spaces removed. 
Refer to the spreadsheet attached for a list of configuration that should be created.

Title: 01c. Consume SmartForm in workflow
Description:
Estimated Duration: 10 minutes
 
1. In Visual Studio, create a new workflow, give it a name of "SmartFormTest", type of 'Flowchart', category 'SFSmokeTest', Package 'SFBaseTest'
2. Add the following variables:
    (a) Client (type: Client), set default to: New Client()
    (b) Name (String)
    (c) AcceptTandC (Boolean)
    (d) StartDate (DateTime), set default to: DateAndTime.Now
    (e) Quantity (Int32)
    (f) Balance (Decimal)
    (g) MoreInfo (String)
3. Drag a SmartForm Task activity onto the design surface, and select the SF created:SFSmokeTest.BasicSmartForm 
    (a) All the variables should be mapped, and check that 'Show Title'is checked
    (b) Set the TaskName to "Single SmartForm Test"
    (c) Set the workflow initiator as the task performer
4. Copy the SmartForm task activity and paste below the first one
5. Change the TaskName to "Single SmartForm - Check data
6. Connect the lines so that the two tasks run sequentially
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: 01d. Run SmartForm in Workflow
Description:
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
-------------------------
1. Open DebugViewer
2. In Visual Studio, run the workflow you have created 
3. Watch DebugViewer as you open the first task. There should be an ERROR log entry: 'OnLoaded script for Basic SmartForm'
4. Once the task has loaded, it should look like the attachment:
5. Check the following:
              a. Name control is required, required count on form = "1"
              b. Name control has prompt when there is no value, and it is not in focus: "What is your name?"
              c. A hover hint appears when you hover over "Accept T and C" and "Quantity"
              d. Start Date - Date Picker control allows manual entry and use of picker, default date = today's date
              d. Quantity - only allow values >= 0 and <= 30 (should get validation icon etc when outside this range)
              e. Balance - only allows 2 decimal places, and a "$"character is prefixed to any value entered after exiting the field
              f. More info - Spans BOTH columns
              g. More info - Expands up to 5 rows if more than 3 rows of data is entered (afterwhich a scroll bar appears)
              h. More info - SpellCheck and Expansion codes are enabled. Test by F7 (SpellCheck) and "="for expansion codes
              i. Divider - separates Client, Office, Display Name, and Department from the other fields above
              j. Selecting a Client, populates the Office, DisplayName, and Department
              k. Department data is displayed in format PrimaryText (Code)
              l. DisplayName - is a read only TextBox control (can highlight and copy text)
              m. Department - is a DisplayText control (cannot 
6. Enter/select values in all fields except 'Name' and press the 'Save & Close' button --> Receive validation error prompt for missing data --> 
              Watch DebugViewer as the task is saved. There should be TWO ERROR log entries: 
                                                                 'OnValidate script for Basic SmartForm'
                                                                 'OnDataChanged script for Basic SmartForm'
7. Re-open the task --> All values that had been entered should still be there
8. Check the tab sequence. Default sequence should be down the first column and then wrap back up to the top of the second.
8. Press the 'Complete' button 
              Watch DebugViewer as the task is completed. There should be TWO ERROR log entries: 
                                                                 'OnValidate script for Basic SmartForm'
                                                                 'OnDataChanged script for Basic SmartForm'
9. When the next task appears, ensure the data from the first task is still visible
 
CHECK FORM PROPERTIES (when task is saved/completed)
- OnValidate
- OnDataChanged
 
KNOWN BUG 
60749: Workflow errors when saving task that has non-decimal data bound to numeric control in SF
