Title: Smartform Wizard - Create SmartForm Summary
Description:
Create SmartForm Set
 
In the Smart Form Wizard, 
 
Step 1: Select 'Create New Smart Form'
Step 2: Enter values for the base Smart Form properties
Step 3:  (a) Select the 'FormSet' radio button rather than the 'SingleForm' radio button and enter values for other properties as required
             (b) Add more than one SF
             (c) Add a summary - select a small subset of the data that is displayed on the SFs contained in the set
             (d) Save the SF
 
 
Confirm Creation of SmartForm Set
(a) For each FormSet defined, parameters should be saved in configuration under the path Technical.Presentation.SmartForms.<SmartFormSection><SmartFormName>
(b) In addition to the above, the child SmartForms that make up the FormSet should be saved in the configuration path
           Technical.Presentation.SmartForms.<SmartFormSection><SmartFormName>.SmartForms
 
Consume in WF
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: Pre SP2 - In the Smart Form Wizard, Step 1: Select 'Create New Smart Form'Step 2: Enter values for the base Smart Form propertiesStep 3:  (a) Select the 'FormSet' radio button rather than the 'SingleForm' radio button and enter values for other properties as required             (b) Add more than one SF             (c) Add a summary - select a small subset of the data that is displayed on the SFs contained in the set             (d) Save the SF || Step 2: Consume in Workflow (via VisualStudio) || Step 3: Confirm Creation of SmartForm Set(a) Pre SP2 - Configuration Manager is found in Expert Share folder.SP2 & Later - Design Studio V2 - Config settings. For each FormSet defined, parameters should be saved in configuration under the path Technical.Presentation.SmartForms.(b) In addition to the above, the child SmartForms that make up the FormSet should be saved in the configuration path           Technical.Presentation.SmartForms.{CategoryName}

Title: General - Create single column SmartForm
General - Edit SmartForm more than once
Description:
Each time a SmartForm is edited, a NEW firm value is created, and a Valid From date (of today and now) is set.
 
Test:
1. Create new SmartForm - no Valid From date on config
2. Edit SmartForm - if changes have been made, create NEW config, set Valid From date to now
3. Edit SmartForm again - if changes have been made, create NEW config, set Valid From date to now
 
IF NO CHANGES HAVE BEEN MADE --> Generate new config?

Radio Group
Address
Advanced Text Box
Check Box
Date Picker
Display Text
Display text box
Multiselect
Name

2. Test that The label can be top aligned and the label set to blank
 
3. Test that labels in smart form summaries can be set to top aligned:

Title: Scripting - Set conditional rules for IS property
Description:
When setting the "Is" properties using conditions, it is possible to use:
- View model data
- Workflow data
- SmartForm variables
 
* An "Is" property refers to IsRequired, IsEnabled, IsVisible, IsReadOnly properties for SmartForm controls
 
NOTE: 
From 8003, conditions have been replaced by expressions. However, if existing SmartForms use conditions, these should still function and can still be maintained and edited.

Title: Scripting - SmartForm scripting points in SFW
Description:
Functionality changed quite a bit here...
 
When the SF is launched from the VS SF designer, the IronPython scripting points will be enabled/disabled depending on which controller language is selected in the VS designer when the SFW is launched. If the SFW is launched from anywhere other than the SF designer in VS, the scripting points will be enabled if the 'Scripting Required' checkbox in step 3 of the SFW is checked (by default it is UNchecked)
 
Scripting Required NOT checked (default)
FORM level:
Advanced XAML Override
 
CONTROL level: None
 
Scripting Required checked, Advanced checkbox unchecked
Form-level scripting points:
By default: On Loaded
                  On Validate
                  On Data Changed 
 
Scripting Required checked AND Advanced checkbox is checked
In addition to above, 
  Scripting:                 Global Declarations
                                  Class Declarations
                                  On Data Changing
                                  Additional Functions
                                  On Data Grid Loaded
                                  On Data Grid Unloaded
                                  On Creating New Item
                                  On Created New Item
                                  On Editing Item
                                  On Edited Item
                                  On Creating New Item From Existing
                                  On Created New Item From Existing
                                  On Removing Item
                                  On Removed Item
   XAML:                    Additional Namespaces
                                  Resources   
Control-level
                  On Validate 
                  On Change
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: Create search data provider (Return Type: Int32)Add the following config in Configuration Manager:Path: Technical.Presentation.DataProviders.CustomData Type: XMLName: CourtDataProviderValue:<DataProvider DisplayName="Court" Description="Default data provider for retrieving and displaying Courts in a LookupDto" Type="Aderant.Framework.Presentation.DataProviders.GenericLookupDtoSearchDataProvider, Aderant.Framework.Presentation"> <Template><fpd:GenericLookupDtoSearchDataProvider LookupTableName="LMM_COURT" PrimaryTextColumnName="Court_name" SecondaryTextColumnName="Court_Id" KeyColumnName="Court_uno" ExcludeInactiveRows="True" IsMruEnabled="True"  MruName="Court"> </fpd:GenericLookupDtoSearchDataProvider> </Template> <Column property="Id" title="Id" propertyType="Id" isVisible="false" /></DataProvider> || Step 2: Create lookup data provider (Return Type: String)Add the following config in Configuration Manager:Path: Technical.Presentation.DataProviders.CustomData Type: XML Name: Jurisdiction Value: <DataProvider DisplayName="Jurisdiction Cust" Description="Default data provider for retrieving and displaying Jurisdiction in a LookupDto" Type="Aderant.Framework.Presentation.DataProviders.GenericLookupDtoFilterDataProvider, Aderant.Framework.Presentation"> <Template><fpd:GenericLookupDtoFilterDataProvider LookupTableName="LML_COURT_JURIS" PrimaryTextColumnName="COURT_TITLE" SecondaryTextColumnName="JURIS_CODE" KeyColumnName="JURIS_CODE" ExcludeInactiveRows="True" IsMruEnabled="True"  MruName="Jurisdiction"> </fpd:GenericLookupDtoFilterDataProvider> </Template> <Column property="Id" title="Id" propertyType="Id" isVisible="false" /></DataProvider> || Step 3: Create a copy of Namespace: Aderant to the custom path: Technical.Presentation.DataProviders.Custom || Step 4: Consume the custom data providers:1. In Step 3 of SmartForm Wizard, select the Form tab, then tick the Advanced checkbox.2. Under XAML, add the following: a) Additional Namespaces: fpc="clr-namespace:Aderant.PresentationFramework.Converters;assembly=Aderant.PresentationFramework"b) Resources:<fpc:IdentifierToUnderlyingConverter x:Key="IdentifierToUnderlyingConverter" /> || Step 5: Now select the items that you want to bind the COURT data provider to or create a new item. The selected item must be a parameter of type Int32. (a) From the right-hand properties grid click the Control tab and select the data provider that you added to configuration in the register data provider section above (in this example "COURT").(b) For the BindTo property, set the value to 'SelectedItem'(c) We must now use the IdentifierToUnderlyingConverter to assign the unique id of the selected item to our parameter item. Click the Advanced button and modify the xaml to include the Converter attribute as shown below :<c:SearchBox.SelectedItemId> <Binding Path="Data.courtId" NotifyOnSourceUpdated="True" Mode="TwoWay" NotifyOnValidationError="True" Converter="{StaticResource IdentifierToUnderlyingConverter}" /></c:SearchBox.SelectedItemId> || Step 6: Repeat steps 5 for the Jurisdiction data provider using a parameter of type String || Step 7: Cllick 'Save' and close Smart Form Wizard. | Expected: You should get a dialog to say that the smart form has been re-generated and saved. || Step 8: Launch Visual Studio. Open solution and view workflow.xamlx e.g. File Opening Workflow.(a) Click on the 'Variables' tab and create a new variable, 'CourtId', type Int32, scope IntakeFlow and a new variable 'Jurisdiction', type string, scope IntakeFlow.(b) In the workflow.xamlx, navigate to the task you want the data provider to appear in e.g. ClientMatterDataEntry. (c) Click on 'Edit smart forms'. In the Configure SmartForms dialog, refresh the smart form set e.g. FileOpening.MatterSet. Then scroll to view the smart form parameters for e.g. MatterDetails. The new data providers e.g. CourtId and Jurisdiction should be displayed in the Form Parameter section and the corresponding workflow variables should be selected. You will have to select the correct workflow variable if the name is different to the item you specified in Smart Form Wizard. Then click OK.(d) In the workflow xamlx, navigate to a subsequent task e.g. Intake Approval Task in File Opening Workflow. (e) Click on 'Edit smart forms'. In the Configure SmartForms dialog, refresh the smart form set e.g. FileOpening.MatterSet. Then scroll to view the smart form parameters for e.g. MatterDetails. The new data providers e.g. CourtId and JurisdictionId should be displayed in the Form Parameter section and the corresponding workflow variables should be selected. You will have to select the correct workflow variable if the name is different to the item you specified in Smart Form Wizard. Then click OK.(f) Re-build solution. || Step 9: Run workflow.(a) If the data providers have been implemented using File Opening using steps above - accept Intake task. Select requesting attorney that is different to initiator. Select an existing client and enter matter description.(b) Scroll down to Matter Details smart form. The 2 new data providers, Court (search control) and Jurisdiction (filter) should be displayed.(c) Test that the data providers are searching for and displaying the correct data by comparing to database tables (LML_COURT_JURIS and LMM_COURT). | Expected: Court data provider: (a) Data provider is SEARCH mode (b) Results match: select * from LMM_COURT (and takes search criteria into account)Jurisdiction data provider:(a) Data provider is FILTER mode (b) Results match: select * from LML_COURT_JURIS || Step 10: Save and close task. Re-open task. | Expected: Values that were selected for the 2 new data providers are still displayed. || Step 11: Complete task.Proxy the requesting attorney and accept Intake Approval task. Scroll down to Matter Details smart form | Expected: The values selected for the 2 new data providers are correcty displayed.

Title: Scripting - Consume python data providers
Description:
GOAL: To create new custom IronPython data providers and implement in an existing smart form and ensure data is passed correctly between workflow tasks.
 
FOR FURTHER INSTRUCTIONS:
http://ttwiki/wiki/index.php?title=Creating_Generic_Lookup_Search_Data_Providers
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Scripting - Disable MRU on data provider for control instance
Description:
When a data provider is selected in a SmartForm, the MRU is either enabled/disabled by default (enabled is more common). This can be overridden at design time for a particular SF instance.
 
Current Method
- Advanced Xaml for control

Title: Scripting - Display Property Metadata in script editor
Description:
To enable the changing the property metadata information like Visible, Validation, Required etc the script editor should display the Property Metadata so that it can be changed.
 
This data will be visible via a checkbox to "Show Property Metadata" above the data tree picked in the script editor
 
In the following locations, check that the checkbox is available and that checking/unchecking it makes the property metadata visible/not visible.
SmartForm Wizard:          Iron Python script editors
Workflow Designer:         Dynamic Script activity
 
Note: 
PropertyMetaData can only appear in the tree for viewmodel data and not for primitive data types (e.g. string, datetime etc), although the scripts can still reference this metadata as it gets created for primitive data types at runtime

Title: Scripting - Overwrite data properties on task to an expression
Description:
Overwrite data properties  on task task properties  (IsVisible/IsRequired/IsEnabled etc)  to  or other data items in view model or workflow.
 
-- Closed - added as a step to some other test

Title: Scripting - Overwrite data properties on task to true or false
Description:
Overwrite data properties  on task (IsVisible/IsRequired/IsEnabled etc)  to true/false
 
-- Closed - added as a step to some other test

Title: Scripting - Overwrite SF Control properties on task to true or false
Description:
Overwrite data properties  on task (IsVisible/IsRequired/IsEnabled etc)  to true/false
 
-- Closed - added as a step to some other test

Title: Scripting - Run script that fires at control or form level
Description:
In the SFW for basic SmartForms, scripts may be set to fire at form or control level for the SmartForm. 
 
There are 3 methods available at form level:
- On Loaded
- On Validate
- On Data Changed
 
There are 3 methods available at control level:
- On Validate
- On Change
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Form - Collapsed and Collapsable in Workflow
Description:
When a SF is consumed in a workflow, it may be defined as collapsed/non-collapsed by default.
 
By default, when you first add a SF to a manual task activity in the workflow designer, the SF will default to being non-collapsable by default.
 
Things to Test:
Check settings the properties as follows, and the behaviour at runtime for the following scenarios
 Is Collapsed =True
 Is Collapsed =False

Title: Form - Read Only in Workflow
Description:
When a SF is consumed in a workflow, it may be set to read-only in a particular task/activity
 
By default, when you first add a SF to a manual task activity in the workflow designer, the SF will default to NOT being read-only
 
Things to Test:
Check settings the properties as follows, and the behaviour at runtime for the following scenarios
1. Non read-only (default behaviour)
2. Read-only
Steps: Step 1: Pre SP2 - In a workflow (via VS), add a SmartForm task activity and add two different BASIC SmartForms: - On the first one, leave IsReadOnly as False - On the second one, set IsReadOnly to True | Expected: At runtime, - The first SmartForm is not read only - The second SmartForm IS read only

Title: Form - Required Counter
Description:
On a SmartForm, indiviudal fields where the data is required are highlighted with an orange outline around the control when there is no value/data in the control. A counter is also displayed in some parts of a workflow task, as a summary of all of the required fields that are not currently populated within the given context. Inherit task behaviour dictates that the required counters do not disabled buttons etc, however WILL prevent a user completing a task.
 
A required counter is available at two levels: 
Task-level - Counter is visible at the top right-hand corner of the task and adds up the number of required fields that are not populated across ALL SmartForms on that task
SmartForm Set- Counter is visible at the top right-hand corner of the SmartForm set header/summary and adds up the number of required fields that are not populated across the SmartForms contained withint that SmartForm set
 
Note: There is no required counter for an individual SmartForm that is not contained in a SmartForm set. Only the individual fields are highlighted when required.
Steps:
Step 1: On a BASIC SmartForm, add several data items and ensure that there is at least one item that falls into each of the folllowing categories:
- IsRequired=False
- IsRequired=True
- IsRequired=Expression (define something simple that can be dynamically changed in the UI) | Expected: At runtime, 
- the controls are highlighted as required of the IsRequired property was True, or the expression resolves to True, and the control is not populated with data
- the  required count on the SmartForm is accurate 
- The required count on the task is accurate
- The Complete button is disabled if the required count is not 0
Note: If a control goes from being unpopulated to populated, the required counts are only updated when the user loses focus from the control that was updated

Title: Address Book - Create & Consume
Description:
Test that a new smart form can be created that uses a Address Book Control, primarily using default values. Ensure that the wizard generates the smart form correctly, and the smart form can be used in a Task/Workflow
 
Purpose:
The purpose of this case is to ensure the NEW smart forms can be generated and consumed only. More specific details of the control will be tested in another Test Case "Address Book Control" i.e. all the available properties and options.
 
Test:
In Visual Studio:
1. Create a variable (i.e. MySelectedAddress) where variable-type = Aderant.Query.ViewModels.PhysicalAddress
a. Make sure this variable is initialized as such: New PhysicalAddress()
2. Create another variable (i.e. (MyAddressBook) where variable-type is a collection = ViewModelObservableCollection<PhysicalAddress>
a. Make sure this variable is initialized as such: New ViewModelObservableCollection(Of PhysicalAddress)
3. Drag a Smartform Task activity
4. In the Configure Smartform dialog, create a New Smartform
5. In Step 3 of the Smartform Wizard, click 'Add/View item' then select items from the Workflow Scope.
a. Select both MySelectedAddress and MyAddressBook 
b. Un-tick MyAddressBook as this does not have to be displayed
6. Select the control-type = AddressBook for MySelectedAddress with the following properties edited as:
a. ItemSource = Data.MyAddressBook
b. SelectedAddressBinding = Data.MySelectedAddress
Steps:
Step 1: In Visual Studio, create a new workflow project:Create a variable (i.e. MySelectedAddress) where variable-type = Aderant.Query.ViewModels.PhysicalAddress    a. Make sure this variable is initialized as such: New PhysicalAddress() || Step 2: Create another variable (i.e. (MyAddressBook) where variable-type is a collection = ViewModelObservableCollection
    a. Make sure this variable is initialized as such: New ViewModelObservableCollection(Of PhysicalAddress) || Step 3: Drag a Smartform Task activity || Step 4: In the Configure Smartform dialog, create a New Smartform || Step 5: In Step 3 of the Smartform Wizard, click 'Add/View item' then select items from the Workflow Scope.
    a.  Select both MySelectedAddress and MyAddressBook 
    b.  Un-tick MyAddressBook as this does not have to be displayed || Step 6: Select the control-type = AddressBook for MySelectedAddress with the following properties edited as:
    a.  ItemSource = Data.MyAddressBook
    b.  SelectedAddressBinding = Data.MySelectedAddress || Step 7: Run workflow | Expected: The Address Book behaves as expected according to labels/instructions in a BASIC SmartForm

Title: Advanced TextBox - Create & Consume - Basic Smartforms
Description:
Test that a new smart form can be created that uses a Advanced Text Box Control, primarily using default values. Ensure that the wizard generates the smart form correctly, and the smart form can be used in a Task/Workflow
 
Purpose:
The purpose of this case is to ensure the NEW smart forms can be generated and consumed only. More specific details of the control will be tested in another Test Case "Consume Advanced Text Box Control" i.e. all the available properties and options.
 
Test:
1. Select a Context data string value in the smart form wizard, and choose a control of "Advanced Text Box"
2. Change some properties, like min and max lines, Clear button off, and set spell check on.
3. Ensure the common values of the control are completed. Label, validation script, required field.
4. Select some other control types to and out the form & Generate
5. Use a Workflow & Task to consume the form, ensure that the UI is correct, and the user can complete tasks without error.
6. Ensure labels, prompts, tooltips (and other text properties) are displayed in English as entered in the property. i.e. you do not see the internationalisation key

Title: DisplayText - Create & Consume Unbound
Description:
BASE RUNTIME TEST
 
Unbound DIsplayText Control can be consumed in Smart forms, and all of the available appearance and Binding attributes are availlable.
 
Test:
Run the test workflow "UnboundDisplayTextControl"in the attached package.
1. Import the attached UnboundDisplayText.zip into a dev environment (this will add the BASIC  SmartForms to config)
2. Extract the workflow source UnboundDisplayTeztSfsAndWF.zip to a local directory
2. Navigate to the extract location and delete the SharedBin folder (IMPORTANT!!!! Otherwise your workflow might not run) 
2. Open workflow solution in workflow designer
3. Run workflow and follow instructions for tests as per tasks that appear
Steps: Step 1: Create new BASIC SmartForm using SmartForm Wizard (two columns) || Step 2: Add DisplayText from Add/View Items button and set: (a) Text = To change the overall look of your document, choose new Theme elements on the Page Layout tab. To change the looks available in the Quick Style gallery, use the Change Current Quick Style Set command. Both the Themes gallery and the Quick Styles gallery provide reset commands so that you can always restore the look of your document to the original contained in your current template. (b) Leave all other properties as default values | Expected: At runtime, the text is displayed (a) without a label (b) in a single column (i.e. not spanned across multiple columns) (c) with the control expanding in height to display the entire text (no scroll bards etc) || Step 3: Add DisplayText from Add/View Items button and set: (a) Text = To change the overall look of your document, choose new Theme elements on the Page Layout tab. To change the looks available in the Quick Style gallery, use the Change Current Quick Style Set command. Both the Themes gallery and the Quick Styles gallery provide reset commands so that you can always restore the look of your document to the original contained in your current template. (b) Set Column Span = True (c) Leave all other properties as default values | Expected: At runtime, the text is displayed (a) without a label (b) spanned across both columns (c) with the control expanding in height to display the entire text (no scroll bards etc) || Step 4: Add DisplayText from Add/View Items button and set: (a) Text = To change the overall look of your document, choose new Theme elements on the Page Layout tab. To change the looks available in the Quick Style gallery, use the Change Current Quick Style Set command. Both the Themes gallery and the Quick Styles gallery provide reset commands so that you can always restore the look of your document to the original contained in your current template. You can easily change the formatting of selected text in the document text by choosing a look for the selected text from the Quick Styles gallery on the Home tab. You can also format text directly by using the other controls on the Home tab. Most controls offer a choice of using the look from the current theme or using a format that you specify directly. (b) Set Maximum Rows = 2 (c) Leave all other properties as default values | Expected: At runtime, the text is displayed (a) without a label (b) in a single column (i.e. not spanned across multiple columns) (c) two rows in height, with scrollbar to view additional text || Step 5: Import the attached UnboundDisplayText.zip into a dev environment (this will add the BASIC SmartForms to config) | Expected: The file is located in TFS QA folder. e.g. $/ExpertSuite/Releases/801x/QA/Framework/UX Controls/BasicSFs || Step 6: Extract the workflow source UnboundDisplayTeztSfsAndWF.zip to a local directory || Step 7: Navigate to the extract location and delete the SharedBin folder (IMPORTANT!!!! Otherwise your workflow might not run) || Step 8: Open workflow solution in workflow designer || Step 9: Run workflow and follow instructions for tests as per tasks that appear

Title: RadioButtonGroup - Use case - Support INTs
Description:
This test needs to cater for scenario in bug 67846
 
Radio button has option of 'Id' to both 'Selected Value' and 'Display Value' property. You can now bind an int to the RadioButtonGroup if you select a dataprovider that has an int Id and/or Code, and select'Id'(int) 'CodeText' as the Value'.
 
If SelectedValue = Int, when you add the SF to a workflow task, the selected value should be retained when you save & close task and then reopen. TO see behaviour you can import the package attached, and start workflow from Actions menu in EA (Test radio button with int)
 
 
A data provider that has an Int for a primary key: Fee Rate Level

Title: WebBrowser - Create & Consume
Description:
In order to consume the Web Browser control, you must assign a URL to the item.
 
You can either do this through the String assignment within the workflow, or use scripting (example below, placed at the Form Scripting: On Loaded section):
   
self.Data.testWebBrowser="http://www.google.co.nz"
 
The Data type of Web Browsers are of String type... and have the following fields:
 
Height
MinHeight
 
Name
IsVisible

Title: ItemsSelector - Bind to data that does not exist in the view model
Description:
To complete and end-to-end customisation scenario using this control in a workflow:
 
Data not in view model:
1. In step 3 of SFW, add control to SmartForm, using a data type of ViewModelObservableCollection <T> (define <T> as type such as Employee).
2. Update workflow
(a) Create variable in the workflow that is of the same type (e.g. ViewModelObservableCollection <Employee>) as the SmartForm and instanciate it. e.g. New ViewModelObservableCollection (Of Employee)
(b) If required: Add Dynamic Script activity to workflow that fetches the data from the database
(c) Add SmartForm Task activity to workflow and bind the data on the SmartForm with the data you have created on the workflow via the 'Edit SmartForms' button on the activity
(d) If you consume custom activities in your workflow where the SmartForm will be consumed, you may also need to supply arguments to those workflow
(e) If required: Add Dynamic Script activity to workflow that saves the data to the database
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: ItemsSelector - Bind to data that exists in the view model
Description:
To complete and end-to-end customisation scenario using this control in a workflow:
 
Data in view model:
1. In step 3 of SFW, add control to SmartForm, using the data type in the view model e.g. MarketingEntity.SicCodes
2. Update workflow
(a) Create variable in the workflow that is of the same type as the SmartForm: e.g. Client (will automatically include ClientIndustries)
(b) Data may be fetched by retieving data in the same way as fetching data on the Client viewmodel
(c) If the data is a subset of an existing view model such as Client/Matter/Employee there also needs to be an expand clause to fetch the additional data
(d) Add SmartForm Task activity to workflow and bind the data on the SmartForm with the data you have created on the workflow via the 'Edit SmartForms' button on the activity
(e) If you consume custom activities in your workflow where the SmartForm will be consumed, you may also need to supply arguments to those workflow
(f) If data is an extension of an existing view model (e.g. Client/Matter/Employee), the data may be saved using the SaveClient, Save Matter or Save Employee activity
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Consume Progress Bar Control
Description:
BASE RUNTIME TEST 
Run the test workflow in the attached package and check that the inline Progress Bar behaves as expected at runtime.
Steps:
Step 1: Import the attached "ProgressBarBasic.zip" into a dev environment (this will add the SmartForms to config and placed the workflow source (contained in a zip) into the Output folder | Expected: The file is located in TFS QA folder.
e.g. $/ExpertSuite/Releases/801x/QA/Framework/UX Controls/BasicSFs || Step 2: Extract the workflow source "ProgressBarBasicWF" zip to a local directory || Step 3: Navigate to the extract location and delete the SharedBin folder (IMPORTANT!!!! Otherwise your workflow might not run) || Step 4: Open workflow solution in workflow designerVisual Studio || Step 5: Run workflow and follow instructions for tests as per tasks that appear | Expected: The Progress Bar behaves as expected according to labels/instructions in a BASIC SmartForm

Title: 02. Create grid SmartForm - Advanced
Description:
***************
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
************
 
1. Launch SF Wizard from Visual Studio
2. Press the Begin button and in step 1, select 'Create New SmartForm'. Press the Next button
3. In step 2
   (a) Check the 'Expert Owner' displays the firm name from: SELECT NAME FROM FWM_OWNER WHERE ISSYSTEM = 'Y'
   (b) SmartForm Name: Enter  'BasicGridForm' (check no spaces allowed in name)
   (c) SmartForm Category: Create a new category called 'SFSmokeTest' and select
   (d) SmartForm Description: Enter a simple description
   (e) SmartForm Type: Select 'Grid Form'
   (f) Scripting Required: Leave default as checked
   (g) Customization Package: Select package 'SFBaseTest' and select
   (h) Press the Next button
 
In step 3
   (a) Click on the Add/View Items button
   (c) In the Parameters window, in the Select Item search box search for and select:
              i. 'Client' 
              ii. Drill into Client, right-click on 'Parties', and select 'Set as Grid Source'
              iii. Drill into 'Parties', check the items below, then press the Done key
                                     - BusinesssEntity\DisplayName
                                     - BusinessEntity\Birthday
                                     - BusinessEntity\NoOfChildren
                                     - PartyStatusId
                                     - PartyTypeEnum
                                     - BusinessEntity\AvailableForMarketing
              iv. 
    (e) FORM tab, set:
               i. In the Buttons property, add buttons 'Add Remove Button' 
               ii. OnLoaded = self.LogWriter.Log(LogLevel.Error, 'OnLoaded script for Grid SmartForm')
               iii. OnValidate = self.LogWriter.Log(LogLevel.Error, 'OnValidate script for Grid SmartForm')
               iv Row Defaults =  
               v.Row Validate = 
               vi. Cell Validate =
    (f) Control tab     
               i. DisplayName - TextBoxGridColumn (default), IsRequired=True, change Title to 'Name'
               ii. NoOfChildren- NumericBocGridColumn (default), change Title to 'Kids', check the 'Show Total' property, set Minimum property to '0', Maximum to '30'
               iii. Birthday - DatePickerGridColumn (default)
               iv. PartyStatusId - SearchBoxGridColumn, select Data Provider = 'Party Status'
               v. PartyTypeId - SearchBoxGridColumn, select Data Provider = 'Party Type'
               vi. AvailableForMarketing - CheckBoxGridColumn, change Title to 'Avail EM'            
               x. Arrange the order of the Visible Items using the UP/DOWN arrows. Order should be:
                              DisplayName, Kids, Birthday, Status, Type, Avail EM
 Press the Save button
5. Press the 'Preview'button --> The preview pop up should look like the attachment to this test called: 'BasicGridSFPreview.png'
6. Press the Next button --> until you reach step 6 then press the Finish button
 
 
Confirm Creation
For each SmartForm defined, parameters should be saved in configuration under the path Technical.Presentation.SmartForms.<SmartFormName>, where <SmartFormName> is the SmartForm name with spaces removed. 
e.g. SFSmokeTest.BasicSmartForm
 
Consume in workflow activity
1. Add SF to workflow and kick off workflow instance
2. Open the workflow task. In DebugViewer there should be an ERROR log entry: 'OnLoaded script for Grid SmartForm'
3. Check the properties match what was set in step 4.
4. Enter/select values in all fields except 'Name' and press the 'Save & Close' button --> Receive validation error prompt for missing data --> 
              Watch DebugViewer as the task is saved. There should be TWO ERROR log entries: 
                                                                 'OnValidate script for Grid SmartForm'
5. Re-open the task --> All values that had been entered should still be there
6. Check the tab sequence. Default sequence should be down the first column and then wrap back up to the top of the second.
7. Add a row of data using the insertion row and another using the Add New
8. Press the 'Complete' button 
              Watch DebugViewer as the task is completed. There should be TWO ERROR log entries: 
                                                                 'OnValidate script for Grid SmartForm'
9. When the next task appears, ensure the data from the first task is still visible
Steps: Step 1: Pre SP2 - Create a new SF project in Visual Studio. Add in the smartform by the right-click option. Press the Begin button and in step 1, select 'Create New SmartForm'. Press the Next button In step 2 (a) Check the 'Expert Owner' displays the firm name from: SELECT NAME FROM FWM_OWNER WHERE ISSYSTEM = 'Y' (b) SmartForm Name: Enter 'BasicGridForm' (check no spaces allowed in name) (c) SmartForm Category: Create a new category called 'SFSmokeTest' and select (d) SmartForm Description: Enter a simple description (e) SmartForm Type: Select 'Grid Form' (f) Scripting Required: Leave default as checked (g) Customization Package: Select package 'SFBaseTest' and select (h) Press the Next button || Step 2: In step 3 (a) Click on the Add/View Items button (c) In the Parameters window, in the Select Item search box search for and select: i. 'Client'  ii. Drill into Client, right-click on 'Parties', and select 'Set as Grid Source' iii. Drill into 'Parties', check the items below, then press the Done key - BusinesssEntity\DisplayName - BusinessEntity\Birthday - BusinessEntity\NoOfChildren - PartyStatusId - PartyTypeEnum - BusinessEntity\AvailableForMarketing iv.  (e) FORM tab, set: i. In the Buttons property, add buttons 'Add Remove Button'  (f) Control tab  i. DisplayName - TextBoxGridColumn (default), IsRequired=True, change Title to 'Name' ii. NoOfChildren- NumericBocGridColumn (default), change Title to 'Kids', set Minimum property to '0', Maximum to '30' iii. Birthday - DatePickerGridColumn (default) iv. PartyStatusId - SearchBoxGridColumn, select Data Provider = 'Party Status' v. PartyTypeId - SearchBoxGridColumn, select Data Provider = 'Party Type' vi. AvailableForMarketing - CheckBoxGridColumn, change Title to 'Avail EM'  x. Arrange the order of the Visible Items using the UP/DOWN arrows. Order should be: DisplayName, Kids, Birthday, Status, Type, Avail EM Press the Save buttonRegenerate and publish SmartForm || Step 3: Consume in workflow activity Add SF to workflow and kick off workflow instance Open the workflow task. | Expected: In DebugViewer there should be an ERROR log entry: 'OnLoaded script for Grid SmartForm' || Step 4: Check the properties match what was set in step 4. || Step 5: Enter/select values in all fields except 'Name' and press the 'Save & Close' button --> Receive validation error prompt for missing data --> Watch EventViewer as the task is saved. | Expected: There should be TWO ERROR log entries: 'OnValidate script for Grid SmartForm' || Step 6: Re-open the task | Expected: All values that had been entered should still be there || Step 7: Check the tab sequence. | Expected: Default sequence should be down the first column and then wrap back up to the top of the second. || Step 8: Add a row of data using the insertion row and another using the Add New Press the 'Complete' button Watch EventViewer as the task is completed. | Expected: There should be TWO ERROR log entries: 'OnValidate script for Grid SmartForm' || Step 9: When the next task appears | Expected: Ensure the data from the first task is still visible

Title: Checkboxgrid column - uses converter
Description: When using a checkbox column in a SmartForm grid, a converter may be used to ensure the data is interpreted correctly. This is to cope with domain limitations early on where booleans were represented as chars of length 1. (You now have the option for booleans to exist as booleans in the domain so a converter is not always required.

Title: Consume edit, edit and copy, remove buttons
Steps:
Step 1: When creating a ADVANCED grid SmartForm, for the grid buttons, allow the edit, edit and copy and remove buttons to be displayed || Step 2: Check the buttons at runtime | Expected: Edit - opens pop up window to edit selected row
Edit and Copy - copies data from selected row into pop up window, pressing OK creates new item
Remove - removes selected row from grid

Title: Run grid SmartForm
Description:
Expected UI behaviours in SmartForm grids
 
Add data to grid cell
- For each of the grid cell control types - Textbox, search control and Date Picker test that you can add/or select a value to the cell, whether the cell is on the insertion row or an existing (posted/saved) row.
- For Search Control cells, you can use the up and down arrow keys, then hit 'enter' to select a value. If the cell is in 'display' mode you need to hit 'enter' first to change to 'edit' mode. Then hit 'enter' again to change back to 'display' mode.
 
Delete data from grid cell
- For each of the grid cell control types - Textbox, search control and Date Picker test that you can delete a value from the cell, whether the cell is on the insertion row or an existing (posted/saved) row.
- You can delete cell data by hitting 'enter' key to change to 'edit mode'. Then using the backspace key, or clicking on the cell's 'x' delete button.
- You can also delete the cell data by hitting the 'escape' key twice.
 
Edit grid cell value
For each of the grid cell control types - Textbox, search control and Date Picker, test that you can edit an existing cell value, whether the cell is on the insertion row or an existing (posted/saved) row.
 
Validation Errors
If the cell has a validation error, the Validation Error icon should be displayed to the right of the cell control (within the cell). 
Test that:
1. Validation Error! Message you get when you hover over the Validation Error icon is correct.
2. Validation icon disappears when you edit the cell to a valid value, and 'x' delete cell data re-appears.
3. Cells that are required fields should have the control border highlighted orange until valid data is entered/selected. If the user tries to click on the '+' add new row button there should be a dialog that alerts the user that a required item is either missing or invalid.
 
Change order of grid column
You can change the order of the grid columns by clicking on the grid column title cell and dragging to the required location (i.e. before or after another column).
 
Sort grid columns
You can sort grid columns by clicking on the grid column title cell.
 
Save Grid Data
Grid data is saved when you enter data then hit 'enter' key, or when you click '+' button at end of row.
SAVING CELL DATA - Test for cells which are different control types e.g. DatePicker, Search control, textbox.
When you hit the 'enter' key after entering/selecting data in a cell, this changes the cell mode from 'edit' to 'display' and saves the data from that cell. The cell data should still be displayed after you have hit 'enter'..
SAVING ROW DATA
The row of data is saved when you click on the '+' button at the end of the row. This button also adds a new row to the top of the grid. The row you saved is no longer the insertion row, and the row mode has changed from 'edit' to 'display' mode. 
VALIDATION ERRORS
If one of the cells in the row has a validation error, the cell data will still be saved when you lose focus on the cell.
 
Create new row of data in grid
-Check that can enter data into insertion row (which is always at the top) and has pencil icon to show row is in 'edit mode'.
-Test that you can't add a new (insertion) row if the current insertion row is blank. I.e. there shouldn't be a whole lot of blank rows in your grid.
-Check that you can't create a new (insertion) row if your previous rows contain validation errors. If so, then check that you can create a new (insertion) row if you have fixed the validation errors on the previous (insertion) row.
 
SAVING CELL DATA - Test for cells which are different control types e.g. DatePicker, Search control, textbox.
When you hit the 'enter' key after entering/selecting data in a cell, this changes the cell mode from 'edit' to 'display' and saves the data from that cell. The cell data should still be displayed after you have hit 'enter'..
 
SAVING ROW DATA
The row of data is saved when you click on the '+' button at the end of the row. This button also adds a new row to the top of the grid. The row you saved is no longer the insertion row, and the row mode has changed from 'edit' to 'display' mode. 
 
VALIDATION ERRORS
If one of the cells in the row has a validation error, the cell data will still be saved when you lose focus on the cell.
 
Delete grid row
Test that you can delete the row by clicking on any cell within that row and clicking on the 'x' remove button at the end of the row, or using the 'Remove' button (at the top right hand side).
 
Navigate across grid row
Test you can use the tab and shift+tab keys to move back and forth across a grid row.
 
Navigate between grid rows
- Test that you can navigate between grid rows using the up and down keyboard arrows, and by clicking on different rows using the mouse.
- Use ESCAPE key to take focus from indiviudal cell to navigate between rows
 
Select grid row
- To select a row click on any cell within that row.
- To select more than one row - use shift + click on the rows, and either use the up/down arrows or the mouse to select the rows.

Title: Set grid column width
Steps:
Step 1: Create advanced SmartForm grid. In step 3 of the SmartForm WIzard, set column widths as follows- First column has width set to a fixed number of pixels- Second column has width set to 2*- Third column has width set to 3* | Expected: At runtime, assumin x columns in grid:
- First column has width as explicit length set in SmartForm Wizard
- Second column has width = 2/(x-1) of remaining width
- Third column has width = 3/(x-1) of remaining width
- Remaining columns = equally proportioned for remaining width (i.e. 1/(x-1) each)

Title: Smartform Wizard - Create SmartForm Set
Description:
Create SmartForm Set
 
In the Smart Form Wizard, 
 
Step 1: Select 'Create New Smart Form'
Step 2: Enter values for the base Smart Form properties
Step 3:  (a) Select the 'FormSet' radio button rather than the 'SingleForm' radio button and enter values for other properties as required

             (c) Do NOT add a summary

Create a SF set for a SF containing a grid

(a) For each FormSet defined, parameters should be saved in configuration under the path Technical.Presentation.SmartForms.<SmartFormSection><SmartFormName>
(b) In addition to the above, the child SmartForms that make up the FormSet should be saved in the configuration path
           Technical.Presentation.SmartForms.<SmartFormSection><SmartFormName>.SmartForms

Title: Run current version of SmartForm
Steps: Step 1: Launch Expert Time SmartForm Project (via VS) and edit a SmartForm: (make any change that will be visible in UI - e.g. remove field, change labels etc) || Step 2: Clear cache then run Expert Time | Expected: The time project now shows the modified version of the smartform.

Title: View script for IronPython property on form
Description:
SF Wizard: If a scripting property actually contains a script (IronPython OR XAML), the property pane in step 3 of the Wizard should show the first line of the script.
 
(Previously, the property pane view always displayed '(Edit) ' regardless of whether or not a script had actually been added).
 
Test:
View the IronPython script property in the property pane for a FORM, for each of the following situations:
(a) No script --> the property pane value field will appear blank
(b) Script exists --> property pane displays first line of script
(c) Add script - one line  --> property pane displays first line of script
(d) Add script - more than one line --> property pane displays first line of script with a '...' at the end of it
 
--> Test both default and advanced properties on different controls
 
Note: 
Check how it looks if the first line of the script is longer than the size of the text field...

Title: View script for XAML property on form
Description:
SF Wizard: If a scripting property actually contains a script (IronPython OR XAML), the property pane in step 3 of the Wizard should show the first line of the script.
 
(Previously, the property pane view always displayed '(Edit) ' regardless of whether or not a script had actually been added).
 
Test:
Applies to the 'Additional Namespaces' and 'Resources' (non-grid SFs only) properties in the Advanced section for the FORM
Viewing the XAML script property in the property pane for a FORM, for each of the following situations:
(a) No script --> the property pane value field will appear blank
(b)  Script exists --> property pane displays first line of script
(c) Add script - one line  --> property pane displays first line of script
(d)  Add script - more than one line --> property pane displays first line of script with a '...' at the end of it
 
--> Test both default and advanced properties on different controls
 
 
****EXCEPTION****:
The above does NOT apply to the Advanced Xaml Override property in the BUttonBar section for a grid SmartForm. In this case, there will ALWAYS be content if the client has added content to the button bar. In this case, the property will show any generated Xaml, it does not necessarily represent script that the client has MANUALLY added/overridden.
 
Note: 
Check how it looks if the first line of the script is longer than the size of the text field...

Title: VisualStudio -  Auto-add Reference Path
Description: The Reference Path to your ExpertShare location should be added automatically when the project is built. You should not have to manually add it to the SmartForm library project properties.

Title: VisualStudio -  Launch SFW from VS designer - non-modal
Description:
When the SmartForm Wizard is launched from VS for a file-based SmartForm (VS project), it is not modal. 
To make it modal would be really difficult to do, so instead the editable fields on the design siurface in VS SF designer are disabled whilst the wizard is open
 
- will monitor this behaviour given the change to the Edit button and guage whether the SFW not being modal is an issue for other docs etc in the solution

Title: VisualStudio -  SmartForms can only be added to SmartForm Library
Description:
For Smartform project, right-click menu has two options to add a SmartForm
(a) Add > SmartForm
(b) Add > New Item > Window pop up > Expert sub list > SmartForm
 
For NON Smartform projects (e.g. workflow), right-click menu has diff behaviour
(a) Add > SmartForm --> NOT AVAILABLE
(b) Add > New Item > Window pop up > Expert sub list > SmartForm --> If selected, an error message is displayed to inform cannot add

Title: VisualStudio -  Title and Description Availability
Description:
When creating file-based SmartForms, the Title and Description will only be editable in the VS editor for the SmartFOrm, and NOT in the SmartForm Wizard.
When creating config-based SmartForms, the Title and Description will be editable in the SmartFOrmWizard as it always has been.

Title: Advanced SF instances
Steps: Step 1: Below the Instances list, click on the + | Expected: SF Wizard is opened at step 2The SmartForm Instance control is empty and REQUIREDThe User and Groups control is empty and REQUIRED || Step 2: Enter a name, and select a user group that you belong to (e.g. QA Security) || Step 3: Make a minor change to the SF so you recognise it as the one belonging to QA Security, then save, regenerate and publish SF || Step 4: Add SmartForm to workflow then run || Step 5: Launch Expert Assistant as yourself | Expected: Task shows SmartForm for QA Security || Step 6: Ensure TTQA1 does not exist in the QA Security user group || Step 7: Launch Expert Assistant as any other user e.g. TTQA1 | Expected: Task shows default SmartForm || Step 8: Cloes EA for TTQA1, add TTQA1 to QA Security and re-open EA and task for TTQA1 | Expected: Task shows SmartForm for QA Security || Step 9: Return to edit the advanced SF, and add an instance specifically for yourself || Step 10: Run the workflow again and open task for yourself | Expected: Task shows user-specific instance of SF created || Step 11: Add user to multiple instances | Expected: Hierarchy of config wins - User instance followed by User Group instance followed by Default instance || Step 12: Create multiple user or group SF instance || Step 13: Publish SFs to local: Right click on the Smartform project and select 'Publish Smartforms to Local'. | Expected: Creates a config item: Technical>presentation>SmartForms>xxx>yyy>ControllerFactoryType - Firm scope for Default instance - User scope for user-specific instance (one for EACH user) - Group scope for group-specific instance (one for EACH group) xxx=SF category yyy=SF name Config value = namespace, assembly name (from project properties in vS where assembly defaults from project name, and namespace defaults from Aderant.Smartforms ) package = package assigned to SF project. || Step 14: In a smartform project, open an existing smartform. | Expected: Below the "Instances" column, there is a "+" button to add an instance and a "-" button to remove the selected instance. || Step 15: Verify that the default instance cannot be removed. | Expected: Default instance cannot be deleted. '-' button below the Instances list is disabled when the Default Instance is selected || Step 16: Verify that when an existing instance is removed, the corresponding xxx.cs/xxxmxaml files are also removed from the smartform project.

Creating Advanced SF and its Pre-requisites
Description:
To ensure you have appropriate security rights to customize and consume SmartForms, you need to:
 
(a) Add yourself to the Administrators user group (can launch SmartForm Wizard)
(b) Add yourself to the Advanced Workflow Licence policy (can consume FIRM's own SmartForms)
Steps:
Step 1: To ensure you have appropriate security rights to customize and consume SmartForms, you need to:

(a) Add yourself to the Administrators user group (can launch SmartForm Wizard)
(b) Add yourself to the Advanced Workflow Licence policy (can consume FIRM's own SmartForms) || Step 2: Create a new Advanced SF:1. In VS, create new SmartForm Library (File>New>Project>Expert>ExpertSmartFormLibrary) - give it a name of BaseSmokeTest.2. Add a SmartForm to the library (Right-click on project in Solution Explorer, select Add>New Item>Expert>Expert SmartForm - give it a name of 'baseSmartForm'3. - Set Category to 'SmokeTest'    - Set Title to 'Simple Controls' | Expected: SmartForm editor should open.

Title: 01a. Create new SmartForm  - Visual Studio
Description:
Estimated Duration: 2 minutes
 
In Visual Studio, 
1. Create new SmartForm Library (File>New>Project>Expert>ExpertSmartFormLibary) - give it a name of BaseSmokeTest
                 - Set Category and Package?
2. Add a SmartForm to the library (Right-click on project in Solution Explorer, select Add>New Item>Expert>Expert SmartForm - give it a name of 'BaseSmartForm.smartForm
3.  SmartForm editor should open
                  - Set Category to 'SmokeTest'
                  - Set Title to 'Simple Controls'

Title: 01b. Create new SmartForm - SFW
Description:
Estimated Duration: 15 minutes
 
Continued from previous test:  '01a. Create new SmartForm - Steps 1 & 2'
Once the SF designer is visible in the document well, 
1. Select the Default Instance 
2. Press the Edit button --> Launches SFWizard - step 2
                 - Name, Category should be disabled - should come from the SmartForm header
                 - Package should be disabled - should come from the SmartForm library
                 - Scripting Required checkbox - should not be visible
                 - User or Group - default to empty
                 - Check the 'Expert Owner' displays the firm name from: SELECT NAME FROM FWM_OWNER WHERE ISSYSTEM = 'Y'
                 - SmartForm Description: Enter a simple description/from VS editor
3. SmartForm Type: Leave default of 'Single Form'
4. Check the individual help links work
5. Press the Next button
6. In step 3 of the SFW
   (a) Leave Display Columns default as 'Two'
   (b) Click on the Add/View Items button
   (c) In the Parameters window, in the Select Item search box search for and select:
              i. 'Client' 
              ii. 'String' with details: name =  'Name', description = 'Your name', IsReadOnly/IsNullable - leave default as unchecked
              iii. 'Boolean' with details: name = 'AcceptTandC', description = 'Accept terms and conditions', IsReadOnly/IsNullable - leave default as unchecked
              iv. 'Datetime' with details: name = 'StartDate', description = 'Commencement Date', IsReadOnly/IsNullable - leave default as unchecked
              v. 'Int32' with details: name =  'Quantity', description = 'Number of children', IsReadOnly/IsNullable - leave default as unchecked
              vi. 'Decimal' with details: name =  'Balance', description = 'Bank balance', IsReadOnly/IsNullable - leave default as unchecked
              vii. 'String' with details: name =  'MoreInfo', description = 'More information about yourself', IsReadOnly/IsNullable - leave default as unchecked
    (d) Back in the Parameters window, check 'Client', expand Client and check, 'DisplayName', 'DepartmentId', 'OfficeId'
    (f) Control tab     
               i. Name - TextBox (default), enter Prompt =  "What is your name?" (freeform text), IsRequired=True
               ii. AcceptTandC - Checkbox (default), change Label to "Accept T and C", enter Tooltip "Check this box if you accept the Terms and Conditions" (freeform text)
               iii. StartDate - DatePicker (default)
               iv.Quantity - TextBox, Tooltip="How many children do you have?" (freeform text), Characters Allowed=PositiveInteger
               v. Balance - NumericBox, enter Decimal Places=2, LeadingText=$
               vi. MoreInfo - AdvancedTextBox, ColumnSpan = True, Minimum Lines=3, Maximum Lines = 5, SpellChecking=True, ExpansionCodes=True
               vii. Client - SearchBox, Data Provider=Client, BindTo=SelectedItem
               viii. ClientOfficeId - SearchBox, Label=Office, DataProvider=Office, BindTo=SelectedItemId
               viii. Client.DepartmentId - DisplayText, Label=Department, DataProvider='Department, DisplayFormat = 'Standard'
               ix. Client.DisplayName - TextBox, IsReadOnly='True'
               x. Arrange the order of the Visible Items using the UP/DOWN arrows. Order should be:
                              Name, AcceptT&C,StartDate,Quantity, Balance, MoreInfo, Client, Client.OfficeId, Client.DisplayName, Client.DepartmentId
               xi. Add a Divder: Click on the DOWN arrow on the Add/View Items button and select Divider. Once you see a Divider item in the list, move it so it is after 'MoreInfo'and before 'Client'
2. Press the Save button
3. Press the 'Preview'button --> The preview pop up should look like the attachment to this test called: 'BasicSFPreview.png'
4. Press the Next button --> Step 4, make no changes
5. Press the Next button --> Step 6, summaised SF info
6. Press the Finish button --> Prompted to continue (Yes/Continue/No)
 
7. Back on the Designer, save the SmartForm
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: Continued from previous test: '01a. Create new SmartForm - Steps 1 & 2' || Step 2: Select the Default Instance || Step 3: Press the Edit button --> Launches SFWizard - step 2 - Name, Category should be disabled - should come from the SmartForm header - Package should be disabled - should come from the SmartForm library - Scripting Required checkbox - should not be visible - User or Group - default to empty - Check the 'Expert Owner' displays the firm name from: SELECT NAME FROM FWM_OWNER WHERE ISSYSTEM = 'Y' - SmartForm Description: Enter a simple description/from VS editor || Step 4: SmartForm Type: Leave default of 'Single Form' || Step 5: Check the individual help links work || Step 6: Pre SP2 - In step 3 of the SFW || Step 7: Leave Display Columns default as 'Two' || Step 8: In the Parameters window, in the Select Item search box search for and select: i. 'Client' ii. 'String' with details: name = 'Name', description = 'Your name', IsReadOnly/IsNullable - leave default as unchecked iii. 'Boolean' with details: name = 'AcceptTandC', description = 'Accept terms and conditions', IsReadOnly/IsNullable - leave default as unchecked iv. 'Datetime' with details: name = 'StartDate', description = 'Commencement Date', IsReadOnly/IsNullable - leave default as unchecked v. 'Int32' with details: name = 'Quantity', description = 'Number of children', IsReadOnly/IsNullable - leave default as unchecked vi. 'Decimal' with details: name = 'Balance', description = 'Bank balance', IsReadOnly/IsNullable - leave default as unchecked vii. 'String' with details: name = 'MoreInfo', description = 'More information about yourself', IsReadOnly/IsNullable - leave default as unchecked || Step 9: Back in the Parameters window, check 'Client', expand Client and check, 'DisplayName', 'DepartmentId', 'OfficeId' || Step 10: Control tab i. Name - TextBox (default), enter Prompt = "What is your name?" (freeform text), IsRequired=True ii. AcceptTandC - Checkbox (default), change Label to "Accept T and C", enter Tooltip "Check this box if you accept the Terms and Conditions" (freeform text) iii. StartDate - DatePicker (default) iv.Quantity - TextBox, Tooltip="How many children do you have?" (freeform text), Characters Allowed=PositiveInteger v. Balance - NumericBox, enter Decimal Places=2, LeadingText=$ vi. MoreInfo - AdvancedTextBox, ColumnSpan = True, Minimum Lines=3, Maximum Lines = 5, SpellChecking=True, ExpansionCodes=True vii. Client - SearchBox, Data Provider=Client, BindTo=SelectedItem viii. ClientOfficeId - SearchBox, Label=Office, DataProvider=Office, BindTo=SelectedItemId viii. Client.DepartmentId - DisplayText, Label=Department, DataProvider='Department, DisplayFormat = 'Standard' ix. Client.DisplayName - TextBox, IsReadOnly='True' x. Arrange the order of the Visible Items using the UP/DOWN arrows. Order should be: Name, AcceptT,StartDate,Quantity, Balance, MoreInfo, Client, Client.OfficeId, Client.DisplayName, Client.DepartmentId xi. Add a Divder: Click on the DOWN arrow on the Add/View Items button and select Divider. Once you see a Divider item in the list, move it so it is after 'MoreInfo'and before 'Client' || Step 11: Press Next until you finish the SmartForm WIzard || Step 12: On the SF design surface, right=click on the tab and select Save xxx where xxx is your SmartForm name

Title: 01c. Add custom controller logic - Step 4
Steps: Step 1: Pre SP2 - In Visual Studio, create a new custom controller (if you make changes to the generated controller, these will be overwritten and lost when the controller is re-generated each time the SF is saved) || Step 2: In Solution Explorer, right-click on the .smartform file and select "Add custom smartform logic" || Step 3: Open the generated controller file AND the custom controller file || Step 4: In the GENERATED controller file, copy the namespace at the top of the file, then in the CUSTOM controller, replace the existing namespace with the one copied from the generated file || Step 5: In the GENERATED controller file, copy the public partial class name from the top of the script to the custom controller e.g. Generated controller had public partial class BaseSmartFormController : BaseSmartFormControllerBase { private static readonly ILogWriter logWriter = Logger.Current.GetLogWriter(); Into the Custom controller, enter: public partial class BaseSmartFormController || Step 6: In the custom controller file, add the following lines to the "using" section:using Aderant.Framework;using Aderant.Framework.Logging; || Step 7: Where indicated, insert the following text into the custom controller defaul text: || Step 8: In the custom controller, create partial class methods to overwrite the base logic in the generated controller. Form level: OnLoaded = self.LogWriter.Log(LogLevel.Error, "OnLoaded script for Advanced SmartForm"); OnValidate = self.LogWriter.Log(LogLevel.Error, "OnValidate script for Advanced SmartForm");OnDataChanged=self.LogWriter.Log(LogLevel.Error, "OnDataChanged script for Advanced SmartForm");Control level: OnChange=self.LogWriter.Log(LogLevel.Error, "Client has changed"); | Expected: The override methods section of the custom controller should look like this: public override void OnLoaded() { base.OnLoaded(); // Insert your custom initialization logic here that must run before the controller has subscribed to all the change event handlers. logWriter.Log(LogLevel.Error, "OnLoaded script for Advanced SmartForm"); } /// <summary> /// Called when the controller has initialized. /// </summary> protected override void OnInitialized() { base.OnInitialized(); // Insert your custom initialization logic here that must run after the controller has subscribed to all the change event handlers. logWriter.Log(LogLevel.Error, "OnInitialized script for Advanced SmartForm"); } /// <summary> /// Validates the controller and it's data. /// </summary> public override void Validate() { base.Validate(); // Insert your custom validation logic here logWriter.Log(LogLevel.Error, "OnValidate script for Advanced SmartForm"); } protected override void OnDataChanged(string dataName) { base.OnDataChanged(dataName); // Added log for Base SmokeTest. Previously entered in OnDataChanged scripting point in SFW for IronPython controller  logWriter.Log(LogLevel.Error, "OnDataChanged script for Advanced SmartForm"); } protected override void OnClientChanged() { base.OnClientChanged(); // Added log for Base SmokeTest. Previously entered in OnDataChanged scripting point in SFW for IronPython controller  logWriter.Log(LogLevel.Error, "Client has changed on Advanced SmartForm"); } || Step 9: Save the custom controller using the right-click option on the tab for the custom file | Expected: File is saved without errors

Title: 01d. Regenerate and Publish SFs in Project
Description:
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: 01e. Consume SmartForm in workflow
Description:
Estimated Duration: 10 minutes
 
1. In Visual Studio, create a new workflow, give it a name of "SmartFormTest", type of 'Flowchart', category 'SFSmokeTest', Package 'SFBaseTest'
2. Add the following variables:
    (a) Client (type: Client), set default to: New Client()
    (b) Name (String)
    (c) AcceptTandC (Boolean)
    (d) StartDate (DateTime), set default to: DateAndTime.Now
    (e) Quantity (Int32)
    (f) Balance (Decimal)
    (g) MoreInfo (String)
3. Drag a SmartForm Task activity onto the design surface, and select the SF created:SFSmokeTest.BasicSmartForm 
    (a) All the variables should be mapped, and check that 'Show Title'is checked
    (b) Set the TaskName to "Single SmartForm Test"
    (c) Set the workflow initiator as the task performer
4. Copy the SmartForm task activity and paste below the first one
5. Change the TaskName to "Single SmartForm - Check data
6. Connect the lines so that the two tasks run sequentially
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: 01f. Run SmartForm in Workflow
Description:
1. Open DebugViewer
2. In Visual Studio, run the workflow you have created 
3. Watch DebugViewer as you open the first task. There should be an ERROR log entry: 'OnLoaded script for Basic SmartForm'
4. Once the task has loaded, it should look like the attachment:
5. Check the following:
              a. Name control is required, required count on form = "1"
              b. Name control has prompt when there is no value, and it is not in focus: "What is your name?"
              c. A hover hint appears when you hover over "Accept T and C" and "Quantity"
              d. Start Date - Date Picker control allows manual entry and use of picker, default date = today's date
              d. Quantity - only allow positive integer values (should get validation icon etc when outside this range)
              e. Balance - only allows 2 decimal places, and a "$"character is prefixed to any value entered after exiting the field
              f. More info - Spans BOTH columns
              g. More info - Expands up to 5 rows if more than 3 rows of data is entered (afterwhich a scroll bar appears)
              h. More info - SpellCheck and Expansion codes are enabled. Test by F7 (SpellCheck) and "="for expansion codes
              i. Divider - separates Client, Office, Display Name, and Department from the other fields above
              j. Selecting a Client, populates the Office, DisplayName, and Department
              k. Department data is displayed in format PrimaryText (Code)
              l. DisplayName - is a read only TextBox control (can highlight and copy text)
              m. Department - is a DisplayText control (cannot highlight and copy text)
6. Each time you change the value of one of the ROOT elements on the SmartForm, there should be an ERROR log entry in DebugViewer
                                                                  'OnDataChanged script for Basic SmartForm'
6. Enter/select values in all fields except 'Name' and press the 'Save & Close' button --> Receive validation error prompt for missing data --> 
              Watch DebugViewer as the task is saved. There should be ONE ERROR log entry: 
                                                                 'OnValidate script for Basic SmartForm'
7. Re-open the task --> All values that had been entered should still be there
8. Check the tab sequence. Default sequence should be down the first column and then wrap back up to the top of the second.
8. Press the 'Complete' button 
              Watch DebugViewer as the task is completed. There should be ONE ERROR log entry: 
                                                                 'OnValidate script for Basic SmartForm'
9. When the next task appears, ensure the data from the first task is still visible
 
CHECK FORM PROPERTIES (when task is saved/completed)
- OnValidate
- OnDataChanged
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: 02. Edit existing SmartForm
Description:
When editing existing SFs, there should be no errors when they are re-generated.
 
1. Make changes (via Visual Studio)
- Use the Edit button in the designer, then save the xxx.SmartForm (to regenerate Controller and ControllerFactory)
- Create/update the custom controller (not the generated one)
 
2. Redeploy SFs to ExpertShare to test: Close Expert Assistant so that there are no file locks, 'Publish SmartForms to Local'
 
Edit some existing default SmartForms and 
For each of the SFs listed, select to edit the SF in the SF Wizard . Continue to press 'Next' through the SF WIzard until you get to the Finish button and then press this and ensure that no errors occur when re-generated
             - FileOpening.ClientDetails
             - FileOpening.ClientParties
             - FileOpening.MatterParticipatingEmployees
             - Billing.TImeCard
             - FileOpening.NameReconciliationDataGrid
             - FileOpening.NameReconciliationMasterGrid
             - FileOpening.ClientSet
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: 04. Create SmartForm Summary
Description:
Create SmartForm Set
 
In the Smart Form Wizard, 
 
Step 1: Select 'Create New Smart Form'
Step 2: Enter values for the base Smart Form properties
Step 3:  (a) Select the 'FormSet' radio button rather than the 'SingleForm' radio button and enter values for other properties as required
             (b) Add more than one SF
             (c) Add a summary - select a small subset of the data that is displayed on the SFs contained in the set
             (d) Save the SF
 
 
Confirm Creation of SmartForm Set
(a) For each FormSet defined, parameters should be saved in configuration under the path Technical.Presentation.SmartForms.<SmartFormSection><SmartFormName>
(b) In addition to the above, the child SmartForms that make up the FormSet should be saved in the configuration path
           Technical.Presentation.SmartForms.<SmartFormSection><SmartFormName>.SmartForms
 
Consume in WF
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: AddressBook - Create & Consume
Description:
This control is out-dated and has been replaced by the more generic inline address book control. 
If you attempt to select the AddressBook in the SFW (step 3), you will be notified of this.
However, if you have existing SmartForms that use this original control, these should still work at runtime, and the SF should still be able to be re-generated.
 
Test that a new smart form can be created that uses a Address Book Control, primarily using default values. Ensure that the wizard generates the smart form correctly, and the smart form can be used in a Task/Workflow
 
Purpose:
The purpose of this case is to ensure the NEW smart forms can be generated and consumed only. More specific details of the control will be tested in another Test Case "Address Book Control" i.e. all the available properties and options.
 
Test:
1. Select a Address From a DTO, and choose a control of "Address Book"
5. Ensure the common values of the control are completed. Label, validation script, required field.
6. Select some other control types to and out the form & Generate
7. Use a Workflow & Task to consume the form, ensure that the UI is correct, and the user can complete tasks without error.
 
 
 
<Jon>
In Visual Studio:
1. Create a variable (i.e. MySelectedAddress) where variable-type = Aderant.Query.ViewModels.PhysicalAddress
a. Make sure this variable is initialized as such: New PhysicalAddress()
2. Create another variable (i.e. (MyAddressBook) where variable-type is a collection = ViewModelObservableCollection<PhysicalAddress>
a. Make sure this variable is initialized as such: New ViewModelObservableCollection(Of PhysicalAddress)
3. Drag a Smartform Task activity
4. In the Configure Smartform dialog, create a New Smartform
5. In Step 3 of the Smartform Wizard, click 'Add/View item' then select items from the Workflow Scope.
a. Select both MySelectedAddress and MyAddressBook 
b. Un-tick MyAddressBook as this does not have to be displayed
6. Select the control-type = AddressBook for MySelectedAddress with the following properties edited as:
a. ItemSource = Data.MyAddressBook
b. SelectedAddressBinding = Data.MySelectedAddress
7. Ensure labels, prompts, tooltips (and other text properties) are displayed in English as entered in the property. i.e. you do not see the internationalisation key
Steps: Step 1: Create a Advanced Smartform. In Step 3 of the Smartform Wizard, click 'Add/View item' then add Client item of type Client then tick items: a. Clientb. Client.BusinessEntity.DefaultAddressId || Step 2: Select the control-type = AddressBook for DefaultAddressId | Expected: Message displayed that AddressBook is obsolete and that the InlineAddressBook should be used instead. || Step 3: Select OK to close the message box || Step 4: Select the control-type =InlineAddressBook for DefaultAddressId with the following properties edited as: a. ItemSource = Client.BusinessEntity.Addresses b. SelectedAddressIdBinding = Client.BusinessEntity.DefaultAddressId || Step 5: For data item Client, select a Search control, then select data provider=Client, BindTo=SelectedItemId.Position Client before DefaultAddressId || Step 6: Save, generate and publish SmartForms || Step 7: In Visual Studio create a new Workflow: Create a variable Client(of type Client) || Step 8: Drag a Smartform Task activity, select the Advanced Smartform and combine the variables with the items. Set the task performer to the workflow intitator || Step 9: Run the workflow and open the task | Expected: * Before selecting a Client, the address control is disabled* After selecting a Client, the address control is enabled* Default address for the client (if there is one) is pre-selected (can be verified in Expert Classic)* When you click on the drop down for the address control, lists all addresses for the Client (can be verified in Expert Classic)* When you select an address, the address is retained when you save the task and re-open it
