Title: CheckBox - Create & Consume - Advanced Smartforms
Description:
Test that a new smart form can be created that uses a check box Control, primarily using default values. Ensure that the wizard generates the smart form correctly, and the smart form can be used in a Task/Workflow
 
Purpose:
The purpose of this case is to ensure the NEW smart forms can be generated and consumed only. More specific details of the control will be tested in another Test Case "Consume Check Box Control" i.e. all the available properties and options.
 
Test:
1. Select a Context data string value in the smart form wizard, and choose a control of "Check Box"
2. Ensure the common values of the control are completed. Label, validation script, required field.
3. Select some other control types to and out the form & Generate
4. Use a Workflow & Task to consume the form, ensure that the UI is correct, and the user can complete tasks without error.
5. Ensure labels, prompts, tooltips (and other text properties) are displayed in English as entered in the property. i.e. you do not see the internationalisation key
Steps: Step 1: Select a Context data string value in the smart form wizard, and choose a control of "Check Box" || Step 2: Ensure the common values of the control are completed. Label, validation script, required field. || Step 3: Select some other control types to and out the form & Generate || Step 4: Use a Workflow & Task to consume the form, | Expected: Ensure that the UI is correct, and the user can complete tasks without error. || Step 5: Ensure labels, prompts, tooltips (and other text properties) are displayed in English as entered in the property. i.e. you do not see the internationalisation key

Title: DisplayText - Create & Consume Unbound
Description: Test the creation of a SmartForm using an unbound version of the DisplayText control.
Steps: Step 1: Create new ADVANCED SF with TWO columns || Step 2: Add unbound DisplayText item from the dropdown of the Add/View items button, (a) Set the XXX property to: | Expected: At runtime, (a) The text for the control takes up the entire width of the column it is in (b) The text displayed is.... (c) Mouse can be used to highlight and copy text displayed || Step 3: Add unbound DisplayText item from the dropdown of the Add/View items button, Span both columns | Expected: At runtime, The text should span BOTH of the columns in the SF || Step 4: Add unbound DisplayText item from the dropdown of the Add/View items button, Set maximum rows to 5 | Expected: At runtime, (a) the space that the DisplayText consumes is only 5 rows. (b) The text that extends beyond 5 rows is accessible via a scroll bar || Step 5: Add unbound DisplayText item from the dropdown of the Add/View items button, Set minimum rows Add a button to the SF - after the DisplayText | Expected: At runtime, (a) the DisplayText control consumes 3 rows, even though the text is not long enough to take up 3 rows You can see this because button is not displayed in the row immediately after the end of the text || Step 6: Add unbound DisplayText item from the dropdown of the Add/View items button, In the text, include new lines, paragraphes, basic formatting | Expected: At runtime, (a) the DisplayText control displays the text in the same format as was entered in the SFWizard || Step 7: Add unbound DisplayText item from the dropdown of the Add/View items button, Unusual characters | Expected: At runtime, The entire text is displayed without any issues || Step 8: Add unbound DisplayText item from the dropdown of the Add/View items button, Large quantity of text (e.g. 50 rows), minimum rows and maximum rows not set | Expected: At runtime, the DisplayText control takes up as much space as it needs to host the entire text without ANY scrollbars.

Title: RadioButtonGroup - Usecase - Support INTs
Description:
This test needs to cater for scenario in bug 67846
 
Radio button has option of 'Id' to both 'Selected Value' and 'Display Value' property. You can now bind an int to the RadioButtonGroup if you select a dataprovider that has an int Id and/or Code, and select'Id'(int) 'CodeText' as the Value'.
 
If SelectedValue = Int, when you add the SF to a workflow task, the selected value should be retained when you save & close task and then reopen. TO see behaviour you can import the package attached, and start workflow from Actions menu in EA (Test radio button with int)
 
 
A data provider that has an Int for a primary key: Fee Rate Level
Steps: Step 1: Select a Context data int value in the smartform wizard and choose a control of "radio group" | Expected: If SelectedValue = Int, when you add the SF to a workflow task, the selected value should be retained when you save & close task and then reopen. || Step 2: Link the radio group to an 'Adhoc list - Create New', and edit the list items to add some int values like 1,2,3,4,5. || Step 3: Ensure the common values of the control are complete. Label, validation script, required field. || Step 4: Add some other context data and set other controls for them. || Step 5: Regenerate and publish the SFs. || Step 6: Use a workflow to consume the form, ensure that the UI is correct, and the user can complete tasks without error. || Step 7: Ensure labels, prompts, tooltips (and other text properties) are displayed in English as entered in the property, i.e. you do not see the internationalisation key

Title: TextBox - Create & Consume
Description:
Estimated Duration: 10 minutes
 
BASE DESIGN TIME TEST
 
Test that a new smart form can be created that uses a Text Box Control, primarily using default values. Ensure that the wizard generates the smart form correctly, and the smart form can be used in a Task/Workflow
 
Purpose:
The purpose of this case is to ensure the NEW smart forms can be generated and consumed only. More specific details of the control will be tested in another Test Case "Consume Text Box Control" i.e. all the available properties and options.
 
Test:
1. Select a Context data string value in the smart form wizard, and choose a control of "Text Box"
2. Change some properties, like min and max lines, Clear button off.
3. Ensure the common values of the control are completed. e.g. Label, 
4. Set 'Is Required' to True
5. Add an 'On Validate' script: self.LogWriter.Log(LogLevel.Error, 'THE TEXT BOX CONTROL WORKS')
6. Use a Workflow & Task to consume the form, 
(a) Ensure that the UI is correct, 
Note: The On Validate script should fire when you lose focus from the field and display an Error log entry in DebugVIew
(b) The data is saved if you save and re-open the task 
(c) The user can complete the task without error.
7. Ensure labels, prompts, tooltips (and other text properties) are displayed in English as entered in the property. i.e. you do not see the internationalisation key
Steps: Step 1: Test that a new advanced smartform (using VS) can be created that uses a Text Box Control, primarily using default values. Ensure that the wizard generates the smart form correctly, and the smart form can be used in a Task/Workflow Purpose: The purpose of this case is to ensure the NEW smart forms can be generated and consumed only. More specific details of the control will be tested in another Test Case "Consume Text Box Control" i.e. all the available properties and options. || Step 2: Select a Context data string value in the smart form wizard, and choose a control of "Text Box" || Step 3: Change some properties, like min and max lines, Clear button off. || Step 4: Ensure the common values of the control are completed. e.g. Label, || Step 5: Set 'Is Required' to True || Step 6: Use a Workflow & Task to consume the form, | Expected: (a) Ensure that the UI is correct. Note: The On Validate script should fire when you lose focus from the field and display an Error log entry in DebugVIew (b) The data is saved if you save and re-open the task (c) The user can complete the task without error. (d) Ensure labels, prompts, tooltips (and other text properties) are displayed in English as entered in the property. i.e. you do not see the internationalisation key

Title: WebBrowser - Create & Consume
Description:
In order to consume the Web Browser control, you must assign a URL to the item.
 
You can either do this through the String assignment within the workflow, or use scripting (example below, placed at the Form Scripting: On Loaded section):

self.Data.testWebBrowser="http://www.google.co.nz"
 
The Data type of Web Browsers are of String type... and have the following fields:
 
Height
MinHeight
 
Name
IsVisible
Steps: Step 1: Create an Advanced Smartform control and add context data item of type 'String' and give the name as 'WebBrowser'. Assign it to the Web Browser control. || Step 2: In order to consume the Web Browser control, you must assign a URL to the item. || Step 3: You can either do this through the String assignment within the workflow, or use scripting (example below, placed at the Form Scripting: On Loaded section): self.Data.WebBrowser="http://www.google.co.nz" (Note - '.WebBrowser' in the above line assumes that you've named your string control type in the SF as WebBrowser) || Step 4: The Data type of Web Browsers are of String type... and have the following fields: Height MinHeight Name IsVisible

Title: ItemsSelector - Bind to data that does not exist in the view model
Description:
To complete and end-to-end customisation scenario using this control in a workflow:
 
Data not in view model:
1. In step 3 of SFW, add control to SmartForm, using a data type of ViewModelObservableCollection <T> (define <T> as type such as Employee).
2. Update workflow
(a) Create variable in the workflow that is of the same type (e.g. ViewModelObservableCollection <Employee>) as the SmartForm and instanciate it. e.g. New ViewModelObservableCollection (Of Employee)
(b) If required: Add Dynamic Script activity to workflow that fetches the data from the database
(c) Add SmartForm Task activity to workflow and bind the data on the SmartForm with the data you have created on the workflow via the 'Edit SmartForms' button on the activity
(d) If you consume custom activities in your workflow where the SmartForm will be consumed, you may also need to supply arguments to those workflow
(e) If required: Add Dynamic Script activity to workflow that saves the data to the database
Steps: Step 1: Data not in view model:Create an advanced SF using VS. In step 3 of SFW, add control to SmartForm, using a data type of ViewModelObservableCollection <T> (define <T> as type such as Employee). || Step 2: Update workflow using VS.2. Update workflow(a) Create variable in the workflow that is of the same type (e.g. ViewModelObservableCollection <Employee>) as the SmartForm and instanciate it. e.g. New ViewModelObservableCollection (Of Employee)(b) If required: Add Dynamic Script activity to workflow that fetches the data from the database(c) Add SmartForm Task activity to workflow and bind the data on the SmartForm with the data you have created on the workflow via the 'Edit SmartForms' button on the activity(d) If you consume custom activities in your workflow where the SmartForm will be consumed, you may also need to supply arguments to those workflow(e) If required: Add Dynamic Script activity to workflow that saves the data to the database

Title: ItemsSelector - Bind to data that exists in the view model
Description:
To complete and end-to-end customisation scenario using this control in a workflow:
 
Data in view model:
1. In step 3 of SFW, add control to SmartForm, using the data type in the view model e.g. MarketingEntity.SicCodes
2. Update workflow
(a) Create variable in the workflow that is of the same type as the SmartForm: e.g. Client (will automatically include ClientIndustries)
(b) Data may be fetched by retieving data in the same way as fetching data on the Client viewmodel
(c) If the data is a subset of an existing view model such as Client/Matter/Employee there also needs to be an expand clause to fetch the additional data
(d) Add SmartForm Task activity to workflow and bind the data on the SmartForm with the data you have created on the workflow via the 'Edit SmartForms' button on the activity
(e) If you consume custom activities in your workflow where the SmartForm will be consumed, you may also need to supply arguments to those workflow
(f) If data is an extension of an existing view model (e.g. Client/Matter/Employee), the data may be saved using the SaveClient, Save Matter or Save Employee activity
Steps: Step 1: Data in view model:Create an advanced SF using VS. 1. In step 3 of Advanced SF, add control to SmartForm, using the data type in the view model e.g. MarketingEntity.SicCodes || Step 2: Update workflow using VS.2. (a) Create variable in the workflow that is of the same type as the SmartForm: e.g. Client (will automatically include ClientIndustries)(b) Data may be fetched by retieving data in the same way as fetching data on the Client viewmodel(c) If the data is a subset of an existing view model such as Client/Matter/Employee there also needs to be an expand clause to fetch the additional data(d) Add SmartForm Task activity to workflow and bind the data on the SmartForm with the data you have created on the workflow via the 'Edit SmartForms' button on the activity(e) If you consume custom activities in your workflow where the SmartForm will be consumed, you may also need to supply arguments to those workflow(f) If data is an extension of an existing view model (e.g. Client/Matter/Employee), the data may be saved using the SaveClient, Save Matter or Save Employee activity.

Steps: Step 1: For an Advanced SF,(a) Add control that you wish to default data from(b) Add control that you wish to default data to || Step 2: Pre SP2 - In VS, (a) For your SmartForm, add custom controller to your SmartForm project (refer to...) using System; using System.Collections.Generic; using System.Linq; using System.Text; namespace Aderant.SmartForms.SFControls { public partial class TextBoxController { } } } || Step 3: (b) Add override class for the data control that you are defaulting FROM e.g. using System; using System.Collections.Generic; using System.Linq; using System.Text; namespace Aderant.SmartForms.SFControls { public partial class TextBoxController { protected override void OnForDataChangeChanged() { base.OnForDataChangeChanged(); } } } || Step 4: (c) Within the override method, add script to default/set the data using System; using System.Collections.Generic; using System.Linq; using System.Text; namespace Aderant.SmartForms.SFControls { public partial class TextBoxController { protected override void OnForDataChangeChanged() { base.OnForDataChangeChanged(); DefaultFromData = ForDataChange; } } }

Title: Control - Update on lose focus

If you press the Save & Close or Complete button will control is still in focus, this should also have the effect of losing focus, thereby updating the data

Title: Overwrite data properties on task to an expression
Description: Overwrite data properties  on task task properties  (IsVisible/IsRequired/IsEnabled etc)  to  or other data items in view model or workflow

Title: Overwrite data properties on task to true or false
Description:
Overwrite data properties  on task (IsVisible/IsRequired/IsEnabled etc)  to true/false
 
 
The IsVisible/IsRequired/IsEnabled/IsReadOnly properties can be used to set the state of controls used in a SF. For each, there are three possible settings:
 
(a) Default value (will not be overwritten by SF logic or scripts at runtime)
                 IsRequired=FALSE               
                 IsEnabled=TRUE
                 IsVIsible: True
                 IsReadOnly=FALSE
(b) True or False (set a different default for this instance, which may be overwritten dynamically at rumtime in some circumstances e.g. via a script)
(c) Condition (is dynamically evaluated at runtime from a variable or script)
 
 
Option (a) does not generate any methods in the SF controller for these properties
Options (b) and (c) both generate methods in the SF controller so that you can set the dynamic behaviour for these properties via a custom controller (using partial classes)

Title: Set data properties based upon an expression
Description:
Set data properties (IsVisible/IsRequired/IsEnabled/IsReadOnly to be based on other data items in view model or workflow or expression (referred to as 'Condition' in the SF Wizard).
 
E.g. 
Based on value set/selected in another control in same SmartForm
Based on value set/selected in another SmartForm on the same task
Based on value set/selected prior to the creation of this task (in another task or part of the workflow)

Title: Set data properties to inherit from view model
Description: Set data properties (IsVisible/IsRequired/IsEnabled etc)  to inherit from view model

Title: Tooltips - Set long label or description
Description:
A tooltip displays two pieces of information when you hover over a control that has one defined.
 
(a) Label - First line in the hover hint displays the label for the control 
               - Text Is in Bold font
               - Tooltip does not automatically resize for long labels, the label text is truncated if it does not fit in the width of the tooltip
                
(b) Tooltip - The text from the tooltip property
               -  Text automatically wraps around for long tooltips

Title: Hyperlink - Create Unbound version
Description: This test verifies the various configurations of an UNBOUND Hyperlink. Since the hyperlink is not bound any data item, the url is specified in the SFWizard, and as such, cannot not change dynamically at runtime.
Steps: Step 1: Create a new Advanced SF using Visual Studio || Step 2: Add Hyperlink control from Add/View Items button (step 3 of SFWizard) with the following properties: (a) Url - Any internal website address (b) Description - Anything (c) Leave all other properties as default | Expected: At runtime, (a) Hyperlink displays what was entered in the Description (b) Clicking on the Url launches the internal webpage using local default browser || Step 3: Add Hyperlink control from Add/View Items button (step 3 of SFWizard) with the following properties: (a) Url - Any external website address (b) Description - Anything (c) Leave all other properties as default | Expected: At runtime, (a) Hyperlink displays what was entered in the Description (b) Clicking on the Url launches the internal webpage using local default browser || Step 4: Add Hyperlink control from Add/View Items button (step 3 of SFWizard) with the following properties: (a) Url - Any non-existent/invalid website address (b) Description - Anything (c) Leave all other properties as default | Expected: At runtime, (a) Hyperlink displays what was entered in the Description (b) Clicking on the Url displays an informative message || Step 5: Add Hyperlink control from Add/View Items button (step 3 of SFWizard) with the following properties: (a) Url - Any valid website address (b) Description - LEAVE THIS BLANK (c) Leave all other properties as default | Expected: At runtime, (a) Hyperlink displays the url address (b) Clicking on the Url launches the webpage using local default browser || Step 6: Add Hyperlink control from Add/View Items button (step 3 of SFWizard) with the following properties: (a) Url - Any valid website address (b) Description - Any really LONG description (c) Leave all other properties as default | Expected: At runtime, (a) Hyperlink displays the text from the description and when the column is not wide enough to fit in one row, the text wraps around to next row rather than being truncated (b) Clicking on the Url launches the webpage using local default browser || Step 7: Add Hyperlink control from Add/View Items button (step 3 of SFWizard) with the following properties: (a) Url - LEAVE THIS BLANK (b) Description - Anything (c) Leave all other properties as default | Expected: At runtime, (a) Hyperlink displays what was entered in the Description (b) Clicking on the Url displays an informative message || Step 8: Add Hyperlink control from Add/View Items button (step 3 of SFWizard) with the following properties: (a) Url - A local folder location e.g. C:\ExpertShare (b) Description - Anything (c) Leave all other properties as default | Expected: At runtime, (a) Hyperlink displays what was entered in the Description (b) Clicking on the Url launches the local folder in Windows Explorer || Step 9: Add Hyperlink control from Add/View Items button (step 3 of SFWizard) with the following properties: (a) Url - A file in a local folder location e.g. C:\ExpertShare\ExpertAssistant.exe (b) Description - Anything (c) Leave all other properties as default | Expected: At runtime, (a) Hyperlink displays what was entered in the Description (b) Clicking on the Url opens the file that was specfied in the url || Step 10: Add Hyperlink control from Add/View Items button (step 3 of SFWizard) with the following properties: (a) Url - A local folder location that DOES NOT EXIST (b) Description - Anything (c) Leave all other properties as default | Expected: At runtime, (a) Hyperlink displays what was entered in the Description (b) Clicking on the Url displays an informative message || Step 11: Add Hyperlink control from Add/View Items button (step 3 of SFWizard) with the following properties: (a) Url - A NETWORK folder location e.g. C:\ExpertShare (b) Description - Anything (c) Leave all other properties as default | Expected: At runtime, (a) Hyperlink displays what was entered in the Description (b) Clicking on the Url launches the local folder in Windows Explorer || Step 12: Add Hyperlink control from Add/View Items button (step 3 of SFWizard) with the following properties: (a) Url - A file in a NETWORK folder location e.g. C:\ExpertShare\ExpertAssistant.exe (b) Description - Anything (c) Leave all other properties as default | Expected: At runtime, (a) Hyperlink displays what was entered in the Description (b) Clicking on the Url opens the file that was specfied in the url || Step 13: Add Hyperlink control from Add/View Items button (step 3 of SFWizard) with the following properties: (a) Url - A website that is not accessible (b) Description - Anything (c) Leave all other properties as default | Expected: At runtime, (a) Hyperlink displays what was entered in the Description (b) Clicking on the Url opens the browser but the page cannot be loaded || Step 14: Add Hyperlink control from Add/View Items button (step 3 of SFWizard) with the following properties: (a) Url - Any valid address (b) Description - Anything (c) Horizontal alignment - Center (c) Leave all other properties as default | Expected: At runtime, (a) Hyperlink is displayed in the center of the column (b) Clicking on the Url opens the browser but the page cannot be loaded || Step 15: Add Hyperlink control from Add/View Items button (step 3 of SFWizard) with the following properties: (a) Url - Any valid address (b) Description - Anything (c) Horizontal alignment - Right (c) Leave all other properties as default | Expected: At runtime, (a) Hyperlink is displayed to the right of the column (b) Clicking on the Url opens the browser but the page cannot be loaded || Step 16: Add Hyperlink control from Add/View Items button (step 3 of SFWizard) with the following properties: (a) Url - Any valid address (b) Description - Anything (c) Column span = True (c) Leave all other properties as default | Expected: At runtime, (a) Hyperlink spreads across BOTH columns of the SmartForm (assuming a 2 column SF) (b) Clicking on the Url opens the browser but the page cannot be loaded || Step 17: Add Hyperlink control from Add/View Items button (step 3 of SFWizard) with the following properties: (a) Url - Any valid address (b) Description - Anything (c) Margin = 50 (c) Leave all other properties as default | Expected: At runtime, (a) Hyperlink displayed with top and left margin of 50 (b) Clicking on the Url opens the browser but the page cannot be loaded || Step 18: Add Hyperlink control from Add/View Items button (step 3 of SFWizard) with the following properties: (a) Url - an email address (needs to be prefixed with "mailto:") (b) Description - Anything (c) Leave all other properties as default | Expected: At runtime, (a) Hyperlink displayes what was entered in the Description (b) Clicking on the Url opens the browser but the page cannot be loaded

Title: Hyperlink - Usecase - Dynamic File Hyperlink
Description: This test contains a hyperlink that is dynamically set to launch a file that is created during execution of the workflow.

Title: 01. Create Advanced SmartForm
Description:
Advanced SmartForms are C# files that are created via Visual Studio with the assistance of an Aderant designer and SmartForm Wizard. This test outlines the initial creation of the SmartForm but not the design and details of it. The detail are added in test cases to follow: 
 
01b. Create new SmartForm - SFW
01c. Add custom controller logic - Step 4
01d. Regenerate and Publish SFs in Project
01e. Consume SmartForm in workflow
01f. Run SmartForm in workflow
02. Consume advanced SmartForm in Workflow
02. Create grid SmartForm - Advanced
02. Edit existing SmartForm
4. Create SmartForm Summary
05. Create SmartForm Set
Steps: Step 1: On a customization workstation, open VIsual Studio || Step 2: From the File menu, select New>ProjectIn the New Project window that opens, (a) Navigate to the Expert node in the tree, (b) Select Expert SmartForm library(c) Enter a name for your collection of SmartForms(d) Press OK | Expected: Aderant Workflow Project Window opens || Step 3: In the Aderant Workdlow || Step 4: In Visual Studio, ensure Solution Explorer is open then(a) Right-click on the Project you have created and select Add>SmartForm(b) In New Aderant SmartForm window, enter name for SmartForm, press OK | Expected: SmartForm designer opens

Title: 02. Consume advanced SmartForm in workflow
Description:
To consume a context controller in a workflow, the controller must be referenced on any manual task activities that it needs to apply to:
 
> XXX Conrtoller Language
> YYY Controller Source
 
 
Controller Language: CSharp
Controller Source: Provide a string value in the following format:  "namespace, fully qualified assembly name"

Title: Context controller - Default data from parameters
Description:
e.g. 
ClientAdministrative SF: Office, Dept, Profit Cetner default for new client in FO

Title: Context Controller - Fetch data based upon data selection
Description:
If a data provider returns an object, fetching the object as a whole should default data into other controls that are bound to sub-items of that object,
 
For example,
SmartForm has searchox bound to Client, and a DisplayText for Client.DisplayName
If a Client is selected in the searchbox, the displayname for the CLient should be automatically displayed in the DisplayText control

Title: Context Controller - Fetch data based upon data selection - use script
Description: If a control allows users to select/enter a value, further data may be fetched using a script to populate (or manipulated) other items of data or part of the SF.

Title: Context controller - Update data across SFs
Description: e.g. Billl groups???

Title: CSharp SF Controller, WF IronPython controller
Description: If SFs have CSharp controller, and workflow has IronPython task controllers, how do these interact?

Title: Alternate control in same position
Description:
Two alternate controls or labels for one spot (dependant on data changes e.g.  code entry task special case=client name control)
 
 
SFW - Advanced Xml, visibility etc =condition based, 
SFW - Resources on Form properties
Steps: Step 1: Add at least 3 data items to an advanced SmartForm || Step 2: Set the visibility (IsVisible property) on the last two items using an expression so that one is visible when the condition is true, and the other is visible when the same condition is false E.g. If Client is on the SmartForm, set the expression like Client.OfficeId='TLH'Client.OfficeId !='TLH' || Step 3: Save, re-generate, and publish the SmartForm || Step 4: Add the SmartForm to a workflow and run. | Expected: When task is opened, the last two items alternate on the same spot depending on which condition is satisfied (e.g. which client is selected)

Title: Consume custom xml data providers
Description:
GOAL: To create new custom XML data providers and implement in an existing smart form and ensure data is passed correctly between workflow tasks.
 
If the new custom XML data providers are created in a separate custom folder, at-least one of the Namespaces should be present inside the folder.
 
FOR FURTHER INSTRUCTIONS:
http://ttwiki/wiki/index.php?title=Creating_Generic_Lookup_Search_Data_Providers
Steps: Step 1: Launch Configuration Manager and add Config value for Int32 data provider (search mode)Path: Technical.Presentation.DataProviders.Custom Data Type: XMLName: CourtDataProviderValue:<DataProvider DisplayName="Court" Description="Default data provider for retrieving and displaying Courts in a LookupDto" Type="Aderant.Framework.Presentation.DataProviders.GenericLookupDtoSearchDataProvider, Aderant.Framework.Presentation"> <Template><fpd:GenericLookupDtoSearchDataProvider LookupTableName="LMM_COURT" PrimaryTextColumnName="Court_name" SecondaryTextColumnName="Court_Id" KeyColumnName="Court_uno" ExcludeInactiveRows="True" IsMruEnabled="True"  MruName="Court"> </fpd:GenericLookupDtoSearchDataProvider> </Template> <Column property="Id" title="Id" propertyType="Id" isVisible="false" /></DataProvider>(Add Namespace: Aderant to the custom folder by adding a new config instance and copying the code inside Namespace: Aderant) || Step 2: Launch Configuration Manager and add Config value for string data provider (filter mode) Path: Technical.Presentation.DataProviders.Framework Data Type: XML Name: Jurisdiction Value: <fpd:GenericLookupDtoFilterDataProvider LookupTableName="LML_COURT_JURIS" PrimaryTextColumnName="COURT_TITLE" SecondaryTextColumnName="JURIS_CODE" KeyColumnName="JURIS_CODE" ExcludeInactiveRows="True" IsMruEnabled="True" MruName="Jurisdiction"> </fpd:GenericLookupDtoFilterDataProvider> || Step 3: Create an Advanced SF using VS. Launch the Smart Form Wizard and either begin the process of creating a new Smartform or select an existing SmartForm that you wish to add the data provider onto. || Step 4: To consume the lookup data providers you must use the IdentifierToUnderlyingConverter value converter in your smart form. i. From the Step 3 page of the SmartForm Wizard select the Form tab, tick the Advanced checkbox and click the AdditionalNamespaces button under the XAML category in the properties grid to bring up the Namespaces editor ii. Add the following line in the editor: fpc="clr-namespace:Aderant.PresentationFramework.Converters;assembly=Aderant.PresentationFramework" iii. Now click the Resources button to bring up the Resource editor. Add the following line in the editor: || Step 5: Now select the items that you want to bind the COURT data provider to or create a new item. The selected item must be a parameter of type Int32. (a) From the right-hand properties grid click the Control tab and select the data provider that you added to configuration in the register data provider section above (in this example "COURT"). (b) For the BindTo property, set the value to 'SelectedItem' (c) We must now use the IdentifierToUnderlyingConverter to assign the unique id of the selected item to our parameter item. Click the Advanced button and modify the xaml to include the Converter attribute as shown below : || Step 6: Repeat steps 5 for the Jurisdiction data provider using a parameter of type String || Step 7: Cllick 'Save' and close Smart Form Wizard. | Expected: You should get a dialog to say that the smart form has been re-generated and saved. || Step 8: Launch Visual Studio. Open solution and view workflow.xamlx e.g. File Opening Workflow. (a) Click on the 'Variables' tab and create a new variable, 'CourtId', type Int32, scope IntakeFlow and a new variable 'Jurisdiction', type string, scope IntakeFlow. (b) In the workflow.xamlx, navigate to the task you want the data provider to appear in e.g. ClientMatterDataEntry. (c) Click on 'Edit smart forms'. In the Configure SmartForms dialog, refresh the smart form set e.g. FileOpening.MatterSet. Then scroll to view the smart form parameters for e.g. MatterDetails. The new data providers e.g. CourtId and Jurisdiction should be displayed in the Form Parameter section and the corresponding workflow variables should be selected. You will have to select the correct workflow variable if the name is different to the item you specified in Smart Form Wizard. Then click OK. (d) In the workflow xamlx, navigate to a subsequent task e.g. Intake Approval Task in File Opening Workflow. (e) Click on 'Edit smart forms'. In the Configure SmartForms dialog, refresh the smart form set e.g. FileOpening.MatterSet. Then scroll to view the smart form parameters for e.g. MatterDetails. The new data providers e.g. CourtId and JurisdictionId should be displayed in the Form Parameter section and the corresponding workflow variables should be selected. You will have to select the correct workflow variable if the name is different to the item you specified in Smart Form Wizard. Then click OK. (f) Re-build solution. || Step 9: Run workflow. (a) If the data providers have been implemented using File Opening using steps above - accept Intake task. Select requesting attorney that is different to initiator. Select an existing client and enter matter description. (b) Scroll down to Matter Details smart form. The 2 new data providers, Court (search control) and Jurisdiction (filter) should be displayed. (c) Test that the data providers are searching for and displaying the correct data by comparing to database tables (LML_COURT_JURIS and LMM_COURT). | Expected: Court data provider: (a) Data provider is SEARCH mode (b) Results match: select * from LMM_COURT (and takes search criteria into account) Jurisdiction data provider: (a) Data provider is FILTER mode (b) Results match: select * from LML_COURT_JURIS || Step 10: Save and close task. Re-open task. | Expected: Values that were selected for the 2 new data providers are still displayed. || Step 11: Complete task.Proxy the requesting attorney and accept Intake Approval task. Scroll down to Matter Details smart form | Expected: The values selected for the 2 new data providers are correcty displayed.

Title: Consume python data providers
Description:
GOAL: To create new custom IronPython data providers and implement in an existing smart form and ensure data is passed correctly between workflow tasks.
 
FOR FURTHER INSTRUCTIONS:
http://ttwiki/wiki/index.php?title=Creating_Generic_Lookup_Search_Data_Providers
Steps:
Step 1: Add python script to Configuration Manager:In Configuration Manager, add a new value (DataType = IronPython) with details:Path:   Technical.Presentation.Scripts.Custom.DataProvidersName: APAttorneyDPValue:#Script-Language:IronPythonimport clr clr.AddReference("Aderant.Framework") clr.AddReference("Aderant.Query") clr.AddReference("Aderant.Query.Common") clr.AddReference("System.Data.Services.Client") clr.AddReference("Aderant.PresentationFramework.Windows") from Aderant.Framework.Factories import Factory from Aderant.Query.Dynamic import DlrQuery from Aderant.Query.ViewModels import Employee from Aderant.Query.DataProviders import QueryServiceDataProvider from Aderant.PresentationFramework.Windows.Data import PropertyMetadata, PropertyTypes,  DataProviderModeclass AttorneyDataProvider(QueryServiceDataProvider[(int, Employee, Employee)]):         def __init__(self):         print 'Initializing IronPython data provider: %s.' % self.__class__.__name__         self.metadata = None        self.IsMruEnabled = True                self.Query = DlrQuery(Factory.Current)         #define the departments for the employee        self.departments = "ADM, AUD, LIT, TAX"            def GetExactMatchQuery(self, proxy, queryText):         try:             print 'GetExactMatchQuery: queryText:%s'%(queryText)             return self.Query.Employees.Where("Code = @0 and isActive = True and (@1).Contains(DepartmentId)", queryText, self.departments).Expand("BusinessEntity").Queryable         except Exception, e:             print e     def GetItemQuery(self, proxy, key):         try:             print 'GetItemQuery: key: %s'%(key)             return self.Query.Employees.Where("Id = @0 and isActive = True and (@1).Contains(DepartmentId)",key, self.departments).Expand("BusinessEntity").Queryable         except Exception, e:             print e     def GetItemsQuery(self, proxy, queryText, maxItems):         try:             print 'GetItemsQuery: queryText: %s, maxItems:%s'%(queryText,maxItems)             return self.Query.Employees.Where("DisplayName.Contains(@0) and isActive = True and (@1).Contains(DepartmentId)", queryText, self.departments).Queryable        except Exception,e:             print e     def get_ItemMetadata(self):         if self.metadata:             return self.metadata                 self.metadata = []        self.metadata.append(PropertyMetadata(Title='Id', Property='Id', PropertyType=PropertyTypes.Id, IsVisible=false))        self.metadata.append(PropertyMetadata(Title='Employee Name', Property='DisplayName', PropertyType=PropertyTypes.PrimaryText))        self.metadata.append(PropertyMetadata(Title='Employee Code', Property='Code', PropertyType=PropertyTypes.CodeText))         self.metadata.append(PropertyMetadata(Title='Office Description', Property='OfficeDescription'))        self.metadata.append(PropertyMetadata(Title='Office Code', Property='OfficeCode'))        self.metadata.append(PropertyMetadata(Title='Department Description', Property='DepartmentDescription'))        self.metadata.append(PropertyMetadata(Title='Department Code', Property='DepartmentCode'))        self.metadata.append(PropertyMetadata(Title='Email', Property='Email'))        self.metadata.append(PropertyMetadata(Title='Phone Number', Property='PhoneNumber'))        self.metadata.append(PropertyMetadata(Title='', Property='Position', PropertyType=PropertyTypes.SecondaryText))                return self.metadata     def set_ItemMetadata(self, value):         self.metadata = value | Expected: Alternatively you can import the same configuration via importing the attached package into your environment. || Step 2: Consume python data provider in SmartForm
     (i) Launch SmartForm WIzard - Pre SP2
SP2 & Later - Launch Design Studio V2 and create a new Advanced SmartForm as appropriate to this test.
     (ii) Copy or edit existing SmartForm and navigate to step 3
     (iii) In step 3, click on the Forms tab, and expand the XAML property, and then click on the ellipsis for Additional names
     (iv) In the editor that pops up, paste the following
a="clr-namespace:Aderant.Framework.Presentation.MarkupExtensions;assembly=Aderant.Framework.Presentation"
     (v) In step 3 again, select an attribute, and select a control type of 'Search Control'
     (vi) For the search control, click on the Advanced button and add the following line in amongst the SearchBox properties
 DataProvider="{a:PythonDataProviderFactory Technical.Presentation.Scripts.Custom.DataProviders.APAttorneyDP}"
     (vii) Save SmartForm || Step 3: Add SF to workflow | Expected: (a) Data provider is SEARCH mode
(b) Results returned match search criteria and is subset of:
SELECT * FROM HBM_PERSNL WHERE DEPT IN ('ADM', 'AUD', 'LIT', 'TAX') AND INACTIVE = 'N'
(c) Values selected in the search control on the SmartForm is saved when the task is saved and closed, and re-opened, and between tasks

Title: Disable MRU on data provider for control instance
Description:
When a data provider is selected in a SmartForm, the MRU is either enabled/disabled by default (enabled is more common). This can be overridden at design time for a particular SF instance.
 
Current Method
- Advanced Xaml for control

Title: Display Property Metadata in script editor
Description:
To enable the changing the property metadata information like Visible, Validation, Required etc the script editor should display the Property Metadata so that it can be changed.
 
This data will be visible via a checkbox to "Show Property Metadata" above the data tree picked in the script editor
 
In the following locations, check that the checkbox is available and that checking/unchecking it makes the property metadata visible/not visible.
SmartForm Wizard:          Iron Python script editors
Workflow Designer:         Dynamic Script activity
 
Note: 
PropertyMetaData can only appear in the tree for viewmodel data and not for primitive data types (e.g. string, datetime etc), although the scripts can still reference this metadata as it gets created for primitive data types at runtime

Title: Overwrite data properties on task/SF
Description: Overwrite data properties  on task task properties  (IsVisible/IsRequired/IsEnabled etc)  to  or other data items in view model or workflow

Title: Overwrite data properties on task to true or false
Description:
Overwrite data properties  on task (IsVisible/IsRequired/IsEnabled etc)  to true/false
 
-- Closed - added this test as a step to some other test.

Title: Overwrite SF Control properties on task to true or false
Description:
Overwrite data properties  on task (IsVisible/IsRequired/IsEnabled etc)  to true/false
 
-- Closed - added as a step to some other test.

Title: Overwrite SF Control properties to other data items
Description:
Overwrite SmartForm properties  on task task properties  (IsVisible/IsReadOnly/IsCollapsible/IsCollapsed etc)  to  or other data items in view model or workflow
 
-- Closed - as added as a step to some other test.

Title: Retain default value for data properties
Description:
Properties:
IsReadOnly
IsRequired
IsVisible
IsEnabled
 
These default values CANNOT be overwritten by anything else
e.g. at SmartForm level, task level

Title: Run script that fires at control or form level
Description:
In the SFW for basic SmartForms, scripts may be set to fire at form or control level for the SmartForm. 
 
There are 3 methods available at form level:
- On Loaded
- On Validate
- On Data Changed
 
There are 3 methods available at control level:
- On Validate
- On Change

Title: Set SF Control title based on data or expressions
Description: Set SmartForm title based on data or expressions

Title: Update data on one control based upon another
Description: Update the data in one control based upon another - same SF

Title: Use ampersand in control label
Description:
If you wish to display a "&"in a control's label, you will get an error in the XAML (e.g. if you Preview SmartForm) if you simply include it in the text for the label. Instead you must go into the Advanced Xaml editor.
 
E.g. For a label of "D&B Number", you need this syntax in your Xaml for the control:
Text="D & B Number"

Title: 02. Create grid SmartForm - Advanced
Description:
1. Launch SF Wizard from Visual Studio Smartform Project
2. Press the Begin button and in step 1, select 'Create New SmartForm'. Press the Next button
3. In step 2
   (a) Check the 'Expert Owner' displays the firm name from: SELECT NAME FROM FWM_OWNER WHERE ISSYSTEM = 'Y'
   (b) SmartForm Name: Enter  'BasicGridForm' (check no spaces allowed in name)
   (c) SmartForm Category: Create a new category called 'SFSmokeTest' and select
   (d) SmartForm Description: Enter a simple description
   (e) SmartForm Type: Select 'Grid Form'
   (f) Scripting Required: Leave default as checked
   (g) Customization Package: Select package 'SFBaseTest' and select
   (h) Press the Next button
 
In step 3
   (a) Click on the Add/View Items button
   (c) In the Parameters window, in the Select Item search box search for and select:
              i. 'Client' 
              ii. Drill into Client, right-click on 'Parties', and select 'Set as Grid Source'
              iii. Drill into 'Parties', check the items below, then press the Done key
                                     - BusinesssEntity\DisplayName
                                     - BusinessEntity\Birthday
                                     - BusinessEntity\NoOfChildren
                                     - PartyStatusId
                                     - PartyTypeEnum
                                     - BusinessEntity\AvailableForMarketing
    (f) Control tab     
               i. DisplayName - TextBoxGridColumn (default), IsRequired=True, change Title to 'Name'
               ii. NoOfChildren- NumericBocGridColumn (default), change Title to 'Kids', check the 'Show Total' property, set Minimum property to '0', Maximum to '30'
               iii. Birthday - DatePickerGridColumn (default)
               iv. PartyStatusId - SearchBoxGridColumn, select Data Provider = 'Party Status'
               v. PartyTypeId - SearchBoxGridColumn, select Data Provider = 'Party Type'
               vi. AvailableForMarketing - CheckBoxGridColumn, change Title to 'Avail EM'            
               x. Arrange the order of the Visible Items using the UP/DOWN arrows. Order should be:
                              DisplayName, Kids, Birthday, Status, Type, Avail EM
 Press the Save button
5. Press the 'Preview'button --> The preview pop up should look like the attachment to this test called: 'BasicGridSFPreview.png'
6. Press the Next button --> until you reach step 6 then press the Finish button
 
 
Confirm Creation
For each SmartForm defined, parameters should be saved in configuration under the path Technical.Presentation.SmartForms.<SmartFormName>, where <SmartFormName> is the SmartForm name with spaces removed. 
e.g. SFSmokeTest.BasicSmartForm
 
Consume in workflow activity
1. Add SF to workflow and kick off workflow instance
2. Open the workflow task. In DebugViewer there should be an ERROR log entry: 'OnLoaded script for Grid SmartForm'
3. Check the properties match what was set in step 4.
4. Enter/select values in all fields except 'Name' and press the 'Save & Close' button --> Receive validation error prompt for missing data --> 
              Watch DebugViewer as the task is saved. There should be TWO ERROR log entries: 
                                                                 'OnValidate script for Grid SmartForm'
5. Re-open the task --> All values that had been entered should still be there
6. Check the tab sequence. Default sequence should be down the first column and then wrap back up to the top of the second.
7. Add a row of data using the insertion row and another using the Add New
8. Press the 'Complete' button 
              Watch DebugViewer as the task is completed. There should be TWO ERROR log entries: 
                                                                 'OnValidate script for Grid SmartForm'
9. When the next task appears, ensure the data from the first task is still visible
 
 
---- **** Redundant *******------

Title: Add custom controls to grid header
Description: ***** Same Test Exists elsewhere ****

Title: Checkboxgrid column - uses converter
Description: When using a checkbox column in a SmartForm grid, a converter may be used to ensure the data is interpreted correctly. This is to cope with domain limitations early on where booleans were represented as chars of length 1. (You now have the option for booleans to exist as booleans in the domain so a converter is not always required.

Title: Consume edit, edit and copy, remove buttons
Description: **** Same test exists elsewhere *******

Title: Run grid SmartForm
Description:
***** Redundant *******
 
Expected UI behaviours in SmartForm grids
 
Add data to grid cell
- For each of the grid cell control types - Textbox, search control and Date Picker test that you can add/or select a value to the cell, whether the cell is on the insertion row or an existing (posted/saved) row.
- For Search Control cells, you can use the up and down arrow keys, then hit 'enter' to select a value. If the cell is in 'display' mode you need to hit 'enter' first to change to 'edit' mode. Then hit 'enter' again to change back to 'display' mode.
 
Delete data from grid cell
- For each of the grid cell control types - Textbox, search control and Date Picker test that you can delete a value from the cell, whether the cell is on the insertion row or an existing (posted/saved) row.
- You can delete cell data by hitting 'enter' key to change to 'edit mode'.  Then using the backspace key, or clicking on the cell's 'x' delete button.
- You can also delete the cell data by hitting the 'escape' key twice.
 
Edit grid cell value
For each of the grid cell control types - Textbox, search control and Date Picker, test that you can edit an existing cell value, whether the cell is on the insertion row or an existing (posted/saved) row.
 
Validation Errors
If the cell has a validation error, the Validation Error icon should be displayed to the right of the cell control (within the cell). 
Test that:
1. Validation Error! Message you get when you hover over the Validation Error icon is correct.
2. Validation icon disappears when you edit the cell to a valid value, and 'x' delete cell data re-appears.
3. Cells that are required fields should have the control border highlighted orange until valid data is entered/selected. If the user tries to click on the '+' add new row button there should be a dialog that alerts the user that a required item is either missing or invalid.
 
Change order of grid column
You can change the order of the grid columns by clicking on the grid column title cell and dragging to the required location (i.e. before or after another column).
 
Sort grid columns
You can sort grid columns by clicking on the grid column title cell.
 
Save Grid Data
Grid data is saved when you enter data then hit 'enter' key, or when you click '+' button at end of row.
SAVING CELL DATA - Test for cells which are different control types e.g. DatePicker, Search control, textbox.
When you hit the 'enter' key after entering/selecting data in a cell, this changes the cell mode from 'edit' to 'display' and saves the data from that cell. The cell data should still be displayed after you have hit 'enter'..
SAVING ROW DATA
The row of data is saved when you click on the  '+' button at the end of the row. This button also adds a new row to the top of the grid. The row you saved is no longer the insertion row, and the row mode has changed from 'edit' to 'display' mode.  
VALIDATION ERRORS
If one of the cells in the row has a validation error, the cell data will still be saved when you lose focus on the cell.
 
Create new row of data in grid
-Check that can enter data into insertion row (which is always at the top) and has pencil icon to show row is in 'edit mode'.
-Test that you can't add a new (insertion) row if the current insertion row is blank. I.e. there shouldn't be a whole lot of blank rows in your grid.
-Check that you can't create a new (insertion) row if your previous rows contain validation errors. If so, then check that you can create a new (insertion) row if you have fixed the validation errors on the previous (insertion) row.
 
SAVING CELL DATA - Test for cells which are different control types e.g. DatePicker, Search control, textbox.
When you hit the 'enter' key after entering/selecting data in a cell, this changes the cell mode from 'edit' to 'display' and saves the data from that cell. The cell data should still be displayed after you have hit 'enter'..
 
SAVING ROW DATA
The row of data is saved when you click on the  '+' button at the end of the row. This button also adds a new row to the top of the grid. The row you saved is no longer the insertion row, and the row mode has changed from 'edit' to 'display' mode.  
 
VALIDATION ERRORS
If one of the cells in the row has a validation error, the cell data will still be saved when you lose focus on the cell.
 
Delete grid row
Test that you can delete the row by clicking on any cell within that row and clicking on the 'x' remove button at the end of the row, or using the 'Remove' button (at the top right hand side).
 
Navigate across grid row
Test you can use the tab and shift+tab keys to move back and forth across a grid row.
 
Navigate between grid rows
- Test that you can navigate between grid rows using the up and down keyboard arrows, and by clicking on different rows using the mouse.
- Use ESCAPE key to take focus from indiviudal cell to navigate between rows
 
Select grid row
- To select a row click on any cell within that row.
- To select more than one row - use shift + click on the rows, and either use the up/down arrows or the mouse to select the rows.

Title: Set grid column width
Steps: Step 1: Create advanced SmartForm grid. In step 3 of the SmartForm WIzard, set column widths as follows - First column has width set to a fixed number of pixels - Second column has width set to 2* - Third column has width set to 3* | Expected: At runtime, assumin x columns in grid: - First column has width as explicit length set in SmartForm Wizard - Second column has width = 2/(x-1) of remaining width - Third column has width = 3/(x-1) of remaining width - Remaining columns = equally proportioned for remaining width (i.e. 1/(x-1) each)

Title: 05. Create SmartForm Set
Description:
Create SmartForm Set
 
In the Smart Form Wizard, 
 
Step 1: Select 'Create New Smart Form'
Step 2: Enter values for the base Smart Form properties
Step 3:  (a) Select the 'FormSet' radio button rather than the 'SingleForm' radio button and enter values for other properties as required
             (b) Add a single GRID SF
             (c) Do NOT add a summary 
             (d) Save the SF
 
Create a SF set for a SF containing a grid
 
Confirm Creation of SmartForm Set

(b) In addition to the above, the child SmartForms that make up the FormSet should be saved in the configuration path
           Technical.Presentation.SmartForms.<SmartFormSection><SmartFormName>.SmartForms
 
Consume in WF

(b) In addition to the above, the child SmartForms that make up the FormSet should be saved in the configuration path Technical.Presentation.SmartForms..SmartForms || Step 4: Consume in WF and run | Expected: SmartForm summary displays data as defined in the SmartForm Wizard Summary data displayed when SmartForm set is collapsed

Title: Developer can save SmartForms directly to TFS Branch
Description:
Verify that Smart Form Wizard launches in Developer mode and developers can save SmartForms directly to TFS Branch.
 
See Design Steps

Title: IronPython Editors
Preview button
Description:
On step 5 (and step 8 if creating a SmartForm summary) of the Smart Form Wizard, there is a 'Preview' button displayed below the Available Attributes box. Clicking on this button should pop up a window that displays the layout of the SmartForm.
 
Test:
1. The correct controls are displayed, and are in the right position
2. If the Xaml button is expanded, the Xaml that will be generated for the SmartForm will be displayed.
 
Note: 
If the controls are dynamically displayed/hidden, the preview window does not take this into account. So where a SmartForm may toggle between displaying two different controls, they will BOTH appear, overlapping each other. The view is purely to see the layout of each control when they are visible.
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Reset button
Description:
On step 5 (and step 8 if creating a SmartForm summary) of the Smart Form Wizard, there is a 'Reset' option. This is hidden in the 'Advanced' drop down button above the Control Type properties grid.
 
Test:
1. Clicking on this button restores the properties for the selected control back to its original default values, and any values that have been changed by the user are overwritten (in the same way as when the control type is first selected).
 
Dont have this button anymore..

Title: Save SF
Description:
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Step 1 - Select Mode
Description:
The first step in the Smart Form Wizard, requires the user to select from the following modes:
 
1. Create New SmartForm
SmartForm label and searchbox are hidden
 
2. Create SmartForm By Copying From Existing SmartForm
SmartForm label and searchbox are displayed
SmartForm searchbox displays existing SmartForms: SectionName.SmartFormName 
A SmartForm must be selected before the 'Next' button is enabled
 
3. Edit Existing SmartForm
SmartForm label and searchbox are displayed
SmartForm searchbox displays existing SmartForms: SectionName.SmartFormName 
A SmartForm must be selected before the 'Next' button is enabled

Title: Step 2 - SmartForm Properties
Description:
Step 2 in the Smart Form Wizard allows the user to add/edit core properties for the Smart Form:
 
Properties:
Mode:                              The mode selected in step 1
SmartForm Section:         A SmartForm(s) grouping (disabled if copying or editing a SmartForm)
SmartForm Name:           The SmartForm  name (disabled if editing a SmartForm)
ExpertInterface:              The default data context for the SmartForm. If there are Dtos in your workflow's context data, the   
                                        radio button defaults to 'From Workflow' and the first Dto in your context data defaultsin the search  
                                        box. If there are NO Dtos defined in your workflow's context data, the 'Advanced' radio button 
                                        defaults as selected.If 'Advanced' view, any Dto that is registered in Configuration should be 
                                        available (I.e. Techincal.Framework.Workflow.ContextData.Dtos)
SmartForm Description:   SmartForm Description
Customization Package:  Option to create new or select existing package
 
TFS Branch: Which TFS branch to save the smartform to (Only is the user has deployed with ExpertDevelopmentEnvironemnt defined in the windows environment variable)
 
 
 
Form Validation Behaviour:
The Next button is disabled until all required fields are populated, and entries are valid (see 'Rules' below)
Error messages are dislpayed as tooltips on the Error icon for invalid fields
A pop up box is produced if the user attempts to modify Aderant owned smartforms (current FileOpening and EmployeeIntake)
Users can save select the TFS branch to save the smartform to on this screen as well
 
 
Rules:
- SmartForm Name is required
- SmartForm Name must be unique
- Customization Package is required

Title: Step 3 - Add Layout Controls
Description: Use the 'Add/View Items' control to select layout controls (not bound to data) to be included on the SmartForm by clicking an option in the split button. The item should be added to the Visible Items list.

Title: Step 3 - Add or View Items List
Description:
Use the Add/View Items button to add data items to your SF. You can then choose appropriate controls 
 
If smartform wizard was launched from C:\ExpertShare, you can view the viewmodels or parameters that have been added to the smartform
 
If smartform wizard was launched from within Visual Studio, you are able to include the variables from your workflow using the radio button at the top of the parameters window
 
You should be able to view all the attributes that could be added as visible / enabled items on the smartform

Title: Step 3 - Display Columns
Description: The SmartForm may have one or two columns to format its controls. The default is to have two columns.

Title: Step 3 - Display Options for SmartForm
Description:
Step 4 of the Smart Form Wizard allows users to specify display options for the SmartForm. All properties except for 'IsCollapsible and 'Show Title' may be set using context data as well as True/False.
 
SingleForm (oneSmartForm only):
HelpLinkId (default to -1 if no help is required)
IsCollapsible
IsCollapsed (Only relevant if IsCollapsible = True. Whether the SmartForm default as collapsed/expanded when opened)
IsReadOnly (Specifies if all fields on the SF are read-only or editable. If True, overrides the ReadOnly property of individual fields. Default = False)
IsVisble
ShowTitle
Title
ValidationScript (script that fires when a task including the smart form is saved/completed)
FormLoadedScript (script that fires when a task including the smart form is opened)
AdditionalNameSpaces (references to types that are required for the SmartForm that do not get included when controls are added to it)
Resources
 
GridView (one smartform only, but a collection of data / rows):
To be fleshed out
 
 
FormSet (a collection of SmartForms):
HelpLinkId (default to -1 if no help is required)
IsCollapsed (Sets are always collapsible. Whether the SmartForm default as collapsed/expanded when opened)
IsReadOnly (Specifies if all fields on the SF are read-only or editable. If True, overrides the ReadOnly property of individual fields. Default = False)
IsVisble
Title
ValidationScript (script that fires when a task including the smart form is saved/completed)
FormLoadedScript (script that fires when a task including the smart form is opened)
AdditionalNameSpaces (references to types that are required for the SmartForm that do not get included when controls are added to it)
Resources

Title: Step 3 - Item Properties
Description:
Step 3 allows users to select the controls that will be displayed on their SmartForm for the attributes that were included/added in step 4.
 
Test:
1. The VisibleItems includes all data items that have been added via the Add/View Items button
2. Once the user has selected an item in the "Included Attributes" ListBox and a control type in the "Control Type" SearchBox is selected, the property sheet on the right should be updated to reflect the properties of that control for the selected item. 
3. If the user highlights a Layout control (such as a button, divider or image) in the "Included Attributes" ListBox, that control is auto selected in the Control Type SearchBox and the SearchBox is disabled.
4. * Needs updating* If the user selects Span or Empty Cell in the "Included Attributes" ListBox, the "Control Type" SearchBox and Property Grid are hidden. 
5. The Preview button should display a mock image of the anticipated screen layout (with field names replacing sample data).
6. The Advanced button retrieves the XAML template associated with the selected attribute and control.
(The button is disabled if a valid control is not selected in the "Control Type" SearchBox or the SearchBox is hidden).
7. The Reset button resets the properties for the currently selected attribute back to the defaults for the control
8. * Needs updating* The IsEnabled, IsVisible, Is Required properties should have possible values of True/False, or context data items so that the property can be dynamically  resolved when the workflow is running.

Title: Step 3 - SmartForm Sets
Description: If creating a Smart Form SET, individual smart forms can be added/removed in this screen. All smart forms currently registered in configuration should be available (?).

Title: Step 4 - Create SmartForm Summary
Description:
This step is available for FormSets, and single SmartForms where the IsCollapsible property is false. 
 
Test:
1. If the SmartForm Type is Single, and the IsCollapsable property of the SmartForm is set to False, then skip steps 6, 7 and 8 and proceed directly to Step 9.
2. The 'Define a SmartForm collapsed Summary View?' checkbox is checked by default

Title: Step 5 - Optional
Description:
This step is similar to the Step 4 'Select Screen Items & Layout', except that the DataTemplate being defined is for the Summary view.
 
Test:
1. This Screen is only displayed if the user checked the "Define a SmartForm Collapsed Summary View" checkbox in Step 6.
2. Other differences to Step 5 are that: when the XAML is generated, the DataTemplate is saved under the configuration parameter name "SummaryDataTemplate", instead of just "DataTemplate".

Click Once - Applications are signed with Aderant certificate
Description:
For Click Once to work in a distributed environment, the network share path in the environment manifest must have the network name for the ExpertShare folder rather than a relative local path.
E.g. Must be in the format \\WSAKL000666\ExpertShare rather than C:\ExpertShare
 
If this path is in the local relative path, remote client machines will fail a CIick Once deployment (even though the ExpertShare folder and Click Once manifest is available to them).

Title: Click Once - Applications NOT signed with certificate
Description:
For Click Once to work in a distributed environment, the network share path in the environment manifest must have the network name for the ExpertShare folder rather than a relative local path.
E.g. Must be in the format \\WSAKL000666\ExpertShare rather than C:\ExpertShare
 
If this path is in the local relative path, remote client machines will fail a CIick Once deployment (even though the ExpertShare folder and Click Once manifest is available to them).

Title: Terminal Services - Connect via Terminal Services
Description:
Terminal Services test (Note: Terminal Services now called Remote Desktop for Administrators) 
 
To test connecting via Terminal Services, 
1. Multiple users connect to VMAKLEXPDEVB02 (up to 3 users permitted) via Remote Desktop (one user may need to connect via the console e.g. to launch via a command window> mstsc /admin
2. Each user should then launch the application being tested directly from the Expert Share folder (NOT using Click Once)
--> You should see that there is a SEPARATE process (e.g. via Task Manager) for each user that has that application open
3. Do a few tests with the app open, make sure the different users do not interfere with each other
Steps:
Step 1: For a Terminal Services environment, using at least two separate test client machines, connect to the terminal server directly, then launch Expert Assistant.exe from the Expert Share folderNB: In AKL, VMAKLEXPDEVB02 may be used (up to 3 users permitted). Each user should connect via Remote Desktop (one user may need to connect via the console e.g. to launch via a command window>  mstc /admin | Expected: 1. On the terminal server, there is a SEPARATE Expert Assistant process for EACH connected client machine (this can be verified using Task Manager - Use Process list, and look at UserName column)
2. Expert Assistant behaves and functions as expected without any interference from other users.

Title: Expert Assistant - UAC settings on client machine
Description:
BUG 71772
 
Users may have UAC enabled on their client machines. We need to ensure that our applications still operate as expected with this level of security.
Steps: Step 1: Use the specified test configuration for this test. See http://ttwiki/wiki/index.php?title=QA_Environments for client machine pool. || Step 2: Enable UAC (or equivalent) on your client machine with Windows 7 || Step 3: Install Expert Assistant via Click Once and MSI | Expected: There may be additional prompts, but no errors should occur || Step 4: Launch Framework Applications - Solution Designer, - Configuration Manager, - Security Manager, - Expert Assistant | Expected: There may be additional prompts, but no errors should occur || Step 5: Launch Matter Planning application and click around | Expected: There may be additional prompts, but no errors should occur || Step 6: Launch Paperless Prebill application and click around | Expected: There may be additional prompts, but no errors should occur || Step 7: Launch Rates application and click around | Expected: There may be additional prompts, but no errors should occur || Step 8: Run through FW smoke test and FO workflow | Expected: There may be additional prompts, but no errors should occur || Step 9: Repeat steps 1-7 on your client machine with Windows XP | Expected: There may be additional prompts, but no errors should occur

See http://ttwiki/wiki/index.php?title=QA_Environments for client machine pool. || Step 2: Install Expert Assistant via MSI (and Click Once) | Expected: Installs without any problems EA added to Start menu and can be launched from there || Step 3: Check SpellCheck in a workflow task or in an application (Expert Time or Expert Paperless Prebilll) | Expected: Functions as expected || Step 4: Enable email notifications for workflow tasks. Start a workflow where task will be assigned to logged in user | Expected: Email task notification received on that client machine Double-clicking on task in email opens the task

Title: Copy Old Environment Manifest

Description:
Required fields should be:

- Aderant Expert Database

  - Password
 
Suggested additional fields:

SMTP Port: 25
From Email: expertqa@aderant.com
 
For all roles other than Workflow Server Role, Service Runs As    ==> ADERANT_AP\service.expert.ap
For Workflow Server Role, Service Runs As                                   ==> ADERANT_AP\service.workflow.ap
 
Test that you can deploy using the new manifest
Steps: Step 1: Open Deployment Manager Select SQL server and Expert DB , create a new environment manifest (click "ADD" button on the ribbon if DM doesn't automatically ask to create new env) | Expected: Environment wizard is launched || Step 2: Step 1, select @EnvironmentType.a) Check Source Pathb) If Environment type is "Load balanced", fill in the load balancer name field (With valid/invalid values)If required:c) Fill in Expert directory path (With valid/invalid directory path to CMS binaries)d) Fill in Connection details (This is the Connection name in CMS.ini) | Expected: a) The source path is auto generated to the directory where Deployment manager was launchedb) Load balancer is a required field; Invalid load balancer name should return appropriate error messagec) Appshell path is auto generated when Directory path is filled in; Invalid appshell path should return appropriate error message || Step 3: Step 2, fill in the following fields:a) Environment nameb) Expert Share Pathc)Enable/Disable Enhanced security as required d) Service Account name/gMSA security Group/Password  (Service Account name/Password: ADERANT_AP\service.expert.qa/Ad3rant0)f) SSRS Web service URL, Username and password h) UnCheck 'Enable Service call compression'i) Http proxy - No proxyj) Set SMTP host to: smtp.dev.ap.aderant.com, Port: 25k) Set from email to: expertqa@aderant.com | Expected: a) @EnvironmentNameb) @SharePathc) Enhanced security is checked by default when adding new environments.If Enhanced security: Service Account name/gMSA security Group required;If non-Enhanced security: Service Account name/ Password is required;d) Service name field is checked against the prompted format (username@domain or domain\username)f) SSRS service URL is checked against URL format (http://web.servicename) || Step 4: Step 3, add servers and select rolesa) Add server - specify server name and expert path (Directory where Expert services will be installed to)b) Edit serverc) Add role | Expected: a) @AddServerb) Server name and expert path can be changed in the 'Edit server' dialogc) @AddRole || Step 5: Step 5, Fill in database details. Server name: Your machine name Expert Database Name: Your database Database Owner Username: CMSDBO Database Owner Password: cmsdbo [Case sensitive] Monitoring Database Name: Your database + “Monitoring” (This should default in and be created automatically) | Expected: a) All fields except 'Instance name' and 'Custom connections' are requiredb) Workflow database name is auto populated after you enter Expert Database name (We recommend to use the same DB for Workflow and Expert) || Step 6: Finish the wizardClick No when deployment manager asks you to deploy | Expected: 1. Deployment manager is loaded with the new manifest2. Verify the manifest matches your specifications during the creation wizard3. Environment file (environment.xml) is created under the same directory as DeploymentManager.msi

Title: DM - L & F - Deployment manager

Drop down: DB or File* System Info - gets the system data from the manifest file* Deploy - validates the environemnt details and then deploys* Validate - validates the environment details* Remove - removes the deployment* Copy - enabled if log info exists, copies the log text to clip boardService Monitor tab* New - launches wizard* Edit - enables environment tab fields for editing* Advanced edit - allows editing of the manifest xml* Accept and Cancel enabled when in edit or advanced edit mode* Import - default launches Expert Database Details dialog. Title: Load balance - fail over to other server
Description: In a load balanced environment, any services that are balanced across multiple servers should be failed over to other servers if one or the other servers is unavailable/not running.

Title: Mass Prebill Select

Title: Import Patch to Expert environments
Description: Patch deployment mainly involves importing a package in the same way you would import a customization package. However, each patch is unique, and may have more or less steps involved, so the Install Guide for the specific patch being tested should be followed to test this process.
Steps: Step 1: (Get help from CRT for this step)Create a Patch that contains the following:a. Files from services folder (C:\AderantExpert\Local\Services\FrameworkServices\Configuration)b. Files from SharedBin folder (C:\AderantExpert\Local\SharedBin)c. Files from ExpertShared. Files from ExpertSourcee. UPD filesf. Config/Security/Adhoc/Rules from Expert system | Expected: Patch can be created || Step 2: Import the patch to @EnvironmentType and check the list of items | Expected: All items should be pushed to the correct locations and updated & backed up the original file

Clean environment using command line
