Title: Remove Load Balanced Environment
Remove Expert Deployment
Steps: Step 1: *You need to have a @EnvironmentType deployment first*Remove Expert deployment @EnvironmentType using Deployment Manager | Expected: - Services are removed from IIS in all serverse.g. Expert_* app_pools and Expert_Local services- ExpertShare is emptied out (except for custom files such as custom SmartForm dlls) - Published workflow files remain in all servers: \\{servername}\AderantExpert\{EnvironmentName}\Services\Workflows - Design Studio extension uninstalled from Visual Studio (Only for Local Deployments)

Title: Deploy - Sign apps with certificate
Steps: Step 1: In 80SP2, Click once are signed using Aderant certificate, and clients are not required to sign CO with their own certificate. || Step 2: Deploy to a distributed environment, ensuring that environment manifest has: (a) the network share path as the network name for the ExpertShare folder rather than a relative local path. (b) The certificate path and password details ARE specified | Expected: Environment manifest is in the format \\WSAKL000666\ExpertShare rather than C:\ExpertShare || Step 3: From a client machine that does NOT have the certificate installed, navigate to the ExpertShare folder and double-click on the ExpertAssistantCO.application file HINT: To check if the certificate is installed. In Internet Explorer, go to Internet Options and select the Content tab. Then press the Certificates button. In the Trusted Publishers tab, there should not be anything listed. If there is, you may see our internal certificate we use for testing 'ADERANT Holdings Inc' | Expected: If the certificate that EA and Timer have been signed with has NOT been installed on client machine the user will receive a prompt to install/not install the application. The prompt should have the 'publisher' details of the certificate owner (e.g. 'Aderant Holdiings')

Title: Deploy Distributed Environment
Description:
Pre-requisites:
As per the current Expert System Configuration Guide ensure that all required Roles and Features have been installed on the application servers.
Use the powershell module (ExpertApplicationServer.ps1) that is included in the Expert source to automatically setup the roles and features required.
Steps: Step 1: Distribute services among 3 different machines (Prepare the machines to be deployment ready):a. Create an environment manifest with Test/Production Distributed typeb. Select product roles to server 1c. Select framework roles to server 2d. Select workflow roles to server 3e. Deploy Expert | Expected: Product services should be deployed to Server 1 (C:\AderantExpert\Services)Framework services should be deployed to Server 2Workflow services should be deployed to Server 3 || Step 2: Run Sanity tests on all deployed products || Step 3: Import Workflow packages | Expected: Workflow files are installed on Server 3 (C:\AderantExpert\[EnvironmentName]\Services\Workflows) || Step 4: Build a Test Patch (Containing files in the C:\AderantExpert\[EnvironmentName]\SharedBin folder)Import the Test Patch | Expected: SharedBin on all servers should be patched || Step 5: Create Domain Customizations (Custom tables & Columns, add them to Expert) in Dev environment Import the customization packageBuild & Apply the customization in Deployment Manager

Title: Deploy distributed system using command line
Description: DeploymentEngine.exe Deploy Environment.manifest.xml

Title: Deploy Load Balanced Environment
Steps: Step 1: Load Balance setupa. NLB - vmhsfnlb.ap.aderant.comb. Server 1 - VMHSF302c. Server 2 - VMHSF303d. Deployment Machine - VMHSF301 (Folder: C:\ADERANT\VMHSFNLB\ExpertBinaries) || Step 2: a. Create an environment manifest with Test/Production Load Balanced typeb. Specify the load balancer - vmhsfnlb.ap.aderant.comc. Add VMHSF302 as Server 1 and VMHSF303 as Server 2d. Add all roles to Server 1 and 2 (Some roles can only be added to 1 server)e. Deploy Expert | Expected: Services should be deployed to both Servers (C:\AderantExpert\Services) || Step 3: For unenhanced security deployment, review the deployment logs and do a search for CredSSP. For enhanced security deployment, review the deployment logs and do a search for Kerberos. | Expected: Unenhanced security should be doing authentication via CredSSP, whereas enhanced security does it via KerberosNote: Verify this step and update. In particular, check whether unenhanced security includes both Kerberos and CredSSP keywords, or just CredSSP. || Step 4: Run Sanity tests on all deployed products || Step 5: Import Workflow packages | Expected: Workflow files are installed on both Servers (C:\AderantExpert\[EnvironmentName]\Services\Workflows) || Step 6: Build a Test Patch (Containing files in the C:\AderantExpert\[EnvironmentName]\SharedBin folder)Import the Test Patch | Expected: SharedBin on all servers should be patched || Step 7: Create Domain Customizations (Custom tables & Columns, add them to Expert) in Dev environment Import the Customization packageBuild & Apply the customization in Deployment Manager

Title: Deploy Local Environments (Customization Workstation)
Steps: Step 1: Deploy Customization workstation environmenta. Create an environment manifest with Customization workstation typeb. All all roles to local serverc. Deploy Expert || Step 2: Run Sanity tests on all deployed products || Step 3: Import Workflow packages | Expected: Workflow files are installed on Local Server (C:\AderantExpert\[EnvironmentName]\Services\Workflows) || Step 4: Build a Test Patch (Containing files in the C:\AderantExpert\[EnvironmentName]\SharedBin folder)Import the Test Patch | Expected: SharedBin should be patched || Step 5: Create Domain Customizations (Custom tables & Columns, add them to Expert) in Dev environment Build & Apply the customization in Deployment Manager

Description: DeploymentEngine.exe Deploy Environment.manifest.xml

Title: Deploy with same SQL versions - Expert database, existing workflow or monitoring
Description:
Test deploying with:
Expert database - SQL2008
Workflow database - SQL2008
Monitoring database - SQL2008
 
Workflow and Monitoring databases exist in SQL 2008 and will be updated (names as per environment manifest in Deployment Manager)
 
Perform smoke test on deployed environment

Title: Deploy with same SQL versions - Expert database, no workflow or monitoring
Description:
Test deploying with:
Expert database only - SQL 2008
Workflow database - does not exist
Monitoring database - does not exist
 
Workflow and Monitoring databases should be created on SQL 2008 (names as per environment manifest in Deployment Manager)
 
Perform smoke test on deployed environment
Steps: Step 1: Using an existing Expert database (has had previous release(s)deployed to it), deploy with all roles checked. | Expected: -Deploy succeeds without errors -Monitoring and Workflow databases are created in SQL-Moniotring jobs are created: AutoPurge, ImportTransferEvents, ImportWcfEvents, ImportWfEvents

Title: Deployment Authoring Role -  Pre-req Validations
Description:
To ensure designer environment is properly configured, Deployment manager runs a pre-requisite check which includes:
 
1. Complete environment roles to be deployed are available in the binaries being deployed
2. Verifying Expert Service USER as a privilege user.
3. Existence of the network share location
4. SQL Server Agent service is running
5. Verifying existence of an existing deployment
6. The following are checked per role if applicable:
  a. MSDTC configured correctly
  b. IIS version 7
  c. AppFabric Event Collection installed
  d. AppFabric Workflow Management installed
  e. Message Queuing service is installed
  f. World Wide Web Publishing service is installde
  g. WS-Management service is installed
  h. .NET 4.0 Framework version or greater
  i. Remote powershell is enabled
7. Visual Studio 2010 Ultimate, Premium or Pro (and make sure that it is closed during deployment)

Title: Deployment Authoring Role - Ensure ExpertShare path uses local path
Description:
When deploying to the production environment, the ExpertShare path uses the Network path 
(i.e. \\WSAKL000658\ExpertShare)
 
When deploying the authoring role though, because Visual Studio uses local files, the ExpertLocation option inside VS2010 only allows local paths.

Title: Deployment Authoring Role - Verify that the ADERANT extension is installed
Description:
Upon openiing Visual Studio 2010, verify that the ADERANT authoring toolbar is visible.  This ensures that the ADERANT extension has been installed.
 
Alternatively, one can go to Tools => Extension Manager, and verify that the ADERANT Design Studio extension is installed.

Title: Set Role Arguments before deployment
Description:
Each deployment role may have parameters that may be set at the time of deployment. These are specific to roles and can be seen and edited in the bottom of the Environment tab in Deployment Manager.
 
Argument settings in deployment manager will be pushed to the following locations in Expert system:
Common application settings is in config under Preference - Applications - NotesExpert Expenses setting is in config under Business - ExpensesExpert Time Connections setting - need to find outFile Opening Service settings is in config under Technical - ConflictsSearchMatter Center Integration settings - need to find outMessaging Service settings - need to find outWorkflow Management settings is in FWM_ENVIRONMENT tableWorkflow On The Go settings is in FWM_ENVIRONMENT table
Steps: Step 1: Open Deployment Manager and check all roles in your environment | Expected: In the Roles Arguments section of the Environment tab, there are arguments that relate to most (but not all) roles || Step 2: Select Edit in the Deployment Manager ribbon and look for Roles Arguments section in Environment page | Expected: Section exists and editable || Step 3: Make changes to the following area then Deploy Expert:Common applicationExpert Expenses Expert Time Connections File Opening Service Matter Center Integration Messaging Service Workflow Management Workflow On The Go | Expected: After deployment, changes made in Role Arguments are pushed to the corresponding locations in Expert System(See summary page to find out full maping)

Title: Script failure
Description: Test that deployment fails when a SQL file (e.g stored procedure or view) fails. This sort of failure usuallly indicates that the database is not up-to-date. Either the latest UPD has not been run, or there is an issue with the scripts in/not in the UPD.

Title: Services autostart after deployment & reboot
Description: This test is to check for auto startup of Services after reboot on distributed service hosts
Steps: Step 1: Deploy Expert Suite. After deployment:a) check windows services: Control Panel > Administrative Tools > Servicesb) check IIS services and app pool in IIS managerc) check query service is running: http://localhost/Expert_Local/FrameworkServices/Query/QueryService.svc/ | Expected: a) ADERANT services StartUp Type defaults to: Automatic (Delayed Start)b) IIS services are started || Step 2: Reboot server(s) that services are hosted on | Expected: After reboot check services are started

Title: Test workflow can be completed  in a load balanced environment
Description: Regression testing should be carried out on a distributed environment (preferably load balanced) by default.

Title: Use Deployment function secondary functions using command line
Description: Other functions from Deployment Manager may be executed via command line

Title: Verify SPN registrations
Description:
An SPN is used to uniquely identify a service in the Active Directory.  Integrated windows authentication uses Kerberos authentication service first and then falls back to NTLM.
An SPN for the service is required for Kerberos to successfully authenticate the service.
 
A check is done during deployment to verify that SPNs exist for the Expert services, if any are missing then a DOS command file should be created in the expert sources folder - RegisterAderantSPNs.bat 
 
Pre-requisites:
Use a login account that has Domain Admin privileges
 
Prior to deployment check the existing SPNs registered, use command eg.  setspn -L service.expert.ap where service.expert.ap is the service account the Expert services run as.
 
Remove some existing SPNs to ensure that a RegisterAderantSPNs.bat is generated with the required setspn commands, use command eg. setspn -D [service] [service account]
 
Deploy to the environment
 
Test:
Verify that the RegisterAderantSPNs.bat exists and contains the setspn -A commands to add missing SPNs
Execute the RegisterAderantSPNs.bat file from a command line
Verify that the SPNs have been added using setspn -L
Remove and Re-deploy to verify that the SPNs added are verified in the deployment log

Title: BasicSF - Copy existing column SmartForms
Description:
When copying existing column SmartForms created on earlier versions of the software, the new copy should be regenerated using new versions of wizard, control, templates, properties etc without any issues.
 
Ensure all control types are used
 
Pre-upgrade set-up:
Create a column SmartForm that consumes one of each control type, and at least one 'OnLoaded' or 'OnValidate' script.
 
To Test:
After the upgrade, create a new column SmartForm by copying an existing column SmartForm that has been created on an earlier version of the software. 
 
Expected Result:
There should be no issues when generating the SmartForm via the WIzard.

To Test:

Expected Result:
There should be no issues when
(a) adding the SmartForm set to the workflow, or 
(b) when running the workflow

Title: WFAuthoring - Development workflows - do not survive IIS
Description: Development workflows are removed from IIS when an environment is removed. (The virutal path is removed). To run the workflow again in an authoring environment, the user must re-open the workflow solution/project using the 'Open Project' option in the Design Studio toolbar.

Title: Workflow Editing enables protocols http, net.pipe in IIS
Description:
When a development workflow is opened in Design Studio, the virtual directory should be created, and the Enabled Protocol property for the web app should be: http,net.pipe
 
To check:
1. Open workflow solution in VS (select 'Yes' to create virtual directory)
2. Launch IIS Manager
3. Find the workflow in the tree e.g. Sites>Default Web Site>Expert_Local>Development>xxx 
     where 'xxx' is the name of the workflow
4. Right-click on the workflow and select Manage>Advanced Settings, 
5. Check that the Enabled Protocols property is 'http,net.pipe'

Title: WF - Launch Status window for previously published workflow
Description:
If a workflow definition was published/imported BEFORE the upgrade, and there is no associated milestone metadata in FWM_WORKFLOW_MILESTONE, the metadata will be created for milestones launching the FIRST time the status window is launched after the upgrade.
 
On a build prior to when the metadata was released: e.g. SP4HotFix
1. import workflow package (can use the attached package 'FOV1Unchanged.zip'). Ensure that the FWM_WORKFLOW_MILESTONE table does not exist. Kick off a workflow
2. Upgrade to 8.0 build
3. After upgrade, check that the FWM_WORKFLOW_MILESTONE  now exists, but there is no associated metadata for the published workflow
(a) To get workflow definition uno:
select * from WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION
(b) Substitute workflow definition uno into the query below and run. There should be NOrows in the table for the milestones contained in the published workflow
select * from FWM_WORKFLOW_MILESTONE where WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION = 'xxx'
 
3. For the running workflow instance, launch the Status window (may take approximately 12 seconds to launch)
 
4.  Check the FWM_WORKFLOW_MILESTONE table. There should now be a row in the table for EACH milestone contained in the published workflow definition for which the status window was launched.
 
(a) To get workflow definition uno:
select * from WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION
 
(b) Substitute workflow definition uno into the query below and run. There should be a row in the table for EACH milestone contained in EACH published workflow
select * from FWM_WORKFLOW_MILESTONE where WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION = 'xxx'
 
5. Return to the running workflow instance, and launch the Status window again - should be a lot quicker, approximately 1 second

Title: Configuration created by client, new config created by Aderant has duplicate name
Description:
If clients have created a new confiugration entry in a particular version, and in an upgrade Aderant has created a new configuration by the same name, there should be a mechanism in the deployment that checks whether new configuration that is being created conflicts with configuration that may have been created by a client.
 
-- > If the config has the same path and name, there will most likely be a System value for the one created by deployment, and a Firm value for the one created by the client on site
--> Need a warning in deployment??? At runtime, the firm value will take precedence - may cause issue depending on what the config is used for by Aderant code.

Description:

Package:                               Client's own customization package has been assigned

Configuration NOT overwritten/changed by upgrade.

Techincal.ConflictsSearch.xxx
 
 
Test Data ('UpgradeTestConfig' package):
Techincal.ConflictsSearch.UseSoundex:
(a) Set value = False
(b) Assigned to package 'UpgradeTestConfig'

Title: Configuration updated by role files
Description:
The process of deployment creates some config items which have a scope of system even though the values are environment-specific. 
 
For most configuration, the default values are created via configuration packages which are imported by deployment as they are not dependent on the environment they are deployed to. 
Where it IS dependent on the environment (e.g. database/server locations etc), such config items are CREATED by the import of config packages with a blank value as we do not know the environment details at this point in time. A later step in the deployment goes through config specified in role files in and sets these config to use the environment details obtained from the environment manifest.
EACH of these values should have a Scope of 'System' and a Valid From date of today
 
Examples:
Technical.Instance.cmsnet.databasename 
Technical.Instance.cmsnet.Application.Connection 
Technical.Framework.Workflow.SmtpHost

Title: MAN_01. Setup data customisations on current version
Description:
Test that a package including data customizations can be imported into an upgraded environment and that there are no breaking changes.
 
1. Add the data customizations to your database by running the attached GENU scripts in DBGEN.exe. To do this:
   (a) Copy the GENU files attached to this test to a local directory
   (b) Launch DBGEN.exe from your CMS binaries folder
   (b) Select and connect to your database
   (c) Click on the Add button and select the GENU files from your local directory
   (d) Click on the Create button and select Yes/OK to create a UPD
   (e) Press the Process button
 
2. Import the customisation package. To do this:
    (a) Copy the 'CustomFOWorkflow.zip' attached to this test to a local directory
    (b) In Deployment Manager, import the package 
 
 
 
 
=============================================================================================
Any customization package created by client sites should be imported into an upgrade environment without any issues.
Pre-upgrade Set-up (each of these item types is included in the attached package)
Create a customization package that modifies FO including:
- Data customization (column AND table)
- SmartForms
- Configuration (e.g. including Action menu item to kick off workflow)
- Security Policy (e.g. to run workflow)
- Ad hoc lists
- Workflow
- Ad hoc files

Title: Existing Packages - Client categories - no modules assigned
Description:
If clients have created categories prior to upgrading to 80 (i.e. they did not have modules assigned to them),
 
(a) Deployment - no modules will be automatically assigned to client categories
(b) Export package containing category - category is a separate plugin in package, the module 110010 (Expert Workflow) will be allocated to the category in the package zip

Title: Existing Packages - Existing Packages - Aderant categories have modules assigned
Description:
After upgrading to 80 (or later), the categories created and owned by Aderant should have modules assigned to them.
 
Check categories by running below query, module_id should be populated with sensible module_id
SELECT MODULE_ID, * FROM FWM_CATEGORY
 
To find out which module  is assigned to the categories 
SELECT * FROM CMS_MODULE 
WHERE MODULE_ID IN (SELECT MODULE_ID FROM FWM_CATEGORY)

SELECT BILL_EMPL_UNO, _CONRTACT_START_DATE, _ESTIMATED_VALUE, _INDUSTRYTYPE, _QUANTITY,* FROM HBM_CLIENT WHERE CLIENT_CODE = 'XXX'

Title: Existing Packages -  SFs in packages created prior to 80 import
Description: No issues importing packages containing SFs created before 80 release

Title: Existing Packages - Re-generate SF using AddressBook
Description:
BUG 71681: Xaml error when SF using original AddressBook control is regenerated
 
The Address Book has been replaced with a more generic control - InlineAddressBook (AddressBook was specifically created for FO). You should no longer be able to SELECT it in step 3 of the SFW, however, you should be able 
- re-generate existing SFs that do use the original control
- run the control in a SF

Title: Existing Packages - Re-generate SF using DisplayTextBox control
Description:
The DisplayTextBox has been replaced with a more generic control - DisplayText. You should no longer be able to SELECT it in step 3 of the SFW, however, you should be able to
- re-generate existing SFs that do use the original control
- run the control in a SF
 
 
NOTE: The FileOpening.ClientSet uses a DisplayTextBox control in its summary to display the Client's email address

Any members that have been added are NOT lost on upgrade

Title: EA - Click once install with Vista PC
Description:
Set-Up SP1:
Install Click Once EA on a Vista client machine 
E.g. VMAKLEXPVISTA01, logged in as TTQA4
(Auto-start of EA is FALSE)
Clear cache
 
Post-Upgrade to HF1: 
Launch EA from the Start menu on the Vista machine. Click Once should upgrade without any notification (silent install). In addition to the standard splash screen for EA, the user will also notice a progress window appear in the top left-hand corner of the screen which will automatically close.

Title: EA - Click once install with Windows7
Description:
Set-Up SP1:
Install Click Once EA on a Windows7 client machine 
E.g. WSAKL000602, logged in as TTQA4
Clear cache
 
Post-Upgrade to HF1: 
Launch EA from the Start menu on the Windows7 machine. 
Click Once should upgrade without any notification (silent install). 
In addition to the standard splash screen for EA, the user will also notice a progress window appear in the top left-hand corner of the screen which will automatically close.

Title: EA - Click once survives Expert upgrade on XP, auto-start disabled
Description:
Test that when the framework is upgraded, that the click once version still functions, and that any new features are auto discovered.
 
Test with an upgrade of the click once manifest itself.
 
Test with an upgrade of the framework without a change to the manifest.
 
Both cases should invoke the upgrade process.
 
Steps:
1. Install click once on Version a on a client machine (WSAKL000500, user login = TTQA3). In EA settings, set Auto-start to 'False'
2. Shut down the assistant (DONT uninstall)
3. Perform a server side upgrade using deployment engine.
4. Try and reopen the assistant from the client machine's program menu
5. User sdhould be prompted that a new version exists, and they wish to upgrade. (unless app has been signed and certificate is installed on client --> Silent install , no user interaction required)
6. Upgrade should take place, and user can use the assitant.

Title: EA - Click once to XP client, running during upgrade
Description:
If ExpertAssistant has been installed via Click Once on a client machine prior to the upgrade, the user should be able to launch ExpertAssistant from their local install without having to uninstall first, or return to the ExpertShare folder to install again.
 
Set-Up SP1:
Install Click Once EA on a XP client machine, leave client machine RUNNING during upgrade (EA closed, however)
Install Click Once Timer on a XP client machine, leave client machine RUNNING during upgrade (EA closed, however)
- also has a TimerGadget set up for National Groceries CC400, NGM001. 4h35m21s
 
E.g. WSAKL000539.ap.aderant.com, logged in as TTQA2
 
Post-Upgrade to HF1: 
1. Launch EA from the Start menu on the XP machine. 
--> Click Once should upgrade without any notification (silent install). 
--> In addition to the standard splash screen for EA, the user will also notice a progress window appear in the top left-hand corner of the screen which will automatically close.
 
 
To check the version that is installed go to the loocation below and check the File Version of the files matches the file version of the files from the release you have upgraded to.
 
XP:

Windows7:
C:\Users\kalpana.mitthal\AppData\Local\Apps\2.0\Data\K7ABV3T5.5G0\N4712V0A.QAG\expe..tant_0000000000000000_0001.0008_bcdbf703f8c04812\Data
 
(Note: the folders that look like random numbers maybe a bit different in each environment).
 
 
 
When the user launches Expert Assistant from where it has been locally installed, the local installation should be automatically updated to the new version. (They will know this because they will get a prompt to notify them that a more recent version is available).

Title: EA - Click Once to XP client, shutdown during upgrade, auto-start enabled
Description:
The first time EA is accessed after an upgrade is when the Auto-start setting kicks in the first time a user logs into their machine after the upgrade
(rather than them already being logged into their machine the first time the launch EA after the environment is upgraded)
 
Set-Up SP1:
1. Install Click Once EA on a XP client machine.
2. Ensure Auto-start of Expert Assistant is set to TRUE for EA
3. Install Click Once Timer on a XP client machine.
   - TimerGadget:  no matter, 15h 22m, 28s, Phase task=L100.L190, narrative=Some notes added pre-upgrade
4, Leave client machine SHUT DOWN or log off during upgrade
e.g. WSAKL000599, logged in as TTQA1
 
Post-Upgrade to HF1: 
1. Start up client machine
2. Launch EA from the Start menu on the XP machine. 
3. Click Once should upgrade without any notification (silent install). 
4. In addition to the standard splash screen for EA, the user will also notice a progress window appear in the top left-hand corner of the screen which will automatically close.
Steps: Step 1: Pre-upgrade:1. Install Click Once EA on a XP client machine.2. Ensure Auto-start of Expert Assistant is set to TRUE for EA3. Install Click Once Timer on a XP client machine. - TimerGadget: no matter, 15h 22m, 28s, Phase task=L100.L190, narrative=Some notes added pre-upgrade4, Leave client machine SHUT DOWN or log off during upgradee.g. WSAKL000599, logged in as TTQA1 || Step 2: Post-Upgrade: Start up client machine Launch EA from the Start menu on the XP machine. | Expected: Click Once should upgrade without any notification (silent install). In addition to the standard splash screen for EA, the user will also notice a progress window appear in the top left-hand corner of the screen which will automatically close.

Description: If previously had CO install, and changing to MSI install, the configuration cache and MRUs should survive

Title: EA - Uninstall EA Click Once after upgrade, re-install after upgrade
Description:
If the user has NOT uninstalled their Click Once version BEFORE the upgrade, they must be able to uninstall AND re-install AFTER the upgrade.
 
 
BEFORE UPgrade
Install EA Click Once on WSAKL000500, user TTQA3

To do this, from the Control Panel on the client machine, go to 'Programs and Features', select Expert Assistant, and click on 'Uninstall' button

Title: BT_Add User Alert Activity - Base DesignTime Test
Description:
Basic end-to-end smoke test for the Add User Alert activity
 
1. Drag Add User Alert activity onto workflow 
2. Set the Alert Type to "Warning"
3. Set Message - "Time Entry Reminder"
4. Set SubMessage - "Remember to enter time for this work. Click on the '!' icon to copy the task code for your time entry."
5. Set Additional Information - "RESEARCH"
6. Set source - "Research Task"
7. Add an approval activity after the Add User Alert activity
   - Remove all SmartForms except the Text SmartForm. Change the text to 
     "An alert should be displayed at the top of this task. Close the alert using the 'X' "
   - Set the task performer to workflow.initiator
8. Run the workflow and ensure that
   a. The alert is displayed at the top of the approval task
   b. The alert type, message and description display the details as set per the properties
   c. Click on the '!' icon and then paste into any doc e.g. Notepad. The word "RESEARCH" should be pasted from the clipboard
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: BT_Add User Alert Activity - Base Runtime Test
Description:
Test the Add User Alert activity at run time by running a a workflow that already consumes the AddUserAlert activity. 
 
1. Extract attached zip to local directory (choose the correct one for the GG version you are testing)
2. Navigate to the extract location and delete the SharedBin folder (IMPORTANT!!!! Otherwise your workflow might not run) 
2. Open workflow solution in workflow designer
3. Run workflow and follow instructions for tests as per tasks that appear
 
*BUG 69018 User alert of type "Warning" and "Error" causes error messages saying "Task is about to close" in WF tasks
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Display multiple alerts in task
Description:
The height of the alert bar at the top of tasks should increase to fit up to two entire alerts.If there are more than two alerts a vertical scroll bar should appear.
 
--> This is generic user alert behaviour, i.e. when you already have alerts in your collection. It is not affected by the Add User Alert activity that creates the alert.

Title: Export-Import-Run - Add User Alert Activity
Description: Check that if you export a package that contains the new version of the Add User Alert activity and a workflow that it is consumed in, then import into another environment, it behaves as expected at runtime in the second environment.

Title: Leave alert open in task window
Description: If an alert is still open at the time of completing a task, the alert will appear in the next manual task that the workflow creates.

Title: Set additional information property
Description:
The Additional Information property is used to specify text that will be copied to clipboard when the alert level icon is pressed at runime (VB Expression).
 
Test
(a) Setting the Additional Information Property when you add the Add User Alert activity to a workflow. 
Verify that when the alert is displayed in a task, clicking on the Error/Warning/Info icon will copy that detail to the clipboard. This can be tested by "pasting" (from the clipboard) into another document after pressing the icon.
(b) The property is a VB expression. Test this typing in explicit text as well as using workflow variables

Title: Set alert sub message
Description:
The Sub Message is a second set of more detailed information that is displayed in smaller font below the alert title.
 
Test:
(a) Setting this in the workflow designer, and ensure that the text entered is displayed in the alert below the title.
(b) The property is a VB expression. Test this typing in explicit text as well as using workflow variables

Title: Set alert type
Description:
The alert type property is used to give a visual indicator to the user of the importance/seriousness of the alert. 
 
Check that:
(a) In workflow designer, the 'Alert Type' property for the Add User Alery activity has 3 options: Error/Warning/Info
(b) At runtime, the alert displays the icon that matches the alert type selected

Title: Set message
Description:
The message propery represents the primary title for the alert. 
 
Check that:
(a) The property is required - you cannot run/build the WF without this property being set
(b) The property is a VB expression. Test this typing in explicit text as well as using workflow variables
(c) The text that you enter is displayed in the alert

Title: Set source property
Description:
The source property can be set on alerts so that they can be identified later in the workflow and actioned. 
 
Test:
(a) Setting the property to a simple word (e.g. 'ConflictsApproval')
(b) Later in the workflow insert a Dynamic Script Acitivity that removes any alerts with the source specified above
      e.g. Replace 'xxx' in the last row with the source you set in (a)
 
import clr
clr.AddReference('Aderant.Workflow.Activities')
from Aderant.Workflow.Activities import WorkflowScript
from Aderant.Framework.Logging import LogLevel
 
class Workflow(WorkflowScript):
 
    def DynamicScript(self):
        #add your code here
        self.Data.RemoveUserAlerts('xxx')
 
(c) Add a manual activity between the Add User Alert activity and the Dynamic Script activity, and another manual task activity after the dynamic script activity - each with any details
(d) Run the workflow, ensure that:
                       i. On the first manual activity, the alert is displayed (DO NOT CLOSE THE ALERT BEFORE COMPLETING THE TASK)
                       ii. On the second manual activity, the alert is NOT displayed (as it has been removed via the Dynamic Script activity)

Title: Use case 01 - Replace FO script with activity
Description:
In File Opening, the last note from the admin approvals, is added to the alert collection if one of the admin approvals is declined. This alert is then seen in the Intake task when the workflow returns to this task. At the moment, a Dynamic Script activity is used to get the data and add it to the alert collection.
 
Test replacing the section of the Dynamic Script activity that sets the alert with an 'Add User Alert' activity.

Title: Use case 02 - Consume multiple alert activities
Description:
An alert is added to the User Alert collection for EACH instance of the Add User Alert activity. I.e. They are appended to the list. 
 
They will not overwrite or replace each other unless one is closed in a task when it is completed, and another alert is added subsequent to this.

Title: Validate required properties
Description:
When an instance of the Add User Alert activity is linked up in a workflow (via the arrows) the required properties will be validated. 
 
Required Properties:
- Type
- Message

Title: BT _ Workflow References activity - Base DesignTime Test
BT_V2 Task Replicator - Base Runtime test
Description:
1. To get SFs used by the workflow, import ReplicatorV2TestSF.zip via Deployment Manager
2. Extract V2TaskReplicator.zip 
3. Delete Shared Bin (will get re-created when you open the solution)
4. Open solution in Visual Studio
5. Run workflow form Visual Studio, follow instructions/expectations in task

Where task.CompletedByUser.Email = "ttqa1@aderant.com"
Select task).Any
 
 
* Client "Arden Industries" selected on at least 2 tasks
(From task In progress.TasksCompleted
From data In task.TaskData
Where data.Key = "Client" AndAlso CType(data.Value, Aderant.Query.ViewModels.Client).DisplayName = "Arden Industries"
Select task).Distinct.Count >= 2

(From task In progress.TasksCompleted
From data In task.TaskData
Where data.Key = "Number" AndAlso CType(data.Value, System.Int32) > 20
Select task).Any

Title: Task Replicator - Percentage Responded
Description:
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
------------------------
 
After each replicated task is completed, the condition on the task replicator should be evaluated. At this point:
 
1. Calculate the percentage that has responded with the expected response, by assessing,
   (a) Of the tasks that have been completed, how many have responded with the Expected Response
   (b) How many tasks were created by the replicator activity?
   (c) Calculate Percentage Responded by: (a)/(b) * 100 
 
2. Using the Percentage Responded and the value in the Amount property on the task replicator
   (a) If Percentage Responded < Amount --> workflow should wait for futher replicated tasks to be completed before re-evalutating
   (b) If Percentage Responded = Amount --> workflow should cancel any incomplete replicated tasks and move on
   (c) If Percentage Responded > Amount --> workflow should cancel any incomplete replicated tasks and move on 
        (e.g. Amount is an even number such as 5, but there is an odd number of replicated tasks such as 3)
   (d) If the (number of replicated tasks that have been completed)/(number of replicated tasks created) is greater than the Amount but Percentage Responded is still less than the Amount. --> wait for futher replicated tasks to be completed before re-evalutating
   (e) If all replicated tasks have been completed and the Percentage Responded still not >= Amount --> workflow should move on
Steps:
Step 1: Add Task Replicator activity to a workflow and drag an approval activity as the task to be replicated. Set the Completion Type to 'Percentage Responded' | Expected: The Expected Value list has the approval options from the approval task || Step 2: Set the Completion Type to 'Percentage Complete' and and set to any percentage less than 100
Set Expected Value to any of the approval choices || Step 3: At runtime, 
- complete at least one of the replicated tasks with an approval choice that does NOT match the Expected Value
- complete some (same number as Amount on task replicator activity) of the replicated tasks with an approval choice that DOES match the Expected Value | Expected: The workflow moves on from the task replicator once the number of users that have completed the task with an approval choice matching the Expected Value is an equal or greater perentage than the number of users that received the task.The workflow also moves on if all tasks generated by task replicator has been completed

Title: Task Replicator - Set amount as a variable
Description: Test that if the Amount property (used for % completed, response completed, count completed, count  ..) is set to a variable (rather than a fixed number), the replicator evaluates correctly.

Title: Task Replicator - Simple vs complex condition properties
Description:
1. The design surface exposes simple completion criteria only:
            (a) Completion Type
            (b) Amount
            (c) Expected Value
            (d) Security Plan
 
2. In the property grid, 
            Category:                                               Properties:
            Completion                                               Use Advanced Criteria (default=FALSE)
            Completion Criteria                                   Amount (VB expression)
                                                                             Completion Type (4 choices: Percentage Complete, Percentage Responded with Value, Number Complete, Number Responded with Value)
                                                                             Expected Value (Approval choices from approval task within replicator)
            Completion Criteria-Advanced                 Completion Condition (VB expression)
 
            NOTE: The properties in the property grid will ALWAYS be enabled in the property grid, as we are unable to dynamically enabled/disable the state of them unless we use our own controls (not a realistic 
                       option)
 
3. The state of properties in the design surface may change depending on the value of some of the properties. If:
            (a) Completion Type=Percentage Complete --> Amount enabled, Expected Value disabled on design surface
            (b) Completion Type=Percentage Responded with Value--> Amount enabled, Expected Value enabled on design surface
            (c) Completion Type=Number Complete --> Amount enabled, Expected Value disabled on design surface
            (d) Completion Type=NumberResponded with Value--> Amount enabled, Expected Value enabled on design surface
            (e) Use Advanced Criteria --> Completion Type, Amount, Expected Value are ALL disabled on design surface

Check the Notes button in the task | Expected: Ensure that 
- a new note is created at run time for the next task in the workflow.
- the note is flagged as important
- the note has the attachment assigned at design time
- the new note is launched from any task that is past this point of the sequence. || Step 8: Check the notes attached to the workflow from the process list in Expert Assistant | Expected: Ensure that

Title: "Query by id" activity design & run test
Description:
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
----------------
 
Basic end-to-end smoke test for the Query By Id activity
 
1. Create a workflow variable called "ArdenClient". The type should be "Client"
2. "Drag Query By Id" activity onto workflow 
3. Set the Source to 'Clients'
4. Set the Id clause to: 1
5. Set Result to variable: ArdenClient
6. Set the Expands property (this line can be ignore until updated)
7. Add an approval activity to workflow 
        a. Attach a decsion.text SmartForm. Change the text to 
              "Arden client xxx is : " & ArdenClient.DisplayName
        b. Set the task performer to workflow.initiator
8. Run the workflow and check that in the approval activity, the list of clients and their displaynames match results from the SQL below:
        select * from hbm_client where CLIENT_UNO = '1'
 
 
 
**OLD STUFF IGNORE**
Add an Assign activity
        a. On the LHS, set variable: "FrankfurtClientList
        b. On the RHS, set: ""
Steps: Step 1: To access the "Query By Id" activity, open up a workflow solution then open the "Toolbox" pane | Expected: "Query" activity available under "Expert" in the toolbox || Step 2: Create an "Query By Id" activity from the toolbox and check the designer surface | Expected: The following properties should be availablea) Source - This dropbox should show all items within the domain, including customized items (e.g. custom tables, columns)b) Id - Provide the id of the entity to fetchc) Result - workflow variable to store the query result, ONLY accepts variables of type ViewModelObservableCollection<T> (I think this is meant to be changed to Clients instead)d) Check all fields have appropriate prompt and tooltip || Step 3: Check the properties pane of the "Query By Id" activity | Expected: The following properties should be available:a) Expands - Define expand paths to pre-fetch in the result set (e.g. BusinessEntity/Addresses)b) Id - Provide the id of the entity to fetchc) Ignore Not Found Error - Ignores error caused by entity not foundd) DisplayName - Display name of the activitye) Result - Workflow variable to store the query result, ONLY accepts variables of type ViewModelObservableCollection<T> (I think this is meant to be changed to Clients instead)f) Check all fields have appropriate prompt and tooltip || Step 4: Scenario 1: Query all clients in London office-Select CLIENT as source-Enter Id: 100154-Create a variable of type Client for result (Using '+' button) -Add a "Log" activity after the "Query by id":a) Set level as Fatalb) Set message: "Client: " + Client.DisplayName | Expected: -This should fetch the client: Becky's Bakery-A fatal error is logged with message "Client: Becky's Bakery" (From event viewer and workflow runner log window)-Verify the result in SQL: select * from HBM_CLIENT where id = '100154' || Step 5: Scenario 2: Result not foundUsing the same workflow as #1, change to anything that does not exist in the database (e.g. 9999901) | Expected: -You should get an error in event viewer and workflow runner log window that "Query by id" failed that client with requested id was not found-The workflow should fault at this point with appropriate status and error messages || Step 6: Scenario 3: Ignore not found error-Using the same workflow as #2, check the "Ignore Not Found Error" option on the "Query by id" activity properties-Remove the log activity-add a smartform task activity to show "Client.DisplayName" and set task performer to yourself | Expected: -No error on "client was not found"-No data is shown by "Client.DisplayName" in the smartform-Workflow moves on after the query activity with no errors

Title: BT_Query By Id Activity - Base Runtime Test
Description:
The base runtime test for this activity is combined with the Query Activity. Refer to:
 
Test Path:         ..\Workflow\Workflow Creation\Workflow Activities\Query Activity
Test Name:       BT_QueryActivities - Base Runtime Test

Title: Default Display Name for QById activity
Description:
The Display Name property is displayed on the design surface for this instance of the Query By Id activity 
 
Test:
1. Add an instance of this acitivity to your workflow -->  the display name should defaults to "Fetch Client"
2. Change the Source value from 'Clients' to something else -->  the display name should change to "Fetch <xxx>" where xxx is the source that was selected (after you set focus away from the activity)
3. Manually change the Display Name (either on the design surface or in the property grid) --> changing the Source should not overwrite the DisplanName

Title: Set expands property
Description:
If you do not set the expands property, when the data is fetched, you will not be able to drill into deeper levels of that object unless you have expanded at the time the query activity does the fetch.
 
E.g.
If the Query By Id activity fetches a Matter, you cannot drill into Matter.Parties in a subsequent Dynamic Script activity
Therefore, at the time of adding the Query Activity to the workflow, you must set the Expands property to "Parties"

Title: Set Id property
Description:
When an instance of the Query By Id activity is linked up in a workflow (via the arrows) the Id will be validated. 
 
The expression on the Id property must resolve to a single item that is a  non-nullable integer
 
Test:
For each of the following scenarios, test an end-to-end workflow where a Query By Id activity is added to a workflow
1. Id property set to a fixed integer value
2. Id property set to a non-nullable integer variable
3. Id property set to a view model attribute/variable
Other tests:
5. If the variable/attrtibute that you are linking to is a nullable integer, you will get a validation message regarding mismatched types since the property is 
you should use the 'Value' property to allow the expression to match on type e.g. 'xxx.Value' where xxx is the nullable variable/attribute
 
???6. Variable resolves to more than one integer value --> NOT POSSIBLE...

Title: Set Result property
Description:
The Result property is used to specify the variable that the fetched item will be saved/stored (VB Expression). The type of the variable you specify match the type of the 'Source' you have selected.
 
Test:
1. Test setting the Result property to a variable that is of the same type e.g. Source = Clients, property variable is of type Aderant.Query.ViewModels.Client - no validation errors when task linked into workflow
2. Test setting the Result property to a variable that is not of the same type e.g. Source = Clients, property variable is of type Aderant.Query.ViewModels.Employee - validation error when task linked into workflow
3. Test an end-to-end workflow where a Query By Id activity is added to a workflow, the result property is set to a variable and the use the variable later in the workflow to  view/manipulate/action the data e.g. in Dynamic Script Activity
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Use case 01  - Email all matter part employees for matter
Description:
File Opening Customization Use Case:
For each matter participating employee, send an email to notifiy them that the matter intake is complete.
 
As the MatterParticipatingEmployees view model only has employee ids without the full employee object, there is no automatic access to the email address for these employees without expanding the view model. Must therefore use the query service (hence the Query Activity) to get the rest of the employee object to get these details.
 
Steps:
1. Clone FO workflow
2. Add a Query Activity that fetches a collection of the full Employee ViewModel (as far down as email address) based upon the EmployeeIds on items in the Matter Participating Employee collection
3. Add a for/while loop that iterates through each of the employees in the collection fetched 
4. Add an Email Activity that sends an email to the email address for each of the matter participating employees in the collection fetched
 
*** OR SHOULD THE QUERY ACTIVITY BE INSIDE THE LOOP??

Title: Use case 02 - Use throw property - Id not resolved
Description:
The 'Throw if not found' property will determine whether or not the workflow will fault if no sinlge Id is found (Checkbox)
 
Test:
1. When Query By Id activity is dragged onto design surface, the property defaults to true
2. If ticked, and no item with given Id is found at runtime, the workflow will fault
3. If not ticked, and no item with given Id is found at runtime, the workflow will NOT fault, but will instead move on to the next activity in the workflow

Title: V1 Query Activity - Base DesignTime Test

Title: Milestone activity - when Report if incomplete is set to false
Description:
By default, the Report if Incomplete property is set to true. So if a workflow has not been through the milestone yet, the Pending Milestone name will display in the status window for workflow instances.
If the property is false (this may be desired if the milestone is in a parallel activity branch with conditions), the milestone will not be displayed at all in the workflow status window UNTIL/UNLESS the workflow has actually passed through it.
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Parallel Milestone percentage displays as one in the Status window
Description:
Ensure that when Milestone activities in parallel with the same percentage complete will be displayed as one once workflow passed through the milestone activity.
 
To Test:
1. Drag a parallel activity into the design surface where for braches with a task and a milesotne activity is placed in each branch.
2.  In the milestone activity, enter the same value in percentage complete (i.e. 25).  Set the Completed name different from each one.
3.  In the Parallel activity property, set completion condition to 'True'
4.  Run the workflow and complete one of the tasks.
 
Expected Result: when status is checked from the Process list in EA, the status should display only one Milestone activity from the branch where the task was completed.
 
NOTE:

Title: BT_Launch Workflow activity - Base DesignTime Test
Ensure that all Process Data values like initiator are persisted over to the launched workflow
Description:
Ensure that process data is not Workflow.Service in the launched workflow.
 
To test:
1. Create and publish a workflow to be launched where there is only an email activity within the flow.
  - make sure that the SendEmail activity has the 'ProcessData.InitiatorEmail' in the 'To' field.
2. Create and publish another workflow calling that above workflow using LaunchWorkflow activity.
3. Create an Action menu item for the second workflow 
    (see http://ttwiki/wiki/index.php?title=Creating_Action_Menu_Items)
4. Run the second workflow, an email should be sent to self proving that the process data from calling workflow were ported over to the called workflow.

Title: BT_Escalation activity - Base DesignTime Test
Description:
Ensure that the Escalation activity can be dragged within a Flowchart-type workflow.
 
The Escalation activity is composed of:
1. Escalation wrapper - Ensure that when an Escalation activity is dreagged to the design surface, two bracnhes are automatically in place.  Aside frm the Delay activity in each, one of them should have an Escalate Task activity and the other an Assign activity where Display Name = 'Cancel Escalation'
2. Task activity
3. Escalation branches where a Delay activity is automatically added and the Escalate Task activity or an Assign activity can be added.
    a. Using Escalate Task - ensure that the Security plan dialog is launched and that users or groups can be added to the matrix to whom the task is escalated
    b. Assign activity - default Display Name is 'Cancel Escalation' which assigned the value True to a variable called cancelEscalation.  This branch is used to cancel the tasks within the Escalation wrapper after the specified delay period.  Ensure that a different boolean variable can be used and the variable can be set o either True or False.

Title: Escalation - Escalate Task activities
Description:
The Escalation activity should support all types of manual task that are available.
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.

Title: Escalation - Multiple escalation branches
Description:
NOTE:

Title: Escalation - parallel escalations - no conflict
Description:
Ensure that if you have more than one escalation branches (for different workflows) that start around the same time, the act of escalation is performed on the correct task.
(There was an issue where the last task created for an escalation branch was considered to be the "active" one, and this would be the one that gets escalated even if the wait period that expired was for a different workflow).
 
E.g.
(a) Workflow 1 - Escalation Branch has (wait period of 1 min) - First task created - do not complete
(b) Workflow 2 - Escalation Branch has (wait period of 5 mins) - First task created - do not complete
(c) Wait for wait period on workflow 1 to expire (1 minute)
 
--> Check that the task from workflow 1 is escalated, and not the task from workflow 2

Title: Escalation properties - Escalate Task
Description:
Verify that the following property fields are editable according to designer preference: 
 
1. Description - a brief note describing the purpose of this Workflow Activity.
2. Display Name - the name that is displayed for the activity on the workflow design surface
3. Alteration Strategy - specifies the option by which task is escalated (Replace or Append, see above)
4. Security Plan - specifies the security policy to be applied to the activity.  Specify the user/s to whom the task is replicated.

Title: Escalation properties - Escalation Branch
Description:

1. Description - a placeholder for any text that designer can  use to describe what the task does
2. DisplayName - ensure that when text is modified here, design surface display name also changes on lost focus

Title: Escalation properties - Escalation wrapper
Description:
Verify that the following property fields are editable according to designer preference: 
 
1. Completion Condition  - Default value is 'cancelEscalation' which is a variable created durig design time when Escalation activity is dragged to the design surface.  Ensure that any variable can be assigned to this property
2. Description - a placeholder for any text that designer can  use to describe what the task does
3. DisplayName - ensure that when text is modified here, design surface display name also changes on lost focus

Title: BT_Dynamic Script activity properties - Design Time Test
Description:
Ensure that the following design surface properties correctly behave as intended:
 
1. Edit Script - ensure that an IronPython script editor is launched when button is selected
2. Advanced checkbox - ensure that selecting this will expose the following fields:
   a. File Name - ensure that files in the App_Data folder of the solution are present in the dropdown (default is Workflow.py).  Ensure that a python file can also be created when Workflow.py is not selected and designer defines a file name.
   b. Ensure that a method name can be defined within the selected script.  Test adding of a new method name and test multiple methods being created.
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps:
Step 1: Check that the Dynamic Script activity is available for workflows | Expected: - Is in Expert section of activity toolbox
- Is available for both flowchart and sequential workflows || Step 2: Drag activity onto workflow | Expected: Properties on design surface:

Properties in property grid: || Step 3: Check that workflow variables can be consumed in workflow properties | Expected: - Workflow variables can be set in apporpriate properties || Step 4: Press the Edit Script button | Expected: - An IronPython script editor is launched
- Ensure that workflow variables can be used within Python scripts (using Dynamic Script activity) || Step 5: Select the Advanced checkbox | Expected: The following fields are exposed:
   a. File Name - ensure that files in the App_Data folder of the solution are present in the dropdown (default is Workflow.py).  Ensure that a python file can also be created when Workflow.py is not selected and designer defines a file name.
   b. Ensure that a method name can be defined within the selected script.  Test adding of a new method name and test multiple methods being created. || Step 6: Attach a python file to the App_Data folder in Solution Explorer that includes more than one method | Expected: Note: You can edit the workflow.py file and add multiple methods to this file || Step 7: In the Dynamic Script activity, select the file and method you wish the activity to call. || Step 8: Drag another Dynamic Script activity onto the workflow design surface and write a simple python script || Step 9: Run the workflow | Expected: BOTH scripts execute as expected

Title: Approve Activity using properties in Property pane
Description:
Verify that the following property fields are editable according to designer preference: 
 
1. Smartforms - ensure that the configure smartform window is launched when the elipsis is selected [...] and that whatever changes applied persisted when the window is re-opened.
2. Task Name - ensure that the field is editable and WF variables can be used to append to the added text
3. Control Language - ensure that control language can be CSharp (default) or IronPython
4. Control Source - ensure that an Expression Editor dialog is opened when the elipsis [...] is selected
5. Completed By User - this defaults to a variable called completedByUser.  Designers can use this variable within the workflow to fetch the Display Name (i.e. completedByUser.DisplayName) , email address, ID and External ID. of the user who completed the task 
6. Parameters - ???
7. Description - a placeholder for any text that designer can  use to describe what the task does
8. DisplayName - ensure that when text is modified here, design surface display name also changes on lost focus
9. External Applicaiton - ???
10. Default Conversation Name - ensure that this property accepts texts and can use variables and notes created within the task will default to whatever is specified here on runtime
11. Notes Embedded - ensure that Notes field at the bottom of the task form is present when this is ticked.
12. Completion Responsibility - Solo (default) or Shared. This property will determine whether the task will disappear when one of the performers accepted it (Solo) or the task can be seen in the inbox of all performers until task is completed (Shared)
13. Include Global Security - ticked means all task performers in the Global Task Security will be appended to the task level security.
14. Security Plan - ensure that the task securer window is launched and that whatever changes applied persisted when the window is re-opened.

- Drag on Approval activity

- Drag on SmartForm task activity
                 - property = FALSE by default

--> Check runtime

ALWAYS PRESENT

Title: Toolbox - Only exposes V2 of Approval Activity
Description:
There are two versions of the Approval Activity
 
V1 supports approval choices in the form of SmartForms
V2 supports approval choices in a header at the top of the activity (as well as the SmartForms). The default option is to use the new header approvals instead of SmartForms
 
When adding new instances of the Approval activity onto a workflow, only V2 should be applied.
V1 is supported only for existing workflow instances that already consume this version

Test The Data picker, ensure users can select from the picker, as well as over write any value by typing.
What Data formats does this accept?

Title: BT_Query Activity - Base DesignTime Test
Description:
(Need Update)
 
Basic end-to-end smoke test for the Query activity
 
1. Create a workflow variable called "FrankfurtClients". The type should be ViewModelObservableCollection<Client>
2. Create another workflow variable called "FrankfurtClientsList" of type String
3. Drag Query activity onto workflow 
4. Set the Source to 'Clients'
5. Set the where clause to: item.OfficeId="FRAN"
6. Set Result to variable: FrankfurtClients
7. Add an Assign activity
        a. On the LHS, set variable: FrankfurtClientList
        b. On the RHS, set: String.Join(", ", From client In FrankfurtClients Select client.DisplayName)
8. Add an approval task activity to workflow 
        a. Attach a decsion.text SmartForm. Change the text to 
              "Frankfurt clients are: " & FrankfurtClientList
        b. Set the task performer to workflow.initiator
9. Run the workflow and check that in the approval activity, the list of clients and their displaynames match results from the SQL below:
        select * from hbm_client where OFFC = 'FRAN'

Description:

2. Change the Source value from 'Clients' to something else -->  the display name should change to "Query <xxx>" where xxx is the source that was selected (after you set focus away from the activity)
3. Manually change the Display Name (either on the design surface or in the property grid) --> changing the Source should not overwrite the DisplanName

Title: Set expands property
Description:
If you do not set the expands property, when the data is fetched, you will not be able to drill into deeper levels of that object unless you have expanded at the time the query activity does the fetch.
 
E.g.
If the Query activity fetches clients, you cannot drill into Client.BusinessEntity.Addresses in a subsequent Dynamic Script activity
Therefore, at the time of adding the Query Activity to the workflow, you must set the Expands property to "Addresses"
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Set Result property (Query Activity)
Description:
The result property must be set to a variable of type: ViewModelObservableCollection <of T>
 
If set to any other type, the activity will not validate

Steps: Step 1: Set the where clause using a static value in the Query Activity - In the where clause, type Item.Id = 1 | Expected: No validation error || Step 2: Test it works by adding a smartform task to the workflow below the query activity- Edit Smartforms: create a new smartform. Fill in required fields and change smartform type to 'grid form'. Add/View Items. Change the radio button to "Workflow Scope". In the 'Selected Item' field at the top, select the down arrow and retrieve your Result variable from the Query Activity in the workflow (defaulted to QueryResult when you added it). Right-click on the variable you just added and "Select as grid source". Expand the variable and find "DisplayName" (tick this) and then done. Finish SmartformWizard and add this smartform to your smartform task- Security plan: set initiator as Task PerformerRun the workflow | Expected: Check that when the workflow is run, the task that gets assigned to you displays the correct client that corresponds to the query item.id = 1 (in most databases this will be Arden Industries)

Title: Import sample workflow SmartForms (SP1 Version and Earlier)
Description:
Before any of the sample workflows can be run, the SmartForms that are consumed must be created/added. To do this, import the following package into your environment using Deployment Manager:
 
C:\ExpertShare\Workflows\Samples\SampleWorkflows.zip

Title: SampleWF, AR Over 120 - Configure and Package (SP1 Version and Earlier)
Description:
** See customization guide for additional steps for running the published version of this workflow
 
1. In Windows Explorer, navigate to C:\ExpertShare\Workflows\Samples, and extract Workflow.Samples.Template.zip to a local directory
2. In Design Studio, and open the workflow solution 'Workflow.Samples.Template.sln' from the extract location
3. Open the workflow.xamlx for Aderant.Workflow.Samples.AROver120
4. Assign a package to the workflow
5. In Configuration Manager, create an Action menu item an assign to the same package as the workflow (details to create action menu item below)
6. Export the package via Design Studio
7. Import/publish in production environment
8. Run through workflow in production environment using the Action menu item created in EA
 
Path:   Technical.Applications.Actions
Name: StartAROver120Workflow
Value:
<Action displayName="AR Over 120" description="Start AR Over120 WF" resourceDescriptor="" imageUri="pack://application:,,,/Aderant.PresentationFramework.Images;component/FileOpening/FileOpeningSmall.xaml" imageKey="FileOpeningSmall">
            <Script>
import clr
#This will start a published workflow.  You need to hardcode the name below.
clr.AddReference('Aderant.Workflow')
from Aderant.Workflow import WorkflowInitiator
workflowInitiator = WorkflowInitiator("Aderant.Workflow.Samples.AROver120")
NotificationId = workflowInitiator.Start()
            </Script>

Title: Task notifications (Toaster) in Expert Assistant
Description:
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
---------------------------------
If a grouped notification is received, the user may click on the 'X' to close it. If they do so, they should not receive ANY further task notifications in the next 30 seconds. These are just never received. Any notifications received AFTER 30 seconds, will be displayed, and will resume usual behavior.
 
Things to Test:
1. Launch two Visual Studio, and open two different workflow
2. Use workflow runner to kick off 20 instances for each workflow
3. When the grouped task notification appears, click on the 'x' before it reaches a count of 20
4. Check that: 
    (a) The task notification closes
    (b) The system tray EA Inbox will pop open for you to select a task to open
    (c) You should not receive any further task notifications for the next 180 seconds (even if tasks are received in that time)
5. Kick off a SINGLE workflow. Check that if you CLICK on the task notification for this single task, it does not stop notifications appearing in the 30 seconds that follow
 
 
 
The following description abandoned:
Things to Test:
1. Publish the Prebill Markup workflow
2. Use the script below to kick off 20 workflow instances of the Prebill markup workflow
3. When the grouped task notification appears, click on the 'x' before it reaches a count of 20
4. Check that: 
    (a) The task notification closes
    (b) The systray EA Inbox will pop open for you to select a task to open
    (c) You should not recieve any further task notifications for the next 180 seconds (even if tasks are recieved in that time)
5. Kick off a SINGLE workflow by altering the script below and running it (change '20' in line 4 to '1') . Check that if you CLICK on the task notification for this single task, it does not stop notifications appearing in the 30 seconds that follow
 
DECLARE @I INT
SET @I = 0
DECLARE @MSG VARCHAR(100)
WHILE @I < 20
BEGIN
        exec MESSAGING.FWP_StartWorkflowByName 'Aderant.Workflow.PaperlessPrebill.Markup', ''
        select @msg = 'Starting workflow number ' + CAST (@i as varchar(4))
        RAISERROR (@msg, 0, 1) WITH NOWAIT 
        SET @i = @i + 1
        IF @i % 10 = 0
                BEGIN
                         RAISERROR ('Sleeping', 0, 1) WITH NOWAIT 
                         WAITFOR DELAY '00:00:05' -- sleep 5 seconds
                END
 
END
Steps: Step 1: Check "EA settings /Task inbox /Desktop alert" is enabled || Step 2: Recieve grouped notification 1. Use the script in Attachment to initiate 10 workflows2. Wait for task notifications to appear3. Wait for 10 seconds till the notification disappear4. Start another 10 workflows5. Wait for task notifications to appear6. Hover over the task notification | Expected: Check that: (a) Verify UI against the attached image(b) The task notification disappears in less than 10 seconds(c) When you are hovering over the notification, it will NOT disappear || Step 3: Open task inbox via grouped notification1. Use the script in Attachment to initiate 20 workflows2. Wait for task notificationsto appear3. Click within the grouped notfication window before it reaches a count of 20 | Expected: Check that: (a) The task notification closes (b) The system tray EA Inbox will pop open for you to select a task to open (c) You should not receive any further task notifications for the next 180 seconds (even if tasks are received in that time) || Step 4: Close & disable grouped notification (temporarily)1. Use the script in Attachment to initiate 20 workflows2. Wait for grouped task notification to appear3. Click on the 'x' before it reaches a count of 20 | Expected: Check that: (a) The task notification closes (b) You should not receive any further task notifications for the next 180 seconds (even if tasks are received in that time) || Step 5: Grouped notification for different types of tasks1. Modify the script in attachment. Add extra lines of:exec MESSAGING.FWP_StartWorkflowByNameAsUser 'Aderant.Workflow.FileOpening.MatterIntake', '100189', ''Change the workflow name to match your published workflows, change 100189 to match your EMPL_UNO (Find it in HBM_PERNSL)2. Wait for the notifications to appear | Expected: Check that:(a) Rules of the above steps (2 & 3) still apply(b) The notification windows correctly shows infomation about the latest recieved task || Step 6: Recieve single task notification1. Initiate 1 workflow2. Wait for task notification to appear3. Wait for 10 seconds till the notification disappear4. Start another workflow5. Wait for task notification to appear6. Hover over the task notification | Expected: Check that: (a) Verify UI against the attached image(b) The task notification disappears in less than 10 seconds(c) When you are hovering over the notification, it will NOT disappear || Step 7: Open task via single task notification1. Initiate 1 workflow2. Wait for notification to appear3. Click within the notification4. Initiate another workflow | Expected: Check that:(a) The task opens(b) You can still recieve notifications of other tasks || Step 8: Close single task notification1. Initiate 1 workflow2. Wait for notification to appear3. Click on 'x'4. Initiate another workflow | Expected: Check that(a) The task notification closes(b) You can still recieve notification of other tasks
