Title: Email notification scenarios for workflow task
Description:
Test that an email is generated for all of the below scenarios, which are typical task user scenarios
 
1. Task received via auto accept (eg only one user). Test for a single user, and also for a group with only 1 member
2. Task received by mutiple individuals, that all individuals with email addresses receive a notification of the new task
3. Test that if a user is a member of a group the user receives emails when a task is sent to the group.
4. Test that if a user is set to receive a task as an individual as well as a member of a group, they only receive one email
5. Test that emails are receive to task subscribers when the task is received when the security policy is attached to the process, as well as the task
6. Test that emails are receive to task subscribers when the task is received when the security policy is attached to the process, as well as the task
 
 
Test that Tasks opened from Email contain the most recent data, and generally behave the same as a assistant opened task.
 
1. For a shared task that has been worked on by another user, ensure data correct
2. Another user changes the rpiority, ensure this is up to date.
3. Ensure that most recent copies of notes is available.
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: Check that you have enabled task email notifications (in EA settings, task inbox) || Step 2: #1 Task received via auto accept (eg only one user). Test for a single user, and also for a group with only 1 member | Expected: Email notification received || Step 3: #2 Task received by mutiple individuals, that all individuals with email addresses receive a notification of the new task | Expected: Email notification received || Step 4: #3 Test that if a user is a member of a group the user receives emails when a task is sent to the group. | Expected: Email notification received || Step 5: #4 Test that if a user is set to receive a task as an individual as well as a member of a group, they only receive one email | Expected: only receive one email || Step 6: #5 Test that emails are receive to task subscribers when the task is received when the security policy is attached to the process, as well as the task | Expected: Email notification received || Step 7: #6 Re-assign task with notes attached | Expected: Email notification received includes notes || Step 8: #7 Re-assign task without notes attached | Expected: Email notification received does not include notes || Step 9: #8 Share task with notes attached | Expected: Email notification received includes notes || Step 10: #9 Escalate task via workflow | Expected: Email notification recieved

Title: Open File without Assistant installed already
Description: Test that when a user launches a task from an email and user does not already have EA installed, the task opens using the ExpertTask.exe (instead of the ExpertAssistant.exe from the local Click Once or MSI install of EA).

Title: Opening .task file from other location
Description:
Test that user can open the .task file type from other locations other than email
 
Save to file and try and open.

Title: Receive different task notifications at once
Description:
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
-----------
 
If a task notifications for a DIFFERENT task is received on a client machine before the last one has closed, the task notifications will be grouped together. There will not be separate notification for each task type.
 
Things to Test:
1. Launch two Visual Studio, and open two different workflow
2. Use workflow runner to kick off 10 instances for each workflow
3. A grouped task notification appears with
   (a) Name of logged in user
   (b) Multiple Notifications (x)
   (c) x is a count of the number of task notifications received while the notification has been open (minimum of 2, otherwise individual task notification received) 
   (d) 'Most Recent'
   (e) Task Name - Name of the most recent task type that a notification was received for
 
4. If the notification is left untouched (i.e. do not click on the task notification or close it, or touch EA), the count on the notification will increment until it reaches the total number of ALL tasks that were created, and will close 6-7 seconds after the last increment.
 
 
The following description abandoned:
Things to Test:
1. Publish the Prebill Markup workflow
2. Publish another workflow - 
3. Use the script below to kick off 20 workflow instances of each of the published workflows (Note: you may need to update lines 6 and 7 to reflect the workflows you have published, the names should be as they appear as they are seen in IIS: Default Web Site > Expert_Local > Workflows > xxx  ). 
4. A grouped task notification appears with
   (a) Name of logged in user
   (b) Multiple Notifications (x)
   (c) x is a count of the number of task notifications received while the notification has been open (minimum of 2, otherwise individual task notification received) 
   (d) 'Most Recent'
   (e) Task Name - Name of the most recent task type that a notification was received for
 
4. If the notification is left untouched (i.e. do not click on the task notification or close it, or touch EA), the count on the notification will increment until it reaches the total number of ALL tasks that were created, and will close 6-7 seconds after the last increment.
 
DECLARE @I INT
SET @I = 0
DECLARE @MSG VARCHAR(100)
WHILE @I < 50
BEGIN
        exec MESSAGING.FWP_StartWorkflowByName 'Aderant.Workflow.PaperlessPrebill.Markup', ''
        exec MESSAGING.FWP_StartWorkflowByName 'Aderant.Workflow.PaperlessPrebill.Approval', ''
        select @msg = 'Starting workflow number ' + CAST (@i as varchar(4))
        RAISERROR (@msg, 0, 1) WITH NOWAIT 
        print @msg
        SET @i = @i + 1
        IF @i % 10 = 0
                BEGIN
                         RAISERROR ('Sleeping', 0, 1) WITH NOWAIT 
                         WAITFOR DELAY '00:00:05' -- sleep 5 seconds
                END
 
END

Title: Receive multiple task notifications at once
Description:
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
-------------
If a task notifications is received on a client machine before the last one has closed, the task notifications will be grouped together so instead of there being one for each, only one notification will be displayed to represent both tasks.
 
Things to Test:
1. In Visual Studio, create a workflow or open an existing workflow
2. Use workflow runner to kick off 10 instances
3. A grouped task notification appears with
   (a) Name of logged in user
   (b) Multiple Notifications (x)
   (c) x is a count of the number of task notifications received while the notification has been open (minumum of 2, otherwise individual task notification received) 
   (d) 'Most Recent'
   (e) Task Name - Name of the most recent task that a notification was received for
 
NOTE: You may receive a notification for a SINGLE task prior to the grouped task notification if the two sequential notifications are not received in quick enough succession
4. If the notification is left untouched (i.e. do not click on the task notification or close it, or touch EA), the count on the notification will increment until it reaches the total number of tasks that were created, and will close 6-7 seconds after the last increment.

Description:

In Expert Assistant:
EA Setting> Task Inbox> Desktop alerts
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.

Title: Send email reminder after x amount of time
Description:
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
--------------
 
Test Objective: Verify the correct functionality of the email notification setting as a reminder when tasks are assigned to a user and are not complete in 'x' number of days.
 
Scenario Traceability: http://tfs.ap.aderant.com:8080/WorkItemTracking/WorkItem.aspx?artifactMoniker=16519
 
In Expert Assistant:
EA Setting> Task Inbox> Reminder email
EA Setting> Task Inbox> Reminder Days Elapsed
 
Details:
Users should be able to set a notification to self thru email about tasks not yet completed within a specified amount of time.  In the ExpertAssistant settings, this notification can be set to true or false.  If true, the number of days after a task is assigned (accepted, shared or unaccepted) is set in the EA settings.  Also, it should be able to allow the user to set it to either a repeatable or a non-repeatable notification.  Repeatable notifications simply sends email reminders everyday (defaults to 12.00am), regardless of the number of days set for the initial reminder.  A flow that allows the assigned, shared and escalated tasks (both to one user and multiple users) should be used to test this.
 
Pre-requisite:
1.  Reminder should be ticked or set to true.  In EA, go to Settings then Task Inbox.  Set the reminder to true (tick the box).  Enter a number in the "Reminder Days Elapse" other than zero.
2.  Make sure that CMS partner database has your email address (locate your record in HBM_PERSNL table and verify existence of email address).  Manually updating FWM_USER is not viable since partner databases synch everyday.
3.  In config, make sure the FromEmail field is not blank and does not have your email address (same from and to email addresses are treated as spam).  Located here ==> Technical.Framework.Workflow
4.  For testing purposes, reminder can be set to minutes or hours rather than days as configuration manager accepts values in seconds.  See config values here ==> Technical.Framework.Worklfow.Management
 
 
Functional test:
A. Assigned to one or more users
Verify that email will be sent as a reminder for all active tasks (accepted, unaccepted and reassigned) in the task inbox according to the reminder settings.   Verify that the notification will be sent again daily when it is set to repeatable.
 
B. Shared to multiple users
Verify that email will be sent as a reminder for all active shared tasks in the task inbox according to the reminder settings.   Verify that the notification will be sent again daily when it is set to repeatable.
 
C. Delegated to one or more users
Verify that email will be sent as a reminder for all active delegated tasks in the task inbox according to the reminder settings.   Verify that the notification will be sent again daily when it is set to repeatable.

Title: Email notification to specified user/group when a task is created with inactive task performer
Description:
** New feature in 8.0 SP1 **
 
When a task ends up allocated to no users, an email will be sent to all Administrators/Supervisors of the workflow task.
Note: This does not apply if the user/performer becomes inactive after the task has been created.
 
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: Go to cms.net and check that you have a valid email address. (Cms > Employee Management > Employee Details) || Step 2: In Visual Studio, go to workflow properties and set "Email on error" to @Email || Step 3: Add a smartform task and set TTQA1 as Task performer || Step 4: Go to cms.net and change the status of TTQA1 to INACTIVE. || Step 5: Start the workflow. | Expected: The task is created with no performers. You should be able to access it by using Expert Assistant task inbox (Manage by Task/User) The person or email you specified in step 4 should recieve an email notification that Task "XXXXX" has no Performers. || Step 6: Reassign the task to yourself | Expected: The task and workflow should then be able to complete without error.

To disable task notifications:
1. Launch EA
2. Click on the Settings button
3. Select Task Inbox

Things to Test:
1. Launch Visual Studio, create a workflow or open existing workflow
2. Use workflow runner to kick off 10 instances
3. Check that the user does NOT receive ANY notifications

Title: Timeout grouped notification
Description:
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.

If a grouped notification is received, the user may click on the 'X' to close it. If they do so, they should not receive ANY further task notifications in the next 30 seconds. These are just never received. Any notifications received AFTER 30 seconds, will be displayed, and will resume usual behavior.
 
Things to Test:
1. In Visual Studio, create a workflow or open an existing workflow
2. Using workflow runner kick off 20 workflow instances
3. When the grouped task notification appears, do not click or close it, allow it to timeout
4. Check that: 
    (a) The task notification closes
    (b) You should not receive any further task notifications for the next 30 seconds (even if tasks are received in that time)

Title: Workflow scenarios for task email notification
Description:
Test that only valid tasks, generate an email:
 
1. In a while statement - users should receive a new notification for each instance.
2. Tasks in conditional statements are only notified if called.
3. Task in replicator task activity correctly send emails
4. Ensure these work in sequential and state machine WF's

Title: Approval Task Data Validation on Complete
Description:
Test that completing a Approval task invokes the correct data validation on the values entered by the user. What is triggered will be determined by how the properties are set, and what the default value is.
 
Details:
1. Manadatory Property for both approval and approval value value here dictates the rules, as to user actioning.
2. Test that no validations are struck when the properties for both fields are set to not manadatory. Users should be able to complete
3. When mandatory ensure that a valid value be entered in order to complete.
4. For each data type, ensure other negative values can not be entered, and completed.
5 test these separately and together.
 
What happens when the default value is not valid for that data type?
 
 
Questions:
 Does this apply only to complete? or to save as well eg Although null can be a default, if this boolean is set to Y/true (ie Is Mandatory) then null cannot be an answer.  Actor must select a non-null entry from the collection before the task will complete.

Title: Approval Task Removed via escalation
Description:
Test that the new Approval Activity task can be removed, as part of the escalation process "Skip Task" process.
 
Task is removed when the escalation branche is completed
Test only removed when option set to skip

Title: Approval Tasks Data Validation on save
Description: Test that Savng an Approval task DOES NOT invoke data validation on the values entered by the user. This only applies to COMPLETE

Title: Approval Tasks Performed in Parallel Activity
Description:
Test that Approval activites can be used as part of Parallel Actvites. Ensure that when these use the same context data items. that these are updated correctly, and are the value is the current value.
 
Details:
At test run time, investigate the scenarios here. In the past there has been some data corruption occur when 1 approval value updates context data that is used be others.
 
Use muulti users/ machines here, and ensure the data is updated. As well as be the same user.

Title: Approval Tasks suspended or terminated
Description:
Test that an approval Activty can be removed from a users in box when the processed is either suspended or cancelled
 
Details:
Test this when the task is both open and just sitting in a users inbox.
Test both on a machine acting as Server or client

Title: Change task priority
Description: Verify that task priority can be changed and all task performers' inbox will be changed accordingly.

Title: Close alert in task window
Description:
If you close an alert in a task (by clicking on the 'X'), it will re-appear if you close and re-open the task. If, however, you complete the task with the alert closed, the alert will not be re-displayed again in sunbsequent tasks.
 
Note: 
The only exception to this, is if the user alert is saved to a variable, and then later added to the alert collection again.

Title: Conduct Conditional Parallel Activites with NO Merge
Description:
Test that conditional Parrallel activities that contain multiple manual tasks binding to workflow variables still behave correctly when the data fields will NOT cause the data to merge. This is a regression test of conditional Parrallel Activty outside the scope of merging data.
 
Test:
1. Test forms pointing to different DTO's with in the context data model. Ensure that both of these getting completed by different users does not trigger a data merge, and the process continues. Context data is updated.
2. Test using different types of activites within, the conditional parrallel activty, including conditional activies, and embedded, Launch activites.
3. Test with up to 5 branch actviites.
4. Try with both sequential and state workflows
 
Test with Multi users on multi PC's encompassing Multi client and server platforms - eg Vista and XP client, Vista and Server 2003 Server.
 
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Conduct Parrallel Activites with NO Merge
Description:
Test that Parrallel activities that contain multiple manual tasks binding to context data still behave correctly when the data fields will NOT cause the data to merge. This is a regression test of Parrallel Activty outside the scope of merging data.
 
Test:
1. Test forms pointing to different DTO's with in the context data model. Ensure that both of these getting completed by different users does not trigger a data merge, and the process continues. Context data is updated.
2. Test using different types of activites within, the parrallel activty, including conditional activies, and embedded, Launch activites.
3. Test with up to 5 branch actviites.
4. Test with both sequential and state workflows
 
Test with Multi users on multi PC's encompassing Multi client and server platforms - eg Vista and XP client, Vista and Server 2003 Server.

Title: Data Merge Logging
Description: To Run, Execute Step 1

Title: Escalation Activity push effect on on Open tasks
Description:
Verify that when a task is escalated (Alteration Strategy = Append) while the task is open and accepted, that task will become unaccepted while the user to whom the task is escalated to will also receive the task.
 
Verify that when a task is escalated (Alteration Strategy = Replace) while the task is open and accepted, that task will close while the user to whom the task is escalated to will receive the task.

Title: Escalation activity push effect on Task List
Description:
Verify that when a task is escalated (Alteration Strategy = Append), the present user/s will still have the task in their task inbox and the user to whom the task is escalated to will also receive the task.
 
Verify that when a task is escalated (Alteration Strategy = Replace), the present user/s will no longer have the task in their task inbox and the user to whom the task is escalated to will also receive the task.

Title: Escalation activity with Concurrent Users
Description:
Test functionality around when users have a task open, when an escalation activities imposed wait expires, that the correct functionality is triggered.
 
Details:
When the activite is set to skip task, the user is prompted that task no longer valid, and closes.
When the activity is set to not skip task, user is unaffected.
 
Things to consider:
Multi users have the task opened - and un-accepted
A single user has opened - Accepted
 
 
When Alteration Strategy=Append and task is escalated while open, completing the task will encounter an error: Task Inbox Application Error ... close the task and try again later.
 
When Alteration Strategy=Replace and task is escalated while open, the task will close.

Title: Faulted and suspended workflow task access
Description:
Test that when a process is faulted or suspended, it is removed from the users inbox, and cannot be worked on
 
If a task is suspended by the administrator, or becomes faulted through the process, correct behaviour is for the tasks to be removed from the assignees inbox.
Currently manual tasks are not removed, and can still be opened. When opened the task does not have the option to be worked on (all buttons ex terminate and save and close are disabled) however they should not be able to see the task to begin with.
--Gm there is also an issue with the resume task here. Once a suspended task is resumed, the ability to edit the task does not exist, the tools are disabled.

Title: Merged Business Data, Conditional Parallel Activity
Description:
*** Test needs to be updated ***
 
Using a workflow that uses a conditional parrallel activity, set up a scenario whereby multiple users/system processes will be able to edit the business Data at the same time. 
 
Test that when multiple users are editing the business data at the same time that the data is merged, users are notified that a merge is taking place. Use only manual users to update the data to be tested.
 
Use the table on business Merging from the WIKI, and cover each condition that is possible
http://ttwiki/wiki/index.php?title=Workflow#Business_Data_Merging
 
Things to Test:
Tests scenarios with users editing the same task instance:
Different users updating distinct objects
DIfferent users updating the same object but different items
Different users updating the same item(s) in the same object
More than two users/processes editing same business data at the same time
Edit = adding data object and/or items (start workflow with NULL values)
Edit =  changing data object and/or items (start workflow by populating values)
Edit = deleting data object and/or items (start workflow by populating values and remove when performing task) The  'Required' property on the ApprovalQuery or ApprovedValue should be FALSE
Condition met on first task completed vs condition met on second (or later) task completed
Condition not met by any task completed
 
Expected Results:
Ensure that the instance can be completed, the correct data is stored in XML and DB
If there is a conflict when a task is completed, the user should be advised, and the task should not be completed
 
Scenarios:
Manual user vs manual user
Manual user vs system user
System user vs system user

Title: Multi Users performing parallel tasks
Description:
Set up a workflow where the task requires tasks to be performed by different users in Parallel.
Test the multi users can work on the same instance of a process, but on different tasks.
 
Details:
Test that tasks can be actioned (see Action use case for scenarios) by different users, and the parallel taks do not get confused. Ensure notification messages are pushed to multiple users etc.
 
Things to test:
Ensure that when one approve task is actions and data saved, that this does not become the default data for other tasks.
 
QA Questions:
Check with Greg around the sequential behaviour of the parallel tests, and how this functions

Title: Priority List Options
Description:
Test the the workflow priority has the the options of Normal & High, with a default option of Normal
 
Things to test:
Ensure that all options can be selected, and saved.
Ensure that the priority does not persist from 1 task to the next, eg have multiple inbox activities in a workflow sequence, on completion of the first, the priority for the second still defaults to normal.
Test that the inbox view displays the correct icons depending on the priority, ensure these update for priority changes.

Title: Push effect on sequential tasks in workflow
Description: Test that when 2 or more tasks are in sequence with each other in a workflow process, that the completion of 1 task means that in the next task is pushed straight into other users task list in Run Time.

Title: Scroll bar after two alerts
Description: A maximum of two user alerts are displayed at the top of a task before a scroll bar is displayed.

Title: Task window - Form level validation
Description:
If there are validation errors within the SmartForms consumed in the task when the user attempts to save/close the task, they will be notified by a prompt
 
- save - -->  button always enabled, but if required fields unpopulated or invalid data --> get generic message pop-up with two choices (save /cancel), required/invalid fields should be highlighted
- save & close -->  button always enabled, but if required fields unpopulated or invalid data --> get generic message pop-up with four choices (save/ save & close/ cancel / cancel & close), required/invalid fields should be highlighted
- complete -->  button is disabled if required fields unpopulated. If there is invalid data --> get generic message, required/invalid fields should be highlighted. Data must be fixed before task can be completed
 
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: Test that required/invalid fields are correctly counted and highlighted with appropriate error message | Expected: Verify against the attached images || Step 2: If there are validation errors when the user attempts to save/close the task, they will be notified by a prompta) Try to save the task with errorsb) Try to close the task window with errors | Expected: Always enabled, but if required fields unpopulated or invalid data: a) Warning message pop-up with two choices (save /cancel)b) Required/invalid fields should be highlightedc) Task can still save with invalid fields || Step 3: Try to save & close the task with errors | Expected: Always enabled, but if required fields unpopulated or invalid data:a) Warning message pop-up with four choices (save/ save & close/ cancel / cancel & close)b) Required/invalid fields should be highlighted c) Task can still save & close with invalid fields || Step 4: Try to complete the task with errors | Expected: Disabled if required fields unpopulated or contain invalid data:a)Complete button should be disabled until there are no more required/invalid fieldsb) You could bypass #1 by entering invalid data to a valid field then press "Complete" right after thatBy doing so you should get an error message, required/invalid fields should be highlighted. Data must be fixed before task can be completed || Step 5: Try to complete & next the task with errors | Expected: Disabled if required fields unpopulated or contain invalid data:a)Complete button should be disabled until there are no more required/invalid fieldsb) You could bypass #1 by entering invalid data to a valid field then press "Complete" right after thatBy doing so you should get an error message, required/invalid fields should be highlighted. Data must be fixed before task can be completed

Title: Task removal for a faulted process
Description:
Test that a users inbox is kept up to date (with multi users - tasks going to more than one user) when the task instance is faulted.
 
Functionality should be that all users in boxes should be updated instantly (via Push) when a task that they have access to is faulted
 
Details:
Test when the user does not have the instance open, the task inbox updates correctly
Test that when the user does have the task open, that this closes the  task

Title: Task Removal for a Suspended Process
Description:
Test that a users inbox is kept up to date (with multi users - tasks going to more than one user) when the task instance is either suspended or suspending.
 
Functionality should be that all users in boxes should be updated instantly (via Push) when a task that they have access to is suspended or suspending.
 
Details:
Test when the user does not have the instance open, the task inbox updates correctly
Test that when the user does have the task open, that this closes the  task

Title: Task removal for a Terminated process
Description:
Test that a users inbox is kept up to date (with multi users - tasks going to more than one user) when the task instance is terminated.
 
Functionality should be that all users in boxes should be updated instantly (via Push) when a task that they have access to is terminated
 
Details:
Test when the user does not have the instance open, the task inbox updates correctly
Test that when the user does have the task open, that this closes the  task

Title: Task Screen UI and non functional test
Description:
Test that the Task form performs correctly outside of its functional scope. Ensure that normal windows behavior is apparent, that the screen is robust, and no errors are generated by a users general usage.
 
Details:
Collapsible (can be minimized and maximized)
Hide and display features (notes, details, subject information) are correct
Single instance ie if the task list is double clicked again, the same instance bought to the front, not another instance opened
Customization and removal of toolbar's correct
Buttons are displayed correctly both when they are enabled and disabaled.
 
NOTE:
This is likely to change as UI change on this form is planned in the future,

Task:

Title: Standard smartform task action - Accept Task
Description:
Assuming sole responsibility for the task completion, only ONE of the task performers for a task may have accepted it at a time and only the user who has it accepted may complete it.
 
Things to Test:
1.  Ensure that when a task that is assigned to multiple users is accepted by one of the users, that task will be removed in the list of the other users.
2.  Ensure that when a task that is assigned to multiple users is accepted by one of the users, if one of the other users had the task open, in trying to change or accept the task, will encounter a message saying "The task you have open could not be found; the task might have been cancelled or it may have been completed by another user." 
3.  Ensure that when the above task is unaccepted, that task will be present in the list of the other users as an unaccepted task.
4.  Ensure that when a task is shared, that task will be present in the task list of those users (shared task icon is displayed) - Accept/Unaccept are disabled
5.  Ensure that when the task is reassigned, that task will be removed from the task list and will only be present in the users' list to whom the task is reassigned.
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: Accept tasks via Task ribbon/Task window/Right click menu (3 iterations @Interface) | Expected: a) Accept button is ONLY visible when the task is not yet accepted.b) Accepted tasks should have appropriate icons (Task icon with a yellow star)c) Task inbox is updatedd) Not applicable to shared tasks || Step 2: Task has multiple performers (multiple users or group) | Expected: a) Accepting a multi performer task will remove the task from other performs' task inboxb) Accepting a multi performer task will notify other users if they also have the same task opened || Step 3: Task has only 1 performer | Expected: Tasks with only 1 performer is automaticly accepted to that user || Step 4: a) Check task ownership in SQL: select workflowname,displayname,CANDIDATES,PARTICIPANTS,OWNERID,PERFORMERID from WFM_TASK orderby LAST_MODIFIED descb) Check userID in SQL: select EMPL_UNO,EMPLOYEE_CODE,EMPLOYEE_NAME,USERID from HBM_PERSNL where USERID= (select TOP 1 OWNERID from WFM_TASK orderby LAST_MODIFIED desc) | Expected: Accepting the task would change the owner of the task to the current userCheck the task owner ID matches to the USERID of the user that accepted the task

Title: Accept and decline Single Tasks from Assistant
Description:
Ensure the following when a task is accepted or declined:
1. Cannot Accept an accepted task (not an option in the dropdown list)

4. Re-assigned task can only be Unaccepted by the user to whom the task was re-assigned
5. Unaccepted tasks can be shared or reassigned.

Title: Close note on workflow task
Description:
When a re-assign note is displayed at the top of a task, the user may close it. It will re-appear if they close and re-open the task.
 
Pre-requisites:
1. Launch EA for yourself on one PC
2. Launch EA for another user on another PC 
3. Set up workflow with approval task, ensurng that both yourself and the other user are task performers
 
To test:
1. Kick off the workflow
2. On behalf of yourself, accept and open the task from EA
3. Click on the Assign button in the Task ribbon
4. In the window that pops up, select the users you wish to re-assign to and enter a note in the text box
5. Press the OK button
6. Press 'NO' to continue working on the task
7. Open the task on behalf of the other user that the task has been assigned to7. Open the task on behalf of the other user that the task has been assigned to
8. When the re-assign note is displayed, click on the 'x' at the end of the row
9. Check that the note is closed
10. Close and re-open the task
11. Check that the note is displayed again (unchanged)
 
Repeat for app task
 
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

(b) If the user has not made changes, the task will close

Title: Collaboration window in reassign task state
Description:
Test the layout and view of the Collaborate Window when opened via the Re-assign button.
 
Ensure this is tested from the 2 areas reassigning is performed - Task form and Expert Inbox.
 
Details:
The Collaborate window opens in a new window and consists of the following areas (REFER ALSO TO WIREFRAMES):
(a) The recipients' area, where the recipients of the task are specified.
(b) A notes area, where the user can capture a note to the recipients of the task.
(c) A Priority Dropdown where the user can specify a new priority for the task.
(d) OK and Cancel buttons.
 
On the Collaborate window,
Title: "Reassign Task <Task Subject>" (If more than one task was selected, the Title should just read "Reassign Tasks"
Subject: <Task DIsplay Name> (<PublicDataReference1>)
Reassign To/Share button reads "Reassign To"
The candidates list for that task should contain all users or groups who have ever had the "Perform" right for this task
The Reassign To textbox is initially empty

Title: Collaboration window in share task state
Description:
When the Collaborate Window is opened via the Share button (either from the Inbox or a task), 
 
 
Details:
The Collaborate window opens in a new window and consists of the following areas (REFER ALSO TO WIREFRAMES):
(a) The recipients' area, where the recipients of the task are specified.
(b) A notes area, where the user can capture a note to the recipients of the task.
(c) A Priority Dropdown where the user can specify a new priority for the task.
(d) OK and Cancel buttons.
 
On the Collaborate window,
Title: "Share Task <Task Subject>" (If more than one task was selected, the Title should just read "Share Tasks"
Subject: <Task DIsplay Name> (<PublicDataReference1>)
Reassign To/Share button reads "Share With"
The candidates list for that task should contain all users or groups who have ever had the "Perform" right for this task
The Share With textbox is initially empty

Title: Collaboration window Non functional and UI
Description:
Test that the reassign/share "Select User" pop up form is robust
 
Test Scope:
This relates to the reassign/share select user pop up form, that is evoked when a user wants to reassign/share a task. This looks at the UI of this box as well as the non functional requirements.
 
Testing of the functionality eg, ensuring the task is reassigned, will be looked at in another test.
 
Details:
1. Users can be added and removed from the selected users screen by double click, button.
2. More than one user can be selected.
3. If the user has the "UnrestrictedReassign" permission, the available users will be all users and groups in the database
4. If a user does not have the "UnrestrictedReassign" permission, for the selected tasks, the users and grops in the Available listbox are restricted to those in the candidates list.
 
Form can be minimised etc
If the user clicks Cancel, the above dialog is closed and the users and groups in the Reassign To/Share With textbox remain unchanged.
Form has Alt tab icon, and does not interfere with any other applications functionality when opened,

Description: Declining (or unaccepting) a task should change the task appearance so that user will be able to Accept or Close the task.

Title: Error handled when task fails to be reassigned
Description:
On return from the Collaborate Window  (i.e. when the window is closed), the system determines if the user pressed OK or Cancel to close that window.
 
Ensure this is tested from the 2 areas reassigning is performed - Task form and Expert Inbox.
 
Details:
If the user pressed Cancel, the Task Form remains open.
If the user pressed OK, 
(a) If the task was NOT successfully reassigned, the Task Form remains open and the system displays the message "Reassign Task failed.", with an "OK" button. The user presses OK" and the message box closes.                  
(b) If the task was successfully reassigned, the Task Form closes.

Title: Error handled when task fails to be shared
Description:
On return from the Collaborate Window (i.e. when the window is closed), the system determines if the user pressed OK or Cancel to close that window.
If the user pressed Cancel, the Task Form remains open.
If the user pressed OK, 
                   (a) If the task was not successfully shared, the Task Form remains open and the system displays the message "Share Task failed.", with an "OK" button. The user presses                          
                          OK" and the message box closes.
                   (b) If the task was successfully shared, the Task Form closes.

Title: Standard smartform task action - Re-Assign Task
Description:
If a user has restricted reassign rights, they will only have the option to re-assign the task to users within the current list of task performers for the task
 
E.g. A user has restricted re-assign rights if they are a member of a security policy that contains the following data policy rtght: 
> Framework.Workflow.Task.Reassign
NOTE:  
By default, the Everyone user group has this right by virtue of the WorkflowTaskPerformer data policy
 
Ensure this is tested from both places where reassigning is performed - i.e. from the Task form and from Expert Assistant Task List.
 
Details:
1. Update the Shared attribute on the task to FALSE
2. If there was an owner on the task, the owner is deleted
3. The task is removed from the inital users in box
4. The task re-appears in the new user's Task Inbox
5. All previous changes by initial user are made.
6.  Ensure that the fields are updated in the task:
  a.  resets the 'task accepted' indicator, i.e. task owner
  b.  adds the following information to the task's history by adding a system generated note in the task
    -  type of action performed = 'Re-assigned'
    -  date and time performed = <system date and time>
    -  performed by = <name of user>
    -  assignment/target of action = <name of user>
7. Update the task's priority to the selected Priority, if "Unchanged" is not selected.
8. If a note was captured, system should operate as described in the Expert Notes Design document
9. Record the Reassign or Share Action in workflow tracking (this functionality might already exist, but must be tested).Change Workflow Tracking to include a column to track the Share attribute for manual tasks. 
 
 
Things to test:
Test this from every available activtiy that contains that "reassign to" field
Ensure the scenario whereby the user has only standard reassign rights but the reassign default user isnt in the goup theat the user would normally see? what happens here?
Ensure that the user actually still needs the reassign rights.
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: Be default, non-admin users have restricted assign rights, admin users have un-restricted assign rights.For users with restricted rights, they will only have the option to assign tasks to users within their office. Where as admin users does not have this restriction.(This can be changed in config: Technical.Framework.Workflow.Options.RestrictedReassignDataProvider or ExpertAdmin under System - Workflow Options) This test will cover 3 different point of access to this action: via Task Ribbon, Expert Tab and Task inbox right click menu(3 iterations @interface) || Step 2: Check the following conditions:a) Task has multiple performers (multiple users or group)b) Task has only 1 performerc) Task is sharedd) Task is not acceptede) Task have un-saved data | Expected: a) "Assign task" dialog opens in reasonable timeb) Active users or user groups can be searched & selected c) Notes can be addedd) Task priority can be sete) The reassign process should complete in reasonable timef) Other performers are notified when task is reassignedh) The list of performer is recreated everytime you reassign i.e. If you reassign to TTQA1 and TTQA2 then reassign to TTQA3 and TTQA4. The final task performers would be TTQA3 and 4. i) User alert bar is created after assignment of who the task is assigned toj) You are prompted for any un-saved datak) Task inbox is updated || Step 3: Restricted Re-Assign:a) Use a standard user, without admin rights (Check in security manager that user and user group does not have Data resources.Framework.Workflow.Task.UnrestrictedReassign rights)b) Change performer data provider from Office to Department | Expected: a) You can only search for users that have same OFFICE as you.b) You can only search for users that have same DEPARTMENT as you. || Step 4: Un-Restricted Re-AssignUse an admin user(Check in security manager that user is in Admin group and the user group have Data resources.Framework.Workflow.Task.UnrestrictedReassign rights) | Expected: You are able to search for all active users in the firm

Title: Reassign a task - Unrestricted reassign
Description:
If a user has unrestricted reassign rights, they will have the option to re-assign the task to ANY other user (not just the users within the current list of task performers)
 
E.g. A user has unrestricted re-assign rights if they are a member of a security policy that contains the following data policy rtght: 
> Framework.Workflow.Task.UnrestrictedReassign
 
NOTE:  
By default, the Administrators user group has this right by virtue of the WorkflowAdministrators data policy, and anyone assigned as a Workflow Supervisor in the workflow/task security
Note that anyone with Workflow rights can do this in the 'Manage by' list if the user is not the performer of the task.
 
Ensure this is tested from the 3 areas reassigning is performed - Task form, Expert Task List and Expert Process Task List.
 
 
Details:
 
 
Details:
1.  Ensure user has Unrestricted reassign rights and the names displayed in the list are those allowed to perform the selected task, of which the user has access to.
2.  The user can select both one or more than one names from the list. In both cases all users receive the new task
3.  On reassigning the task form closes and the task is removed from the users inbox if the task is reassigned away (user takes away his performer right).
        a. Update the Shared attribute on the task to FALSE
        b. If there was an owner on the task, the owner is deleted
        c. The task is removed from the inital users in box
        d. The task re-appears in the new user's Task Inbox
        e. All previous changes by initial user are made.
4.  Ensure that the fields are updated in the task:
  a.  resets the 'task accepted' indicator, i.e. task owner
  b.  adds the following information to the task's history
    -  type of action performed = 'Re-assigned'
    -  date and time performed = <system date and time>
    -  performed by = <name of user>
    -  assignment/target of action = <name of user>
6.  The system removes the task from the inbox of the current task performers and adds the task to the inbox of the users to whom the task has been re-assigned.
 
Things to test:
Test that tasks can be reassigned from the assignor's task Inbox, when the assignor has "Unrestricted" Reassign rights (either Admin or a Workflow Supervisor for the task).

SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Description:
FROM TEST: FORWARD AN UNSAVED TASK.....
Test that a task that has unsaved data can not be reassigned until the data is saved.
 
Details:
If the user presses the Re-assign button, the system should check if the task has any unsaved changes. If it does, the system should display a warning message, "You have unsaved changes. Do you want to save?", with "Yes", "No" and "Cancel" buttons.
-       If the user clicks "Yes", the system should close the message box, save the changes and open the Collaborate Window.
-       If the user clicks "No", the system should close the message box and open the Collaborate Window. Any changes made on the task will be lost.
-       If the user clicks "Cancel", the system should close the message box. 
 
 
Things to test:
1. For the task form test that all changes to all changeable fields trigger the unsaved validation.
2. Test that all unsaved changes to notes are triggered including attachment, note priority, and text.
3. Test that by answering yes, the task can be reassigned, and the new user sees the new task.
4. Test that by answering no no changes are saved, and reassign can not take place.
 
 
- if there are unsaved Notes then a prompt should appear asking if you wish to save the current note
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

*** This test just verifies that Reassign basically works from the Task List. More detailed test cases for reassigning tasks can be found in QC under
>Workflow>Share and Reassign Tasks>ReassignTask

Title: Reassign Task Security Policy
Description:
When closing the collaboration window after selecting users for the task(s) to be shared with/re-assigned to, if the validation passes, the following occurs with respect to the task security policies:
 
Details:
If the Collaborate window is open in the Reassign state, retrieve the Aderant supplied template policy with the "Perform" and "Reassign" right. 
If this template is not found, retrieve the Aderant supplied template policy with the "Perform" only right. 
If this is not found, display the error message "Aderant Template policy with Perform and Reassign rights or with Perform only right not found. Reassign task(s) failed.", with an "OK" button.When the user clicks the message box's "OK" button, close the message box, but leave the Collaborate window open.
 
For each selected task, the system should,
 
(a) Amend all existing non-firm policies that secure the task and that contain the "Perform" right, by including the identities in the Share With textbox as grantees (in addition to the existing grantees). 
If the task's Share attribute is false, 
(b) Create a new policy from the template retrieved above and make all the identities in the Reassign To textbox, grantees of this policy.
(c) Replace all existing non-firm policies that secure the task and that contain the "Perform" right, with the new policy. 
(d) All other policies securing the task (firm policies and policies that don't contain the perform right) are left unchanged.
(e) Add any users or groups that have been specified in the Reassign To / Share With textbox to the task's candidates list, if they are not already members of this list.
 
Things to Test:
Aderant template policy exists with 'Perform' and 'Reassign'
Aderant template policy exists with 'Perform' only
No Aderant policy foudn with either of above

Title: Reassigning an auto accepted task
Description:
Test the ability to Reassign a task that has been auto accepted (only gone to the one user). the abilty to reassign depend on rules around what other users have been invovled in the task, and if the user has the abilty to reassign using the candidate list (normal reassign), or the full list of users/user groups (unrestricted reassign)
 
Details:
1. With a user that has normal reassign right, and no other users where involved in process, user has no-one to reassign to
2. normal reassign rights, and other users involved in process, only those users can the task be reassigned to
3. User who has extended reassign rights, all users available, and task can be reassigned to any user.

Share an unsaved Task

Title: Share attribute on task
Description:
When the user reassigns a task, he is specifying that it will be a sole responsibility task. Although the task may be reassigned to more than one user or group, only one of these users can accept the task and complete it. Once the user has accepted the task, he has sole responsibility to perform the task, so he becomes the owner and it is removed from the inbox of the other task performers. The task's Share attribute is set to false to indicate that it is a sole responsibility task.
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Share attribute on task - Auto accept
Description:
When a task is created, it is currently automatically accepted to the task performer if there is only one task performer. This must now only happen if the task's Share attribute is false. 
 
If the task's Share attribute is false a running task should appear in a user's Inbox, if
 (a) the user has Perform right and there is no owner, OR
 (b) the user has Perform right and the user is the owner
 
If the task's Share attribute is true, a running task should appear in a user's Inbox, if the user has the Perform right.

Title: Share single task with Assign Rights
Description:
Test that when a user has set the "reassign to" property for an activity, that when the user shares this task, it is automatically shared with the desired user or group.
 
I.e. Security rights: 
(Module.Framework.Workflow.Enterprise.InboxEC.ReassignTask.execute OR Module.Framework.Workflow.Enterprise.InboxEC.ReassignTask.execute right) AND
the Function.Framework.Workflow.Task.Reassign
 
Ensure this is tested from the 2 areas reassigning is performed - Task form and Expert Assistant Task ListList.
 
Details:
1. When sharing the user can only select other users that were already in the set of task performers for the task
2. Update the Shared attribute on the task to TRUE
3. If there was an owner on the task, the owner is not deleted
4. The task also appears in the new user's Task Inbox
5. All previous changes by initial user are made.
6. Ensure that the fields are updated in the task:
  a.  resets the 'task accepted' indicator, i.e. task owner
  b.  adds the following information to the task's history by adding a system generated note in the task
    -  type of action performed = 'Re-assigned'
    -  date and time performed = <system date and time>
    -  performed by = <name of user>
    -  assignment/target of action = <name of user>
 
Things to test:
Test this from every available activtiy that contains that "reassign to" field
Ensure the scenario whereby the user has only standard reassign rights but the reassign default user isnt in the goup theat the user would normally see? what happens here?
Ensure that the user actually still needs the reassign rights.

Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Standard smartform task action - Share Task
Description:
Test that tasks can be shared from the assignor's task inbox, when the assignor has "standard" access to Reassign tasks.
 
*** This test just verifies that Share basically works from the Process List. More detailed test cases for sharing tasks can be found in QC under
>Workflow>Share and Reassign Tasks>Share Task
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: Be default, non-admin users have restricted assign rights, admin users have un-restricted assign rights.For users with restricted rights, they will only have the option to assign tasks to users within their office. Where as admin users does not have this restriction.(This can be changed in config: Technical.Framework.Workflow.Options.RestrictedReassignDataProvider or ExpertAdmin under System - Workflow Options) The same assignment restriction rules also applies to "Share" actionThis test will cover 3 different point of access to this action: via Task Ribbon, Expert Tab and Task inbox right click menu(3 iterations @interface) || Step 2: Check the following conditions:a) Task has multiple performers (multiple users or group)b) Task has only 1 performerc) Task is sharedd) Task is not acceptede) Task have un-saved data | Expected: a) "Share task" dialog opens in reasonable timeb) Active users or user groups can be searched & selected c) Notes can be addedd) Task priority can be sete) The share process should complete in reasonable timef) Other performers are notified when task is being sharedh) The list of performer is appended everytime you share the task, i.e. Share to TTQA1, then share to TTQA2, then share to TTQA3. The final task performers would be Youself, TTQA1, TTQA2, and TTQA3.i) User alert bar is created after assignment of who the task is shared toj) You are prompted for any un-saved datak) Task inbox is updated || Step 3: Restricted Re-Assign:a) Use a standard user, without admin rights (Check in security manager that user and user group does not have Data resources.Framework.Workflow.Task.UnrestrictedReassign rights)b) Change performer data provider from Office to Department | Expected: a) You can only search for users that have same OFFICE as you.b) You can only search for users that have same DEPARTMENT as you. || Step 4: Un-Restricted Re-AssignUse an admin user(Check in security manager that user is in Admin group and the user group have Data resources.Framework.Workflow.Task.UnrestrictedReassign rights) | Expected: You are able to search for all active users in the firm

Title: Task Security Policy
Description:
When closing the collaboration window after selecting users for the task(s) to be shared with/re-assigned to, if the validation passes, the followingoccurs with respect to the task security policies:
 
Details:
If the Collaborate window is open in the Reassign state, retrieve the Aderant supplied template policy with the "Perform" and "Reassign" right. 
If this template is not found, retrieve the Aderant supplied template policy with the "Perform" only right. 
If this is not found, display the error message "Aderant Template policy with Perform and Reassign rights or with Perform only right not found. Reassign task(s) failed.", with an "OK" button.When the user clicks the message box's "OK" button, close the message box, but leave the Collaborate window open.
 
For each selected task, the system should,
 
(a) Amend all existing non-firm policies that secure the task and that contain the "Perform" right, by including the identities in the Share With textbox as grantees (in addition to the existing grantees). 
(b) If the task's Share attribute is true, amend all existing non-firm policies that secure the task and that contain the "Perform" right, by including the identities in the Share With textbox as grantees (in addition to the existing grantees). 
(c) Add any users or groups that have been specified in the Reassign To / Share With textbox to the task's candidates list, if they are not already members of this list.
 
Things to Test:
Aderant template policy exists with 'Perform' and 'Reassign'
Aderant template policy exists with 'Perform' only
No Aderant policy foudn with either of above

Title: Standard smartform task action - Un-accept Task
Description:
Test that when a task is a candidate for auto accept (only one user has the right to perform a task via the functional perform security policy), the user still has the abilty to unaccept the task.
However once unaccepted the task is still only available to the one user, and still remains as an auto accept task. Once reopened the user will have to accept the task.
 
Verify that if a task is unaccepted from an open task (from the Unaccept button in the ribbon) before the data is saved, 
(a) Any changes that were made prior to the task being unaccepted are rolled back and do not update the context data.
(b) Accept and Close overlay buttons appear on task
(c) Unaccept button in ribbon changes to an Accept button
 
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: Un-Accept tasks via Task ribbon/Task window/Right click menu (3 iterations @Interface) | Expected: a) Unaccept button is ONLY visible when the task was already acceptedb) Unaccepted tasks have no iconsc) Task inbox is updatedd) Not applicable to shared tasks || Step 2: Task has multiple performers (multiple users or group) | Expected: If the unaccepted task have multiple performers, it will then showup in other performers' task inbox || Step 3: Task has only 1 performer | Expected: Apply rules from step #1 and #2 || Step 4: a) Check task ownership in SQL: select workflowname,displayname,CANDIDATES,PARTICIPANTS,OWNERID,PERFORMERID from WFM_TASK orderby LAST_MODIFIED descb) Check userID in SQL: select EMPL_UNO,EMPLOYEE_CODE,EMPLOYEE_NAME,USERID from HBM_PERSNL where USERID= (select TOP 1 OWNERID from WFM_TASK orderby LAST_MODIFIED desc) | Expected: Unaccepting the task would change the owner of the task to NULL

Title: User Notification when an active task was changed from other source
Description:
Test Objective: Verify that associated users will be notified through email when the task is completed or saved by one of the users.
 
Requirement Traceability: http://tfs.ap.aderant.com:8080/WorkItemTracking/WorkItem.aspx?artifactMoniker=16521
 
Details:
When a user completes the shared task, everyone in the shared list, except himself, will be notified thru email regardless of their email notification preference.
 
Functional test (this is assuming User1, User2, User3 and User4 share the task):
A. Save task
Verify that when User1 saves the task, the other users will be notified that the task has been changed. 
 
B. Complete task
Verify that when User1 completes the task, the other users will be notified that the task has been changed. 
 
C. Save or Complete shared by users in a group
Verify that when User1 completes or saves the task, the other users in the group will be notified that the task has been changed. 
 
D. Save or Complete shared by users using TaskReplicator activity
Verify that when User1 completes or saves the task, the other users in the group will be notified that the task has been changed.
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: Objective: Verify that associated users will be notified when the task is completed/saved/changed by another user.Setup:1. A task assigned to user group (i.e. create a new user group in CMS and add TTQA users and some test users)2. A task assigned to multiple users3. A task shared to user group4. A task shared with multiple users 5. Login to another machine as one of the test users || Step 2: #1 Task assigned to user groupOn the other machine, open task as the test user, do not accept the task. Then for each step, reopen the task on the test machine.a) On your machine open the task as yourself, accept the task.b) On your machine, make some changes to the task and save.c) On your machine, complete the task | Expected: For each case, the test user's should get a message saying "The task was modified from other user" and then the task window should close. || Step 3: #2 Task assigned to multipe usersOn the other machine, open task as the test user, do not accept the task. Then for each step, reopen the task on the test machine.a) On your machine open the task as yourself, accept the task.b) On your machine, make some changes to the task and save.c) On your machine, complete the task | Expected: For each case, the test user should get a message saying "The task was modified from other user" and then the task window should close. || Step 4: #3 Task shared to user groupOn the other machine, open task as the test user. Then for each step, reopen the task on the test machine.a) On your machine, make some changes to the task and save.b) You should get an dialog to notify other performers by email - choose yesc) On your machine, complete the taskd) Don't notify others by email | Expected: a) The test user should get a message saying "The task was modified from other user" and then the task window should close.b) All performers should get an email notification when you choose 'yes' and vice versa. || Step 5: #4 Task shared to multiple usersOn the other machine, open task as the test user. Then for each step, reopen the task on the test machine.a) On your machine, make some changes to the task and save.b) You should get an dialog to notify other performers by email - choose yesc) On your machine, complete the taskd) Don't notify others by email | Expected: a) The test user should get a message saying "The task was modified from other user" and then the task window should close.b) All performers should get an email notification when you choose 'yes' and vice versa.

Title: Standard smartform task action - View Workflow Status

1. Running flow
2. Completed flow
3. Restarted flow (view running and completed, cancelled and terminated). In all these, the status window should specifiy that the process was restarted)

6. Terminated flow (should still show a completed or ticked icon)

Grid behaviour

Description:

Title: Task inbox - Task list filters (views)
Description:
SP2 & Later - See the attachment. The feature is introduced from SP2 release. The feature allows to reschedule tasks and have tasks with (start and due dates).
 
**************
 
Test that the View My tasks filter correctly displays all relevant tasks:
 
Test both the expanded and collapsed view.
Ensure on the expanded, the correct column are included in the grid, as specified below.
Ensure that this refreshes when new tasks are added, aswell as an action is performed (Accept, unaccept, complete, that will change the content)
 
We have the following filters:
1. My Tasks - All my Accepted/Unaccepted and Shared tasks, important or not
2. Important - All Accepted and important tasks
3. Manager by Task - Tasks sorted by tasks, workflow display name is secondary text.  Will only appear if you are the workflow supervisor
4. Manage by User - Tasks sorted by users, task performers is secondary text.  Will only appear if you are the workflow supervisor
 
Collapsed layout:
- Subject (Task name, Client and Matter display names when applicable)
- Timestamp: Date and time when task was created
 
Expanded layout:
o Will display the following columns in the order given
-Status
-Task
   -Task Name
   -Received date/time
   -Performers
   -Workflow
 
-Details
 
 
 
****OLD****

- Description
- Participants
- Status

- Priority
- Data Label 1 
- Data Value 1 
- Data Label 2 
- Data Value 2 
- Data Label 3
- Data Value 3 
- Data Label 4
- Data Value 4 
- Workflow Display Name

Title: Transient group policy is updated when users being added/removed to the group
Description:
Test that the adding and removing of group members is updated in any running instances of workflows.
 
For a workflow that is currently running, and has tasks with users that are unaccepted that:
- Adding new users to the group means the tasks will appear in new users inbox
- Removing of users means that the task is removed from the users inbox.
 
 
Ensure that the direction of this is pushed eg notification tells user.

Title: Global process security - Default window
Description:
Security that will apply to the process (NOT individual tasks) can be set in the Workflow Properties window. This is launched from the Design Studio toolbar and will apply to the workflow process throughout the entire duration of the workflow.
 
Things to Test:
1. Process Security for the workflow can be viewed in the following way:
     a. Click on the 'Workflow Properties' button on the Aderant toolbar
     b. In the window that pops up, click on the 'Process Security' button
2. By default, the 'Administrators' group is ticked with the 'Workflow Administrators' policy - this should be disabled and cannot be changed
3. By default, the 'ServerExecution' User/Group ticked with the 'Workflow Service' policy - this should be disabled and cannot be changed
4. Users are NOT required to set anything manually here. If they do not, the default settings should be picked up.

Title: Global Task Security - Set Task Performer
Description:
To assign ALL tasks in a workflow to the same user(s), task performer(s) may be set within Global Task Security. 
This is useful in a test/development environment, but it is not recommneded in a production environment unless it makes sense for the particular use case.
In most cases, the task performer should only be set on individual tasks.
 
To set-up:
- From VS, click on the Workflow Properties button in the Design Studio toolbar
(a) Click on the Global Task Security button
(b) Add a user to the matrix that is only part of the Everyone and QA Security user groups, and is not assigned to any other process or task security for the workflow
(c) Assign this user to the Task Performers policy in the Process Security matrix
(e) Press the OK button and close the properties window
 
Things to Test:
If the user is set as the task performer in Global Task AND the individual task (activity in the workflow) has 'Include Process Security' set to True, the user should be able to:
1. Open, Save & Close and Complete the task.
2. Complete the task.
3. Share/reassign the task to any of the users in the available list (depending on that user's security level)
4. Is able to see the status of the task from the Task list and the Task form but not in the Process list
5. Cannot see the workflow process in any of the process lists in EA
6. Does not have the option to cancel the task from the task ribbon, or from the process list
 
TASK
EA Task List > View task in 'My Tasks' and 'Important' list --> Yes
EA Task List > View task in 'Manage By xxx' lists --> Yes
EA Task List and Task > View Status --> Yes
Task > Open, Save task --> Yes
Task > Complete task --> Yes
Task > Reassign/Share --> Yes
Task > Unrestricted Reassign/Share --> NO
Task > Cancel Process --> NO
 
PROCESS - NONE of these are applicable in this scenario
->  should not be able to see any of the processes in process lists (unless, of course, he is also a workflow supervisor/administrator at PROCESSlevel)
EA Process List > View process in 'My Active'and 'My Initiated Processes' lists --> No
EA Process List > View process in 'Processes' lists --> No
EA Process List > View process in 'xxx Processes' lists --> No
EA Process List > View Status --> No
EA Process List > Suspend/Resume/Cancel Process --> No
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Global Task Security - Set Workflow Administrator
Description:
Workflow Administrators can not be set at Global Task Level in design studio.
In order to set up adminitrator rights:
1. Open Security Manager, navigate to Data Policies tab.
2. In the dropbox, select Workflow Administrators. In the right pane, select a user to assign WF admin rights.
3. Alternatively, Navigate to Users tab. Search for the user, and attach the Workflow administrators policy.
 
By giving user WF admin rights, they will be given rights in both task and process security for ALL WF instances.
 
Things to Test:
If the user is set as Workflow Administrator, the following behaviour is expected:
 
TASK
EA Task List > View task in 'My Tasks' and 'Important' list --> Yes (only if he is also Task Performer)
EA Task List > View task in 'Manage By xxx' lists --> Yes 
EA Task List and Task > View Status --> Yes (only if he is also Task Performer)
Task > Open, Save task --> Yes
Task > Complete task -->  Yes (only if he is also Task Performer)
Task > Reassign/Share --> Yes
Task > Unrestricted Reassign/Share --> Yes
Task > Cancel Process --> Yes
 
PROCESS
EA Process List > View process in 'My Active'and 'My Initiated Processes' lists --> Yes (only if he is also WF initiator)
EA Process List > View process in 'Processes' lists --> Yes
EA Process List > View process in 'xxx Processes' lists --> Yes
EA Process List > View Status --> Yes
EA Process List > Suspend/Resume/Cancel Process --> Yes
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: Workflow Administrators cannot be set at Global Task Level in design studio.In order to set up adminitrator rights:1. Open Security Manager, navigate to Data Policies tab.2. In the dropbox, select Workflow Administrators. In the right pane, select a user to assign WF admin rights.3. Alternatively, Navigate to Users tab. Search for the user, and attach the Workflow administrators policy.By giving user WF admin rights, they will be given rights in both task and process security for ALL WF instances.Things to Test:If the user is set as Workflow Administrator, the following behaviour is expected:TASKEA Task List > View task in 'My Tasks' and 'Important' list --> Yes (only if he is also Task Performer)EA Task List > View task in 'Manage By xxx' lists --> Yes EA Task List and Task > View Status --> Yes (only if he is also Task Performer)Task > Open, Save task --> YesTask > Complete task --> NOTask > Reassign/Share --> YesTask > Unrestricted Reassign/Share --> YesTask > Cancel Process --> YesPROCESSEA Process List > View process in 'My Active'and 'My Initiated Processes' lists --> Yes (only if he is also WF initiator)EA Process List > View process in 'Processes' lists --> YesEA Process List > View process in 'xxx Processes' lists --> YesEA Process List > View Status --> YesEA Process List > Suspend/Resume/Cancel Process --> Yes

SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: "Workflow Supervisor" policy can be found in Security Manager - Data Policies - WorkflowGroupSupervisorTemplate | Expected: By default, workflow supervisor has the following rights:Process:-Reschedule-SuspendResume-Cancel-ViewProgressTask:-Reassign-Reject-Reschedule-UnrestrictedReassign-UpdateInfo || Step 2: In a workflow, grant a test user "Supervisor" rights in "Task Security", "Process Security", and "Global Task Security" | Expected: For all 3 cases, the test user should be able to:-View tasks and make changes, but NOT able to complete the task or view workflow progress.-View processes in all views, perform admin actions (e.g. Reschedule, terminate) || Step 3: In Security manager, add a user to the "WorkflowGroupSupervisorTemplate" policy, and run a workflow which the user is not assigned to any other process or task security. | Expected: The user should be considered as a "Workflow supervisor" in any workflow.

Title: WF Designer Activity Level Security UI and non Functional
Description:
Test Scope:
This relates to the security dialogue box that is evoked when a user wants to create a security plan for an activity by clciking on the property. This looks at the UI of this box as well as the non functional requirements.
 
Testing of the functionality eg, ensuring an activity is secured to certain users, will be looked at in another test.
 
Details:
Option to right click available for columns.
All right click columns are correct: select/deselct all open policy
On opening the security pop up for the first time all policies that are available are shown in columns (regardless if there is users tagged against these or not.
When opening after the initial instance, only columns that have been selected are displayed.
 
Users:
All users and groups displayed in the list of available users. 
Users can be selected by double clicking or single.
User groups can be selected by double clicking or single.
Users can be removed by right click option.
 
Policy:
Users can be added or removed to a policy
the rights of a policy can be maintained (only when selected from the right click option)
Note: this only updates a copy of the policy details: - should not update the security manager (confiirm)

Title: Milestone name - pending versus completed
Description:
Two separate properties on the Milestone activity
(a) Pending name- used for milestone name in workflow status if milestone NOT YET completed)

?? TBC: If only the pending name is provided in the milestone activity, it is also used for the completed name
