Title: Multple items with same percent complete
Description:
Test the use case where two or more milestones can have the same percentage complete, and how this displays in the status window.
 
1. Milestones that have the same percentage are sorted by level of completion, ie show incomplete followed by complete. 
 
2. Milestones that have the same percentage AND the same label only show the 1 item. If both are incomplete, so 1 entry as incomplete. If 1 complete, and 1 not completed, show 1 as completed. If both completed, show 1 as complete.
Steps:
Step 1: Test the use case where two or more milestones can have the same percentage complete, and how this displays in the status window.

1. Milestones that have the same percentage are sorted by level of completion, ie show incomplete followed by complete. 

2. Milestones that have the same percentage only show the 1 item. If both are incomplete, so 1 entry as incomplete. If 1 complete, and 1 not completed, show 1 as completed. If both completed, show 1 as complete.

2. Milestones that have been by passed by the sequence and not executed, display using icon (detailed in wire frames) denoting this.
 
a. Test both in sequence activity and state machine activity.
b. Use both milestones, in the following
conditional if else branches
parallel branches.
conditional parallel scenarios
task replicator activities (to potentially display tasks not completed)
Steps:
Step 1: Test the milestones that are yet to be completed display on the status window
- Milestones that have not yet been reached in the sequence display using icon (detailed in wire frames) denoting not yet reached
    a. Test in sequence activity
    b. Use both milestones, in the following
        - conditional if else branches
        - parallel branches
        - conditional parallel scenarios
        - task replicator activities (to potentially display tasks not completed)

Title: Cancel process from Process List
Description:
Users that have appropriate permissions may cancel a workflow by selecting the right-click option 'Cancel' from the Process list in EA. When a workflow is canceled, all active tasks are terminated before the workflow goes into the cancellation handler.
 
A user will only have permission to cancel a workflow if they belong to a data policy that has the following security resource:
>Framework>Workflow>Process>Terminate
By default, members of the Administrators user group has this permission as this group is a member of the Workflow Administrators data policy.
 
Things to Test:
1. Only users that have the above permission has the 'Cancel' option enabled in the right-click menu for Processes in EA
2. Any users that have active tasks open at this time should be notified that the task has been canceled/cannot be completed
3. All task inbox lists should be updated to remove these tasks from their view.
4. Selecting the 'Cancel Process' option on the task will invoke the workflow's cancellation handler before terrminating the workflow.
5. Workflow status changes to 'Cancelled'

Title: Process list action - Cancel workflow process
Description:
The 'Cancel Process' button is only available if the task performer has security to cancel workflow processes (i.e On the corresponding actviivty for the task on the workflow, the user is attached to the workflowGroup Supervisor policy). Selecting the 'Cancel Process' option on the task will invoke the workflow's cancellation handler before terrminating the workflow.
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: Cancel workflow process via Task window and Process listCheck the test user have Workflow Admin rights || Step 2: From Task window, cancel the workflow (Locate the "Cancel Process" button on task ribbon) | Expected: a) "Cancel Workflow Processes" dialog opens in reasonable timeb) Text control for entering comments is available - Comments are shown in the detailed summary status of the workflow process.c) Canceled workflow goes into cancellation handler, and the workflow process shows as "Cancelled" state (i.e. Fileopening would send you an email saying that workflow was cancelled)d) Assciated tasks are removed (Check task inbox and WFM_TASK) || Step 3: From Process list, cancel the workflow(Right click on the workflow process and select cancel) | Expected: a) "Cancel Workflow Processes" dialog opens in reasonable timeb) Text control for entering comments is available - Comments are shown in the detailed summary status of the workflow process.c) Canceled workflow goes into cancellation handler, and the workflow process shows as "Cancelled" state (i.e. Fileopening would send you an email saying that workflow was cancelled)d) Assciated tasks are removed (Check task inbox and WFM_TASK) || Step 4: When canceling from process list, check the following workflow conditions:a) Workflow is activeb) Workflow is faultedc) Workflow is completedd) Workflow is terminatede) Workflow is canceledf) Workflow is suspended | Expected: Check that process can only be canceled from Active, Faulted and Suspended state, cancel option is disabled for other states.

Title: Process list action - Suspend & Resume workflow process
Description:
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: This test covers: suspend workflow process via Process listCheck the test user have Workflow Admin rights || Step 2: From Process list, suspend the workflow(Right click on the workflow process and select suspend) | Expected: a) "Suspend" action completes in reasonable timeb) Suspended workflow process shows as "Suspended" state || Step 3: When suspending, check the following workflow conditions:a) Workflow is activeb) Workflow is faultedc) Workflow is completedd) Workflow is terminatede) Workflow is canceledf) Workflow is suspended | Expected: Check that "Suspend" option is ONLY enabled when workflow is in "Active" state || Step 4: From Process list, resume the suspended workflow(Right click on the suspened workflow and select resume) | Expected: a) "Resume" action completes in reasonable timeb) Workflow statues change to "Active" and resumes from where it was suspened from - verify by checking the reactivated tasks and workflow milestone records. || Step 5: When resuming, check the following workflow conditions:a) Workflow is activeb) Workflow is faultedc) Workflow is completedd) Workflow is terminatede) Workflow is canceledf) Workflow is suspended | Expected: Check that "Resume" option is available for workflows in "Suspended" (or Faulted) state

Title: Workflow process actions via AppFabric
Description:
If you have the ability to run IIS for an environment, you can cancel a workflow via AppFabric (this does not depend on security permissions in Security Manager). 
Canceling a workflow process from AppFabric should invoke the cancellation handler
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: In AppFabric, navigate to a service for a published workflow that has running instances and open AppFabric dashboard(e.g. Default Web Site/Expert_local/Workflows/Aderant.Workflow.FileOpening.MatterIntake/1) || Step 2: Drill into Active or Idle processes, right-click on an instance and select 'Cancel' | Expected: - Any users that have active tasks open at this time should be notified that the task has been canceled/cannot be completed - All task inbox lists should be updated to remove these tasks from their view. - Selecting the 'Cancel Process' option on the task will invoke the workflow's cancellation handler before terrminating the workflow. - Workflow status changes to 'Cancelled' || Step 3: Drill into Active or Idle processes, right-click on an instance and select 'Suspend' | Expected: - Any users that have active tasks open at this time should be notified that the task has been suspended be completed - All task inbox lists should be updated to remove these tasks from their view. - Workflow status changes to 'Suspended' || Step 4: Drill into Suspended processes, right-click on an instance and select 'Resume' | Expected: - All task inbox lists should be updated to re-add current tasks to EA views - Workflow status changes to 'Active' || Step 5: Drill into Active or Idle processes, right-click on an instance and select 'Terminate' | Expected: - Any users that have active tasks open at this time should be notified that the task has been canceled/cannot be completed - All task inbox lists should be updated to remove these tasks from their view. - Selecting the 'Terminate Process' option on the task will NOT invoke the workflow's cancellation handler.- Workflow status changes to 'Terminated'

Title: Process list action - Fault & resume workflow process
Description:
If an exception is not specifically handled by the workflow using 'TryCatch' activities, the workflow will be handled by AppFabric and suspended. The workflow can then be administered from AppFabric.
 
Example of fault not handled by workflow:....
 
Things to Test:
1. Exceptions that are not handled by specific handlers in the workflow are suspended (check in AppFabric AND the Process List in EA)
2. The suspended workflow can be resumed from AppFabric
3. The suspended workflow can be resumed from the Process List in EA
 
 
Examples of exceptions that might not be handled:
- Null references in Dynamic Script activities e.g. At runtime, the workflow does not have the value for something referred to in a script e.g. script refers to Client.Code, but no client has been selected/does not exist
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: This test covers: workflows going into faulted state and resuming faulted workflowsCheck the test user have Workflow Admin rights || Step 2: SETUP: Create a workflow solution, add an If activity and throw exception activity that "If DateTime.Now.Day = 30 then Throw exception", add a smartform task of any type. || Step 3: Set your system date to a day other than 30th of any month, then run the workflow. | Expected: Workflow should show as Faulted in EA process list || Step 4: Set your system date to 30th of any month.From Process list, resume the faulted workflow(Right click on the faulted workflow and select resume) | Expected: a) "Resume" action completes in reasonable timeb) Workflow status change to "Active" and resumes.c) You should recieve a task from the same workflow. || Step 5: When resuming, check the following workflow conditions:a) Workflow is activeb) Workflow is faultedc) Workflow is completedd) Workflow is terminatede) Workflow is canceledf) Workflow is suspended | Expected: Check that "Resume" option is available for workflows in "Faulted" (or Suspended) state

Title: Process list action - Terminate workflow process (Does not invoke cancellation handler)
Description:
After selecting ''Cancel' the user is prompted to 'Cancel' or 'Terminate' the workflow. Choosing 'Cancel' will bypass the Cancel handler of the workflow and set the workflow status to 'Cancelled'
 
Things to Test:
After selecting 'Terminate' from the Cancel dialog,
1. Any active tasks are canceled and removed from task inboxes
2. Workflow status changes to 'Cancelled'
3. Ensure Cancellation Handler was not invoked
 
 
Ensure that a process can be terminated whether it is in a suspended or running state.
 
Test the effect of terminating a process when multiple users have access to the task. Ensure the notifications are triggered to inform other users.
 
things to test:
One user terminates a process (resulting in the termination of a task) when another user has the task open.
 
One user terminates a process (resulting in the termination of a task) when another user has the task open, and trys to update the task.
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Smartforms, Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
Steps: Step 1: Terminate workflow process via Task window and Process listCheck the test user have Workflow Admin rights || Step 2: From Task window, terminate the workflow (Locate the "Cancel Process" button on task ribbon) | Expected: a) "Cancel Workflow Processes" dialog opens in reasonable timeb) Text control for entering comments is available - Comments are shown in the detailed summary status of the workflow process.c) Terminated workflow does NOT go into cancellation handler, and the workflow process shows as "Terminated" state (i.e. Fileopening has a cancellation hander that would send you an email saying that workflow was cancelled, you should NOT recieve this email when terminating Fileopening workflows)d) Associated tasks are removed (Check task inbox and WFM_TASK) || Step 3: From Process list, terminate the workflow(Right click on the workflow process and select cancel) | Expected: a) "Cancel Workflow Processes" dialog opens in reasonable timeb) Text control for entering comments is available - Comments are shown in the detailed summary status of the workflow process.c) Terminated workflow does NOT go into cancellation handler, and the workflow process shows as "Terminated" state (i.e. Fileopening has a cancellation hander that would send you an email saying that workflow was cancelled, you should NOT recieve this email when terminating Fileopening workflows)d) Associated tasks are removed (Check task inbox and WFM_TASK) || Step 4: When canceling from process list, check the following workflow conditions:a) Workflow is activeb) Workflow is faultedc) Workflow is completedd) Workflow is terminatede) Workflow is canceledf) Workflow is suspended | Expected: Check that process can only be terminated from Active, Faulted and Suspended state, cancel option is disabled for other states.

Title: Auto refresh of Workflow Process List
Description:
As a process list is updated, the process list should be automatically updated, without a user having to manually right-click on the Process List and select 'Refresh'
 
e.g.
Complete workflow
Suspend workflow
 
NOTE:

Title: View Processes as Proxy User
Workflow Client Processes Non Functional and UI Test
Description:
Test the below non functional and UI elements are correct for the Processes window
 
Screen Resize
·       Screen resizing will resize inbox grid proportionally
·       Toolbar will retain constant height but may re-organize itself for function availability using native ribbon capabilities.
Grid behaviour
·       User may click on any column to sort the Inbox as desired, user may hold shift-key down and click to specify a secondary sort column.
·       User may re-size columns as desired
o       Columns in grid should have a minimum width, beyond which they cannot be shrunk, too many or too wide columns will result in a horizontal scrollbar
·       User may select any column and use it as a "grouping" field to both sort and organise the inbox content.  Ideally such groupings include a count of members when collapsed.
·       On exiting application the current grid organization should be saved and restored on re-loading application.  User preferences will be lost if selecting a new view (opportunity for inspired idea here, ie: named views or a "user-preference" view).

Title: 01. Invoke from Start Without Debugging Window
Description:
If the Start Without Debugging window is pressed from the Design Studio toolbar, the Workflow Runner should open. 
 
Things to Test:
1. The details in the main body of the window should reflect the details (Name, Display Name, Category) from the properties of the workflow that was in focus when the button was pressed.
2. Hover hints on each of the buttons make sense
3. The Start New and Refresh buttons are always enabled
4. The 'Terminate All' and' Delete All' buttons are disabled if the Running Instances count is '0', should only be enabled if count is greater than 1
5. Start the WF via aderant tool bar then make some changes in the designer and start the WF again - this would update the running WF window with your changes; Make sure that starting new WFs would contain these changes, and the changes does not affect WF instances that were running already.
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: 02. Start new workflow instances
Description:
Clicking on the 'Start New' button in the workflow runner 'Run Workflow' window should:
 
1. Kick-off a workflow instance for the current workflow you have open in Design Studio
2. Increment the Running Instances count in the Run Workflow window by 1
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: 03. Terminate all workflow instances
Description:
Clicking the 'Terminate All' button will terminate all the running workflow instances for the current workflow. This will have the same effect as canceling a workflow from the Process List in EA (and selecting the Terminate option).
 
1. Task list in EA: Any tasks relating to those workflow instances should no longer be visible in any Task lists in EA
2. Process list in EA: The processes for those workflow instances will have a status of 'Canceled' in EA
3. The workflow instances will NOT be deleted from the WORKFLOW database -  The following query will still find any instances relating to that workflow definition
Select * from [System.Activities.DurableInstancing].Instances
3. The 'Running Instances' count on the workflow runner window is NOT decreased/updated
4. Ensure that only instances relating to the workflow that is active for that window are terminated
5. The workflow instances that were terminated will be displayed as 'Canceled' in the Process list in EA
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: 04. Delete all workflow instances
Description:
Clicking on the 'Delete All' workflow instances button in the workflow runner will delete the workflow instances from the database.
 
1. Task list in EA: Any tasks relating to those workflow instances should no longer be visible in any Task lists in EA
2. Process list in EA: The processes for those workflow instances will still have a status of 'ACTIVE' in EA (they cannot be canceled first otherwise we may still end up with wp3.exe errors)
3. The Running Instances count in the workflow runner window should be decreased to '0'
3. The workflow instances be DELETED from the WORKFLOW database - The following query should not find any instances relating to that workflow definition
Select * from [System.Activities.DurableInstancing].Instances
4. Ensure that only instances relating to the workflow that is active for that window are deleted
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Composite activity added to toolbox
Description:

Can be dragged onto workflow surface for this project.
(Only appears in the toolbox for the current project after solution is built - not permanently available in toolbox)

SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: Consuming composed activities
Description:
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
 
------------------------------
Drag and drop from toolbox sub-menu for the project
If arguments have been created on the composite activity, these are represented as required properties when the activity is consumed. Will result in build errors if not populated.
 
==============================================
 
Creating Single Activity
 
Before You Begin
You must have set up your Customization environment to enable you to create custom workflow activities. 
You will also need to have created the workflow project (.csproj) that you want to add the custom activity to. 
 
Instructions
To add a single custom activity to a workflow project:
1. Launch Visual Studio 2010. The Visual Studio 2010 startup screen displays.
2. In the ADERANT toolbar, click [Open project]. The Open Project screen displays.
3. Specify the location of the workflow project (.csproj) that you want to add the activity to.
4. Click Open.
5. Select Project > Add New Item from the main menu. The Add New Item screen displays.
6. In the Installed Templates pane to the left of the screen, select Visual C# > Workflow.
7. In the middle pane, select Activity.
8. Click Add. A new blank custom activity is added to the project and the designer for this activity opens.
9. In the Simplified Explorer pane, select <ActivityName>.xaml.
10. Build the activity to meet your requirements.
    Tip: Building a new activity is an advanced customization scenario which involves writing C# code called a Code Activity (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd489425.aspx).
11. Click [save].
12. Select Build > Build Solution from the main menu
 
What Happens Next
The new activity is displayed in the Toolbox pane to the left of the screen and is available to use within the workflow project.
 
You can now choose to do one or more of the following actions:
1.  To add the new activity to the current workflow:  
               Drag the activity from the Toolbox pane to the left of the screen on to the editing pane. 
2.  To add the new activity to another workflow within the current solution:  
               Drag the activity from the Toolbox pane to the left of the screen on to the editing pane. 
3.  To add the new activity to another workflow solution: 
               Add a reference in the workflow project to the output (.dll) file of the custom activity library.
4.  To make the new activity available to workflow projects and solutions in another environment:   
               Add a reference in the workflow project to the output (.dll) file of the custom activity library. 
 
Note: To add created activities:
1. Right-click in the toolbox and 'Add a Tab'.  
2. In that Tab, right-click and 'Choose Items'.  
3. In the 'Choose Toolbox Items' select the 'System.Activities Components' tab.
4. Click 'Browse' and locate the project folder where the activities were created.
5. Select the .dll in the Bin folder and click 'Open'.  If the 'System.Activities Components' grid is sorted according to Directory, notice that all the .xaml files (includes any workflow file), which are effectively the created activities, are selected (ticked).
6. Tick/untick the activities.

Title: Consuming composite activity
Description:
Should be visible in:
 
1. To edit/maintain: In Simplified Explorer 
2. To consume in workflow: In Toolbox - in own section for the workflow.

Title: Create new Activity Library
Description:
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of Workflows etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.
 
------------------
 
Can create a composite of ANY combination of activities from a workflow to create a activity library.
 
Need to include all possible activities into the library to see if there are dependency issues e.g. dynamic Script activity depending on the existance of AppData to find its workflow.py file and actually work.
 
======================================
 
Creating Activity Libraries
 
Before You Begin
You must have set up your Customization environment to enable you to create custom workflow activities. 
You will also need to have created the workflow project (.csproj) that you want to add the custom activity to. 
 
Instructions to create a custom activity:
1. Launch Visual Studio 2010). The main Workflow Designer screen displays.
2. In the ADERANT toolbar, click [Open project] . The Open Project screen displays.
3. Specify the location of the workflow project (.csproj) that you want to add the custom activity to.
Note: If you already have a workflow solution (.sln) open, you can choose to either open this workflow project within that solution (by selecting the Add to Solution option) or close the current solution and open the one that contains the workflow project (by selecting the Close Solution option).
4. Click Open.
     Tip: The Open button provides a dropdown with a Show previous versions option.
5. Select File > Add > New Project from the main menu. The Add New Project screen displays.
6. In the Installed Templates pane to the left of the screen, select Visual C# > Expert. A list of ADERANT Expert templates is displayed in the middle pane.
7. In the middle pane, select Expert Workflow Activity Library.
     Tip: We strongly recommend that you use the ADERANT Expert template because it already has all the references required for the ADERANT Expert environment set up.
8. Click OK. An activity library (and activity.xaml file) is added to the project. the new activity library is listed in the Simplified Explorer pane to the right of the screen.
9. In the Simplified Explorer pane to the right of the screen, select the ActivityName.xaml file.
     Tip: If the Simplified Explorer pane is not visible, select the Simplified Layout button from the ADERANT toolbar.
10. Build the activity to meet your requirements.
     Tip: Building a new activity library is an advanced customization scenario which involves writing C# code called a Code Activity (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/enus/library/dd489425.aspx).
11. Click [Save].
12. Select Build > Build Solution from the main menu.
 
Add New Activity to Workflow
To add the newly created activity to one of the workflow projects in the solution that is currently open:
1. In the Simplified Explorer view to the right of the screen, double-click the workflow.xamlx file associated with the workflow project that you want to add the activity to. That file should be loaded, or become active, within the editing pane in the middle of the screen.
2. Drag new activity from the Toolbox pane to the right of the screen, into the editing pane in the middle of the screen.
3. In the Properties pane to the right of the screen, complete the properties for the new activity.
     Tip: If the Properties pane is not displayed, select View > Properties Window from the main menu.
4. Click in the Aderant Toolbar. The workflow.xmalx file is saved.
 
What Happens Next
The new activity is displayed in the Toolbox pane to the left of the screen and is available to use within any of the workflow projects within the current workflow solution.
     Tip: If the Toolbox pane is not displayed to the left of the screen, select View > Toolbox from the main menu.
 
You can now choose to do one or more of the following actions:
1.  To make this activity library available to workflow projects and solutions in another environment:
               Copy the output (dll) file and add it as a reference in the target project.
 
2.  To add another activity to the activity library:
               a. Right-click on the Activity Library and select Add New Item. The Add File screen displays.
               b. Select Visual C# > Workflow.
               c. Select Activity.
               d. In the Name: field, specify a name for the new activity.
               e. Click OK. The new activity is listed under the Activity Library.
               f. In the Simplified Explorer, select the ActivityName.xmal file.
               g. Build the new activity, as required.
               h. Click [Save] in the Aderant Toolbar. The new activity is saved.
               i. Select Build > Build Solution from the main menu. The new activity is added to the Toolbox pane to the left of the screen and will be available to use within any of the workflow projects within the current workflow solution.
 
3.  To make this activity library available to workflows outside of the current workflow solution but within the current environment:
               Copy the output (dll) file and add it as a reference in the target project.
 
4.  To make this activity library available to workflow projects and solutions in another environment:
               Copy the output (dll) file and add it as a reference in the target project.

Title: Task inbox - Task list sorting
Description:
2 types of sort order will be present on the EA Task Inbox.
- Priority
- Custom.
 
Priority 
- First show tasks DUE TODAY OR EARLIER. These must be sorted ASCENDING ON DUE DATE.
- Next show tasks that should START TODAY OR EARLIER. These must be sorted DESCENDING ON CREATED DATE.
- Finally show tasks that have a FUTURE START DATE. These must be sorted ASCNEDING ON START DATE.
 
Custom
- By expanding the task inbox and clicking on a lable to sort by that field. The system will remember the last custom sort selected, and will save this to the user's prefeerences, when they exit the application. The default custom sort order will be on Task Name ASCENDING.
- Right-Click -> Sort -> Custom - will sort by the last 'remembered' custom sort order.
 
Note: The expanded and collapsed views of the Task Inbox should always be synchronised in their sort order.
 
The sort order of tasks in the systray EA shouldn't be the same as in detached EA - as both of them have difference user preferences in the Configuration Manager.
Steps: Step 1: Setup - Launch several tasks from several workflows (e.g. - FO, PRebill, etc) || Step 2: Open EA in the system tray | Expected: EA is opened. || Step 3: Expand the EA TAsk Inbox View. | Expected: The EA task inbox is expanded and the following four columns are shown: 1. Status 2. Task 3. Dates 4. Details || Step 4: Navigate to the task inbox and see the default sorting order of the tasks. | Expected: By default, the tasks are sorted by their 'Priority'. (Confirm this by right-clicking on the task inbox and checking the 'Sort By' option. Should be selected as 'Default') || Step 5: Click on 'Start' field to sort the inbox based on the sort date. | Expected: The tasks in the inbox are sorted accordingly as per the 'Start' date on the tasks. || Step 6: Now right-click on the task inbox -> 'Sort By' and see the option selected. | Expected: The 'Custom' Sort by option is selected automatically on contrary to Step 3. This is because you clicked on the 'Start' field in the previous step - which changes the sort order to 'Custom' type from 'Defaul' type. || Step 7: Expand the EA Task Inbox View. | Expected: Ensure that the sorting is synchronised with the Expanded and Collapsed EA Views. || Step 8: Close and reopen the EA. || Step 9: Once again check the tasks in the EA Task Inbox. | Expected: Should have the same sorting as in step 5. The system remember's the User Preferences.

Title: "All My Tasks" view on the EA Task Inbox
Description: A new inbox view is created to show "All My Tasks" that the workflow has initialized, but are  not expected to be performed yet. This view allows a user or administrator to access tasks that are waiting to be performed and choose to actively perform them early, change their scheduling, re-assign or whatever action might be needed.

Title: EA- Changes in "Manage by User, Manage by Task" views of the EA Task Inbox.
Description:
The Manage by User view will also display the future dated tasks and they will be sorted to be at the bottom of the list.
 
The Manage by Task view will also display the future dated tasks and they will be sorted to tbe at the bottom of the list.

Title: EA - Expected Date/Due Date fields on the EA Task Inbox
Description:
When the EA Task Inbox is expanded, an additional column 'Dates' can be seen along with 'Status, Task & Details'
 
The Dates column should show the following 3 fields:
1. Received
2. Start
3. Due.

Title: Sort Order on the EA Task Inbox should be synchronised for Expanded and Collapsed views
Description:
The user can perform a custom sory, by expanding the task inbox and c licking on a lable to sort by that field. Only single-field sortng will be enabled. The system will remember the last custom sort selected, and will save this to the user's preferences, when they exit the application. The default custom sort order will be on Task Name ascending.
 
The collapsed and expanded views of the Task Inbox should always be synchronised in their sort order.

Title: Sort By on EA Task Inbox - Custom
Description:
2 types of sort order will be present on the EA Task Inbox.
- Priority
- Custom.
 
Priority 
- First show tasks DUE TODAY OR EARLIER. These must be sorted ASCENDING ON DUE DATE.
- Next show tasks that should START TODAY OR EARLIER. These must be sorted DESCENDING ON CREATED DATE.
- Finally show tasks that have a FUTURE START DATE. These must be sorted ASCNEDING ON START DATE.
 
Custom
- By expanding the task inbox and clicking on a lable to sort by that field. The system will remember the last custom sort selected, and will save this to the user's prefeerences, when they exit the application. The default custom sort order will be on Task Name ASCENDING.
- Right-Click -> Sort -> Custom - will sort by the last 'remembered' custom sort order.
 
Note: The expanded and collapsed views of the Task Inbox should always be synchronised in their sort order.
 
The sort order of tasks in the systray EA shouldn't be the same as in detached EA - as both of them have difference user preferences in the Configuration Manager.

Title: Existing SmartForm tasks (V2 Tasks) retain their originality
Description:
New SmartForms are built to a requirement from clients - they are designed in such a way that the task within the workflow is expected to be performed on or by a specific date. The new SmartForm task is named as V3 SmartForm and they do have any date related fields (SCHEDULING) as properties.
 
Existing application use V2 Version of SF Task. Existing applications should not have any new changes to the SF task

Title: Future Dated Tasks on "All My Tasks" inbox
Uncheck 'Enable Rescheduling' on the workflow properties
Description:
By default, 'Enable Rescheduling' is checked on the workflow properties dialog. Having this ticked would allow an user to reschedule his/her workflow process.
 
When this option is UNCHECKED in the workflow properties window, ideally the 'Reschedule' option on the workflow process and task should not be available or should be disabled.
Steps:
Step 1: Setup - Build a simple workflow and start new task.Note - when you create the workflow, ensure that 'Enable Rescheduling' option is unchecked in the workflow properties dialog.Note - Check WorkflowAdministrators Data Policy in Security Manager and make sure Reschedule at the process level is denied/not allowed. || Step 2: Run the workflow without debugging and Start a new workflow. | Expected: The task is created and can be seen in "My Tasks" (if the start date is Today)
In case of future dated tasks, the task can be seen in "All My Tasks" inbox. || Step 3: Navigate to the Process inbox and look for the process associated with this task || Step 4: Right-click on the respective process and look for "Reschedule" option. | Expected: Reschedule option should not be available at the process level - as the "Enable Rescheduling" option was unchecked in the workflow properties dialog in Step 1. || Step 5: Right-click on the task and look for "Reschedule" option. | Expected: Reschedule option should not be shown at the task level - as the "Enable Rescheduling" option was unchecked in the workflow properties dialog in Step 1.

Title: Task inbox - Task list grouping
Description:
Group By - functionality allows the user to group the workflow tasks according to the selected option. For instance, the user could group by - Tasks, Category, Workflow, Due Date.
 
The tasks should be synchronised with the sort order in the collapsed and expanded version of EA.
 
The sort order of tasks in the systray EA shouldn't be the same as in detached EA - as both of them have difference user preferences in the Configuration Manager.
Steps: Step 1: Setup - Ensure that you already have a list of workflow tasks from different applications (for e.g. FO, Prebill, etc) in your inbox. || Step 2: Navigate to EA Task Inbox and have "My Tasks" view. | Expected: All tasks with today as start date and earlier dates will be shown. Note - Tasks with future date will be seen in "All My Tasks" inbox view. They could also be seen at the bottom of "Manage by User" and "Manage by Tasks" inbox views. || Step 3: Right click on the task inbox and Group By -> @Groupby | Expected: The tasks in the inbox will be grouped by @Groupby || Step 4: Collapse 1 or more groups. | Expected: The groups are collapsed. || Step 5: Change the inbox view to "All My Tasks". | Expected: All the tasks (including future dated tasks) will be shown. || Step 6: Change the inbox view to "My Tasks". | Expected: The inbox should look like (the Expected Result) of Step 5 (i.e.) already collapsed groups should appear as collapsed. || Step 7: Repeat the same test for EA in detatched mode. | Expected: Should behave the same as in systray mode.

Title: Security Policy governing access to reschedule the workflow - Task Level
Description:
A new securable task level right-click menu option is available to "Reschedule Task". 
 
- This brings up a dialog that allows the user to adust the expected and/or the due date of that task by a numeric offset. For instance you can choose to defer this task by 3 days. If a task does not have an expected or due date, then this applies a date to the task - hence allowing you to conceptually defer work that didn't have expected/due dates allocated by design.
 
- If a user completes a task BEFORE the Expected date, then they are given a dialog that states "You have completed this task ahead of schedule, do you wish to bring forward all other active tasks accordingly?" Selecting Yes will adjust all other tasks by the number of days the current task has preceded expectation.
 
- If a user completes a task AFTER the Due Date, then they are given a dialog that states "You have completed this task behind schedule, do you wish to defer all other active tasks accordingly?" Selecting Yes will adjust all other tasks by the number of days the current task has been late.
 
***********
VD - Since I'm an administrator in the database, it was decided to create another data policy (by copying the existing WorkflowAdministrators policy) and deny the 'Reschedule' right on the (copied) policy.
***********
 
SECURITY:
 
Processes and Task reschedule options are new securable operations for workflow. 
Default Workflow Admin policy and default Workflow Supervisor policy should include both of these rights - Reschedule at Task and Process level. 
Default Perform policy should include the reschedule task right only - Reschedule at Task level only.

Title: User Prompt to reschedule tasks when a task is completed early
User Prompt to reschedule task when a task is completed late
Description:
A new securable task level right-click menu option is available to "Reschedule Task". This brings up a dialog that allows you to adjust the expected and/or the due date of that task by a numeric offset. For instance you can choose to defer this task by 3 days. If a task does not have an expected or due date, then this applies a date to the task - hence allowing you to conceptually defer work that didn't have expected/due dates allocated by design.
 
If a user completes a task AFTER the Due Date, then they are given a dialog that states "You have completed this task behind schedule, do you wish to defer all other active tasks accordingly?" Selecting Yes will adjust all other tasks by the number of days the current task has been late.

Title: (Smoke Test) Workflow Administration app
Steps: Step 1: Run WorkflowAdmin.exe from ExpertShare as:a) Admin userb) TTQA user (Non admin) | Expected: - Non admin users cannot run the app - appropriate error message is shown- Non-privilege level 1 user cannot access this app - App launches for Admin users- By default the Processes tab is loaded without filters applied || Step 2: We don't retrieve all workflows at startup || Step 3: Processes tab | Expected: By default the following columns are shown:a) Categoryb) Workflow Namec) Startedd) Statee) Last Eventf) Versiong) Workflow Ref 1 - 4h) Initiated By || Step 4: Start workflow instances and check that those instances are shown in the Processes tab. | Expected: a) Workflows instances are shown with appropriate details in Workflow admin and EAb) The total number of WFs matches the number in the tab || Step 5: Test each of the filters individually using appropriate parameters based on the test data set | Expected: Each of the filters (Date From, Date To, Workflow, Performer and References) will filter the results in the processes pane accurately. || Step 6: Use a combination of different filters to ensure that they are able to work in conjunction with each other. Search function still works with/without "Show First 100" option ticked | Expected: When applying multiple filters the results shown in the processes pane will display the results expected || Step 7: Use each of the option provided in the Reports button (SSRS must be enabled for this to function) | Expected: Check all the data returns in the report are according to the filters || Step 8: Switch to the Tasks pane and test each of the filters individually. Search function still works with/without "Show First 100" option ticked | Expected: Each of the filters (Date From, Date To, Workflow, Performer, References and Task) will filter the results in the processes pane accurately. || Step 9: Use a combination of different filters to ensure that they are able to work in conjunction with each other. | Expected: When applying multiple filters the results shown in the processes pane will display the results expected || Step 10: Return to the processes tab and clear the filters, on the right hand side change the Processes drop down, and select each of the options | Expected: ensure that the processes shown appropriately match the process filter. || Step 11: select a process and right click menu - view tasks | Expected: Note: Unless you are in the administrators group, you will only see tasks you have the right to see; this list should correlate with the list of tasks you are able to see in Expert Assistant!This applies to all steps in the test.the tasks pane will be brought to focus and the tasks relating to the process will be shown, all others will have been filtered out || Step 12: changing the tasks drop down menu from filtered to all tasks will reset the view | Expected: all the tasks are shown in the pane. || Step 13: right click, and re-assign a task | Expected: able to re-assign a task and the new assignee is show in the details (refresh may be required) || Step 14: in the processes tab, suspend a workflow and restart it | Expected: suspended workflow disappears from active processes list and you are able to switch to suspended processes list and resume it. || Step 15: in the processes tab, right click and cancel the process | Expected: using the cancel and terminate options will cancel the task and ammend the status appropriately. || Step 16: Verify all the Right click options are available in the ribbon as buttons. | Expected: Buttons change depending on selected workflow and available actions. || Step 17: Go to the logging page for workflow instances by clicking on the instance name

Description:

- This brings up a dialog that allows the user to adust the expected and/or the due date of that task by a numeric offset. For instance you can choose to defer this task by 3 days. - If a user completes a task BEFORE the Expected date, then they are given a dialog that states "You have completed this task ahead of schedule, do you wish to bring forward all other active tasks accordingly?" Title: Email notification for future dated task - REVISIT THIS
Description:
When Email Notification is turned on in the EA - Task Inbox Settings, it should send task notification to the assignee (whom the task is assigned to) via email.
 
FOR TASKS WITH START-DATE IN FUTURE:
For a future dated task, it shouldn't send email notification when the task is created or assigned. 
IMP - Instead it should send email notification whenever the task's start date is reached. - **** Test this and include in the test step ***
Steps: Step 1: Set-up: Launch EA (in systray) and turn on the Email notification under Task Inbox Settings. | Expected: Email notification is turned on. || Step 2: Start a new task. | Expected: The task is notified via Email and a Toast. || Step 3: Edit the above workflow to have Start Date Offset of the first task to a future date. For example, add '1' to the Start Date Offset field. || Step 4: Rebuild and run the workflow again. Start a new task | Expected: That task is not notified via Email or Toast. SP2 - Currently, an email is sent out and a toast appears as soon as this task is assigned, despite the start date being in the future.

Title: Running the Sample Workflows (SP2 Version and Later)
Description:
Importing the package C:\ExpertShare\Workflows\Sample would import the three workflows along with their actions and smartforms. Hence the workflow can be started from the EA - Actions menu.
 
If you want to look at the actual workflow itself, navigate to the C:\ExpertShare\Workflow\Sample and unzip the package containing the workflows. Click on the solution to open the solution.
Steps: Step 1: Import Sample WorkflowsC:\ExpertShare\Workflows\Samples\SampleWorkflows.zip | Expected: Imports successfully || Step 2: Open EAOpen OTG Workflow (IIS>Expert_Local>Application Services> Browse) | Expected: added to EA: Start a Help Desk Request / Start a Leave Request / Start an Office Supplies Requestadded to OTG: Start Leave Request || Step 3: Start Leave Request workflow via EA and OTG(if you don't get the second task, set yourself as the supervisor and department head in the hbm_persnl table and CMS respectively) | Expected: The workflow gets started and goes through all the steps without any issues. || Step 4: Start Supplies Request workflow | Expected: The workflow gets started and goes through all the steps without any issues. || Step 5: Start Help Desk Request workflow. | Expected: The workflow gets started and goes through all the steps without any issues.

Title: Email Notification for a future dated Reassigned task - REVISIT THIS

Title: Workflow options - Open task in running application
Workflow options - Auto open next task when current task is completed
Steps: Step 1: Open Configuration Manager and view Technical.Framework.Workflow.Options.LaunchSubsequentAlert. || Step 2: Delete all configuration values except the system scope values. || Step 3: Open Expert Administration and go to System > Workflow Options. || Step 4: Uncheck "Auto open next task when current task is completed". || Step 5: Specify a package and save. || Step 6: Refresh Configuration Manager. | Expected: A new firm scope configuration value is created. It is "false". || Step 7: Open Expert Assistant. Go to Settings > Task Inbox. See the "Auto open next task when completing current task" option is unchecked. | Expected: "Auto open next task when completing current task" option is unchecked. || Step 8: Start a workflow. Complete a task. Wait for a while. It should not open the next task automatically. | Expected: It does not open the next task automatically. || Step 9: Shut down Expert Assistant. || Step 10: In Expert Administration, check "Auto open next task when completing current task" option and save. || Step 11: Refresh Configuration Manager. | Expected: The firm scope configuration is now "true". || Step 12: Open Expert Assistant again. Go to Settings > Task Inbox. See the "Auto open next task when completing current task" option is checked. | Expected: "Auto open next task when completing current task" option is checked. || Step 13: Start a workflow. Complete a task. After a while, the next task should open automatically. | Expected: The next task opens automatically.

Title: Reschedule Process to an Earlier date
Description:
The workflow process can be rescheduled to an earlier date or later date.
- When rescheduled to an earlier date, the rescheduled process then sits in the 'My Tasks' inbox with a high-priority icon (if the due date is earlier than today) or with the normal icon if the due date is today.
Steps: Step 1: Setup - Create a workflow with the SF Task. Set the SF Task to have Start Date either today or in future and Due Date to be null. Start a new task of the workflow. || Step 2: In EA - Processes, find the respective workflow process (that you just launched the task for) and right-click 'Reschedule'. | Expected: The Reschedule dialog opens up asking to reschedule 'x' days earlier or later. || Step 3: Enter 10 in the box and choose earlier. | Expected: A toast message is displayed once the task is rescheduled successfully. Also, the task is put up in the 'My Tasks' inbox view with the high-priority (Exclamation mark) icon. (Currently no exclamation mark appears, probably due to there being no due date)

Title: Reschedule Process to a Later date
Description:
The workflow process can be rescheduled to an earlier date or later date.
- When rescheduled to a later date, the rescheduled process then sits in the 'All My Tasks' inbox (as the start date of the task is in future).

Add Time Entries and test Ignore All action
Description:
There is a new option available to "Ignore all" the mis-spelt words on Expert Time.  
For instance, if a user spells hello as 'Hellooo' at more than one place. Right click -> Ignore all should ignore the yellow high-lighting from all the places of the word 'Hellooo'.
 
But this doesn't get persisted if you close and reopen the app again.

Title: Testing 'Ignore All' on general Notes feature
Description:
There is a new option available to "Ignore all" the mis-spelt words on Expert Time/wherever spell-checking is used (notes, narrative editor etc).  
- Client would like the Ignore All option in Spellcheck to affect all time entries within the user's view instead of each individual entry.
- For instance, if a user spells hello as 'Hellooo' at more than one place. Right click -> Ignore all should ignore the yellow high-lighting from all the places of the word 'Hellooo'.
 
But this doesn't get persisted if you close and reopen the app again.

Send email notification for reassigning task
Description:
As a workflow user I may not want to receive notifications of new tasks, but do want to receive notifications for re-assignments.  Classic example is in Paperless Billing where I am not normally part of the process, but on occasion get roped in.  In this situation it is great to get emails for what in effect are manual escalations.
 
- This test is to ensure that the user receives email for the Reassigned task

Title: Service Account Validation - Validate against local service account

Steps: Step 1: Make sure you have undeployed expert || Step 2: Change your service account user to a invalid domain user (e.g. Aderant_ap\ashdkjasd) | Expected: Attempt to deploy. Deployment should fail during the prereq check saying that the service user is invalid || Step 3: Set service user to a local account that is invalid (e.g. .\asdsad) | Expected: Attempt to deploy. Deployment should fail during the prereq check saying that the service user is invalid || Step 4: Deploy with a valid user with a incorrect password | Expected: Attempt to deploy. Deployment should fail during the prereq check saying that the password is incorrect || Step 5: Deploy with a valid user with the correct password | Expected: No errors should be thrown by the prereq checker regarding the service accounts

Basic Design Studio 2 UI
Description:
This tests assumes you start DS for the first time. if you used it before, make sure to remove your user preferences

 
With 8.0.3 the Navigation and Properties panel are selected via the Show / Hide Panels button.
 
Design Studio 2 is a 
- Combined tool incorporating workflow, smartform, domain/data, rule & action editors.
- Simplified designers limited to common activities and properties
- Rules, Actions, Scheduling.
Steps: Step 1: Click Navigation and Properties from the ribbon | Expected: DS opens showing the Home tab with all available Products, Navigation an Properties can be chosen to be shown or hidden. || Step 2: Navigate through the left pane. | Expected: You can expand and collapse the available products for menues jobs or rules etcPost 8.0.3: You have the ability to include System / Firm items in your Navigation || Step 3: Double click to open (an action, rule, job or an Extension Point) | Expected: The item is opened on the design surface where edits could be made. Edits can also be made on the Properties pane on the right. The Data used for the item is shown in the Data tab (on the right side). The Version is shown in the Version tab (on the right side).Post 8021: Edits can only be made if item is in edit mode / Firm version || Step 4: Check the header for the opened item | Expected: It displays information about the item like Name Active Description Effective From || Step 5: Click the Buttons in the Home Tab | Expected: External Tools open as expected

Title: Set Task priority via workflow variable
Default Actions come through deployment
Description:
Ensure that you delete everything from the following 4 tables:
1. FWM_EXTENSION_POINT
2. FWM_EXTENSION_POINT_CONTRACT
3. FWM_RULE
4. FWM_RULE_ITEM
 
And then deploy the Rules branch (until it is merged to Main).
 
Make sure that you get all your default actions in the EA Actions menu. (Note - Default Actions refer to the Actions that Aderant provides by default and are not customized ones)
In Future - You should also be getting the client customized actions on the EA Actions menu.

Title: Customized Actions come through deployment
Description:
(Not Implemented Yet)
 
With the deployment of Expert Services Framework, it is expected for the clients to get their own custom actions migrated automatically to the new Actions Infrastructure that the Design Studio 2 is going to provide.
 
To test this,
1. Make sure that you have some custom actions built in the EA Actions menu.
2. Deploy Expert and without running any SQL, verify if the actions have come through.

Title: Properties for Workflow outcome
Expression language extending the support of calculated fields for STRINGS
Description:
- Strings
Support concatenation using the '+' operator, e.g. DisplayName = Title+FirstName+MiddleName+LastName
 
The poop-up will allow multiple strings to be listed and concatenated together. The string can be either a reference to a string or a literal value.

Title: Expression language extending the support of calculated fields for NUMBERS
Description:
- Numbers
Support basic arithmetic operator: +,-,*,/. [Add, Subtract, Multiple, Divide]
Support a Rounding function: ROUND( ).
Support scoping via parenthesis to override operator precedence.
 
Provide a simple equation editor that allows the basic arithmetic operations and parenthesis to be entered:
(3+4)*5=35.
3+4*5=23.

Title: Expression language extending the support of calculated fields for DATES
Description:
- Dates
Support adding a time period to a date-time. Allow second, minute, hour, day, month, year units to be used.
 
- DateTime
Support concepts NOW and TODAY.
NOW returns the current system date-time.
TODAY returns the current system daet with the time component set to 12.00.00 a.m.
Allow time periods (second, minute, hour, day, week, month, year) to be added and subtracted from a date-time.

Test Date Picker
Steps: Step 1: Single Click on Single Date in Calendar | Expected: The date selected is highlighted in the calendar. Refresh of Found Time list and Time Entries list occurs after selection. || Step 2: Single Click on Calendar Arrows to Scroll thru Calendar Months Display | Expected: Calendar month displays a single month. No refresh of Found Time list or Time Entries list occurs unless new dates are selected. Can scroll back to the calendar month of dates selected and dates are highlighted and correspond to items displayed in Found Time list and Time Entries list. Scrolling allows display of future calendar months. || Step 3: Click Today Button to Set Calendar to Current Day | Expected: Current date is highlighted on the calendar. Refresh of Found Time list and Time Entries list occurs after selection. If Today button is selected and Calendar Month display does not show current month - the calendar month display changes to the current month and the current date is highlighted. || Step 4: Invalid Data Entry, Invalid Actions, etc. | Expected: Application displays appropriate error messages and disables/ignores invalid actions. Application does not display exceptions or crash. || Step 5: Test '.' key | Expected: Today's date. || Step 6: Test '.' key on the number-pad (yes they're different) | Expected: Today's date. || Step 7: Test 't' | Expected: Today's date. || Step 8: Test 'T' | Expected: Today's date. || Step 9: Test 'y' | Expected: Yesterday's date. || Step 10: Test 'Y' | Expected: Yesterday's date. || Step 11: Enter date using the keyboard | Expected: As expected. || Step 12: Test year changer | Expected: Can click on the year at the top of the date picker and scroll to other years || Step 13: Test month changer | Expected: Can click on the month at the top of the date picker and scroll to other months

Title: Generate Full MSI
Steps: Step 1: Prerequisite: You need to have deployed as a Test/Production environment prior to running this test.Or use one of the existing ITE's that has your desired release deployed. | Expected: MSI and ClickOnce files will not deploy remotely if the source environment is deployed as a customization environmentThis is due to the way we've specified the config files as pointing to C:\Expertshare instead of a network accessible address || Step 2: Post 8.0.3: In Deployment Manager > Advanced Options tick to generate Full MSI and Deploy | Expected: Full MSI are generated || Step 3: Remove Full MSI / make sure deployment has no full MSI | Expected: No full MSI || Step 4: In Power Shell: Run the command, DE GenerateFullMsi | Expected: Script will run without any errors.Two files are generated (assuming time roles are ticked), which are:ExpertTime.Full.msiExpertTimeActiveAgent.Full.msi || Step 5: Check that new .full.msi files have been generated in the ExpertShare specified by your environment.xml | Expected: Full MSI are generated || Step 6: Post 8.0.3:Leave Full MSI installed, remove deployment, Tick Require latest MSI Version in advanced options, deploy a newer build, try using old Full MSI | Expected: You get prompted that your MSI version is not the latest and you need to uninstall - reinstall latest.

Save & Close the Action. || Step 2: Open EA from your ExpertShare folder and double click on the action. | Expected: The file is opened.

Title: QbeSearchBox - Create & Consume
Description:
Expenses branch has added the smart form implementation of the QbeListBox, which is called the QbeSearchBox. We consumed this within the expenses app for the ReceiptMeal smart form.  Added a ReceiptInternalAttendee data provider for this purpose.  And created a mock QbeSearchBox in the UX Catalog page for the QbeListBox. 
 
 
QBeSearch box can be used to consume ad hoc lists as well as data providers
 
Test that Qbesearch box can be consumed to return results from the selected data providers / ad hoc lists.
 
 
BASE RUNTIME TEST
Run the test workflow in the attached package and check that the search box behaves as expected at runtime.
 
NOTE:
SP2 & Later - With the new Design Studio V2 project, all the individual customization elements (like, action wizard, domain wizard, smartform wizard, workflow designer etc) are clubbed together into the same product (Design Studio V2) to simplify customization.
 
Hence the creating and editing of SmartForm's etc will be from Design Studio V2 itself (as supposed to be from Expert Share folder) earlier.

Title: QbeSearchBox - Create & Consume
Description:
Expenses branch has added the smart form implementation of the QbeListBox, which is called the QbeSearchBox. We consumed this within the expenses app for the ReceiptMeal smart form. Added a ReceiptInternalAttendee data provider for this purpose. And created a mock QbeSearchBox in the UX Catalog page for the QbeListBox. 
 
 
QBeSearch box can be used to consume ad hoc lists as well as data providers
 
Test that Qbesearch box can be consumed to return results from the selected data providers / ad hoc lists.
Steps: Step 1: Select a item and give it a name 'Client' and link to the 'QbeSearchBox' control type. | Expected: Item type has to be a collection e.g. ViewModelObservableCollection || Step 2: Associate the Client item with the 'Client' data-provider. || Step 3: Ensure the common values of the control are completed. Label, Validation Script, Required Field. || Step 4: Select some other control types and associate with other controls. || Step 5: Regenerate and publish the smartforms to local. || Step 6: Use a workflow to consume the form, ensure that the UI is correct and the user can complete tasks without error. | Expected: Remember to set the workflow variable with default value: New New ViewModelObservableCollection(Of Client) || Step 7: Ensure labels, prompts, tooltips (and other text propeties) are displayed in English as entered in the property. i.e., you do not see the internationalisation key.

Title: Parameters get deleted on deleting the respective condition
Description:
this is changed in 803 - data reference has to be deleted manually as you could want to use it still
-----
 
Ensure that the Data References are dynamic and gets deleted automatically while deleting the rule/condition that uses/creates the data reference.
Steps: Step 1: Create a simple rule with two or more conditions. Set return type message to a parameter to one of the conditions. (By condition I mean lines. Create two or more lines of condition for this test) | Expected: The parameter is set to the respective condition. || Step 2: Delete the condition (that returns a parameter). Save & Close the rule. || Step 3: Reopen the rule and check the Edit Parameters dialog box. | Expected: Ensure that the parameter is also deleted from the Data tab, and the parameters dialog.

Title: Action using parameter
Description:
This testcase ensures that the reference variable can be used to hold values. 
The variable is given a default value in the Design Studio while creation. (However the default value can be changed if required).
The same variable can be given a value using the admin app. 
 
When the rule or action using the variable runs it, it first looks for the value in the Admin app and if it couldn't find any - it uses the default value used while creation of the variable.
Steps: Step 1: Expert AssistantNew ActionActivity = Message Dialog || Step 2: Ribbon Bar | Parameters | AddName = WhateverType = StringDefault Value = Default1OkClose | Expected: Parameter appears in data pane || Step 3: PropertiesMessage = Parameter you just createdSave & Close the action | Expected: Action is saved || Step 4: Expert Admin | System | Customization Parameters | Expert Assistant | Menus | Actions MenuDouble click the action you created | Expected: The parameter and its default value are shown. || Step 5: Edit the parameter valueSave || Step 6: Run the action in EP | Expected: Edited message is displayed.

Steps: Step 1: Select an existing action and disable it by unticking the IsActive checkbox in Expert Assistant | Menus | Actions Menu. Save the action. | Expected: When you look for the Action in the application or EA -> Actions; it shouldn't be shown.

Title: Reset To Defaults resets to the default condition
Description: Testing if the Reset to Default button removes all the conditions and leaves just  the default condition.

Title: Expired versions open in read-only mode
Description:
A version of an Action/Rule is referred to as Expired if the EffectiveUntil date is over or is in the past.
When one such version of Action/Rule is tried to open - it should not be available for edit (should open in read-only mode).
Steps: Step 1: Navigate to a rule/action that has multiple versions.Open the old version of the rule/action. | Expected: The old version open in read-only mode and changes cannot be made.

Title: (Smoke Test) Customization End-to-End 04 - Create rules, actions, and schedules
Description:
As a customizer I want to be able to customize actions, rules and smartforms to all users within a firm, to specific users and from an effective date. I need to be able to do this to allow these customizations to be targeted at specific audiences. The effective date is required to allow the system to switch over to new functionality (which might be legislative) on a particular date.
 
As customizatio items, rules, actions, and schedules should be able to be packaged and imported into production environments, then run from there.
Steps: Step 1: Navigate to an action in EA - for eg (Open New File) and set the Effective Until date to yesterday.

Title: **Create a new version of an Action
Description:
Create a new version of an Action and leave the EffectiveUntil date empty. Shouldn't be a problem.
 
Check if this version expires when a  new one is created? or What happens when a new version is created (when there is an earlier version with just no EffectiveUntil date)?

Title: Design Studio - Create an Action with the EffectiveStart date in future
Description: Create an Action Version with its EffectiveStart date in future and ensure if it is picked up when the date is reached?

Title: Default EffectiveFrom date for an action version
Description: When a rule/action is created - its default date corresponds to today's date.
Steps: Step 1: Create a new Action under EA Actions. | Expected: Ensure that the default EffectiveFrom date corresponds to the present/today's date.

Title: Create a Rule and use at a different EP
Description:
Create a simple Rule that can be reused in different applications/at different EP.
 
-> for example, Create a rule that would send a Test Email when an application/action is started.
-> reuse this rule at other EP's (provided the EP's have same contract).
-> ensure that the rule works as expected.
Steps: Step 1: Navigate to Expert Expenses - Rules - Report Rules and check for the contracts at the EP. | Expected: Invoice is the only contract available at that EP || Step 2: Create a simple Rule under Report Rules - that would send an Email to the initiator of the Application/Action. Save the rule. | Expected: The rule is saved. || Step 3: Navigate to EA - Create a Rule EP and share the contract as same as Report Rule EP. | Expected: The new Rule EP is created with Invoice as the contract under EA. || Step 4: Right click on the Rule EP in EA and choose Shared Menu Item. | Expected: A Window displays the list of available rules (from different EP's - that share the same contract as that of Rule EP in EA) || Step 5: Add the rule to the Rule EP (in EA) and see that it works as expected. | Expected: The rule works as expected.

Title: Properties on the Assign outcome
Description:
The following properties should be present for the Email outcome:
When -> 
Condition
Assign ->
Value
To
General -> 
Comment
 
The customizer of the Expert product would like a way to Assign the value to something in a Action. The Assign To value should be the result of the evaluation of a rule or several rules.

Title: Testing the Assign outcome
Description: Ensuring that the assign activity actually assigns the value to a new value.
Steps: Step 1: Add a contract of type Employee to EA - Actions Menu EP. | Expected: The contract is added. || Step 2: Create an action in EA with Assign Activity.Set the Value of Employee.DisplayName to "your name".Add another line with Message Dialog activity and set the message to Employee.DisplayNameSave the action. | Expected: The action is saved || Step 3: Run the action from EA. | Expected: A Message Dialog with your name is displayed.

Title: Fetch Data using Aggregate functions
Aggregate functions are available only for selective objects
Steps: Step 1: Expenses | Validation Rules | Receipt RulesCreate a Rule | Expected: Ribbon Bar | Data VariablesMake sure contract of Disbursements is given || Step 2: CONDITIONAL = YesSelect disbursements in first drop down | Expected: Aggregate functions become available:Any, All, None, Count, Sum, Average, Min, Max || Step 3: Change disbursements to Employee | Expected: No aggregate functions are available any more

Title: UI differences to aggregate objects
Description: Aggregate functions can be applied on Selective view model objects and such objects end with the square brackets.
Steps: Step 1: Create a new Validation Rule or use an existing one for this test. || Step 2: Back on the rule designer - enter the conditions with AND operation as follows:1. ReceiptDetail.ExpenseTypeID = "Meal"2. Disbursements Any Disbursement.MatterId = 13. Disbursements Any Disbursement.PhaseTaskId = 16 | Expected: Aggregate/Collection objects look different from non-aggregate objects (table like symbol as a prefix).Once an aggregate/collection object is selected, it gives the list of aggregate options like Any, Count, Sum, Average, Min, Max, All.

Title: Action & Action Outcomes
Description:
Actions can be added so that they can be executed always or on a specific condition.
 
Following are the types of Action outcomes available:
1. Assign
2. Email
3. Form
4. Message Dialog
5. Notification
6. Open Url, Program or File
7. Query
8. Report
9. Run/Schedule Action
10. Script
11. Workflow
12. Workflow Task Action
Steps: Step 1: Create a new action (or edit an existing one) under EA Actions and set the Activity to Email from the list. || Step 2: Add another line to the action and check the condition. Set the outcome type to Message Dialog and enter a condition. Example condition - not Security.User.DisplayName starts with "{1st letter of your last name}" | Expected: The action is saved with 2 rules (one that executes Always and other one on a specific condition). || Step 3: Run the action as yourself and as TTQA1. | Expected: Make sure that they work as expected.

Title: Set same value on multiple controls in SmartForm
Description:
As a customization user I want to be able to make more forms look and behave consistently without having to adjust every form attribute individually.
 
To facilitate this
- Allow multi-select controls and adjust common setting collectively.

Title: Default the SF with Search control and its respective DP for an existing View Model object.
Description:
If a user adds a View Model e.g. Employee to a SF, they get a TextBox as the default control.
They then have to change it to a Search Box, set the DP to Employee and change the SelectedItemId to SelectedItem.
 
Each View Model (where applicable) should have an attribute declared on it which will specify the default DP for that View Model. This should extend to include lookups generated from Domain Wizard.
 
SFW should then be updated to check this attribute when an item is added and set the default control.

Title: Verify  if the ViewModelObservableCollection properties are removed
Description: ViewModelObservableCollection properties are exposed in SmartForm Wizard (Parameters window and Expression editor). It needs to be removed as we do not support binding of collections.

Title: Product & its dependency
**2 Versions of same Action with the same EffectiveFrom date
Description: A customizer shouldn't be allowed to create 2 versions of the same action item 'X' with the same EffectiveFrom date.There should be some sort of mechanism that validates if a new version of the action item - 'X' uses the same EffectiveFrom date or different dates. If it uses the same EffectiveFrom date - then the existing version should be edited and only one version item on the particular date should be displayed on the Version tab.
Steps: Step 1: Create a new Action (on EA) with the outcome type - Email & Effective date to be yesterday. | Expected: The Action is created. || Step 2: Create a new version of the same Action with the outcome type - Form & set same EffectiveFrom date. | Expected: The action version shouldn't be allowed to create. There cannot be 2 versions of the same action with the same EffectiveFrom date.

Title: Action is displayed only once even if there are 'N' number of versions for the same
Description: If a customizer creates multiple versions of the same action item 'X' - not all of them should be shown at the end-point. Only the live version with the valid EffectiveFrom date should be shown.
Steps: Step 1: At EA node - Create a new Action with outcome type - Email  Save the Action. | Expected: The Action is created. || Step 2: Edit the above action and make sure another version of it is created. | Expected: The new version of the Action is created as well. || Step 3: Open EA and check for the same Action. | Expected: Only one version of the Action should be shown and should behave with the new changes.

Title: Search for an Item using the search control in the navigation pane
Description:
Search for a text that is present in the extension point/rule or an action and ensure that the appropriate items are retrieved.
The searched text is retrieved in yellowish-ornage color.
 
Once the text from the search box is cleared - all the extension points/rule/action etc are returned to how it was before searching (expanded items should be expanded - collapsed items should be collapsed).

Title: Default the SF with Search control and its respective DP for a custom View Model object.
Description:
If a user adds a View Model e.g. Employee to a SF, they get a TextBox as the default control.
They then have to change it to a Search Box, set the DP to Employee and change the SelectedItemId to SelectedItem.
 
Each View Model (where applicable) should have an attribute declared on it which will specify the default DP for that View Model. This should extend to include lookups generated from Domain Wizard.
 
SFW should then be updated to check this attribute when an item is added and set the default control.

Title: Expired Version of an action is not shown at the end-point
Description: Actions whose EffectiveUntil date is in the past shouldn't be shown in the end-point after the particular date is met.
Steps: Step 1: Ensure that there is atleast 1 action that is expired (i.e.) its EffectiveUntil date is in the past. || Step 2: Search for that action in the end-point (for example, if the action is to be displayed in EA, look in EA for that action) | Expected: The action shouldn't be present as it is already expired.

Title: Workflow Admin: SSRS report data check
Workflow Admin: Filter works as expected
Test Smartform solutions in ExpertShare
Steps: Step 1: unziip smart projects in C:\ExpertShare\SmartFormProjects | Expected: file will unzip || Step 2: run SmartForms.ExpertTime.Custom.sln || Step 3: double click on smart form | Expected: smartform should open without error

Title: Testing the Aggregate functionality
Description:
Test all the available 8 aggregate functions:
Any
All
None
Count
Sum
Average
Min

Aggregate ClientGroup in Client.BusinessEntity.Addressess into All(Employee.Office.Address1=Client.Office.Address1)=True
