(Try Expenses product and its EP - Receipt Rules for example) || Step 2: Create a sample rule under Receipt Rules that fulfills the usecase - Only png images are accepted.Enter the Message to be - "Only .png images are accepted"For the condition - Receipt.ReceiptImages - Any - ReceiptImage.Name Does Not Contain "png" | Expected: Save the rule. || Step 3: Open Expert Expenses and open an existing report - attach a jpg image for a receipt. Try saving the receipt to the report. | Expected: Policy Violation with the message is shown.

Title: UI differences to the Collection data objects
Description: Making sure that the collection/aggregate objects are distinguishable from non aggregate objects visually.
Steps: Step 1: Create a rule or an action using an aggregate condition on a collection.Example condition - Meal receipts for Arden Industries - General Matter during the Despositions phase is not allowed" || Step 2: From the ribbon bar option - click Edit Data Variables and add a new variable - Disbursements and type 'ViewModelObservableCollection<Disbursement>' | Expected: Ensure that the Disbursement view-model collection object is added by checking from the Data tab. || Step 3: Back on the rule designer - enter the conditions with AND operation as follows:1. ReceiptDetail.ExpenseTypeId = "Meal"2. Disbursements Any Disbursement.MatterId = 13. Disbursements Any Disbursement.PhaseTaskId = 16 | Expected: Aggregate/Collection objects look different from non-aggregate objects (Table like symbol as a prefix). Once an aggregate/collection object is selected, it gives the list of aggregate options like Any, Count, Sum, Average, Min, Max, All.While entering rule 2 and 3 - after choosing any - disbursement is green in color and displays its objects as a tree structure.

Title: View & Hide Properties Panel
Description: Depending on the user preferences - an user could either choose to display or hide the Properties Panel
Steps: Step 1: In the ribbon bar option Show - click on properties.8.0.3: Show/ Hide Panels Button | Expected: If the properties button is highlighted in yellow color and the properties panel itself is visible, clicking on properties button would hide it.If the properties button isn't highlighted and the panel by itself isn't shown on the screen, clicking on the properties button from the ribbon bar would display it.Note - properties panel also includes Data and Version tab

Title: View & Hide Navigation Panel

If the navigation button isn't highlighted and the pane by itself isn't shown on the screen, clicking on the navigation button from the ribbon bar would display it.

Title: EA - Users are able to search tasks based on a variety of criteria
Steps: Step 1: Launch Expert Assistant. || Step 2: Ensure you have a variety of running workflows of different types and featuring different clients/employees || Step 3: Look at the my tasks list and serach for a variety of results using clients, employees and task names | Expected: searching on task name/employee or client will return the expected results || Step 4: Look at the Important list and serach for a variety of results using clients, employees and task names | Expected: searching on task name/employee or client will return the expected results || Step 5: Look at the manage by task list and serach for a variety of results using clients, employees and task names | Expected: searching on task name/employee or client will return the expected results || Step 6: Look at the manage by user list and serach for a variety of results using clients, employees and task names | Expected: searching on task name/employee or client will return the expected results

Title: Design Studio - Schedules only available for Jobs
Description:
Edit: you can't create EP - this functionality was taken out
 
Two key use-cases for Scheduling:
1. An action that requests further independent or deferred activity (e.g. run report X) - Performed by having an Action with an Activity to "Schedule" a "Job" EP
2. A job that needs to be executed once or regularly (e.g. overdue payments emails) - Performed by running the Scheduling Admin to "Schedule" a "Job" EP
 
Once your EP (of type Job is created), execute the following query and ensure that the type =1
 
select * from fwm_extension_point.
Steps: Step 1: Choose a Menu Item / Action under EA | Expected: There is no Schedule Option available in the Ribbon or right click menu || Step 2: Choose a Rule under Expenses | Expected: There is no Schedule Option available in the Ribbon or right click menu || Step 3: Choose a Job under Expenses or Collections | Expected: Schedule option is available in Ribbon and in right click MenuPost 8021: You can access the Schedule Manager from the Ribbon and schedules are shown in a pane not on the job in a tab

Title: Ensure that 'Schedule' option is not available for EP of type - Menu
Description:
Schedule option should be available only for the EP type of Jobs.
 
merged with the prev test and hence closing.

Title: Create a new Job and Schedules (without parameter)
Description:
Two key use cases for scheduling
1. An action that requests further independent or deferred activity (eg run report x) - Performed by having an Action with an Activity to “Schedule” a “Job” Extension Point.
2. A job that needs to be executed once or regularly (eg overdue payments emails) - Performed by running the Scheduling Admin to “Schedule” a “Job” Extension Point.
 
Schedules can be created and managed from both - DS and Scheduling Manager
Steps: Step 1: EA | Right click - New JobName = No Parameter TestDecription = [any] | Expected: New Job opens in Tab, right information displayed in Job header || Step 2: Add Activity = LogMessage = Security.User.DisplayNameLog Level = LogLevel.Fatal | Expected: Job saves fine; Test run shows fatal log with your employee code || Step 3: Add Schedule from within DS and Schedule Manager for @Occurence | Expected: Schedules are created, execute as expected

Title: Create a new Job and Schedules (with parameter)
Description:
Two key use cases for scheduling
1. An action that requests further independent or deferred activity (eg run report x) - Performed by having an Action with an Activity to “Schedule” a “Job” Extension Point.
2. A job that needs to be executed once or regularly (eg overdue payments emails) - Performed by running the Scheduling Admin to “Schedule” a “Job” Extension Point.
 
Schedules can be created and managed from both - DS and Scheduling Manager.
 
This test ensures that the schedules can be created using a parameter and the parameter is available to edit from DS and well as Schedule Manager.
Steps: Step 1: EA | Right click - New JobName = Parameter TestDecription = [any]Data Source: Type = EmployeeSource = SQL (select * from HBM_PERSNL where LOGIN like {@Name})Parameter:Name = NameType = StringDefault Value = "%[your first name]%" | Expected: New Job opens in Tab, right information displayed in Job header || Step 2: Add Activity = LogMessage = Employee.CodeLog Level = LogLevel.Fatal | Expected: Job saves fine; Test run shows fatal log with your employee code || Step 3: Add Schedule from within DS and Schedule Manager for @Occurence | Expected: Schedules are created, execute as expected, Parameter can be set

Title: Editing Schedules
Description:
Two key use cases for scheduling
1. An action that requests further independent or deferred activity (eg run report x) - Performed by having an Action with an Activity to “Schedule” a “Job” Extension Point.
2. A job that needs to be executed once or regularly (eg overdue payments emails) - Performed by running the Scheduling Admin to “Schedule” a “Job” Extension Point.
 
Schedules can be created and managed from both - DS and Scheduling Manager, but can be edited only using Scheduling Manager.
Steps: Step 1: Open Schedule Manager || Step 2: Add Schedule - Any existing JobOccurrence = Daily(rest can be filled out random) | Expected: Schedule created || Step 3: Navigation Pane - Serach Job you added schedule | Expected: Job opens in new tab || Step 4: Ribbon | Scheduling - Click Schedules | Expected: Schedules pane opens showing added schedule || Step 5: Double click schedule / Edit button | Expected: Schedule pop up || Step 6: Change schedule detailsGo back to Schedule Manager - Refresh - open added schedule | Expected: Changes are displayed || Step 7: Change schedule via Schedule ManagerGo back do DS - Refresh - open schedule | Expected: Changes are displayed

Title: Create a new Schedule using Scheduling Manager
Description:
Two key use cases for scheduling
1. An action that requests further independent or deferred activity (eg run report x) - Performed by having an Action with an Activity to “Schedule” a “Job” Extension Point.
2. A job that needs to be executed once or regularly (eg overdue payments emails) - Performed by running the Scheduling Admin to “Schedule” a “Job” Extension Point.
 
Schedules can be created and managed from both - DS and Scheduling Manager, but Schedules can be edited only using Scheduling Manager.

Title: Create a new parameter - for a Rule
Description: This test is to ensure that the rules can also use config entries to process them.

Title: Edit an existing parameter - for a Rule
Description: Editing the parameter and making sure that the rule then takes the new changes into consideration.

Title: Design Studio - Rule Parameter - Admin App value gets picked up before default value
Description:
The default value for a parameter can be set in the Admin app and Edit Parameters window (in DS).
 
When set at both the places, the application will look at the Admin app first for the parameter value and if that fails, it would take the default value from DS.
 
This test is to make sure that it works as expected.
Steps: Step 1: Create a new Value Rule or use an existing one for this test. || Step 2: Add a rule underneath it. | Expected: When the Rule opens in the design surface - it is Conditional by default. However, you can uncheck the Conditional checkbox and make it Non-Conditional/Always. || Step 3: Create a parameter ('Test Parameter' of type string) using the Edit Parameters ribbon bar button. Set its default value to "Hello" | Expected: The parameter is created and is added to the Data tab. || Step 4: Set the activity type to Return for the rule and set the value to the parameter created in step 4. In the value textbox - keep typing 'Test..' and the parameter would pitch up in the dropdown. Select from the dropdown and save the rule. | Expected: The rule is saved to return the parameter. || Step 5: Run the rule and see. | Expected: The rule is valid and returns Hello. || Step 6: Goto Admin app and navigate to Rule Parameters and the rule used for this test. Edit the value of the parameter to something else.. (for example - Hello Admin). Save the setting. | Expected: Rule parameters are listed in two places > Product xxx > Rule Parameters, and > Rule Parameters > Product xxxThe list shows the rules for the product (extension point, name, description, and state), and paramters can be edited in a window opened using the Edit button or by double-clicking || Step 7: Rerun the rule | Expected: The new value is picked up.

Title: Remove a parameter
Description: REmove an existing parameter from the Edit parameters window and make sure that the rule/action using it shows error - until fixed.

Title: Navigating the Expression Textbox control with the keyboard
Description:
This test ensures that the Expression Text box control works as expected when navigated through the keyboard.
For example - Tabbing and Shift Tabbing works as expected.
Steps: Step 1: Open an existing action or create a new action. Add a new line to the action and set it to conditional. | Expected: The When statement with the expression textbox comes up || Step 2: Navigate the Textbox using keyboard. For example, use down arrow to drop the textbox and to navigate various data-items, enter to choose the item, right arrow to expand a view model etc. | Expected: All of them work as expected. || Step 3: Tab and Shift+Tab between fields | Expected: Works as expected.

Title: Creating a new parameter (in the expanded form)
Description:
Parameters can be created on the fly by just typing the right syntax in the textbox control and also from the edit parameters window - from the ribbon bar button option.
 
The syntax to create a parameter on the fly is 
@("parameter_name","description for the parameter","default value for the parameter")

Title: Actions can be directly added to the product
Description: Testing the creation of an action under a product from Home tab

Title: Setting a Rule version to Inactive is setting the Rule to Inactive
Description: The IsActive property on the rules design surface doesn't just make the particular version Inactive and rollback to its previous version. It should actually make the rule itself Inactive.

Title: Tabbing works as expected in Expression Textbox control for Aggregate functions
Description: This test makes sure that the tabbing/shift tabbing works as expected with the Expression Textbox when aggregate function is used.
Steps: Step 1: Create a new rule/action and set the conditional checked. || Step 2: Add a condition so that the aggregate functions are used. Use keyboard to navigate between the textboxes, arrows to choose within the aggregate functions. For example - Aggregate ClientRateFee Any ClientRateFee.EffectiveDate > Today. | Expected: Ensure that the tabbing, shift+tab works as expected in the expression text box control. || Step 3: Add another line and try another condition with where clause:Add a collection object from ribbon bar - Add Data Variable button - ReceiptDetails of type ViewModelObservableCollection<ReceiptDetail>Enter the condition as follows:ReceiptDetails - Sum - ReceiptDetail.ReceiptDetailsAmount - Where - Receipt.Employee.TimeAndBilling.RankDescription = "PARTNER" | Expected: Ensure that the tabbing, shift+tab works as expected in the expression text box control.

Title: Create a New Menu item from the Home tab
Description:
New Menu item can be created from 2 places:
- Home page
- Navigation pane.
 
This test ensures that the menu item is created successfully from the Home page.

Title: Home tab displays available products
Description:
- Home tab displays all the products in the form of tiles. 
- Hovering over tiles shows the available number of EP's Menus/Jobs/forms/Rules
- Clicking on one of the EP's - displays the EP and its associated menu items (bottom of the screen)
Steps: Step 1: The home tab in DS2 displays the available products. || Step 2: Pre 803: Hover over any product (EA for example).While hovering, click on Menus. | Expected: The count of available Menus, Rules, Jobs and Events are shown.EA - Menus are displayed at the bottom of the home tab. || Step 3: Pre 803:  Click on each menu | Expected: Its available actions are shown on the bottom right side of the home tab.

Title: Create a new parameter - for an Action
Description: Ensuring that the parameters can be used for an action

Email.Open the action. || Step 2: Click on the Edit Parameter button from the ribbon and edit the appropriate parameter and save it. | Expected: The parameter is saved to the new value. || Step 3: Run the action. | Expected: The action should take into account the value of the new parameter.

Title: Use Expert Admin to edit parameter - for an Action

Set the activity type to Email. || Step 2: Create a new parameter (EmailTo) from the Edit Parameters tab of type string and set the default value to your email address. | Expected: The parameter is saved to the action. || Step 3: Back to the email activity action - set the To address to the parameter created above. Enter a subject and a body for the email. Save the action. | Expected: The action is saved. || Step 4: Run the action from EA. | Expected: You receive an email. || Step 5: Open Expert Admin and navigate to Rule Parameters and the action that you have used in this test. | Expected: Rule parameters are listed in two places > Product xxx > Rule Parameters, and > Rule Parameters > Product xxxThe list shows the rules for the product (extension point, name, description, and state), and paramters can be edited in a window opened using the Edit button or by double-clicking || Step 6: Edit the parameter value to something else and save. | Expected: The new value is saved. || Step 7: Rerun the action from EA. | Expected: The new value is taken into consideration.

Title: Action with a Data Variable
Steps: Step 1: Create a new action and set it to Message Dialog activity, give a message and check the conditional checkbox || Step 2: Create a new variable from the ribbon button option - Add Data Variable. Title: Editing a Shared Rule
Description:
Should it be possible to edit the rule that is added via 'Choose Shared Menu Item'..
 
In that case - does it also change the original rule from where it came from? Check with Andrew
Steps: Step 1: Navigate to Expert Expenses - Rules - Report Rules and check for the contracts at the EP. | Expected: Invoice is the only contract available at that EP. || Step 2: Cretae a simple Rule under Report Rules - that would send an email to the initiator of the Application/Action. Save the Rule | Expected: The rule is saved. || Step 3: Navigate to EA - Create a Rule EP and share the contract as same as Report Rule EP. | Expected: The new Rule EP is created with the INvoice as the contract under EA. || Step 4: Right click on the Rules EP in EA and choose Shared Menu Item. | Expected: A window displays the list of available rules (from different EP's - that share the same contract as that of Rule EP in EA) || Step 5: Add the rule to the Rule EP (in EA) and see that it works as expected. | Expected: The rule works as expected. || Step 6: Edit the shared rule and save the changes. Execute the rule. | Expected: Make sure that the changes are reflected.(Check with Andrew if the original rule should also be changed or not? when you make changes to the shared rule)

Title: New Version of a Share Rule
Description: Check with Andrew if it is possible to create a new version of the rule that is added via 'Choose Shared Menu Item'?
Steps: Step 1: Navigate to Expert Expenses - Rules - Report Rules and check for the contracts at the EP. | Expected: Invoice is the only contract available at that EP. || Step 2: Create a simple Rule under Report Rules - that would send an Email to the initiator of the Application/Action. Save the rule. | Expected: The rule is saved. || Step 3: Navigate to EA - Create a Rule EP and share the contract as same as Report Rule EP. | Expected: The new Rule EP is created with Invoice as the contract under EA. || Step 4: Right click on the Rule EP in EA and choose Shared Menu Item. | Expected: A window displays the list of available rules (from different EP's - that share the same contract as that of Rule EP in EA) || Step 5: Add the rule to the Rule EP (in EA) and see that it works as expected. | Expected: The rule works as expected. || Step 6: Create a new version for the rule by making some changes to the rule. Run the rule and see. | Expected: The rule works as expected.

Title: Testing the Email outcome (with CC)
WF tasks attempt to retry 3 times when appfabric data is missing.
Steps: Step 1: delete the records for one of your wf's from the [Database]_ExpertWorkflow database > System.Activities.DurableInstancing.InstancesTable (or all of them if you are not too bothered about running instances) | Expected: nb. do not run this test against an ITE as it will potentially impact other users || Step 2: Attempt to run one of the deleted workflows from EA task inbox. | Expected: Viewing the event logs you should see the task attempt 3 times, and fail. resulting in a friendly error message(after some time). Should not cause EA to lock, Should still be able to start new workflows. (SP2 - if you remove the workflow using SQL, the workflow should show as terminated in EA and any tasks should be removed. If removed using AppFabric, the user will see that if they try to open any tasks associated with that workflow, an error message will be displayed stating the task is unavaible)

Title: Aggregate functions on collection objects
Description: This test is to ensure that aggregate functions can be preformed on collection objects as well (just as it is done in aggregate objects)
Steps: Step 1: Create a new rule under Expert Expenses - Receipt Rules to check the following condition. "Meal receipts for Arden Industries - General Matter during the Depositions phase is not allowed"Set the Activity to Return - Severity Error and Message - "Meal receipts for Arden Industries - General Matter during the Depositions phase is not allowed" || Step 2: From the ribbon bar option - click Edit Data Variables and add a new variable - Disbursements and type 'ViewModelObservableCollection<Disbursement> | Expected: Ensure that the Disbursement view-model collection object is added by checking from the Data tab. || Step 3: Back on the rule designer - enter the conditions with AND operation as follows:1. ReceiptDetail.ExpenseTypeId = "Meal"2. Disbursements Any Disbursement.MatterId = 13. Disbursements Any Disbursement.PhaseTaskId = 16 | Expected: Save and close the rule. || Step 4: Open Expert Expenses and create a receipt to an existing report/new report so that the above condition is executed. Receipt type = MealClient Matter = Arden Industries - GeneralPhase task = Discovery - DespositionsSave the receipt | Expected: Upon saving the receipt, the rule should be executed and policy violation is shown.

Title: Properties on Open Url activity
Description: This test makes sure that the Open URL activity shows its respective properties.

Title: Default Value of an EP with Error severity level
Description:
Ability for an EP of type Rule to return a default value when the rules underneath the EP fail to return a value (or) there is no rule within the EP.
 
For the Return Type of ValidationExpressionResult - the default values could be 
1. valid
2. warning
3. error
 
warning and error needs to have an text next to it - for example 
- warning "this is an example"
- default value can hold expressions, so something like - if (1=1) then valid else error "should be equal" - should work
