Title: Default value of the Extension point gets picked up when evaluation of other Rules fail
Description: This test makes sure that when the rules under an EP fall over - the default value of the EP is taken into effect.
Steps: Step 1: Navigate to Expert Expenses and Report Rules. | Expected: Ensure that there is only one rule under Report Rules EP - which says Report amount cannot exceed $2000 in USD || Step 2: Open Expert Expenses and create a report. Make sure that the report amount doesn't exceed $2000. | Expected: The report is created || Step 3: Open the Report Rules EP in the design surface and set the Default Value - error "testing fall over of rules" . Save and close the EP. | Expected: The Default Value for the EP is saved. || Step 4: Open Expenses again and check for the report created in step 3. | Expected: Policy Violation with the message give above is shown.

Title: Ribbon bar options when a Rule/Action is opened
Description: This test is to make sure that the ribbon bar button options are all available when a rule/action is opened in the design surface.
Steps: Step 1: Open a Rule/Action from the navigation pane. | Expected: The item is opened in the design surface || Step 2: Check the Ribbon bar options for the following:Save & CloseCancel & CloseSaveAdd LineDelete LineEdit ParametersAdd Data Variable | Expected: The specified options are available.

Title: Dev mode - Ribbon bar options when an EP is open
Description: This test is to make sure that the ribbon bar button options are all available when an EP is opened in the design surface.
Steps: Step 1: Navigate to an EP and double click to open it on the design surface | Expected: The EP is open. || Step 2: Check for the ribbon bar options for an EP:Save & CloseCancel & CloseSaveDeleteEdit Contract. | Expected: The specified options are available.

Title: Create a New Menu item from the Navigation pane
Description:
New Menu item can be created from 2 places:
- Home page
- Navigation pane.
 
This test ensures that the menu item is created successfully from the Navigation pane.
Steps: Step 1: See that the navigation pane is available. If not, click the Navigation button from the ribbon bar to display it. | Expected: Navigation pane is visible. || Step 2: Navigate to an EP via the Navigation pane. (For e.g. -> Expert Expenses -> Rules -> Report Rules)Right click on the EP and create a new Rule beneath it. | Expected: The dialog opens to create a New Action Menu item with the following fields1. Name - defaults to New Menu, however the title can be changed.2. Description - textbox field to enter the description of the action menu.3. Effective From - defaults to the creation dateCreate and Cancel button options are available. || Step 3: Choose Create | Expected: The new Rule is created. || Step 4: Check the header for the details entered in step 3. | Expected: All the details correspond to what was entered.

Title: Adding an action from an EP to another EP that has the same contract
Description:
In Design Studio, the Rules/Action repository allows to choose Rules/Actions (that belong to a different EP) and add to an EP - provided they use the same contract.
 
This test makes sure that it is possible to add an Action from an EP to another EP that shares the same contract.
Steps: Step 1: Create an action with any simple activity under OTG Workflow - Menus - Actions Menu.(Ensure that the contracts for Actions Menu is NotificationId, IsFormAccepted).803: Expert Assistant | Menus | On The Go Actions Menu | Expected: The action is created. || Step 2: Navigate to EA - Menus - Actions Menu.Right-click and choose Shared Menu Item. | Expected: The actions from EP's that share the same contract are shown. || Step 3: Choose the action that was created in Step 2, and add it to EA. | Expected: The action is added to EA. || Step 4: Run the action from EA. | Expected: Ensure that it behaves as expected.

Title: Repair inconsistent workflow processes
Steps: Step 1: Inconsistent processes are defined as:1. Workflows that ARE "Active","Faulted",or "Suspended" according to Expert DB - that DO NOT have a corresponding instance in the Microsoft repository. 1a. If such a workflow has tasks inside Aderant, then they should be Terminated, and the tasks and associated data removed 1b. If such a workflow has no tasks, then it can be set to 100% and Completed2. Workflows that ARE NOT "Active","Faulted",or "Suspended" according to Expert - that also have Tasks  2a. These should be Terminated, and the tasks and associated data removed || Step 2: To setup test data that meets the above requirements, you need to start some workflows and delete the instance records in the WF database, delete task records from WFM_TASK table and manually change Summary records in WFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARY. Use the following query:DELETE FROM [WorkflowDatabase].[System.Activities.DurableInstancing].[InstancesTable]where creationtime>'2014-01-01 23:59:59.000'DELETE fromWFM_TASKupdateWFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARYsetSTATE='Completed'whereID='87FB7C9D-D6F1-4DAF-8795-A2BB00A474C9' | Expected: You should have the following setup1. Workflows that are NOT 'Completed' AND does NOT have a instance record in the Microsoft workflow database AND does NOT have task records in WFM_TASK2. Workflows that are NOT 'Completed' AND does NOT have a instance record in the Microsoft workflow database AND HAVE task records in WFM_TASK3. Workflows that are 'Completed' AND HAVE task records in WFM_TASK || Step 3: Open Worklfow Admin application || Step 4: Change process filter to 'Inconsistent Processes' | Expected: The workflows setup in previous step should show up with appropriate messages || Step 5: Right click on ONE of the records and REPAIR itRight click on MULTIPLE records and REPAIR them | Expected: Only the selected ones are repaired - Check Summary records and Task records.Refer to STEP 1 for expectations of the repair

Title: Enable Query service monitoring
Steps: Step 1: Follow this guide to setup monitoring in IIS: http://sharepoint.aderantonline.com/Expert%20Blog/Lists/Posts/Post.aspx?ID=687 || Step 2: Ensure that after monitoring is enabled, all query service requets are logged in IIS AppFabric Dashboard

Title: Action/Rule header title is hyperlinked
Description: The Action/Rule title header is hyperlinked. The Customizer could click on it to open the dialog and edit the basic header details there.
Steps: Step 1: Navigate to an existing action or rule and double click on it to open in the design surface. | Expected: The item is opened on the design surface. || Step 2: Check the header of the rule/action. | Expected: The title is hyperlinked. || Step 3: Click on the hyperlink. | Expected: A dialog opens which displays the Name/Description/EffectiveFrom date/IconNote - Icon is only for actions.

Title: UI differences to the Aggregate data objects
Description: Making sure that the collection/aggregate objects are distinguishable from non aggregate objects visually.
Steps: Step 1: Create a new EP or use an existing EP to execute this test. (Try Expenses product and its EP - Receipt Rules for example) || Step 2: Create a sample rule under Receipt Rules that fulfills the usecase - 1. Only png images are accepted.Enter the Message to be - "Only .png images are accepted" || Step 3: For the condition - Receipt.ReceiptImages - Any - ReceiptImage.Name -> Does Not Contain -> "png"Save the rule. The rule is saved. | Expected: Aggregate objects look differrent from non-aggregate objects (Table like symbol as a prefix).Once an aggregate object is selected, it gives the list of aggregate options like Any, Count, Sum, Average, Mix, Max, All.After choosing any - ReceiptImage is green in color and displays its objects/properties as a tree structure.

Title: Aggregate function on Collection objects with Where clause
Description: This test is to ensure that aggregate functions can be preformed on collection objects as well (just as it is done in aggregate objects)
Steps: Step 1: Create a new rule under Expert Expenses - Receipt Rules to check the following condition."Sum of Receipt Detail Amounts for a partner shouldn't exceed $2000"Set the Activity to Return - Severity Error and Message - "Sum of Receipt Detail Amounts for a partner shouldn't exceed $2000" || Step 2: From the ribbon bar option - click Edit Data Variables and add a new variable - ReceiptDetails and type 'ViewModelObservableCollection<ReceiptDetail>' | Expected: Ensure that the Receipt Detail view-model collection object is added by checking from the Data tab. || Step 3: Back ont he rule designer- enter the conditionReceiptDetails - Sum - ReceiptDetail.ReceiptDetailAmount - Where @condition | Expected: Save and Close the rule. || Step 4: Open Expert Expenses and create receipts to check each conditions. | Expected: Upon saving the receipt, the rule should be executed and policy violation is shown.

Title: Testing Assign activity with a variable
Description: Making sure that the assign activity is able to take values from parameters.
Steps: Step 1: Add a contract of type Employee to EA - Actions Menu EP. | Expected: The contract is added. || Step 2: Create an action In EA with Assign Activity.Create a variable @var1 via Edit Parameters window of type string and give a default value of "name" | Expected: The variable is created and is added to the data tab. || Step 3: In the assign activity - set the To - Employee.DisplayNameValue - @var1.Add another line and set the activity to Message Dialog. Set the message to Employee.DisplayName.Save the action. | Expected: Can set the To and Value properties in both the Designer and the Properties pane - update either one and it'll update in both places.The action is saved. || Step 4: Run the action via EA. | Expected: A message dialog with the "name" message on it is displayed.

Title: Rules can be directly added to a Product
Description: Testing the creation of a rule under a product from Home tab
Steps: Step 1: From the Home tab - choose Expert Expenses. || Step 2: Create a sample rule under Receipt Rules that fulfills the usecase - Only png images are accepted.Enter the Message to be - "Only .png images are accepted" || Step 3: For the condition - Receipt.ReceiptImages - Any - ReceiptImage.Name -> Does Not Contain -> "png"Save the rule. | Expected: The rule is saved. || Step 4: Open Expenses and open an existing report and create a receipt with a image of non-png extension. | Expected: The rule is triggered and shows the message as expected.

Title: EffectiveUntil date can't be earlier than EffectiveStart date
Description: Ensuring that the customiser doesn't set the Effective Until date earlier to Effective From date.
Steps: Step 1: Navigate to an action and click on the header. | Expected: The rule/action header properties are displayed. || Step 2: Set the EffectiveUntil date to yesterday. | Expected: You get an alert bar/warning bar that says - the Effective Until date can't be earlier than Effective From date.Save & Close and Save button are disabled.

Title: Edit an Action with the EffectiveStart date in future
Description: This test ensures the editing of an future dated action.
Steps: Step 1: Create an action with a simple activity in EA with Effective From date in future. Save & Close the action.Also close DS. | Expected: The action is saved. || Step 2: Reopen DS and navigate to the action is step 2 and try editing it. | Expected: The edits should be saved and should work as expected (whenever the Effective From date is reached)

Title: Schedules can be created via Design Studio
Description:
As a customizer, it would be nice to have the ability to see and maintain Schedules (or Job Instances) that have been created from Job Definitions within Design Studio.
 
This will eliminate the need to switch back and forth between apps (DS and Schedule Manager)
Steps: Step 1: Navigate to an EP of type Job and Create a new schedule.Enter the basic details and make it RunOnce schedule to run immediately. Save the schedule. | Expected: The Schedule is added to the Job EP which can be seen when the EP is opened in the design surface.(Note - For EP's of type Job - when opened in design surface, its associated Schedules can be seen along with its Rules/Actions)

Title: Schedules can be edited using DS
Description:
As a customizer, it would be nice to have the ability to see and maintain Schedules (or Job Instances) that have been created from Job Definitions within Design Studio.
 
This will eliminate the need to switch back and forth between apps (DS and Schedule Manager)
Steps: Step 1: Ensure that you have schedules created already for this test. || Step 2: Navigate to an EP of type Job and open it on the design surface to see the schedules under the Job. | Expected: All the schedules of the Job are displayed beneath Rules/Actions under the heading Schedules. || Step 3: Double click on one of the Schedules and make some changes (for e.g. change the time to perform) and save it. | Expected: Open Schedule Manager from your Expert Share folder and look for the same schedule and ensure that the changes are synchronised.If Schedule Manager is open already, refresh and open the respective schedule to get the changes in sync.

Title: Schedules (created via Schedule Manager) can be edited in DS
Description:
As a customizer, it would be nice to have the ability to see and maintain Schedules (or Job Instances) that have been created from Job Definitions within Design Studio.
 
This will eliminate the need to switch back and forth between apps (DS and Schedule Manager)
Steps: Step 1: Create a Schedule under a Job EP via Schedule Manager. || Step 2: Navigate to the EP (where the schedule was created using Schedule Manager is step 1) and open it in design surface. | Expected: All the associated schedules under the EP are shown (including the ones created from Schedule Manager). || Step 3: Edit the schedule from the Design Studio. | Expected: Check Schedule Manager and ensure that the changes have come through.

Title: Deleting Job and schedules
Description:
We need the functionality to delete a Job (or Scheduled) and a Job Definition particularly during design time in case we make mistakes or no longer need the Job / Job Definition.
 
This functionality will currently be limited to deleting only job type extension points.
 
Once an EP of type Job is created - a row is created in the table  - FWM_EXTENSION_POINT_SCHEDULE. On the contrary, when it is deleted - the specific row gets deleted from the table.
All the Schedules under the EP that is deleted gets vanished.
Steps: Step 1: Go to a Job with one or more schedules (Firm Job required) || Step 2: Run on your DB:select * from FWM_EXTENSION_POINTselect * from FWM_EXTENSION_POINT_SCHEDULE | Expected: Note down Extension point uno of the job and the schedule unos referring to it || Step 3: DS | Navigation Pane | Job - right click | Delete Job | Expected: Job disappears from the Navigation pane || Step 4: Run on your DB:select*from FWM_EXTENSION_POINTselect*from FWM_EXTENSION_POINT_SCHEDULE | Expected: Job and Schedules are deleted || Step 5: Open Schedule Manager | Expected: Job and Schedules are deleted

Title: Ensure all Schedules under the deleted Job EP is vanished
Description:
We need the functionality to delete a Job (or Scheduled) and a Job Definition particularly during design time in case we make mistakes or no longer need the Job / Job Definition.
 
This functionality will currently be limited to deleting only job type extension points.
 
Once an EP of type Job is created - a row is created in the table  - FWM_EXTENSION_POINT_SCHEDULE. On the contrary, when it is deleted - the specific row gets deleted from the table.
All the Schedules under the EP that is deleted gets vanished.
Steps: Step 1: Ensure that you have one or more schedules for atleast one EP of type Job. || Step 2: Navigate to the Job and delete it. | Expected: The Job gets deleted. || Step 3: Ensure that all the schedules under the job are vanished from Schedule Manager | Expected: They are no more.

Title: View only local workflows in administrative tools
DR - Access local and remote workflows using admin tools
Description:
Must be able to filter workflow views in the admin tools to
- View and administer only local processes
- View and administer workflow processes from all sites

Title: View workflow status while one site is unaccessible
Run workflows while database at one site is inaccessible
DR - View workflow statuses after database has been restored
DR - Continue workflows after database has been restored
DR - Administer workflows after database has been restored
Description:
After an environment has been restored following a "disaster", we need to be able to check workflow statuses and admister workflows.
Test needs to cover central and distributed environments. In a distributed environment we should check both local and foreign workflows.

Title: DR - Run workflows across different locations
Description:
For example, first task assigned to user at site A, second task assigned to user at site B. User B gets task as and when expected.
 
Notes:
- Workflow belongs to one region only
- Workflow tasks can be assigned to users in different regions
- Workflow process uses the services in the region it was initiated
- Workflow task details read from the local database

Title: DR - Action task assigned to multiple users at more than one site
Description:
If a task is assigned to more than one user, and they are not all based in the same office, they should 
- all receive the task at the same time
- be notified/updated if another user accepts/completes the task

Title: [Replication] Update same data from different regions workflows at the same time
Description:
User 1 in region A running workflow for matter that belongs to region A. User in region B running workflow for the same matter.
User 1 updates matter via workflow 
User 2 updates matter via workflow
 
Expected behaviour ??
- If data is region aware, then only users that are in the database for that region can update that data item?
- If data is not region aware, then... ?
- Last man wins?

Title: DR - Access data owned by another region via workflow
Description:
Some data items are region aware. E.g. Clients, Matters
 
Start a File Opening workflow in region A for a client that belongs to region B
--> Should the client data fetched be read only in region A?  Up to the workflow/SmartForm designer to control this
--> Should we be able to edit and update the client data from region A? Up to the workflow/SmartForm designer to control this

Title: [Replication] Insert data via workflow uses local set of unique keys
Run workflows while services at one site are not running
Upgrade Expert in a distributed environment with running workflows
Description:
Upgrade an existing distributed environment with a build/release that has 
- database structure changes e.g. new/modified tables or stored procedures
- pop scripts to seed data
Steps: Step 1: On a Client machine (say wsakl000591 running windows 7) launch a couple of workflows from a distributed environment. | Expected: The workflows fires up as normal and the tasks can be seen in the task inbox. || Step 2: Upgrade the environment to a newer version. | Expected: The upgrade is sucessful without any errors. || Step 3: After Upgrade , launch EA | Expected: The EA should launch as normal and should upgrade itself. || Step 4: Go to the Task inbox | Expected: Previously launched workflows are still there. || Step 5: Launch the workflow by double clicking the task | Expected: The workflow should fire up as normal.

Title: Schedule Manager - Review schedule runs
Description: User might want to be able to view schedule audit data from schedule manager.
Steps: Step 1: Add schedule - existing Job:Occurrence = DailyOccurs every = 5 minutesStart / End = Now until 30 min later | Expected: Schedule saved. Runs asexpected || Step 2: Right click schedule - run immediately | Expected: Schedule executed immediately || Step 3: Go to Run history | Expected: Scheduled runs and ad hoc runs shown as expected || Step 4: double click | previous run review entrychange - Log level | Expected: A log opens up with default log level of 'Debug'.Log level changes appropriately

Title: Run workflows while distributer is powered off
Description:
In a distributed environment, turn off the machine that runs the distributer. When the distributer is powered up again, any queued transactions should be resumed and the changes updated on the other databases. 
 
Test:
- Making a change(s) on a database BEFORE the distributer is shut down 
- Making a change(s) WHILE the distributer is down

Title: [Replication] IIS displays only local workflow details in a distributed environment
DR - Run new workflows on restored databases
[Replication] Insert data via workflow sets region
Description:
When data is created/set via workflow, the region needs to be set. Do we expect this to 
- default from the user that initiated the workflow?
- default from the region of the server that is running the workflow?
- be set in the UI/workflow definition script?
- default from the service?
- default from somewhere else?

Title: Fail insert or update of data itemin a distributed environment
Description:
If the insert of a data item fails in a local database, 
- the item should be rolled back, and 
- the change should not be replicated in the databases for other locations
 
If the edit of an item fails, similar behaviour is expected.

Title: [Replication] View status and administer workflows
Description:
When administering workflows in the Workflow Admin application, there should be two modes. One to only view local workflows, and one to view workflows across all sites.
When administering workflows in Expert Assistant, you should see workflows for both sites, but can filter to view only local workflows? If you have security to administer workflows, you can only administer those for your own site?
 
 
 
- Workflow Admin app
- Process menu in Expert Assistant
Steps: Step 1: Running workflows at both north and south sites || Step 2: Log into the north site || Step 3: View process list

Title: [Replication] View workflow admin reports
Description: The Workflow Admin reports should differentiate site spcific workflow performance data.
Steps: Step 1: Pre-req: Running workflows at both north and south sites || Step 2: From north site, launch Workflow Admin application || Step 3: From north site, open workflow admin report | Expected: Report either (a) shows only local (north) workflows , OR(b) show local AND foreign workflows, but differentiates between them || Step 4: From south site, launch Workflow Admin application || Step 5: From south site, open workflow admin report | Expected: Report either (a) shows only local (south) workflows , OR(b) show local AND foreign workflows, but differentiates between them

Title: Ensure that EP's can be duplicated
Description:
When an EP is duplicated, all the actions/rules under it gets included under it.
 
This is very helpful when developing and testing. Can take a copy of something that you know works and then change it without changing the original.
 
(Check with Andrew for job type EP's. Should the schedules also be duplicated?)
Steps: Step 1: Navigate to an EP and right-click and choose 'Duplicate' | Expected: The EP along with all the rules/actions gets duplicated. || Step 2: Test this for all type of @ExtensionPoints | Expected: Everything under the EP gets copied.

Title: All schedule types can be Run Immediately
Description:
Schedules can run at different intervals of time - one time/daily/weekly/monthly/yearly.
 
But all these schedules should be able to have Run Immediately option. And this option shouldn't affect their next run time.
For ex - have a schedule that performs tasks weekly on weekdays. And it has already ran today. If you Run Immedately now - that shouldn't skip tomorrow's task.
Steps: Step 1: Add Job Activity = EmailTo = "[your email address]"Subject = "Test Schedules"Body = [ExecutionEnvironment.Schedule.Name] | Expected: Save and Run - Test schedule email received || Step 2: Design Studio and Schedule Manager:Add schedules for all Occurrences (One Time / daily / weekly / monthly) | Expected: The schedules are created. || Step 3: Schedule Manager:Each schedule | right click - Run Immediately. | Expected: Schedules are run immediately and email's are received.Review Tab shows ad hoc run for each schedule

Title: Status of Schedules
Description:
Following are the four different status available for schedules
 
Pending - When a schedule is created and is yet to run, it is in Pending state.
Executing - This state lasts only for a few seconds, when the schedule is actually getting run.
Completed - When a schedule is run successfully, it goes to Completed state
Suspended - When an error occurs in running a schedule, it goes to Suspended state.
 
post 803 - Queued / Executing / Inactive/ Completed
Steps: Step 1: Open Schedule Manager || Step 2: Add Schedule (any Job): OneTime | Expected: The Schedule is createdStatus = Queued || Step 3: Refresh | Expected: Status = ExecutingStatus changes to Completed || Step 4: Add Schedule (any Job): Daily | Expected: Status = Pending / Queued || Step 5: Daily schedule | Right click - Edituntick active | Expected: Status = Inactive

Title: Status of Schedules - Queued
Description:
Following are the four different status available for schedules
 
Pending - When a schedule is created and is yet to run, it is in Pending state.
Executing - This state lasts only for a few seconds, when the schedule is actually getting run.
Completed - When a schedule is run successfully, it goes to Completed state
Suspended - When an error occurs in running a schedule, it goes to Suspended state.
Steps: Step 1: Open Schedule Manager from your Expert Share folder. || Step 2: Create a Daily Schedule (at the default time the dialog box shows) for one of the Job EP's | Expected: The Schedule is created and is in Queued state.The schedule also runs it and you receive the action || Step 3: Check the status of schedule. | Expected: Even after the schedule is executed once - it is still in pending state. Check FWM_EXTENSION_POINT_SCHEDULE table for that particular schedule - the next run time should be tomorrow.

Title: Action using UserInfo in a condition
Description:
Rules often need to be able to govern behaviour based upon properties of the current user, rather than just userid. 
 
Rules are often bound to things like the users office or department.
 
Expand UserInfo object to include common properties - users 
- department
- office
- Profit Centre
- Supervising Employee
- Multisite region (derived from office)
Steps: Step 1: Create an action in EA with a simple activity like Email to send out email to yourself.1. Add the condition using the UserInfo available. Something like - Security.User.Department = "ADM"(Make sure that your department is Admin or give your own department details) | Expected: The action is created. || Step 2: Refresh on EA actions and run the action created above. | Expected: The action is run and you receive an email. || Step 3: Now edit the above action and type something random for department.Example - Security.User.Department = "MAN"Save & Close the action. || Step 4: Refresh on EA actions and run the action edited above. | Expected: You shouldn't receive any email.

Title: Rule using UserInfo in a condition
Description:
Rules often need to be able to govern behaviour based upon properties of the current user, rather than just userid. 
 
Rules are often bound to things like the users office or department.
 
Expand UserInfo object to include common properties - users 
- department
- office
- Profit Centre
- Supervising Employee
- Multisite region (derived from office)
Steps: Step 1: Create a new action under EA actions with Message Dialog activity. Write a sample message to display in the dialog. Check the Conditional checkbox and set the following conditions.Security.User.Department = "yourdept" &Security.User.DisplayName contains "yourname".Save the action. | Expected: The action is saved. || Step 2: Run the action from EA. | Expected: Message Dialog is shown || Step 3: Back on DS, edit the second condition to someone else's name and run the action from EA. | Expected: Message dialog shouldn't be shown. || Step 4: Back on DS, change the gate from AND to OR. Save the action. Run from EA. | Expected: Message Dialog is shown.

Title: Insert a activity to precede the activity just defined.
Description: Very frustrating if you want to insert an activity to precede the activity you have just defined.
Steps: Step 1: Navigate to EA - Actions and Create a new action with an email activity. Fill in the details for email activity. || Step 2: Add another line and set it to a simple activity type like Message dialog. || Step 3: Drag the message dialog activity and put it before email activity. | Expected: The experience is smooth. || Step 4: Run the action from EA. | Expected: You receive a message dialog and email.

Title: Using ScheduleDate details
Description:
Note: This time is shown in UTC 
 
ScheduleDate is additional detail that the Design Studio allows the customizer to use to see when the action is received.
Steps: Step 1: Add Job Activity = EmailTo = "[your email address]"Subject = This email was sent out on " + ExecutionEnvironment.Schedule.JobDate.DateBody = [ExecutionEnvironment.Schedule.Name] | Expected: Save and Run - subject = This email was sent out on [today date] 12:00:00 a.m. || Step 2: Add conditionExecutionEnvironment.Schedule.JobDate.Date = Today. | Expected: Save and Run - same email as before || Step 3: change condition ExecutionEnvironment.Schedule.JobDate.Date = #2014/03/05# (Please enter next day's date here). | Expected: Save and Run - log shows "Activity condition failed, activity will not be run"

Title: Using ScheduleDate details in the schedule action condition
Description: ScheduleDate is additional detail that the Design Studio allows the customizer to use to see when the action is received.
Steps: Step 1: Create a n new action with email activity under any Job EP. Check the conditional checkbox and enter the following condition:ExecutionEnvironment.Schedule.CurrentJobDate = Today. || Step 2: Create a new schedule for this EP at the defaul time the dialog shows. | Expected: The email is received.

Title: Schedule jobs in case of system failure
Description:
We want to be able to play catch up for schedule jobs in the case of system failure. Currently the schedule system does not provide enough flexibility to seperate the concept of a schedule template and a schedule run instance.
 
This User-Story was to create a table called FWA_JOB - with LastRunTime, NextRunTime columns so that people would know when is their schedule going to run next and when did it last ran.
Steps: Step 1: Add Job Activity = EmailTo = "[your email address]"Subject = "Test Schedules"Body = [ExecutionEnvironment.Schedule.Name] | Expected: Save and Run - Test schedule email received || Step 2: Add schedule Occurrence = One time Time = 8pm tonight. || Step 3: Undeploy over night || Step 4: Next day redeploy | Expected: The schedule should come through after deployment

Title: Browse All with over 1000 Workflows
Steps: Step 1: Use the following SQL to launch enough workflows to ensure you have over 1000 wf's in your database. DECLARE @I INTSET @I = 0DECLARE @MSG VARCHAR(100)--Increment the count on the next row for the number of workflows you wish to startWHILE @I < 1000BEGIN--You can start one or multiple workflow definitions if you wish...exec MESSAGING.FWP_StartWorkflowByName 'Aderant.Workflow.FileOpening.MatterIntake', ''--exec MESSAGING.FWP_StartWorkflowByName 'Aderant.Workflow.PaperlessPrebill.Approval', ''select @msg = 'Starting workflow number ' + CAST (@i as varchar(4))RAISERROR (@msg, 0, 1) WITH NOWAIT print @msgSET @i = @i + 1END || Step 2: within EA, view the processes list and Browse all to view all wf's | Expected: Only 1000 wf's will be shown.

Title: Use configuration in expressions for rules and actions
Use configuration in actions and rules
Description: Confirms that Expert Configuration (e.g. as can be seen in Configuration Manager) can be used in expressions for rules and actions.
Steps: Step 1: Create a new action of type Email. In the email Subject, enter:"The max length for a client code is " + Business.Hub.ClientCode.MaxLength || Step 2: In the To field, enter your own email address, anything in the Body, the press the Run Test button | Expected: You recieve an email in your Inbox, that has the subject line:The max length for a client code is 10* Note: The number 10 should match what you have in Configuration Manager under Business.Hub.ClientCode.MaxLength || Step 3: Create a new rule from a rule-based extension point.Set the following properties:Severity: 'Error', Message: "The max length for a client code is " + Business.Hub.ClientCode.MaxLengthCondition: Business.Hub.ClientCode.MaxLength = 10 || Step 4: Press the Run Test button | Expected: The last line in the test log shows an Info line with:Error The max length for a client code is 10

Title: Ensure Global and SmartForm level security doubling up dosnt cause a crash (following changes to security indexing)
Steps: Step 1: Open a workflow with a smartform task (either a new one or one of our templates) || Step 2: In the WF properties, and edit the Global task security. || Step 3: change the security (ie add yourself as task performer) but make a note/screenshot of the setting you have configured. || Step 4: return to the wf design surface and find/add a smartform task || Step 5: Edit the security plan for the smartform to match/duplicate the settings you have in the global settings. || Step 6: on the design surface select the smartform task and hit F4 - check the 'Include Global Security' checkbox. || Step 7: ensure the wf runs without error | Expected: If Faulting WFs will get stuck in IIS

Title: Return a list of items using query action
Description: Return a collection of items (rather than a single item) using the "Query" activity in actions and rules.
Steps: Step 1: Create a new RULE || Step 2: Create a new data variable called 'TimeEntries', and give it a type of ViewModelObservableCollection<Time> | Expected: Variable is listed in Data tab for the rule || Step 3: Add a Query action line before the Return action and set its properties:From: TimeWhere: Item.TimekeeperEmployeeId = 100078Result: TimeEntries || Step 4: In the Return action line, set the following properties:Severity: ErrorMessage: "The sum of your time entries over $100 adds up to more than $3000 "Condition:TimeEntries SUM Time.BaseAmount.Value>3000 WHERE Time.BaseAmountValue >100 || Step 5: Run the test | Expected: The action returns in the log : 'Error The sum of your time entries over $100 adds up to more than $3000'

Title: Add more than one line to an action or rule
Description: Actions and rules should allow multiple lines that execute in the sequence as they appear in the action'd design.
Steps: Step 1: Create a new action || Step 2: Add more than one line using different activity types || Step 3: Run the action | Expected: All lines of the action execute in the right sequence || Step 4: Create a new Rule || Step 5: Add more than one line using different activity types || Step 6: Run the rule | Expected: All lines of the rule execute in the right sequence || Step 7: Create a new menu item || Step 8: Add more than one line using different activity types || Step 9: Run the menu item | Expected: All lines of the menu item execute in the right sequence || Step 10: Run at least one of the items created from the product's real extension point | Expected: All lines of the item execute in the right sequence

Title: SPN batch file is updated when environment is updated
Roles that are core roles (dependencies) are not visible for the user to select
Steps: Step 1: Open Deployment Manager || Step 2: Go into edit mode and navigate to Roles/Servers grid | Expected: Only roles that are purchasable, i.e. products, are visible and able to be ticked/unticked || Step 3: Select "deploy" | Expected: During deployment, the roles that are dependencies of roles visible and ticked are also deployed (e.g. services, queries and workflows). Those that are dependencies only of roles that are unticked are not deployed. || Step 4: Check this works if the user has a second server (add a server (name doesn't have to be an actual server, just don't deploy with this server - remove either in advanced edit in DM or in the xml file) and tick all the roles (note: some cannot be ticked for 2 servers)) | Expected: When 'accept' no error messages will appear, and the correct roles will be shown in the xml file, including the visible=false roles.

Title: Duplicate Rule in Design Studio
Description: Ensure that an individual rule can be duplicated, whereby all properties are copied, but at a minimum, the name must be changed before the copy can be saved.
Steps: Step 1: Navigate to any rule via the Home page || Step 2: Right-click on the rule to see the context menu | Expected: The 'Duplicate Rule' option is available || Step 3: Select the 'Duplicate Rule' option | Expected: Window opens, with name (with "Copy of" appended to the front), description defaulted from the original rule. Effective date = today. || Step 4: Remove the "Copy of " text from the name so it is the same as the original rule then press the Save button without changing any details | Expected: Rule cannot be saved || Step 5: Change the name to be something different | Expected: New rule created - in the same location - with all of the lines copied from the original rule- with all the same local data variables added || Step 6: Navigate to any menu item via the Home page || Step 7: Right-click on the menu item to see the context menu | Expected: The 'Duplicate Menu Item' option is available || Step 8: Select the 'Duplicate Menu Item' option | Expected: Window opens, with name (with "Copy of" appended to the front), description defaulted from the original menu item. Effective date = today. || Step 9: Press the Save button | Expected: New menu item is created in the same location with all of the lines copied from the original menu item- in the same location - with all of the lines copied from the original menu item- with all the same local data variables added || Step 10: - in the same location - with all of the lines copied from the original rule- with all the same local variables added || Step 11: Right-click on the event to see the context menu | Expected: The 'Duplicate Event' option is available || Step 12: Select the 'Duplicate Event' option | Expected: Window opens, with name (with "Copy of" appended to the front), description defaulted from the original event. Effective date = today. || Step 13: Press the Save button | Expected: New event is created - in the same location - with all of the lines copied from the original event- with all the same local data variables added || Step 14: Navigate to any rule in the navigation tree || Step 15: Right-click on the rule to see the context menu | Expected: The 'Duplicate Rule' option is available || Step 16: Select the 'Duplicate Rule' option | Expected: Window opens, with name (with "Copy of" appended to the front), description defaulted from the original rule. Effective date = today. || Step 17: Press the Save button | Expected: New rule is created- in the same location - with all of the lines copied from the original rule- with all the same local data variables added || Step 18: Repeat steps 15-18 for a menu item in the navigation tree || Step 19: Repeat steps 15-18 for an event in the navigation tree

Title: TBD - Users are notified of packages which have no effect when imported
Disabling an Action in the Admin App
Description: As a customizer I want to be able to enable/disable rules/actions through the Admin app without needing to goto the Design Studio.
Steps: Step 1: Open Expert Administration || Step 2: System | Customisation Parameters | Expert Assistant | Menus | Actions Menu Choose an action.Edit the action and set it to inactive (uncheck the active check box). | Expected: Open Design Studio and navigate to the same action in EA and ensure that it is set to Inactive. || Step 3: Open EA and look for the action (that was set to inactive in the above step). | Expected: The action doesn't show up in EA until set to Active once again.

Title: Disabling a Rule in the Admin App
Description: As a customizer I want to be able to enable/disable rules/actions through the Admin app without needing to goto the Design Studio
Steps: Step 1: Open Expert Administration || Step 2: Navigate to System - Rule Parameters - Expert Expenses and choose a rule.Edit the rule and set it to inactive (uncheck the active check box) | Expected: Open Design Studio and navigate to the same rule and ensure that it is set to Inactive. || Step 3: Open Expert Expenses and try to trigger the rule (that was set to inactive in the above step). | Expected: The rule doesn't get triggered and the receipt is saved without any errors.

Title: Schedule with conditions - CurrentJobDate to be Today
Description:
As a customizer I want to be able to set the schedule condition to be a specific date so that when the date is reached, the action is triggered.
 
ExecutionEnvironment.Schedule.CurrentJobDate = #2014-02-25# 
Doing above fails because, CurrentJobDate filters datetime. In order to have only the Date portion of it - CurrentJobDate.Date field should be available.
Steps: Step 1: Create an EP of type Job and create an action to send email under the Job EP.Check the conditional checkbox in the Action and enter the following condition.ExecutionEnvironment.Schedule.JobDate.Date = Today. Save the action. | Expected: The action is saved. || Step 2: Create a schedule for the Job EP and schedule it at the default time the dialog shows. | Expected: You should receive the email immediately.

Title: Schedule with conditions - CurrentJobDate to be a specific date
Description:
As a customizer I want to be able to set the schedule condition to be a specific date so that when the date is reached, the action is triggered.
 
ExecutionEnvironment.Schedule.CurrentJobDate = #2014-02-25# 
Doing above fails because, CurrentJobDate filters datetime. In order to have only the Date portion of it - CurrentJobDate.Date field should be available.
Steps: Step 1: Create an EP of type Job and create an action to send email under the Job EP.Check the conditional checkbox in the Action and enter the following condition.ExecutionEnvironment.Schedule.JobDate.Date = #2014-03-05# (Please enter next day's date here).Save the action. | Expected: The action is saved || Step 2: Create a schedule for the Job EP and schedule it at the default time the dialog shows. || Step 3: Check schedule manager after a few minutes. | Expected: The schedule is set to Completed.Right click and look for Run History and see the history - The history says condition failed and hence activity will not be run. || Step 4: Create another schedule to using schedule manager to run the next day. | Expected: Email is received once the condition is met

Title: Checking SPNs on a load-balanced environment
Steps: Step 1: Use the admin vm, LRCTL301 and set up the required binaries and a load-balanced environment || Step 2: Open Deployment Manager (as another user - ask Peter Yu about this. Do this every time you open DM) and select 'edit' and then 'accept' in the environment tab ribbon | Expected: On 'accept', a message box appears stating "Not all SPNs are registered in the Active Directory. This will prevent the services from starting in a load-balanced environment..." || Step 3: Select "ok" on the message box. Locate the RegisterADERANTSpns.bat file in C:\Dev\ExpertSuite\Dev\Grad802\ExpertSource | Expected: Make sure the file's 'date modified' is set to the time you edited the environment manifest. || Step 4: Select "deploy" in Deployment Manager | Expected: Errors/Warnings appear when a service that relies on a load-balanced environment are being deployed saying that they cannot run due to the SPNs not being set up correctly || Step 5: Using the batch file, manually set up the SPNs correctly. Open deployment manager again and select 'edit' and then 'accept' in the environment tab ribbon | Expected: No message box appears as your SPNs are correctly set up || Step 6: Select "deploy" in Deployment Manager | Expected: Deployment works, services that rely on a load-balanced environment start and run successfully and no warnings appear to say the SPNs are not set up correctly

Title: Execute the same rule multiple times for different values
Description: Test that a rule can be run multiple times with different values passed in each time.
Steps: Step 1: PRE-REQ: The office of the employee that is adding the receipt detail is TLH.Add receipt and receipt detail with an expense of type "MEAL" AND Receipt Detail amount is >350.75. || Step 2: Create a new rule on the Receipt Rules extension point for Expenses || Step 3: Add a CSV Data Source by selecting the ribbon button then - Check the "Enable..." checkbox- Paste the following data into the list box:Location,MealValueTLH,350.75LON,125.00TOR,50.00CAN,85.50NZL,184.00 | Expected: Preview at bottom of window has variables:Location - StringMealValue - Double || Step 4: Set the following on the rule:Activity: ReturnSeverity: ErrorMessage: "You cannot claim that much" || Step 5: Add condition to rule:ReceiptDetail.ExpenseTypeId="MEAL" ANDEmployeeOfficeId=LocationANDReceiptDetail.ReceiptDetailAmount>MealValue || Step 6: Test the rule in Design Studio | Expected: Rule errors for TLH, 350.75, but not for any other rows || Step 7: Reopen CSV Data Source window and press the Open in Editor button | Expected: Excel spreadsheet opens with data in spreadsheet || Step 8: Make change to data in spreadsheet and save (save in CSV format) | Expected: Data updated in the CSV Source window || Step 9: Press OK | Expected: Location and MealValue appear in data tree || Step 10: Test the rule in Design Studio 2 | Expected: The error mesage for the rule shows up when you expect the rule to be violated || Step 11: Add receipts and receipt details for expenses of type "MEAL" , some of which will violate, the condition, and others that will not | Expected: The error mesage for the rule shows up when you expect the rule to be violated

Title: Maintain CSV file for rule
Description: The CSV data for a rule can be edited and maintained in different ways. Ensure that these different modes update the data, and are used in execution of the rule.
Steps: Step 1: Create a new rule with the following: || Step 2: Activity: ReturnSeverity: Error || Step 3: Add a CSV data source, selecting the Import from File option (use the file attached to this test step) | Expected: The csv data has two columns, Location (String) and Price (Double), with 25 rows of corresponding data || Step 4: Save the rule || Step 5: Navigate to the rule you have created and open the parameters window | Expected: There is a button to open the CSV Data Source window || Step 6: Make some changes to the data source || Step 7: Return to Design Studio 2 and re-open the rule | Expected: The data source has been updated

Title: Testing Time spell checker in ribbon bar (ignore All)
Steps: Step 1: open time and create 2 new time entries || Step 2: in the narrative for both enter the following error strewn text - 'iss there somee spellling iss spellling mistakers' || Step 3: select the first time entry and run the spell checker from the ribbon bar || Step 4: use the Ignore all function on each of the words in the narrative | Expected: 'iss' and 'Spellling' should only appear once during the process || Step 5: after completing, run the spell check against the second time entry | Expected: none of the words should trigger a spelling error response

Title: Roles that are dependencies of visible roles are generated for the user in advanced edit
Steps: Step 1: Open up Deployment Manager and select "advanced edit" | Expected: An xml file is opened within deployment manager for the environment || Step 2: Add a role type within <roles> of something purchasable (i.e. something visible on the normal environment tab). Select "accept" and then "advanced edit" again | Expected: Any visible=false roles (those that you don't see on the environment tab) that the visible roles are dependent on are added to the roles list (a list of these dependencies are found in the attachments). No errors are shown on edit and accept. || Step 3: Remove a role that is visible=false in advanced edit and hit 'accept' | Expected: A message box appears saying you can't have role " " without the role you just removed, so the role will be generated for you. || Step 4: Go back into advanced edit | Expected: Ensure that role has been added to the roles list again

Title: Update existing deployment with SSRS configuration details
Steps: Step 1: Deploy Expert WITHOUT SSRS | Expected: SSRS Configuration is not specified in Environment manifest AND SSRS folder does not exist in the reports website AND check that SSRS packages are NOT imported || Step 2: In Deployment manager, fill in SSRS configurations and click on DEPLOY | Expected: Deployment manager should detect that you do not have SSRS installed, then should prompt you with an option to deploy SSRS components only. || Step 3: Deploy the SSRS components | Expected: After deployment, check SSRS website, check Expert SSRS packages are imported, and check that you can access reports from Expert products like Matter Planning, Administration app etc.

Title: Retry behavior is set in Admin App
Description:
Retry behaviour can be set in the Admin app for the schedules. And if schedules fail for one reason or the other, it can retry after the given time in the admin app.
 
It is set in the System - Scheduler Settings node.
Steps: Step 1: Go to System > Scheduler Settings Change:Retry Delay 1 = 0h 1mRetry Delay 2 = 0h 2m | Expected: Changes saved || Step 2: Import package | Expected: Package importedJob called "script" added to Expert Expenses || Step 3: Add Schedules to Job Schedule 1Retry Behavior = NoneSchedule 2Retry Behavior = OnceSchedule 3Retry Behavior = Option 1Schedule 4Retry Behavior = Option 2 | Expected: Schedule 1Fails 1st run no more runs afterSchedule 2Fails 1st run and fails immediate run afterSchedule 3Fails 1st run and fails immediate run after, fails run 1minute after retry runSchedule 4Fails 1st run and fails immediate run after, fails run 2minute after retry run

Title: apply Patch All Test
Steps: Step 1: Roll back or create an environment that is at the most recent HF or SP level (Only applicable post 8011) || Step 2: Following the relevant patches Apply All Upgrade Guide apply the UPD to the Database | Expected: UPD applies without issue. || Step 3: Following the relevant patches Apply All Upgrade Guide apply the patch to the environment | Expected: Patch Applies without issue || Step 4: Test the functionality of the contents of the patches within the patch all | Expected: Functionality works as expected || Step 5: sainity test through all the apps to ensure that no functionality has regressed. | Expected: All apps work as expected.

Title: Export package containing extension points and associated rules
Steps: Step 1: Create a new extension point of type Job with a data contract item of Client || Step 2: Add an action to the Job extension point

Title: Export package containing rules with data variables
Description: Ensure that when you export a customization package containing a rule with data variables, the data variables are included in the package and can be successfully inported into another environment.
Steps: Step 1: Create a rule that uses local data variables || Step 2: From Design Studio, export the customization package that the rule is associated with || Step 3: Import the customization package into another environment || Step 4: In Design Studio, navigate to the path that the rule should exist | Expected: * The rule has been created in the new environment* The data variables for the rule are the same as the original environment* The data variables are available for consumption in the rule (highlighted in green) || Step 5: Run the rule | Expected: The rule runs and substitutes the data variables as expected

Title: Export package containing jobs and schedules
Description:
Ensure that jobs and associated schedules can be moved from one environment to another using packaging.
Note that when schedules are packaged they will be in an inactive state. Administrators will need to manually activate schedules via Schedule Manager if they wish to run them in the new environment.
Steps: Step 1: Create a job extension point, and add a job to it. Assign them both to the same package || Step 2: Add a schedule to run the job || Step 3: Test that the job runs when the schedule requires it to | Expected: Job runs- At expected time as per schedule- Job runs through actions as expected || Step 4: Export the customization package that the extension point, job and schedule are assigned to || Step 5: Import the package into another environment || Step 6: Check the job has been created in Design Studio | Expected: The job has been created under the same product and extension point as it was originally created || Step 7: Check the job in Expert Administration application | Expected: The parameters can be seen and default values changed in Expert Administration app || Step 8: View the schedule in Scnein the new environment In Schedule Manager, view the schedule | Expected: Schedule has an inactive state || Step 9: Set the state of the schedule to active || Step 10: Create a schedule for the job || Step 11: Test that the job runs when the schedule requires it to

Title: Export package containing rule that uses a CSV data source
Description: Ensure that when a rule containing a CSV data source is exported in a customization package, the CSV data source is included in the package.
Steps: Step 1: Create a rule containing a CSV data source || Step 2: From Design Studio, export the customization package that the rule is associated with || Step 3: Import the customization package into another environment || Step 4: In Design Studio, navigate to the path that the rule should exist | Expected: * The rule has been created in the new environment* The CSV data source has been enabled on the rule, and the data source is the same as the original environment* The data variables created by the CSV data source are available for consumption in the rule (highlighted in green) || Step 5: Run the rule | Expected: The rule runs and iterates throught the CSV data as expected

Title: Export package containing menu items
Steps: Step 1: Create a menu item under any product || Step 2: From Design Studio, export the customization package that the menu item is associated with || Step 3: Import the customization package into another environment || Step 4: In Design Studio, navigate to the path that the menu item should exist | Expected: The menu item has been created in the new environment || Step 5: Run the menu item in the appropriate application | Expected: The menu item runs as expected

Title: Export package containing rule with its own parameters
Description: Ensure that when you export a customization package containing a rule with parameters, the parameters and associated default values are included in the package and can be successfully inported into another environment.
Steps: Step 1: Create a new rule that uses paramters || Step 2: Set a default value for the parameter(s) || Step 3: Set the parameter values (to something else) in the Expert Admin app (assign a different customization package in Admin app than the package on the rule in Design Studio 2) || Step 4: Export the customization package that contains the rule || Step 5: Import the customization package into another environment || Step 6: In the new environment, navigate to the rule in Design Studio | Expected: Rule has been added to new environment with same details as original environment* Same path, name, description, actions* Same parameters and default value* Parameter value in Admin app has NOT been copied* The parameters are available for consumption in the rule || Step 7: Run the rule | Expected: The rule runs and substitutes the parameters as expected || Step 8: Edit a parameter value using the Expert Admin app || Step 9: Execute rule again | Expected: The rule runs using the new parameter value as expected

Title: Export package containing rule with multiple versions
Steps: Step 1: Create a rule that has more than one version || Step 2: Export the package that the rule belongs to || Step 3: Import the package into another environment || Step 4: In the second environment, navigate to the rule in Design Studio 2 | Expected: Only the most recent active version of the rule has been imported

Title: IsDevEnvironment field logic works
Steps: Step 1: Launch Deployment Manager from the binaries folder || Step 2: Change the IsDevEnvironment field to "false" | Expected: On "accept" an info message appears stating "not all SPNs are not registered correctly in the Active Directory, this will prevent the services from starting in a load balanced environment" || Step 3: Insert some name into the network load balancer field (in advanced edit - doens't have to be a valid load balancer name) | Expected: On "accept" an info message appears stating "not all SPNs are not registered correctly in the Active Directory, this will prevent the services from starting in a load balanced environment" || Step 4: Change the IsDevEnvironment field to "true" | Expected: On "accept" an info message appears stating "not all SPNs are not registered correctly in the Active Directory, this will prevent the services from starting in a load balanced environment" || Step 5: Remove the name in the network load balancer field | Expected: On "accept" no message appears

Title: View domain model from Design Studio
Description: The domain model can be viewed from Design Studio. A toolbar button will launch the domain model in your default browser.
Steps: Step 1: Set IE8 as your default browser || Step 2: In Design Studio, press the 'Show Domain Model Explorer' button in the toolbar | Expected: The Domain Model launches in IE8 || Step 3: Navigate around the domain model explorer | Expected: Items can be searchedProperties are displayed for entitiesFilters work || Step 4: Set IE11 as your default browser || Step 5: In Design Studio, press the 'Show Domain Model Explorer' button in the toolbar | Expected: The Domain Model launches in IE11 || Step 6: Navigate around the domain model explorer | Expected: Items can be searchedProperties are displayed for entitiesFilters work || Step 7: Set Chrome as your default browser || Step 8: In Design Studio, press the 'Show Domain Model Explorer' button in the toolbar | Expected: The Domain Model launches in Chrome. || Step 9: Navigate around the domain model explorer | Expected: Items can be searchedProperties are displayed for entitiesFilters work

Title: Export package containing parameter values for rules
Description: Ensure that parameter values for a rule can be moved from one environment to another using packaging.

Title: Roles that are not dependencies of visible roles or are visible roles themselves still get added
Steps: Step 1: Launch deployment manager and make sure the environment manifest has some roles ticked on a server. Select "advanced edit" in the environment ribbon bar | Expected: The roles that are ticked in the environment manifest before selecting "advanced edit" are listed in the roles within the xml. Other roles that are dependencies of these visible roles (e.g. QueryService, Security, Messaging, Workflow, FirmControl, Configuration, CommonApplications) are also listed within the roles, along with roles that are not visible roles and are not dependencies of visible roles (Custom Workflows, Notes and Workflow Authoring). || Step 2: Remove some of the roles that are not dependencies of visible roles or visible roles themselves (e.g. Custom Workflows, Notes and/or Workflow Authoring). Select "accept" | Expected: A message box appears stating that some roles were added for the user (possibly the message box lists which roles) || Step 3: Go back into "advanced edit" and check the environment xml | Expected: The roles that were removed are back in the environment xml

Title: Format string in expression
Description:
To format date values into more user-friendly string, standard C# formatting can be used.
 
Some examples below from the follpwing website:
http://www.csharp-examples.net/string-format-datetime/
 
String Format for DateTime [C#]
This example shows how to format DateTime using String.Format method. All formatting can be done also using DateTime.ToString method.
Custom DateTime Formatting
There are following custom format specifiers y (year), M (month), d (day), h (hour 12), H (hour 24), m (minute), s (second), f (second fraction), F (second fraction, trailing zeroes are trimmed), t (P.M or A.M) and z (time zone).
Following examples demonstrate how are the format specifiers rewritten to the output.
[C#]// create date time 2008-03-09 16:05:07.123
DateTime dt = new DateTime(2008, 3, 9, 16, 5, 7, 123);

String.Format("{0:y yy yyy yyyy}", dt);  // "8 08 008 2008"   year
String.Format("{0:M MM MMM MMMM}", dt);  // "3 03 Mar March"  month
String.Format("{0:d dd ddd dddd}", dt);  // "9 09 Sun Sunday" day
String.Format("{0:h hh H HH}",     dt);  // "4 04 16 16"      hour 12/24
String.Format("{0:m mm}",          dt);  // "5 05"            minute
String.Format("{0:s ss}",          dt);  // "7 07"            second
String.Format("{0:f ff fff ffff}", dt);  // "1 12 123 1230"   sec.fraction
String.Format("{0:F FF FFF FFFF}", dt);  // "1 12 123 123"    without zeroes
String.Format("{0:t tt}",          dt);  // "P PM"            A.M. or P.M.
String.Format("{0:z zz zzz}",      dt);  // "-6 -06 -06:00"   time zone


You can use also date separator / (slash) and time sepatator : (colon). These characters will be rewritten to characters defined in the current DateTimeForma­tInfo.DateSepa­rator and DateTimeForma­tInfo.TimeSepa­rator.
[C#]// date separator in german culture is "." (so "/" changes to ".")
String.Format("{0:d/M/yyyy HH:mm:ss}", dt); // "9/3/2008 16:05:07" - english (en-US)
String.Format("{0:d/M/yyyy HH:mm:ss}", dt); // "9.3.2008 16:05:07" - german (de-DE)


Here are some examples of custom date and time formatting:
[C#]// month/day numbers without/with leading zeroes
String.Format("{0:M/d/yyyy}", dt);            // "3/9/2008"
String.Format("{0:MM/dd/yyyy}", dt);          // "03/09/2008"

// day/month names
String.Format("{0:ddd, MMM d, yyyy}", dt);    // "Sun, Mar 9, 2008"
String.Format("{0:dddd, MMMM d, yyyy}", dt);  // "Sunday, March 9, 2008"

// two/four digit year
String.Format("{0:MM/dd/yy}", dt);            // "03/09/08"
String.Format("{0:MM/dd/yyyy}", dt);          // "03/09/2008"


Standard DateTime Formatting
In DateTimeForma­tInfo there are defined standard patterns for the current culture. For example property ShortTimePattern is string that contains value h:mm tt for en-US culture and value HH:mm for de-DE culture.
Following table shows patterns defined in DateTimeForma­tInfo and their values for en-US culture. First column contains format specifiers for the String.Format method.




Specifier
DateTimeFormatInfo property
Pattern value (for en-US culture)

t
ShortTimePattern
h:mm tt

d
ShortDatePattern
M/d/yyyy

T
LongTimePattern
h:mm:ss tt

D
LongDatePattern
dddd, MMMM dd, yyyy

f
(combination of D and t)
dddd, MMMM dd, yyyy h:mm tt

F
FullDateTimePattern
dddd, MMMM dd, yyyy h:mm:ss tt

g
(combination of d and t)
M/d/yyyy h:mm tt

G
(combination of d and T)
M/d/yyyy h:mm:ss tt

m, M
MonthDayPattern
MMMM dd

y, Y
YearMonthPattern
MMMM, yyyy

r, R
RFC1123Pattern
ddd, dd MMM yyyy HH':'mm':'ss 'GMT' (*)

s
SortableDateTi­mePattern
yyyy'-'MM'-'dd'T'HH':'mm':'ss (*)

u
UniversalSorta­bleDateTimePat­tern
yyyy'-'MM'-'dd HH':'mm':'ss'Z' (*)

 
 
(*) = culture independent
Following examples show usage of standard format specifiers in String.Format method and the resulting output.
[C#]String.Format("{0:t}", dt);  // "4:05 PM"                         ShortTime
String.Format("{0:d}", dt);  // "3/9/2008"                        ShortDate
String.Format("{0:T}", dt);  // "4:05:07 PM"                      LongTime
String.Format("{0:D}", dt);  // "Sunday, March 09, 2008"          LongDate
String.Format("{0:f}", dt);  // "Sunday, March 09, 2008 4:05 PM"  LongDate+ShortTime
String.Format("{0:F}", dt);  // "Sunday, March 09, 2008 4:05:07 PM" FullDateTime
String.Format("{0:g}", dt);  // "3/9/2008 4:05 PM"                ShortDate+ShortTime
String.Format("{0:G}", dt);  // "3/9/2008 4:05:07 PM"             ShortDate+LongTime
String.Format("{0:m}", dt);  // "March 09"                        MonthDay
String.Format("{0:y}", dt);  // "March, 2008"                     YearMonth
String.Format("{0:r}", dt);  // "Sun, 09 Mar 2008 16:05:07 GMT"   RFC1123
String.Format("{0:s}", dt);  // "2008-03-09T16:05:07"             SortableDateTime
String.Format("{0:u}", dt);  // "2008-03-09 16:05:07Z"            UniversalSortableDateTime
Steps: Step 1: Add activiyt = log Message = string.format("{0:d}",Today)LogLevel = Fatal || Step 2: Test run the action/rule | Expected: Date value is added to string output in format: dd/mm/yyyy || Step 3: Try a couple of other formats as per test case description || Step 4: Test in other places that expressions are used.

Title: Use list <T> in an expression
Description:
According to Andrew this is not a valid use case and not used by clients. for lists you would not use a parameter
 
-----
 
We need the ability to pass List<T> this should include simple types like int, string, decimal and nullable and using expressions like Sum, Count, In, Contains.
Steps: Step 1: Create data variable with type: List <String> e.g. Colours || Step 2: Create parameter (e.g. Numbers) with type: List <Int32> and give it a default value e.g. 1,2,3 || Step 3: Assign values to the data variable e.g. "Red","White","Blue" || Step 4: Use a log action to log the details from the data variable and the parameter || Step 5: Run the action | Expected: Log displays correct values for the variable and parameter || Step 6: Add Assign action to change the values of the parameter || Step 7: Add another log action to log the details from the data variable and the parameter || Step 8: Add another log action and set any text (that does not use the data variable or parameter) in the message property || Step 9: Add a condition to the action that checks whether a given word is in the List <String>E.g. "Red" In Colours || Step 10: Run action | Expected: Last log executes || Step 11: Change condition to "Red" Not In Colours || Step 12: Run action | Expected: Last log does not execute || Step 13: Add another log action and set any text (that does not use the data variable or parameter) in the message property || Step 14: Add a condition to the action that checks whether a given word is in the List <String>E.g. Numbers Contains 1 || Step 15: Run action | Expected: Last log executes || Step 16: Change condition to Numbers Does Not Contain 1 || Step 17: Run action | Expected: Last log does not execute

Title: User is able to create a variable for attachments rather than use a fixed string
Description:
In Visual Studio, the user should be able to create a workflow and create a variable (e.g. AttachmentPath) to enable the ability to add a file path later on in the workflow, rather than having to hardcode it as a string when designing the workflow.
 
In Visual Studio, create a workflow with an email task and a system note task.
Create a string variable in the workflow (e.g. AttachmentPath) and add this to the attachment field in the properties of each of these tasks.
 
This should allow the user to later on add the fie path for the attachment, when the user used to have to add the file path as a string in this field.
 
In the workflow attached, we have also included an approval task to allow the user to enter the file path. 
Within this field, we need to test three different types of paths
- File paths (e.g. C:\Temp\... )
- Network file paths (e.g. \\svnas301\tempswap... )
- Expressions (e.g. String.Format("C:\Temp\{0}", "...") )
 
To test that the variable works, we need to check that in both the email received and the system note attached to the workflow, the specified file is attached. 
The workflow may need to be run 3 times in order to test all three of these types of file paths - try to use different attachments for each type so we can ensure the workflow doesn't hold on to the first file attached.

Title: Advanced deployment option - Show pre-requisite errors as warnings
Steps: Step 1: Go to deployment manager -> Advanced options and enable this feature | Expected: 1. You should get a confirmation/warning dialog to re-confirm and describes the possible consequences of enabling this option2. After this option is enabled, you should get an warnning message below the ribbon bar. || Step 2: If the manifest contains skipPrerequisistesCheck=true flag | Expected: 1. This flag will be ignored and always be treated as FALSE2. You should get a warning message below the ribbon saying this flag is replaced by the advanced option and being ignored. || Step 3: Few things you can do to fail the pre-req check:1. Remove admin and logon as service rights from services.expert.ap2. Remove Sharing of ExpertShare folder for test/production envrionment3. Install from a computer without Visual Studio4. Install from a computer with .net 4.05. Install with missing source files? | Expected: You should still get logs about the failed pre-req checks but the deployment will not stop and go on.

Title: User is able to send emails (allocate tasks) to workgroups
Description:
To test this, you will need to set up a workgroup which includes a number of people whose email you can monitor to ensure all members of the workgroup get the email.
To set up a workgroup:
In Appshell: Hub Setup > Personnel Setup > Select a workgroup (e.g. PM), hit attach on the bottom left and assign people to the workgroup.
In SQL, you can check the different IDs and properties of the workgroup by selecting the top 1000 rows of the HBL_WORKGROUP table (right-click, "select top 1000 rows).
 
You will need to import the attached workflow, and open it in Visual Studio. In the "send email" task, change the TO: field to one or some of the properties of the workgroup or an individual (to make sure the send email activity works as normal as well as being able to send to work groups - these properties are listed below)
 
Username (e.g. Firstname.Lastname)
UserId 
User Uno
User email address
Group Name (e.g. PM)
Group ID
Group Uno
Group Display Name (e.g. Practice Management)
 
When you run the workflow, it will send you an approval task to attach a file path - attach a path (such as "C:\temp\...") and when you "approve", an email should be sent to ALL members in the group (if you use any properties of the workgroup) or only to the user you specified. Make sure that all users also get the attachment (if nobody does, it's possible the path is wrong)

Title: TBD Design Studio - Rules - Parameter
Description: Determine the order in which rules for an extension point run, using the Reorder Rules button that is available in the ribbon when an extension point is open in the Design Studio 2 ribbon.
Steps: Step 1: In Design Studio create a New Rule for Expenses Receipt Rules | Expected: Rule is opened in a Tab || Step 2: Create a parameter ('Test Parameter' of type string) using the Parameters ribbon bar button. Set its default value to "Hello" . | Expected: The parameter is created and is added to the Data tab.Post 8021: The parameter is in the section Parameters and is shown as Rule / action parameter. Hovering over it shows it is a string || Step 3: Set the activity type to Return for the rule and set message to the parameter | Expected: The rule is saved to return the parameter. || Step 4: Run the rule and see. | Expected: The rule is valid and returns Hello.Post 8021: You get an edit Parameter Pop up before the rule is run

Title: Reorder actions for a job
Description: Determine the order in which actions for a job run, using the Reorder Actions button that is available in the ribbon when a job is open in the Design Studio 2 ribbon.
Steps: Step 1: Add Job Activity = Message DialogMessage = " First" | Expected: Save and Run - pop up with dialog opens || Step 2: Add LineActivity = Message DialogMessage = " Second" | Expected: Save and Run - pop ups appear in order first and second || Step 3: Drag and Drop second Message dialog before first | Expected: Save and Run - pop ups appear in order second then first

Title: Approval decision can be used as a variable in conditions on forms in the same task
Steps: Step 1: Create a Smartform using both Visual Studio and Smartform Wizard | Expected: In Visual Studio, File > New > Project > Expert Smartform Library. Right-click on the project, Add > New Items > Expert Smartform. 'Edit' to get to the Smartform Wizard. || Step 2: Add the TaskInfo parameter, expand the node and tick "ApprovalResult". Add several other parameters, e.g. add Client and tick "OfficeId", "DepartmentId", and "ProfitCenterId" | Expected: TaskInfo no longer exists? :( || Step 3: Under each of the parameters (apart from TaskInfo.ApprovalResult), change some of the IsVisible, IsEnabled and IsRequired fields to expressions in a number of different combinations. | Expected: Make sure if you have a field as IsRequired, the field will be visible at the same time, and that you make an expression at least once for each IsRequired, IsVisible and IsEnabled || Step 4: Click on the "..." in the new row underneath 'Expression' for all these combinations (all the fields you want as expressions). This will open a new window where you can add an expression, or a 'rule'. In the left-hand field in the rule, enter in the TaskInfo.ApprovalResult parameter. In the right-hand side, make this parameter equal to either "APPROVE" or "DECLINE" || Step 5: Save the smartform and finish the wizard. | Expected: When creating the smartform in Visual Studio, make sure you regenerate all smartforms (right-click menu on project) and publish to local to be able to access the smartform through the approval task. || Step 6: Open a new Aderant Workflow project in Visual Studio || Step 7: Add an Approval Task to the workflow and double-click on the task || Step 8: Select "Edit Smartforms" and add your two smartforms to the task. If there are any parameters that require linked workflow data (e.g. Client), add them using the + next to the field. Save the smartforms to the task. || Step 9: In the task properties, find the Approval Result property and click on the +. Save that variable (this is what the TaskInfo.ApprovalResult links to) and check the 'Web Enabled' property. Add an approval comment and security plan to satisfy the building needs and then save the workflow. || Step 10: Launch EA to receive the task and run the workflow. Accept and open the task. | Expected: Make sure that the correct field/s become required, visible and/or enabled when they're meant to depending on the decision (approve or decline) that you choose on the task for BOTH smartforms. || Step 11: Launch OTG Workflow and open the task | Expected: Make sure that the correct field/s become required, visible and/or enabled when they're meant to depending on the decision (approve or decline) that you choose on the task for BOTH smartforms.

Title: Design Studio - Rules - Change rule sequence
Description:
The run order for rules under an extension point can be manually changed in Design Studio. We need to ensure that the order can be changed, that the sequence is honoured at runtime, and that the sequence is when exporting/importing packages.
 
Note:
When rules are imported into another environment, if there is an existing rule with the same sequence number, the rule in the package is added after the one that already exists in the environment.
Steps: Step 1: Under the Expenses Receipt Rules extension point, add a further three rules (assign all new rules to the same package) | Expected: When Rule point Tab is open you see the order the Rules will be run || Step 2: Click on the Reorder Rules button in the ribbon and in the pop up, change the order of the rules || Step 3: Cause the rules to run from the appropriate extension point | Expected: Log viewer shows that the rules are executed in the order of the list you edited || Step 4: Return to Design Studio and on the page for the extension point, press the Reorder link and change the order of the rules || Step 5: Cause the rules to run from the appropriate extension point | Expected: Log viewer shows that the rules are executed in the order of the list you edited || Step 6: Export the package containing the new rules | Expected: The package contains the correct sequence number for each rule (in the ExtensionPointReferences_ExpertExpenses_Rules_ReceiptRules.xml file) || Step 7: Import the package into a different environment || Step 8: View the rules in Design Studio | Expected: The rules that were imported have been slotted in after the existing rule that had the same sequence number

Title: Use last run date information in future runs of job
Description:
Details of when the last time a job was executed can be used in future runs of the same job.
For example, you may have a condition on an action in your job that specifies you only want to run the action if certain data has changed since the last time the job was run.
Steps: Step 1: Add Job Activity = LogMessage = "Test"Log Level = LogLevel.Fatal | Expected: Save and run - shows fatal log in log window || Step 2: Add ConditionExecutionEnvironment.Schedule.LastRunTime = Today.Day | Expected: Save and run - condition failed with null > today --> false || Step 3: Add scheduleOccurrence = dailyFrequency = 5 minutesstart / end = Now - 10 min from now | Expected: Review run history:first run condition failed (last run time = null)second run condition passes (last run time = last run time set in [select * from FWM_EXTENSION_POINT_SCHEDULE])
