Title: EA - MSI survives Expert upgrade on XP, auto-start disabled
Description:
Test that when the framework is upgraded, that the click once version still functions, and that any new features are auto discovered.
 
Test with an upgrade of the click once manifest itself.
 
Test with an upgrade of the framework without a change to the manifest.
 
Both cases should invoke the upgrade process.
 
Steps:
1. Install click once on Version a on a client machine (WSAKL000500, user login = TTQA3). In EA settings, set Auto-start to 'False'
2. Shut down the assistant (DONT uninstall)
3. Perform a server side upgrade using deployment engine.
4. Try and reopen the assistant from the client machine's program menu
5. User sdhould be prompted that a new version exists, and they wish to upgrade. (unless app has been signed and certificate is installed on client --> Silent install , no user interaction required)
6. Upgrade should take place, and user can use the assitant.
Steps:
Step 1: PRE-UPGRADE:'1. Install MSI on Version a on a client machine (WSAKL000500, user login = TTQA3). In EA settings, set Auto-start to 'False'2. Shut down the assistant (DONT uninstall) || Step 2: POST-UPGRADE:
Try and reopen the assistant from the client machine's program menu | Expected: User should be prompted that a new version exists, and they wish to upgrade. (unless app has been signed and certificate is installed on client --> Silent install , no user interaction required)
Upgrade should take place, and user can use the assitant.

Title: EA - MSI to XP client, shutdown during upgrade, auto-start enabled
Description:
The first time EA is accessed after an upgrade is when the Auto-start setting kicks in the first time a user logs into their machine after the upgrade
(rather than them already being logged into their machine the first time the launch EA after the environment is upgraded)
 
Set-Up SP1:
1. Install Click Once EA on a XP client machine.
2. Ensure Auto-start of Expert Assistant is set to TRUE for EA
3. Install Click Once Timer on a XP client machine.
   - TimerGadget:  no matter, 15h 22m, 28s, Phase task=L100.L190, narrative=Some notes added pre-upgrade
4, Leave client machine SHUT DOWN or log off during upgrade
e.g. WSAKL000599, logged in as TTQA1
 
Post-Upgrade to HF1: 
1. Start up client machine
2. Launch EA from the Start menu on the XP machine. 
3. Click Once should upgrade without any notification (silent install). 
4. In addition to the standard splash screen for EA, the user will also notice a progress window appear in the top left-hand corner of the screen which will automatically close.
Steps: Step 1: Pre-upgrade:1. Install EA msi on a XP client machine.2. Ensure Auto-start of Expert Assistant is set to TRUE for EA3. Install Timer msi on a XP client machine. - TimerGadget: no matter, 15h 22m, 28s, Phase task=L100.L190, narrative=Some notes added pre-upgrade4, Leave client machine SHUT DOWN or log off during upgradee.g. WSAKL000599, logged in as TTQA1 || Step 2: Post-Upgrade: Start up client machine Launch EA from the Start menu on the XP machine. | Expected: EA should upgrade without any notification (silent install). In addition to the standard splash screen for EA, the user will also notice a progress window appear in the top left-hand corner of the screen which will automatically close.

Title: Standard smartform task action - Complete & open Next Task
Description:
Expected behaviour:
1. Complete & Next button should be shown in all types of Tasks, and should be to the right of the Complete button.
 

 
 
2. Complete & Next should open the next task of same type as current task. i.e. If you are on a Prebill Markup task and hit Complete & Next, the next Markup task in your inbox should be opened.
 
3. If you do not have any more tasks of same type in your inbox, you should be notified that there are no further tasks to process.
Steps: Step 1: Complete & Next a task via Task ribbon and Expert Tab(2 iterations @interface) || Step 2: See Summary page for expected behaviours || Step 3: SETUP: Start 5 workflows and have 5 tasks of same type in your EA inbox || Step 4: Open 1 of the tasks, fill in required fields and then hit "Complete & Next". a. Open a task from top of the listb. Open a task from bottom of the listc. Open a task from middle of the list | Expected: After a reasonable time you hit "Complete & Next", the next task of same type should be opened and loaded. Check that a, b, c function the same way and output the same result. || Step 5: Complete & Next a task while you don't have other tasks of same type | Expected: You should be notified that there are no further tasks to process.

Description:

1. Complete & Next button should be shown in all types of Tasks, and should be to the right of the Complete button.

Go to EA settings and change Task settings to recieve email for new tasks.3. Run this test with EA open || Step 3: Go to your email client, open 1 of the tasks from email attachment, fill in required fields and then hit "Complete & Next". a. Open a task from top of the listb. Open a task from bottom of the listc. Open a task from middle of the list | Expected: After a reasonable time you hit "Complete & Next", the next task of same type should be opened and loaded. Check that a, b, c function the same way and output the same result. || Step 4: Complete & Next a task while you don't have other tasks of same type | Expected: You should be notified that there are no further tasks to process. || Step 5: Ran this test again without EA running | Expected: You should get a message saying EA is not running and task list is not available.

Title: 'New Client' install of Expert.
Steps: Step 1: The purpose of this test is to simulate a 'new client' fresh install onto a load balanced environment, ie one that has not had pre-reqs set up. || Step 2: Ensure that the VMs for this test have been rolled back to blank after the last run through. VMs (VMNEWCLIENT301 (host), VMNEWCLIENT302, VMNEWCLIENT303) || Step 3: VMNEWCLIENT301 is the host machine, this is where the Database, CMS binaries and Expert Binaries should live. || Step 4: Follow the documentation to set up the environment from fresh to deploy the expert binaries | Expected: The guides are accurate and easy to followDeployment completes without errors or warnings || Step 5: Perform a smoketest on the environment to ensure all functionality works correctly. | Expected: all applications work correctly || Step 6: Return VMs to their original state.

Title: TBD Schedule Manager Test - Review Tab
TBD Collection Projection - Where clause
TBD Domain Model Explorer
Email notifications in batch for workflow tasks
Description:
There is a new setting found in Expert Assistant and Configuration Manager called "Batch Reminders". 
When this is set as "True", the user/firm will get all their reminder emails sent in one email instead of receiving several emails reminding them of tasks throughout the day.
This can be set in Expert Assistant under Settings.TaskInbox > Batch Reminders or in Configuration Manager under Technical.Framework.Workflow.Options > NotifyOnAssignmentReminderBatching
 
The time that anybody with Batch Reminders set as "True" will receive their email is set in Configuration Manager under Technical.Framework.Workflow.Options > TaskReminderBatchProcessingTime
 
For more information:
 
http://sharepoint.aderantonline.com/Expert%20Blog/Lists/Posts/Post.aspx?ID=741
Steps: Step 1: Note: This test should be done properly over several days, as a client would be getting the emails. But, the test can also be done by changing the clock and date on your computer (and possibly some other Windows settings as well) || Step 2: Launch Expert Assistant and create several tasks (e.g. File Opening or Employee Intake tasks) || Step 3: In Configuration Manager, navigate to Technical.Framework.Workflow.Options and open TaskReminderBatchProcessingTime. Change the value to the hour when you would like to receive batch email reminders | Expected: Valueis defaulted to 10 and can be changed to any value between 1 and 23 - the value will correspond to the hour in the day that the email reminders are sent/received. || Step 4: In the same location, find NotifyOnAssignmentReminderBatching and change the firm value to true. | Expected: Batch reminders are defaulted to False. Value can be changed to True. || Step 5: Launch Expert Assistant and navigate to Settings.TaskInbox. Change the batch emails to "False"/unticked but keep reminder emails on. Check Configuration Manager under NotifyOnAssignmentReminderBatching to ensure the User setting has been created. | Expected: Settings in Expert Assistant are set to the same as the firm settings: batch reminders = True. User is able to change the batch reminders to "False" and a User setting is created, the Firm setting remains unchanged (batch reminders = "True") || Step 6: Two ways to do this: a) Negotiate with a work colleague who has their user and email address in the database to assign some tasks to, or b) Create a new employee that has your email address and assign some tasks to them. Do not change their reminder email settings. || Step 7: Depending on how many days to wait for the reminder emails are set to (defaulted to 1), check your inbox and take a note of how many emails/what emails you get over the next few days. (This is set in the same location in Configuration Manager under NotifyOnAssignmnetReminderDelay) | Expected: If your days to wait is set as 1, make sure you get an email every day onwards. Ensure the batch emails are sent at the correct time each day, and that the individual reminders are sent around the same time they were started/received. If your days to wait is set to longer than 1 day, make sure that both the batch and individual reminders do not get emailed out until that many days have passed. And then the reminders are sent out daily. || Step 8: For batch reminders: double-click on the email attachment. For individual reminders: double-click on the email attachment. | Expected: For batch reminders: ensure the email attachment takes you to your task inbox in Expert Assitant. For individual reminders: ensure the email attachment takes you to the specific task and opens the correct task window.

Title: Matter search with different combination of search criterias
Steps: Step 1: Matter search should have consistant behaviour across all apps (EA, Time, MatterPlanning etc.) || Step 2: Using the master database, test with the following criteria. || Step 3: Enter Client code (10901) | Expected: Matters of client "Arden Industries" are returned || Step 4: Enter Client Name (landscaping) | Expected: Matters of client "Underhill Landscaping & Contruction Ltd.) " are returned || Step 5: Enter Long Client Name (Underhill Landscaping & Contruction Ltd.) | Expected: Matters of client "Underhill Landscaping & Contruction Ltd.) " are returned || Step 6: Enter Matter Name (Payment) | Expected: Matters of client "Underhill Landscaping & Contruction Ltd.) " are returned || Step 7: Enter Long Matter Name (Advanced Fees balance) | Expected: Matter is returned || Step 8: Enter Client name + Matter name (Advanced Fees - FC/Disb Wip - No Fee WIP)1. Advanced Disb2. Fees Disb3. Fees WIP4. Advanced no wip | Expected: Matters returned for "Advanced Fees - FC/DisbWip - No Fee WIP" || Step 9: Enter Long client name + Matter name (advanced fees - fc disb wip - no fee wip) | Expected: Matter is returned that meets that criteria || Step 10: Enter Client Code + Long Matter name (i3010 disb wip - no fee wip) | Expected: Matter is returned that meets that criteria || Step 11: Enter Client code + Matter name keyword (i3010 no fee) | Expected: Matters are returned for i3010 with ‘no fee’ in the Matter Name || Step 12: Enter Clientcode.matter name keyword (i3010.fee) | Expected: Matters are returned for i3010 with ‘fee’ in the Matter Name || Step 13: Enter Clientcode.mattercode (i3010.0002) | Expected: Exact Matter is returned (Advanced Fees - FC/Advanced Fees balance) || Step 14: Enter Client name keyword.Matter code (Fees.0002) | Expected: Matter is returned that meets that criteria || Step 15: In Configuration Manager, navigate to Business-Matter-SearchSeparators and change the default separator to "-" "/"Use the new seperator to retest step 12 - 14 || Step 16: *In CMS you can change child matter separator code in Hub Setup - Hub Parameters.*You can create child matters in Matter Management - Model Matters.*You have to either create a child matter using each of these separator settings, or change the separator in the database (HBM_MATTER) for one child matter and searchMatter Code that is a ChildMatter using four different Hub Setup options:a. Entering Matter Code that is SubMatter 666666.00001 b. Entering Matter Code that is SubMatter 666666:00001 c. Entering Matter Code that is SubMatter 666666-00001 d. Entering Matter Code that is SubMatter 666666/00001 | Expected: SubMatter is returned || Step 17: Enter special characters:1. 'Propriétés De Chambre D'Île'2. '10% Fees, 1% Disb Tax on Matter'3. Thompson Metal & Sons Fredericks vs R.j. Thompson (--May not be in your database--) | Expected: Matter is returned that meets that criteria || Step 18: Check that in-active client/matters are not returned || Step 19: Check that client/matters with very long names (40 characters) can be searched

Title: [Replication] Schedules should not be replicated in an EDE
Description: Schedules should not be replicated across regions in an EDE environment. If a schedule exists in one region, it should only run in the deployment for that region. If you need a schedule to run in EACH region, an appropriate package containing the schedule(s) must be imported into each region.
Steps: Step 1: On a customization workstation, create a package containing a simple schedule for region A. * Ensure the action in the schedule contains something that will identify which region the job ran from. E.g send an email where the region is listed in the email subject || Step 2: On a customization workstation, create a package containing a simple schedule for region B and assign to a different package. * Ensure the action in the schedule contains something that will identify which region the job ran from. E.g send an email where the region is listed in the email subject || Step 3: Import the first package into region A's deployment || Step 4: Import the second package into region B's deployment || Step 5: Wait for the schedule in each region to run at least once | Expected: The first schedule only runs ONCE for region A and does not run for region BThe second schedule only runs ONCE for region B and does not run for region A

Title: Setup pre-requisites for Expert Deployment using ApplicationServerPrerequisites script
Steps: Step 1: Locate the 'ApplicationServerPrerequisites' script in your expert binaries folder: /ExpertSource/ApplicationServerPrerequisites | Expected: Folder exists || Step 2: Copy ApplicationServerPrerequisites folder to C drive on server machines | Expected: These scripts need to be ran on the servers where services will be installed, to ensure servers meet "pre-reqs" of Expert Suite || Step 3: Start powershell as Administrator and run the following:1. Set-ExecutionPolicy unrestricted2. CD C:\ApplicationServerPrerequisites3. Import-module .\ExpertApplicationServer.ps14. Install-ApplicationServerPrerequisites -appFabricServiceUser 'ADERANT_AP\service.appfabric.ap' -appFabricServicePassword 'Oteha44' -expertServiceUser 'ADERANT_AP\service.expert.ap'(Assuming you are using the domain serviceExpert and appfabric accounts for your deployment) | Expected: Script finishes without any errors. || Step 4: Deploy Expert | Expected: Expert can be deployed after running the pre-req script without any further configurations

Title: QBE Control behaviour & user experience
Description: For technical details, refer to wiki page: http://ttwiki/wiki/index.php?title=Query_By_Example
Steps: Step 1: Test "Delete All":a) In Rates Timekeeper QBE control, Add a few timekeepersb) Press "Left Ctrl" + "Delete"c) Add a few more timekeepersd) Press "Right Ctrl" + "Delete" | Expected: i) In step b) and d) all the timekeepers we added are removed from the field ii) Items in other fields are not effected || Step 2: Test "Add new":a) Add an item by clicking on a blank spotb) Add an item by clicking on the downArrow/calendar/magnify buttonc) Add an item by pressing "Down arrow" key on your keyboard || Step 3: Test "Change existing":a) Items in the controls can be changed by clicking on a item once to select it, then click it again to bring out the dropdown menu to select another item. (Alternatively, double click on an item would also select & bring out the dropdown menu)b) after selecting an item, type in search criteria would show correct results and selecting the result items would replace the old item.c) Select an existing item and change it by pressing "Down arrow" key on your keyboard || Step 4: Test "Delete/Remove"a) Add a few timekeepers to the QBE controlb) Test with "Delete" keyc) Test with "Back space" key | Expected: The selected timekeeper is removed from the field || Step 5: Test "Insert" keya) In Rates timekeeper QBE control, add a few timekeepers b) Select the first item and press "Insert" key on your keyboardc) Select the last item and press "Insert" | Expected: In both cases, it would move the input cursor to the end of the queue || Step 6: Test "Left/Right Arrow" keya) In Rates Timekeeper QBE control, add a few timekeepers b) Within the current field, press Left and Right arrow keys | Expected: When arrow keys are pressed, the input cursor will move between the timekeepers || Step 7: Test "Right click" functionsa) Right click within QBE control.b) RIght click on an item in a dropdown list of QBE control (Searchbox, filtered box) | Expected: a) The following options are available and functional: Add / Remove / Clear Allb) The following options are available and functional: Select this item / Add or Remove from MRU / Pin this item / Create Alias (Only for Matter Search) || Step 8: Test "Tab" keya) In a filtered box, open the dropdown menu then select an item and press "Tab"b) In search box, type in a search criteria and press tab. This will have 2 outcomesc) "Tab" or "Shift + Tab" key moves the input focus item to the left or right. Unlike Left/Right Arrow keys, "Tab" will move out of the control or to the next/previous control when you get to the first or last item. | Expected: a) This would select and resolve that item then create a new item and move the input cursor to that location.b) (i) If the criteria has an exact match in DB, the matched item will be resolved: (Type in timekeeper searchbox for 851 then press tab, this will return Egger, Ron)  (ii) If there are no match in DB for the search criteria, the input would still be resolved but will be highlighted in red, informing user that the input is invalid.c) "Tab" behaves the same as Right arrow key and  "shift + tab" behaves the same as Left arrow key with a control.Input focus will move out or to the next avaliable or to the previous control after it reaches to the last/first item.

Title: Approval Activity - set "Allow Proxy" options
Steps: Step 1: Create or open an existing workflow solution (i.e. FileOpening) || Step 2: Add or use an existing "Approval Task" activity and look for "Allow Proxy" in properties pane | Expected: "Allow proxy" exists with 3 options to choose:-Yes (Default)-No-Save Only || Step 3: Allow proxy - YESThis option means that Proxy users have full rights to the specified task. i.e. View/Save/Complete | Expected: Check that when you proxy to another user, you can View/Save/Complete the task under test. || Step 4: Allow proxy - NOThis option means that Proxy users have NO rights to the specified task. i.e. View/Save/Complete | Expected: Check that when you proxy to another user, you CANNOT see the task under test nor perform any actions to it (If somehow you can see it). || Step 5: Allow proxy - Save OnlyThis option means that Proxy users have the rights to view the specified task but have no rights to complete it. | Expected: Check that when you proxy to another user, you can see the task under test, fill in fields, save changes but NOT able to complete the task.

Title: Smartform Task Activity - set "Allow Proxy" options
Steps: Step 1: Create or open an existing workflow solution (i.e. FileOpening) || Step 2: Add or use an existing "Smartform Task" activity and look for "Allow Proxy" in properties pane | Expected: "Allow proxy" exists with 3 options to choose:-Yes (Default)-No-Save Only || Step 3: Allow proxy - YESThis option means that Proxy users have full rights to the specified task. i.e. View/Save/Complete | Expected: Check that when you proxy to another user, you can View/Save/Complete the task under test. || Step 4: Allow proxy - NOThis option means that Proxy users have NO rights to the specified task. i.e. View/Save/Complete | Expected: Check that when you proxy to another user, you CANNOT see the task under test nor perform any actions to it (If somehow you can see it). || Step 5: Allow proxy - Save OnlyThis option means that Proxy users have the rights to view the specified task but have no rights to complete it. | Expected: Check that when you proxy to another user, you can see the task under test, fill in fields, save changes but NOT able to complete the task.

Title: Email notification can contain OnTheGo web link
Description:
Our current workflow task notification email automatically includes an attachment that when clicked on opens the task within EA.  This is great if you are on your PC, but useless everywhere else.  There is a story to support making your decision directly from email (55406), but we obviously also should make the OTG workflow option available if it is deployed/configured.
 
Simply implemented - we should look at the task:  If the firm have OTG installed and configured , and the task is flagged as OTG accessible - then - automatically append a link to the email that will take you directly to that OTG task and provide ability to make your selection.  This should be tested on PC, tablet and phone devices.
 
If it is possible to incorporate into the standard template an optional section for including the OTG reference this would be ideal as it would allow people to decide where and how they want the link presented.
Steps: Step 1: Create or use an existing workflow solution, add an Approval task and check "Web enabled" in properties pane || Step 2: Start Expert Assistant, go to settings and check "New task email reminder" || Step 3: Start the workflow and open the reminder email | Expected: You should recieve an email reminder for the Approval task1. The email should contain a link to OTG2. Click on the link, it should open default browser and load the Approval task in OTG3. The approval task can be completed without error || Step 4: Check batched emails, go to Approval task properties, check "Batch Email Alerts" | Expected: You should recieve a batched email reminder for the Approval tasks you have1. The email should contain a link to OTG for the FIRST task2. Click on the link, it should open default browser and load the Approval task in OTG3. The approval task can be completed without error

Title: Task actions via Ribbon bar in task window for standard smartform tasks
Steps: Step 1: Open a standard smartform task from Expert Assistant task inbox || Step 2: Accept button, check the following:a) Task has multiple performers (multiple users or group)b) Task has only 1 performerc) Check task ownership in SQL: select workflowname,displayname,CANDIDATES,PARTICIPANTS,OWNERID,PERFORMERID from WFM_TASK orderby LAST_MODIFIED descd) Check userID in SQL: select EMPL_UNO,EMPLOYEE_CODE,EMPLOYEE_NAME,USERID from HBM_PERSNL where USERID= (select TOP 1 OWNERID from WFM_TASK orderby LAST_MODIFIED desc)e) Not applicable to shared tasks | Expected: a) Accept button is ONLY visible when the task you opened was not yet accepted.b) Accept button is not visible when task is already acceptedc) Accepting the task would change the owner of the task to the current userd) Accepting a multi performer task will remove the task from other performs' task inboxe) Accepting a multi performer task will notify other users if they also have the same task openedf) Accepted tasks should have appropriate icons (Task icon with a yellow start)g) Task inbox is updated || Step 3: Unaccept button, check the following:a) Task has multiple performers (multiple users or group)b) Task has only 1 performerc) Check task ownership in SQL: select workflowname,displayname,CANDIDATES,PARTICIPANTS,OWNERID,PERFORMERID from WFM_TASK orderby LAST_MODIFIED descd) Check userID in SQL: select EMPL_UNO,EMPLOYEE_CODE,EMPLOYEE_NAME,USERID from HBM_PERSNL where USERID= (select TOP 1 OWNERID from WFM_TASK orderby LAST_MODIFIED desc)e) Not applicable to shared tasks | Expected: a) Unaccept button is ONLY visible when the task was already acceptedb) Unaccept button is not visible when task is not yet acceptedc) Unaccepting the task would change the owner of the task to NULLd) If the unaccepted task have multiple performers, it will then showup in other performers' task inboxe) Unaccepted tasks have no iconsf) Task inbox is updated || Step 4: Complete button:a) Task has 1 performerb) Task is shared | Expected: a) Completed button is visibled when the task is acceptedb) Complete button is enabled when the task has NO validation errors (Disabled if it has errors)c) Task window is closed after complete button is clickedd) Workflow moves on when the current task is completede) Other users are notified when a shared task is completedf) Task inbox is updated || Step 5: Complete & Next button:a) Task has 1 performerb) Task is shared | Expected: Apply all rules from "Complete button" with the following addtional rulesa) The next task of same type in your inbox is opened after the previous task is completed (i.e. Markup approval tasks)b) You should be notified when there are no further tasks of same type in your inboxc) Task inbox is updated || Step 6: Save button:a) Task has multiple performers (multiple users or group)b) Task has only 1 performerc) Task is sharedd) Task is not acceptede) Task is accepted | Expected: a) Data inputs are saved to the workflow. Check this by close and reopening the task.b) Action completes with reasonable time and appropriate feedback (Use Fiddler to capture HTTP traffic)c) Other task actions are disabled during the save processd) Other performers are notified when the task data is saved || Step 7: Save & Close button:a) Task has multiple performers (multiple users or group)b) Task has only 1 performerc) Task is sharedd) Task is not acceptede) Task is accepted | Expected: Apply all rules from "Save button" with the following addtional rules:a) Task window closes after the save action is completed || Step 8: Reassign button:a) Task has multiple performers (multiple users or group)b) Task has only 1 performerc) Task is sharedd) Task is not acceptede) Task have un-saved data | Expected: a) "Assign task" dialog opens in reasonable timeb) Users or user groups can be searched & selected c) Notes can be addedd) Task priority can be sete) The reassign process should complete in reasonable timef) Other performers are notified when task is reassignedh) The list of performer is recreated everytime you reassign i.e. If you reassign to TTQA1 and TTQA2 then reassign to TTQA3 and TTQA4. The final task performers would be TTQA3 and 4. i) User alert bar is created after assignment of who the task is assigned toj) You are prompted for any un-saved datak) Task inbox is updated || Step 9: Share button:a) Task has multiple performers (multiple users or group)b) Task has only 1 performerc) Task is sharedd) Task is not acceptede) Task have un-saved data | Expected: a) "Share task" dialog opens in reasonable timeb) Users or user groups can be searched & selected c) Notes can be addedd) Task priority can be sete) The share process should complete in reasonable timef) Other performers are notified when task is sharedh) The list of performer is appended everytime you share the task, i.e. Share to TTQA1, then share to TTQA2, then share to TTQA3. The final task performers would be Youself, TTQA1, TTQA2, and TTQA3.i) All performers of the shared task are able to view and perform actions to the taskj) User alert bar is created after assignment of who the task is shared tok) You are prompted for any un-saved datal) Task inbox is updated || Step 10: Cancel Process button:a) Task has multiple performers (multiple users or group)b) Task has only 1 performerc) Task is sharedd) Task is not accepted | Expected: a) "Cancel Workflow Processes" dialog opens in reasonable timeb) Text control for entering comments is available - Comments are shown in the summary status of the workflow process.c) Options: "Cancel Process" and "Terminate Process" are available and function as describedd) Cancel: Workflow is stopped, goes into cancellation handler, and the workflow process shows as "Cancelled" state (i.e. Fileopening would send you an email saying that workflow was cancelled)e) Terminate: Workflow is stopped and workflow record is deleted (forcibly), does not go through cancellation handler and the workflow process shows as "Terminated".f) Task inbox is updated || Step 11: Workflow Notes button:a) Task has multiple performers (multiple users or group)b) Task has only 1 performerc) Task is sharedd) Task is not accepted | Expected: a) Launches "Notes" plugin in reasonable time || Step 12: Status button:a) Task has multiple performers (multiple users or group)b) Task has only 1 performerc) Task is sharedd) Task is not accepted | Expected: a) "Status" dialog opens in reasonable timeb) Dialog shows: Started time, by who, workflow version, effective date, progress percentage and status, complete activities, active activities and more details. || Step 13: Priority button:a) Task has multiple performers (multiple users or group)b) Task has only 1 performerc) Task is sharedd) Task is not accepted | Expected: a) Priority options: Normal (default), highb) Sets the priority accordinglyc) Updates task status and icon in task inbox || Step 14: Reschedule button:a) Task has multiple performers (multiple users or group)b) Task has only 1 performerc) Task is sharedd) Task is not accepted | Expected: a) "Reschedule" dialog opens in reasonable timeb) Dialog shows: Current start date, new start date, current due date, new due date.c) Sets the specified dates appropriately d) Action completes in reasonable timee) Other performers are notified when task is rescheduledf) Task inbox is updated

Title: Standard smartform task action - Cancel workflow process
Steps: Step 1: Cancel workflow process action can be found on task ribbon | Expected: a) "Cancel Workflow Processes" dialog opens in reasonable timeb) Text control for entering comments is available - Comments are shown in the summary status of the workflow process.c) Options: "Cancel Process" and "Terminate Process" are available and function as described || Step 2: Check the following conditions:a) Task has multiple performers (multiple users or group)b) Task has only 1 performerc) Task is sharedd) Task is not accepted | Expected: a) Cancel: Workflow is stopped, goes into cancellation handler, and the workflow process shows as "Cancelled" state (i.e. Fileopening would send you an email saying that workflow was cancelled)b) Terminate: Workflow is stopped and workflow record is deleted (forcibly), does not go through cancellation handler and the workflow process shows as "Terminated".c) Task inbox is updatedd) If the current task has multiple performers, they should be notified

Title: Standard smartform task action - Open Task Notes
Steps: Step 1: Open notes action can be found in task ribbon and task inbox right click menu(2 iterations @interface) || Step 2: Check the following conditions:a) Task has multiple performers (multiple users or group)b) Task has only 1 performerc) Task is sharedd) Task is not accepted | Expected: a) Launches "Notes" plugin in reasonable time

Title: Standard smartform task action - Reschedule Task
Steps: Step 1: Reschedule action can be found in Task ribbon and task inbox right click menu(2 iterations @interface) || Step 2: Check the following conditions:a) Task has multiple performers (multiple users or group)b) Task has only 1 performerc) Task is sharedd) Task is not accepted | Expected: a) "Reschedule" dialog opens in reasonable timeb) Dialog shows: Current start date, new start date, current due date, new due date.c) Sets the specified dates appropriately d) Action completes in reasonable timee) Other performers are notified when task is rescheduledf) Task inbox is updated

Title: Standard smartform task action - Print page
Steps: Step 1: a) Print action can be found under the Expert tab on Task ribbonb) Check the printed document | Expected: a) Opens MS print dialog, select printer and page settings.b) Matches the task on display

Title: Expert Admin - Add user or group as task performer to all tasks
Steps: Step 1: The feature is for workflow development only.Check that the test user have Admin rightsNavigate to Expert Admin -> System -> Workflow Development | Expected: Expert admin page exists || Step 2: In the "add user or group to all tasks" field test with:a) One userb) Multiple usersc) User groupCreate a workflow with task security plan that does NOT include users specified in above | Expected: For all three cases, the specified users/groups should recieve tasks even when they were not assigned as task performer during workflow design. || Step 3: Remove the users/groups | Expected: Tasks are correctly sent to the specified users in the security plan.

Title: Workflow global process security
Steps: Step 1: Access workflow process security from workflow properties in Aderant tool bar when you have a workflow solution opened in Visual Studio. | Expected: Check:- Default policies are available: Task Performers, Workflow Supervisors, Workflow Administrators, Workflow Service - By default, the 'Administrators' User group is ticked with the 'Workflow Administrators' policy.This cannot be changed- By default, the 'ServerExecution' User group is ticked with the 'Workflow Service' policy. This cannot be changed || Step 2: Run workflow with default process security, as a non-admin user.Then check the following views in ExpertAssistant processes list:-My Active Processes-My Initiated Processes-Active Processes-Completed Processes-Faulted Processes-Suspended Processes-Cancelled Processes-Processes | Expected: By default, non-admin users cannot see any workflow processes in any of the process views. || Step 3: Grant "Workflow Supervisor" policy to non-admin user and user group:a) Add TTQA1 to the gridb) Add a user group that does not contain TTQA1 to the grid.(Create user group in cms/hub setup/personnel setup/personnel work groups) | Expected: Check:- Multiple Users and User group can be added to the grid- Changes to the grid are correctly saved || Step 4: Run workflow as TTQA1 and as a non-admin user in the user group. Then check the following views in ExpertAssisntant processes list:-My Active Processes-My Initiated Processes-Active Processes-Completed Processes-Faulted Processes-Suspended Processes-Cancelled Processes-Processes | Expected: Check:- My active and My initiated processes are only visable if the user is the workflow initiator.- Processes from other views are visable- You should be able to perform admin actions to the processes, such as: Cancel, terminate, reschedule, suspend. || Step 5: Run workflow as an ADMIN user Then check the following views in ExpertAssisntant processes list:-My Active Processes-My Initiated Processes-Active Processes-Completed Processes-Faulted Processes-Suspended Processes-Cancelled Processes-Processes | Expected: Check:- My active and My initiated processes are only visable if the user is the workflow initiator.- Processes from other views are visable- You should be able to perform admin actions to the processes, such as: Cancel, terminate, reschedule, suspend.

Title: Workflow global task security
Steps: Step 1: Access workflow global task security from workflow properties in Aderant tool bar when you have a workflow solution opened in Visual Studio. | Expected: Check:- Default policies are available: Task Performers, Workflow Supervisors, Workflow Administrators, Workflow Service - By default, the 'Administrators' User group is ticked with the 'Workflow Administrators' policy.This cannot be changed- By default, the 'ServerExecution' User group is ticked with the 'Workflow Service' policy. This cannot be changed || Step 2: Grant "Task Performer" policy to TTQA1 user and a user group:a) Add TTQA1 to the gridb) Add a user group that does not contain TTQA1 to the grid.(Create user group in cms/hub setup/personnel setup/personnel work groups) || Step 3: Create a smartform task, with yourself as "Task Performer" in security plan || Step 4: Locate the "Include global security" property in smartform task propertiesRun the workflow WITH and WITHOUT that property | Expected: Check that: - Global task security is only invoked when the "Include global security" property is checked- Global task secruity should add to the task security, so when global is invoked, the task performers should be TTQA1, "the user group" and yourself. || Step 5: Test with "Task performer", "Workflow Supervisor", "Workflow Admin" policies for a user and a user group.(Workflow admin policy can be configured in Security Manager - Data policy - Workflow Administrators) | Expected: Check changes in the grid are saved || Step 6: Run the workflow and check with the user/group with "Task performer" rights | Expected: a) The task is assigned to the test user or group as they are the task performers. The task performers are able to perform task actions, such as accept, reassign, save or complete.b) The users are NOT able to view the process in the "Process lists" || Step 7: Check with the user/group with "Workflow supervisor" rights | Expected: a) Users/Groups with Supervisor rights are able to view and manage tasks owned by other users under "Manage by task/user" view in Expert Assisntant, however, they CANNOT complete those tasks.b) Supervisor users are able to view and manage processes in the "Process lists" || Step 8: Check with the user/group with "Workflow admin" rights | Expected: a) Users/Groups with Administrator rights are able to view and manage tasks owned by other users under "Manage by task/user" view in Expert Assisntant, however, they CANNOT complete those tasks.b) Administrator users are able to view and manage processes in the "Process lists"

Title: Workflow smartform task security
Steps: Step 1: Access task security plan from smartform task activity and approval activity in workflow solution in Visual Studio | Expected: Check:- Security plan can be accessed from designer surface and properties pane- Default policies are available: Task Performers, Workflow Supervisors, Workflow Administrators, Workflow Service - By default, the 'Administrators' User group is ticked with the 'Workflow Administrators' policy.This cannot be changed- By default, the 'ServerExecution' User group is ticked with the 'Workflow Service' policy. This cannot be changed || Step 2: Test with "Task performer", "Workflow Supervisor", "Workflow Admin" policies for a user and a user group.(Workflow admin policy can be configured in Security Manager - Data policy - Workflow Administrators) | Expected: Check changes in the grid are saved || Step 3: Run the workflow and check with the user/group with "Task performer" rights | Expected: a) The task is assigned to the test user or group as they are the task performers. The task performers are able to perform task actions, such as accept, reassign, save or complete.b) The users are NOT able to view the process in the "Process lists" || Step 4: Check with the user/group with "Workflow supervisor" rights | Expected: a) Users/Groups with Supervisor rights are able to view and manage tasks owned by other users under "Manage by task/user" view in Expert Assisntant, however, they CANNOT complete those tasks.b) Supervisor users are able to view and manage processes in the "Process lists" || Step 5: Check with the user/group with "Workflow admin" rights | Expected: a) Users/Groups with Administrator rights are able to view and manage tasks owned by other users under "Manage by task/user" view in Expert Assisntant, however, they CANNOT complete those tasks.b) Administrator users are able to view and manage processes in the "Process lists"

Title: Open workflow status window
Steps: Step 1: Test all the areas where you could open workflow status window || Step 2: From Smartform task ribbon || Step 3: From product app task ribbon || Step 4: From EA task inbox (Right click menu) || Step 5: From product app task inbox (Right click menu) || Step 6: From Expert Assisntant process list (Right click menu) || Step 7: From Workflow admin app (Right click menu)

Title: "Add User Alert" design & run test
Steps: Step 1: Prerequisite: You need the AdvancedWorkflowLicense in order to be able to create new smartforms from the smartform task surface || Step 2: To access the "User alert" activity, open up a workflow solution then open the "Toolbox" pane | Expected: "Add User Alert" activity available under "Expert" in the toolbox || Step 3: Create an "User Alert" activity from the toolbox and check the designer surface | Expected: The following properties should be availablea) The following options are available for "Type":-Information-Warning-Error-Form-RedFlagb) "Message" field allow inputs of type string:-Double quotes, e.g. "Error" -Workflow variable of type string || Step 4: Check the properties pane of the "User Alert" activity | Expected: The following properties should be available:a) "Addtional Information" - String. further information when user copy & paste the user alertb) "Alert Type" - Type of the alert, same as in step #1c) "Message" - String. message displayed on the alert, same as in step #1d) "Source" - String, used to identify the source of the alerte) "Sub Message" - String, sub message that will be displayed after the alert message.f) "DisplayName" - String, display name of the activity on the design surfaceg) All fields should have appropriate promptsh) All string fields can be bind to a workflow variable of type string || Step 5: Add an "User Alert" activity for each alert type, then link them together followed by TWO smartform activities:-Information-Warning-Error-Form-RedFlag-Set different message strings for each type so that you can identify them easily in runtime | Expected: See attachment for example. || Step 6: Runtime test: Start the workflow and open the task. | Expected: Check:a) In task window, "user alerts" are rendered below the task ribbon.b) Shows up to 2 alerts, you can scroll to see the others.c) Different type of alerts have appropriate icons and messagesd) See attachment for example || Step 7: Hover over an alert to see tooltip | Expected: Tooltip should have appropriate icon, message and sub message || Step 8: Click on the alert icon to copy additional message | Expected: Addtional messages you set in step #3 shoud be copied to clipboard and you should be able to paste it in a note or word document || Step 9: Click on the 'x' to remove alerts-Close the task window without saving-Save the task then close task window | Expected: -If you close task without saving, the alert bar should come back the next time you open this task-If you save the close, the changes you made should be saved. || Step 10: Complete the task and move on to next task | Expected: The user alerts should be carried over to the next task, unless they were removed (and saved) previously

Title: "Query" activity design & run test
Steps: Step 1: To access the "Query" activity, open up a workflow solution then open the "Toolbox" pane | Expected: "Query" activity available under "Expert" in the toolbox || Step 2: Create an "Query" activity from the toolbox and check the designer surface | Expected: The following properties should be availablea) Source - This dropbox should show all items within the domain, including customized items (e.g. custom tables, columns)b) Where - where clause definitionc) Result - workflow variable to store the query result, ONLY accepts variables of type ViewModelObservableCollection<T>d) Check all fields have appropriate prompt and tooltip || Step 3: Check the properties pane of the "Query" activity | Expected: The following properties should be available:a) Expands - Define expand paths to pre-fetch in the result set (e.g. BusinessEntity/Addresses)b) DisplayName - Display name of the activityc) Result - Workflow variable to store the query result, ONLY accepts variables of type ViewModelObservableCollection<T>d) Check all fields have appropriate prompt and tooltip || Step 4: Scenario 1: Query all clients in London office-Select CLIENT as source-Enter where clause: item.OfficeId = "LON"-Create a variable of type ViewModelObserableCollection<Client> for result (Using the '+' button)-Create a GRID smartforma) add a contract of type ViewModelObserableCollection<Client> and set it as grid sourceb) choose DisplayName, Id and Code under Client. Leave everything else as default-Consume the smartform in the workflow, following the Query activity | Expected: (See attachment for setup example)-This should fetch all clients in London office and display their Name, Id and Code in the smartform grid.-Verify the result in SQL: select*fromHBM_CLIENTwhereOFFC='LON' || Step 5: Scenario 2: No result foundUsing the same workflow as scenario 1, change the where clause to: item.OfficeId = "LONDON" | Expected: -Query activity does not return any results-Smartform grid is not populated. -Workflow does not generate any errors and moves on.

Title: Task Replicator with basic completion criteria
Steps: Step 1: Add Task Replicator activity to a workflow and drag an approval activity as the task to be replicated. Set the Completion Type to 'Percentage Responded' | Expected: The Expected Value list has the approval options from the approval task || Step 2: Set the Completion Type to 'Percentage Complete' and and set to any percentage less than 100 Set Expected Value to any of the approval choices || Step 3: At runtime, - complete at least one of the replicated tasks with an approval choice that does NOT match the Expected Value - complete some (same number as Amount on task replicator activity) of the replicated tasks with an approval choice that DOES match the Expected Value | Expected: The workflow moves on from the task replicator once the number of users that have completed the task with an approval choice matching the Expected Value is an equal or greater perentage than the number of users that received the task. || Step 4: Add Task Replicator activity to a workflow and set the Completion Type to 'Number Complete' and set the Amount to a number that is SMALLER than the number of task performers in your security plan | Expected: At runtime, the workflow moves on from the task replicator once the number of users that have completed the task equals the Amount set on the activity || Step 5: Add Task Replicator activity to a workflow ans set the Completion Type to 'Number Complete' and set the Amount to a number that is GREATER than the number of task performers in your security plan | Expected: At runtime, the workflow moves on from the task replicator once all users that were assigned a replicated task have completed it. || Step 6: Add Task Replicator activity to a workflow and drag an approval activity as the task to be replicated. Set the Completion Type to 'Number Responded' | Expected: The Expected Value list has the approval options from the approval task || Step 7: Set the Completion Type to 'Number Responded' and - set the Amount to a number that is SMALLER than the number of task performers in your security plan - set the expected value to one of your approval choices || Step 8: At runtime, - complete at least one of the replicated tasks with an approval choice that does NOT match the Expected Value - complete some (same number as Amount on task replicator activity) of the replicated tasks with an approval choice that DOES match the Expected Value | Expected: The workflow moves on from the task replicator once the number of users that have completed the task with an approval choice matching the Expected Value equals the Amount set on the activity || Step 9: Kick off another workflow instance, - complete at least one of the replicated tasks with an approval choice that matches the Expected Value - complete the other remaining replicated tasks with an approval choice that does NOT match the Expected Value | Expected: At runtime, the workflow moves on from the task replicator once all users that were assigned a replicated task have completed it. || Step 10: Add Task Replicator activity to a workflow and set the Completion Type to 'Percentage Complete' and set to any percentage less than 100 | Expected: At runtime, the workflow moves on from the task replicator once the number of users that have completed the task is an equal or greater perentage than the number of users that received the task.

Title: Task Replicator with advanced completion criteria
Task Replicator design surface and properties
Steps: Step 1: Access Task Replicator activity from Visual Studio toolbox, under "Expert" and add it to the design surface | Expected: Task Replicator activity can be found in toolbox and can be added to the workflow design surface || Step 2: Check the properties on the design surface:-Completion Type-Amount-Expected Value-Security Plan-Emply space for task activity | Expected: -Completion Type, 4 options:a) Percentage completeb) Percentage complete with valuec) Number completed) Number complete with value-Amount - Only accept values of type decimal-Expected Value - Shows the approval options of the replicated task,

Title: Apply customizations with an encrypted stored procedure in the database
Description: This was a client raised issue that when Expert database have an encrypted SP, the apply customization process will fail.
Steps: Step 1: Create an encrypted sp in your Expert database:CREATE PROCEDURE TestEncryptSPWITH ENCRYPTIONASSELECT TOP 10 *FROM HBM_PERSNLGO || Step 2: Identify the Non-Expert SP by the following SQLselectOBJECT_NAME(m.object_id)asobject_name,definition from sys.sql_modules m innerjoinsys.objectsoonm.object_id=o.object_idinner join sys.schemas s ons.schema_id=o.schema_idands.name<>'ExpertQuery'where (objectproperty(m.object_id, 'IsView') = 1 or objectproperty(m.object_id, 'IsProcedure') = 1) and (OBJECT_NAME(m.object_id)isNULLordefinitionisnull)orderbyobject_name | Expected: This query should return the SP you created in #1 and has definition of NULL || Step 3: Start deployment manager, go to Package tab and click on Apply customization | Expected: The process should complete without any errors

Title: Development Workflow with running instances are reinstated to IIS during Expert Deployment
Steps: Step 1: This feature was implemented in 80SP2HF1 release.You will need a DEV envrionment (Customization Workstation) to test this.A new column PHYSICALPATH was added to WFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARY table, the data stored in this new column is ONLY used by DEV workflows. || Step 2: a. In the DEV envrionment, create a workflow project under a directory that has special charaters and spaces (e.g. C:\Exp3r+! Dev W@rkFlow5\)b. Add a SmartForm task activity to the workflowc. Run the workflow, recieve the task and then check the column PHYSICALPATH in WFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARY table in Expert Database | Expected: Physical path to the "workflow.xamlx" file is set correctly || Step 3: Also setup the following scenarios:a. Dev workflow that have an IIS instance: i. Does not have any workflow/task records in Expert Database (e.g. the workflow was not started) ii. Have workflow records, but have an INVALID or null PHYSICALPATH in the WFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARY table (e.g. the workflow files are moved or deleted)b. Published workflow: i. Does not have any workflow/task records ii. Have task records and PHYSICALPATH iii. Have task records and INVALID or NULL PHYSICALPATH || Step 4: Redeploy the environment, then go to IIS manager and check under Sites\Default Web Site\Expert_Local\Development | Expected: a. Dev workflows are reinstated only if they have task records AND the PHYSICALPATH is valid.b. Published workflows should be reinstated in ALL scenarios || Step 5: Start EA and try to open the tasks that we setup in the previous steps. | Expected: All tasks that had a VALID PHYSICALPATH should be accessable

Title: Pending actions should lock the task window
Steps: Step 1: When you perform an action within a task, the contents within the task window should be locked until the action is completed | Expected: Fields within the task should be disabled when the task is in locked state || Step 2: Open a smartform task in EA and test with the following actions:(Perform the tests in a non-local environment, ideally with some latency.)a) Save/Save & Closeb) Assign/Sharec) Accept/Un-Acceptd) Cancel Processe) Reschedule | Expected: When you perform these actions, the task window should be locked until the actions have been completed. When the task window is being locked, you cannot make any changes to the task, e.g. change a value in a field or try to click on another action.

Title: (Sanity Test) Design Studio
Description:
Domain Model Explorer
 

 
Group Name

 
 
 
Reports Group Menu
Steps: Step 1: Open Design Studio from your ExpertShare | Expected: Design studio opens, by default the Navigation pane is shown. You will need the security rights to run the app (see Security Manager, Modules/DesignStudio/DesignStudioApplication)If you don't have security rights, the app should not open and you should get an appropriate error message. || Step 2: Click Domain Model Explorer in Ribbon bar | Expected: A new webpage should be similar to the screenshot in the summary of this test case Close the web browser. || Step 3: Go back to Design Studio andDouble-click Expert Billing in the Navigation tree | Expected: Expert Billing Tree node is expanded and shows Forms, Jobs, Menus, Rules and Workflows || Step 4: Go to Menus | Reports Menu || Step 5: Create 2 new Menu items EG. Name: First Custom Report, Code: Report 1Report group: Custom report group(click on the menu header area to get the menu Item properties) Activity:  Log, Log level : Fatal, Message: "First Custom report" | Expected: Setting page will be similar to the screenshot in the summary of this test case || Step 6: Go to Expert Share and Open BillingNOTE: we need to deploy SSRS in order to see Report menu on ribbon bar || Step 7: Update report URL to point to invalid server. Open Report | Expected: An error should display showing the URL is invalid. App should not crash || Step 8: Update report URL to point to valid server . Open Report | Expected: Report is opened with no issues || Step 9: Open Reports menu in ribbon bar | Expected: New group should show up the ribbon bar with reports showing inside group. || Step 10: Go back to Design studio and remove Reports from report menu | Expected: Reports can be deleted || Step 11: Double-click Expert Assistant in the Navigation tree in design studio | Expected: Expert Assistant Tree node is expanded and shows Jobs and Menus || Step 12: Under menus, right-click Actions Menu, Add Menu Item and Create New | Expected: New Menu Item opens in new Tab, activity is required - you can't save at this stage || Step 13: Click Parameters in the Ribbon and add a new Parameter - Input / String / default "Smoke" | Expected: New Parameter is created and visible in the Data Tab || Step 14: Change the activity to Log and specify in the Properties Tab - Log level: Fatal - Message: your created Parameter. Give the Menu Item a Name. Click Save and Run | Expected: You are prompted for the created parameter and you can change "Smoke" to "Smoke Test"the screen shows a log window with the Fatal message "Smoke Test" || Step 15: Click on Properties in ribbon bar to hide/show Properties pane in right panel || Step 16: Open Expert Assistant and go to the Action menu | Expected: The created Menu Item is shown in EA under Actions || Step 17: Click the action and check Event viewer on the server, or the Logging if you're on a Post-82 environment | Expected: The Fatal message "Smoke"/"smoke Test"(if you changed it in step 11) is shown in the EventViewer on the client machine || Step 18: In Design studio right click the menu item and select Revert Menu Item | Expected: You have the choises to disable or delete the Item || Step 19: Choose Disable Menu Item | Expected: Menu Item changes to inactive Firm item, i.e. Is Active = unticked || Step 20: Reopen EA | Expected: The item is not visible any more except possibly as a Recently Used item || Step 21: In Design studio right click the menu item and select Disable / Revert Menu Item - this time choose delete Item | Expected: The Menu Item is successfully deleted || Step 22: In Design studio> Expert Assistant > Actions Menu> Double click "Open New File (Quick Start)" | Expected: The description of Open New File will open || Step 23: Click "Yes" (next to "Is Active: ") on opened menu item header | Expected: "Yes" will become "No" || Step 24: Reopen EA | Expected: The item is not visible anymore except possibly as a Recently Used Item || Step 25: Revert these changes by going back to Design Studio and clicking "No" for Open New File (Quick Start) , and verify that the action can be done in EA once more | Expected: File opening can be seen and run once more after activating it again. || Step 26: In Design Studio, open the default package under Expert System | Expected: The package can successfully be opened || Step 27: In Design Studio, Select system package  and export package | Expected: Packaged is exported successfully || Step 28: Check Navigation pane | Expected: All available Expert products should be available in Navigation pane || Step 29: Navigate to ExpertAssistant tree from the Navigation pane. | Expected: Navigation tree can be expanded and shows all available menus || Step 30: Create a new Job from the Home ribbon bar, in the new tab fill in the fields:Product: ExpertAssistantName: SMOKETESTJOBCode: SMOKEDescription: This is a new job for Smoke TestsScope: FirmIsActive: Ye | Expected: Job creation tab should appear with ability to fill in details about the job, and select/order activities to execute. || Step 31: Add a Query Activity:From: EmployeeWhere: Item.Code = "YOUR EMPLOYEE CODE (Find this in HBM_PERSNL)"Item.PrivilegeLevel = "0"Result:Create new variable with the name "QueryResult" | Expected: Check in DataVariables from ribbon bar that the new variable has been created || Step 32: n the left hand side, add a new line using '+ Add Line' button to add an Email Activity below and save the job:To:  QueryResult.EmailSubject: "Smoke Test"Body: AnythingConditional - When: QueryResult != Null | Expected: Job is saved to the system and can be accessed in the Navigation tree under Expert Assistant/Jobs || Step 33: Create Schedule for the Job you created:Navigate to ExpertAssistant/Jobs, right click on the job and select "Add Schedule" And/Or Open Schedule manager from ribbon bar | Expected: Check that the schedule is create in ScheduleManager. The job should run when you schedule it and send you an email. It may be sent to your junk folder. || Step 34: Create new package , Attach SmartForms with user/group-level variants to the package, then save it , Export package | Expected: Exported SmartForms Contains User/Group Variants

Title: File Selector control - Create & Consume
Steps: Step 1: To create a smartform using <File Selecter> control: Add a contract of type <GUID> then select the control type to <File Selecter> | Expected: File select control is available in the dropdown list. Common properties like label names, expressions etc. are available. || Step 2: Fill in the common properties like:1. Lablel name2. Lable Alignment3. Prompt4. Tool tip5. Expressions || Step 3: In a workflow project, create a variable of type GUID and add the smartform to a smartform activity using the GUID contract. || Step 4: Open the smartform task in EA and test that the control behaves as expected:1. Check the control render with the specified properties2. Pick an attachment3. Enter a note4. Delete the attachment | Expected: 1. The control should render correctly2. You should be able pick a file as attachment. If you are using a local file, e.g. C:\Temp\test.txt. The file should be added as an attachment3. If you are using a file in a shared folder, e.g. \\VMITEGG\Temp\test.txt. You should get an option to either add as attachment or add a link to the file. a. The link option saves the full path to the file, e.g. \\VMITEGG.ap.aderant.com\Temp\Test.txt4. You should be able to enter a note, this note should be appended to the existing conversation of the workflow.5. You should be able to delete the note and the attachment/link by using the "Cross" icon.6. The Attachment is saved in Database, FWM_NOTE table along with the note.7.  The row of the added comment should have the filename under ARTIFACTNAME column8. The row of the added comment should have the actual file as hex value under ARTIFACTDATA column - We also need to test viewing/retrieving the attachment file || Step 5: Open the smartform task in OTG workflow and test that the control behaves as expected:1. Check the control render with the specified properties2. View attachment/link3. View notes | Expected: 1. The control should render correctly2. In OTG workflow, you are only allowed to view existing attachments and notes BUT you cannot add or modify them.

Title: Push config changes as notifications to running client applications
Steps: Step 1: Test that configuration changes are pushed to client applications.You will need an environment that is not a Customization Workstation || Step 2: 1. Start EA, go to settings - task inbox page. 2. Start Workflow Admin app, go to System - Workflow options and change the options around notifications | Expected: You should see the changes you made in Workflow Admin app pushed to your EA settings.e.g. if you enabled new task notification, you should see in EA that option is checked. || Step 3: Test that the push mechanism also works in Configuration Manager:Start configuration manager and go to Technical - Framework - Workflow - NotifyOnAssignmentEmail.Change the value of that config and check in EA | Expected: You should see the changes you made are pushed to your EA settings.e.g. if you enabled new task notification, you should see in EA that option is checked. || Step 4: Test the push mechanism when importing a package:Export the configure changes as a package and import them to your system the check EA | Expected: You should see the changes you made are pushed to your EA settings.e.g. if you enabled new task notification, you should see in EA that option is checked.

Title: Design Studio - Upgrade Test from 8.0.2 Environment
Steps: Step 1: Deploy 8.0.2 Environment || Step 2: Under Expenses, change a System Rule EXP001 to be a Firm Rule | Expected: EXP001 is displayed as Firm Rule || Step 3: Create a new Rule "Upgrade Test" and assign it to another package than the Firm Package, set activity to Log and use as Log Message a parameter with default "Upgrade" | Expected: Rule is created || Step 4: Create a Job with activity send EMail and set the To adress to your email adress | Expected: Job is created || Step 5: Create Schedules for this job | Expected: Schedules are created || Step 6: In Admin app go to the Expenses Rules and edit Rule EXP001, set Expense Type Id to AIRB and budget to 500 | Expected: EXP001 is changed || Step 7: Set for Rule EXP003 Expense Type Id to AIR and change both amounts to 500 | Expected: EXP003 is changed || Step 8: Set the parameter from Rule "Upgrade Test" to "Admin app" | Expected: Rule "Upgrade Test" is changed || Step 9: Add a EA Action with Notification activity | Expected: Run it in EA and it displays the notification || Step 10: Post Upgrade:Open Design Studio and Admin App | Expected: Opens without crash || Step 11: Go to EXP001 in both apps | Expected: EXP001 is a Firm Rule with System and Firm versions, the values in Admin app are AIRB and 500 || Step 12: Go to EXP003 in both apps | Expected: Firm Rule with values in Admin app are AIR and both amounts 500 || Step 13: Go to Rule Upgrade Test in both apps | Expected: Firm Rule with parameter default value "upgrade" and admin app value "Admin app" || Step 14: Go to the Job you created | Expected: Job Parameters are upgraded to the new parameter design and schedules are still there || Step 15: Go to the EA actions | Expected: Your action is there and works when running in EA

Title: Design Studio - Rules Overview
Steps: Step 1: Open Design Studio and go to Expenses | Expected: Expenses has a Rules point with Per Diem, Receipt and Report Rules || Step 2: Double click on Receipt Rules | Expected: Rules point opens in Tab displaying all Rules on this point, the point details and contract || Step 3: Press New Rule button from Ribbon | Expected: New Rule opens in Tab, Name is set to New Rule and blue hyperlinked, By default a Return activity with Severity Error is added || Step 4: Click the Name | Expected: Window opens and you can change Name, Description, Effective Date and Package, clicking save changes the values int he Rule header || Step 5: Click in the header | Expected: Properties Pane shows Rule properties || Step 6: Click the in the activity | Expected: Properties change to Return activity Properties || Step 7: Click Add line once via Ribbon once inside the Rule | Expected: 2 lines are added || Step 8: Click Delete Line via ribbon and via selecting line and using delete keyboard button | Expected: 2 lines are deleted || Step 9: Give a Return message in the remaining line | Expected: Error message disappears || Step 10: Click Cancel and Close | Expected: Confirmation asks for saving, select Yes - Rule Tab is closed but Rule is shown in the left under Receipt Rules || Step 11: Double Click New Rule in the Navigation Tree | Expected: Rule is opened in new Tab || Step 12: Click Save and Close | Expected: Rule is closed || Step 13: Double Click New Rule from Receipt Rule Tab | Expected: Rule is opened in new Tab || Step 14: Click Disable / Revert in Ribbon, chose Disable | Expected: Rule is set to inactive ( Tree changes display to inactive) || Step 15: Click Disable / Revert in Ribbon, chose Delete | Expected: Rule is deleted and not shown in navigation tree nor in the Receipt Rules Tab

Title: Interval schedules
Steps: Step 1: Add Job Activity = EmailTo = "[your email address]"Subject = "Test Schedules"Body = [ExecutionEnvironment.Schedule.Name] | Expected: Save and Run - Test schedule email received || Step 2: Create ScheduleOccurrence = dailyFrequency = occurs every 5 minutesStart / End = Now - half an hour later | Expected: Schedule runs every 5 minutes form now and ends 30 min later next run time day later same start time || Step 3: Create ScheduleOccurrence = dailyFrequency = occurs every 1 hourStart / End = Now - 3 hour later | Expected: Schedule runs every 1 hour form now and ends 3 hours later next run time day later same start time

Title: TBD - 8021 interval schedules
[Pre 80SP3] Design Studio - Export / Import Rules
Description: Rules and all their parameters, variables, csv data should be able to be exported and moved to a new environment
Steps: Step 1: In Design Studio create a Rule that uses a Parameter, assign this Rule a new Package | Expected: Rule is created || Step 2: Create a Rule using a CSV Data Source (Assign same package as before) | Expected: Rule is created || Step 3: Create a Rule using Local Variables (Assign same package as before) | Expected: Rule is created || Step 4: Change a System Rule from Expenses to be a Firm Rule (Assign same package as before) | Expected: System Rule canges to Firm Rule || Step 5: Export the package via Design Studio | Expected: Export successful || Step 6: Import Package into new Environment | Expected: The 3 Rules are created and the system Rule becomes a Firm Rule with the changes made

Title: [Pre 80SP3] Design Studio - Export / Import Jobs and Schedules
Description:
Make sure Jobs and their schedules are exported and imported correctly
 
8021 changes:
 
Jobs are not split in job and action any more
schedules can be scheduled down to 5 minutes intervals
Steps: Step 1: In Design Studio create a Job with an action using Parameters on Job and Rule LevelPost 8021: Job and action are one itemAssign Job and Rule, both to a new Package | Expected: Job is created with Parameters || Step 2: Create schedules ( one time, daily, weekly, monthly)Post 8021: Create a schedule for a 5 minute interval | Expected: Schedules are created and are also visible in Schedule Manager || Step 3: Export the Package with Job Rule and schedules | Expected: Export is successful || Step 4: Import the package into a new Environment | Expected: Job (and action) are created and parameters are imported tooThe schedules are shown EXCEPT the One time schedule / Schedules are inactive

Title: [Pre 80SP3] Design Studio - Export / Import Menu Items
Description: Make sure you can export and import Menu Items from one environment to another
Steps: Step 1: In Design Studio create a new Menu Item (Action) for Expert Assistant - Actions MenuFill in all fields and assign the Action to a new Package | Expected: Action is created and is shown in EA (restart EA) || Step 2: Export the Action via Design Studio | Expected: Export is successful || Step 3: Import the Package you just exported into a new Environment | Expected: Action is created for EA and has all the values given

Title: NEW deployment - Install Release, Customise HBM_NAME, update Person AND Organisation model
Description:
SCENARIO INVOLVES ADDING CUSTOM FIELDS TO HBM_NAME. SOME OF WHICH ARE TO EXTEND PERSON, SOME EXTEND ORGANISATION. 
THIS MAY OR MAY NOT BE AN POSSIBLE OR MAY CAUSE ISSUES - MAY HAVE TO BE RELEASED AS A KNOWN ISSUE WITH THIS PATCH
Steps: Step 1: Install release (and patches) [e.g.802 ] || Step 2: Use DBEDITOR to two custom columns to HBM_NAME e.g. _MENTOR, type String, allows nulls _ TWITTER, type String, allows nulls || Step 3: From the ExpertShare folder, launch Domain Wizard and run through with the following:(a) Step 1: Select 'Extend existing entity...'(b) Step 2: Table to Include: HBM_NAME, Custom column: _MENTOR(c) Step 3: Select domain: Person(d) Repeat wizard. Title: NEW deployment - Install 802, Customize HBM_NAME, update Person model only
Description:
PRIMARY SCENARIO FOR PATCH 2388
****
Testing that if you add a custom field to HBM_NAME that is only intended for business entities that are of type PERSON and NOT Organisation, the Organisation model should be unaffected. Only the model and SQL (insert and update SPs, views) for PERSON should be updated by the customization.
Steps: Step 1: Install 802 release (and patches) || Step 2: Use DBEDITOR to add a custom column to HBM_NAME (e.g. _MENTOR, type String, allows nulls) || Step 3: From the ExpertShare folder, launch Domain Wizard and run through with the following: (a) Step 1: Select 'Extend existing entity...' (b) Step 2: Table to Include: HBM_NAME, Custom column: _MENTOR (c) Step 3: Select domain: Person (d) Finish wizard || Step 4: Launch Deployment Manager and Apply CustomizationsSelect Yes when prompted to Apply Customizations || Step 5: Use SmartForm Wizard to update the FileOpening.Administrative SmartForm and FileOpening.MatterParties SmartForm to include the new field for a person || Step 6: In File Opening, add a new Client (e.g. via File Opening) that is a PERSON | Expected: No errors, custom field populated on HBM_NAME || Step 7: In File Opening, add a new client that is an ORGANISATION | Expected: There is also no errors (this FAILED with this BUG), custom field NOT populated on HBM_NAME || Step 8: In File Opening, add a new matter party (e.g. via File Opening) that is a PERSON | Expected: No errors, custom field populated on HBM_NAME || Step 9: In File Opening, add a new matter party that is an ORGANISATION | Expected: There is also no errors (this FAILED with this BUG), custom field NOT populated on HBM_NAME || Step 10: In File Opening, edit an existing Client (e.g. via File Opening) that is a PERSON | Expected: No errors, custom field populated on HBM_NAME || Step 11: In File Opening, edit an existing client that is an ORGANISATION | Expected: There is also no errors (this FAILED with this BUG), custom field NOT populated on HBM_NAME || Step 12: In File Opening, edit an existing matter party (e.g. via File Opening) that is a PERSON | Expected: No errors, custom field populated on HBM_NAME || Step 13: In File Opening, edit an existing matter party that is an ORGANISATION | Expected: There is also no errors (this FAILED with this BUG), custom field NOT populated on HBM_NAME
