Title: (Smoke Test) Design Studio V2
Description:
Questions to ask yourself when running a smoke test:
1. Can I open the application?
2. Can I create a new item (Action, Job, Rule, Schedule)?
3. Can I edit an item (Create firm from system, edit existing)?
4. Can I create parameters and variables?
5. Can I test run an action?
6. Can I export items (Action, Job, Rule, Schedule)?
7. Can I delete an item?
8. Can I resize, relocate the different panels within the application?
 
 
Following are the types of Action outcomes available:
1. Assign
2. Email
3. Form
4. Message Dialog
5. Notification
6. Open Url, Program or File
7. Query
8. Report
9. Run/Schedule Action
10. Script
11. Workflow
Steps: Step 1: Open 'Design Studio' from Expertshare. | Expected: You will need the security rights to run the app (see Security Manager, Modules/DesignStudio/DesignStudioApplication)If you don't have security rights, the app should not open and you should get an appropriate error message. || Step 2: The Navigation pane can be selected from the Ribbon | Expected: Pre 8.1: Use the drop down to show / hide the panePost 8.1: Use the panel section to tick untick the pane || Step 3: Check Navigation pane | Expected: All available Expert products should be available in Navigation pane || Step 4: Navigate to ExpertAssistant tree from the Navigation pane. | Expected: Navigation tree can be expanded and shows all available menus || Step 5: Create a new Job from the Home ribbon bar, in the new tab fill in the fields:Product: ExpertAssistantName: SMOKETESTJOBCode: SMOKEDescription: This is a new job for Smoke TestsScope: FirmIsActive: Yes | Expected: Job creation tab should appear with ability to fill in details about the job, and select/order activities to execute. || Step 6: Add a Query Activity:From: EmployeeWhere: Item.Code = "YOUR EMPLOYEE CODE (Find this in HBM_PERSNL)"Item.PrivilegeLevel = "0"Result:Create new variable with the name "QueryResult" | Expected: Check in DataVariables from ribbon bar that the new variable has been created || Step 7: On the left hand side, add a new line using '+ Add Line' button to add an Email ActivityTo:  - Pre 82SP1: [QueryResult.Email] - 82SP1: QueryResult.EmailSubject: "Smoke Test"Body: AnythingConditional - When: QueryResult != Null || Step 8: Save the Job | Expected: Job is saved to the system and can be accessed in the Navigation tree under Expert Assistant/Jobs || Step 9: Create Schedule for the Job you created:Navigate to ExpertAssistant/Jobs, right click on the job and select "Add Schedule" And/Or Open Schedule manager from ribbon bar | Expected: Check that the schedule is create in ScheduleManager. The job should run when you schedule it and send you an email. It may be sent to your junk folder. || Step 10: Remove the job from  Expert assistant Jobs | Expected: Job can be removed || Step 11: Edit an item:1. ExpertAssistant/Menus/Actions Menu/AddNewEmployee2. ExpertExpenses/Jobs/EXP200 Reports scheduled for payment | Expected: a. Items are opened in "ReadOnly" mode, you need to click on the 'Click to Edit' bar to enable edittingb. When you open a System level item, you will be asked to create a Firm one first before editting. || Step 12: Delete items | Expected: You can only delete Firm level itemsVerify that the item has been deleted from the system || Step 13: Before 82SP2- Ribbon buttons exist on the Home tab: Import Package, New Package, Smartform WizardAfter 82SP2- Ribbon buttons exist on the Home tab: Import Package, New Package || Step 14: 1. Edit or create new rule for Matter Details form for Entity Manager2. Select an Sql query event.3. Create a query that involves the [Matter.Id] variable for example, or other DB queries | Expected: Matter.ID DB value is displayed correctly with no error

Title: TBD DS in Dev mode
Design Studio - Admin app & Rules
Steps: Step 1: Open Expert Administration | Expected: App opens and you have Expenses in the tree of available Products || Step 2: Go to Expenses - Customization Parameters | Expected: there are sections for validation rules and value rules, validation rules consists of Per Diem, Receipt and Report Rules; Value Rules of Approval Tasl Grouping and Narrative Expression Rules || Step 3: Go to Receipt Rules and tick Show System and Show Inactive | Expected: opening Receipt Rules shows only active Firm Rules, after ticking show system you see active firm or system rules, ticking show inactive shows all rules. || Step 4: Sort the list by Rule Name | Expected: Rule EXP001 is on top ( if you don't have a custom Rule before) || Step 5: Select EXP001 | Expected: The buttons in the top become available || Step 6: click Edit | Expected: New Window opens, you can't change name or description, active and parameters are editable || Step 7: set it to active and change one of the parameters | Expected: rule is changedPost 8021: the system rule becomes a Firm version || Step 8: Click Copy while EXP001 is selected | Expected: You see a new Window with all the changed properties from EXP001 and the name has a suffix [COPY], save rule creates the copy || Step 9: Select the EXP001 Copy and click Disable/Revert, select Disable | Expected: You have the options Disable or Delete, disable sets it inactive || Step 10: Select the EXP001 Copy and click Disable/Revert, select Delete | Expected: EXP001 Copy is deleted || Step 11: Select Copy From, you get the same functionality as before clicking Copy - copy a rule and save | Expected: Copied rule is created || Step 12: select copied rule and click advanced Edit | Expected: Rule is openend in a Tab in Design Studio

Title: UI testing
Base Test: Database Connection Validation
Steps: Step 1: On a @enviornment , start the health-check app and check the current running enviornment. | Expected: Ideally to be all green on each check option. || Step 2: Disconnected the database server. | Expected: Same as step1 || Step 3: DIsconnected the database server. | Expected: Same as step1 || Step 4: Stop the database server. | Expected: Every row related to database should be Red. || Step 5: Start the database server. | Expected: Every row related to database should be Green. || Step 6: Stop the SQL Server Agent. | Expected: Should be a warning message || Step 7: Restart the SQL Server Agent. | Expected: Every row related to database should be Green. || Step 8: Rename the one of the database from Expert, Monitoring and Workflow. | Expected: Correspond row should be red. || Step 9: Change the database name back to the pervious one. | Expected: Every row related to database should be Green. || Step 10: Go to Powellshell, run the command de stop to stop all the services which communicate with the database. || Step 11: Bring Expert database Offline. | Expected: Expert database indicator turns red. || Step 12: Bring Expert database Online. Take Monitoring database Office. | Expected: Monitoring database indicator turns red. || Step 13: Bring Monitoring database Onine. Take Workflow database Offline. | Expected: Workflow database indicator turns red. || Step 14: Bring Workflow database Online. | Expected: Every row related to database should be Green. || Step 15: Take Offline of any combination of the 3 databases. | Expected: Correspond row should be red. || Step 16: Bring everything on line. | Expected: Every row related to database should be Green. || Step 17: Go to Powellshell, run the command de start to start all the services which communicate with the database.

Title: ExpertShareValidation
Steps: Step 1: Start the app and check @environment @LoginAccount the current ExpertShare health status. | Expected: Ideally to be green. || Step 2: Rename the ExpertShare to ExpertShare1234 in order to make the folder out of path. | Expected: The health monitoring app should return an error in ExpertShare Validator. The patch of the folder should be not found. and services should be not found as well. || Step 3: Change the folder name back to ExpertShare | Expected: The ExpertShare Validator should return Green. || Step 4: Right click on the folder and then Properties, security, select the Admininstrator, deny the write permission. | Expected: The service.expert.ap is not authorized to write to C:\ExpertShare || Step 5: Right click on the folder and then Properties, security, select the Admininstrator, grant the read permission back and deny the read permission. Caution: this is a risky step, you might cant grant admin permission back once you deny the permission. | Expected: The service.expert.ap is authorized to write to C:\ExpertShare. The service.expert.ap is not authorized to read to C:\ExpertShare || Step 6: Grant all the permission back. | Expected: Expert path: C:\ExpertShare does exists. The service.expert.ap is authorized to write to C:\ExpertShare. The service.expert.ap is not authorized to read to C:\ExpertShare

Error message states "The server has less than the recommended 8GB of physical memory." || Step 2: Create a virtual machine with logical proccessors <4 | Expected: Create a virtual machine with logical processors <4  An error occured. Title: Base Testing: SSRS Connection Validation
Steps: Step 1: Configure SSRS and make sure it is running, Run the monitoring app. @Environment | Expected: Ideally SSRS Field will show green signal. || Step 2: Run Report Service Configuration Manager. From Report Server Status, Stop running the server. | Expected: Check SSRS Configuration field should be green. Check Whether SSRS is running will return a red signal.

Title: Export Package with different type of items
Steps: Step 1: You will need 2 environments for this test, 1 environment where you create the package, and another one to import the package.You need to prepare the following framework items for this test:a) Smartforms - Basic and Advancedb) Workflowsc) Category for smartform and workflowsd) Config values - Create config with different valid from and valid until dates (NOTE: Machine/User scope config does not get exported)e) Security policy and resource - with users and user groups as membersf) Adhoc list | Expected: Note: When exporting workflows, you need to have the workflow.xaml opened in Visua studio in order to successfully export the workflow. || Step 2: Prepare domain customization:a) Use dbeditor to add a custom column to HBM_CLIENTb) Add the customization to Expert using Domain wizard -> Extend existing entityc) Build & Apply customization in Deployment manager | Expected: Customization data will be added to FCM_CUSTOMIZATION_METADATA table, this will be the data that gets exported || Step 3: Prepare SSRS items (Your environment has to be configured with SSRS):a) Check that you have ssrs reports and data sources | Expected: You should be able to view & select the reports available on your SSRS server || Step 4: Prepare Additional files:a) Txt, pdf, word, scripts, zip files etc. || Step 5: Create a package in Design studio then add all the items you have prepared to the package | Expected: All items should be in appropriate categories in content picker All items that are added to the package should display under the appropriate categories || Step 6: Export the package | Expected: You should get a console to display the logs for export || Step 7: Check the content of the exported package zip | Expected: The package should contain all these items:a) Smartforms - Basic smartform should be a set of config values and advanced smartform should be a .dll fileb) Workflows - the workflow project bin folder should be packagedc) Category for smartform and workflows - should be a set of config valuesd) Config valuese) Security policy and resourcef) Adhoc listg) Domain customization metadata - should be the same as FCM_CUSTOMIZATION_METADATAh) SSRS reportsi) Additional filesj) Manifest file that contains info about the package and info on UPD/SSRS/File/Package items || Step 8: Check that Advanced smartform and workflow projects are also packaged and exported in the package | Expected: There should be a project zip in the same directory as the SF or WF. Verify that you can unzip, open, build and use the project

Title: Import Package with different type of items
Description: if you can't see imported customizations make sure you have right to the advanced workflow license
Steps: Step 1: Import the package from the Export Test to another environment using design studio, then check the following items | Expected: a) Package is imported - Verify in DesignStudio that package spec is created with all the contentsb) Package definition is created in FWM_PACKAGE tablec) Package specification is created in FWM_PACKAGE_SPECIFICATION table || Step 2: Check package specification in Design Studio | Expected: a) The imported package specification can be found and opened from Expert system -> Packages -> [PackageName]b) The spec contains all items in the original package || Step 3: Check the imported Smartforms - basic and advanced | Expected: a) Basic smartforms are added to config, under Technical > Presentation > Smartforms > [CategoryName] > [SmartformName]b) Advanced smartform .dll files are added to ExpertShare location and regesistered under config as well.c) Basic smartforms can be accessed from smartform wizard || Step 4: Check the imported Workflows | Expected: a) A new instance of the workflow should be created under IIS > Expert_Local > Workflows > [WorkflowName] > [VersionNumber] b) If you imported the same workflow multiple times, the version number will NOT CHANGE - The version number only changes when the WF being imported has a different MD5 hash.c) Existing IIS instances of the workflow are not affected or removed d) A workflow definition record is created in the WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION table e) Security resource is created under Module Resources > Framework > Workflow > StartProcess > [WorkflowName] || Step 5: Check Category for smartforms and workflows | Expected: Imported categories can be selected from the category dataprovider (From workflow properties window or smartform wizard) || Step 6: Check Config values | Expected: Should be created with correct path. If the path does not exist prior, they should have been created. || Step 7: Check Security policy and resource | Expected: Security policy and selected resources and member should be created and available in security manager || Step 8: Check Adhoc list | Expected: Imported Adhoc lists should be available in smartform wizard, data provider setting or Expert Admin app > Expert system settings || Step 9: Check Domain customization | Expected: Domain customization metadata should be added to FCM_CUSTOMIZATION_METADATA table || Step 10: Check SSRS reports | Expected: Imported SSRS reports should be added to the SSRS site and viewable || Step 11: Check Additional files | Expected: Should be installed to the correct location

Title: Using Package specification designer
Steps: Step 1: Check packaging plugin availability in Design Studio | Expected: Packaging plugin is available in Design Studio under ExpertSystem > Packages-Firm level package are stored under "Custom" node-Aderant owned packages are stored under "Products" node-Other packages like 'Default' and 'Blacklist' are stored at root level of 'Packages' nodeLicence packages is under a different node ExpertSystem > Licenses-Open a License, it should show you: NameOfLicense, DateIssued, Licensee, ExpiryDate, UserLimit. || Step 2: Create new packagea) Use ribbon barb) Use "Right click -> Create new" on the "Packages" node | Expected: A package specification is opened in a new tab. (Check against the attachment screenshot) || Step 3: In the Package name field, try to enter invalid strings:| {} "" <> \/ * | Expected: You should not be able to enter string (charaters) that are not supported || Step 4: Edit a packagea) Use Double click on a packageb) Use "Right click -> Edit" on a package | Expected: Opens the selected package specificationIf the spec is already opened, it should focus on the spec instead of opening a new one. || Step 5: Import a packagea) Use "Import package" from ribbonb) Use "Right click -> Import package" on the "Packages" node | Expected: Only valid packages can be imported (The package zip need to have a valid manifest file)You should get a preview for the package being imported || Step 6: Add Expert components to packagea) Use Drag & Drop on Any items in design studiob) Use "Add to package" button on Items in content pickerc) Multi select items in the content picker by selecting the checkboxes | Expected: a) any item in Design studio should allow you to drag & drop it into a packageb) Items in content picker can be added using "Add to package" buttonc) Items that are selected can be added to the pacakge || Step 7: Add files to the package using "Add items" button on ribbon | Expected: Opens window dialog to pick a file || Step 8: Remove items from packagea) Use remove button on ribbonb) Use "Delete" key on keyboardc) Multi select by holding shift or ctrl while selecting items | Expected: Item are removed from the specification designer and the package || Step 9: Save changes to a package:a) Use "save"b) Use "save & close" | Expected: Check that changes made to a package is saveda) Using save will leave the specification tab openb) Using save & close will close the specification tab || Step 10: Use Delete button from the ribbon to delete a packagea) Delete package specification b) Uninstall an imported package | Expected: a) Package specification is removed from the system (Check FWM_PACKAGE_SPECIFICATION and FWM_PACKAGE_SPEC_CONTENT table)b) Removes the package entry and the specification from the system (Check FWM_PACKAGE, FWM_PACKAGE_SPECIFICATION and FWM_PACKAGE_SPEC_CONTENT table). Also removes the contents that was imported by the package (NOT YET IMPLEMENTED)

Title: Base test :Check for network load balancer
Steps: Step 1: Open Health monitoring application in an environment not load balanced. | Expected: Health monitoring page should not show the network load balance || Step 2: Open Health monitoring application in an environment which is load balanced. | Expected: Health monitoring page should show the network load balance. The status of the laod balanced should be connected and the green tick icon should be there indicating it is working fine. || Step 3: Stop the load balance cluster in load balanced environment from network load balancing manager | Expected: Health monitoring page should show the network load balance. The status of the laod balanced should be not connected and the red tick icon should be there indicating it is working fine. The proper message should be there for the cause of failure. || Step 4: Stop any one of the server among the load balanced servers from network load balancing manager | Expected: Health monitoring page should show the network load balance. The status of the laod balanced should be connected and the green tick icon should be there indicating it is working fine.

Title: Using Default package
Steps: Step 1: Check the default package is create after deployment to a fresh environment || Step 2: Check Default package is read only | Expected: a) You cannot rename the packageb) You cannot change the content of the packagec) You cannot delete the packaged) You get a message bar saying "Read only - the contents of this package is populated by the system" || Step 3: Create a firm level value for each of the following types:a) Smartforms - Basic and Advancedb) Workflowsc) Category for smartform and workflowsd) Config values - Create config with different valid from and valid until dates (NOTE: Machine/User scope config does not get exported)e) Security policy and resource - with users and user groups as membersf) Adhoc listg) Domain customization || Step 4: Check the default package | Expected: Firm values that are created in the system are added to the default package, || Step 5: Create a package with the following types of items:a) Smartforms - Basic and Advancedb) Workflowsc) Category for smartform and workflowsd) Config values - Create config with different valid from and valid until dates (NOTE: Machine/User scope config does not get exported)e) Security policy and resource - with users and user groups as membersf) Adhoc listg) Domain customizationThen import this package to another system || Step 6: Check the default package on the other system | Expected: Firm values that are imported to the system are added to the default package, || Step 7: Check you can Export the default package || Step 8: Check you can import default package to another system

Title: Using Black list package
Steps: Step 1: Check the Black list package is created after deployment to a fresh environment | Expected: There are 2 blacklist packages, Blacklist(System) and Blacklist(Firm). The system blacklist is only visible under "Dev Mode" (or with System checkbox ticked) || Step 2: Check that you cannot:a) rename the packageb) delete the package || Step 3: Add items to the Blacklist package | Expected: This should work just like adding items to normal packages || Step 4: Add the same items to another standard package | Expected: The items specified in the black list package will appear crossed out in other packages || Step 5: Export the package | Expected: You will get warning that the items are in black list and will not get exported || Step 6: Check the package content | Expected: Verify that the blacklisted items are not exported.

Title: Package specification designer functions
Steps: Step 1: Create package || Step 2: Edit package || Step 3: Import package || Step 4: Delete/Uninstall package || Step 5: Designer window || Step 6: Save, Save & Close, Cancel || Step 7: Add items || Step 8: Delete items || Step 9: Reorder items

Title: Create & Export & Import database update (UPD) packages
Steps: Step 1: @Action in Design Studio || Step 2: Use "Add Items" on the ribbon bar to add a UPD file (Change the file type to *.upd in the pop-up and select UPD file in your ExpertSource\Database folder) | Expected: a) "Add Items" button is availableb) Changing file type to *.upd allows you to see UPD filesc) The UPD file is added to the package spec under "Database Updates" with the UPD's directory path || Step 3: Export the package | Expected: a) The exported package should have a folder called "DBFiles"b) The "DBFiles" folder should contain the UPD file and all the scripts that refered in the UPD file (In this test case, all scripts under your ExpertSource\Database folder)c) Other items in the package are also exported || Step 4: Import the package | Expected: a) The current environment's database should be updated with the UPD, verify this by checking import log and the db update record table CMS_DB_UPDATEb) Other items in the package are also imported

Title: Create & Export & Import Package of other packages
Steps: Step 1: Create packages that contain different types of items and then export them:a) Package with Workflowsb) Package with Smartforms, adhoc, configs and action rulesc) Package with Domain customizations || Step 2: Create packages with different names than the ones in #1, that contain different types of items and DO NOT export them:a) Package with Workflowsb) Package with Smartforms, adhoc, configs and action rulesc) Package with Domain customizations || Step 3: Create a new package in Design studio (e.g. Name it "PackageTest") || Step 4: Add the packages you prepared in #1 and #2:a) Use "Add items" button to add the exported packagesb) Use Content picker to add package specifications | Expected: Packages added will show up under the "packages" catergory in the spec designera) Exported packages are added with reference to their directory path. (e.g. C:\Temp\Test.zip)b) Package specs are added with reference to their package spec name. (e.g. Test) || Step 5: Export the package "PackageTest" | Expected: Check the exported package: a) In the package, you should have a "Packages" folder containing all the packages specified in the specb) Packages added as a zip file should remain the same as the original filec) Packages added as a spec should picked the values of the items specified in the package spec || Step 6: Import Package into new environment | Expected: Package Test is added to the package list as is every package that it contained

Title: Packaging console logging
Create & Export & Import Rules\Actions
Steps: Step 1: In Design Studio create a Rule that uses a Parameter (Rule 1) | Expected: Rule is created || Step 2: Create a Rule using a CSV Data Source (Rule 2) | Expected: Rule is created || Step 3: Create a Rule using Local Variables (Rule 3) | Expected: Rule is created || Step 4: Create a package or open an existing Package in Design Studio. In the Content types select Rules / Actions. | Expected: You can see your 3 created Rules but no System Rules. || Step 5: Add the Rules to the package (Drag and drop / double click or use add to package button) | Expected: You get a new Components Node showing the Rules || Step 6: Change a System Rule from Expenses to be a Firm Rule (EXP001) | Expected: System Rule canges to Firm Rule || Step 7: Add a  new Menu Item (Action) for Expert Assistant - Actions Menu. Fill in all required fields. | Expected: Action is created and is shown in EA (restart EA) || Step 8: Go back to your package and add EXP001 and the EA Action. | Expected: EXP001 Is now available in the content menu and can be added to the package || Step 9: Export the package via Design Studio | Expected: Exports successful (The Zip File contains the Rules and Action) || Step 10: Import Package into new Environment | Expected: The 3 Rules are created, the system Rule becomes a Firm Rule with the changes made, EA has the new Action.

Title: Create & Export & Import Jobs and Schedules
Steps: Step 1: In Design Studio create a Job with an action using Parameters on Job and Rule Level | Expected: Job is created with the different Parameters || Step 2: Create schedules ( one time, daily, weekly, monthly and 5 minute interval) | Expected: Schedules are created and are also visible in Schedule Manager || Step 3: Create a package or open an existing Package in Design Studio. In the Content types select Jobs. | Expected: You can see your created Job but no System Jobs. || Step 4: Export the Package with Job. | Expected: Export is successful (The Zip File contains the Job) || Step 5: Import the package into a new Environment | Expected: Job is created and parameters are imported tooThe schedules are shown EXCEPT the One time schedule. Schedules are inactive.

Title: Create & Export & Import database update (UPD) packages
Steps: Step 1: @Action in Design studio || Step 2: Use "Add Items" button on the ribbon to add a UPD file (Use UPD in ExpertSource\Database folder) | Expected: a) "Add Items" button is availableb) Can change file type to (*.upd) and see UPD filesc) The UPD is added to the package spec under "Database Updates" with its' directory path || Step 3: Export the package | Expected: a) Export with no errorsb) The exported package should contain a folder called "DBFiles"c) All scripts refered in the UPD should be in the DBFiles folder. (All files under ExpertSource\Database)d) All other items in the package spec should have been exported as well. || Step 4: Import the package | Expected: a) When a package with UPD is imported, the UPD will be applied to the environment's databaseb) Check the import log and database update record table CMS_DB_UPDATE to verify that UPD has been ran against the database.

Title: Create & Export & Import Workflow packages
Steps: Step 1: Prepare workflow project, e.g. FileOpening workflow or custom projects:a) Create the projects under C:\ExpertDevelopmentb) Open the project and rebuild the solution | Expected: After you have opened & rebuilt the solution, you should get an IIS instance of the workflow under Expert_Local\Development || Step 2: Open Design Studio - Packaging and create a new package "WF TEST" || Step 3: In the content picker, select "Workflow Projects" | Expected: a) "Workflow projects" catergory existsb) Only workflows that are available under Expert\Development in IIS is show in the list || Step 4: Select the workflows projects you created in #1 | Expected: The selected workflows are added to the package under "Development Workflow Project" catergory || Step 5: Export the package and check its' contents | Expected: a) The package .zip is exported to the selected directoryb) there should be a "Workflow" folder in the zipc) Each exported workflow should have 2 zips; the WF application and the WF solution.d) The WF application zip should contain: Bin, App_Data folder, Web.config, Workflow metadata and workflow.xamlxe) The WF solution zip should contain the full WF project || Step 6: Extract the WF solution zip and verify that the WF project can be opened in Visual studio and builds without error || Step 7: Import the package "WF TEST" and check the IIS app under Expert_local\Workflows | Expected: a) A new IIS app is created for each workflows in the packageb) The version number should start from 1 (and matches the version record in WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION table) || Step 8: Re-import the package "WF TEST" by using the following scenarios:a) The workflows contains no changes from previous (WF project was unchanged)b) The workflows has been changed (WF project was changed, rebuilt and exported)c) There are no running workflows in the current Workflow version (e.g. No workflows running in Expert_local\Workflows\Fileopening\1)d) There are running WFs in the current WF versione) Remove the current WF version in IIS (Stop the application and delete the version folder) | Expected: a) If the imported WF contain no changes compared to the existing one, it should not be imported and the version number should remain the sameb) If there were changes, the version number should increment by 1.c) If there are no running workflows in the current version, the current version should be removed and replaced by a new version (e.g. Fileopening\1 is removed and replaced by Fileopening\2)d) If there are running workflows, the current version should be untouched so you end up with 2 versions (e.g. Fileopening\1 and Fileopening\2 both exists in IIS)e) A new version of WF should be imported to IIS || Step 9: OPTIONAL: Re test #8 with more test data:a) 10 workflow versions, some with running workflows, some dontb) Import a package that contains 10 workflow projects, some have changes, some dont. | Expected: Same rule as #8 should apply to all workflows.

Title: Design Studio Activities
Steps: Step 1: In the Home Tab click Expert Assistant | Expected: Navigation Tree expands EA || Step 2: Double click on Actions Menu and select New Menu Item in the Ribbon | Expected: New Tab with Action Menu opens, New Menu Item tab opens after clicking the button || Step 3: Select in the action @Activity, fill out all required fields | Expected: You can save the Menu Item

Title: Base Test: Automatic periodic refresh
Steps: Step 1: Open the app and leave the app on the screen.@Browser | Expected: Automatic refresh should start and refresh the page every 30s. || Step 2: Minimize the window and leave the app on the screen. | Expected: Automactic refresh should still working as usually. || Step 3: Maxmize the window and leave the app on the screen. | Expected: Automactic refresh should still working as usually. || Step 4: Random rezise the window to any size and leave the app on the screen. | Expected: Automactic refresh should still working as usually. || Step 5: Leave some of the tab expanding. | Expected: After the refresh, all the tab should remind the same status as the it before the refresh.

Title: Base Test: Enviornment detail header information display
Steps: Step 1: Check the environment name match or not. @environment | Expected: Should display the name which indicate the runnning environment || Step 2: Check the time/data/time of the last run of the app and compare with the real time. | Expected: The 2 time captures should match || Step 3: Check the version number is right or not. | Expected: Check if the version number is the same as the version you have deployed || Step 4: check the patch number. | Expected: Check if the Patch number is the same as the version you have deployed

Title: Create & Export & Import patches
Description:
Import patch is only supported by Deployment Manager so far
 
Patching Web : no single files are going to be patched but the entire .zip file (search in expert source of your binaries for zip and you find all the files for OTG)
Steps: Step 1: In FWM_OWNER table, set Aderant to IsSystem = 'Y' || Step 2: Start Design Studio and switch to "Dev Mode" | Expected: "Development Mode" is only available when system owner is Aderant || Step 3: Navigate to Expert system -> Packages || Step 4: Right click on Packages and select "Create New Patch" | Expected: "Create New Patch" option is only available in "dev mode"Patch is created under Expert System -> Patch || Step 5: Add contents to the Patch (Make sure the files have different time stamp and version number from the current environment)Include the following:1. Files in Sharebin (Aderant assemblies)2. Files in ExpertShare (Aderant assemblies, thirdparty assemblies, exes) 3. Files in WebServices (Web.[xy].zip, add additional files to the zip) || Step 6: Export the Patch | Expected: a. The files specified in the spec are in the exported zipb. The manifest in the zip has isPatch flag set to TRUE || Step 7: Import the patch using Deployment Manager | Expected: 1. Check that all files in the package are imported to the correct location - Files are updated in Service directories, ExpertSource directories and WebBin zips2. Check that previous files are backed up (Folders "Package undo")3. Imported patches are shown in Design Studio > Expert System > Patch

Title: Base Test: Clearview database and connection test
Steps: Step 1: Configure clearview and open the monitoring app | Expected: Clearview validator will show green. || Step 2: Stop Clearview | Expected: Clearview validator should show red. || Step 3: Start Clearview | Expected: Clearview validator will show green. || Step 4: Delete some tables in the clearview database. | Expected: The table indicator will show the table which is deleted cant be found. || Step 5: Restore the database. | Expected: Everything shoud be green

Title: Base Test: Setting Up the auto refresh period from Web.Configure(Local)
Steps: Step 1: Go to IIS || Step 2: Click on the Computer Name, then Sites, Default Web Site, Expert_local, Framework Services, right click on infomation system, then click Explore || Step 3: Open web.configure under Explore folder. || Step 4: find the line '<add key="refreshTime" value="600000" />' change the value to 600 | Expected: the web should auto refresh every 10 second. || Step 5: find the line '<add key="refreshTime" value="600000" />' change the value to 1200 | Expected: the web should auto refresh every 20 second.

Title: BaseTest: Web.Configure set up auto refresh time on VM
Steps: Step 1: Go to iis @VM_name || Step 2: Click on the Computer Name, then Sites, Default Web Site, Expert_SYSINFO, Framework Services, right click on infomation system, then click Explore || Step 3: Find Web.configure, right click, Properties. Security, choose user(VMHSF30X\Users), then grant the write acess to web.configure || Step 4: Open web.configure under Explore folder. || Step 5: find the line '<add key="refreshTime" value="600000" />' change the value to 600 || Step 6: find the line '<add key="refreshTime" value="600000" />' change the value to 1200

Title: Base Test: Check if the environment manifest depends on DB, not on the query service
Steps: Step 1: Open the app @environment || Step 2: Stop the query service | Expected: The app should working fine. No dependency on query service. || Step 3: Start the query service || Step 4: Stop the Exoert database | Expected: The app should not crash but can not get any data for environment manifest. || Step 5: Staert the Expert databse

Title: Monitor Expert services
Steps: Step 1: Run DeploymentManager and switch to 'Service Monitor' tab | Expected: Service Monitor exists || Step 2: Check windows/appfabric services when Expert is NOT deployed | Expected: Service status should be 'Not installed' || Step 3: Check windows/appfabric services when Expert is deployed | Expected: Service status should be 'Running' or 'Stopped' || Step 4: Stop Core service from 'Windows services' and Query service from 'IIS' | Expected: Services status is updated to 'Stopped' for those 2 services || Step 5: Start Core service from 'Windows services' and Query service from 'IIS' | Expected: Service status is updated to 'Running' || Step 6: Restart services - all services will be restarted | Expected: All services are stopped then started

Title: Recent used items list
Steps: Step 1: Open Design Studio and locate the 'Recent Items' node in the Navigation pane | Expected: Recent items node exists and can be expanded/collapsed || Step 2: Add the following types of items to the Recent Items list by Double clicking or Right click and "Modify":a. Rules/Actionsb. Jobc. Packaged. Extension Point (e.g. Expert Assistant -> Actions Menu)e. Product (e.g. Expert Assistant) | Expected: The selected item(s) should be added to the "Recent items" list when you double click or modify the item.The most recent used item should be at the top of the list. || Step 3: Use Right click menu for all types of items | Expected: Appropriate menus should show up for each type of item and all options should work || Step 4: Double click on all types of items | Expected: It should open the selected item

Title: Email Support - Advanced settings
Steps: Step 1: Open Design Studio || Step 2: Click on 'Show Advanced Settings' | Expected: Advanced settings should show up:a. Attachments Encryption - uncheckedb. System Information - checkedc. Expert Manifest - checkedd. Licensing Details - checkede. Environment Details - checkedf. Data Customization Details - checkedg. Event Log - checkedh. Events Sinse - Defaults to 1 day back in time || Step 3: Uncheck all advanced options and click 'Email Support', then check the contents of 'Diagnositics.zip'. | Expected: It should contain the following files/folders:a. Configuration cache folder with xml files - configuration, added, deleted, queries and updated.b. GeneralInfo || Step 4: Check through all the advanced options and check the contents of 'Diagnositics.zip' | Expected: Verify the content of Diagnositics.zip matches the list of checked items.NOTE: the password to open the encrypted attachment is Aderant0 || Step 5: Check 'Event Log' then select a past date | Expected: a. Date picker (Events Since) becomes visible when 'Event Log' is checkedb. Cannot select future dates in the date picker || Step 6: Click 'Email Support' and check the contents of 'Diagnositics.zip' | Expected: The zip should contain an event log (eventLogArchived.evtx) || Step 7: Open the event log | Expected: The event log should contain logs within the specified date

Title: Design Studio - Activity Compilation (Detailed Steps - Quick test use attached package)
Description:
For a Quick Version of this Test you can import attached package which includes the created Action.
 
Note:
You need the Sample "Leave Request" Workflow published. This is deployed to ExpertShare\Workflows\Samples\SampleWorkflows.zip[Load Balanced environments have this in the Binaries]
Steps: Step 1: Setup: Publish Sample "Leave Request" Workflow.Set Test Email overrideOpen EA[Quick Version: import attached package and run EA Action "Activity Compilation" - Results are in Step 18] || Step 2: Go to Design Studio, create a new Menu Item for EA - Actions | Expected: New tab for the Menu Item is opened with a blank Activity || Step 3: Use activity Form with Form SampleWorkflows.LeaveRequestV2, Create Data Variables , Save , Result = IsFormAccepted | Expected: You can save the new Menu Item || Step 4: Add Line underneath. Activity = Notification, give a Title and Message, Condition : IsFormAccepted = True | Expected: No Errors || Step 5: Add Line underneath. Activity = Workflow, Workflow Name = Leave Request, Map the Arguments with previous created Variables, Result = NotificationId, Condition : IsFormAccepted = True | Expected: No Errors || Step 6: Add Line underneath. Activity = Message Dialog, give a Title and Message, Condition : IsFormAccepted = True | Expected: No Errors || Step 7: Create a Parameter via the Ribbon, Name= UserName, type Input - String, No default | Expected: Parameter is created || Step 8: Add Line above Form Activity:Activity = Assign, To = UserName, Value = Security.User.DisplayName | Expected: No Errors || Step 9: Add Line above Form Activity:Activity = Assign, To = Name, Value = UserName | Expected: No Errors || Step 10: Add Line above Form Activity:Activity = Assign, Value = TodayTo = StartDate | Expected: No Errors || Step 11: Add Line above Form Activity:Activity = Assign, To = EndDate, Value = Today + 1 day | Expected: No Errors || Step 12: Add Line above Form Activity:Activity = Query, From = Employee, Where Item.DisplayName = UserName, Result = create Variable User | Expected: No Errors || Step 13: Add Line above Form Activity:Activity = Log, Message = ExecutionEnvironment.ExtensionPoint.DisplayName, LogLevel = Warning | Expected: No Errors || Step 14: Add Line above Form Activity:Activity = Script, Add to script = from Aderant.Framework.Logging import LogLevelExecutionEnvironment.Log(LogLevel.Warning, 'Script Activity for '+ User.DisplayName) | Expected: No Errors || Step 15: Add Line underneath message dialog. Activity = Email, To = User.Email , Subject = "Workflow with " + NotificationId + " is started.", Body = OTG Workflow with your task will be opened., Condition : IsFormAccepted = True | Expected: No Errors || Step 16: Add Line underneath. Activity = Open URL, URL = "http://localhost/Expert_Local/ApplicationServices/OnTheGoworkflow", Condition : IsFormAccepted = True | Expected: No Errors || Step 17: Add Line underneath. Activity = Expert Application, Application = WorkflowAdmin.exe,Condition : IsFormAccepted = True | Expected: No Errors || Step 18: Save and Run the Action in Design Studio and later via EA (8.0.2.1when prompted for a parameter value in DS you can keep it blank) | Expected: Smartform: Leave Request / your Name, start and end date are populated (today and tomorrow).Cancel Smartform and nothing else will happenClick ok in Smartform - notification is displayed, Workflow is started, Message dioalog pops up, You receive an email, OTG is openend in your broswer and Workflow admin app starts (both show your leave request task).Event Viewer or log: 2 warnings shown (Actions Menu and User name). || Step 19: Create PackageAdd ActionDifferent Environment - import package | Expected: Export and import without errorsAction runs the same as before in new environment

Title: Email Support - Diagnostics - Environment Details
Steps: Step 1: Check the content of EnvironmentDetails.xml | Expected: It should contain the following sections:<environmentRegistration><header><report><additionalInfo><Signature></environmentRegistration> || Step 2: Verify info under <header> section | Expected: effectiveDate -- Current time in UTCenvironmentName -- Should match to fwm_environment tableexpertVersion -- owner -- Should match to fwm_owner tabledomain -- Machine nameuserCount -- Active users in hbm_persnltimeKeeperCount -- Number of users that have time records || Step 3: Verify info under <report> section | Expected: roles -- Should match environment manifest and fwm_environment tablepackages -- Should match fwm_package table with OwnerId = '00000000-0000-0000-0000-00000000000A'databaseUpdates -- Should match cms_db_update table (Only select rows with the highest version_uno and adhoc_uno = 0) || Step 4: Verify info under <additionalInfo> section | Expected: isLoadBalanced -- Should match environment manifest and fwm_environment tablenumberOfServer -- Should match environment manifest and fwm_environment tablecustomizations -- Should match fwm_package table with OwnerId!='00000000-0000-0000-0000-00000000000A'

Title: Email Support - Diagnostics - Configuration Cache
Steps: Step 1: Check the contents of Configuration cache(The xml files are a collection of cache data under %userprofile%\AppData\Roaming\Aderant\local\Configuration) | Expected: There should be 5 cache xml files:a. Configuration.xmlb. ConfigurationAdded.xmlc. ConfigurationDeleted.xmld. ConfigurationQueries.xmle. ConfigurationUpdated.xmlAll cache data under userprofile - Configuration folder should be collected

Title: Email Support - Diagnostics - Event Log
Steps: Step 1: Check the content of eventLogArchived.evtx | Expected: It should contain Error/Warning/Info messages within the specified dates from sources: Aderant, Secuirty and System

Title: Email Support - Diagnostics - File versions in ExpertShare & Local
Steps: Step 1: Check contents of ExpertLocalManifest.xml | Expected: ExpertLocalManifest.xml is generated If you launched the app from a MSI or CO.The list of files should have their actual directory pathThe list of files should match the ExpertShareManifest.zip in the directory path || Step 2: Check contents of ExpertShareManifest.xml | Expected: ExpertShareManifest.xml is ALWAYS generatedThe list of files should match the ExpertShareManifest.zip in ExpertShare location

Title: Email Support - Diagnostics - General Information
Steps: Step 1: Check the content of GeneralInfo.txt | Expected: Should contain the following:Ping time to query serviceSend 1MB traffic testRetrieve 1MB traffic testEnvironment NameDatabase Server NameDatabase NameConnected UserCitrix/Terminal Services checkMachine NameUser Domain NameOperating System infoCPU infoMachine RAM

Title: Email Support - Diagnostics - Data Customizations
Steps: Step 1: Check that you have data customizations in your environmente.g. FCM_CUSTOMIZATION_METADATA is populated || Step 2: If you do not have data customization, you can use DBEditor to add custom tables or columns (e.g. to HBM_PERSNL)Then use Domain wizard to extend the domain with your customization and use Deployment manager to apply the customization. || Step 3: Check and open CustomizationDetails.xml | Expected: 1. File exists in the generated diagnostics2. Check customization metadata is generated under <CustomizationMetadata> tag and it matches the records in FCM_CUSTOMIZATION_METADATA3. Check index metadata is generated under <t> tag and it matches the customization you added to the database

Title: Email Support - Diagnostics - License Details
Steps: Step 1: First check that you have License imported for Budgeting, Expenses and Collections(If you dont, see attachment of this test and import them) || Step 2: Check the content of LicensingStatusDetails.xml | Expected: It should contain license details for all 3 applications like these:a. <license name="ExpertBudgeting" issued="06-Nov-2013" usercount="14" userlimit="unlimited" usertype="User" expiry="unlimited">b. <license name="ExpensesApplication" issued="13-Feb-2014" usercount="14" userlimit="unlimited" usertype="User" expiry="unlimited">c. <license name="ExpertCollections" issued="22-Nov-2013" usercount="280" userlimit="unlimited" usertype="User" expiry="unlimited">

Title: Email Support - Diagnostics - Debug logs
Steps: Step 1: Run ExpertTime.exe from Expertshare || Step 2: Navigate to backstage help from 'Expert' button -> Help || Step 3: Click on 'Start' to Enable logging | Expected: Log2Console should be launched || Step 4: Perform actions in ExpertTime to populate logging | Expected: Logs should be populated in Log2Console window || Step 5: Click on 'Email Support' to generate Diagnostics files | Expected: You should get a new email window with Diagnostics file attached || Step 6: Save and extract 'Diagnostics.zip' and check the log file | Expected: The log file is named by datetime, e.g. 150204-113659.log (year month day - hour minutes seconds) || Step 7: Check the content of the log file against the actual logging | Expected: The content should be exactly same

Title: Email Support - Diagnostics - System Information
Steps: Step 1: Check the content of MSINFO.nfo | Expected: It should contain the following categories:a. Hardware Resourcesb. Componentsc. Software Environment

Title: Email Support - Standalone utility
Steps: Step 1: Run the standalone utility (SupportMailGenerator.exe) in ExpertShare || Step 2: Check the generated diagnostics files against the ones from step 1. Make sure they are the same || Step 3: Shutdown IIS and Windows services and run the standalone utility | Expected: Diagnostics is generated regardless of the status of the services

Title: DS - Script Editor 8.0.3
Description: with 8.0.3 we changed the Script Editor in Design studio. instead of a new window a new tab opens in which you can change the script and you can jump inbetween tabs now.
Steps: Step 1: Open Design Studio and press button Script editor | Expected: In the ribbon is a Script Editor button under external tools.Pressing the button opens a new Tab with script editor / When hit Run it prints hello world / insert snippets adds snippets to the script || Step 2: Import attached package and search in DS for Script, open job , open script, run inside script editor | Expected: You see the Testing Script Error above the log window

Title: MSI Install - Per User Deployment - Install by user
Description: Per user is Installation done by particular user on there machine. So application installed or Uninstalled by one of the user should be chnaging anything for other user. Changes should be specific for that particualr user.
Steps: Step 1: - Make sure there are no MSIs currently installed on your machine (check Programs and Features in the control panel)- Deploy | Expected: Deployment is successfull6 MSi files are generated in ExpertShare 1. 3 installs files are created for perMachine Installs.-ExpertAssistantperMachine.msi-ExpertTimeperMachine.msi-ExpertTimeActiveAgentperMachine.msi2. 3 installs files are created for perUser Installs.-ExpertAssistantperUser.msi-ExpertTimeperUser.msi-ExpertTimeActiveAgentperUser.msi || Step 2: Run MSI files for ExpertAssistantperUser.msi, ExpertTimeperUser.msi, ExpertTimeActiveAgentperUser.msi from file location C:\ExpertShare | Expected: Expert Assistant, ExpertTime, ExpertTimeActiveAgent is installed and Applications are open once they are installed1. Shortcut for Applications are created in Start Menu.2. Applications with version 8.02.1 and installed Date of Today in Program and Feature in Control Panel || Step 3: Sign off your machine and log on as another user (Eg:-TTQA1) -Check the start menu | Expected: No Shortcut for Applications || Step 4: Check Programs and Features for installed MSI's | Expected: No MSI's currently installed for TTQA1 || Step 5: Run MSI files for ExpertAssistantperUser.msi, ExpertTimeperUser.msi, ExpertTimeActiveAgentperUser.msi from file location C:\ExpertShare | Expected: Expert Assistant, ExpertTime, ExpertTimeActiveAgent is installed and Applications are open once they are installed1. Shortcut for Applications are created in Start Menu.2. Applications with version 8.02.1 and installed Date of Today in Program and Feature in Control Panel || Step 6: Run Uninstalls for ExpertAssistant, ExpertTime, ExpertTimeActiveAgent from Program and Features in Control Panel | Expected: Expert Assistant, ExpertTime, ExpertTimeActiveAgent is uninstalled successfully1. No shortcut for applications is in Start Menu.2.No applications is in Program and Feature in Control Panel || Step 7: Sign off your machine and log on as you. | Expected: Expert Assistant, ExpertTime, ExpertTimeActiveAgent is still installed 1. Shortcut for Applications are still in Start Menu.2. Applications with version 8.02.1 and installed Date of Today is still in Program and Feature in Control Panel

Title: MSI Install - Per Machine Deployment - Install by Administrator
Description: Per Machine install is done by ADMIN. So application installed or uninstalled, changes will be for a large number of user. User dont have rights to install or uninstall the applicaions per Machine
Steps: Step 1: - Make sure there are no MSIs currently installed on your machine (check Programs and Features in the control panel)- Deploy | Expected: Deployment is successfull6 MSi files are generated in ExpertShare1. 3 installs files are created for perMachine Installs.-ExpertAssistantperMachine.msi-ExpertTimeperMachine.msi-ExpertTimeActiveAgentperMachine.msi2. 3 installs files are created for perUser Installs.-ExpertAssistantperUser.msi-ExpertTimeperUser.msi-ExpertTimeActiveAgentperUser.msi || Step 2: Run ExpertAssistantperMachine.msi, ExpertTimeperMachine.msi and ExpertTimeActiveAgentperMachine.msi from ExpertShare | Expected: Expert Assistant, ExpertTime, ExpertTimeActiveAgent is installed1. Shortcut for Applications are created in Start Menu.2. Applications with version 8.02.1 and installed Date of Today in Program and Feature in Control Panel || Step 3: Sign off your machine and log on as another user (Eg:- TTQA1). | Expected: Expert Assistant, ExpertTime, ExpertTimeActiveAgent is still installed 1. Shortcut for Applications are still present in Start Menu.2. Applications with version 8.02.1 and installed Date of Today is still in Program and Feature in Control Panel || Step 4: Run Uninstall for ExpertAssistant, ExpertTime, ExpertTimeActiveAgent from Program and Features in Control Panel | Expected: Dailouge box appears "To continue, Type administrator password and then click Yes" asking for aadministrator credentials. || Step 5: Enter the Administrator Credentials and Click "Yes" | Expected: Expert Assistant, ExpertTime, ExpertTimeActiveAgent is uninstalled successfully1. No shortcut for applications is in Start Menu.2.No applications is in Program and Feature in Control Panel

Title: MSI Install - Per Machine Deployment - Allow Silent Intall
Description: Per Machine install is done by ADMIN, so its a silent install. Application doesnot open up automatically once they are installed

Title: MSI Install - Per Machine - Allow REMOVE-ALL
Description: REMOVE_ALL feature is developed for per Machine(ADMIN) installs only. Two folder are created on installing a particular MSI, Installer folder and Application folder in C:\AderantExpert\{Environment Name}. On uninstalling the MSI, it deleted both Apllication and installer folder to attain the CLEAN state.
Steps: Step 1: - Make sure there are no MSIs currently installed on your machine (check Programs and Features in the control panel)- Deploy | Expected: Deployment is successful. If you check your ExpertShare, there are 6 MSI files that have been generated - 3 Per Machine MSIs for each ExpertAssistant, ExpertTime and ExpertTimeActiveAgent- 3 Per User MSIs for each ExpertAssistant, Expert Time and ExpertTimeActiveAgent || Step 2: Run ExpertAssistantPerMachine.msi, ExpertTimeperMachine.msi and ExpertTimeActiveAgentperMahine.msi from ExpertShare | Expected: Expert Assistant, ExpertTime, ExpertTimeActiveAgent are installed and these new folders are created in C:\AderantExpert\{Envrionment Name}1. Application folder 2. ExpertAssistantInstaller 3. ExpertTimeInstaller4. ExpertTimeActiveAgentInstaller || Step 3: Run uninstall for ExpertAssistant from Programs and Features in Control Panel | Expected: 1. Expert Assistant is uninstalled and ExpertAssistantInstaller and Application folder is deleted from C:\AderantExpert\{Envrionment Name}2. ExpertTimeInstaller and ExpertTimeActiveAgentInstaller is still present in C:\AderantExpert\{Envrionment Name} || Step 4: Open ExpertTime from Start Menu. Check C:\AderantExpert\{Envrionment Name} | Expected: Application folder is regenerated || Step 5: Run uninstall for ExpertTimeActiveAgent and ExpertTime from Programs and Features in Control Panel | Expected: Application, ExpertTime and ExpertTimeActiveAgent folders are deleted from C:\AderantExpert\{Envrionment Name}

Title: MSI Install - Client control over which MSI installs during deployment
Description:
This Test Case check for the client control over MSI installation. The following approach is followed 
 
-With the deployment, user will have an option available for both perMachine(ADMIN) install and perUser install for MSI. MSI files for both types of installs are generated with deployment which will be available in ExpertShare folder. 
-Button or a checkbox will be available in advanced option in deployment manager which will initiate generation of FULL MSI
Steps: Step 1: Launch Deployment ManagerIn the Environment tab, click on "Advanced Options" in the ribbon | Expected: A checkbox for Full Deployment is available || Step 2: Deploy without checking the Checkbox for Full Deployment | Expected: Deployment is successful If you check your ExpertShare, there are 6 MSI files that have been generated: - 3 Per Machine MSIs for each ExpertAssistant, ExpertTime and ExpertTimeActiveAgent- 3 Per User MSIs for each ExpertAssistant, Expert Time and ExpertTimeActiveAgent || Step 3: Launch Deployment Manager (if not still open) and remove your deployment || Step 4: In the Environment tab, click on "Advanced Options" in the ribbon. Check the checkbox for Full Deployment | Expected: Dailogue box appears "Insert correct message here" || Step 5: Click on Deploy | Expected: Deployment is successful If you check your ExpertShare, there are 3 MSI files that have been generated: - 3 Full MSIs for each ExpertAssistant, ExpertTime and ExpertTimeActiveAgent

Steps: Step 1: Setup:- Make sure there are no MSIs currently installed on your machine (check Programs and Features in the control panel)- Deploy your environment with the option checked for Full deployment in "Advanced Options" in deployment manager- Make sure you have another user who can log on on your machine (Note: both users also have to be in your database to be able to launch the applications)-Make sure other user have rights to open ExpertTime, ExpertTimeActiveAgent | Expected: Deployment is successful and two new MSI files are generated in ExpertShare1. ExpertTime.full.msi 2. ExpertTimeActiveAgent.full.msi || Step 2: Run ExpertTime.full.msi and ExpertTimeActiveAgent.full.msi from C:\ExpertShare | Expected: ExpertTime and ExpertTimeActiveAgent is installed and Applications are open once they are installed1. Shortcut for Applications are created in Start Menu.2. Applications with version 8.02.1 and installed Date of Today in Program and Feature in Control Panel || Step 3: Sign off your machine and log on as another user. (TTQA1) | Expected: ExpertTime and ExpertTimeActiveAgent is still installed1. Shortcut for Applications is still in Start Menu.2. Applications with version 8.02.1 and installed Date of Today is still in Program and Feature in Control Panel || Step 4: Run uninstall for ExpertTime and ExpertTimeActiveAgent from Programs and Features in Control Panel | Expected: Dailouge box appears "To continue, Type administrator password and then click Yes" asking for aadministrator credentials. || Step 5: Enter the Adminstrator Credentials and Click "Yes" | Expected: ExpertTime and ExpertTimeActiveAgent is uninstalled successfully1. No shortcut for applications is in Start Menu.2.No applications is in Program and Feature in Control Panel

Title: MSI Install - Push Deployment - Self-updating MSI on applying patch
Description:
If you are installing the MSI  as perMachine which is a AMDIN install, then it checks for updates on applying patch.
As MSI installed as perMachine is self-healing MSi , so donot need to repair or re-install to use it again. The application is ompletely usable as soon as it is updated
Steps: Step 1: - Make sure there are no MSIs currently installed on your machine (check Programs and Features in the control panel)- Deploy | Expected: Deployment is successfull6 MSi files are generated in ExpertShare1. 3 installs files are created for perMachine Installs.-ExpertAssistantperMachine.msi-ExpertTimeperMachine.msi-ExpertTimeActiveAgentperMachine.msi2. 3 installs files are created for perUser Installs.-ExpertAssistantperUser.msi-ExpertTimeperUser.msi-ExpertTimeActiveAgentperUser.msi || Step 2: Install ExpertAssistant, ExpertTime, ExpertTimeActiveAgent | Expected: Expert Assistant, ExpertTime and ExpertTimeActiveAgent are installed in the machine || Step 3: Open ExpertTime app form the start menu and make a Time entry and save. | Expected: Time Entry is done successfully with "Draft" status || Step 4: Open ExpertAssistant from start menu and kick off "Add New Employee" worklfow | Expected: A task is received for adding New employee and added to "My Task" list || Step 5: Close both ExpertTime and ExpertAssistant | Expected: Applications are closed || Step 6: Upgrade the Environment by applying a patch | Expected: Envrionment is upgraded without any error || Step 7: Check the Applications folder in C:\AderantExpert\{Environment Name} | Expected: All the files in application folder is updated with Today's date and current time. || Step 8: Open ExpertTime. | Expected: Time entry is still present in Draft status || Step 9: Open ExpertAssistant | Expected: Workflow for adding a new employee is still presnt in "My Task" list

Title: MSI Install - Pull Deployment - Self-updating MSI on applying patch
Description:
If you are installing the MSI  as perUser install, then it checks for updates on applying patch.
As MSI installed as perUser is self-healing MSi , so donot need to repair or re-install to use it again. The application is completely usable as soon as it is updated
Steps: Step 1: - Make sure there are no MSIs currently installed on your machine (check Programs and Features in the control panel)- Deploy | Expected: Deployment is successfull6 MSi files are generated in ExpertShare 1. 3 installs files are created for perMachine Installs.-ExpertAssistantperMachine.msi-ExpertTimeperMachine.msi-ExpertTimeActiveAgentperMachine.msi2. 3 installs files are created for perUser Installs.-ExpertAssistantperUser.msi-ExpertTimeperUser.msi-ExpertTimeActiveAgentperUser.msi || Step 2: Run ExpertAssistantperuser.msi, ExpertTimeperUser.msi and ExpertTimeActiveAgentperUser. | Expected: Expert Assistant, ExpertTime and ExpertTimeActiveAgent are installed in the machine || Step 3: Open ExpertTime app form the start menu and make a Time entry and save. | Expected: Time Entry is done successfully with "Draft" status || Step 4: Open ExpertAssistant from start menu and kick off "Add New Employee" worklfow | Expected: A task is received for adding New employee and added to "My Task" list || Step 5: Close both ExpertTime and ExpertAssistant | Expected: Applications are closed || Step 6: Upgrade the Environment by applying a patch | Expected: Envrionment is upgraded without any error || Step 7: Check the Applications folder in C:\AderantExpert\{Environment Name} | Expected: All the files in application folder is updated with Today's date and current time. || Step 8: Open ExpertTime. | Expected: Time entry is still present in Draft status || Step 9: Open ExpertAssistant | Expected: Workflow for adding a new employee is still presnt in "My Task" list

Title: MSI Install - Full Deployment - Not Self-updating MSI on applying patch
Description:
If you are installing the MSI  by Full deployment, then it checks for updates on applying patch.
As MSI installed by Full deployment, so needs to repair or re-install to use it again. The application is not usable when they are updated.
It is not self healing
Steps: Step 1: - Make sure there are no MSIs currently installed on your machine (check Programs and Features in the control panel)- Deploy your environment with the option checked for Full deployment in "Advanced Options" in deployment manager | Expected: Deployment is successful and two new MSI's are created in C:\ExpertShare1. ExpertTime.full.msi2.ExpertTimeActiveAgent.full.msi || Step 2: Run the ExpertTime.full.msi and ExpertTimeActiveAgent.full.msi from C:\ExpertShare | Expected: ExpertTime.full.msi and ExpertTimeActiveAgent.full.msi are installed in the machine || Step 3: Open ExpertTime app form the start menu and make a Time entry and save. | Expected: Time Entry is done successfully with "Draft" status || Step 4: Close ExpertTime | Expected: Application is closed || Step 5: Upgrade the Environment by applying a patch | Expected: Envrionment is upgraded without any error || Step 6: Check ExpertTime.full.msi and ExpertTimeActiveAgent.full.msi from C:\ExpertShare | Expected: Both the files are not updated with Today's date and current time. || Step 7: Open ExpertTime. | Expected: Time entry is not present

Title: MSI Install - Upgrading Expert environment
Description: This check for effect on updating environment from 8021 to current release.
Steps: Step 1: Deploy environment with 8021 release | Expected: Deployment is successfull || Step 2: Run ExpertAssistant.msi, ExpertTime.msi and ExpertTimeActiveAgent.msi from ExpertShare | Expected: MSI are installed || Step 3: Open Time app and do time entries in all status | Expected: Time app opens and status of various TIme entries is Draft, Pending, Posted-wip || Step 4: Open ExpertAssistant and kick off worklfow for adding New employee | Expected: In "My Task" workflow for adding new employee is added || Step 5: Close the applications || Step 6: Upgrade environment with CRTVNext latest Build | Expected: Envrionment upgraded succesfully || Step 7: Open ExpertTime from Start Menu | Expected: Time app opens up || Step 8: Check for the Time entries | Expected: Time entries is also present

Title: Using Package QBE to assign a package to an item
Steps: Step 1: From Design Studio, create 5 different new packages (e.g. test01, test02...) || Step 2: Package QBE can be found in the following applications:a. Configuration Managerb. Title: SF3 - Create & Consume Form level validation Rule
Description:
There are "Event points" inside a SmartForm where we allow the use of Rules:
-Form Level, "On Initialize" and "On Validate" events
-Control Level , "On Changed" and "On Validate" events
 
Form Level - On Initialize event: Rules under this event will be evaluated when the Form is first initialized (loaded)
Form Level - On Validate event: Rules under this event will be evaluated when Form data has changed (e.g. Changes to input in fields, Save, Cancel/Close)
 
Control Level - On Changed event: Rules under this event will be evaluated when the data is changing inside the control 
(When you are typing, this Rule is evaluated after every keypress)
Control Level - On Validate event: Rules under this event will be evaluated when the data has changed 
(After you finished typing, 0.5 second throttling)
Steps: Step 1: Open DesignStudio then open Smartform Designer (Create/Edit a smartform) || Step 2: In the Smartform properties pane, go to "On Validate" property under "Events" | Expected: a. The property is available for smartform propertiesb. The dropdown allows you to create or choose an existing Rulec. Clicking on "..." (Ellipsis) opens Rules editor for selected Rule (If no rule was selected, a new one is created) || Step 3: @PickRule (e.g. Return error if Client.DisplayName contains "Arden") | Expected: You should be able to use data bindings for the expression fields in the Rule editor. (e.g. Error message: "The selected Client " + Client.DisplayName + " is invalid.") || Step 4: Test the Validation rule by consuming the smartform a. In Designtime (Run Form Validation and Open in Test Harness)b. In runtime (Workflow) | Expected: The form level validation rule is only evaluated when the form is being saved or the task containing the form is being completed.When the rule returns an error, save/complete should be intercepted with an error bar on top of the form displaying the error message you specified in the Rule editor Check that there is logging in the Log console in Test harness when the validation event is triggered

= v.NameIdWHEREPathLIKE'Preference.SavedSearches%' || Step 2: Create checks | Expected: * Creates can be saved per user* Creates can be saved per firm (if the user has permissions)* Can create a new (this is not case sensitive)* Can't edit a search that would result in a duplicate for the firm (this is not case sensitive)* Can create a search for different users with the same name* Can create a Title: Create & Maintain Adhoclist
Description: You can create & maintain adhoclist from Expert Admin app or Smartform wizard. This test case will walk through both apps.
Steps: Step 1: Create Adhoclist in Expert Admin:a. Run ExpertAdministration.exe from Expertshareb. Navigate to: System.Adhoc List Editorc. Create a new Adhoclist by clicking on the "Plus" button next to "Adhoc lists" fieldd. Enter Adhoclist Name and Description: Use long strings, special characters and symbolse. Create "List items" for the selected Adhoclist by clicking on the "Plus" button next to "List Items" fieldf. Enter Primary, Secondary and Code texts: Use long strings, special characters and symbolsg. Save your changes | Expected: -The Adhoclist Editor only shows adhoclists created by the firm-Adhoclist are stored in FWA_ADHOC_LIST table. Its' list items are stored in FWA_ADHOC_LIST_ITEM table-An empty item is aways created when you click on the "Plus" button-Text field accepts unlimited length for Adhoc list name and description. (VCHAR MAXX in database)-Text field accepts up to 100 characters for Primary,Secondary and code text. (VCHAR 100 in database)-Text field accepts special characters and symbols || Step 2: Create Adhoclist in Smartform Wizard:a. Run SmartformWizard.exe from Expertshareb. Go through the wizard, create a new smartform, add a String data contract and change its' control type to SearchBoxc. Use the Data Provider search and search for "Create new" and select "Adhoc List: Create New"d. Edit list by clicking on Ellipsis on "Adhoc List Items" fielde. In the pop-up, Create "List items" by clicking on the "Add" buttonf. Enter Primary, Secondary and Code texts: Use long strings, special characters and symbolsg. Click Accept to save changesh. In the pop-up, Enter Adhoclist Name and Description: Use long strings, special characters and symbolsi. Select an existing packagej. Save your changes | Expected: -The Data provider search shows all available Adhoc lists, including system lists and the one created by the firm-Adhoclist are stored in FWA_ADHOC_LIST table. Its' list items are stored in FWA_ADHOC_LIST_ITEM table.-An empty item is aways created when you click on the "Add" button-Text field accepts unlimited length for Adhoc list name and description. (VCHAR MAXX in database)-Text field accepts up to 100 characters for Primary,Secondary and code text. (VCHAR 100 in database)-Text field accepts special characters and symbols || Step 3: Maintain Adhoclist in Expert Admin:a. Run ExpertAdministration.exe from Expertshareb. Navigate to: System.Adhoc List Editorc. Select an existing Adhoc List and edit Name and Description - Save your changes and verify in the databased. Select the list items and edit Primary,Secondary and Code texts - Save your changes and verify in the databasee. Delete selected list itemf. Delete selected Adhoc List | Expected: -Values in FWA_ADHOC_LIST are correctly updated for the selected Adhoclist-Values in FWA_ADHOC_LIST_ITEM are correctly updated for the selected Adhoclist and selected List items || Step 4: Maintain Adhoclist in Smartform Wizard:a. Run SmartformWizard.exe from Expertshareb. Go through the wizard, create a new smartform, add a String data contract and change its' control type to SearchControlc. Use the Data Provider search and search & select for an existing Adhoclistd. Select the list items and edit Primary,Secondary and Code textse. Delete a list itemf. Click "accept" on "List editor" window so you get the "Save adhoc list" window and edit Name and Descriptiong. Save your changes and verify in the database | Expected: -Values in FWA_ADHOC_LIST are correctly updated for the selected Adhoclist-Values in FWA_ADHOC_LIST_ITEM are correctly updated for the selected Adhoclist and selected List items || Step 5: Delete un-saved Adhoc list: Adhoc list can only be delete when they are created new and not yet saveda. Run ExpertAdministration.exe from Expertshareb. Navigate to System.Adhoc List Editorc. Create a new Adhoc list, make some changes (Do not save)d. Delete the adhoc list | Expected: -Verify no entries are added to FWA_ADHOC_LIST table-Verify the tooltip of "Delete" button shows that only un-saved items can be delete.

Title: System Monitor - Check Database Server Free Space
Description: The Expert System Monitor checks that the database server has at least 15% free and returns a warning if not. This test describes how to accomplish that.
Steps: Step 1: Start the System Monitor (via Icon in Deployment Manager, Expert Assistant or browse in IIS) || Step 2: Open Disk Management (right click on Windows icon) to get the capacity and free space of the server. || Step 3: To create a file of the correct size, you will need to calculate the following based on the values in Disk Manager:Free Space - (Capacity * .85) || Step 4: Run the following commands in powershell (edit XXX to be the appropriate size from step 3) to create a large file so that the disk space is 15% or lessFSUTIL.EXE File CreateNew C:\Temp\TestFile.DAT (XXXGB)FSUTIL.EXE File SetValidData C:\Temp\TestFile.DAT (XXXGB) || Step 5: Refresh the System Monitor | Expected: Database server disc space check should return Orange warning || Step 6: Delete the Test File so that disk space returns back to normal. || Step 7: Refresh the System Monitor | Expected: Database server disc space check should be Green and let you know what the current disk space available is.

Title: System Monitor - Email Availability
Description:
The System Monitor should ensure the email server is available and email addresses are supplied for the systems and operations email address.
 
If a test override email address is utilized, that should be noted as no other users will be able to recieve workflow emails while this address is in use. 
 
Note: at this time the monitor only checks to ensure that an email has a valid format (x @ aderant) , not whether this is a valid system email address.
Steps: Step 1: Systems and Operations Email can be edited prior to deployment in Deployment Manager>> environment or after deployment via Admin App System>> Environment Test Override Email can be edited via Config Manager: Technical.Framework.Workflow.TestOverrideEmail or Admin App:System>> Workflow/Custom Development. If you update via Admin app you must also run the scheduled job so it goes into config manager. || Step 2: Update the systems email address and operations email to an invalid format (missing @) prior to deployment | Expected: Email should return red error and display incorrect email. || Step 3: Update the Override email address to an invalid address (missing @) | Expected: Email >> Test Override Email should return red error and incorrect email. || Step 4: Update the Test Override email address to a valid email address | Expected: Email >> Test Override Email should return yellow warning and indicate the override email || Step 5: Remove the address in the Test Override email | Expected: Email >> Test Override Email should return green check and indicate emails will be routed normally. || Step 6: Update the SMTP Host to an invalid host address(either in Deployment manager prior to deployment, or via SSMS in FWM_ENVIRONMENT) | Expected: Email >> Ping check should return Red. || Step 7: Update the SMTP Port to an invalid port number | Expected: Email>Ping check should return Red. || Step 8: Update the SMTP Host and Port to the correct information (Host: smtp.dev.ap.aderant.com Port: 25) | Expected: Email>Ping check should return Green. || Step 9: Update the systems email address and operations email to a valid format (missing @) prior to deployment | Expected: Check should return Green and correct value

Title: System Monitor website : AppFabric Configuration checks

Title: Database Check - Fragmented Indices
Steps: Step 1: On @Environment for each @Database start with a fresh database backup to ensure some indices are fragmented || Step 2: Run the attached SQL to ensure at least one index with 1000+ pages is highly fragmented (>30%) | Expected: System Monitor - Database >>@Database >> Index will return Red || Step 3: Run the attached SQL to recreate the indices so that they have <30% fragmentation | Expected: System Monitor - Database >>@Database >> Index will return Green

Title: Database Check - Auto update of statistics
Description:
SQL Server statistics ensure queries run with up-to-date statistics for optimizing query performance. 
 
The auto-update can be configured to run synchronously or asynchronously. As long as one of those options is selected, the System Monitor should not trigger a warning.
Steps: Step 1: For the Expert database || Step 2: Ensure statistics are turned off (both rows should be 0)SELECT name, is_auto_update_stats_on, is_auto_update_stats_async_onFROM sys.databasesWHERE name ='<YourExpertDB>'; | Expected: In System Monitor Database >>Expert >> Statistics returns Orange warning || Step 3: Turn auto update statistics asynchronous on ALTER DATABASE <YourExpertDB> SET AUTO_UPDATE_STATISTICS_ASYNC ON; || Step 4: Once complete, open or refresh the System Monitor. | Expected: In System Monitor Database >>Expert >> Statistics returns Green pass || Step 5: Turn auto update statistics on ALTER DATABASE<YourExpertDB>SET AUTO_UPDATE_STATISTICS ON; || Step 6: Once complete, open or refresh the System Monitor. | Expected: In System Monitor Database >>Expert >> Statistics returns Green pass || Step 7: Turn both statistics offALTER DATABASE<YourExpertDB>SET AUTO_UPDATE_STATISTICS OFF; ALTER DATABASE<YourExpertDB>SET AUTO_UPDATE_STATISTICS_ASYNC OFF; || Step 8: Once complete, open or refresh the System Monitor. | Expected: In System Monitor Database >>Expert >> Statistics returns Orange warning

Title: Database Check - Database backup
Description: The System Health Monitor should return a warning if the database backup is more than 3 days old.
Steps: Step 1: In SSMS, for the Expert database || Step 2: On day 1, create a full backup in SSMS and check System Monitor | Expected: Database >> Expert >> Backup should return Green || Step 3: On day 2, create a differential/incremental backup in SSMS and check System Monitor | Expected: Database >> Expert >> Backup should return Green || Step 4: On day 5, check System Monitor | Expected: Database >> Expert >> Backup should return Orange Warning
