Steps: Step 1: In the Action activity, create and configure the extension point and create a new Rule that executes a simple Action e.g. Send Email || Step 2: In the Package editor, select "Workflow Projects" in the components panel | Expected: Workflow created in Step 1 is shown || Step 3: Select the Workflow and add it to the Package | Expected: -Workflow is added to the Pacakge-Extension point and Action created in Step 2-3 are also added to the Package || Step 4: Save and export the Package | Expected: Check the content of the package, it should contain workflow, extension point and Action || Step 5: Import the Package to another system | Expected: Workflow, extension point and Action is published to that systemVerify this in Design Studio - Expert Workflow > Published > Workflow Name

Title: SF3 - Create Form Set (Master Forms)
Steps: Step 1: Create a SmartForm or open an excisting form || Step 2: Add a Form Ribbon > Create New > Form | Expected: Form control added - nothing visible yet on preview || Step 3: In properties under Misc > Path: give full Path to a pre v3 SmartForm (e.g. FileOpening.ClientDetails ) Note: this is case sensitive | Expected: Form is shown on SmartForm || Step 4: Add another Form Ribbon > Create New > Form | Expected: Form control added - nothing visible yet on preview || Step 5: Select Form Ribon >Form > Select Form (Select a v3 Form) | Expected: Form is shown on SmartForm || Step 6: Change Layout properties | Expected: Bug 126349 - collapse or any layout won't change || Step 7: Edit v3 and v2 Form Ribon >Form > Edit Form | Expected: Form is opened in new tab - v2 orm asks for upgrade and upgrades to v3 formBug 126220 - upgraded form shown as duplicate || Step 8: Note: you might want to test here what happens when you change the form in edit , because of all the bugs not sure what will happen

Title: Design Studio - Checkbox Control - Label and Label Placement
Description:
Previously, for Checkbox Controls we had a Text property (on the right) and a Label property (on the left), but this got really confusing because sometimes people would use the text field and other times people would use the label field.
 
So now, we only have a label property, and clients are able to specify if the label is on the left or the right (defaulted to right).
Steps: Step 1: Launch Design Studio and create a new SmartForm under an existing Extension Point (e.g. Expert Billing > Forms > CreatePrebill > Create Prebill, right-click "Add Form" > "Create New") || Step 2: Enter a name for the Form and add a Checkbox control to the form. Under Properties > Content | Is Checked, add some valid input to make the control valid (e.g. BillSession.IsActive -- the valid input will be in bold) | Expected: When the control is valid, you'll see the checkbox control in the Preview Pane. Default Label is "Label" and default Label Placement is Right. || Step 3: Change the Label to be something other than the default - e.g. "Bill Session" and save. | Expected: The label in the Preview pane changes to the new label. Form is saved. || Step 4: Properties: Common > Is ReadOnly | True (change back to false after this step) | Expected: Field becomes a display text field that shows "Yes" or "No" depending on whether or not the checkbox was ticked || Step 5: Change the Label Placement to be Left. Save the form. | Expected: The label in the Preview pane moves from on the right of the Checkbox to be on the left (and like other labels - so it has : after the text). Changes are saved || Step 6: Properties: Common > Is ReadOnly | True | Expected: Field becomes a display text field that shows "Yes" or "No" depending on whether or not the checkbox was ticked || Step 7: Create a new SmartForm in SmartForm Wizard that contains a checkbox control with both Text and Label entered in the properties | Expected: Checkbox control in SmartForm Wizard still has the old properties - Text, Label, Label Alignment (with options "Top" and "Left") || Step 8: In Design Studio, go to Expert System > Forms (Respository) > Your New SmartForm - double click on the form and upgrade the form | Expected: When your form has upgraded, check the properties for the Checkbox control. The data you added in the Text property has gone, and the Label data has been retained and set as the new Label property. The Label Placement default is Right.

Title: Display Text Control - Display calculated expression (SF v2)
Description:
Adding a display text element to a form and setting the value to an expression (e.g. VariableA -  VariableB) should show results from the expression in the smartform
 
See Billing.DisbursmentSplit below:

Title: Design Studio - Add Local Variables to Shared Rules
Description:
This Test Covers:
- Rule Local Variables
     --> Add a Local Variable to a rule that is shared with more than one Extension Point
     --> Add a Local Variable to a rule and share the rule
 
Background:
We now have the ability to share one rule between several extension points that have compatible data contracts with the rule. You're able to create a rule under one extension point and then select that rule from another extension point so it can be used in both places. 


 
To check which data contracts are in a particular Extension Point, right-click on the Extension Point and click "Properties". This will bring you to a new tab where you can see what contracts are available. With regards to selecting an existing rule for this extension point, this just means that if you're using the Prebill Edit Disbursement Validation extension point, then you won't be able to select a rule with a condition of "Time.BaseHours > 1" as the "Time" contract is not in the list/available for this Extension Point. 

 
The rule can be edited under any of the extension points it is "shared" with and it will change for all - visually, it looks like there is just a rule with the same name under each extension point, but update one and they all update, rather than if you duplicated the rule and only the version you update gets updated.
 
With regards to the rule's contracts, a contract from the Extension Point will only be considered "on" the rule if the rule actually uses it. For example, if the rule is under Extension Points A (with Client contract) and B (with Client and Matter contracts), it will not have "Client" and "Matter" contracts unless the rule uses them (speaking in terms of what the compatibility checks check against). 
With regards to what is available to the rule in this scenario, it will depend on where the rule is opened from - if the rule is opened from under Extension Point A, only Client will be available to use. If it is opened from under Extension Point B, Client and Matter will be available.
When editing and saving a rule, a validation check will occur to determine whether the rule is still compatible with the other Extension Points it is shared with. For example, if the rule is opened under Extension Point B and the rule is changed to use the Matter contract, then a dialog will pop up when you try to save the rule which will notify you that the rule is no longer compatible with Extension Point A. From here, you have two options - remove the reference to the incompatible Extension Point, or cancel the save and change the rule so it remains compatible.
Note: Local Variables/Contracts should not affect the matching between Rules and Extension Points on both the select existing function and when saving.
 
When it comes to different versions of rules, the compatibility check will be additive - that means if you edit a rule as a new version and remove the use of Client (for example), the check that occurs when saving will still check for Client compatibility - Client will still be a part of the rule's contracts.
--> Different versions are created when you edit a rule on a different day you created it (24 hours after creation)
 
 
 
Note: there is a Usages tab which will show all the extension points/areas where the rule is used - there will be another test case for this, however.
(needs design)
Steps: Step 1: Launch Design Studio and navigate in the tree to Expert Billing > Validation Rules > (Choose an Extension Point (e.g. Prebill Edit Time Validation)). Right-click and "Add Rule" > "Create New" || Step 2: Enter a name for your rule and enter in a message (e.g. "Please Try Again" (with quotes)) || Step 3: Save the rule and close the tab || Step 4: Right-click on another Extension Point under the same area. "Add Rule" > "Select Existing". Choose your rule and add it to the Extension Point. Do this with a couple of other Extension Points as well.Note: Your rule should be compatible with any Extension Point as it isn't using any data contracts at this point | Expected: A window will pop up showing the available rules to select. The rules listed will have similar/compatible data contracts as the extension point you are adding a rule to (for example, most likely Expenses rules will not use the same data contracts as Billing rules).Your rule should now be seen under all the Extension Point nodes you added it to. || Step 5: Double-click or right-click and "Edit" the rule from under any of the Extension Points (doesn't matter which). || Step 6: Select "Data Variables" from the ribbon, and choose "Add...". Enter any Name (e.g. "LocalVariable"), add a Data Type of "Boolean", tick "Optional (Nullable)" and click "OK". Click "OK" again. || Step 7: Tick Conditional on your rule and add "[VariableName] = Null" to the When clause. Save your rule | Expected: Local variable has been added to the database for your rule with a SOURCE of "L". Rule is still shared with all the Extension Points without any issues. SELECT * FROM FWM_RULE_CONTRACT ORDER BY LAST_MODIFIED DESC || Step 8: Create a new rule under any Extension Point, add a Local Variable, and add a Condition of "[VariableName] = Null". Save this rule. | Expected: Local variable has been added to the database for your rule with a SOURCE of "L"SELECT * FROM FWM_RULE_CONTRACT ORDER BY LAST_MODIFIED DESC || Step 9: Right-click on another Extension Point and "Add Rule" > "Select Existing..." | Expected: The rule you created is in the list of available rules to select under the Extension Point you originally created it under || Step 10: Choose the second rule you created and add it to the Extension Point | Expected: No errors occur, the rule is shared with both Extension Points

Title: Design Studio - Sharing a Rule is Validated for Compatibility with Additive Contracts for Different Versions of the Rule
Description:
This Test Covers:
- Different Versions of Rules and their Contract Compatibility with Extension Points
     --> Remove "Time" (for example) Contract use from a rule in a new version of the rule and save, still can't share with Disbursement type Extension Points as the Rule is still considered to be using Time Contract (as it is using it in past Versions)
 
Background:
We now have the ability to share one rule between several extension points that have compatible data contracts with the rule. You're able to create a rule under one extension point and then select that rule from another extension point so it can be used in both places. 


 
To check which data contracts are in a particular Extension Point, right-click on the Extension Point and click "Properties". This will bring you to a new tab where you can see what contracts are available. With regards to selecting an existing rule for this extension point, this just means that if you're using the Prebill Edit Disbursement Validation extension point, then you won't be able to select a rule with a condition of "Time.BaseHours > 1" as the "Time" contract is not in the list/available for this Extension Point. 

 
The rule can be edited under any of the extension points it is "shared" with and it will change for all - visually, it looks like there is just a rule with the same name under each extension point, but update one and they all update, rather than if you duplicated the rule and only the version you update gets updated.
 
With regards to the rule's contracts, a contract from the Extension Point will only be considered "on" the rule if the rule actually uses it. For example, if the rule is under Extension Points A (with Client contract) and B (with Client and Matter contracts), it will not have "Client" and "Matter" contracts unless the rule uses them (speaking in terms of what the compatibility checks check against). 
With regards to what is available to the rule in this scenario, it will depend on where the rule is opened from - if the rule is opened from under Extension Point A, only Client will be available to use. If it is opened from under Extension Point B, Client and Matter will be available.
When editing and saving a rule, a validation check will occur to determine whether the rule is still compatible with the other Extension Points it is shared with. For example, if the rule is opened under Extension Point B and the rule is changed to use the Matter contract, then a dialog will pop up when you try to save the rule which will notify you that the rule is no longer compatible with Extension Point A. From here, you have two options - remove the reference to the incompatible Extension Point, or cancel the save and change the rule so it remains compatible.
Note: Local Variables/Contracts should not affect the matching between Rules and Extension Points on both the select existing function and when saving.
 
When it comes to different versions of rules, the compatibility check will be additive - that means if you edit a rule as a new version and remove the use of Client (for example), the check that occurs when saving will still check for Client compatibility - Client will still be a part of the rule's contracts.
--> Different versions are created when you edit a rule on a different day you created it (24 hours after creation)
 
 
 
Note: there is a Usages tab which will show all the extension points/areas where the rule is used - there will be another test case for this, however.
(needs design)
Steps: Step 1: Note: There are two ways you can run this test - either by changing the date on your computer (when told to do so) or to run this test over two days - to get a new version of a rule, you have to go and edit the rule on a new day. || Step 2: Launch Design Studio and navigate in the tree to Expert Billing > Validation Rules > (Choose an Extension Point (e.g. Prebill Edit Time Validation)). Right-click and "Add Rule" > "Create New" || Step 3: Enter a name for your rule and enter in a message (e.g. "Please Try Again" (with quotes)) || Step 4: Tick Conditional and add a condition specifc to the extension point (for example, if you're using one of the Time extension points, use "Time.BaseHours > 1") || Step 5: Save the rule and close the tab || Step 6: Right-click on another Extension Point under the same area that has the same/compatible data contracts that were used in your rule (e.g. Prebill Processing Time Validation). "Add Rule" > "Select Existing". Pick your rule and select "OK".Note: To check if the data contracts are compatible, right-click and "Properties" on the Extension Point. The Extension Point must contain the contract you used in your rule (in the example, that would be "Time"). | Expected: Rule is now shared with two Extension Points || Step 7: Close Design Studio.Either change the date on your computer to be tomorrow or some day in the future, or continue the rest of this test tomorrow (if you're doing this on an ITE, changing your computer date won't make a difference). || Step 8: Launch Design Studio and go back into your rule - you should be prompted with a yellow alert on the rule that the rule is now read-only and you must create a new version to be able to edit it. Click on the alert to create a new version. | Expected: Rule is now editable and if you go to the Versions tab you'll see there is a new version with the effective date of whatever you expect (i.e. what you changed your computer date to, or the day after you started this test). || Step 9: Remove the Condition on your rule so it's just a simple unconditional return activity rule. Save these changes. || Step 10: Right-click on an Extension Point this rule is not shared with that wouldn't match the previous Condition (e.g. Prebill Edit Disbursement Validation) and "Add Rule" > "Select Existing..." | Expected: Your Rule is still not available in the list || Step 11: SELECT * FROM FWM_RULE_CONTRACT ORDER BY LAST_MODIFIED DESC | Expected: Your Rule still has the Time (if you followed the examples, might be a different contract if you didn't) contract you used in the first version, and because the validation is additive, that means the Rule is not compatible with the Extension Point, regardless of you having removed the use of the contract in another version.

Title: WF Development - Initiate Dev Workflows with invalid definition entries
Description: These test scenarios could occur when the database was recovered from another environment/machine, which might have entries from previous releases or pointing to locations that does not exists on current machine.
Steps: Step 1: Create a new Workflow solution from Visual Studio | Expected: -A new Dev Workflow entry is created in WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION table, PHYSICALPATH value is the directory of the Workflow project (e.g. C:\WorkflowDevelopment\TestWorkflow1\)-The Dev Workflow entry is shown in Design Studio: Expert Workflow - Development - "Workflow Name" || Step 2: Manually modify the workflow entry and change physical path value to NULL:update WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION set PHYSICALPATH =NULL where NAME ='YourWorkflowName'Close and reopen Design Studio, navigate to Expert Workflow - Development - "YourWorkflowName', right click and choose 'Run' | Expected: You should see a warning icon next to the Workflow entry in Design Studio, the hover text should say "Physical path is blank"You should get an error message when you try to initiate the Workflow: "Workflow cannot start as physical path is blank" || Step 3: Manually modify the workflow entry and change physical path value to an invalid path:update WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION set PHYSICALPATH ='C:\Invalid' where NAME ='YourWorkflowName'Close and reopen Design Studio, navigate to Expert Workflow - Development - "YourWorkflowName', right click and choose 'Run' | Expected: You should see a warning icon next to the Workflow entry in Design Studio, the hover text should say "Physical path is invalid"You should get an error message when you try to initiate the Workflow: "Workflow cannot start as physical path is invalid" || Step 4: Manually modify the workflow entry and change physical path value to the orignal path:update WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION set PHYSICALPATH ='C:\ExpertDevelopment\YourWorkflowName' where NAME ='YourWorkflowName'Close and reopen Design Studio, navigate to Expert Workflow - Development - "YourWorkflowName', right click and choose 'Run' | Expected: The warning icon goes away and you are able to initiate the workflow, Dev workflow runner should start after you right click 'Run'

Title: Design Studio - Read-Only Controls 01 - Create a Form with Read-Only Controls
Description:
Optimised the "Read-Only" property on SmartForm Controls to convert to a DisplayText control when a field is marked as "Read-Only". This means that instead of the control just greying out and looking disabled when it become Read-Only, it will actually show like a DisplayText field - which means the user just sees the information in the control (e.g. Employee details, text entered, date, etc.) and can copy that information to paste elsewhere. 
 
This test covers the common controls that are used on forms:
- Search Box
- Numeric Box
- Date Picker
- Text Box
- Advanced Text Box
 
When the control is not Read-Only, it looks just as it used to, and is expected to:

But when the control is Read-Only, it looks like a DisplayText control (because it is):
Steps: Step 1: Launch Design Studio and navigate to a Form Point (e.g. Expert Billing > Forms > PrebillEdit > Bill Detail). Right-Click and "Add Form" > "Create New". || Step 2: Give your new Form a name and add these controls (tip: to easily add controls, go to the Data tab next to Properties and double click on fields to add them):- Textbox (e.g. Bill>BillAdjustmentReason)- Textbox (advanced) (e.g. Bill>CurrencyDisplay - Change to Textbox (adv))- Date Picker (e.g. Bill>BillDate)- Numeric Box (e.g. Bill>SpotExchangeRate)- Search Control (e.g. Bill>BillingEmployeeId) || Step 3: Add a Checkbox control to the formProperties: Content > Is Checked | (Create New Variable) -- call this variable "IsChecked" || Step 4: On all other controls:Properties: Common > Is ReadOnly | IsChecked || Step 5: Tick and Untick the Checkbox in the Preview pane and see the behaviour of the form | Expected: Controls (other than the Checkbox) should become Read-Only and be similar to DisplayText controls (simple display field, no calendar or search icons, etc.) when the Checkbox is ticked. When unticked, the controls should be as expected - Date Picker is a calendar control where you pick your date, Search Box you can click into it and search for a result, etc.. || Step 6: Save this Form || Step 7: Go to the Home tab in Design Studio -> "New Package" || Step 8: Enter a name for the package (e.g. ReadOnlyControlsForm)Components: SmartForms | [YourForm] -- Double-click to add to package | Expected: Note: Currently you have to write the full path to find your SmartForm (e.g. ExpertBilling.Forms.PrebillEdit.BillDetail.YourFormName || Step 9: "Export Package" in the Ribbon - "OK" to saving the package first | Expected: Package is exported successfully (to be used in linked test)

Title: SF3 - Grid - Numeric box should display nothing (Empty cell) for NULL or Empty value
Description: This test case should merge into Grid Smartform - Numeric Box test case in the future
Steps: Step 1: Create a new smartform in DesignStudio || Step 2: In "Data Variables" (Contracts), add Client collection || Step 3: Create New 'Data Grid' bind its 'Source' to the 'Client' collection || Step 4: Change the value in Allow Adding Rows from FALSE to TRUE || Step 5: Double click on the new 'Data Grid' || Step 6: Create New 'Numeric Box', bind 'Value' to the Item.Number || Step 7: Save the Smartform and run it in Test harness || Step 8: In the Grid, Click on the '+ Add New' button | Expected: A new row is appeared with a numeric box || Step 9: Enter 123 || Step 10: Click Add button | Expected: A new row is added with new added value || Step 11: Click on the '+ Add New' button again || Step 12: Click Add button without adding any new data | Expected: A new row is created with no values (Empty cell) || Step 13: Delete all new created rows | Expected: All new rows is removed

Title: Design Studio - Read-Only Controls 02 - Consume a Form with Read-Only Controls
Description:
Optimised the "Read-Only" property on SmartForm Controls to convert to a DisplayText control when a field is marked as "Read-Only". This means that instead of the control just greying out and looking disabled when it become Read-Only, it will actually show like a DisplayText field - which means the user just sees the information in the control (e.g. Employee details, text entered, date, etc.) and can copy that information to paste elsewhere. 
 
This test covers the common controls that are used on forms:
- Search Box
- Numeric Box
- Date Picker
- Text Box
- Advanced Text Box
 
When the control is not Read-Only, it looks just as it used to, and is expected to:

But when the control is Read-Only, it looks like a DisplayText control (because it is):
Steps: Step 1: Note: Please run test 126969 first. If you're working on a different environment as when you ran 126969, import the package created in the first test into your second environment. || Step 2: Launch Design Studio and open the SmartForm created in 126969 || Step 3: Click on "Open in Test Harness" in the Ribbon | Expected: SmartForm Test Host opens as a new tab in Design Studio || Step 4: Enter some data into all the Controls (ignore the Checkbox control for now) | Expected: All controls behave as expected- Date Picker drops down a calendar and you can select a date- SearchBox allows you to search for a result (e.g. search for an Employee/Client/Matter depending on what your searchbox is for) and then select the desired result- Textbox and Textbox (advanced) let you type into the field, both numbers and letters- NumericBox allows you to type numbers into the field || Step 5: Tick the Checkbox | Expected: All fields other than Checkbox become Read-Only DisplayText fields - can't type into any of the fields, they're all visibly disabled (darker background in field). You're able to copy the data entered in the field/s and paste elsewhere. || Step 6: Untick the Checkbox | Expected: Fields return to their original state of being different controls and behave as they did before you made them Read-Only.

Title: Design Studio - DisplayText Control - Display a Value with a Currency
Description:
In v1 and v2 SmartForms, we had two DisplayText controls - a normal DisplayText and a CurrencyDisplayText. Because it didn't make much sense in having two controls, in v3 SmartForms we have implemented the ability to support currency in the DisplayText control.
 
When upgrading v1 and/or v2 SmartForms, the CurrencyDisplayText control/s should upgrade to DisplayText controls with the appropriate properties kept.
Creating a new SmartForm with a DisplayText control should work as usual - we just have a "CurrencyId" property and you have to change the "Display Format" to be either "Currency" or "CurrencyWithCodeAsPrefix".
 
Currency = $, £, C$, €
CurrencyWithCodeAsPrefix = USD, GBP, CAD, EUR
Steps: Step 1: Launch Design Studio and create a new form under a Form Point (e.g. Expert Billing > Forms > PrebillEdit > TimeSplit). Name the form and create the following controls: || Step 2: SearchBox ControlProperties: Content > Data Provider | CurrencyContent > Selected Item | [Create a new variable - Variable1] || Step 3: NumericBox ControlProperties:Content > Value | [Create a New Variable - Variable2] || Step 4: DisplayText ControlProperties:Content > Value | [Variable2]Appearance > Display Format | CurrencyContent > Currency Id | [Variable1].Id || Step 5: In the Preview pane, fill in the SearchBox and NumericBox fields | Expected: DisplayText field will pick up the number you write in the NumericBox field and the currency you pick in the SearchBox field to display something like "£123.45" || Step 6: Change the DisplayText control:Properties: Appearance > Display Format | CurrencyWithCodeAsPrefix | Expected: Data from before should still be in the SearchBox and NumericBox fields (if it's not, enter data again). DisplayText field displays something like "GBP123.45" || Step 7: Launch SmartForm Wizard and create a new SmartForm with a CurrencyDisplayText control on it. Save this SmartForm. || Step 8: In Design Studio, find the SmartForm you created under Expert System > Forms (Repository), double-click and Upgrade the form | Expected: Form opens up in a new tab after upgrading and the CurrencyDisplayText control is now a DisplayText control - the appropraite fields (such as Currency Id) are filled in as you would expect.

Title: EDE - Generate Region (Site) specific exes and configs for Workflow support
Description:
EDE Test Environment in AKL:
 
Global SQL Server: SVSQL305
Global Database: MASTER_80SP3_AKL_GLOBAL
 
North SQL Server: SVFWKSQL301
North Database: MASTER_80SP3_AKL_NORTH
North Expert Application Server: VMAKLFWK01
North ExpertShare: \\VMAKLFWK01\AderantExpert\ExpertShare
 
South SQL Server: SVFWKSQL302
South Database: MASTER_80SP3_AKL_SOUTH
South Expert Application Server: VMAKLFWK02
South ExpertShare: \\VMAKLFWK02\AderantExpert\ExpertShare
 
 
 
The PS script needs to be copied to ExpertShare folder on any site/region and run from there: Run PowerShell as admin, change diretory to ExpertShare and run .\EDE_app_setup.ps1 
 
-          Environment details are picked from FWM_ENVIRONMENT table, so you will need to ensure that the entries in this table are all valid (Clean up invalid ones) before running this script. (e.g. All participating EDE nodes should have an entry in this table)

 
-          For now we only setup Expensesand Prebill. You can easily add additional applications in the script by adding a new line under $apps and specify the application exe name.

 
-          The modified files all outputs to C:\Temp\EDE, this can be changed by specifying $TargetPathRoot.
 
-          Output folder should look like below. Check that files are renamed correctly with actual environment name, check the config files are in UTF-8 encoding, check the content of the config files that North configs have binding URL to North server and South configs have binding to South server.

 
-          All generated files need to be copied to ExpertShares of all participating environments/servers.
Steps: Step 1: EDE patch location:\\svnas301\internal\team\ExpertCRT\Expert 8.0\8.0.3.0\Patch 2509 - HSF EDE patch || Step 2: Copy EDE_app_setup.ps1 in the patch zip to ExpertShare in North || Step 3: Check FWM_ENVIRONMENT table | Expected: Should have environment entries for North and South || Step 4: Run Powershell as Admin, and run EDE_app_setup.ps1 - This script creates environment specific exes for Expenses and Prebill. Also creates environment specific config files for Instance and client. See attachment for output example | Expected: -Outputs to c:\temp\ede-Check that files are renamed correctly with actual environment name-Check the config files are in UTF-8 encoding-Check the content of the config files that North configs have binding URL to North server and South configs have binding to South server.

Title: EDE - Access Workflow Tasks of foreign regions
Description:
EDE Test Environment in AKL:
 
Global SQL Server: SVSQL305
Global Database: MASTER_80SP3_AKL_GLOBAL
 
North SQL Server: SVFWKSQL301
North Database: MASTER_80SP3_AKL_NORTH
North Expert Application Server: VMAKLFWK01
North ExpertShare: \\VMAKLFWK01\AderantExpert\ExpertShare
 
South SQL Server: SVFWKSQL302
South Database: MASTER_80SP3_AKL_SOUTH
South Expert Application Server: VMAKLFWK02
South ExpertShare: \\VMAKLFWK02\AderantExpert\ExpertShare
Steps: Step 1: To run this test you need to have an EDE environment of at least 2 nodes (Regions). Eg. North and South || Step 2: See Test Case 127376 for Workflow setup in EDE | Expected: Workflow processes and tasks are owned by a specific environment. Environment details are in FWM_ENVIRONMENT tableWorkflow and Task tables have a ENVIRONMENT_ID column that defines which environment a WF or Task belongs to(WFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARY and WFM_TASK table) || Step 3: Start a Standard Workflow - File Opening in North | Expected: Check FWM_ENVIRONMENT table for North's environment IDCheck WFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARY and WFM_TASK that the FileOpening workflow and Matter Intake task has North's environment iD || Step 4: Open FiddlerOpen Matter Intake task from ExpertAssistant in South and fill in all required fields and complete the intake task | Expected: In fiddler you should see that all workflow traffic is going to North services || Step 5: Create an Expense report and initiate an Expense approval in Expert Expenses in North || Step 6: Open the Expense Approval Task in South | Expected: Expenses.North.exe is launched when you open the Expense approval taskAll traffic like expense detail queries are going to North services - This means that data is always retrieved from workflow's origin environment

Title: Design Studio - Form Elements - Address Book Control
Steps: Step 1: Open any SmartForm in Design Studio || Step 2: Ribbon > Items > Create New | Address Book ControlProperties: Content > Addresses > Create New VariableContent > SelectedAddress > Create New Variable | Expected: Address Book Control is added to the SmartForm Preview || Step 3: Click on the Address Control on the Preview Screen | Expected: An "Address Book" window pops up with Address Type, Country, and Street 1 as required fields. || Step 4: Click on Cancel in the ribbon | Expected: Window closes and no address is added to the Preview || Step 5: Click on the Address Control on the Preview Screen. Fill in the required fields and check the Save and Close button becomes enabled (after clicking into another field). Fill in the other fields on the form, and Save and Close | Expected: Save and Close button becomes enabled once you've entered all the required fields and clicked into another field.In the Preview, the Address Book control displays all the information you entered || Step 6: Click on the Address Book Control on the Preview Screen | Expected: A dropdown shows with the address you just created and options to edit the address or add a new address when you hover over it

Title: Form Elements - Duration Picker Control
Description:
Duration Picker Controls - Covering:
*IsRequired (True/False)
*Input formats
*Button Mode options (AddReplace/None)
*Display Mode options (DaysHoursMinutes/HoursMinutes/HoursMinutesSeconds/Decimal)
*Fast Edit Mode (True/False)
*OnValidate (unconditional rule)
Steps: Step 1: Open any SmartForm in Design Studio || Step 2: Ribbon > Items > Create New | Duration Picker ControlProperties: Content > Value | Create New Variable (you'll need to change this variable to be of type "TimeSpan")Label > Label | "Duration" | Expected: Duration Picker Control is added to the SmartForm Preview with the label "Duration" || Step 3: Properties: Common > Is Required | True | Expected: Form shows (at least) 1 Required in the top right corner - hover over this and "Required: - Duration" will be in the list || Step 4: Click into the Duration field on the Preview screen - use the keypad, [TAB], [ENTER] and arrow keys to select different times | Expected: A time picker control opens up when you click into the field and you're able to use a combination of typing the number to navigate to it (e.g. type "22" will move the focus onto the number 22), [TAB] to focus on the Minutes section and then use the arrow keys to move around the numbers and enter to select the one you want and close the Time Picker || Step 5: Type letters into the field | Expected: Error around the control is shown || Step 6: Type in different formats (e.g. "1h 1m", "1.1") and [TAB] out of the field | Expected: HHMM and decimal formats are both accepted and solved to be in "1h2m" format || Step 7: a) Properties: Content > Display Mode | DaysHoursMinutes (Result #1)b) Properties: Content > Display Mode | HoursMinutes (Result #2)c) Properties: Content > Display Mode | HoursMinutesSeconds (Result #3)d) Properties: Content > Display Mode | Decimal (Result #4) | Expected: #1) Duration is displayed in DDHHMM format (e.g. 1d 9h 24m)#2) Duration is displayed in HHMM format (e.g. 33h 24m)#3) Duration is displayed in HHMMSS format (e.g. 33h 24m 0s)#4) Duration is displayed in a decimal format (e.g. 33.40) || Step 8: a) Properties: Content > Button Mode | AddReplace (Result #1)b) Properties: Content > Button Mode | None (Result #2) | Expected: #1) When you click into the field, you get options to either "Add" or "Replace" the amount you select - "Add" will add the selected amount to the original, and "Replace" will just change the original value to be the new duration you've selected#2) When you click into the field, you don't get the options "Add" or "Replace" at the bottom of the picker - instead, when you select a duration (double click), it just replaces the original value || Step 9: a) Properties: Content > Fast Edit Mode | False (Result #1)b) Properties: Content > Fast Edit Mode | True (Result #2) | Expected: #1) When you click into the field, a Time Picker opens and you can use that or click into the field again to type#2) When you click into the field, no Time Picker opens and you can freely type straight away || Step 10: Properties: Events > On Validate | Click on "..."Create an unconditional rule by just adding a message such as "This Duration Picker Control will always have a validation error.". Save and Close the rule. | Expected: Form shows (at least) 1 Required at the top right - hover over this and "Invalid: - Duration - This Duration Picker Control will always have a validation error." will be in the list

Title: Form Elements - Numeric Box Control
Description:
Numeric Box Controls - Covering:
*Input (only numeric characters)
*IsRequired (True/False)
*Leading Text
*Decimal Places
*Trailing Text
*OnValidate (unconditional rule)
 
Also cover data binding:
-Int16
-Nullable Int16
-Int32
-Nullable Int32
-Int64
-Nullable Int64
-Double
-Nullable Double
-Decimal
-Nullable Decimal
Steps: Step 1: Open any SmartForm in Design StudioOr Create a New SmartForm | Expected: SmartForm editor opens || Step 2: Open Data variable (Contract) from Ribbon bar and create each of the following type:-Int16-Nullable Int16-Int32-Nullable Int32-Int64-Nullable Int64-Double-Nullable Double-Decimal-Nullable Decimal || Step 3: Check that you can bind the above data types to a Numeric Box controlCheck the behavior for non-null and nullable data types | Expected: Non-nullable types: -Defaults to 0-Control raises error when there is no input valueNullable types:-Defaults to empty (Null)-Control accepts null values || Step 4: Check other properties of Numeric Box ControlRibbon > Items > Create New | Numeric Box ControlProperties: Value > Bind to Decimal dataContent > Value > Create New VariableLabel > Label | "Numeric Box" | Expected: Numeric Box control is added to SmartForm Preview with the label "Numeric Box" || Step 5: Type into the control a variation of letters, numbers, and symbols | Expected: Only the numbers and decimal places will work in the field - alphabet characters and symbols can not be entered || Step 6: Properties: Common > IsRequired | True | Expected: Form shows (at least) 1 Required at the top right - hover over this and "Required: - Numeric Box" will be in the list || Step 7: Properties: Appearance > Leading Text | "abc"Type a number into the field and [TAB] out | Expected: Value shown has "abc" before the number you entered (e.g. "abc1.23") || Step 8: a) Properties: Appearance > Decimal Places | 4 (Result #1)b) Properties: Appearance > Decimal Places | 1 (Result #2) | Expected: #1) When you type a number, you can type up to 4 decimal places before you get an error - e.g. 1.1234 doesn't have an error but 1.12345 does#2) When you type a number, you can type up to 1 decimal place before you get an error - e.g. 1.1 doesn't have an error but 1.12 does || Step 9: Properties: Appearance > Maximum | 4Properties: Appearance > Minimum | 1a) Type a number between 1 and 4 (e.g. 1.5) (Result #1)b) Type a number outside of 1-4 (e.g. 4.5) (Result #2) | Expected: #1) No error is shown#2) An error is shown stating either that the number must be less than 4 or greater than 1 (the error you get depends on which end of the scale your number is on) || Step 10: Properties: Appearance > Trailing Text | "abc"Type a number into the field and [TAB] out | Expected: Value shown has "abc" after the number you entered (e.g. "1.23abc") || Step 11: Properties: Events > On Validate | Click on "..."Create an unconditional rule by just adding a message such as "This Numeric Box Control will always have a validation error.". Save and Close the rule. | Expected: Form shows (at least) 1 Required at the top right - hover over this and "Invalid: - Numeric Box - This Numeric Box Control will always have a validation error." will be in the list

Save and Close the rule. | Expected: Form shows (at least) 1 Required at the top right - hover over this and "Invalid: - Radio Button - This Radio Button Control will always have a validation error." will be in the list

Title: Form Elements - Text Box Control
Description:
Text Box Controls - Covering:

Steps: Step 1: Open any SmartForm in Design Studio || Step 2: Ribbon > Items > Create New | Text BoxProperties: Content > Text | Create New VariableLabel > Label | "Text Box" | Expected: Text Box Control is added to the SmartForm Preview with the label "Text Box" || Step 3: Properties: Common > IsRequired | True | Expected: Form shows (at least) 1 Required at the top right - hover over this and "Required: - Text Box" will be in the list || Step 4: Change the property below as shown and at each change, type in a variety of alphabetic and numeric characters, and symbolsa) Properties: Appearance > Characters Allowed | All (Result #1)b) Properties: Appearance > Characters Allowed | Numeric (Result #2)c) Properties: Appearance > Characters Allowed | AlphaNumeric (Result #3)d) Properties: Appearance > Characters Allowed | PositiveInteger (Result #4) | Expected: #1) All characters are accepted - e.g. "123abc!@#"#2) Only numeric characters show in the field, typing alphabetic characters and symbols doesn't show up in the field, and negative numbers are allowed - e.g. "-123.00"#3) Alphabetic and numeric characters show in the field - e.g. "123abc"#4) Only numeric characters show in the field, and you cannot make a negative number (e.g. "-" doesn't work) - e.g. "123.00" || Step 5: Enter some text into the field and change the following propertya) Properties: Appearance > Show Clear Button | True (Result #1)b) Properties: Appearance > Show Clear Button | False (Result #2) | Expected: #1) An 'x' button is visible at the end of the field to clear the field of any data when clicked#2) Nothing is visible in the field to allow the user to easily remove anything from the field || Step 6: Properties: Events > On Validate | Click on "..."Create an unconditional rule by just adding a message such as "This Text Box Control will always have a validation error.". Save and Close the rule. | Expected: Form shows (at least) 1 Required at the top right - hover over this and "Invalid: - Text Box - This Text Box Control will always have a validation error." will be in the list

Title: WF Development - Right click menu options for Workflow entries in Design Studio

Title: WF Development - Workflow Runner app shows Rule\Action execution log
Description: Rules/Actions execution logs are shown in Workflow runner app.
Steps: Step 1: Create a Dev Workflow Solution in Visual Studio || Step 2: Add the following activities to the workflow:-Validation: Create a new validation rule that returns Error with any error message-Action: Create a new action that sends an email to yourself-Rule: Create a Boolean Rule that returns false || Step 3: Run the dev workflow from Visual Studio || Step 4: In the workflow Runner app, start a new workflow instance | Expected: After the workflow starts, you should see execution logs of the rules\actions created in #2 (See attachment for example)

Title: Design Studio - Share Forms 01 - Add an Existing Form to Another Form Point
Description:
This Test Covers:
The ability to select an existing form to use at another form point
- Select Existing right-click function
- Toggle the "Only show compatible items" option
- Use the search function at the top of the dialog
 
Background:
We now have the ability to share one form between several form points that have compatible data contracts with the form. You're able to create a form under one form point and then select that form from another form point so it can be used in both places.
<Image>
To check which data contracts are in a particular Form Point, right-click on the Form Point and click "Properties". This will bring you to a new tab where you can see what contracts are available. With regards to selecting an existing form for this form point, this just means that if you're using the Disbursement Split form point, then you won't be able to select a form using any data from a "Time" contract (e.g. a form under "Time Split"), as the Time contract is not in the list/available for this Form Point. 
<Image>
The form can be edited under any of the form points it is "shared" with and it will change for all - visually, it looks like there is just a form with the same name under each form point, but update one and they all update, rather than if you duplicated the form and only the version your update gets updated.
Steps: Step 1: More information on data contracts and validations done can be found in the Summary page. || Step 2: Launch Design Studio and navigate in the tree to Expert Billing > Forms > (Choose a Form Point (e.g. Time Split)).Right-click and "Add Form" > "Create New" || Step 3: Enter a name for your form and add a Hyperlink control || Step 4: Save the form and close the tab || Step 5: Right-click on another Form Point under the same area. "Add Form" > "Select Existing" | Expected: A window will pop up showing the available forms to select. The forms listed will use similar/compatible data contracts as the form point you are adding a form to.By default, "Show only compatible items" is ticked || Step 6: Toggle the "Only show compatible items" option on and off | Expected: With the option set to True, only forms that are compatible will be shown and are able to be selected (e.g. you will not see any v1/v2 forms)With the option set to False, all forms are shown in the list, but those that are not compatible are disabled/greyed out and cannot be selected || Step 7: Search for your form in the search field at the top | Expected: Search field searches/filters forms correctly. Results will be filtered down and text highlights what matches your search input || Step 8: Select the form you created earlier and click on "OK" | Expected: The form is added to the list of forms under the Form Point

Title: Check editing Workflow variables in Visual Studio will update all extension point contracts under that workflow
Steps: Step 1: Create a Workflow in Visual Studio. Add a Rule activity, Validation activity and Action activity on to the designer. || Step 2: For each activities, configure and save. || Step 3: In Visual studio perform the following actions:(Check expected result for each action, rebuild Workflow solution for each action)a. Create new Workflow variables of type String, Boolean, Client, Matter.b. Change the names of those Workflow variablesc. Change the type of those Workflow variablesd. Delete those Workflow variables | Expected: In Design Studio the properties of the Rule\Validation\Action points you added in step 1 should be updated:a. New variables are added to the contract list with correct data type and data source of "Provided by Application"b. Contract name are updatedc. Contract data type are updatedd. Contracts are removed

Title: Design Studio - Share Forms 02 - Edit a Form shared with more than one Form Point
Steps: Step 1: Please run test 128185 before running this one to set up a form shared with multiple Form Points || Step 2: Launch Design Studio and navigate to Expert Billing > Forms > (select a Form Point that shares your form) || Step 3: Double-click or right-click and "Edit" on a form that is shared with more than one Form Point. Check the available Data Variables/Contracts | Expected: Available Data Variables/Contracts are only those from the Fomr Point you opened the form from || Step 4: Make some changes to the rule - e.g. change the label on one of the controls, or change the name of the form. Save the changes and close the form | Expected: SELECT * FROM FWM_SMARTFORM ORDER BY LAST_MODIFIED DESCSELECT * FROM FWM_SMARTFORM_DELTA ORDER BY LAST_MODIFIED DESCThe changes made are saved to the database || Step 5: Open the form from under another of the Form Points and look for your changes | Expected: Changes you made on the form are shown in all places that the form is shared to - no matter where you open the form from, it is actually opening the same form || Step 6: Make a change to your form that would make it no longer compatible with all the shared Form Points and save the changesHow to -> Add controls using the Data pane on the right and double-clicking on several controls that are available to you | Expected: When you save, a dialog pops up warning you that the changes you've made make the form no longer compatible with another Form Point || Step 7: Choose "Cancel Saving" | Expected: User is returned back to the form - changes have not been saved but are still on the form, form is "dirty". || Step 8: Save the rule again - this time choose "Replace Association" | Expected: User is prompted with a dialogue to give a new name to the form || Step 9: Create a new name for your form and click "OK" | Expected: A new form is created with all the changes you made. The old form has been removed from under the Form Point and replaced by the new form. All other Form Points still contain the old form, which is as it was before you made any changes.

Title: Invoke action to run a scheduled job
Steps: Step 1: Pre-condition: You need a Dev Environment. || Step 2: Add a new action to the extension point - Go to Design Studio, right click on the extension point, Add Action > Create New | Expected: New action dialog pop up || Step 3: In the dialog, fill in Action name. In the Activity dropdown, select "Schedule Job" || Step 4: In the properties panel:-select Environment Validation in Job dropdown-select Occurs: OneTime-select Start: Time Now || Step 5: After workflow starts, open Schedule Manager. Check a new schedule for Environment validation is created and completed

Title: Invoke action to assign values to Workflow variables
Steps: Step 1: Pre-condition: You need a Dev Environment. || Step 2: Open Workflow.xamlx and create Workflow variables of the following:-Name: TestString, Type: String-Name: TestBoolean, Type: Boolean-Name: TestInt, Type: Int32-Name: TestClient, Type: Client (ViewModel) || Step 3: Connect the activity with 'Start' node || Step 4: Add a new action to the extension point - Go to Design Studio, right click on the extension point, Add Action > Create New | Expected: New action dialog pop up || Step 5: In the dialog, fill in Action name. In the Activity dropdown, select "Assign".Select "TestString" in To field, and enter a string in the Value field (e.g. SmrvIOmRp3) || Step 6: Click on "Add Line"Select "Assign" as Activity.Select "TestBoolean" in To field, enter TRUE in value field || Step 7: Click on "Add Line"Select "Assign" as ActivitySelect "TestInt" in To field, enter 1234567890 in Value field || Step 8: Click on "Add Line"Select "Query" as ActivitySelect From: Client; Where: Item.Id = 1Select TestClient in Result field || Step 9: Add a 'Log' activity from Toolbox panel, add it to the designer and connect it below the action activity || Step 10: Set Log level = ErrorSet Log Message = TestString + TestBoolean.ToString + TestInt.ToString + TestClient.DisplayName || Step 11: After workflow starts, check the log window of Workflow runner app | Expected: Should see an error logged with error message: SmrvIOmRp3TRUE1234567890Arden Industries || Step 12: In Design Studio, edit the action and change values for all activities || Step 13: Run the workflow again | Expected: Should see updated error message

Title: Invoke actions that are not active
Steps: Step 1: Create a Workflow that invokes an action (For details, see TestCase 126167, 128264) || Step 2: Change the actions to inactive in Design Studio || Step 3: Run the workflow | Expected: In log window, you should see that those actions are inactive and skipped

Title: Invoke Rules that return a ViewModel
Steps: Step 1: Set 'Result type' to StringCreate a new Result variable of type 'String' then click on 'Configure'-In the pop up window (Expert Workflow Rule), click on 'Save & Close' | Expected: In Design Studio, check that 'Expert Workflow Rule' extension point is created under Expert Workflow>Development>"YourWorkflowName">Expert Workflow RuleThe extension point entry is created in FWM_EXTENSION_POINT table. Check by: select * from FWM_EXTENSION_POINT order by LAST_MODIFIED desc || Step 2: Right click on 'Expert Workflow Rule'Select Add Rule> Create New || Step 3: Change Activity from Return to QuerySet From to ClientSet Where to Item.Id = 1Select Create new Variable in Result: ClientQueryResult || Step 4: Add a new line, set Activity to ReturnEnter ClientQueryResult as Return value || Step 5: Save & close the Rule | Expected: Rule is created under 'Expert Workflow Rule' extension point also check database: select * from FWM_RULE order by LAST_MODIFIED descRULE_KEY value should be extension point PATH + Rule name || Step 6: Start the workflow from Workflow runner app | Expected: Should see Rule execution logs: Rule returns Client Arden Industries

Title: Design Studio - Hyperlink Control Link Placement
Description:
We have four scenarios for the placement of the link for a Hyperlink Control:
 
With Show Label = True and Text Wrapping = True

 
With Show Label = True and Text Wrapping = False

 
With Show Label = False and Text Wrapping = True

 
With Show Label = False and Text Wrapping = False
Steps: Step 1: Launch Design Studio and open an existing SmartForm - make the SmartForm layout be 2 or 3 columns (e.g. Properties: Layout > Columns | 2 Columns) || Step 2: Ribbon > Items > Create New | Hyperlink Control | Expected: Hyperlink control is added to the SmartForm Preview. Default for Content > Text Wrapping is True and Label > Show Label is True. || Step 3: Ribbon > Items > Create New | Textbox ControlProperties:Content > Text | Create New Variable "TextboxVariable" || Step 4: Enter a long value into the Textbox control - something that is longer than the column width || Step 5: Hyperlink Advanced Properties:Appearance > Tooltip | TextboxVariableFor each of the following steps, hover over the Hyperlink link and check the tooltip | Expected: The tooltip should show the full link, even if the control is set to trim the text (i.e. Text Wrapping = False) || Step 6: Hyperlink Properties:Label > Label | "" (i.e. empty string)Content > Display Text | TextboxVariable | Expected: When the link is long, it will follow on to a second lineLink is shown in line with the other controls - i.e. not the label, but the control itself || Step 7: Hyperlink Properties:Content > Text Wrapping | TrueLabel > Show Label | False | Expected: When the link is long, it will follow on to a second lineLink is shown in line with the other labels || Step 8: Hyperlink Properties:Content > Text Wrapping | FalseLabel > Show Label | False | Expected: When the link is long, it will end on the first line in "..." to display to the user that the link exceeds the length of the columnLink is shown in line with the other labels || Step 9: Hyperlink Properties:Content > Text Wrapping | FalseLabel > Show Label | True | Expected: When the link is long, it will end on the first line in "..." to display to the user that the link exceeds the length of the columnLink is shown in line with the other controls - i.e. not the label, but the control itself

Title: Product - End-to-End View and Edit Form Information from Within an Application
Description:
This Test Covers:
> Customization Mode by a User who does not have access to Design Studio
> Customization Mode by a User who does have access to Design Studio
> Using the Refresh button in the Form Information window
> Customization Mode in apps that have v1/v2 forms and v3 forms without a form point
> Customization Mode in apps that have v3 forms with a form point
> Edit on Form Point
> Edit on Form
 
There is now a new option in the help dropdown which will enable the customization mode feature.
 

 
When in customization mode, all form embedded in applications will get a border around them and provide a "customize" button.
 
 

Pressing the buttion will show the form information dialog which allows editing of the form if you have rights to design studio. If the form host is hosting a non-form point form, the button will not be available.
Steps: Step 1: Launch a product app (e.g. Billing) that has v3 SmartForms as a user who has the ability to launch Design Studio (e.g. with Privilege Level 1) | Expected: Note: the SmartForms have to be v3 (or newer) and must be associated to a Form Point to use this feature || Step 2: Click on the Help ? in the top right corner and make sure "Customization Mode" is turned on || Step 3: Navigate around the app and find some SmartForms (e.g. Time Card, Create Prebills > New Session Information) | Expected: All SmartForms are shown to have a border and the area is brought to the user's attention (i.e. you can tell what is a form and what isn't). V1/V2 SmartForms and V3 SmartForms that aren't referenced at a Form point don't show a "Customize" button in the top right corner of the form, but V3 SmartForms referenced at a Form Point do. || Step 4: Find a V3 (or newer) SmartForm and click on the Customize button in the corner of the form | Expected: A Form Information window pops up that contains information about the Form Point and the Forms shown. There are Edit buttons for the Form Point and for each of the Associated Forms || Step 5: Click on "Edit" next to the Form Location (Form Point) details | Expected: Design Studio launches and the Form Point Properties opens in a new window. User is able to make changes where appropriate for their privilege level (can't do much when not in Dev mode) || Step 6: Go back to your Product app and click on "Edit" next to one of the Associated Forms | Expected: The Form opens in a new window and the user is able to make changes to the form || Step 7: Edit some of the label names for a couple of the controls. Make a note of these changes so you can change them back after this step. Save the changes in Design Studio. In the Product app, click on the Refresh button in the Form Information window. | Expected: On Refresh, the form in the app will refresh and show the changes you made to the form in Design Studio || Step 8: Close the Form Information window and close the app. || Step 9: Launch the app again as a user who does not have security permission to launch Design Studio (e.g. TTQA1) || Step 10: Navigate through the app again in Customization Mode and find the same form you were looking at earlier. Click on Customize in the corner of the form | Expected: The Form Information window pops up, but the Edit buttons are disabled. The user can see the details of the Form Point and which forms are associated with it, but can't open the forms in Design Studio

Title: Pop-up form window resizes automatically according to the size of Smartform
Description:
Setup:
For this test, we need to create 3 SmartForms:
1. Has at least 15 controls on it, any controls are fine
- Create a new SmartForm under Expert System > Forms (Repository) | Right-Click > Create New
- Enter in a name for the form, and click on Data Variables in the Ribbon
- Add a new Data Variable - e.g. Name: Client, Data Type: Client
- Go to the Data pane on the right side of Design Studio, and double click on Client to add it to the form
- Enter a Client in the SmartForm Preview and then add at least 14 other fields to the form (I generally choose those that have data next to them e.g. Code, DepartmentId, DisplayName, DisplaySecondary, etc. - if any fields have errors, just delete them entirely off the form and choose another, the fields themselves don't matter in this case)
- Save the SmartForm
 
2. Has at least 15 controls on it, and form has 3 columns
- [Repeat above steps, but create a Matter Data Variable]
- Click on the Form header (where you entered the form name)
- Properties: Layout > Columns | 3 Columns
- Save the SmartForm
 
3. Has at least one control that will show/hide other controls (e.g. checkbox)
- [Repeat SmartForm1 steps, create an Employee Data Variable]
- Ribbon: Items > Create New > Check Box (create a new variable for the Is Checked property e.g. YesNo)
- Edit several of your controls so that the Common > IsVisible property is set to be dependent on the Checkbox created above (i.e. IsVisible = YesNo)
- Save the SmartForm
Steps: Step 1: Window size fits the size of Smartform its hosting:-Smartforms in 3 columns-Multi-Smartforms-Smartform size changes in runtime || Step 2: Setup:Create 3 SmartForms (see Summary for details on how):1. Has at least 15 controls on it, any controls are fine2. Has at least 15 controls on it, and form has 3 columns3. Has at least one control that will show/hide other controls (e.g. checkbox) || Step 3: Launch Design Studio and create a new Action under Expert Assitant > Menus > Actions Menu. Set the Activity to be SmartForm and select the first form you created above in Properties (Appearance > SmartForms). || Step 4: Set the SmartForm Size > Dialog Size property to "SizeToContent" and Save and Run the Action | Expected: Window opens containing the form and is a sensible size - if the form is larger than the screen, the window will have a scroll bar and will not exceed the height/width of the screen. || Step 5: Properties: Appearance > SmartForms | Add the second form you created (Create data variables where appropriate) || Step 6: Run the Action | Expected: Window opens containing the form and is a sensible size - if the form is larger than the screen, the window will have a scroll bar and will not exceed the height/width of the screen. The columns aren't squashed to fit in the form to the smallest possible size it can be - the window width is appropriate to fit all the fields in all columns in the form (a scroll bar appears if the window would exceed the width of the screen) || Step 7: Properties: Appearance > SmartForms | Add the third form you created (Create data variables where appropriate) || Step 8: Run the Action | Expected: Window opens containing the form and is a sensible size - if the form is larger than the screen, the window will have a scroll bar and will not exceed the height/width of the screen. || Step 9: In the window, change the checkbox (or other control) which will show/hide the fields on the third form | Expected: Window resizes itself when more fields are shown on the form - user can still resize the form

Title: Pop-up form window size can be defined in Actions editor
Description:
A common client scenario is to be able to control the size of the window that pops up when you open a form from a button, an action, etc.. 
We've added a property to the SmartForm activity called "Dialog Size" which controls the size of the window when it is opened.

SizeToContent: The default option, which will just size the window depending on the size of the form.
Manual: The window size is determined by the Height and Width properties below the Dialog Size property - if the form content exceeds these values, scroll bars are expected.
Maximize: Will open the window as the full size of the screen, regardless of the form content.
 
 
For example: 800x800 window:
Steps: Step 1: Launch Design Studio and create a new Action under Expert Assitant > Menus > Actions Menu. Set the Activity to be SmartForm and select a form in Properties (Appearance > SmartForms). | Expected: Properties: Dialog Size > Dialog Size | SizeToContent is default. Height and Width are hidden(? - To be confirmed if expected behaviour) || Step 2: Ribbon: Test > Save & Run the Action | Expected: A window pops up and is an expected size for the content of the form - the controls are readable, there is no scroll bar unless the form is outside the limits of the screen || Step 3: Properties: Dialog Size > Dialog Size | Maximize || Step 4: Ribbon: Test > Save & Run the Action | Expected: A window pops up and is the size of the screen regardless of the form content || Step 5: Properties: Dialog Size > Dialog Size | ManualDialog Size > Height | 800Dialog Size > Width | 800 | Expected: When you select "Manual" as the Dialog Size, the Height and Width properties are visible and editable || Step 6: Ribbon: Test > Save & Run the Action | Expected: A window pops up and is a 800x800 size form (see Summary for example) - there are scroll bars if the content of the form exceeds this

Title: Deployment checks actual database owner vs metadata in master DB
Description: Master database of the SQL server has metadataof all databases and their owner IDs. This could mismatch the actual DB owner and cause runtime errors. Our deployment validates this and ensure the db owner metadata is matched.
Steps: Step 1: Database owner is usually cmsdbo. The master database has metadata table that has information of all databases and their owners. The actual db owner can be different than the metadata. This deployment check is to verify that they are the same. || Step 2: Check metadata in Master DB (Edit with your Expert DB name):select SD.SID, SL.Name frommaster..sysdatabases SD innerjoinmaster..syslogins SL on SD.SID= SL.SIDwhere SD.Name ='FrameworkNext''YOUR_EXPERT_DB_NAME' | Expected: The query should return DB Name and Owner Name || Step 3: Check the actual owner of your Expert DB:In SQL Management Studio, Object Explorer, go to Database properties > Files and check the owner || Step 4: Modify the metadata and change the owner name || Step 5: Run through deployment. You should get validation errors that owner does not match.

Title: Design Studio - Workflows are sorted by Product
Description:
User Story Details:
Goal
Workflows should be displayed in Design Studio under the appropriate product. To enable this the workflow definition needs to contain the ProductId to which it belongs.
Reason
As we get more and more workflows, having everything all in one place gets messy, so we need to separate the workflows out to their own products to make it easier to work with.Define Done
- Development workflows (create a new workflow -> Build Solution) and Published workflows (import workflow package) are found under both Expert Workflow "product" node AND an Expert Workflow node under the product the workflow belongs to (PRODUCT_ID in WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION)
- Can change the workflow product in workflow properties, location in Design Studio alters accordingly (e.g. used to be under Expert Assistant, now under Expert Billing)
- Product for new Workflows is defaulted to "Expert Workflow"Design Ideas- Have an "Expert Workflow" node which acts similar to the Expert System > Form Repository node - this will be a repository for ALL workflows, development and published. 
- Have "Expert Workflow" nodes under each of the products that have a workflow - this is determined by a new PRODUCT_ID column in WFM_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION, which comes off the Product field in workflow properties (defaulted to Expert Workflow for new workflows)
Steps: Step 1: Click on the Workflow Properties button in the design toolbar. Change the Product to be something other than "Expert Workflow", e.g. "Expert Billing" | Expected: Product is defaulted to "Expert Workflow" for all new workflows || Step 2: Right-click on the Solution in the Solution Explorer and "Build Solution" || Step 3: Launch Design Studio and check under Expert Workflow > Development for your workflow | Expected: Your workflow is found under "Development" || Step 4: Navigate to the product you set as your workflow product and check under Expert Workflow > Development for your workflowE.g. Expert Billing > Expert Workflow > Development | Expected: There should be an Expert Workflow > Development folder under your product node and you should find your workflow there || Step 5: In Design Studio, go to the Home tab and create a new Package that includes your workflow (New Package (Name) > Components (Workflow Projects) > Your Workflow. Export this package. || Step 6: Import the package into your environment || Step 7: Check under Expert Workflow > Published for your workflow | Expected: Your workflow is found under "Published" || Step 8: Navigate to the product you set as your workflow product and check under Expert Workflow > Published for your workflowE.g. Expert Billing > Expert Workflow > Published | Expected: There should be an Expert Workflow > Published folder under your product node and you should find your workflow there

Title: Expressions - Get values of dynamic properties in *.UserData
Steps: Step 1: This function is only supported in Smartform expressions. This will not work in Rules/Actions || Step 2: Syntax: GetValueByName(Time.UserData, "MyDynamicProperty")First argument is the path to UserData.Second argument is the dynamic property name under UserData || Step 3: Usage: GetValueByName(Time.UserData, "IsFoundTimeDisplay") | Expected: This returns True/False value for IsFoundTimeDisplay at runtime, and can be used for IsVisiable/isRequired properties of controls in Time smartform.

Title: Expressions - Explicit conversions (Cast) - Converting numeric data types
Steps: Step 1: Casting syntax: (CastOperator)SourceVariableExample: (int)5.555, Result: 5Example: (double)5, Result 5.5 || Step 2: Casting in Expression language:(int)(double)(decimal)(string) || Step 3: References to casting: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms173105.aspx || Step 4: Test casting of above types in Expression Editor

Title: Option to enable/disable the Client/Matter/Employee business cards available on the client/matter/employee search controls
Description:
Design idea please see linked user story. 
We will ship True as default configuration value which means always show the business card. Frim can change this setting based on their firm's requirement.
 
We have created 3 different configuration value to control Client/Matter/Employee respectively.
Configuration_Technical_Presentation_DataProviders_DetailCards_ClientDetailCardEnabled.xml
Configuration_Technical_Presentation_DataProviders_DetailCards_EmployeeDetailCardEnabled.xml 
Configuration_Technical_Presentation_DataProviders_DetailCards_MatterDetailCardEnabled.xml
 
For the configuration changes to take effect, it is essential that users have to clear their configuration cache, which can be found C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Roaming\ADERANT\ENVIRONMENTNAME\Configuration
Steps: Step 1: Check the configuration setting in your system for Configuration_Technical_Presentation_DataProviders_DetailCards_ClientDetailCardEnabledConfiguration_Technical_Presentation_DataProviders_DetailCards_EmployeeDetailCardEnabledConfiguration_Technical_Presentation_DataProviders_DetailCards_MatterDetailCardEnabled | Expected: Defult value should all set to be True || Step 2: Update two of them to be False and save itConfiguration_Technical_Presentation_DataProviders_DetailCards_ClientDetailCardEnabledConfiguration_Technical_Presentation_DataProviders_DetailCards_EmployeeDetailCardEnabled | Expected: Client and Employee's setting has changed to be False || Step 3: Clear configuration cache under C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Roaming\ADERANT\ENVIRONMENTNAME\Configuration From 82 onwards, clear the config cache via IISReset || Step 4: Open EA, Search a Client, a Employee, a Matter and hover it when the data returns | Expected: There is no business card shows up when hover Client and EmployeeThere is a business card shows up when hover Matter || Step 5: Check other apps that consume Client/Employee/Matter data providerE.g. Time, Rate, Matter Planning, Expenses.... | Expected: There is no business card shows up when hover Client and EmployeeThere is a business card shows up when hover Matter || Step 6: Change the setting to the other way around, clear cache and test it again | Expected: There is no business card shows up when hover MatterThere is a business card shows up when hover Client and Employee

Title: Include proxy user as well as performer in workflow status window
Description:
Task performed line in status window states something along the lines of "XXX Task completed by User A (on behalf of User B)" when a proxy user exists. 
If no proxy user then text remains as it currently does. eg "xxxx Task completed by User A"
Steps: Step 1: Start a workflow that has approval taskE.g. File Opening, Prebill, Expenses || Step 2: Here we are going to use Expense as an example, setup a new matter and assign TTQA1 as Matter Billing Partner; setup TTQA1, TTQA2, TTQA3 have access to Expenses app; setup TTQA3 can proxy TTQA1, TTQA2; make sure TTQA3 is in admin user group || Step 3: Launch Expense as TTQA3 and create a new report, add a billable receipt with the matter your just created | Expected: Report submitted and Expense approval workflow startedPartner Expense Approval task assigned to TTQA1 || Step 4: Change Proxy to TTQA1 and then goto task tab, you should be able to see this Partner Expense Approval task , OPEN the task and approve it | Expected: Task completed and goes to Department Head Expense Approval TaskIf you change proxy back to yourslef and check the workflow status in report tab, you should be able to see something like "Partner Expense Approval Task Completed by: TTQA3 (on behalf of TTQA1)" which indicate the task is assign to whom and completed by whom || Step 5: Change Proxy to TTQA2 and then goto task tab, you should be able to see this Department Head Expense Approval task, OPEN the task and approve it | Expected: Task completed and goes to Finance Director Expense Approval TaskIf you change proxy back to yourslef and check the workflow status in report tab, you should be able to see something like "Department Head Expense Approval Task Completed by: TTQA3 (on behalf of TTQA2)" which indicate the task is assign to whom and completed by whom || Step 6: Change Proxy back to yourslef and then goto task tab, you should be able to see this Finance Director Expense Approval task which is assign to Administrator group, Accept&Open the task and approve it | Expected: Task completed and goes to Accounting Review for Expense Approval TaskCheck the workflow status in report tab, you should be able to see something like "Finance Director Expense Approval Task Completed by: TTQA3"

Title: Expressions - Look up Expert domain objects by id
Description:
The goal of this look up expression is to allow ability to define an error message that shows the description rather than the id of a lookup value
 
You should be able to use the following method in expressions:
 
Lookup(entity, id, [displayformat])
 
supported display formats:
 
 "Standard" -> {PrimaryText} ({CodeText})
 "PrimaryText" -> {PrimaryText} 
 "SecondardText" -> {SeconardText}
 "CodeText" -> {CodeText}
 "Full" -> {PrimaryText} ({CodeText})\r\n{SecondardText}
 
Examples:
 
> Lookup("Employee", 100146, "Standard")
Andrew Jackson (100146)
 
> Lookup("Employee", 100146)
(returns the Employee object)
 
> "Employee " + Lookup("Employee", 100146, "primarytext") + " has spent more than... etc"

Title: Form Elements - Numeric Box Control - Input value is outside the range of binded data type
Description:
Numeric Box control supports the following data binding (This defines the type of data we can save) :
-Int16,32,64 
-Double
-Decimal
-Nullables of above
 
However, at runtime, user can enter any numeric value into the control. 
This test case is to check that the Numeric box control behaves and validates correctly when a user try to enter a value that is out of range to its binded data type. 
E.g. Value that is out side the range of an Int32. Try to enter a decimal value into Int32.
 
 
Numeric type ranges
 





Type

Range


Int16

-32,768 to 32,767


Int32

-2,147,483,648 to 2,147,483,647


Int64

-9,223,372,036,854,775,808 to 9,223,372,036,854,775,807


Double

1.7E +/- 308 (15 digits)


Decimal

(-7.9 x 1028 to 7.9 x 1028) / (100 to 28) (28-29 Digits)
Steps: Step 1: In Design Studio, create a new SmartForm.Create Data variables of following type:-Int16,32,64 -Double-Decimal-Nullables of above || Step 2: For each data variable, create & associate a Numeric box control. Change label name of the numeric boxes to corresoponding data type || Step 3: In Int16 field, enter 32768 | Expected: Validation error, user input is out of range for int16 || Step 4: enter -32769 | Expected: Validation error, user input is out of range for int16 || Step 5: enter 2016.0316 | Expected: Validation error, user input is {Decimal} which is not compatible to Int16 || Step 6: In Double field, enter 2016.0316 | Expected: Validation error, user input is {Decimal} which is not compatible to Int16
