Title: Check SmartForm data is cached within the lifespan of the running process
Description:
In the SmartForm v3 infrustructure, SmartForm info (Name, path, Category, scope etc.) needs to be fetched from query service. This request is now cached within the lifespan of the application process. Everytime you start a new instance of the application and open a screen that contains a SmartForm, "GetSmartFormInfo" request will be called to QueryService.
The cost of this request is around:
Bytes Sent:      0.673 KBBytes Received:  77.091 KB
 
This request is only needed once, meaning if you open other screens/pages containing SmartForms, you should not see this request call. (Use Fiddler to capture HTTP traffic)
 
Example Application:
Use ExpertTime, open the screen to Create New Time Card > In Fiddler, you should see a request made for "GetSmartFormInfo".
Close and reopen the New Time Card screen > You should not see the "GetSmartFormInfo" request again.
 
Request example:
http://wsakl001174.ap.aderant.com/Expert_Local/FrameworkServices/Query/QueryService.svc/GetSmartFormInfo()?includeModel=false&name=''
Steps: Step 1: See Sumary page for details

Title: Workflow Form Point Activity - Define Form Point in Workflow designer
Description:
Workflow Form Point activity is designed for SmartForm v3 only. It is the is the upgraded version of Smart Form Task v3 Activity which is used for Smartform v1 and v2.
It uses the same concept as Extension Point for Rules in Design Studio, which means the configuration of the Form point and association of SmartForms are done in Design Studio.


Form Points are created from Workflow designer (Currently, Visual Studio) - Form Point Activity.

Form Points are configured in Design Studio, under Expert Workflow section

Form Points are Workflow specific (Same as SmartFormTaskv3)

Data contract of Form point is defined by 'Parameters'. The Form point does not use data contract directly from the Workflow.

You can have as many Form Points in a Workflow

You can have as many SmartForms attached to a Form Point

SmartForms can be shared across different Workflows and Form Points, as long as they are compatible (Same as SmartFormTaskv3)

SmartForms can be attached to a Form Point in Design Studio
On the Workflow designer, the Form Point activity has the following properties:



Task Name: Task name to be displayed. String type, can be bind to a String variable.

Parameters: List of variables (data contracts) to pass into the associated SmartForms

Form Point: Create the Form Point in Design Studio

Security Plan: Configure user/group security rights to this Task (e.g. Configure who is the Task performer)
Form Point activity also shares the same workflow properties as SmartFormTaskv3 activity:

 
Clicking on "Form Point: Configure" will create the Form Point and launch the configuration screen. 
In this screen, you can attach/edit/remove SmartForms 
You can access this screen again by right clicking on the Form point in Design Studio and select "Add/edit items".
At this stage, the Form Point is created.


 
The Form Point is stored in Database in FWM_EXTENSION_POINT table. The Path value should be GUID.
select*fromFWM_EXTENSION_POINT orderbyLAST_MODIFIED descTest Cases1. Test the end to end process of creating a Form point, attaching SmartForms to the Form point and consuming them in runtime
 
2. Test that Form Point and its associated SmartForms only use the defined parameters as their data contract. It should NOT use any Workflow variable directly as data contract.
 
3. Test that after defining the Workflow and Form points Visual Studio, you can add more SmartForms to the Form point on the fly inside Design Studio. The SmartForms added later should correctly showup for all consumers at runtime.
Steps: Step 1: See Summary Page for full details

Title: Workflow Form Point activity - Attach a SmartForm v3 to Workflow Form Point and consume in standard Workflow

SmartForm v3 need to be attached(associated) to a Form Point so that they can be consumed in Workflow. This is similar concept as attaching Rules to extension point and the similar process as attaching Smartform(v2)(v1) to a SmartFormTaskv3 activity.
 
Prerequisite of this test: You have already created a Workflow Project, and defined a Form Point.
 
After you have defined a Form point. In Design Studio you should be able to see the Form point regisited under your Workflow's node:


Right click on the Form Point, you should be able to attach a SmartForm with options of Create a new Smartform, or select an existing, compatible Form (Data contract must match).
You can also attach a SmartForm by going into the properties of the Form Point and attached Forms there.
You are able to attach as many SmartForms in the Form Point
Build and run your test Workflow in Visual Studio
Run ExpertAssistant and go to Task inbox view. You should get a SmartForm task, displaying the SmartForms you attached to the Form Point activity.
Steps: Step 1: See Summary Page for full details

Title: Deployment Manager Prerequisite Check for Security Rights
Description:
In the linked bug, we fixed the issue where "Deployment Manager Prerequisite Check Does Not Recognize Security Rights Inherited By Group Membership"
So the testing for this bug will include test the following scenarios
1. local account on its own          2. local account in the administrators group  3. local account in a custom group      
4. domain account on its own            5. domain account in the administrators group    6. domain account in a custom group        7. domain account in a domain group
Steps: Step 1: Please read the SUMMARY tab to get some background information, the client issue is 5 but we will have to test all these scenarios to make sure the code change didn't break anything. The test case will only detailed the steps for 5. || Step 2: Assume your environment has run the pre-request scripts which means the service account has already added in Log on as a batch job/service || Step 3: Run gpedit.msc to open the Local Group Policy Editor || Step 4: Navigate to Computer Configuration | Windows Settings | Security Settings | Local Policies | User Rights Assignment || Step 5: Double-click on Log on as a batch job, if the Expert service account is on the list, highlight it and click Remove || Step 6: Click Add User or Group and add a Group that the service account belongs to, e.g. Administrators, and click OK || Step 7: Repeat steps five and six for Log on as a service || Step 8: Close the Local Group Editor || Step 9: Open Deployment Manager and click Deploy | Expected: The deployment pre-request check passed || Step 10: Repeat the above steps for other scenarios | Expected: The deployment pre-request check passed

Title: Create Rules from SmartForm editor
Description:
The validation logic inside SmartForm v3 can be customized by using "Rules".
There are "Event points" inside a SmartForm where we allow the use of Rules:
-Form Level, "On Initialize" and "On Validate" events
-Control Level , "On Changed" and "On Validate" events
 
Form Level - On Initialize event: Rules under this event will be evaluated when the Form is first initialized (loaded)
Form Level - On Validate event: Rules under this event will be evaluated when Form data has changed (e.g. Changes to input in fields, Save, Cancel/Close)
 
Control Level - On Changed event: Rules under this event will be evaluated when the data is changing inside the control (When you are typing, this Rule is evaluated after every keypress)
Control Level - On Validate event: Rules under this event will be evaluated when the data has changed (After you finished typing)
 
Test in SmartForm editor:
1. Can create new Rules, at Form level and Control level.
2. Can select Rule created in previous sessions, at Form level and Control level
3. Rules created in a SmartForm can be shared at different Event points within the SAME Form - e.g. Rules created at Control level can be selected and used in the Form level
4. These Rules are stored in FWM_RULE table (Common repository for Rules). Rule key starts with the name of the SmartForm along with the name of the Rule itself.
5. These Rules are specific to SmartForms. You should not be able to select these Rules for an Extension point.
6. Exporting SmartForm with Rules - you should get the SmartForm xml file, containing the serialized SmartForm, the references to Rules and the serialized Rule itself
7. Importing SmartForm with Rules - SmartForm is imported to FWM_SMARTFORM table. Rule is imported to FWM_RULE. Rule reference is imported to FWM_SMARTFORM_RULE.
(SmartForm only stores references to Rules)

Title: Deployment "pre-requisite check" validates duplicate LOGIN records in HBM_PERSNL table
Description:
During pre-requisite check of deployment, we check for duplicate entries in HBM_PERSNL table on LOGIN column
 
Test setup, run the following query on your test database, this should create duplicate entries on LOGIN:
UPDATE HBM_PERSNL 
SET LOGIN = 'ARUNasasd.PALURU!PIU' 
WHERE EMPL_UNO in ('100203', '100320')
 
Run the following to check for the duplicate entry, it should bring return the duplicate "Login":
SELECT Login, Count(*)
FROM HBM_PERSNL
GROUP BY Login
HAVING Count(*) > 1
 
Now redeploy from Deployment Manager. You should get an error in pre-requisite check step, deployment process should be stopped. 
The error message should contain the name of the duplicate record.
Steps: Step 1: See Summary Page for details

Title: Dev feature - Configure Validation Mode in Extension point properties
Description:
In Expert 8.1, we allow validation rule to return as warning. To enable this feature, you need to modify validaiton extension point to allow "Errors and Warnings".
Note that this is a Dev only feature.
 
Switch on Dev mode, run the following SQL query:
UPDATE FWM_OWNER 
SET ISSYSTEM = 'Y' 
WHERE NAME = 'Aderant'
 
Launch Design Studio, you should see "Dev Mode" enabled on the task ribbon.

Navigate to a Validation extension point, e.g. Expert Billing > Validation Rules > Prebill Edit Time Validation
Open its properties, you should see Validation Mode field is editable:

 
Setting this to "Errors" means that all Validation Rule under this Extension Point has to return an ERROR when validation fails
 
Setting this to "Errors and Warnings" means that all Validation Rule under this Extension Point has an option to either return an ERROR OR return a WARNING when validation fails.
 
In the console window, the debug logging should reflect what type of validation message is being returned.
Steps: Step 1: See summary page.

"Presentation Mode" gives the ability for users to switch applications into a mode that improves visibility on projects and low grade screens (By applying higher contrast)
In below screenshot, left hand side is in "Presentation Mode". Right hand side is in standard mode.

 
"Presentation Mode" can be switched on in Expert Administration app under System > User Expreience.

Test:
- This option is off by default
- Enable "Presentation Mode": You get a message saying "Any open Expert applications must be restarted after Presentation mode is enabled."
- This is a user specific option, after enabling, a color profile is created in Windows, under: %UserProfile%\AderantExpert\Styles
- Open Design Studio from ExpertShare, verify that app is loaded with new color profile
- Disable "Presentation Mode": You get a message saying "Any open Expert applications must be restarted after Presentation mode is disabled."
- The color profile is deleted
- Reopen Design Studio, verify that standard color profile is loaded

Title: Temp TestCase
Extension point properties - Show restricted editing dialog when system owner is not Aderant
Description:
Restricted extension point editor is used when the system owner is NOT Aderant.
Pre-requisite:
-Check the system owner your Expert database: SELECT * FROM FWM_OWNER > Verify that the entry Aderant has ISSYSTEM = N
-Launch Design Studio and verify that you do NOT see "Development Mode" button on the task ribbon bar, like this:
 

There are 3 types of restricted editors (different functionality).

Rule point editor, you can perform the following actions:


-Evaluation Order: Shows a dialog to set evaluation order of the Rules under the current Rule point, in run time the Rules will be executed by the defined order. The Seq. column shows the sequence number of each Rule.
-Show Inactive Rules: Toggle on/off to show disabled Rules (On by default)
-Add new Rule: Opens a tab for creating a new Rule. The Rule is a child of the current Rule point, which inherits all data contracts from the Rule point.
-Edit selected Rule: Opens editor in a new tab for the selected Rule.
-Remove selected Rule: Removes the association of the selected Rule to the current Rule point (This does NOT delete the Rule itself)
-Enable/Disable selected Rule: Sets the IS ACTIVE status of the selected Rules (You can select multiple items from the list)
-Duplicate: Create a new Rule by Duplicating the selected Rule (opens a new tab)
 

Action point editor, you can perform the following actions:

-Show Inactive Actions: Toggle on/off to show disabled Actions (On by default)
-Add new Action: Opens a tab for creating a new Action. The Action is a child of the current Action point, which inherits all data contracts from the Action point.
-Edit selected Action: Opens editor in a new tab for the selected Action.
-Remove selected Action: Removes the association of the selected Action to the current Action point (This does NOT delete the Action itself)
-Enable/Disable selected Action: Sets the IS ACTIVE status of the selected Actions (You can select multiple items from the list)
-Duplicate: Create a new Action by Duplicating the selected Action (opens a new tab)
 

Form point editor, you can perform the following actions:


-Add new SmartForm: Opens a tab for creating a new SmartForm. The SmartForm is a child of the current Form point, which inherits all data contracts from the Form point.
-Edit selected SmartForm: Opens editor in a new tab for the selected SmartForm.
-Remove selected SmartForm: Removes the association of the selected SmartForm to the current Form point (This does NOT delete the SmartForm itself)
 
Examples of Rule\Action\Form point 
-In Design Studio, use the Navigation panel and drill down to Expert Assistant - Menus - Actions Menu (this is an Action point)
-Navigate to Expert Expenses - Value Rules - Approval Task Grouping Rules (this is a Rule point)
-Navigate to Expert Billing - CreatePrebill - Create Prebill (this is a Form point)
-Navigate to Expert Workflow - Development - {WorkflowName} - {FormPointName} (this is a Workflow Form point)

Test cases
1. Check that when system owner is NOT Aderant, double clicking on an extension point opens the restricted editor:
-Check Rule points
-Check Action points
-Check Form points

2. Check that you can access the restricted editor from the right click menu of an extension point:
-Check Rule points
-Check Actions points
-Check Form points

3. Check that each action inside the editor works as the expected behavior described above:
-Rule editor: Close, Refresh, Evaluation Order, Show Inactive, Add New, Edit, Remove, Enable, Disable, Duplicate
-Action editor: Close, Refresh, Show Inactive, Add New, Edit, Remove, Enable, Disable, Duplicate
-Form editor: Close, Refresh, Add New, Edit, Remove

4. Check that you can multi select items in the editor:
-Select all items: CTRL + A 
-Cherry pick items: CTRL + Click on any items
-Select a range of items: SHIFT + Click on First item + Click on Last item

5. Check that you can only have 1 editor opened for the current extension point, if you already have the editor opened, attempts to open it again should bring focus to the opened one:
-Open editor, then try to open the editor again by double clicking on the extension point and right click - Add/edit items
Steps: Step 1: See Summary page

Title: Expressions - User inputs in Expression editor are validated at design time to prevent incorrect usage
Description:
Expression editors are mainly used in Design Studio. You can identify weither a field expects an expression by looking at the dropdown menu.

 
The dropdown menu shows:
-Option to create new variable as local data contract
-List of available data contract items, this list is made up of: Parameters, Data Variables and CSV Data Source which are either inherited from Extension point or defined locally
-The ability to drill down into any data items and access it's properties
-Default values for system types like Boolean types would show option: True, False
 
 
Test case for user input validation:
 
1. Refering to a data contract that does not exist or not reachable (e.g. dynanmic properties)
(Also test when data reference was valid at first, then remove the data contract)

 
 
2. Comparing non-nullable items to null, e.g. Comparing an non-nullable Interger data to Null
 
Data variable can be set to nullable in the contract editor

3. Enter value or data item with mismatching type, e.g. Enter a string when the expected type is Boolean

 
 
4. Incomparable data type and values, e.g. comparing an Int32 to a decmial number

 
 
5. Assigning values into an incompatible type, e.g. Assign decimal value into int32
Steps: Step 1: See Summary Page

Title: Data Provider Designer - Upgrade Configuration based Data provider registrations into Design Studio
Description:
Need to test:
-Upgrade tools/methods

-System default Data providers are upgraded to Design Studio
-Firm Data providers are upgraded to Design Studio
-Custom Data providers (C#, Python, XML) are upgraded to Design Studio

Title: Data Provider Designer - Customize Data providers in Design Studio
Description:
Consumers:
Currently all old Design tools (SmartForm Wizard, Workflow, SmartForm v2) consume Configure based Data provider registrations
All new Design tools (Design Studio, SmartForm v3) consume the new model
 
Data Provider tables:
-FWM_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION
Repository for Data provider registrations info: Path, Name, Description, Area, Types, Product, Scope
 
-FWA_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION_PROP
Repository for Data provider properties 
 
Data provider scope:
-System level: 0
-Firm level: 10
 
Available functionalities in Design Studio:
-Create new System: When system owner is Aderant. (Aderant Dev only )
-Create new Firm: When system owner is not Aderant
-Edit System: Create a Firm version of the selected Data Provider, it will have the same Path as the system copy and all references to this Data provider now refers to the new Firm copy
-Edit Firm
-Duplicate System/Firm: Create a firm copy of the selected Data Provider, it will have different Path than the selected and concidered as a new registration.
 
Test Cases:
1. If System owner is not Aderant, System level Data providers are not editable in the Designer. 
Firms need to create a Firm copy of the selected DP if they wish to make any customization.
"Path" and "Scope" properties are the identifiers.
 
2. Firm can discard their Firm customization of the selected DP and revert back to the system version. 
All apps should correctly pickup the version with the highest scope (0 for system, 10 for Firm)
 
3. DP Properties and property values are correctly saved and consumed at runtime.
 
4. When creating a DP, you can only change "Data Provider" selection. "Return Data Type" dropdown is readonly and poplates depending on the selection in "Data Provider" dropdown.
 
5. When editing a DP, you cannot change "Data Provider" selection

Title: Data Provider Designer - Package Data provider customizations in Design Studio
Description: This test case applies to Data providers created in Design Studio only.You can add Data providers in Design Studio - Package editor using Components panel - Data providers.You can drag a Data provider list item from the Navigation tree on to the Package editor.When System Owner is Aderant. You can add Data providers in system scope to packaging.When System Owner is Firm. You can only add Data providers in firm scope to packaging.Data providers should be packaged and exported with correct detail, properties and scope in XML format.Data providers can be imported to another system, the DP defined inside the package are created in the target system. If the DP already exist in the target system, the DPs in the package should overwrite the ones in the target system - This include both system and firm scope values. (Check against Data provider Path and Scope)

Title: SmartForm Editor - Delete SmartForm and its associations from system
Description:
The Delete option is available in the Actions group on the task ribbon bar for SmartForm editor
 
Security:
Deletion of Firm SmartForms are secured by security resource: MODULE:Framework.Customization.CanDeleteFirmSmartForm/Execute
We have a default system Security Policy that consumes this resource: ExpertApllication and is assigned to Administrators by default
 
Check system owner in FWM_OWNER table:
-You are Aderant user when ADERANT entry has ISSYSTEM = Y
-You are non-Aderant user otherwise
 
When you are non-Aderant user:
-Firm SmartForm can only be deleted if you have the above right
-System SmartForm cannot be deleted
 
When you are Aderant user:
-Both system and firm SmartForms can be deleted
 
When you delete a Form, the Form AND any Form point associations are deleted from the repository:

FWM_SMARTFORM
FWM_SMARTFORM_CONTRACT
FWM_SMARTFORM_DELTA
FWM_SMARTFORM_RULE
FWM_EXTENSION_POINT_SMARTFORM
 
Test Case:
 
1. Set system owner to ADERANT and open Design Studio. Open a system and firm scope SmartForms. You should be able to use the Delete button and delete those Forms
 
2. Set system owner to Firm (Clifford, Maximillian & Scott). 
-Open a system Form and try to delete > You should not be able to delete the system Form 
-Open Security Manager, open ExpertApplications policy and un-check CanDeleteFirmSmartForm then save
-Open a Firm Form and try to delete > You should not be able to delete Firm Forms when you do not have the CanDeleteFirmSmartForm right
-Switch back to Security Manager, check the CanDeleteFirmSmartForm right and then save

Title: Framework - Architecture - Data Providers - Data providers can be packaged up and reimported to another 81 environment
Description:
The following things have to be tested:
 
- When exporting data providers, if the data provider has both firm and system versions, and it is exported, the firm version should be picked for exporting.
- If only system, nothing happens - the DP is already in the system package
   - Also if the data provider has multiple versions and effective dates, only the most recent one should be picked
 
- Also it is impractical to test exporting all data providers and their properties - so we will test:
   - Client dataprovider and properties set
   - Matter DP and properties
   - Employee DP and properties
 
Testing approach
 
Original environment
- Create a firm version of the client, matter, and employee data provider
    - Ensure you have filter expression set on some of the exported data providers
- Create a package under Firm scope, and search for data providers
  - Only firm definitions of data providers are displayed/ available for inclusion into package
- Save package, and open package in design studio
   - Double click the data providers to ensure they are pointing to the firm scoped data providers that you created [bug]
- Export Package
  - Check Package contents - data provider definition is exported [ bug]
 
Other environment
- Reimport package to another environment
- Check tables
  - FWM_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION - New Data providers have been saved
  - FWA_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION_PROP - Data provider properties have been transferred
- Open firm data providers in new environment

Title: Framework - Architecture - Data providers - FWM_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION contains all of Aderant's Data Providers
Description:
According to Peter's comments on the user story history:
The data provider upgrader picks up configure values from Technical.Presentation.DataProviders. Non xml values are excluded.
- This is the reason why the list in 
select *
from CFM_CONFIGURATION_VALUE
where NAMEID in (select ID
from CFM_CONFIGURATION_NAME
where path like 'Technical.Presentation.DataProviders%')
is less than the # of dataproviders in FWM-DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION
The upgraded DPs are stored in FWM_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION table, and properties stored in FWA_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION_PROP
The upgrader checks if the configure value path already exist in the table(FWM_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION) before performing the upgrade
 
The use cases are:
- Old data providers / data providers that are currently working and NOT in FWM_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION will be migrated
- After migration, the data providers can be used in our Forms
 
Testing approach
 
Assuming we have a database that already has upgrade data providers...
 
1. Remove a particular row from FWM_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION, as well as the related table 
FWA_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION_PROP
2. Redeploy
3. Check the deleted data provider has been re-added to FWM_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION and 
FWA_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION_PROP

Title: Framework - Architecture - Data Providers - Data provider results can be filtered via filter expressions
Description:
We will pick a property from each section and test that the dataprovider filters when these conditions are satisfied.
 

 
Also check that one property from each of the tabs can be used in a 'complex' filtering condition

 
Note that the current implementation applies filtering on the client side i.e. fiddler will still catch everything when the results are sent back from the server.
Future versions will implement the filtering on the server side to stop results from being 'snoop-able'
 
Testing approach
 
Pick an existing data provider to test with - ideally we want a data provider that is used on a Form that you can find e.g. Employee dataprovider:

We can do several expressions like:
and then search on a Billing Form that uses this dataprovider, eg the Disbursement Split Form: (note you need to save changes on the data provider prior to searching on the Form.


Test both positive and negative search results:

We also want to test with slightly complex expressions:
 
Item.TerminateDate = Null
Item.HireDate < Today
Item.BookId = 1
 
And chaining these together for a more complex evaluation:
if Security.User.Department = "ADM" then Item.OfficeId = "TLH" else Item.OfficeId = "BUF"
  
 
Save changes
 
Test via Application Form:
e.g.

The search result after each expression change should satisfy the filter expressions.
