Title: Framework - Customization - Rules - A rule can be called from another rule
Description:
Talked with Andrew - some notes
 
We don't care if the user creates infinite loops - it's silly, but we have no way of knowing that the rules they're referencing is going to create infinite loops
 
In terms of the display of rules when selecting a shared rule, it is possible for rules that have not been attached to a rule point to be created; thus we would expect these rules to be displayed under the All rules (repository) node.
 
When the Only Show compatible items checkbox is ticked, the rules that has overlapping data contracts with the extension point of the calling rule will be displayed. (this remains to be verified - but it is the case from my understanding)
Conversely, rules that have non-overlapping data contracts are only displayed when the checkbox is unticked.
 
In terms of the results merging back to the calling rule, if multiple validation messages are being returned from the rule-ception, then all instances of the validation message should be merged and displayed.

Title: Framework - Customization - Rules - Testing each currency function with literals, variables, and other things
Description:
For each function, check the following:
- Descriptions are accurate for each currency function
 
Test each function with only literals:

Then test each function with variables:

The tables you need:
TBL_CURR_DATE: The periods covered by the DRUNO / DateRateId
TBL_CURR_RATE: The corresponding Rate and reciprocal rate
 
With each test, verify the amounts being displayed (via the validation message) is correct by using the exchange rates to calculate the expected amounts, and also to verify the correct rate from the correct period is being used
 
Examples by function
 
FromSystemCurrency
- By Druno

- By Date

ToCurrency
- By Druno

- By Date
ToSystemCurrency
- DRUNO

Confirm via back calculation: Using TBL_CURR_RATE.RECIPROCAL and multiply by the source currency amount, to arrive at the system currency
 
- Date

Title: Framework - Customization - Smartforms - When multiple rows of data are opening in one field e.g. mass edit, -Mixed- prompts are displayed
Description:
This test case checks that smartforms are able to display the -Mixed- prompt when multiple rows of different data are held for a given field when opening a smartform. The common use case is when the user is performing a mass time / disbursement edit,
and the data for a specific is different across the instances, a - Mixed - prompt is displayed instead
 
Where the data is the same, we expect that value to be displayed instead of the prompt.
 
Use Billing (and maybe Time? ) to check as this requires product consumption to work.
 
Where the data is same, the value is displayed
Where the data is different, a 'Mixed' watermark is displayed instead, which clears if you click into it.
Steps: Step 1: Open Billing, and open a Prebill.Then go to the Time or Disbursements page for any matter on the prebill. || Step 2: Select multiple time entries, and open the mass edit dialogSelect multiple disbursement entries, and open the edit dialog | Expected: Mass Edit dialogs should display in a similar manner as the screenshot on the test case summary

Title: Framework - Customization - Smartforms - New Data grid rows are now added via forms, instead of inside the grid itself
Description:
Instead of adding inside the data grid row, we now display a smaller form for users to fill out:

The field requiredness and controls are set in the Data grid:

This is tested via the Expert Billing Product, and we verify that:
- Data grid column layout is obeyed by the smartform
- Values in the column should display before having intertacted with them in any way
- Control type, requiredness and other control properties are rendered correctly on the add new row form
- User is able to save data via this new 'add new row' form.

Title: Framework - Customization - Smart Forms - V3 - Title visibility can be determined by a boolean or expression now
Description:
Title visibility can be driven by True / False boolean:

 
Also test that simple expressions (which evaluates to a boolean) can be used to control visibility of Smartform title as well.
 
Finally, check with Billing where they are using this, and quickly check how they've used the smartform title visibility
 
 
Testing approach
 
After entering a new expression and saving your changes, check that:
- Changes have been saved to FWM_SMARTFORM_DELTA
- Reloading the form doesn't reset your changes
 
Existing forms that are good candidates to play with:
This one is displayed when you select multiple prebills to return to WIP
Test the folowing scenarios:
 
Basic: 
- True / False
Expression evaluation: 
- 1 = 1: evaluates to true
- 1 = 2: evaluates to false
Using the expression builder to use our inbuilt functions:
The above is only evaluated when the application loads the smartform - so you'll need to test this within the application.
- Security.User.Office = "TLH" - if this matches your user, expect the title to be displayed
- Security.User.Office = "COR" - if this does not match your user, expect the title to be hidden
Steps: Step 1: Read the test case summary first || Step 2: Basic: - True / False | Expected: Smartform title toggles on/off as expected || Step 3: Expression evaluation: - 1 = 1: evaluates to true- 1 = 2: evaluates to false | Expected: Smartform title toggles on/off as expected || Step 4: Additional expression evaluations - Security.User.Office = "TLH"- Security.User.Office = "COR" | Expected: Smartform title is displayed inside the application, or hidden, as expected.

Title: Framework - Customization - Smartforms - Header text can be displayed with string as well as complex data types
Description:
Test basic data types can be used in conjunction with displaying the header text:

 
Check heading levels are affected based on the Heading level selection:

Title: Framework - Customization - Smartforms - Smartforms now support 4 column layouts
Description:
Using the Expert Billing smartform CreatePrebill -> New Session information information as the basis of testing, and adding additional controls to this smartform to check the 4 column layout.
 
We have:
- Date pickers
- Check boxes
- Numeric boxes
- Textboxes
- Search box
- Section 
 
on the smartform already.
 
In addition, I added:
- Spacers
- Headers
- Display text
- Radio button group
 
The above are the most commonly used controls - and the 4 column layout appears to be maintained.

Title: Framework - Customization - Rules - Forms and rules created with 'Do not attach to form point' are created as unattached assets
Description:
This test case checks that if rules or smartforms are created via right clicking on a non-extention point node:

Or via the ribbon:

Forms and rules will be created as unattached to any extension points
 
We will create via the right click method, and then via the ribbon button, and then verify the created Form / Rule is unattached.
 
Add unattached Form / Rule via right click
 
Find a product, and right click on a node that is higher than an extention point (because right clicking on an extention point and creating stuff implies we want to be attached to it). Select Form or Rule, and fill out required fields.

We can verify the created asset (in this case a form) is unattached as there are no data contracts (which normally exists on an extension point and is inherited by its assets)

We can also look in the tables via SQL:
 
select *
from FWM_SMARTFORM
where SMART_FORM_UNO not in (
select SMART_FORM_UNO
from FWM_EXTENSION_POINT_SMARTFORM
where SMART_FORM_UNO is not null
)
 
Repeat the above for rules, and check using the following SQL (as rules are saved in a different table):
 
select *
from FWM_RULE
where RULE_UNO not in (
select RULE_UNO
from FWM_EXTENSION_POINT_RULE
where RULE_UNO is not null
)
order by LAST_MODIFIED desc -- Added this line as there are already a lot of rules that are not attached to an extension point
 
Add unattached Form / Rule via Ribbon button
 
We can create new Forms and Rules via the ribbon most of the time as well:

There is a fixed related bug where an extension point is still used when we select 'Do not attach to a Form / Rule point' and have selected an extension point prior to opening the dialog. Therefore when you're testing, be sure to select an extension point to test this aspect as part of regression, as well.
 
As above, create the Form / Rule, then use the same methods to verify the Form / Rule is unattached. The same SQL scripts apply.
Steps: Step 1: Read the test case summary first! || Step 2: Add Forms / Rules via Right clickingSelect any nodes above an existing extension point E.g. Billing.Forms.Administration, and right clickSelect Form / Rule depending on which one you're creating to testFill out required fields, and save the Form / Rule | Expected: Verify the Form / Rule is unattached by checking the data contracts - there should be only System / environmental variables available for use hereAlso check via SQL to check the Form / Rule has not been linked to any extension points || Step 3: Add Forms / Rules via Ribbon buttonSelect any nodes above an existing extension point E.g. Billing.Forms.Administration, and right clickSelect Form / Rule depending on which one you're creating to testFill out required fields, and save the Form / Rule | Expected: Verify the Form / Rule is unattached by checking the data contracts - there should be only System / environmental variables available for use hereAlso check via SQL to check the Form / Rule has not been linked to any extension points

Title: SF3 - Firm versions of smartforms retain their customizations when the system level SF is reimported via packages
Description:
This test case checks that when we make a firm level customization of a system level smartform, and the delta is saved, when the system level smartform is reimported into the system e.g.
- Redeploying
- Reimporting the package for whatever reasons
 
We need to check that the delta does not get removed when a package containing the system level smartforms are reimported
 
The initial bug verification performed by Simon used smartforms from WIPAware. We will be doing the same but with Billing smartforms.
 
Testing approach
 
1. Perform a smartform customization, then save it and check the table
Add new elements to the smartform, and then save the smartform changes.
 
The table we need to check is the smartform delta table / FWM_SMARTFORM_DELTA:
select *
from FWM_SMARTFORM_DELTA
order by LAST_MODIFIED desc
 
We can then verify in FWM_SMARTFORM that the top entry refers to the same smartform we've just edited. 
select *
from FWM_SMARTFORM
where SMART_FORM_UNO in (2)
 
In this case, I had edited the Disbursement split smartform under 

but you can perform the edit anywhere else.
 
2. Reimport the package containing a system level definition of the smartform
Find where your package is (usually under Expertsource\packages) and look inside using Design studio:
Verify the smartform definition is contained within, then import the smartform.
 
After import, check FWM_SMARTFORM_DELTA again - we expect the delta to remain after importing the package.
Steps: Step 1: Read the test case summary first! || Step 2: Pick a Product smartform you want to customize and test withThen make the customization via Design Studio, and save your changes. | Expected: Verify changes have been saved as Delta by checking FWM_SMARTFORM_DELTA: || Step 3: Find the package with the system level definition of the smartform you've just customized, then reimport that package. || Step 4: Verify:- Package import is successful- The Delta still exists in the table- The changes are retained and displayed when viewed in Design Studio

Title: Deployment manager MSI - Deploying with an existing manifest
Description:
New process as outlined:
 
1. Launch the Deployment Manager MSI. Expert Deployment Manager will then be automatically installed at C:\AderantExpert\Install2. Check that Deployment manager has been installed via Program and Features
- Question: Should there be a shortcut for Deployment Manager in start menu? - Asking via email
3.  Launch Deployment Manager
- Need to change splash screen to display version 81 - raised as bug
3.a Expert Database Details dialog is displayed - user is able to provide Expert Database Name, and User name and password for the database
- What is the user credential used to log into the database server? - Windows security. However, as per current documentation the deployment user is required to have access to the database servers they are going to deploy to - so this is not a concern
- In the case where the user is not allowed to log onto the database server, what happens? 
   - Currently it displays the list of databases from the last valid connection made within the application session - raised as bug 
- If the database details are updated, the validation error on the server name field is not removed. It is removed when the validation error is on the instance name field, however. - Raised as bug
- Can the list of databases be alphabetically ordered to make finding databases easier? - Raised as bug
- We seem to be doing something smart around the case where a db server is provided, but no instance has been provided, and no databases are found - do we default mssql10 into the instance and then try again automatically? - incorrect - we load the list of databases from the last valid connection
 4. Assuming a valid 8.1 database is picked, and it has been previously deployed against i.e. having a valid row in FWM_ENVIRONMENT, the environment manifest is loaded and populates deployment manager
- If the database is not considered a valid 8.1 database, what happens?
  
 
The rest of the process is as before - although there are changes behind the scenes - hitting 'deploy' will take you the rest of the way and set up your environment.
 
 
 
Fringe case - reinstalling the MSI - what is expected? Silent install over the previous one? Do they need to shut down any open instances of Deployment manager prior to reinstalling?
Steps: Step 1: Read the test case summary first! || Step 2: Get the Deployment Manager MSI and install it. || Step 3: Point to the database server and the database that contains your environment manifest information, as well as the database username and password fields. | Expected: Manifest is loaded into Deployment ManagerValidate C:\AderantExpert\Install\environment.config to verify a new entry for our environment has been createdVerify in FWM_ENVIRONMENT that the manifest has been updated with out information || Step 4: Scenario: Deploying a local customization workstationImport the manifestStep through the wizard and check all relevant information has been importedFinish the wizard | Expected: All manifest information has been imported as expectedAs environment wizard is finished, user is prompted to deploy or not deploy. || Step 5: Scenario: Deploying a load balanced environmentImport the manifestStep through the wizard and check all relevant information has been importedFinish the wizard | Expected: All manifest information has been imported as expectedAs environment wizard is finished, user is prompted to deploy or not deploy.

Title: Deployment Manager MSI: Restoring a production DB into a test environment
Description:
In this scenario, the firm has decided to take their product database and restore it onto the database server of the testing environment.
 
We assume the database is already at the 81 release level, and all prerequisites have been met.
 
Data setup:
Take your current database and make a backup of it. We still be restoring it onto a different server for the following tests.
 
 
Scenario: Moving from a previously deployed environment e.g. Production, to another environment e.g. Test. While using the same database backup.
 
1. Data setup
Ensure the database has been used in a deployment, and has a manifest in FWM_ENVIRONMENT
Publish a few workflows and start instances of these workflows
Then backup the database
 
Take the backup, and restore it on a server that you have access to e.g. SVSQL304.
Load Deployment manager, and pick the restored database.
 
OR
 
Do some hacks...
Take your local customization workstation's DB, and extract the manifest from FWM_ENVIRONMENT
Change the database server and/or name in the manifest
Remove the database entry from C:\AderantExpert\Install\environment.config if it exists there
Then re-pick the database
 
We get the following dialog:

Selecting cancel will take you back to the deployment manager UI.
 
Selecting No does ???
 
Selecting Yes will clear everything for the user to setup again - but what does it really clear up?
To talk over with Paul on this and test later when things have been merged to MAIN

Title: Deployment Manager MSI cannot be reinstalled without uninstalling the previous version
Description:
Part of the regular MSI installation framework is requiring users to uninstall the previous version before installing the current version.
 
This test case checks that this happens (don't need to re-run for regression)

Title: Deployment Manager MSI - Deploying with a new manifest
Description:
This test case checks that in the event where:
 
- The client is attempting a fresh install at the 81 level
 
I.e. there is no valid environment manifest in FWM_ENVIRONMENT, and the user does not have a manifest from a previous release
 
With the new Deployment manager MSI we can still achieve a successful installation.
 
The following environments should be tested:
- Local customization workstation
- Load balanced environment running a Windows Server OS.
 
For Local Customization Workstation, just using your local machine should be fine.
For Load balanced deployments, either look to test on a CRT load balanced environment, or use VMHSF301, VMHSF302 and VMHSF303 (302 and 303 are application servers)
 
Scenario: Local Customization Workstation
 
1. Test data prep
Grab a database backup, and upgrade to 81 level
 
2. Deploy
Create a new manifest
- Verify new manifest has been saved into FWM_ENVIRONMENT
- Verify new environment has been created in environment.config in C:\ADERANTEXPERT\INSTALL folder
Deploy
 
3. Smoke test some apps
- Expert Assistant search
- Save timer
... etc
 
4. Remove deployment
Check that the deployment can be successfully removed
 
Scenario: Load balanced environment
 
Same as Local customization workstation steps
Steps: Step 1: Read the test case summary first! || Step 2: Prerequisites:Have a local customization workstationHave a Load balanced environmentDeployment Manager MSI || Step 3: Local customization workstationOpen DM and point to the database (at the 81 level)Create the manifest from scratchDeploySmoke test a few apps | Expected: Verify C:\AderantExpert\Install\Environment.config that an entry for the new environment has been createdVerify in FWM_ENVIRONMENT that the environment manifest has been saved successfullySmoke testing a sample of available apps e.g. Expert Time, Expert Assistant should be sufficient || Step 4: Load balanced environmentOpen DM and point to the database (at the 81 level)Create the manifest from scratchDeploySmoke test a few apps | Expected: Verify C:\AderantExpert\Install\Environment.config that an entry for the new environment has been createdVerify in FWM_ENVIRONMENT that the environment manifest has been saved successfullySmoke testing a sample of available apps e.g. Expert Time, Expert Assistant should be sufficient

Title: Deployment Manager MSI - Restoring a production DB into a test environment against an existing ExpertShare
Description:
It is possible for users to:
 
- Stop services on an existing environment
- Backup the database from the environment, then restore this onto another database server
- Fix the database up in terms of environmental data (DB Sync)
- ???
 
We need to test that it's possible for users to do this on the 8.1 release

Title: Deployment Manager MSI - Deploying using 80SP2 or 80SP3 manifest
Description:
This test case checks that in the event where:
 
- The client is upgrading from a release older than 80SP2
 
The following environments should be tested:
Local customization workstation
Load balanced environment running a Windows Server OS.
 
For Local Customization Workstation, just using your local machine should be fine.
For Load balanced deployments, either look to test on a CRT load balanced environment, or use VMHSF301, VMHSF302 and VMHSF303 (302 and 303 are application servers)
 
Scenario: Deploy using 80SP2 manifest
 
1. Prep the test data 
 
Check the upgrade steps if you are also testing customization upgrade along the way
Restore the database and upgrade to the version you're testing (any release older than 80SP3)
If you don't have a manifest at that level, create it using deployment manager from the older release level.
Then upgrade the database to 81 once a manifest has been created
 
2. Test the manifest upgrade process
 
Open Deployment Manager, and target the restored database
- Manifests may exist at this level as FWM_ENVIRONMENT was introduced at 80SP2 level.
Once the environment manifest creation wizard is displayed, import the old manifest (not sure if it's at this step when they ask for manifest import?)
Run through the manifest wizard to check the data has been parsed through and ensure it's correct
Deploy
 
Smoke test EA and sample of apps
 
 
Scenario: Deploy using 80SP3 manifest
 
1. Prep the test data 
 
Check the upgrade steps if you are also testing customization upgrade along the way
Restore the database and upgrade to SP3
If you don't have a manifest at that level, create it using deployment manager from the older release level.
- This new manifest should then be stored in FWM_ENVIRONMENT
Then upgrade the database to 81 once a manifest has been created
 
2. Test the manifest upgrade process
 
Open Deployment Manager, and target the restored database
- The 80SP3 manifest is expected to just load and work.
- Validate the environment has been added to the environment.config file in the DM MSI install directory (C:\ADERANTEXPERT\INSTALL)
Deploy
 
Smoke test EA and sample of apps
Steps: Step 1: Read the test case summary first || Step 2: Prerequisites:Manifests at the 80SP2 local workstation, load balanced environmentManifests at the 80SP3 local workstation, load balanced environment || Step 3: Deploying using 80SP2 manifest, local workstationCreate a new entry in DM, and load the manifestCheck details and deploySmoke test a few apps | Expected: Validate a new entry has been created in C:\AderantExpert\Install\environment.configValidate manifest has been saved in FWM_ENVIRONMENTExpert App smoke test should pass || Step 4: Deploying using 80SP2 manifest, load balanced environmentCreate a new entry in DM, and load the manifestCheck details and deploySmoke test a few apps | Expected: Validate a new entry has been created in C:\AderantExpert\Install\environment.configValidate manifest has been saved in FWM_ENVIRONMENTExpert App smoke test should pass || Step 5: Deploying using 80SP3 manifest, local workstationCreate a new entry in DM, and load the manifestCheck details and deploySmoke test a few apps | Expected: Validate a new entry has been created in C:\AderantExpert\Install\environment.configValidate manifest has been saved in FWM_ENVIRONMENTExpert App smoke test should pass || Step 6: Deploying using 80SP2 manifest, load balanced environmentCreate a new entry in DM, and load the manifestCheck details and deploySmoke test a few apps | Expected: Validate a new entry has been created in C:\AderantExpert\Install\environment.configValidate manifest has been saved in FWM_ENVIRONMENTExpert App smoke test should pass

Title: Deployment Manager MSI - UI - Opening a manifest for a deployed environment
Description:
This test case checks that when the manifest is pointing to an environment with a non-empty expertshare (persumably by the presence of instance config files... we are not testing this aspect though), if the user attempts to edit the environment manifest, some environment specific fields will be disabled.
 
Keep in mind that this is the start of a "first-pass" towards locking down all environment-specific fields, and that we have only implemented read only on some fields at this stage.
 
Opening a manifest for an environment deployed makes the following fields read only:
- Environment name
- Database server name
- Database server instance name 
- Database name
- The load balancer field
 
There is currently no differentiation between local and load balanced environments when setting manifest fields to read only.
Steps: Step 1: Open environments manifest in Deployment manager || Step 2: verify deployment configuration is correct | Expected: - Environment name- Database server name- Database server instance name - Database name- The load balancer field || Step 3: Deploy environment | Expected: Deployment is completed successfully

Title: Deployment Manager MSI - Pre-8.1 databases are rejected by Deployment manager
Description:
Deployment manager MSI version will only work with databases at the 8.1 level.
 
The initial step filters out all databases that do not have CMSADM in the following table:
select * from sys.database_principals
As well as filtering any databases that have system as its owner.
 
After this initial filtering, if there are pre-8.1 databases and they are selected:
  
 
and bounce the user back to the Expert Database Details dialog.
 
In the following scenarios, the selected database will be rejected if:
- CMS_DB_UPDATES: The 81GA update hasn't been applied to the environment
- FWM_ENVIRONMENT: The column DATABASE_UNO does not exist
 
If there is a partial condition met, then the following dialogs will be displayed:
 
 
We dont expect the partial conditions to appear outside the dev cycle, so this is unlikely to appear:

Or if the 81 GA update hasn't been applied as well:
(we can replicate this by corrupting the update_code in CMS_DB_UPDATE)
Steps: Step 1: Read the test case summary || Step 2: Straightforward test - use a database that is NOT at the 8.1 level, and attempt to select the database using Deployment manager MSI | Expected: Database is rejected and user needs to select another database

Title: Framework - Compatibility - 81GA MSI and ClickOnce continue to install and upgrade as expected
Description:
There are two scenarios to check here: Fresh installation and upgrade
 
Scenario: Fresh installation
Install ClickOnce and MSI products, then run a quick sanity test using those applications from the client machines
 
Target machine: WSAKL000648; .NET 4.6.1 is installed here.
The following products exist:
ClickOnce: ExpertAssistantCO.application, ExpertTimeActiveAgentCO.application , ExpertTimeCO.application
MSI: ExpertAssistantPerMachine.Msi / ExpertAssistantPerUser.msi , 
ExpertTimeActiveAgentPerMachine.msi / ExpertTimeActiveAgentPerUser.msi, 
ExpertTimePerMachine.msi / ExpertTimePerUser.msi
 
For each Installation, check in Program and Features that the version number is correct.
 
For Expert assistant:
Install. Then Launch, and perform search in Client / Matter / Employee. Open an application from the actions tab.
 
For ExpertTimeActiveAgent:
Install. Then launch the status bar - and look at the stats
 
For Expert Time:
Install. Then Launch the application, and save a time entry.
 
Scenario: Upgrade
Upgrade the deployed environment to 81, and then launch the ClickOnce and MSI products.
Then run a quick sanity test using these products from the client machines.
 
Need to find a client machine, and setup an old environment to upgrade.
 
Then upgrade the environments, and perform the quick tests as above, checking in Program and Features that the clickOnce and MSI applications have been upgraded successfully.

Title: Framework - Compatibility - Existing workflows can be opened, upgraded, built, published, and run the happy path in 4.6.1
Description:
There are many workflow template solutions - Ideally we want to check all of them run:
where time is limited, sample a few solutions to ensure they run - if they do, we can assume the others don't have any issues either.
 
The process is:
Extracting each template workflow solution, and then opening them in a visual studio instance that has 81 Design studio installed.
- It should be upgraded automatically, with the user being prompted to save changes after the upgrade has finished processing
- Check the project properties are targeting .NET 4.6.1
 
Build the workflow solution
- It should be built successfully
 
Publishing the workflow
- The dev workflow node in IIS should be created
- This is verified when you create a new package in Design studio, and pick the template workflow, in order to export it 
- Re-import the workflow to publish the workflow
 
Run the workflow
- The workflow should be runnable from the applications concerned e.g. EA, or from the product if it's a product specific workflow
- Run through the happy path for the workflow

Title: Framework - Compatibility - Deployment manager checks for .NET 4.6.1 during prerequisite check
Description:
Test test case checks that during deployment prerequisite check:
- The deployment environment has .NET 4.6.1 installed
- The application servers has .NET 4.6.1 installed
 
Note: It might be a good idea to run the application server prerequisite check test case if you need to, as they fit into the same workflow.
 
We'll need to perform the check for both Local customization workstations and load balanced environments
Candidate environments:
Local: VMCRT8030WS301
Load balanced: vmcrt8030ad301
 
Please contact John or someone from CRT team to get permission to do the upgrade,and also ask them to revert after running the test case.
 
Test approach
1. Remove the deployment
2. Upgrade the database
3. Run deployment manager from the new binaries, and attempt to deploy
 
Deployment manager should be stopped because the prerequisite checker will fail the check
 
Run the Application server prerequisite scripts on the application servers
You will also need to install .NET 4.6.1 on the administration workstation
All workstations will need to be restarted after upgrading the .NET framework
 
Deploy after the workstations have restarted
Deployment should succeed at this point
 
Run sanity tests on a few products to ensure deployment integrity

Title: Framework - Deployment - Deployment Manager - Apply customization works with VS 2015 Professional + Extensibility update/ VS SDK + VS Modelling and visualization SDK
Description:
Check that the installation process of using admin machine with VS 2015 professional + VS SDK + VSM SDK to execute the customization process.
 
Test approach
 
Ensure the deployment machine has:
- VS 2015 professional
- VS SDK / Extensibility update (see below)

- VIsualization and Modelling SDK
 
Data setup
 
Go through the deployment process to get an environment online using the above setup
 
Domain customization - You should know how to do this - if you don't, go through Peter's session on Domain customization to learn more. There are also additional learning resources on the QA sharepoint site.
 
After Apply customization has succeeded and the customization has deployed, complete the end to end customization process by:
- Modifying a product smartform/ adding a new smartform to expose the customized column
- Open this Form via an application and save data
- Check the database to confirm the data has been saved to the new column.

Title: Framework - Customization - Designer - Design Studio - Only admin users can modify product assignment on Expert System assets
Description:
Note: The forms must be opened from All Forms / Repository node in order for the product to change - because if you open the forms under form points, those forms already inherit Product from the form points, which inherits from the product they exist under.
 
Development mode
- The user is able to change the product value of any opened forms, regardless of scope
  
Non Development mode- If the form is firm scope, the user can change the product field
- If the form is toggled to system scope, the user cannot change the product field

Title: Framework - Compatibility - 81 Release - New workflow projects are only available in .NET 4.6.1 and removed from previous .NET versions
Description:
This still needs to be confirmed, but is created out of the linked bug (146785) where the available Expert projects that users can create in Visual studio is incorrect.
 
In 80SP3 we supported the following, so we expect the same to be available in .NET 4.6.1

We want this selection to be removed from previous .NET versions because we don't want users to create older vesions that will be automatically upgraded on create anyway.
 
Testing approach
- Check .NET 4.6.1 can create the above project and solutions
- Each builds successfully and 'runs'
- For older .NET versions, we remove the above options
 
No need to run for regression

Title: Framework - Customization - Design Studio - Form Product association cannot be changed at the extension point, only at the Repository view
Description:
When viewing a Form from a product extension point, the associated product is implicit and cannot be changed; therefore the field is read only:

 
However when we view the form from the repository i.e. not the instance, the Product field should be enabled.
 
Testing approach
 
If a Form has been opened from the extension point, then expect the Product field to be read-only and populated to the product of the Form Extension point:
 

 
If a Form has been opened from the repository, then the Product field should be enabled.
 

 
Currently, Design studio will attempt to display the first instance of the opened Form from the Product tree. This design may change later.
Steps: Step 1: Read the test case summary first || Step 2: Open a Product Form from the Form point, and observe the Product field | Expected: Product field is read only || Step 3: Open a Product Form from the repository, and observe the Product field | Expected: Product field can be changed

Title: Framework Customization - Design Studio - Attaching a form to a form point where the Form Point contract satisfies the Form. If the Form contract cannot be satisfied, then attachment is not possible
Description:
Forms can be attached to a form point if:
 
If What the Form requires is provided by the Form point
 
If the Form Point provides more than what the Form needs, attachment should be possible
 
If the Form Point only partially satisfies or does not satisfy what the Form requires, then attachment should not be possible
 
 
Testing Approach
 
Data setup
 
Pick an existing Form Point and look at its properties; the contracts on the Form points would be what we are going to try and add on our new Form:
 
 
Then create a new Form, with no contracts.  Proceed to add the Form to the Form point using right click -> Add Form -> Select Existing... dialog
 
Test 1: Attempt to add the Form with no data variables defined to the Form point 
- We expect the Form to be displayed as a candidate for attaching to the Form point
 
Test 2: Update the Form with additional data variables, and name them in the same manner as the Form point
- We expect our Form to be displayed as a candidate for attaching to the Form point
 
Test 3: Change the Naming for one of the data variables on our Form.
- We expect our Form to NOT be displayed as a candidate for attaching to the Form point, as the matching process determines based on the Variable name as well as the data type.
 
Test 4: Add additional variables to the Data Variable which is outside the scope of the Form point
- We expect our Form to NOT be displayed as a candidate for attaching to the Form point, because if the Form point cannot satisfy the data requirements of the Form, then it should not be possible to add the Form to the Form point.

Title: Framework - Customization - Design Studio - New rules can be added against an existing rule point or unattached
Description:
We want to check that new rules can be created:
- Against an existing rule point
   - Verified in the tables the association has been created
- Unattached (viewable from the repository)
- Verified in the tables that the new value has been created successfully
 
Testing approach
 
Unattached
 
Test the following type of rules can be created, unattached for a rule point, and is saved into the expected tables
Create with both right click and via the Ribbon - we need to test both methods!
 
For each rule created, check the following tables:
- FWM_RULE to ensure the rule has been saved
- FWM_RULE_VERSION for the version_uno that you need to search in the tables below
- FWM_RULE_ITEM - check the activities for the rule has been saved, and is in the correct sequence
 
Verify on the Navigation tree under repository (for the product associated with the rule), that the rule we've created exists

 
Attached
 
Test the following type of rules can be created, attached to a rule point, and is saved into the expected tables
 

 For each rule created, check the following tables:
- FWM_RULE to ensure the rule has been saved
- FWM_RULE_VERSION for the version_uno that you need to search in the tables below
- FWM_RULE_ITEM - check the activities for the rule has been saved, and is in the correct sequence
- FWM_EXTENSION_POINT_RULE - check that the rule + rule point association has been saved

Title: Framework - Customization - Design Studio - New Forms can be added against an existing form point or unattached
Description:
We want to check that new Forms can be created:
- Against an existing Form point
   - Verified in the tables the association has been created
- Unattached (viewable from the repository)
- Verified in the tables that the new value has been created successfully
 
Testing approach
 
Unattached
 
Test creating a Form via right click as well as via the ribbon.
Create a form by right clicking from anywhere other than an extension point (because creating on the Form point will automatically add it to the Form point)
 
After a Form has been created, check the following tables:
- FWM_SMARTFORM - this is where the form will be stored
- FWM_SMARTFORM_DELTA - this will only be populated if the Form has been changed at any point after the initial save
 
Attached
 
Test creating a Form via right click as well as via the ribbon.
 
After a Form has been created, check the following tables:
- FWM_SMARTFORM - this is where the form will be stored
- FWM_EXTENSION_POINT_SMARTFORM - this stores the Form + Form point association
- FWM_SMARTFORM_DELTA - this will only be populated if the Form has been changed at any point after the initial save

Title: Framework - Customization - Design Studio - New Menu items can be created via right click or the ribbon.
Description:
There is only one hook point in an application where menu items are displayed, hence menu items cannot be created 'unattached'.
 
If you do not select a valid Menu Point, then the menu creation will not progress
 
Check that:
- Menus can be created via the ribbon
- Menus can be created via right clicking on a non-extension point node
 
When the Menu item is created, check the following tables:
- FWM_RULE - Menus are treated like Rules, except they are opened / activated via Application Menus
- FWM_RULE_VERSION - A version for the rule will be created
- FWM_RULE_ITEM - The activity(s) within the Menu will be saved here under the Expression column in the table

Title: Framework - Customization - Design Studio - New Job items can be created from the ribbon and right click, and is categorized under Jobs
Description:
Jobs are considered a form of Rule that is only run when scheduled (or adhoc) via Schedule manager, and thus does not hang off any particular extension points.
 
Check that Jobs can be be created via the Ribbon or via right clicking any nodes that is not an extension point.
 
Check the following tables when Jobs are created:
- FWM_RULE: Where the job is stored
- FWM_RULE_VERSION: Versioning of the Jobs, if there are changes made later on
- FWM_RULE_ITEM: This is where the Job activity & sequence is stored
 
Additionally, Open schedule manager, and check that the job you created can now be added and a schedule created for it.
When a schedule has been created, check the following table:
- FWM_EXTENSION_POINT_SCHEDULE - a schedule has been created for the job and therefore we expect a row here

Title: Framework - Customization - Design Studio - Package exporter - Exported item picker is influenced by whether Development mode is on or not (system vs firm scope)
Description:
Test that:
- If the package scope is firm, then the things it sees are in firm scope
- If the package scope is system, then the things it sees are in system scope
 
Test Approach
 
Set FWM_OWNER to Aderant so you can toggle Development Mode on/off, then check the following items:
 
Firm scope
Adhoc lists: Compare available data provider selections between system / firm scopes
Configuration Values: Selection didn't seem to matter regardless of package scope???
Data Providers: Compare available data provider selections between system / firm scopes
Domain Extensions: Only firm customizations displayed here
Domain Lookups: Only Firm customizations displayed here
Existing Packages: Compare availalbe package selections between system / firm scopes
Jobs: Selection didn't seem to matter regardless of package scope???
Products: Selection didn't seem to matter regardless of package scope???
Report Items: These have no scope defined - so we show all
Rules / Actions: Compare available data provider selections between system / firm scopes
Security policies: These have no scope defined - so we show all
Security Resources: These have no scope defined - so we show all
Smart Forms: Selection didn't seem to matter regardless of package scope???
Workflow Projects: Selection didn't seem to matter regardless of package scope???
 
 
System scope

Extension points is an additional node that is only pickable if the package scope is system

Title: Framework - Customization - Design Studio - New Packages can be created via the ribbon or right clicking on a node
Description:
Packages are not necessarily product specific, they are simply a container that allows the transportation of "stuff" from one environment to another. This includes the following components:
 

However we are not looking to test the creation, export and import of the above in this test case - this is done in other test cases. 
 
We are just looking at creating a new package, attaching a config value, smartform, and a rule, then exporting it to examine the contents. In particular, we are looking at creating new packages via the ribbon and via right clicking.
 
Testing approach
 
Create a package via right click or the ribbon, then add a config value, a smartform, and a rule. Save the package.
Check FWM_PACKAGE_SPECIFICATION to see if the Package has been created.
Then check  FWM_PACKAGE_SPEC_CONTENT to see the number of items associated with the package
 
Then export the package, and check its contents - this is currently the fastest way to determine whether we've associated our components with the package correctly
The package zip file should contain the config value, the smartform definition, and the rule definition that you included in the package in the zip.

Title: Framework - Customization - Design Studio - New Data Providers can be created via the ribbon or right clicking on a non-extension point node
Description:
Test that data providers can be created via the ribbon as well as right clicking on a non-extension point node
 
Test approach
 
Create a new data provider
Then fill out the required fields etc, and save.
Check the following tables:
- FWM_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION: This is where the Data provider is saved in 81
- FWA_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION_PROP: This is where the data provider property settings are saved
 
Then run a quick test by placing the data provider on a form, and searching in the preview pane.
 
Note: The dataprovider I used has been exported to a package, then attached to this test case.
Feel free to import this package and test it alongside the DP you've created (it should create records in the same tables)

Title: Framework - Customization - Design Studio - Look in repository to find all your Forms/Rules/Menus/Jobs
Description:
Testing approach
 
For each type (Forms, Rules, Menus, and Jobs), they appear in:
- The extension point with which they are associated with
- The repository
 
For a Form:
- Pick a Form point and an existing Form that is attached
- Then Open the All Forms repository and search for that Form
 
The same form should be found here
 
Repeat the above for Rules, Menus, and Jobs. Expert Billing is a useful product to do this test.

Title: Framework - Architecture - Data Providers - Python Data providers can be created inside Design Studio
Description:
Use the linked test cases to create the custom python data providers
 
Config-based Data providers are upgraded on deployment; thus when the config-based XML data providers are added, you will need to redeploy in order to use them in Design Studio.
 
Testing approach
 
1. Create a python-based data provider using the linked test case. We now support the creation of python data providers via design studio:
Copy the python script from the test case (81791) into the Edit Script... dialog.
2. Check FWM_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION to verify the Python data provider had been created successfully
3. Create a form, and plug the data provider into a control on the form:
4. Search via the Preview pane against the data provider - it should do what it says (search for and return employees)

Title: Framework - Architecture - Data Providers - Domain customization data providers are upgraded during deployment
Description:
Testing approach
 
1. Perform a domain customization to create a new table, this will be the basis for our new data provider
2. Apply customization
3. Check FWM_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION  to ensure the data provider has been created
4. Add some data to the table so we can test data retrieval, eg:
insert into _HERO_DATAPROVIDER2 values (1,'Batman','Gotham',CURRENT_TIMESTAMP)
insert into _HERO_DATAPROVIDER2 values (2,'Joker','Gotham',CURRENT_TIMESTAMP)
insert into _HERO_DATAPROVIDER2 values (3,'Superman','Metropolis',CURRENT_TIMESTAMP)
5. Add the data provider to a smartform, and test via Preview pane:

Title: Framework - Architecture - Data Providers - Data providers with both firm versions and System versions are upgraded correctly into FWM_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION
Description:
Testing approach
 
1. Setup the environment by picking a data provider at the following path, and creating a firm level config value by double clicking on the System version and clicking OK:
2. Remove that particular data provider from the new tables:
- FWM_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION
- FWA_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION_PROP
 
3. Then remove, and redeploy to perform the upgrade process
DELETE FROM FWM_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION
WHERE path LIKE '%disbursementgroup%'
DELETE FROM FWA_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION_PROP
WHERE DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION_UNO = (SELECT row_uno FROM FWM_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION WHERE path LIKE '%disbursementgroup%')
 
4. Upgrade to the latest release
 
5. Check Design studio to see whether the Firm version of the data provider has been imported alongside the system version, and whether the firm version can revert to System. Do this by going to Design Studio | Expert System | Data Provider | Bill | Disbursement Group. This should open as a firm version when you double-click.
 
6. Check the database has a firm (scope = 10) and system (scope = 0) level: 
SELECT SCOPE, * FROM FWM_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION WHERE path LIKE '%disbursementgroup%'

Title: Framework - Architecture - Data Providers - If an old data provider has multiple firm versions, we will upgrade the one with the latest effective date
Description:
Test that if an old data provider to be upgraded has multiple firm versions, the latest version is picked up on data provider upgrade
 
Testing approach
 
Find a data provider and create multiple firm versions of this, with valid from date filled on each firm scope data provider value
Upgrade the data provider via deploying the environment
Only the system level and the firm scope data provider value with most recent VALID FROM date migrated into FWM_DATA_QUERY_DEFINITION
 
Steps:
In the configuration manager open ExpertSystem.DataProvider.Bill.DisbursementAdjustment
Double click the system entry
Note: Valid from will default to today and cannot be a date in the past
Under "Advanced" set the Valid until date to be some time in the recent past
Ok
Double click the system entry again
Under "Advanced" set the Valid from date to be some time after the above date

Title: Framework - Customization - Smart Forms - Utilizing DataGrid OnChange and OnValidate events
Description:
This test case is to specifically look at the changes introduced by the linked user story:
 
We now have events for grids:
This was previously available only in smartform wizard
 
We also now support expressions on the IsReadOnly and IsRequired fields:

We also support the calculation of values via the events that fire on the default row / insertion row, and the events that fires on validating existing rows i.e. when editing an existing row, we validate it when the user stops editing / row focus is lifted:

 
Finally, the easiest way to test this is to observe the split rules (depending if you are splitting time entries or disbursement entries), and then perform the action in Billing.
 
The validation rules should be triggered on editing existing rows, and the default row / new row rules should only trigger for adding a new split entry.
The top portion of the split smartform should update whenever the split entries are added / edited.

Title: Deployment Manager MSI  Installation
Description: Deployment Manager MSI supports re-installation; as
Steps: Step 1: Double click DeploymentManager.msi | Expected: Popup is displayed, confirming the installation. Verify that the publisher is ADERANT Holdings Inc || Step 2: Select yes when prompt appears | Expected: Deployment Manager should install successfully || Step 3: Open Deployment Manager | Expected: Popup is displayed, confirming authorization to make changes. Verify that the publisher is ADERANT Holdings Inc Verified correct version  (Currently it is 8.2) || Step 4: Select yes when prompt appears | Expected: Deployment Manager is launched with no issue. Verify that the publisher is ADERANT Holdings Inc. Verified correct version  (Currently it is 8.2) || Step 5: Go to Windows Installed Apps  and look for Deployment Manager | Expected: Publisher should show 'Aderant' || Step 6: Uninstall Deployment Manager from Programs and Features | Expected: Should see the same permission request poup || Step 7: Select yes when prompt appears | Expected: Uninstall complete successfully

Title: Framework - Deployment - Deployment Manager - (Release 81) Deployment fails when installation pre-requisites are not met
Framework - Deployment - Deployment Manager - If ExpertSource path is empty, we will require the zip file path to be provided (and then extract things for you
Description:
Things to test:
 
 
If both source path and source zip is empty, then both fields are marked as invalid
 
If the Source path is empty, and the zip path is not provided:
- Both paths will be marked as invalid until a source path with files are provided, or a zip file is provided
 
If the source path is non-empty and provided, the zip path will not be marked as required
 
If the zip path is provided, but the source path is not
- The source path is marked as invalid, and needs to be provided

Title: Framework - Deployment - Deployment Manager - Load balanced manifests automatically add dependent roles
Description:
This is existing functionality that we need to check in the MSI world - once it's been checked, should not need to re-run
 
In a load balanced manifest, the role dependencies are handled automatically.
If a role is dependent on another, and the dependent role has been unticked, on accepting the manifest the dependent roles are automatically selected to help the user out.
 
The dependencies of each role can be found in the *.role.xml of the corresponding role you're interested in

Check that unticking (the visible roles that we can untick) the roles that our product roles depend on, and accepting the changes, undos the change and re-ticks the role that the ticked product roles depend on.

Title: Framework - Deployment - Deployment Manager - If a user adds an environment that already exists in environment.confg, DM will load that environment
Description: This test case is created to ensure DM MSI does not crash, and when users add an environment that already exists, we will display that environment in DM.

Title: Framework - Deployment - Deployment Manager - When the user makes a mistake on entering database server name details, they are able to correct it without DM crashing
Description:
See linked bug - this use case describes a common scenario where the user mis-types a database server name, and then DM crashes (see linked bug)
 
We need to check that the user can make mistakes, and that after the db server call times out, they are told of the problem (the server name field now has a validation error) and the user can fix the problem (change the db server name) and add the database they intended to add in the first place

Title: Framework - Deployment - Deployment Manager - Deployment Manager now handles cmsdbo password being updated
Description:
This is a current issue PS is facing with firms that have enforced password policy on the cmsdbo user. Previously the firms were not able to use deployment manager because there was no facility to update the cmsdbo password that is stored in the database to grant access. 
 
The changes introduced in 81 will facilitate this via the following scenario:
 
Make sure the environment is already deployed.
Start DM
- Environment A & B are already registered in environment.config
- Environment A is selected and saved in environment.config.
 
Change cmsdbo password. Then restart DM MSI.
 
Load deployment manager - Environment A is loading... we expect prompt for login info
 
Switch to Environment B - Enviornment B is loading... we expect prompt for login info
 
Switch bran to Environment A - and remove the environment, and redeploy 
- This is also required in the workaround they performed for 803 release clients

Title: Framework - Deployment - Deployment Manager - If the source path becomes empty, we require the zip to be provided, and extract the files for them
Description:
Where the user has created a new location for ExpertSource, but has not extracted them - we now provide the facility to extract it.
 
Check the following scenarios:
 
- In deployment manager manifest editing UI:
 - If the expert source path becomes empty, invalidate it
 - Source zip file becomes required
 - Providing the zip file immediately extracts the files into expert source
 
- In environment creation wizard
 - If the expert source path becomes empty, invalidate it
 - Source zip file becomes required
 - On progressing to the next step, the zip file is extracted (we need it for the roles step)

Title: Framework - Compatibility - Old workflow templates prompts users to upgrade on opening the solutions
Description: See attached user story

Title: Framework - Deployment - Running the Release 81 ApplicationServerPrerequisites script will create an environment variable on the box, and allow 81 deployment to use the machine
Description:
Positive test:
Run the application server prerequisite script
The following should appear in your environment variables list:

 
If you don't know where to go:
Right click on start menu:
 
Then
 And
Deploy releases 81 on this environment (either use it as admin machine, application server, or local customization workstation)
 
Deployment should occur successfully
 
 
Negative test
 
Don't run the application server prerequisite script
 
Attempt to use the box as an admin machine, application server, or local customization workstation machine
 
You should get an error complaining the server is not 81 ready, and to run the Application Server Prerequisite script.

Title: Database Restore - Restore Datbase with different name with filestream enabled
Steps: Step 1: Precondition - Backup a DB that has FILESTREAM enabled || Step 2: Open SSMS | Expected: SQL Open || Step 3: Click the New Query Button | Expected: New Query Window is displayed || Step 4: Open the attached file in SQL | Expected: Attached File Open in SQL || Step 5: Set the restore name and the path to the directory where the backup is stored. | Expected: Path and name set || Step 6: Press F5 or the execute button in SQL | Expected: DB restore is executing || Step 7: Confirm that the DB was restored | Expected: Confirmed || Step 8: Confirm that the DB was named accordingly | Expected: Confirmed || Step 9: Run the following script: select * from sys.database_files | Expected: Script executed and results are displayed || Step 10: Confirm that the filestream is updated | Expected: Confirmed || Step 11: Confirm that the paths are correct | Expected: Confirmed || Step 12: Confirm that the paths can be browsed to | Expected: Confirmed || Step 13: Open expert and confirm that functionality was not lost (Import Documents, create appointments, etc.) | Expected: Confirmed.

Title: Framework - Customization - Smartforms v3 - On Grids, the ability to delete rows can be determined by expressions instead of just booleans
Description:
As part of required functionality for Entity Manager, we now have the ability to use expressions to evaluate whether users can delete rows from Data grids or not.
 
Things to test:
- Existing data grids - delete is enabled
If CanDeleteRow is not set (for data grids created prior to this change), the default behavior is to allow row deletion i.e. CanDeleteRow is implicitly true 
- This can be verified in Billing - Disbursement and Time split data grids were created prior to this change.
 
- Entity Manager -> Select a client -> go to Red Flagged words - delete is enabled / disabled depending on setting
If CanDeleteRow is set to false, the delete button is disabled for each row in the data grid
If CanDeleteRow  is set to true, then delete button is enabled for each row
If the CanDeleteRow condition evaluates to true at any point e.g. 

Then the delete button is enabled; if the condition stops being evaluated as true, then the delete button is disabled.

Title: Framework - Customization - Smartforms - Upper casing can be applied to Textbox and Advanced Textbox text
Description:
Not sure when functionality for textbox upper case / lower case was added. Advanced textbox casing functionality was added in 8.1 (see linked user story).
 
Create a smartform, then add a textbox and an advanced textbox.
Change the casings, then enter text in the preview panel
 
If upper: all characters entered into the textbox becomes upper case. Test that numbers can be entered, and shift can be pressed to change the numbers into symbols.
 
If lower: all characters entered into the textbox becomes lowercase
 
 
Test the above scenarios for advanced textboxes as well

Title: Framework - Customization - Smartforms - Row totals can be enabled on Data grid columns
Description:
Check that row totals can be toggled on a data grid column:

Can either test using the existing Billing forms, by toggling the setting on, and then browsing to the smartform in the application

Title: Framework - Customization - Smartforms - We can now rule rules to default information onto new rows in a Data Grid
Description:
Test via Product form in Design studio; 
 
Billing has already implemented rules to run for defaulting information on disbursement split:

Modify the rule that is run on defaulting row - in this case, I've modified the value that is defaulted onto new split items:
 
Save the changes, then open Expert Billing.
Open a prebill, and split a disbursement
 
The disbursement narrative should be defaulted from the source entry, with the additional information ("test")
Save the disb split

Title: Design Studio - Expressions - String functions can be used to build expressions in expression builder.
Description:
String functions have been introduced:

And they have documentation on the right pane as each is selected:

This is fairly straightforward to test - you just need a candidate rule or expression that you can use to play with using the string functions. In this case, I used the filter expression on a data provider to test the string functions. Update the filter expression, then search for the record.
 
I updated the email of an employee to "Test", then ran the following functions:
ToLowerCase(Item.Email) = "test" -- Expect match
ToUpperCase(Item.Email) = "test" -- Expect no match
ToUpperCase(Item.Email) = "TEST" -- Expect match
ToSentenceCase(Item.Email) = "TEST" --Expect no match
ToSentenceCase(Item.Email) = "Test" --Expect match (see example from function description to understand this)
ToSentenceCase(Item.Email) = Trim("Test  ") -- Expect match
ToSentenceCase(Item.Email) = Trim("  Test") -- Expect match
ToSentenceCase(Item.Email) = ItemAtIndex(Split("@", "Test@anothertestword"),0) -- Expect match.
ToSentenceCase(Item.Email) = ItemAtIndex(Split("@", "Test@anothertestword"),1)  -- Expect no match.
 
Note that in the above case, we need to use ItemAtIndex to facilitate looking into arrays, as we currently don't support directly working with collection objects... yet
Steps: Step 1: Follow the steps in the summary || Step 2: Create an IsNullOrEmpty expression1 - Open Design Studio and open a form to customise2 - Select a field on the form and press the ellipsis button next to On Validate3 - On the form that opens select the Expression Builder link 4 - Create an expression in the Expression Builder using IsNullOrEmpty, for example - IsNullOrEmpty(CurrentEmployee.DisplayName) and CurrentEmployee.Email = "%@aderant.com" note that the form indicates that the expression is valid.5 - Press save | Expected: Saves as expected || Step 3: Check that the tree in the Configuration tab of the Expression Builder is formatted with the indenting you would expect for such a tree.

Title: Framework - Customization - Rules - Rules and Jobs can now store codes, which can be used to contain additional information
Description:
Jobs and rules now have an additional "Code" field in Design Studio:
 

When entered, the Code will be displayed in the title. They are saved in FWM_RULE.Code

Title: Framework - Customization - Smartforms - CTRL + SHIFT + D on a customizable smartform opens the smart form host dialog
Description:
When opening a customizable smartform, the following dialog is displayed:

Pressing Edit will open Design Studio, and opens the smartform in question.
The Top edit button opens the Form point edit dialog:

While the lower edit button opens the smart form edit dialog.
 
The smartform name and scope are both displayed in the dialog.
Pressing refresh will bring in changes to the currently displayed smartform e.g. changes to the smartform controls, behavior, etc.

Title: Framework - Customization - Data Providers - Users can create Lookup dataproviders in design studio
Description:
Users can now create LOOKUP data providers:
 
As long the value provided for the LookupType matches a value in CXL_CODE_LOOKUP.LOOKUP_GROUP, the lookup can be generated.
 
We can then consume the data provider:

When working correctly, the data provider will retrieve the values we expect from CXL_CODE_LOOKUP and allow you to persist the selected value back to the database.

Title: Framework - Workflow - Child workflows / sub workflows should be cancelled when the parent workflow has been suspended or cancelled
Description:
Possible scenarios:
- Suspend parent workflow
  - Child workflow is suspended
- Suspend Child Workflow
  - ??? Parent workflow
 
- Resume parent workflow
  - Resume child workflow
-  Resume child workflow
  - ???/Resume Parent workflow
 
- Cancel parent workflow
  - Cancel child workflow
-  Cancel child workflow
  ???/ Cancel parent workflow
 
- Terminate parent workflow
  - Terminate child workflow
-  Terminate child workflow
  ???/ Terminate parent workflow

Title: Framework - Customization - Design Studio - Creating rules for form and grid events (On Initialize / On Change / On Validate )
Description:
In 8.1, you can create new rules from:
 
Attached to Form Points (148678)
Unattached to form points (148678)
 
- Within smartforms - As validation rules that are triggered by events (on initialize, on validate)

Or on datagrid events
 
For each rule created, check the following tables: 
- FWM_RULE to ensure the rule has been saved
- FWM_RULE_VERSION for the version_uno that you need to search in the tables below
- FWM_RULE_ITEM - check the activities for the rule has been saved, and is in the correct sequence
- FWM_EXTENSION_POINT_RULE - check that the rule + rule point association has been saved

Title: Framework - Launch startup measurements
Description:
Meant to capture the changes Tjeerd and Alex has implemented for the current selection of applications that are using the new mechanism.
 
Testing approach
 
Pre-change
 
Collect fiddler logs to measure the startup time of each application
Also identify the service calls invoked during startup via the fiddler logs
 
Post-change
 
Collect fiddler logs against the same set of applications, and check the startup time
Check the service calls and, using the provided documentation, look for any service calls that are in the 'black list'
Also check Event viewer for any error events related to the startup work e.g. any error events referencing the startup cache is related
 
Email from Jamie on the results of the testing done on the startup work:
 
Hi all,
 
Last Friday Franklin and I captured data on the application startup for Rates, Billing, Collections, Expenses, Time, MatterWorks and WIP Review on Main.BuildAll_20160824.5. 
 
Test Process:
1.       Logging was set to Info level.
2.       The cache was cleared prior to starting each application, but IIS was not reset (we were not sure if this step was necessary or not, please advise if this step should be included in future testing). 
3.       Captured service calls for each application startup using Fiddler
4.       Monitored Event Viewer for info level events to do with application startup
 
All event logs to do with “Could not use application startup cache” are summarised in the attached Excel document. Event logs are attached. Service calls for each application captured using Fiddler. Fiddler logs also attached.
 
Observations of service requests which looked like they matched criteria listed in the documentation for service calls that should be combined:
Billing:
Identity
MatterWorks:
Current employee
Rates:
Configuration cache eviction
Help links
Security
Employees
Time:
MRU
Extension points
Employees
WIP Review:
Current employee

Title: Framework - Deployment - (Upgrade) Integrated security interaction in Deployment Manager
Description:
Integrated security has been introduced
 
When enabled, if there are existing credentials inside the fields, it should be cleared.
- Even if there are credentials, they won't be used as the integrated security flag is checked.
When disabled, the credential fields are still set as reqiured (as they were before), and those credentials will be used to connect to the database during deployment.
 
Different scenarios exist:
 
Editing the manifest:
- New DM, point to existing environment. Has old expertsource.
   - integrated security is disabled because the expertsource framework dll does not have the integrated security changes - OK
- New DM, point to existing environment with new expertsource.
   - integrated security is checked or unchecked depending on the manifest. Also check the save to database is correct (both check and unchecked - see next line). - OK
   - useIntegratedSecurity attribute is new, on the databaseConnection attribute in the environment file. Updating as expected. - OK
 
Adding environments:
- New DM, add an existing environment (pre 8.1.1) with existing manifest, choose use integrated security
   - Ignores integrated security and does not modify the manifest - OK
- New DM, add an existing environment (at 8.1.1) with existing manifest, choose use integrated security. Manifest was set to use integrated security
   - Environment manifest added with integrated security checked - fail, did not update manifest?
- New DM, add an existing environment (at 8.1.1) with existing manifest, choose use integrated security. Manifest was set to not use integrated security
   - Environment manifest added with integrated security unchecked - fail, did not update manifest?
- Old DM, adding an existing environment (at 8.1.1) Low risk?
   - Opens manifest fine and does not display the integrated security checkbox as expected. - OK
Steps: Step 1: See the test case summary please

Title: Framework - Architecture - Security - Making sure SSN and Salary are masked for non-admin users
Description:
Apart from Admin users and our Expert Applications, if the user tried to view the data they will instead see "*" 's in place of the data.
Note that SYSADMIN and DBOWNER users bypass this security, so they can see the data - but their rights can also be revoked. The data masking facility is to make sure SQL-based snooping by non-users are HARD - there are still ways to infer masked data from other sources.
 
Note that this feature is only available in 8.1.1, and ONLY if the environment is using SQL Server 2016. Environments deployed on earlier versions of SQL Server will not have this feature enabled.
 
The tables storing the data concerned are:
 
select ANNUAL_SALARY, *
from BDA_EMPLOYEE
 
select SALARY, *
from BDA_EMPL_ASSIGN_PERIOD
　
select ssn, *
from HBM_NAME_PEOPLE
 
select ssn, *
from KEY_CMSCLIENT
 
select ssn,*
from KEY_CMSPERSONNEL
 
The areas where we need to check if the data is hidden correctly:
 
SQL Server query sessions
Application UI & Reporting
Exporting / Importing excel sheets containing the salary info
 
Application UI vs SQL Server
 

If the user has rights to use the application, show the data as intended
Otherwise, if the user is not an administrator, they should see "*" or 0's when querying data.
 
Exporting the Salary - This is viewable, and follows the same train of thought - if the user can use the application (and then export the data), then it should be viewable once exported. The user has made a conscious decision and it is their responsibility to keep this information safe, once exported.
 
Test that the salary can still be exported and reimported (data masking shouldn't have affected this functionality)
 
Test that the reports which retrieve salary still display the data as expected:

In Case - Ensure SSN is not available as a search filter in contacts, on the Personal View -> Advanced Search tab.

Title: Design Studio - SmartForms - Upgrade - Upgrade report is retained on Upgraded smartforms, and can be deleted
Description:
Testing Approach
 
Create a basic smartform
Upgrade this smartform either through Design studio > Double click, or go through the Smartform Upgrade Wizard process.
An upgrade report is generated and saved at the Roaming profile location e.g. C:\Users\franklin.liu\AppData\Roaming\Aderant\Local\UpgradeReports
On opening the upgraded smartform, if there's an associated report, the user can click on the information alert to open the report (which opens the report HTML page)
The user can also choose to delete the report - which removes the page from the cache
Only the user who upgraded the smartform can see the report (because that's where the report is stored) - other users opening the upgraded smartform will see nothing.

Title: Framework - Architecture - Security - User - Application access are logged based on application importance
Description:
From 8.1.1, we start logging User authorization attempts when they interact with our applications.
 
[question: is this toggle-able? Or always on, and is dependent on the log4net settings?][answer: always on, since 8.1.1]
 
An additional security appender has been added to Log4net, which looks like below:
   <!-- Security Logger -->  <!-- Note: Does not inherit from root. -->  <logger name="Aderant.Security" additivity="False">    <level value="ERROR" />    <appender-ref ref="SecurityAppender" />  </logger> 
 
Usage is the same as the other log4net appenders, in that the level value will determine the level of message logged in event viewer.
Attempts are logged to Event Viewer (as well as DebugView if that's running), with the source set to Aderant Security.
This means the event viewer log can be filtered based on this specific source, if the firm wants to conduct a security audit.
 
Events that are logged:
- Failed attempts to get rights. 
All applications where user access failed, should generate a log entry
 
- Administrative applications - the app and the user access are logged.

Domain Wizard
Deployment manager
Security Manager
Configuration Manager
Package Manager Console
Design Studio
Smartform wizard
Expert Administration
Schedule Manager
Regardless of failure or success, access is logged for admin applications.
 
Testing approach
 
Setup user for positive access to all apps
Setup user for negative access to all apps
 
Changes haven't been made to the security mechanism / infrastructure, only to log the events, so this is a low risk feature.
 
Check that if users proxied attempt to start applications e.g. Franklin proxied TTQA1 in EA, then started other applications - the log should display the TTQA credentials in the log events.
 
Questions:
1. What is additivity?

Title: Framework - Architecture - Security - Non-admin users can be granted unmask rights as per installation guide
Description:
Look for the Enable Data Masking section in the Installation / Upgrade guide.
 
Once there, you will see instructions to create a new domain group - this is unnecessary for internal testing, we can piggy back on an existing group.
You can skip to step 2 and create a new login against the group e.g. ADERANT_AP\SG_AP_Software_Tester.
 
As per documentation, if you don't turn on Groups object type, you will have a bad time.
 
The next steps aren't referred to in the documentation (but are implied...), which is to MAP your user against the target database:

 
--This returns nothing until you map the newly created domain group 'user' against the target database you wish to grant unmask rights on
select * from sys.database_principals where name = 'ADERANT_AP\SG_AP_Software_Tester'
 
--This won't succeed if the SQL statement above returns no user for the user you've just created, but not mapped, to the target database
alter Role
[DBR_UnmaskRights] ADD MEMBER "ADERANT_AP\SG_AP_Software_Tester"
 
Alternatively, you could also just tick the DBR_UnmaskRights role in the user mapping to achieve the same result.
 
This was useful in getting some understanding around database principals:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16040557/cannot-find-the-user-because-it-does-not-exist-or-you-do-not-have-permission
 
Then ask IT to add TTQA4 (or whichever tester login) to the group you've setup. But do the testing steps below first before you do this last step.
 
Testing
 
You want to test with the user e.g. TTQA4 before it gets added to the group, to make sure the data masking is working as expected.
Start Budgeting, and load a budget with data. Open a SSRS report e.g. Employee Compensation, and check the Salary figures are 0 (it means you don't have rights to see it, as designed)
 
Then make the changes as per above and load the report again
 
You should be able to see the salary now.

Title: Framework - Architecture - Security - Users can debug secured environment traffic
Description:
Notes on how to setup fiddler to inspect 
 
If you go to the inspectors to look up the details of the call, you will get a pretty yellow bar at the top that you can click to set up the decryption. 
 

 
Select to decrypt HTTPS traffic and the trust the fiddler root certificate.
 

You may need to restart fiddler to pick up the change. Once you do you will start seeing the fiddler calls as you are used to.
 

 
Once you have finished you may want to uninstall the certificate installed by fiddler, in particular if you are doing this on a client site.
In order to do this, with Fiddler go to Tools -> Telerik Fiddler Options…
 

 
Go to the HTTPS tab, and then go to the Actions, and select Reset All Certificates and follow the prompts. 
Be careful after following the prompts, you may get asked to re-approve the certificate so make sure you don't do this.
