Title: EA Launcher copes with LOCKED files on update
Description:
If Billing is running, and the share has been updated with new files that Billing needs. Someone launches Billing via EA Pro to update Billing - what happens?
 
In this case where client applications are using a file that needs to be updated, the user would receive the following dialog:

 
And they would not be able to update until all applications using this file is closed. The dialog also provides information on what applications need to be closed from the client side for the updates to proceed.
 
To Test:
- Find ExpertShareManifest.zip, and MAKE A BACKUP OF THIS SOMEWHERE. You'll need this to restore your environment to the original condition at the end of this test.
- Extract the zip, and look for a file that is definitely being used by the application you want to test with e.g. Aderant.Framework.dll
- Change the hash value - this will force EA launcher to evaluate the local files in the Applications folder as different, therefore outdated, and it will force an upgrade attempt on the file. As an example, you can change the hash value like so:
<file fileName="Aderant.Framework.dll" directory="" lastModified="2018-03-01T04:32:26Z" fileHash="1A9023D71DFA422555CDDE2EE67BD37E" fileVersion="1.8.6634.47876" />
to
<file fileName="Aderant.Framework.dll" directory="" lastModified="2018-03-01T04:32:26Z" fileHash="1A9023D71DFA423555CDDE4EE69BD37E" fileVersion="1.8.6634.47876" />
- Launch via EA Launcher the same application that you have running on the client side.
- You'll see the dialog above, asking you to close the application before updates can proceed

Title: HTTP Downloads can revert back to Assembly resolver if inaccessible
Description:
Scenario: What happens when the downloads location is not accessible, and applications need to update their files?
 
The HTTP Download functionality will fall back to assembly resolving and grab files via Expertshare when the HTTP Downloads location is inaccessible.
 
To Test:
 
- Go to your Aderant.ExpertLauncherInstaller location, and open the Aderant.ExpertLauncherCO.exe.config file:

- Change the ExpertSharePath to the expertshare folder, like in the image above. Doing so will essentially disable HTTP Downloads and revert EA Launcher to use assembly resolving as the approach towards getting the files it needs. Note: No need to update the other fields in this file.
 
- Start Fiddler
- Go to the Applications folder (e.g. C:\AderantExpert\VMHSFExpert\Applications) and load an application that has not been previously loaded. Observe Fiddler - the application will open successfully, and you should not see any calls to download files via HTTP.

Title: Expert Launcher copes with missing files via HTTP Download
Description:
Scenario: Application is launched through Expert Launcher, however there are files missing. What happens?
 
To Test:
 
We can delete the required files to simulate this, by deleting files from the applications folder e.g. C:\AderantExpert\VMHSFExpert\Applications. E.g. for Billing, we can delete Aderant.Billing.dll.
 
- Launch Fiddler so we can monitor HTTP traffic
- Check the instance.config file in Applications folder - the downloadsURL URI attribute should be pointed to the downloads folder for your environment.

- Launch the application via Expert Launcher / EA Pro
- Check Fiddler - you should see a HTTP download line for the missing file

- The application launches successfully and the file has been re-downloaded.

Title: Pinned applications will attempt HTTP Download first if there are missing files, then use expertshare if the location is inaccessible
Description:
Scenario: Users have started applications via EA pro, but have pinned it as a shortcut to the taskbar. Starting applications this way will circumvent the bootstrapper, which is the mechanism used to check if there are updates, and instead attempt to run with the set of files defined with the current manifest.
 
Test approach
 
- Launch fiddler to monitor the HTTP traffic. Ensure you have the target application pinned on the taskbar as well.
- Setup the missing file by deleting a file from the Applications (e.g. C:\AderantExpert\VMHSFExpert\Applications) folder
- Launch the application and monitor Fiddler
- You should see the file being re-downloaded in fiddler, and the application launching successfully.
 
Scenario: The HTTP Downloads location is inaccessible
 
Test Approach
 
- Open the instance.config in Applications (e.g. C:\AderantExpert\VMHSFExpert\Applications) folder
- Change the URI to something nonsensical e.g. www.google.co.nz
- Launch the application
- No fiddler entry for the missing file being retrieved
- Application launches successfully

Title: Redeployment is not affected by EA Pro-enabled applications
Description:
There is a fear that redeployment might be affected by applications launched via EA Professional - this should not be the case as all files needed by the .exe on clientside are pulled across by HTTP Download, then by Assembly resolving where needed.
 
Test approach
 
Open an application via EA pro from target environment - ensure application is fully loaded
Redeploy target environment - remove, then deploy
 
There should be no file locks experienced (on the client machine side). Remember to check for running processes in the background on the target environment...

Title: MSI application self-healing alongside HTTP Download changes
Description:
Note: For FULL Msi's, everything's self-contained and therefore HTTPDownload has no relevance because it will never try to update. Clients are advised to reinstall FULL MSI's every time they upgrade their environment.
 
For MSI applications - there are two ways to start the application, which takes us through two different routes of finding the files needed for the .exe to start successfully.
 
 
If the application is started via PINNED ON TASK MENU (1), this will start the application from the Applications folder, which bypasses the bootstrapper and therefore will NOT update unless something's changed according to the current file manifest.
- This means if an existing file is missing or different for whatever reason, this file will be pulled through via assembly resolving
- Other scenarios, detailed below
 
If the application is started through START MENU (2), this will start the application via the bootstrapper, and pull back files via HTTPDownload (falling back to assembly resolving if this isn't possible)
 
The scenarios we know to test are:
 
Deleted files – where the local cache is corrupted, starting the application via either method will allow the user to continue to use the application
To setup: 
Go to your application folder e.g. C:\AderantExpert\VMHSFExpert\Applications, and delete a file that might be needed for your application e.g. Aderant.Time.dll
For (1) - We expect the file to be pulled across via HTTP (but this will occur after the application has started - because assembly resolving kicks in after application is started, and a required file is missing - it will be fetched then. However manual observation may be meaningless since the timing difference between this and (2) will be small)
For (2) - We expect the file to be pulled across via HTTP - which occurs before the application starts as the bootstrap logic will gather all known required fiels before starting the application
 
Out of date application manifest – this will need a hand-crafted edit to the manifest in the cache to test this mechanism?? 
To setup:
For a load balanced environment, we will need to repeat the steps for both app servers
Go to your app server IIS Downloads location e.g. C:\AderantExpert\Local\Services\Downloads, and open the ExpertshareManifest.xml inside the ExpertShareManifest.Zip
Pick a file that will always be in the application cahce e.g. Aderant.Framework.dll, and update the filehash to be different than the original value

For (1) - Nothing happens - no file transfers for the changed files occurs over HTTP - because aseembly resolver doesn't care about updating files, its only concerned with getting missing files
For (2) - We expect the file with the changed hash to be updated via HTTP - because a difference in hash has been detected. Also a new ExpertshareManifest.zip will be copied via HTTP into the applications folder
 
IIS-stop: where the IIS services are stopped (and therefore the HTTP download location is not available), expertshare will continue to work for the upgrade (check with Chuan / Stef on which services to actually test the stoppage for)
(1) This is already covered by the linked test case 188793, which deals with this scenario. 
(2) This is already covered by the linked test case 188787, which deals with this scenario.

Title: Upgrade -> Client MSI installation on previous releases continues to run on 82GA without reinstallation.
Description:
The HTTP Download changes in 82GA will require users to re-install their MSI's in order to pick up the HTTP Download functionality.
 
We need to check that if users do not reinstall their MSI's, their MSI will continue to work
- This was partially tested during the VMHSF cluster upgrade, using 82GA build without changes, install MSI on client machines, then upgrade VMHSF with HTTP Download changes, and launch the applications and perform sanity test. This passed without failure, but we need to explore this on the 811 line and even further back to see if there are any impact.
 
We also need to check that if users reinstall the MSI's, they don't run into any problems. This can manifest in old files that weren't updated, or any sort of weird behavior. The scope of this is limited to installation, as product related issues should be resolved by the product team Devs.
 
Test Approach
 
Setup previous release environment
Install MSI's on client machine, perform sanity test. Check  event viewer etc.
Upgrade the environment to 82GA
Re-open applications on the client machine, perform sanity test, check event viewer etc.
 
second portion
Re-install the MSI's from the 82GA expertshare
Open the applications, perform sanity test, check event viewer etc.

Title: Deployment Manager supports previous releases with latest changes from HTTP Download
Description:
Changes have been made to DM to ensure changes to the share also results in a sync to the HTTP Downloads location. To this end, additional code have been introduced alongside those actions, so we'll need to retest actions that modifies expertshare. This includes:
 
- Package import
- Apply Customization
 
As with all changes to Deployment Manager, we need to ensure the existing use cases of Deployment manager continues to work on previous release lines.
 
The use cases are:
- Deployment
- Workflow Publishing
- Patching
- MSI Generation
 
Of all the above use cases, the most important ones to test are:
 
- Deployment
- Patching
- Apply Customization
- Workflow publishing
 
The easiest way to test the above changes are:
- Use an admin machine with the latest 82 DM
- On a previous release environment, remove the deployment.
- Add the previous release environment to this machine's DM, and copy the source files and everything needed to redeploy the environment to this machine.
- Redeploy
- Reapply patches if possible
- Rebuild customizations if possible
- Publish existing / new workflow definitions
 
The above approach should provide coverage of all the things we need to test.

Title: (Sanity Test) Security Manager
Description:
Check that:
 
- Policies can be created, edited, and deleted
- Policies can be assigned to users, and removed from users
- Users are able to save proxy / proxied users
- License report can be generated and sent (little button in the top left of the window)
 
Licensing Status Report Email Window
Steps: Step 1: Open Security Manager using login that is NOT in any work groups that have the "Framework.Security.SecurityManager" permission | Expected: Security Manager should not open || Step 2: Open Security Manager using login that is in the Administrators user group | Expected: Security Manager should open || Step 3: Select Module Policies tab || Step 4: Start typing in the 'Select Policy' box as filter for the search | Expected: Existing policies filtered accordingly should appear || Step 5: Select the policy | Expected: Policy is selected, and following are displayed:- Attached members - users or user groups- Appropriate resources are granted/denied || Step 6: Click New || Step 7: Select 'Firm' as Policy Type || Step 8: Enter '_ALL' in Name and Description field || Step 9: Click Ok | Expected: New policy should be added in the list with provided name and description || Step 10: Add permission for policy | Expected: Green tick next to items which this policy gives permission for || Step 11: Save new permissions by clicking the disk in the top left corner | Expected: Green tick should remain next to items permissions are given for || Step 12: Search for member in Members panel || Step 13: Add yourself in Members list || Step 14: Click Save in top left menu || Step 15: Click Properties || Step 16: Change the content in Name and Description field to '_ALL_NEW' | Expected: The policy should be updated in the list with new name and description || Step 17: Click Copy to copy existing policy || Step 18: Enter new policy description in Description field || Step 19: Click Ok | Expected: New policy should be added in the list with provided name, description, and shares the same permissions as the policy that was copied || Step 20: Click Delete || Step 21: Click Ok | Expected: New policy should be deleted from the list || Step 22: Select '_ALL_NEW' policy from policy list || Step 23: Click Delete || Step 24: Click Ok | Expected: '_ALL_NEW' policy should be deleted from the list || Step 25: Select Data Policies tab || Step 26: Repeat step 4 to step 24 || Step 27: Select Users tab || Step 28: Search for an user in 'Select User' field || Step 29: Click Proxy button || Step 30: Search for another user in '{Your username} can act on behalf of' field || Step 31: Click Ok | Expected: The list of proxied users is under your username || Step 32: Open Expert Assistant | Expected: 'On behalf of' field should be appeared || Step 33: Close Expert Assistant and go back to Security Manager || Step 34: Click X button in the top left menu || Step 35: Select 'Licensing Status Report' || Step 36: Select Output Format || Step 37: Click Show Report | Expected: A license report should display with selected output format || Step 38: Select 'Send Licensing Status Report' | Expected: A license report should be generated and attached to email. The outlook window should look similar to the screenshot in the summary of this test case || Step 39: (From 8.2.5) Select Resource Tab - File, and add new resource with network location file://dfs.aderant.com/expertshare/FolderABC/FileABC and Select save option . Select File Policy and update the read/Write/Delete permission . Select Save . Try to download the file by postman or use Get / List/ Put and verify permissions honored as expected | Expected: The resource path should show has a hierarchy in Security Manager. That is if a path is a child it should show as a child of the parent with selected default permission.  Permissions honored as expected || Step 40: Open Entity tab and Create a copy of Entity policyDeny specific entity permissions from policyAdd user with p0 to policy Save changesWait 20 minutes( or IIs reset) | Expected: Open App & web app with limited access and verify access is limited according to policy || Step 41: Open Entity tab and Create a copy of Entity policyDeny specific entity permissions from policyAdd user with p1 to policySave changesWait 20 minutes( or IIs reset) | Expected: Open App & web app and verify access is NOT limited since user is P1, even though user is added to policy || Step 42: Navigate to the Search tab, then search and apply filters to locate specific modules.Export the results to a file. Repeat this process for Entities, Files, and Data | Expected: The returned search results can be refined using filters and exported to a file

Title: (Sanity Test) Expert Administration
Description:
Main purpose of Expert Administration is to hold the configurable options and values of Expert Applications.
These options are only configurable to those that have the appropriate security rights.
 
Therefore the Sanity Test will only attempt to test these things at a high level - taking only a few moments to verify.
 
Test that:
- The applications you have rights to administer, correctly displays the product nodes in Expert Administration
 
E.g. If you don't have the Disbursement administration security resource granted on your user (ExpertDisbursementsAdministration):

Then you wouldn't expect to see a corresponding node to administer Disbursements in Expert Administration:

 
Also Test that:
- Changes in Expert Administration saves and persists.
 
This can be tested as part of the sanity / smoke test of another product, that requires setup. For example, Budgeting needs setup in Expert admin to complete its smoke test.

Title: (Sanity Test) Admin & Configuration Manager
Description:
Since the advent of Expert Administration, Entity Manager, and Design studio - we no longer interact with configuration values directly.
 
Sanity Test ensures that if the user needs to access these values - they are able to do so, and perform the basic functions that might function as workarounds, in case other routes don't work.
 
Check that:
- Configuration values can be opened:
 - As part of product testing setup, licenses will be imported - you can use these to check this (Technical.Licensing.License)
- Expert Administration changes are working with the same config values:
 Example scenario
 Expert Administration: System.Email -> Exchange server Version and URL
 Configuration path: Changes are reflected under Technical.Framework.Integration.ExchangeConfiguration
- Configuration values lookup returns results for search terms
 - Search for email-related configuration values returns results, and shows the configuration value path when highlighted, for example.
Steps: Step 1: Open Expert Admin , Configuration Tab || Step 2: Run this query in SQL Server Management StudioSELECT * FROM CFM_CONFIGURATION_NAME cn INNER JOIN CFM_CONFIGURATION_VALUE cv ON cn.ID = cv.NAMEID WHERE cn.PATH like '%license%' || Step 3: Check the number of license in Technical.Licensing.License | Expected: Number in configuration manager should match with query results || Step 4: Open Expert Administration || Step 5: (Steps 5-8 for POST822 only)Go to System | Email || Step 6: Change Diagnostic Information Email to a new value || Step 7: Go back to Configuration Manager  and check SystemTechnical.Framework.Diagnostics.SupportEmailAddress | Expected: New value should be changed in Configuration Manager and match with new value in Expert Administration || Step 8: Open Expert App, go to back stage and click  help and then select email diagnostic information. | Expected: Outlook opens with a new email to be sent with diagnostic information, with the to field pointing at the Diagnostic Information Email you supplied || Step 9: Go to Business.Client.Domain.BusinessEntity in Configuration Manager || Step 10: Add a new configuration value 'NewConfigCreatedBeforeUpgrade' and its value is 'Hello Worlds' | Expected: Configuration value should be able to be created || Step 11: Reopen Configuration Manager || Step 12: Go to Business.Client.Domain.BusinessEntity.NewConfigCreatedBeforeUpgrade || Step 13: Delete that configuration value | Expected: Configuration value should be able to be deleted || Step 14: Clear the  Diagnostic Information Email that you set in step6 || Step 15: Create a shortcut to ExpertAdministration.exe and in the properties add the /config argument. | Expected: Expert Administration should start with the configuration tab selected. || Step 16: Open up Expert Admin, navigate to System, then Printer Settings | Expected: Printer Settings should be loaded

Title: (Sanity Test) Workflow Admin
Description:
Workflow administration allows users to interact with individual workflow instances, and perform maintenance / gather information.
 
Workflow administration has visibility over all workflow instances (depending on the search filter) in a system, therefore we expect the application to be fairly performant.
 
Check that:
- Non-privilege level 1 user cannot access this app 
- We don't retrieve all workflows at startup (82GA fix)
- We are able to retrieve workflow instances based on various filters
- Process filters, and grid column sorting works as expected
- (82 onward) We are able to go to the logging page for workflow instances by clicking on the instance name
Steps: Step 1: Check that:- Non-privilege level 1 user cannot access this app || Step 2: - We don't retrieve all workflows at startup (82GA fix) || Step 3: - We are able to retrieve workflow instances based on various filters || Step 4: - Process filters, and grid column sorting works as expected || Step 5: - (82 onward) We are able to go to the logging page for workflow instances by clicking on the instance name

Title: Ensure Office add ins work on 64 bit versions of Windows
(Sanity Test) Deployment Manager
Description:
Main use case of Deployment Manager is to deploy an expert environment, when setup correctly. 
Deployment Manager is also used to maintain existing environments.
 
For the scope of sanity tests, check that:
- Deployment manager can add environments, and read the manifest from the environment.
- For environments without manifests, Deployment Manager is able to import a environment manifest into the target environment
- Deploy Expert successfully.
Steps: Step 1: Main use case of Deployment Manager is to deploy an expert environment, when setup correctly. || Step 2: Deployment Manager is also used to maintain existing environments. || Step 3: For the scope of sanity tests, check that:- Deployment manager can add environments, and read the manifest from the environment. || Step 4: - For environments without manifests, Deployment Manager is able to import a environment manifest into the target environment || Step 5: - Deploy Expert successfully. || Step 6: Perform IISReset in powershell || Step 7: Check event viewer for any errors or warnings | Expected: No errors or warnings related to Aderant Expert occur || Step 8: Go to C:\AderantExpert\{EnvironmentName}\tempEnvironmentName will be local if you deploy on local | Expected: Verify ExpertShare.Zip exists

Title: Domain Customization - Adding a custom column
Description:
Customization is a multi-step process:
1. Physical database customization (DBEditor)     1.1 Make sure you add a date time column while doing customization test. #Bug 229050
2. Extend the model (Domain wizard) and build the customization (Deployment manager -> Apply Customization)
3. Consume the customization (Design Studio or smartform wizard if pre 80 release)
 
This test case covers Steps 1 & 2. Step 3 will be covered in a (see links) with some generic guidelines on how the customization could be consumed.
 
Use this as the default source of information: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/sites/Iknow/Expert/Lists/Posts/Post.aspx?List=30beb497-583f-4aa1-b731-298d7b40c50d&ID=3115&Web=15687d89-7e79-49be-8fed-8c53925290a3
 
The steps below will provide some quick reminders of what to do, but the video should be the complete step-by-step / first stop for information.
 
Testing Approach
 
1. Physical database customization (DBEditor)
In DBEditor, having decided the table you need to customize - you'll then need to pick a data type for the new column.

Common data types are:
- integer
This needs to be short as we don't support Long Datatype for data providers. Short will generate the sql data type as int, whereas Long gets generated as Int64. 
- strings of size 1 (chars)
This is treated as a CMS Boolean by our application
If this is added, you need to change the control type to Checkbox:
- strings with specific sizes
- strings of type long 
- date
- currency
- and hours (in some use cases).
 
Remember to tick Nulls or prepopulate the new column with test data before attempting to consume the customization.
Also - ID's for new columns start from 900+ for each table. 
 
Verification: You are able to see the tables with customization in Domain Wizard, in the next step
 
2. Extend the model (Domain wizard) and build the customization (Deployment manager -> Apply Customization)
In Domain Wizard, having decided the domain you want to extend with the new property you've added to the underlying table(s) - just pick it and step through the wizard:
(sample screenshot of the domain wizard)
 
Verification: Check FCM_CUSTOMIZATION_METADATA and verify the METADATA generated matches what you've just setup in Domain Wizard
 
In Deployment Manager, go to Packages tab and click Apply Customization. 
 
Verification: Customization build completes successfully, and Customization is applied successfully.
Deeper verification if time available:
 
Customization build logs
You can look in ~Binaries\ExpertSource\Customization\[generated folder name] for the CustomizationBuild.log and ~Binaries\ExpertSource\Customization\CustomizationBuilder.log for any errors that we might've swallowed. 
 
Customization slugs in stored procedures and views
Find the Stored procedures and views that has customization slugs from the table(s) we've just customized, and verify the custom properties have been added between the customization slugs.
 
This SQL might be helpful - just change the filter value for b.name to the domain you're customizing. Sometimes you might need to dig deeper than what this SQL provides!
 
SELECT pro.name, sch.name
FROM sys.procedures pro inner join sys.schemas sch on pro.schema_id = sch.schema_id
WHERE Object_definition(object_id) LIKE '%--# %% #--%'
--and sch.name like '%matter%'

Title: Domain Customization - Adding a custom column with foreign key relationships
Description:
Customization is a multi-step process:
1. Physical database customization (DBEditor)
2. Extend the model (Domain wizard) and build the customization (Deployment manager -> Apply Customization)
3. Consume the customization (Design Studio or smartform wizard if pre 80 release)
 
This test case covers Steps 1 & 2. Step 3 will be covered in a (see links) with some generic guidelines on how the customization could be consumed.
 
In addition, this test case requires you to be familiar with creating a custom column - see 193340 or the sharepoint link below.
 
Use this as the default source of information: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/sites/Iknow/Expert/Lists/Posts/Post.aspx?List=30beb497-583f-4aa1-b731-298d7b40c50d&ID=3115&Web=15687d89-7e79-49be-8fed-8c53925290a3
 
The steps below will provide some quick reminders of what to do, but the video from the link above should be the complete step-by-step / first stop for information.
 
Testing Approach
 
1. Physical database customization (DBEditor)
 
Create your custom column - the DATATYPE of this column needs to be the SAME as the DATATYPE of the PRIMARY KEY column we're linking to, so find out beforehand.
 
Then add the foreign key - right click on the ForeignKeys heading

 
 And drag your custom column into the Linked Columns area in DBEditor

 
In the Result field, type the target table we're linking to - if the DATATYPE has been setup correctly, the columns we can link to should be populated under the Foreign Columns section.

Worked example below

 
Verification: You are able to see the tables with customization in Domain Wizard, in the next step
 
2. Extend the model (Domain wizard) and build the customization (Deployment manager -> Apply Customization)
In Domain Wizard - progress through the initial steps - the beginning is the same as the process for when we added a custom column

Screenshot from going through the wizard with the worked example
Note that the relationship name is in lower case - it can be either lower case or upper case or a mix in between. Our Domain Customization is expected to handle this, and we need to test these specific cases to ensure the mechanism has not regressed.
 
Verification: Check FCM_CUSTOMIZATION_METADATA and verify the METADATA generated matches what you've just setup in Domain Wizard
 
In Deployment Manager, go to Packages tab and click Apply Customization. 
 
Verification: Customization build completes successfully, and Customization is applied successfully.
 
Deeper verification if time available:
 
In Design Studio, if you opened an existing form / rule that worked with the customized viewModel, then you could verify the new relationship has been established.
 
From the worked example above:
 
The matter model should now has an additional attribute:

Which when expanded is an employee object!

Title: Domain Customization - Creating a custom table - Collection of custom entity off the Aderant Entity / One to many relationship
Description:
Customization is a multi-step process:
1. Physical database customization (DBEditor)
2. Extend the model (Domain wizard) and build the customization (Deployment manager -> Apply Customization)
3. Consume the customization (Design Studio or smartform wizard if pre 80 release)
 
This test case covers Steps 1 & 2. Step 3 will be covered in a (see links) with some generic guidelines on how the customization could be consumed.
 
Use this as the default source of information: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/sites/Iknow/Expert/Lists/Posts/Post.aspx?List=30beb497-583f-4aa1-b731-298d7b40c50d&ID=3115&Web=15687d89-7e79-49be-8fed-8c53925290a3
 
The steps below will provide some quick reminders of what to do, but the video from the link above should be the complete step-by-step / first stop for information. The screenshot provides a worked example - your table may / will look different!
 
A short blurb before we get underway:
 
The setup below considers the situation where we desire a relationship where one Aderant Entity (in this case Employee) has a collection of zero to many Custom entities (in this case, an entity with pet names. So, Pets). If we desire a one-to-one relationship, the Foreign Key needs to reside on the Aderant Entity, and linked back to the target entity whether it be Aderant or Custom. See linked test case for further details.
 
The importance lies in the location of the Foreign key - our software is intelligent enough to detect the type of desired relationship via this aspect, and the things we do to verify post-apply customization goes in line with how we expect Apply Customization interprets the Foreign key placement.
  
Testing Approach
 
1. Physical database customization (DBEditor)
 
Each table is composed of:
- Columns (at least one column as the primary key)
- ResultKey - this sets a column as the primary key of the table
- Foreignkeys - at least one so we know which 
 
Table creation
Note that the ID for custom tables starts at 99000+
 
COLUMNS
We want at least:
- A column to hold data
- A column to act as the Primary Key for this table - cannot be null!!!
- A column to act as the Foreign key to another table 
 
Naming convention of adding '_' in front of column names is not needed for custom table columns.
 
RESULTKEY (Primary Key)
Again - do not check the Nulls checkbox for a column that is going to be designated as a Primary Key for the table!
Right click on ResultKeys and create a new Result key for the table. Then drag the column we've created for Primary Key purpose to the Column list field. Tick Primary to indicate the Primary Key intent.
 
As part of Primary Key designation, we also need to add a index alongside it to complete the Custom table creation.
Similar to ResultKeys - drag and drop your Primary key column, then tick the checkboxes above to indicate the nature of the index being set up.
Note that the index name must be unique in the database - so provide a unique name or else the build will fail
 
FOREIGNKEYS
 
This is the same as setting up a foreign key column (see linked test case 193418) 
Verification: You are able to see the tables with customization in Domain Wizard, in the next step
 
 
2. Extend the model (Domain wizard) and build the customization (Deployment manager -> Apply Customization)
 
In Domain Wizard - progress through the initial steps - the beginning is the same as the process for when we added a custom column
Once selected - all columns of the table must be imported
 

The domain we linked to via Foreign key is available for selection.
 
In Deployment Manager, go to Packages tab and click Apply Customization. 
 
Verification: Customization build completes successfully, and Customization is applied successfully.
 
Deeper verification if time available:
Open Design Studio and access a Form that used Employee model as part of the data e.g. 

Then switch to the Data tab, and expand the Employee model:
 
 
The new entity we've crafted has been extended as a collection of things, based off the Employee Entity. In this case, this is the desired result!
Steps: Step 1: See summary for more details on customizations || Step 2: Create a custom table in DBEditor (e.g., _HBA_ENGAGEMENT_CAT). Example fields: ROW_UNO (integer), MATTER_UNO (integer), ENGAGEMENT_CAT_CODE (string non-null). || Step 3: Set ROW_UNO to be a primary key, and MATTER_UNO + ENGAGEMENT_CODE to be a Result Key. || Step 4: Set MATTER_UNO to be a foreign key to HBM_MATTER.MATTER_UNO. || Step 5: Save changes. | Expected: If you query the DGI_DD_COLCRUTCH table, the MATTER_UNO field should have a KEY_CODE = 'X' || Step 6: Run Domain Wizard. select "Extend existing entity to add a new column or child table", then click Next. || Step 7: Select the custom table you created in step 2, then click | Expected: No error should pop-up, preventing you from submitting the domain customization. || Step 8: Apply customizations || Step 9: Use DBEditor to edit the custom table created in Step 1 above by adding a new custom column || Step 10: Run Domain Customisation Wizard to add the custom column to the domain model || Step 11: Apply customizations

Title: Domain Customization - Adding a foreign key from Aderant Table to another entity - One-to-one relationships
Description:
Customization is a multi-step process:
1. Physical database customization (DBEditor)
2. Extend the model (Domain wizard) and build the customization (Deployment manager -> Apply Customization)
3. Consume the customization (Design Studio or smartform wizard if pre 80 release)
 
This test case covers Steps 1 & 2. Step 3 will be covered in a (see links) with some generic guidelines on how the customization could be consumed.
 
Use this as the default source of information: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/sites/Iknow/Expert/Lists/Posts/Post.aspx?List=30beb497-583f-4aa1-b731-298d7b40c50d&ID=3115&Web=15687d89-7e79-49be-8fed-8c53925290a3
 
The steps below will provide some quick reminders of what to do, but the video from the link above should be the complete step-by-step / first stop for information. The screenshot provides a worked example - your table may / will look different!
 
A short blurb before we get underway:
 
The setup below considers the situation where we desire a relationship where one Aderant Entity (in this case Client) is linked to another entity (In our case, an entity with pet names. So, Pets). If we desire a one-to-many relationship, the Foreign Key needs to reside on the Custom Entity, and linked back to the Aderant entity. See linked test case for further details.
 
The importance lies in the location of the Foreign key - our software is intelligent enough to detect the type of desired relationship via this aspect, and the things we do to verify post-apply customization goes in line with how we expect Apply Customization interprets the Foreign key placement.
 
Note that although the worked example looks at linking Aderant to a custom entity, the step is still the same for linking an Aderant entity to another Aderant entity.
 
  
Testing Approach
 
1. Physical database customization (DBEditor)
 
Setup a custom table - the instructions for this are in the linked test case 193456
Note the Datatype of the Primary key column of the custom table. The Datatype of the Foreign key column we will add to the Aderant table must match.
 
Add a custom column to the Aderant table of your choice - a worked example as been done below. Instructions for doing this are in the linked test case 193418
 

 
Verification: You are able to see the tables with customization in Domain Wizard, in the next step
 
 
2. Extend the model (Domain wizard) and build the customization (Deployment manager -> Apply Customization)
 
In Domain Wizard - progress through the initial steps - the beginning is the same as the process for when we added a custom column (193418)

At the step where the relationship is defined - remember to define a unique name for the relationship you're describing. 
The domain we linked to via Foreign key is available for selection. In our case, we've selected to link to our custom entity:
Note: The source entity in this screenshot is for another entity - the original worked example is linked to Client as the source entity.
 
In Deployment Manager, go to Packages tab and click Apply Customization. 
 
Verification: Customization build completes successfully, and Customization is applied successfully.
 
Deeper verification if time available:
Open Design Studio and access a Form that used Client model as part of the data e.g. 
Then switch to the Data tab, and expand the Client model:
 
 The new entity we've crafted has been extended as a one-to-one mapping of Pet information, based off the Client Entity.

Title: Client/Matter row level security
Steps: Step 1: Note 1: Each step in this test cases builds on the previous stepNote 2: The type of grant applied makes no difference to the outcome for the user as we're only checking that the user is not denied. The form needs some review as this is confusing to the user.Training:https://aderant.csod.com/default.aspx?ReturnUrl=https%3a%2f%2faderant.csod.com%2fphnx%2fdriver.aspx%3froutename%3dSocial%2fUniversalProfile%2fTranscript%26TargetUser%3d124%26isCompletionRedirect%3dtrue%26loStatus%3d16%26regnum%3d1%26loId%3dd3666061-3239-4a6e-8f55-88bd50b45627iknow:https://aderant.sharepoint.com/sites/Iknow/Expert/Lists/Posts/Post.aspx?List=30beb497-583f-4aa1-b731-298d7b40c50d&ID=2891&Web=15687d89-7e79-49be-8fed-8c53925290a3 || Step 2: Pre req dataClient - has 2 matters- has never had client or matter securityUser 1- has privilege level 1UPDATE HBM_PERSNL SET PRIVILEGE_LEVEL = 1 WHERELOGIN=''User 2 - does not have privilege level 1User 3 - does not have privilege level 1- can proxy user 2Group 1- EveryoneNote: For security setup you can use either classic or entity manager Note: For testing the consumption of the security, there are multiple apps that you can use but not all use proxy, so EA may be the easiest to use | Expected: Note: This SQL only works on user, not group so needs enhancedDECLARE @client asvarchar(2000)='JANSEC1'DECLARE @clientuno asINT=  (SELECT CLIENT_UNO FROM HBM_CLIENT WHERE CLIENT_CODE = @client)SELECT sp.SECURITY_ID [Plan], sp.DESCRIPTION,'CLIENT: (' + CLIENT_CODE + ') ' + CLIENT_NAME  [Secured Item],c.SECURITY_ID[Item's linked plan],sr.ROW_UNO [Secure row],e.EMPL_UNO,e.EMPLOYEE_NAME, sr.RIGHTS_MASK,DENY_VIEW,REVOKED,sp.TYPEFROM CMS_SECURE_PLAN spLEFTJOIN CMS_SECURE_ROW sr ON sr.SECURITY_ID = sp.SECURITY_IDLEFTJOIN HBM_PERSNL e ON sr.PERSON_OR_GROUP = e.EMPL_UNOLEFT JOIN HBM_CLIENT c  ON sp.SECURED_ROW_UNO = @clientunoWHERE sp.TABLE_ID = 102 AND c.CLIENT_UNO = @clientunoUNIONSELECT sp.SECURITY_ID [Plan], sp.DESCRIPTION,'MATTER: ('+ m.CLNT_MATT_CODE +') '+ MATTER_NAME [Secured Item],m.SECURITY_ID[Item's linked plan],sr.ROW_UNO [Secure row],e.EMPL_UNO,e.EMPLOYEE_NAME, sr.RIGHTS_MASK,DENY_VIEW,REVOKED,sp.TYPEFROM CMS_SECURE_PLAN spLEFTJOIN CMS_SECURE_ROW sr ON sr.SECURITY_ID = sp.SECURITY_IDLEFTJOIN HBM_PERSNL e ON sr.PERSON_OR_GROUP = e.EMPL_UNOLEFTJOIN HBM_MATTER m ON sp.SECURED_ROW_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOWHERE sp.TABLE_ID = 104 AND m.CLIENT_UNO = @clientuno || Step 3: Plan exists on client as on but has no secured recordsAdd just a plan to the client  (on) | Expected: - User 1 can see the client and both matters  - User 2 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can proxy user 2 and see the client and both matters || Step 4: Plan exists on matter as on 1 but has no secured recordsAdd just a plan to matter 1 (on) | Expected: - User 1 can see the client and both matters - User 2 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can proxy user 2 and see the client and both matters || Step 5: Plan exists but is not on and has no secured records1. Set client plan to off2. Set matter 1 plan to off | Expected: - User 1 can see the client and both matters- User 2 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can proxy user 2 and see the client and both matters || Step 6: Plan exists and is not on but has secured user record1. Set client plan to on2. Apply a grant to user 2 on the client3. Set client plan to off | Expected: - User 1 can see the client and both matters- User 2 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can proxy user 2 and see the client and both matters || Step 7: Grant to user 2 on the client1. Set client plan to on (it already has a grant to user 2) | Expected: - User 1 can see the client and both matters- User 2 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can’t see any- User 3 can proxy user 2  and can't see any because security is not based on proxy || Step 8: Grant to user 2 on matter 11. Set client plan to off2. Set matter plan on matter 1 to on3. Apply a grant to user 2 on matter 1 | Expected: - User 1 can see the client and both matters- User 2 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can't see matter 1- User 3 can proxy user 2 and can't see matter because security is not based on proxy || Step 9: Grant to Group on Client, Deny to user 2 on matter 11. Set client plan to on2. Apply a grant to group 1 on the the client3. Change the security for user 2 on matter 1 to deny | Expected: - User 1 can see the client and both matters- User 2 can't see matter 1- User 3 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can proxy user 2 and can see all because security is not based on proxy || Step 10: Grant to Group on Client, Deny to user 2 on matter 1, Disable row level security for user 21. Add user 2 to a security group that has DisableRowLevelSecurity (you'll find this under Matter) | Expected: - User 1 can see the client and both matters- User 2 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can see the client and both matters- User 3 can proxy user 2 and can see all because security is not based on proxy || Step 11: Grant to Group on Client, Deny to user 2 on client, Deny to user 2 on matter 1, Disable row level security for user 21. Apply a deny to user 2 on the the client | Expected: - User 1 can see the client and both matters- User 2 can't see the client- User 3 can't see matter 1- User 3 can proxy user 2 and can't see matter 1 because security is not based on proxy

Title: Users are able to view database statistics via Instrumentation inquiries
Description:
This is a set of new inquiries that we introduced in 82GA, specifically around capturing database -related statistics and information:
 
sample syntax: http://wsakl001194.ap.aderant.com/Expert_Local/ApplicationServices/WebInquiries/Home/ExternalInquiry/#/
 

However the expected use case behind these inquiries is not well-known - discussion with Leo is required t get more information. 
 
Currently for inquiries that might need user attention:
- Database key limit warning
- Database ServiceBroker EndPoint Count
 
Which indicates if there are any rows that needs user attention - this hidden away in the inquiries, instead of being surfaced up - need further testing to see if System monitor has additional lines to display warnings if any of these statistics breach the default threshold that we've defined (also not visible to user at present).

Title: Post-installation, expert launcher drops an icon onto the client desktop, and users can access EA Professional via this shortcut.
Description:
After installing from the expertshare location, a shortcut is placed on the client's desktop, which points to the EA Professional website.
 
This is the easier way that we expect users to consume usage of EA Professional when their environment has been setup, instead of typing the website URL manually.

Title: ExpertShare Security
Description:
This test case is to check that the permissions for accessing and editing files in the ExpertShare are what they are supposed to be. This work was done by Nathan Boon. 
 
Ensure that the permissions of the ExpertShare line up with what is outlined on this wiki page: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/Platform/Wiki/Expert%20Share%20Write%20Permissions.aspx
 
I.e. ensure users that shouldn't have Full control don't, and users that shouldn't have Read & Execute rights don't, and vice versa. And that users that shouldn't be able to be given control, e.g. the Everyone group, should be able to.
Steps: Step 1: See summary

Title: Are all [product] jobs running successfully on the shared testing environment?
Description:
Check the default loadout of product jobs are working as expected.
 
This includes checking all available jobs have run successfully on the shared environment, according to schedule manager.
However this is only at the observable surface; each product still needs to check if the jobs have done what they have promised to do.

Title: All scheduled jobs on [Release] environment completes successfully
Description:
Check the default loadout of product jobs are working as expected.
 
This includes checking all available jobs have run successfully on the shared environment, according to schedule manager.
However this is only at the observable surface; each product still needs to check if the jobs have done what they have promised to do.

Title: Can users manage existing job schedules using Schedule Manager in 82RC
Description:
Schedule manager is used to oversee the existing jobs & schedules that are running on an environment
 
Users can see all available jobs on a schedule
Jobs without a schedule can have a schedule created for it
Past schedule runs can be reviewed
Scheduled job can be executed on premis ("Run Immediately")

Title: All scheduled jobs on 82RC environment [VMAKLITEGG} completes successfully
Description:
Check the default loadout of product jobs are working as expected.
 
This includes checking all available jobs have run successfully on the shared environment, according to schedule manager.
However this is only at the observable surface; each product still needs to check if the jobs have done what they have promised to do.

Title: Users are able to publish and complete vanilla FileOpening workflow in 82RC
Description:
We often use the completion of vanilla FileOpening workflow as a measure of the workflow infrastructure stability in a release.
 
Doing this regularly helps us have confidence in:
- Workflow publishing
- Workflow tasks completion, assignment
- Workflow notes
- Workflow status
- Proxying, depending on how workflow task assignment / department head/ requesting attorney was setup for the workflow instance
- Client and Matter save via the service.
- Workflow persistence
 
To a lesser extent, test the Expert Assistant settings related to workflow tasks
- Task-related emails
- Auto open settings
- Desktop alert / toaster

Title: Can users manage application security rights for their users in 82RC?
Description:
For a given application in [Release] , check that users can manage their application security for their users via security manager
 
We expect the individual products to have tested this, therefore the framework test will be to sample some of our applications in the test, as the security implementation for all our applications are expected to be consistent.
 
Check that:
- Users without certain application security rights aren't able to perform those actions
- Users are then able to perform those rights when they've been assigned:
  - Either by being part of the module policy membership (the rights are granted on the module policy)
  - Or the module policy security resource has been enabled
 
Popular candidates:
MatterWorks -> Top down wizard
Have rights:

Have no rights:

Title: Can users manage their proxies for their application in Security Manager?
Description:
Check that users are able to perform actions on other's behalf or vice versa, when proxy is defined via Security manager.
 
Once proxy has been defined, we expect the following places to be proxiable:
 
- EA - Workflow tasks
- Expert time - application in general
- MatterWorks - Approval tasks
- And any other applications that supports proxying. 
 
We'd expect only those users that are we are able to proxy would be selectable from the proxy list in an application.
 
We'd also expect those that are able to proxy us can do so, in the applications that supports proxying.
 
In All instances we just need to check at least one of these instances are working as proxy implementations should be consistent across our applications...

Title: Can users customize Product assets using Design Studio
Description:
Our products are shipped with system version of Smartforms; but almost none of our clients use our products as-is. They love to customize our products, and part of this customization involves customizing:
 
- Smartforms
- Rules
- Jobs
- Actions
 
Check that they can perform customization for the above areas

Title: Can users export and import product and environment assets via packaging in 82
Description:
Users were previously only able to perform packaging actions via Deployment action, but now Design Studio is the hub of all packaging activities.
 
From workflows to smartforms, as well as config values and everything on the drop down menu - we support import / export of those items, to facilitate quick content transfer between Test, Production, and any other environments the clients may manage.
 
Check that each component type is supported on export / import in this release by testing a sample of these components.
If there are specific changes around those components, those should be tested as a priority.

Title: Can users customize EA action menu for their Firm in 82
Description:
Clients often customize their EA actions menu to facilitate custom jobs and things being run from EA for their users.
 
Check that they can still continue to do this, by using a sample of the available activities to make things happen.

Title: Can users customize EA Professional for their Firm in 82
Description:
From 811 we are encouraging users to transition from EA and instead use EA Professional as their starting point for their Expert experience
 
Check that the users are able to customize the EA Professional dashboard for their firm's users

Title: Can firms upgrade from 8035 to 82RC
Description:
The top of the pyramid of Upgrade Test Missions.
 
Links to other Master Test Missions for testing upgrading. We set this one to accomplished when all upgrade test Missions have been run successfully.
 
Note that for 82RC, we're officially testing 8035 -> 82RC, with us looking at 811 -> 82RC during RC2. This is due to time constraints but also this represents the highest risk path, so we're making sure this is tested as the first pass.

Title: Can firms upgrade from 8110 to 82RC
Description:
Re-using the Master Test Missions to test this path for RC2. 
 
Planning to combine this with customization testing and upgrade, too, if time permits.

Title: Can Clients upgrade from 8110 Enhanced security environment to 82RC
Description:
Installation guide checks, and application setup guide checks - Most of the information is in here
 
No specific customizations testing
Smoke test / automated sanity test pass for unaffected products
Products with specific use cases with risk of impact are tested 
i.e. data masking for budgeting report, outlook credential encryption and the use cases flowing on.

Title: Can users upgrade their environments from 8110 to 82RC with separate workflow databases
Description:
This is a specific use case that we support.
 
Users can either have their workflows sit inside the Expert database (integrated), or sit in a separate workflow database (separate).
in 82GA we have introduced the facility to automatically upgrade the client's environment by integrating their workflow database back into the Expert database.
 
Apart from the usual post-upgrade checklist, we also need to check specifically the workflow related logging information and tasks/milestone information has been retained and not lost in transit.
 
Revisit the priority on a per-release basis.

Title: Can clients upgrade from [Previous Release] to [Latest Release] and run applications without upgrading smartforms for Time, Collections, and Expenses
Description:
Users with older versions of product e.g. 803 and older will have old smartform versions that are most likely customized.
 
Since they cannot use Design Studio to continue customizing their smartforms without upgrading, and the upgrading process may break their more complex customizations, they may choose to not upgrade.
 
In this case, we need to check the applications continue to work for the clients using their customized old smartforms post-upgrading to the latest release.
 
TODO's
- Previous release environment
- Customized smartforms for Time, Collections, and Expenses (pick ones used by the smoke test)
- Upgrade
- Smoke test of each product using those customized smartforms

Title: Customization - Can users transfer domain customization changes from a TEST environment to PRODUCTION in 82GA
Description:
Clients often develop their customizations on a local customization machine, go through iterations of the customization, and then export the final version to their production environment - almost always load balanced.
 
Check the following use cases work as expected:

- Export a package of these changes
- Import the changes into the PRODUCTION environment
- Verify the changes have been introduced and are working as expected

Title: Can users add columns to tables to extend existing domains
Description:
Testing update:
- 107824 appears to be still an issue - avoid this scenario for now. 
- 187593 is also still an issue - avoiding this scenario for now. Using the workaround and changing the relationship to upper case works as expected though.
 
In terms of the issue with HBA_MATTER_GRP and the customization failing - the stored proc where the customization failed isn't in the Database GIT module. This suggests we haven't had to modify this in the last 6~7 years, because no client issues have been raised with this. Customizations would have failed if they attempted customization on this table. Therefore raising a bug for this is impractical as no client attention = no fixes, currently.
 
If we came across an issue on one of the tables we know from PS / Support that clients heavily customize, then we would fix that for sure. This conclusion was reached after chatting with Jason as well on my attempt to investigate the wider issue (which is already covered by a unit test).
 
Check that users are able to perform various domain customization scenarios.
 
Extended runs - see linked bugs.

Title: The MSI applications we ship install without issue
Description:
While we have the individual functional test missions and test cases to test end to end with the MSI applications, the initial installation, versioning, and launching of integrated applications are often impacted during the dev cycle.
 
Therefore this test mission looks strictly at the installation and the launching of office products where possible, to confirm these installations continue to work. The end-to-end use cases facilitated by the MSI's should be covered by the individual product tests.
Steps: Step 1: Ensure full msi's have been generated for your environment || Step 2: Install all the msi's | Expected: May have to install them in turn, so just do the next step then loop back to this one || Step 3: Check your installed programs in the Control Panel | Expected: Make sure the correct version of the current release is on the msis we release, and the versions for the generated msis should always be larger than the former generated msi || Step 4: Should be able to install a new msi when an older version is already installed.

This is not a use case undertaken often; usually only when setting up new client sites.
 
Test that the respective policies can be managed:

 
And that the respective policies can be searched based on the available filters:

Title: Configuration Manager - Sanity Test
Description: Complete for both ITEGG and Performance environment

Title: Expert Administration sanity test on ITEGG
Description: Perform the sanity test on the ITEGG environment

Title: Expert Administration sanity test on Performance environment
Description: Perform the sanity test on the Performance environment

Title: Time > V3 Smartform Customization.
Design Studio - When users export a smartform with their changes into a package, are all changes included?
Description:
Check that the customization user can export their smartform with changes into a package, and reimport this package into another environment and continue working on it e.g.
 
Create smartform changes on customization workstation
Export smartform into a package
Import package into production environment and continue to modify the same smartform(s)
 
Check FWM_SMARTFORM & FWM_SMARTFORM_DELTA to confirm deltas were created before and after the export/import.
In the past these have been imported as new smartforms, so watch out for that. 
 
 
Setup: Requires both a local customization workstation and another environment (load balanced preferred e.g. the shared testing environment, or another customization workstation)

Title: Can users track task and workflow actions via notes
Description:
Certain actions performed in a workflow generates notes that are added to the workflow.
 
Check that these continue to work, as users depend on these to know what has occurred

Title: Can users upgrade their environments to [Latest Release] with separate workflow databases
Description:
This is a specific use case that we support.
 
Users can either have their workflows sit inside the Expert database (integrated), or sit in a separate workflow database (separate).
in 82GA we have introduced the facility to automatically upgrade the client's environment by integrating their workflow database back into the Expert database.
 
Apart from the usual post-upgrade checklist, we also need to check specifically the workflow related logging information and tasks/milestone information has been retained and not lost in transit.
 
Revisit the priority on a per-release basis.

Title: Can users create new workflows, develop, and publish their workflows in [Release]
Description:
Upon a successful deployment, users can create new workflows via Visual Studio, with our extension Design Studio toolbar being installed.
Users can then develop this workflow iteratively until they're satisfied. 
They can then export this workflow and publish it on a production environment

Title: Users are able to use [random sample] of workflow activities in [Release]
Description:
The toolbox of workflow activities that Aderant supplies are the base components of all our client's workflows.
 
Given that time is usually limited during regression testing, choose a random selection of activities (using known risks to bias your selection) and create a dev workflow to test during your regression.

Title: Customization - Can users transfer domain customization changes from a TEST environment to PRODUCTION in [Release]
Description:
Clients often develop their customizations on a local customization machine, go through iterations of the customization, and then export the final version to their production environment - almost always load balanced.
 
Check the following use cases work as expected:
 
- Perform domain customization changes on a local customization workstation, and verify the changes work as expected
- Export a package of these changes
- Import the changes into the PRODUCTION environment
- Verify the changes have been introduced and are working as expected

Title: Can we create rules and use them to validate Smartforms in [Release]
Description:
Rules are powerful validation tools that can be used to ensure the right kind of data is entered into the system.
 
Smartforms are usually the entry point for data into the database, so being able to validate the data on the form prior to persisting the form data is useful.
 
Check that
- Rules can be created
- Rules can be used to validate data by attaching to smartform events
- Results from rule run are as expected

Title: Can we create basic inquiries in [Release]
Description:
Clients can create inquiries to quickly generate data from entities / areas they are interested in.
 
Check that this can be created in both form and grid variants.
- Follow through the data as far as you can - validate the accuracy of the data being returned if possible via the ExpertQuery views, or the underlying tables if you know where to look.

Title: Can users maintain data providers in [Release] for their [Product]
Description:
Users use design studio to customize the controls, look and feel and other aspects of the smartforms they use in the products they're licensed for.
 
Check that the users are able to do this in Design Studio for their desired product in [Release]
 
If there's time available, check that changes made to data provider definitions continue to work as expected (locally - this will affect other products on shared testing environments)

Title: Can users manage application security rights for their users in [Release] ?
Description:
For a given application in [Release] , check that users can manage their application security for their users via security manager
 
We expect the individual products to have tested this, therefore the framework test will be to sample some of our applications in the test, as the security implementation for all our applications are expected to be consistent.
 
Check that:
- Users without certain application security rights aren't able to perform those actions
- Users are then able to perform those rights when they've been assigned:
  - Either by being part of the module policy membership (the rights are granted on the module policy)
  - Or the module policy security resource has been enabled
 
Popular candidates:
MatterWorks -> Top down wizard
Have rights:

Have no rights:

Title: Can users export and import product and environment assets via packaging in [Release]
Description:
Users were previously only able to perform packaging actions via Deployment action, but now Design Studio is the hub of all packaging activities.
 
From workflows to smartforms, as well as config values and everything on the drop down menu - we support import / export of those items, to facilitate quick content transfer between Test, Production, and any other environments the clients may manage.
 
Check that each component type is supported on export / import in this release by testing a sample of these components.
If there are specific changes around those components, those should be tested as a priority.

Title: Can users customize EA action menu for their Firm in [Release]
Description:
Clients often customize their EA actions menu to facilitate custom jobs and things being run from EA for their users.
 
Check that they can still continue to do this, by using a sample of the available activities to make things happen.

Title: Can users customize EA Professional for their Firm in [Release]
Description:
From 811 we are encouraging users to transition from EA and instead use EA Professional as their starting point for their Expert experience
 
Check that the users are able to customize the EA Professional dashboard for their firm's users

Title: Does [current release] work on a Citrix environment
Description:
Confirm if Citrix is still supported at [Current release]
 
Then do magic...

Citrix server:VMDVCTX301
Citrix Delivery Services Console > Citrix Resources > XenApp

Client machine:VMREG301

Title: Deployment - Can users generate Full MSIs using Deployment manager
Description:
Deployment manager can be used to generate Full MSI's - lets check that:
 
- It can be used to generate the MSI's
- Users can install this on a client machine
- They can launch the application
  
Child test mission should include checking:
- MSI's can be installed on all supported client machines
- For each client machine, the applications can launch and users can perform basic use cases

Tests:Windows 10
- Installed .msi for Expert Time and Expert Time Active Agent
Windows 8.1
- Installed .msi for Expert Time and Expert Time Active Agent
Windows 7
- Installed .msi for Expert Time and Expert Time Active Agent

Title: Expert Launcher > Restore minimised smartapps
Description:
In order to avoid repeatedly creating new instance of smartapps we enhanced Expert Launcher to be able to detect existing smartapp instance/running application.
 
1. when application is not running - launcher launches the application
2. when application is running and there's only one instance - no matter its minimised or behind other windows, launcher will detect the application and restore it.
3. when application is running and there are more than one instances - no matter they're minimised or behind other windows, launcher will detect the first instance and restore it.

Design studio - Can we create new forms and use them in our application
Description:
Pick a product, then create a new form off an existing form point (like a user would - i.e. not in development mode)
Test the form via preview mode
Then consume the form in the application
Check the underlying table for the model we're saving / editing the data with

Description:
Note: This could be based off other missions where forms are created
 
Check that new rules can be created and used:
- As part of a validation event (on initialize / on validate) (any product)
- Run on executing an action e.g. submitting an expense report, validating a receipt (expenses)

Description:
Check that new menu items can be created in:
- Existing applications
- Expert assistant
 
Also check existing report items can be changed (they are an action item type as well) for our applicationsTested:- Added menu item to Expert Assistant- Added menu item to Reports Menu in Expert Billing- Added menu item to Actions Menu in Expert BudgetWise- Added menu item to Backstage Reports in Expert Expenses- Able to create a firm version of the Audit Inquiry Report for Billing and add an activity to it
Steps: Step 1: Check that new menu items can be created in:- Existing applications || Step 2: Check existing report items can be changed (they are an action item type as well) for our applications || Step 3: Add menu item to Reports Menu in Expert Billing || Step 4: Add menu item to Actions Menu in Expert BudgetWise || Step 5: Add menu item to Backstage Reports in Expert Expenses || Step 6: Create a firm version of the Audit Inquiry Report for Billing and add an activity to it

Title: Design Studio - Can users create new data providers, and then consume it on a smartform
Description: Check that users can:- Create a custom table/view with DB Editor- Use the Domain Wizard to create a lookup for the table- Check table FCM_CUSTOMIZATION_METADATA to see if the lookup is saved correctly- Open Deployment Manager, select the Packages tab and hit Apply Customization- Open Design Studio after customization is applied, Expert System - Data Providers - Select any product, right click and add a new data provider- Create a new smartform and see if the data provider could be attached without problem
Steps: Step 1: See summary & make sure Development Mode is turned on

Try to add the same package on both sides - you should get a notification:Select different packages for different sides. You should get:

Title: System Monitor - Verify environment status
Description:
System History page in System Monitor

 
 
User Sessions page in System Monitor

 
Logs page in System Monitor

 
Business Activities page in System Monitor

 
Users are expected to get accurate information from the System Monitor pages.
 
Check that for a deployed local AND load-balanced environment, our information collection is working as expected.
For things that are working, green-ness is displayed.
Red is displayed for any errors detected according to our conditions
 

 
System wide and server side logs are currently tracked under the System availability tab in System Monitor.
 
Anything above WARN i.e. ERROR or FATAL should net a green validation tick as they would lead to less log entries and therefore less noise in the system.
Anything lower than WARN i.e. INFO, DEBUG, or TRACE should be colored amber as WARNINGS
 
The above is for the system-wide logging level.
An additional row will be added for server-side logging level, if enabled.
 
Workflow logging level is not tracked
 
Logging level in System Monitor
 

 
Warning message about CLR profiler in System Monitor
Steps: Step 1: Go to System Monitor via - Deployment Manager- Expert Assistant - Browse in IIS under {EnvironmentName} | FrameworkServices | SystemMonitor- Open this URL in web browser (http://{MachineName}/{EnvironmentName}/FrameworkServices/SystemMonitor/) || Step 2: Go to availability tab and check for service availability and {MachineName} Dependency Services | Expected: User should be able to see following:IIS Admin ServiceNet.Msmg Listener AdapterNet.Pipe Listener AdapterNet.Tcp Listener AdapterWindows Process Activation Service || Step 3: Go to the History tab | Expected: Page will be similar to the one shown in the summary of this test case || Step 4: Click on Logs tab | Expected: A new page should open and it will be similar to the one shown in the summary of this test case || Step 5: Search for a log || Step 6: Click on Activities tab | Expected: A new page should open and it will be similar to the one shown in the summary of this test case || Step 7: Search for a business activity || Step 8: Click on Sessions tab | Expected: A new page should open and it will be similar to the one shown in the summary of this test case || Step 9: Search for an user session || Step 10: Go back to History tab || Step 11: Scroll down and click the Service Activities link || Step 12: Click Search icon || Step 13: Click to remove Service (3) from Activity Type || Step 14: Click Search | Expected: Page will be similar to the one shown in the summary of this test case. || Step 15: Back in the History tab click the Workflow Activies link | Expected: Inquires page looks normal || Step 16: Go to Availability tab || Step 17: Check Log Level under Settings | Events | Expected: If the log level is ERROR or FATAL then the mark should show a green validation tickIf the log level is INFO, DEBUG, TRACE then the mark should show an amber warning validation || Step 18: Create an environment variable COR_ENABLE_PROFILING = 1 in system environment variable || Step 19: Do IIS reset || Step 20: Go to System Monitor | Verification | Performance | Expected: A warning message should appear and it will be similar to the one shown in the summary of this test case

Title: Upgrade Testing for Infrastructure
Description:
I did quite a lot of work during the 821 regression to review test cases, establish what data needed to be put into the environments before they were upgraded, and what needed to be checked post-upgrade. 
 
This work was documented in the attached excel sheet.
 
In theory, all you need to do is read through the "Setup" column in the relevant spreadsheet then set that data up. This should save you the trouble of having to read and understand all the test cases listed.
 It is worth coordinating with the release management team to make sure that the Test Cases labeled as "Release" will be completed by them.Make sure to use the prepared 811 database backup (L:\team\Release Management\Upgrade Test\8110 - 05122019\1. BeforeUpgradeWithData), as this will test some specific scenarios regarding rules which we have encountered bugs with in the past. Bug 227943: Rules have had "Effective From" dates lowered between release versions
Steps: Step 1: See Summary

Description:
Check that users can adjust the job contents to suit their firm (if applicable)
Also check that they can manage the job schedules from Design studio, either in the application or be taken to Schedule manager to perform schedule maintenance

Tested:
- Able to launch Schedule Manager from Design Studio
- Able to view, edit, refresh and delete scheduled jobs in Schedule Manager from Design Studio
- Scheduled jobs created from system jobs in Design Studio execute as expected
- Able to reorder actions for a job
- Able to use a Data Source with Parameters to retrieve data and perform activities

Check that there are logs in C:\AderantExpert\Install\logs
For the Deployment manager and the deployment itself. The folder with the logs for the deployment itself should also contain a copy of the PackageManager.log.

Check that the buttons below open the appropriate logs.

Title: Deployment Validation Negative Test
Description:
Ask a developer for a list of all the things deployment manager validates at the beginning of a deployment/when you hit the Validate button. 
 
Find a way to invalidate an environment in such a way that will fail each validation one by one. 
 
Make notes of your testing experience here.

Title: EA - Users are able to use Expert assistant to perform their daily tasks
Description:
As a user, a surprising amount of actions could originate from Expert Assistant.
 
This includes:
- looking up Client, Employee, and Matters
- Working on assigned tasks, reassigning, and working on other's behalf (proxies)
- Opening applications to do work (actions tab)
 
Workflow related specific testing around tasks related settings, and checking workflow process status, workflow process actions are tested in another test mission
Steps: Step 1: Look up Client, Employee, and Matters || Step 2: Work on assigned tasks, reassigning, and working on other's behalf (proxies) || Step 3: Opening other applications (actions tab) || Step 4: Workflow related specific testing around tasks related settings, and checking workflow process status || Step 5: Click Settings || Step 6: Click Expert Assistant || Step 7: Click About | Expected: A pop up window should appear || Step 8: Click logging which will open another window | Expected: Check that resizing doesn't make the text unreadableCheck that clicking "show advanced settings..." again doesn't pop up a duplicate window.

Title: Customization / Compatibility - Can we add {control} to a legacy smartform in Smartform wizard?
Description:
When existing clients don't upgrade their product smartforms to V3, they will need to use Smartform wizard for their customization experience. We should check that this is still working as expected
 
Check:
- Smartforms
- Smart grids
 
Use existing product smartforms and grids to check consumption.

Title: Can users use Smartform Task Activity in workflows
Per Machine MSI install validation
Description: There are several other checks we need to make to ensure all the MSI installed as expected other than installation running to completion.Recommended to use ExpertAssistantPerMachine.msi
Steps: Step 1: Install a per machine MSI (ExpertAssistantPerMachine.msi) | Expected: Installation completes successfully. A blue expert splash screen appears.Does not open the application after installation. || Step 2: Check application short cut is installed into the right location | Expected: Go to "C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Aderant" and make sure there is a short cut for the application.Make sure this short cut is pointing to the CO.exe. || Step 3: Check the registry entry is present | Expected: Go to the registry hive (regedit in start menu).Go to either 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE/SOFTWARE/Aderant' or 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE/SOFTWARE/WOW6432Node/Aderant' and ensure there is an ExpertAssistant Node || Step 4: Check registry values are correct | Expected: Go to the node in the previous step.CLEAN should be set to 1EXPERTENVIRONMENTNAME should match environment nameinstalled should be set to 1 || Step 5: All users can open from short cut | Expected: Log on (or remote desktop) onto machine as another user. Go to start menu and check there is a short cut for the application.Click short cut and application should open || Step 6: Cannot install per user version of the msi || Step 7: Create a Task for yourselfE.g. by launching a MarkupV2 workflow for a Prebill in Expert Billing. || Step 8: Close the application you used to generate the task. || Step 9: In EA, use the task to open the Expert application. | Expected: Should open as expected.

Title: Can install Per Machine msis without a deployment
Description: Clients often script the per machine installs so they can push it out to a large number of clients at once.They also do this before/while deployment occurs.The MSI installation should succeed as long as there is a valid environment xml next to it.
Steps: Step 1: Remove deployment if there is one || Step 2: Copy a Per Machine msi into a folder with a valid instance.config  from an environment that is not deployed (For environments older than 822 EX0011, environment.xml is used instead) || Step 3: Install the msi from that folder | Expected: Installs successfully

Title: Per User MSI Install validation
Description: There are several other checks we need to make to ensure all the MSI installed as expected other than installation running to completion.Recommended to use ExpertAssistantPerUser.msi
Steps: Step 1: Delete user local cache (both local and roaming) by using the PowerShell command ccache || Step 2: Remove the local folder e.g. C:\AderantExpert\ITEGG if it exists || Step 3: Install a per user MSI (ExpertAssistantPerUser.msi) | Expected: Installation completes successfully. A blue expert splash screen appears.Opens the application after installation || Step 4: Check application short cut is installed into the right location | Expected: Go to "C:\Users\[USER PROFILE]\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Aderant" and make sure there is a short cut for the application.Make sure this short cut is pointing to the CO.exe. || Step 5: Check the registry entry is present | Expected: Go to the registry hive (regedit in start menu).Go to either 'HKEY_CURRENT_USER/SOFTWARE/Aderant' or 'HKEY_CURRENT_USER/SOFTWARE/WOW6432Node/Aderant' and ensure there is an ExpertAssistant Node || Step 6: Check registry values are correct | Expected: Go to the node in the previous step.CLEAN should be set to 0EXPERTENVIRONMENTNAME should match environment nameinstalled should be set to 1 || Step 7: Only current user can open from short cut | Expected: Log on (or remote desktop) onto machine as another user. Go to start menu and check there is no short cut for the application. || Step 8: Other users can install the per user and will see the shortcut in their user profile | Expected: See step 2 || Step 9: Cannot install per machine version of the msi
