Title: Load Balanced Customization Upgrade Test
Description: Deploy a load balanced environment with the relevant previous releaseApply some customizationsUpgradeCheck the customizations all still work as expected

Title: Deployment manager compatibility: Deployment
Description:
This test case is a high level description of what we need to check when we are replacing old version of Deployment Manager with new one without full redeployment of the environment.
This section is about the deployment and manifests:
 

New Deployment Manager should be able to work with environment manifest


Create a new manifest and export it
Import manifest file created in previous version of DM (when you are working with exported manifest, please make a copy of it before the import, because the new DM can modify the xml, which can make it incompatible with previous version of DM)
Edit and save created/imported manifet


Deploy the environmentDeploy without enhanced securityDeploy with enhanced security (82GA+)Check the Anonymous SMTP option 

Validate the environment after the deployment

Remove the environment

Clone application servers (LB environment required)

Title: Deployment manager compatibility: Packaging and Customization
Description:
This test case is a high level description of what we need to check when we are replacing old version of Deployment Manager with new one without full redeployment of the environment.
This section is about the package and customization related activities:

Export system and imported package (using Packages->Extract) Note: only available for DM versions 81SP1 and above (see linked test case)
Import simple packages
             - Packages created in past release lines, containing single type of content 

Import Workflow package and publish workflows, confirming workflows can be started successfully
Import patch (simple patch & patch that replaces multiple files etc)
Perform domain Customization and apply it in new DM, against an older release line

Title: Deployment manager compatibility: Advanced Options
Description:
This test case is a high level description of what we need to check when we are replacing old version of Deployment Manager with new one without full redeployment of the environment.
This section is about the Advanced Options of DM:
 
Export/Import of encryption key
1. Deploy expert2. Export an encryption key3. Delete the registry in regedit (HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE/SOFTWARE/Aderant/Development)3. Open DM and see this window 
 
Force to use the latest full MSI version
If you generate full msi's, install one, then then generate full msi's again, you should no longer to be open the installed application from C:\Program Files (x86)\AderantExpert
Steps: Step 1: Check the option "Automatically reload the previously loaded environment on startup" || Step 2: Export the encription key for environment (Export in old DM, export in new DM, compare) || Step 3: Automatically recycle the Expert services (idealy, both customization and LB environments) | Expected: The app pools will get recycled || Step 4: Check the option "Treat prerequisites errors as warnings" (easy to check on VM with limited amount of RAM) || Step 5: Generate Full MSIs || Step 6: Check the option "Force to use the latest full MSI version" || Step 7: Check the option "Clear the environment from the Expert DB and set it up again" || Step 8: Deploy the Expert SSRS reports (should be configured in manifest) || Step 9: Try to start System monitor || Step 10: Update the client credential certificate thumbprint in place without redeploying || Step 11: Once deployed, Select Reset Encryption Key. Then Export Encryption Key | Expected: Should be able to reset the Encryption key if needed, and create new one without redeploying. The reset Encryption key option will not be available if environment is not deployed,

Title: Import workflow package, publish workflows, and confirm workflows can be started successfully
Description: As part of compatibility testing, the latest version Deployment Manager should be able to import workflow package, publish workflows, and confirm workflows can be started successfully in previous Expert version
Steps:
Step 1: Verify Import Package and Apply Customization buttons are greyed before deployment started/ during deployment/ If deployment failed to complete | Expected: Import Package and Apply Customization buttons are greyed out when no successful deployment || Step 2: Verify Import Package and Apply Customization buttons are enabled after successful  deployment | Expected: Import Package and Apply Customization buttons are enabled after successful  deployment || Step 3: After deployment completed successfully,  Import each of the workflow packages | Expected: Workflow packages imported successfully and can be use in the environment || Step 4: After deployment completed successfully,  Import licenses files | Expected: Licenses imported successfully || Step 5: After deployment completed successfully,  Import dev workflow | Expected: Dev workflow imported successfully || Step 6: After deployment completed successfully,  Import LawPay  workflow | Expected: Law pay workflow imported successfully || Step 7: After deployment completed successfully,  Import customized package. Then Apply customization | Expected: Customized packages imported successfully and can be applied on the environment || Step 8: On LB environment : On each app server:
- Open internet options and go to security tab
- Go to each zone and and remove any entries that may match any app server (including itself)
Try import a workflow package | Expected: Should get user friendly error message that explains that app server entry needs to be added to trusted zone || Step 9: Import package that has no web app (But contains web.config) | Expected: Import package completed successfully

Description: As part of compatibility testing, the latest version of Deployment manager should be able to perform Domain Customization process in previous Expert versions

Title: User Experience Virtualization Testing
Description:
​The Expert applications store user settings in the Windows roaming profile, /appdata/roaming. The Windows OS provides a couple of options for managing roaming data, including User Experience Virtualization (UE-V). The following document walks through configuring UE-V in a test environment, demonstrating the tooling and configuration required. 
https://aderant.sharepoint.com/sites/Iknow/Expert/Lists/Posts/Post.aspx?ID=3538
How to configure and deploy UE-V 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/configuration/ue-v/uev-getting-started
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-desktop-optimization-pack/uev-v2/get-started-with-ue-v-2x-new-uevv2
What is UE-V
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ar-FddDt67M
How to inspect .pkgx file
https://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/17235.description-of-ue-v-files-stored-in-the-settings-storage-path.aspx 
 
UEVTemplates 
\\na.aderant.com\expertshare\UEV\UEVTemplates

UEVStore
\\na.aderant.com\expertshare\UEV\UEVStore

Custom Tempalte and Store location

Tempalte update scheduler
If you make any change to the template, if will not take affect immediately. You can find the trigger in task scheduler. 

No Aderant App Setting Packages created on UEVStore after you close the app
Due to we setup the UEV folder on DFS server, it is possible sometimes the UEV not loading the template correctly. You can check the event viewer to see whether any message like below.
Not sure how to fix, usually restart the VM and wait a couple of hours or a day to login again. It will work again.
Steps: Step 1: Check the Summary tab if you have no idea of what is User Experience Virtualization Testing || Step 2: UEV Templates and User file storage can be found here\\na.aderant.com\expertshare\UEV | Expected: UEVTemplates folder is a read only folder that stores all templates (Domain admin user, John Lee, Franklin Liu, Alex Zhang has the full rights; Domain Computers has the read permission)UEVStore folder is a folder that stores user profiles (Everyone has the read/write permission) || Step 3: Client Machine that enable UEV Setting | Expected: VMQAUEVWIN10301VMQAUEVWIN10302 || Step 4: Login to one of the client machine that enable UEVe.g.  VMQAUEVWIN10301And check whether it has Aderant Expert installed | Expected: You should be able to find Aderant in start menuYou should be able to find AderantExpert under C drive || Step 5: Check C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming | Expected: There is no Aderant folder || Step 6: Click ExpertAssistantCO.exe via start menu | Expected: ExpertAssistant self healed and started || Step 7: Started an app via EA action menu e.g. Expert Expenses, some test the app then check the Roaming folder | Expected: Roaming profile for Aderant has been createdAderant\EnvironmentName || Step 8: Close the app and verify the Roaming folder | Expected: Usually you should have folder like thisAderant\VMCRT8210ITE\Configuration\ExpertExpenses (This usually created after you close the app)Aderant\VMCRT8210ITE\DataProviders                                  Aderant\VMCRT8210ITE\MruLists || Step 9: Check the UEVStore | Expected: There should be a user setting folder for the Aderant product created e.g. \\na.aderant.com\expertshare\UEV\UEVStore\username\SettingsPackages\Expenses-ExpertExpenses-v-1-8How to inspect the .pkgx, please check summary tab || Step 10: Login to another client machine that enable UEVe.g.  VMQAUEVWIN10302And check whether it has Aderant Expert installed | Expected: You should be able to find Aderant in start menuYou should be able to find AderantExpert under C drive || Step 11: Check C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming | Expected: There is no Aderant folder || Step 12: Click ExpertAssistantCO.exe via start menu | Expected: ExpertAssistant self healed and started || Step 13: Started an app via EA action menu e.g. Expert Expenses and check the Roaming folder | Expected: Roaming profile for Aderant has been syncedYou should be able to see these folder are synced when you have done any testing use Expenses yetAderant\VMCRT8210ITE\Configuration\ExpertExpenses (This usually created after you close the app)Aderant\VMCRT8210ITE\DataProviders                                  Aderant\VMCRT8210ITE\MruLists

Title: Check instance.config is restricted for non-admin users
Steps: Step 1: As an Admin user Visit http://vmexpmastlb.ap.aderant.com/Expert_MasterITE/instance.configOr the equivalent for your test environment | Expected: Something like this: This XML file does not appear to have any style information associated with it. The document tree is shown below.<instanceMetadataConfigurationSection environment="MasterITE" useEnhancedSecurity="true"><repository name="VmMasterITE" server="svsql306"/><expertShare uri="\\na.aderant.com\expertshare\VmMasterITE"/><downloadsUrl uri="https://VMEXPMASTLB.ap.aderant.com/Expert_MasterITE/Downloads"/><queryService uri="https://VMEXPMASTLB.ap.aderant.com/Expert_MasterITE/FrameworkServices/Query/QueryService.svc"/><notificationService uri="https://VMEXPMASTLB.ap.aderant.com/Expert_MasterITE/FrameworkServices/Notification/Notifications"/><loggingRepository name="VmMasterITEMonitoring"/></instanceMetadataConfigurationSection> || Step 2: As an Non-Admin user Visit http://vmexpmastlb.ap.aderant.com/Expert_MasterITE/instance.configOr the equivalent for your test environment | Expected: Should be asked for credentials. It should look similar to screenshot in the summary of this test case

Title: Email Diagnostic Information Button
Steps: Step 1: Open any Expert App || Step 2: Click the Expert Tab in the top left || Step 3: Go to Help || Step 4: Click the Email Diagnostic Informationbutton | Expected: This should open a mail window with no value in the "To" fieldDiagnostic information should be attached

Title: Minor Database Checks
Steps: Step 1: Check all the filter columns on the CMS_LOCK table are varchar(1) || Step 2: Run:EXEC [dbo].[SP_CMS_DEFRAGMENTATION] @Defrag = 'Y' , @RecoveryModelCheck='N', @Fragpercent = 0, @PageCount = 0 | Expected: No errors || Step 3: Run:EXEC [dbo].[SP_CMS_DEFRAGMENTATION] @TABLE_NAME = 'SUT_TIME', @FRAGPERCENT = 0, @Defrag='Y',@RecoveryModelCheck='N',@PageCount = 0 | Expected: No errors || Step 4: Run the following SQL and check the tables are all clustered tables SELECT OBJECT_SCHEMA_NAME(i.object_id) AS 'SchemaName',OBJECT_NAME(i.object_id) AS 'TableName',i.name AS 'IndexName',i.type_desc AS 'IndexType',CASEWHEN (i.[is_primary_key]) = 1 THEN 'PRIMARY KEY'WHEN (i.[is_unique]) = 1 THEN 'UNIQUE'WHEN (i.[is_unique]) = 0 THEN 'NON-UNIQUE'ELSE '' END AS 'ConstraintType',STUFF (--get a list of columns(SELECT ', ' + COL_NAME(ic.object_id, ic.column_id) FROM sys.Index_columns icWHERE ic.object_id = i.object_idAND ic.index_id = i.index_idORDER BY index_column_id ASCFOR XML PATH(''), TYPE).value('.', 'varchar(max)'),1,2,'') AS 'ColumnList'FROM sys.indexes iWHERE OBJECTPROPERTY(i.object_id, 'IsUserTable') = 1AND i.name IS NOT NULLAND (object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'APA_IMAGE_LINK' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'APA_VENDOR_BOOK' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'APE_JOB_PARAMETER' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'APE_JOB_QUEUE' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'APH_PERSNL_SUMM' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'APM_RECINV_JE' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'APT_CHECK_EBTRAN' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'APT_MESSAGE' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'APT_SCHEDULE_DETAIL' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'HBM_NAME_BANK' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'BLA_TRACK' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'BLE_JOB_EMAIL_RECIPIENT' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'BLE_JOB_PARAMETER' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'BLE_JOB_QUEUE' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'BLM_BILLP_TRACK' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'BLS_BILL_Z_FILTER' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'BLT_BILL_AMTAX' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'TBA_VALIDATION_MESSAGE' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'GLH_PROJSUM' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CXM_CONTACT' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CSA_PAGE_PARTY_STATUS' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CSL_PICKLIST_ITEM' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CSM_LAW_TYPE_MENU' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CSM_PAGE_DEFINITION' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CRT_CASH' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CXA_CLNT_PARTY' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CXL_RELATION_TYPE' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CLM_JOB' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CLS_REMIND' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CLS_REMIND_Z' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'FTS_CRITERIA' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'FTS_REVISIONS' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CMS_DB_ERROR' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CMS_DD_DOE_TABL' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CMS_MODULE' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'HBA_PERSNL_WKGP' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CDE_JOB_QUEUE' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CDT_MESSAGE' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'TBL_RANK' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CMS_EXPAND' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'DDS_DRAFT' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'TBL_JURPLAN_COS' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'TBL_TAX_RATE' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'FWM_RULE' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'FWM_SMARTFORM_RULE' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CMS_RECAP_AUDIT' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'GLA_ACCT_DEPT' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'GLA_ACCT_PROF' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'GLA_OFFC_BOOK' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'TBL_CURR_REMEAS' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'TBA_ARRANGEMENT' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'TBA_PREMDISC_VOLUME' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'TBM_CLMAT_AUEMP' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'TBM_CLMAT_DISB' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CSA_LAW_TYPE_PICKITEM' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'CSA_LAW_TYPE_PRTY_STATUS' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'HBA_MATTER_MODP' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'HBA_MATTER_TKPR' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'HBA_SOURCE_BUS' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'PMA_PRTY_STATUS' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'MFA_HEALTH_STATUS' OR object_name(i.Object_ID) = 'MFA_HEALTH_STATUS_CONDITION')AND i.type_desc = 'CLUSTERED'ORDER BY 1,2 || Step 5: Run those 2 following queriesSELECT 1 AS 'TableName' FROM sys.synonyms o INNER JOIN sys.schemas s ON s.schema_id = o.schema_id WHERE o.name = 'FWM_LOG' AND s.name = 'configuration' AND base_object_name = '[dbo].[FWM_LOG]'GOSELECT 1 AS 'TableName' FROM sys.tables o INNER JOIN sys.schemas s ON s.schema_id = o.schema_id WHERE o.name = 'FWM_LOG' AND s.name = 'dbo'GO | Expected: The queries should return no results || Step 6: Find the FWM_Note tableRight-Click | DesignIn the column properties | Expected: Confirm the name is NOTEID || Step 7: EXEC dbo.SP_CMS_DB_MAINTENANCE @MaintenanceType ='IndexRebuild', @ParameterList ='@Defrag=''Y'',@RecoveryModelCheck=''N''', @IncludeMonitoringDB = 0EXEC dbo.SP_CMS_DB_MAINTENANCE @MaintenanceType ='UpdateStats', @ParameterList ='', @IncludeMonitoringDB = 0 | Expected: No errors || Step 8: EXEC dbo.SP_CMS_DB_MAINTENANCE @MaintenanceType ='FullTextReorganize', @ParameterList ='@ForceAll=1', @IncludeMonitoringDB = 0EXEC dbo.SP_CMS_DB_MAINTENANCE @MaintenanceType ='FullTextReorganize', @ParameterList ='@ForceAll=0', @IncludeMonitoringDB = 0EXEC dbo.SP_CMS_DB_MAINTENANCE @MaintenanceType ='UpdateStats', @ParameterList ='@ForceAll=1', @IncludeMonitoringDB = 0EXEC dbo.SP_CMS_DB_MAINTENANCE @MaintenanceType ='UpdateStats', @ParameterList ='@ForceAll=0', @IncludeMonitoringDB = 0 | Expected: No errors || Step 9: EXEC SUP_REBUILD_DETAIL_TABLES | Expected: Runs without errors || Step 10: Run SQL ProfilerOpen Entity Manager | Expected: Check that there was only one call to Security.HasResourceRight

Title: Design Studio - Workflow Arguments
Steps: Step 1: Import the attached workflow into your environment || Step 2: Property Navigation Pane | Expert Assistant | Actions Menu | Right-Click | Add Menu Item | Create New || Step 3: Fill all required fields including Name / Code fields || Step 4: Select Activity as Workflow (Workflow) || Step 5: Properties Pane | Workflow | Workflow Name = Cust Workflow | Expected: The Workflow Arguments section should appear under the Workflow section (as shown in the image in the summary). || Step 6: Check you can see the Workflow Arguments || Step 7: Enter a sample message e.g. "Hello" || Step 8: Click 'Save & Close' button in the ribbon bar || Step 9: Open Expert Assistant || Step 10: Double click on the new create Action Menu and check Event Viewer | Expected: A new error message should appear in Event Viewer (as shown in the image in the summary)

Title: Design Studio - Add common properties to a data grid
Steps: Step 1: Open Design studio || Step 2: Go to a smart form (e.g. Expert Entity Manager -> Forms -> MatterInstance -> Matter Review -> Matter Review) || Step 3: Add a Data grid (set source to  Matter.MatterGroups) || Step 4: Double click the data grid in the elements || Step 5: Click Add Common Properties on the ribbon || Step 6: Columns should appear in the Columns section

Title: Design Studio - Development Mode
Steps: Step 1: Run this SQL:update fwm_ownerset ISSYSTEM = 'N'update fwm_ownerset ISSYSTEM = 'Y'where NAME = 'Aderant' || Step 2: Open Design Studio | Expected: There should be a Development Mode button in the ribbon bar || Step 3: Run this SQL:update fwm_ownerset ISSYSTEM = 'N'update fwm_ownerset ISSYSTEM = 'Y'where NAME = 'Clifford, Maximillian & Scott'(Or use another name if your db doesn't have a Clifford, Maximillian & Scott) || Step 4: Open Design Studio | Expected: There should NOT be a Development Mode button in the ribbon bar

Title: Design Studio - Activity Expression
Steps: Step 1: Open Design Studio || Step 2: Go to Expert Assistant | Menu | Actions Menu || Step 3: Right click Add Menu Item | Create New Item || Step 4: Fill all required fields e.g. Name/Code || Step 5: Click on Data Variables on Ribbon bar || Step 6: Add two data variables, one nullable Guid and one Non-nullable Guid by ticking checkbox Optional (Nullable) for Nullable variables || Step 7: Create a Query step with a where clause that filters on the Nullable Guid | Expected: The setting will be similar to the screenshot in the summary of this test case || Step 8: Repeat for the non-nullable guid | Expected: The setting will be similar to the screenshot in the summary of this test case || Step 9: Save the item | Expected: The item should be saved without any issues

Title: Expert Launcher - Launching apps from EAPro
Steps: Step 1: Expert Launcher is the application responsible for launching Smart Apps from the web via EA Pro. The Expert Launcher is designed to support multiple environments from a single install, so to test this you should install an ExpertLauncher msi from an environment other than the main one you will be testing on. || Step 2: Make sure you've run the ExpertLauncherMsiPerMachine.msi | Expected: Check in your installed applications. Name should be Aderant.ExpertLauncher || Step 3: Lauch EA Pro || Step 4: Make sure you can launch each of the Smart Apps (including Admin apps) that appear in the EA Pro sidebar menu | Expected: Should only see 1 splashscreen for Expert Launcher, followed by the spashscreen for the app itself.The gap between these two splashscreens should not be very long. || Step 5: From EA Launch and run through an Expense approval workflow | Expected: Make sure that the workflow task has no issues launching Expert Expenses || Step 6: Lauch EA Pro || Step 7: Import the attached smartform || Step 8: In Billing, open a prebill, go to the Time section, and click New Time in the ribbon bar || Step 9: Check that each hyperlink at the bottom of this smartform opens the intended app | Expected: In Task Manager | DetailsCheck the Command Line column says these apps are running directly from the ExpertShare

Title: Custom Workflow - Multiple Alert Messages on a Smartform
Steps: Step 1: Open the PPB Workflow in Visual Studio. || Step 2: Add a custom alert before the mark up task. || Step 3: Run the workflow || Step 4: Re-assign the mark up task to another user. | Expected: Check that the smartform displays both messages at once

Title: CMS_AUTH_CONTEXT
Steps: Step 1: Add a row to CMS_AUTH_CONTEXTThese rows have an uno and a domain.The idea is that a user must be in the domain and have an uno that either matches, is 0, or is NULL - otherwise they are not authorized. | Expected: --This adds the auth context rowinsert into CMS_AUTH_CONTEXT(AUTH_CONTEXT_UNO, LOGIN_CONTEXT, AUTHORITY_TYPE, INACTIVE)values (666, 'aderant_ap', 'W', 'N')--This adds the auth context uno to TTQA3update HBM_PERSNLset AUTH_CONTEXT_UNO = 666,PRIVILEGE_LEVEL = 1where login like '%ttqa3%' || Step 2: Then in Billing search for prebills using:A user that is in that domain and has an uno that matches the uno | Expected: This should work || Step 3: A user that is in that domain and has an uno that doesn't match the uno | Expected: This should NOT work || Step 4: A user that is in that domain with an uno of 0 | Expected: This should work || Step 5: A user that is in that domain with an uno of NULL | Expected: This should work || Step 6: A user that is not in that domain and has an uno that matches the unoAt Aderant we don't allow LR users to access AP environments, so the only way to test this is to access an LR environment, like the Performance Environment, as an AP user (Shift + Right-click | Run as). If there are no LR domains environments available, it's ok to just pass this test without doing these steps. | Expected: This should NOT work || Step 7: A user that is not in that domain | Expected: This should NOT work

Title: Design Studio - Create a Smarform not attached to any form point
Steps: Step 1: Open Design Studio || Step 2: Go to Expert System | Forms | New Form || Step 3: Select "Do not attach to a form point" || Step 4: Filled all required fields || Step 5: Go to 'Data Variables' in Ribbon bar || Step 6: Add new data and choose the source to Contract Variable | Expected: The setting will be similar to the screenshot in the summary of this test case || Step 7: Add a new Text Box and map the new variable to 'Text' field under 'Content' Section in Properties Panel | Expected: The setting will be similar to the screenshot in the summary of this test case || Step 8: Save the form

Title: Handshake Query Service - Deploy Handshake Query Service utilizing Deployment Manager
Steps:
Step 1: Install DeploymentManager.msi from Binaries folder || Step 2: Launch Deployment Manager from Install directory (e.g. C:\AderantExpert\Install) || Step 3: You may get a message saying there was no manifest found, clicking OK will take you straight to the wizard, otherwise use the “Add” button on the task ribbon to launch Environment Wizard || Step 4: Enter your SQL Server name (e.g. VMQAWIN10) and select Expert Database (e.g. MasterCleanDB) || Step 5: Click Begin || Step 6: Select Environment = Customization Workstation || Step 7: Enter address of your Expert Source path (e.g. C:\ExpertSource) and Expert Dierectory path (e.g. C:\CMS.NET\Bin) || Step 8: Enter Connection = same as connection variable in your CMS.INI (e.g. QA) || Step 9: Click Next || Step 10: Untick Enhanced Security if you don't want to deploy with Enhanced Security
Tick Enhanced Security if you want to deploy with Enhanced Security || Step 11: Fill in Service account name and password if you selected non Enhanced Security or gMSA Security Group if you selected Enhanced Security, SMTP Host, SMTP Port, From Email address, Operations Email address, HTTP Proxy || Step 12: Check all information in Case Document Management, Expert Time Connectors and Workflow On The Go is correct || Step 13: Click Next || Step 14: Enter required fields (e.g. Database Owner Username, Database Owner Password if you selected non Enhanced Security) || Step 15: Click Finish || Step 16: The end of the wizard will ask you if you want to deploy the created environment, click No || Step 17: Click Validate button in the ribbon bar | Expected: Every check steps should be passed without any warnings || Step 18: Click Deploy || Step 19: Open web browser (e.g. Google Chrome) || Step 20: Enter below URLs to test the deploymenthttp://localhost/Expert_Local/Query/QueryService.svc/Matters(100000) http://localhost/Expert_Local/Query/QueryService.svc/Matters()?$expand=MatterWorkingRanks,SicClassifications,MatterWorkingEmployees,MatterParticipatingEmployees,MatterAssociatedEmployees,MatterAuthorizingEmployees,Contacts,MatterGroups,MatterParties/BusinessEntity,MatterTimeBilling,MatterTimeBilling/MatterTime,MatterTimeBilling/MatterDisbursement,MatterTimeBilling/MatterAutomaticAllocation,MatterRateFees,MatterDisbursementConstraints&$filter=Id%20eq%201%20or%20Id%20eq%202%20or%20Id%20eq%203&$format=json | Expected: Handshake Query Service should return results in JSON format

Title: Handshake Query Service - Deploy customizations against Handshake Query Service
Steps: Step 1: Ensure Handshake Query Service is deployed in your environment by running this @URL on web browser || Step 2: Open DBEditor in (e.g. C:\CMS.NET\Bin\dbeditor.exe) || Step 3: Enter username and password for CMS.NET Administrator || Step 4: Go to current version of your Database (e.g. Version 82) || Step 5: Go to Tables | HBM_CLIENT || Step 6: Right click Revise | Add Column || Step 7: Add new customisation column as shown in the screenshot in the summary || Step 8: Click OK | Yes | GO || Step 9: Close the Generation: Expert window || Step 10: Open DomainWizard.exe in ExpertShare folder (e.g. C:\ExpertShare) || Step 11: Click Begin || Step 12: Select 'Extend an existing entity to add a new column or child table' || Step 13: Click Next || Step 14: Select from 'Table to include' drop down list as shown in the screenshot in the summary || Step 15: Click Next and tick the column name as shown in the screenshot in the summary || Step 16: Click Next and select Client Model as shown in the screenshot in the summary || Step 17: Click Next | Finish || Step 18: Select No to close Domain Wizard || Step 19: Open Deployment Manager | Packages tab || Step 20: Click 'Apply Customizations' in ribbon bar || Step 21: Click Yes | Yes (Apply Customizations) || Step 22: Open DesignStudio.exe in ExpertShare folder (e.g. C:\ExpertShare) || Step 23: Go to Expert Entity Manager | Forms | ClientInstance | ClientDetails | Client Details || Step 24: Add new Checkbox from the Add button in Ribbon bar || Step 25: Set up the new checkbox as shown in the screenshot in the summary || Step 26: Save the form and close Design Studio || Step 27: Open ExpertEntityManager.exe in ExpertShare folder (e.g. C:\ExpertShare) || Step 28: Search and select any clients and make sure you can see the changes || Step 29: Open Handshake Toolkit in C:\AderantExpert\Local\Services\Query\bin || Step 30: Select Local in 'Name' drop down list || Step 31: Go to Schemas | AderantExpert | Classes | Clients || Step 32: Confirm you can see the new custom field as shown in the screenshot in the summary || Step 33: Enter @CustomURL on web browser to test the result | Expected: Handshake Query Service should return results in JSON format with new custom column

Title: Trouble Shooting Logging via Workflow Admin
Steps: Step 1: Launch a FileOpening workflow || Step 2: Opening the workflow administrator || Step 3: Turn on TroubleShooting for the selected FileOpening workflow in the Live Definitions tab || Step 4: Click the link to go to the list of User Sessions | Expected: User Sessions page should be opened in web browser || Step 5: Click any links on the user session page to go to user session detail page | Expected: User session detail page should open without any issues || Step 6: Click 'Logs' | Expected: The logs page with relevant Workflow information should display

Title: Workflow Admin - Performance
Steps: Step 1: Precondition:  Have a WFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARY table with more than 20,000 entries,of cancelled, active, and complete workflows || Step 2: Open Workflow Admin App  and refresh Workflow list. Filter list. | Expected: App is launched  and listed workflows. Take measurement of the performance || Step 3: In the processes tab, search for the IDs (which you can get from the SQL script above) of several workflows that are in different states | Expected: This shouldn't take much more than a few seconds to return. Enter some more specific timings here once you have them. || Step 4: Open Workflow Admin | Live Definitions tab | Click Refresh | Expected: We can see data loaded.

Title: Various data provider excentricities
Steps: Step 1: Check that dataproviders such as the BIll Amount field on  Billing's Prebill List can use negative numbers in their ranged searchesE.g. -1000 - -100>-100<-50 || Step 2: Check that QBE separators are autopopulating as semi-colons in fields such as Client in various apps. || Step 3: Certain fields can be set to Filter mode, which means they will show you a list of values before you have typed anything into the field. See the screenshot in the Summary section for an example of one of these fields. | Expected: When set to filter clicking on the field is enough to show you the drop down with all the options. When set to Search, you shouldn't see options until you start typing in the field.

Title: Design Studio - Modify Case SmartForms/SmartLists in Design Studio
Steps: Step 1: Install ExpertLauncherMsiPerMachine.msi in ExpertShare folder | Expected: ExpertLauncher is installed without any issues || Step 2: Open Case web application || Step 3: Open any SmartForms/SmartLists (e.g. Case Details) || Step 4: Press CTRL-SHIFT-D | Expected: An message will be similar to the screenshot in the summary of this test case || Step 5: Click on the SmartForm name in the popup window | Expected: Design Studio will opens with the selected SmartForm || Step 6: Add an OnValidated or OnChanged events in Properties/ Events section in the right menu | Expected: The setting will be similar to the screenshot in the summary of this test case || Step 7: Click Save button in the ribbon bar | Expected: The change will be saved without any issues

Title: Expert Launcher - Updating Pinned Applications
Steps:
Step 1: Install the ExpertLauncher.msi from the ExpertShare || Step 2: Start an application from EAPro to generate FileHashCache.xml in C:\AderantExpert\<environment>\Applications folder | Expected: Application should be download in C:\AderantExpert\<environment>\Applications folder || Step 3: Pin said application to your task bar and close the application || Step 4: Go to the Applications folder and find the FileHashCache.xml || Step 5: Modify the hash value of any of the entries in there.

This makes ExpertLauncher believe that the file in the Applications folder is different from the file in the Downloads folder. So it will need to update it. | Expected: hash = "" || Step 6: Open the application you pinned to the taskbar by clicking on the icon on the taskbar | Expected: You should get a notification telling you that your application is out of date and will now restart and update. There should be no option to decline this. || Step 7: Clicking ok should close the app and reopen it automatically. | Expected: No longer get that message.
But, because in this instance the ExpertLauncher is opening the application, the compare of the files doesn't get done, so not seeing the pop-up is not proof that the process has worked. || Step 8: Check the file you modified earlier | Expected: The hash should have been put back

Title: Expert Launcher Auto-Start
Description: This test case covers the Expert Launcher itself auto-starting on login, as well as the auto-starting of Expert Smart Apps via Expert Launcher.
Steps: Step 1: Install the ExpertLauncher.msi from the ExpertShare || Step 2: Double check the wiki for the enable auto-start and lauch login apps commands(Past the link here once it's been created) || Step 3: First you need to build a URL for your environment, let's use the Master ITE as an example:aderantexpert://vmexpmastlb.ap.aderant.com/Expert_VmMasterITE/enableautostart/ExpertBudgeting The aderantexpert is always the same.You can copy the vmexpmastlb.ap.aderant.com/Expert_VmMasterITE part from the EA Pro URL.enableautostart is the command, might be disableautostart or launch instead.The ExpertBudgeting part is just the name of the application as it appears in the ExpertShare's .exe || Step 4: Run something like the following in PowerShell to launch multiple URLs at once, and thus add multiple applications to the auto-start config start-process "aderantexpert://vmexpmastlb.ap.aderant.com/Expert_VmMasterITE/enableautostart/ExpertAccountsPayable";start-process "aderantexpert://vmexpmastlb.ap.aderant.com/Expert_VmMasterITE/enableautostart/ExpertAssistantDetached";start-process "aderantexpert://vmexpmastlb.ap.aderant.com/Expert_VmMasterITE/enableautostart/ExpertBilling";start-process "aderantexpert://vmexpmastlb.ap.aderant.com/Expert_VmMasterITE/enableautostart/ExpertBudgeting";start-process "aderantexpert://vmexpmastlb.ap.aderant.com/Expert_VmMasterITE/enableautostart/ExpertCollections";start-process "aderantexpert://vmexpmastlb.ap.aderant.com/Expert_VmMasterITE/enableautostart/ExpertDisbursements";start-process "aderantexpert://vmexpmastlb.ap.aderant.com/Expert_VmMasterITE/enableautostart/ExpertEntityManager";start-process "aderantexpert://vmexpmastlb.ap.aderant.com/Expert_VmMasterITE/enableautostart/ExpertExpenses";start-process "aderantexpert://vmexpmastlb.ap.aderant.com/Expert_VmMasterITE/enableautostart/ExpertGeneralLedger";start-process "aderantexpert://vmexpmastlb.ap.aderant.com/Expert_VmMasterITE/enableautostart/ExpertMatterPlanning";start-process "aderantexpert://vmexpmastlb.ap.aderant.com/Expert_VmMasterITE/enableautostart/ExpertRates";start-process "aderantexpert://vmexpmastlb.ap.aderant.com/Expert_VmMasterITE/enableautostart/ExpertTime"; || Step 5: Check the config itself in the equivalent path for your user: C:\Users\brendan.schwass\AppData\Roaming\Aderant\ExpertLauncher\AutoStart.config | Expected: All the applications in the PowerShell script have had launch commands added. || Step 6: In the Windows Task Manager, check the Startup tab for the ExpertLauncher. It should have been put there simply by installing it. || Step 7: Log out and log back in | Expected: When you log in the ExpertLauncher should launch automatically, though you won't see it.It should also launch all the applications now listed to auto-start in the config, you will likely see the ExpertLauncher splashscreen for this.Check that each application in the list has opened. || Step 8: In Notepad++ change the enables in the previous ps script to disables and run it | Expected: Check those applications have been removed from that config. || Step 9: Use the URLaderantexpert://localhost/Expert_Local/launchloginapps | Expected: Nothing should launch || Step 10: Use launcher with SSL cerificate and self signed certificate .  for example run aderantexpert://wsakl001458.ap.aderant.com/Expert_Local/Launch/ExpertBilling   and aderantexpert://wsakl001458.aderant.com/Expert_Local/Launch/ExpertBilling | Expected: Should be able to launch app with both cerificates tupes

Title: Expert Launcher with custom Application Source Path
Steps:
Step 1: This test case runs through the 6 different avenues draw in the Summary image. The most up-to-date version of the flow chart can be found on the wiki page: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/Platform/Wiki/215711%20&%20220418%20&%20220540%20Multiple%20App%20Install%20Types.aspx If you have any of the following variables for your user or your system you'll need to clear them out before you get started:
ExpertLauncher_<environment>_ApplicationSourcePath
ExpertLauncher_<environment>_LaunchFromApplicationSource || Step 2: Path 1 || Step 3: RunExpertLauncher.msifrom the ExpertShare of the environment you with to test. || Step 4: RunExpertTime.Full.msifrom the ExpertShare of the environment you with to test.If it's not there open Deployment Manager and use the Advanced option to generate full msis. | Expected: Should put a file in C:\Program Files (x86)\AderantExpert\ExpertTime\ExpertTime.exe || Step 5: Open EA Pro and launch ExpertTime | Expected: Use the Command line column in Task Manager to confirm that ExpertTime.Exe is running from C:\Program Files (x86)\AderantExpert\ExpertTime || Step 6: Path 2 || Step 7: In Apps and FeaturesUninstall ExpertTime || Step 8: Open EA Pro and launch ExpertTime | Expected: Use the Command line column in Task Manager to confirm that ExpertTime.Exe is running from C:\AderantExpert\<environment>\Applications || Step 9: Path 3 || Step 10: Open your Environment Variables screen (Windows key | Enter environment variables) || Step 11: Under System variables Click NewVariable name = ExpertLauncher_<environmentName>_LaunchFromApplicationSource(e.g. Expertlauncher_VmMasterITE_LaunchFromApplicationSource)
(You can find the environment name in the EA Pro URL - Don't include the Expert_)Variable value = trueOK || Step 12: Open EA Pro and launch ExpertTime | Expected: Use the Command line column in Task Manager to confirm that ExpertTime.Exe is running from the environment's ExpertShare || Step 13: Path 4 || Step 14: Under your user's variables Click NewVairable name = ExpertLauncher_<environmentName>_LaunchFromApplicationSource(e.g. Expertlauncher_VmMasterITE_LaunchFromApplicationSource)Variable value = trueOK || Step 15: Under System variables Click NewVariable name = ExpertLauncher_<environmentName>_ApplicationSourcePath(e.g. Expertlauncher_VmMasterITE_ApplicationSourcePath)Variable value = C:\Temp\CustomOK || Step 16: If it doesn't exist create the folderC:\Temp\Custom || Step 17: Copy the C:\ExpertSharefolder contents of the environment you're trying to test into the Custom folder || Step 18: Open EA Pro and launch ExpertTime | Expected: Use the Command line column in Task Manager to confirm that ExpertTime.Exe is running from C:\Temp\Custom || Step 19: Path 5 || Step 20: Under your user's variables Update ExpertLauncher_<environmentName>_LaunchFromApplicationSourceVariable value = potatoOK | Expected: The value true should be handled one way, all other values should be treated as false. || Step 21: Go to C:\AderantExpert\<environment>\Applicationsand delete the contents of this folder || Step 22: Fire up Process Monitor and filter on ExpertLauncher.exe

Process Name = ExpertLauncher.exe || Step 23: Open EA Pro and launch ExpertTime | Expected: ExpertLauncher should copy the files from C:\Temp\Custom (still a system variable) into C:\AderantExpert\<environment>\ApplicationsConfirm this in Process Monitor Use the Command line column in Task Manager to confirm that ExpertTime.Exe is running from C:\AderantExpert\<environment>\Applications || Step 24: Remove at the files from your custom ExpertShare copy, clear out the applications folder, try to reopen a WPF app via EA Pro | Expected: Check that an appropriate error is logged || Step 25: Path 6 || Step 26: For this step you'll need to find an ExpertTime.Full.msi from another environment. RunExpertTime.Full.msi | Expected: Should put a file in C:\Program Files (x86)\AderantExpert\ExpertTime\ExpertTime.exe || Step 27: Under your user's variables Update ExpertLauncher_<environmentName>_LaunchFromApplicationSourceVariable value = trueOK || Step 28: Under your user's variables Update ExpertLauncher_<environmentName>_ApplicationSourcePath(e.g. Expertlauncher_VmMasterITE_ApplicationSourcePath)Variable value = C:\Temp\Custom\DoesNotExistOK | Expected: The idea here is to test that an error is thrown when the path is invalid || Step 29: Open EA Pro and launch ExpertTime | Expected: Check your local event log for an error.

Title: Expert Launcher Minor Checks
Steps: Step 1: Check that the ExpertLauncher does a check for the appropriate .Net version when you try to install it. Do this by finding an environement that doesn't have that version of .NET (For 822 it's 4.8), and run the ExpertLauncher.msi from a shared environment's ExpertShare. | Expected: Should get a warningShould not install || Step 2: In Chrome:Check that you always get a pop-up message when you try to open a SmartApp || Step 3: In IE:Check that you get a pop-up message when don't have ExpertLauncher installed and you try to open a SmartAPP || Step 4: In Edge:Check that you get a pop-up message when don't have ExpertLauncher installed and you try to open a SmartAPP || Step 5: Expert Launcher installations should put a folder atC:\AderantExpert\ExpertLauncher\Iconswith the icons from all the apps in it. | Expected: Check that no app icons are missing from this folder. || Step 6: Check that if you have a Expert Time already open Expert Launcher won't open a second instance from the same environment

Title: Design Studio - DS Protects Against SQL Injection
Steps: Step 1: Open Design Studio || Step 2: Test via Data Source:Right-click any of the headings in the Navigation pane (e.g. Expert Billing) || Step 3: New > Job > Fill in the Name and Code with any string || Step 4: Click 'Data Source' on the ribbon bar at the top of the window || Step 5: Click 'Add..' || Step 6: Enter a name || Step 7: Set Data Type to 'String' type || Step 8: Under Data Source, set 'Source' to SQL String || Step 9: Enter the following script in the SQL String fieldUPDATE HBM_PERSNL SET PRIVILEGE_LEVEL = 1WHERE EMPLOYEE_NAME LIKE'%Giang%' || Step 10: Click Ok, then click Ok || Step 11: In the main window, set the activity to anything || Step 12: Click 'Save&Run' on the ribbon bar | Expected: An error should be displayed said that Queries are anot allowed to contain the word 'UPDATE' || Step 13: Test via SQL Query Activity:Right-click any of the heading in the Navigation pane (e.g. Expert Billing) || Step 14: New > Job > Fill in the Name and Code with any string || Step 15: In the main window, set the activity type to 'SQL Query' || Step 16: Enter the following script in the SQL String fieldUPDATE HBM_PERSNL SET PRIVILEGE_LEVEL = 1WHERE EMPLOYEE_NAME LIKE'%Giang%' || Step 17: Create a new variable to store the result || Step 18: Click 'Save&Run' on the ribbon bar | Expected: An error should be displayed said that Queries are anot allowed to contain the word 'UPDATE'

Title: Handshake Query Service - Minor checks
Steps: Step 1: Open Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager || Step 2: Navigate to 'Default Web Site' > '{Expert_EnvironmentName}' > 'Query' in the ''Connections' pane || Step 3: Click the 'Advanced Settings...' in 'Actions' pane || Step 4: Check the 'Physical Path' in 'Advanced Settings' window | Expected: It should follow this syntax 'C:\AderantExpert\{EnvrionmentName}\Services\Query' || Step 5: Check you can open this query (but for the relevant workstation)http://localhost/Expert_Local/Query/QueryService.svc/Matters()?$filter=IsActive&$top=1

Title: Workflow Admin - Verify development workflows to be disabled/enabled
Description:
Custom Workflow setup
 

 
Live Definitions tab in Workflow Administration 

New item in ExpertAssistant/ExpertAssistantDetach

 
Message when Workflow is active

Message when Workflow is inactive
Steps: Step 1: Create a custom Workflow in Visual Studio | Expected: Workflow set up will be similar to the one shown in the screenshot in the summary of this test case. || Step 2: Open Workflow Admin || Step 3: Go to 'Live Definitions' tab | Expected: The new custom Workflow should be appeared in the list || Step 4: Set the Workflow to be active | Expected: It should be active by default || Step 5: Open Design Studio || Step 6: Go to Expert Assistant/Menus/Actions Menu || Step 7: Create a new item and select Workflow as Activity || Step 8: Search and select Custom Workflow in Workflow Name || Step 9: Open ExpertAssistant/ExpertAssistantDetach || Step 10: Go to Actions and open new created item (e.g. CustomMenu) | Expected: The new item will be similar to the one shown in the screenshot in the summary of this test case || Step 11: Check the Event Viewer | Expected: The message in Event Viewer will be similar to the one shown in the screenshot in the summary of this test case || Step 12: Repeat step 2 and 3 || Step 13: Set the Worklfow to be inactive || Step 14: Repeat step 9 and 10 || Step 15: Check the Event Viewer | Expected: The message in Event Viewer will be similar to the one shown in the screenshot in the summary of this test case

Title: Workflow - Task create and complete tracking
Steps: Step 1: Run this query in MS SQL Server Management Studio SELECT CUSTOMTRACKRECORDNAME,ACTION,STATE,* FROM WFM_ACTIVITY_EVENT_TRACK ORDER BY EVENTTIME DESC || Step 2: Start File Opening Workflow || Step 3: Repeat step 1 | Expected: The Task-Create record should be added in WFM_ACTIVITY_EVENT_TRACK table || Step 4: Reassign a task in File Opening Workflow to username with special characters || Step 5: Repeat step 1 | Expected: The Task-Reassign record should be added in WFM_ACTIVITY_EVENT_TRACK table || Step 6: Approve when required in File Opening Workflow || Step 7: Repeat step 1 | Expected: The Task-Approval record should be added in WFM_ACTIVITY_EVENT_TRACK table || Step 8: Complete the File Opening Workflow || Step 9: Repeat step 1 | Expected: The Task-Complete record should be added in WFM_ACTIVITY_EVENT_TRACK table || Step 10: Verifiy Email sent for assigned workflow task | Expected: Email has created and submitted and includes: Task NAme, Description, created date, start Date, Due date, Process Name & Client/Matter properties || Step 11: Repeat step 1 | Expected: The Task-Complete record should be added in WFM_ACTIVITY_EVENT_TRACK table || Step 12: Reassign a task in File Opening Workflow to user with empty login value in HBM_PERSNL (check DB) | Expected: The Task-Reassign record should be added in WFM_ACTIVITY_EVENT_TRACK table, Notification received, No error in event viewer || Step 13: Start a Matter Intake workflow.Open the task and change a detail.In IIS bring down the framework app pool.Try to save the task.Add a note to the taskPost the note | Expected: The Message in the alert bar should say that the Task service is unavailable.The window should be restored to an interactive state. || Step 14: In Expert > Admin > System > Workflow > Custom Development, configure multiple email addresses in the <Send all> property using a comma or semicolon as the delimiter. Execute any workflow and confirm that it completes successfully and emails are sent. Ensure that spaces and other delimiters are not accepted. | Expected: The workflow completes successfully and emails are sent when the correct setting is applied and either a comma or a semicolon is used as the delimiter. All other delimiters are restricted

Title: SSRS - Deploy SSRS content with a defined Report Server Path
Description: Example of Availablity  Tab in System Monitor
Steps: Step 1: Go to http://{MachineName}/Reports (e.g. http://wsakl001213.ap.aderant.com/Reports) to verify SQL Server Reporting Service (SSRS) is available || Step 2: Delete the 'Local' folder if it exists (To test the fix for TFS 224787 (https://tfs.aderant.com/tfs/ADERANT/ExpertSuite/_queries?id=224787&_a=edit)) || Step 3: Open Deployment Manager || Step 4: Enter all required fields || Step 5: In Step 2, enter @ReportServerPath || Step 6: Complete the deployment process || Step 7: Go to System Monitor via Deployment Manager or Expert Assistant || Step 8: Check SQL Server Reporting Service (SSRS) in Availability tab. See the screenshot in the Summary section for an example of SSRS service in Availability tab. | Expected: The SQL Server Reporting Service (SSRS) should be available with a green check mark || Step 9: Go to http://{MachineName}/Reports (e.g. http://wsakl001213.ap.aderant.com/Reports) again to verify the SSRS folder is created with @ReportServerPath name

Title: Design Studio - Custom Form Point names should show in tree
Steps: Step 1: Import the standard Paperless Approval Workflow || Step 2: Import the attached package which contains two custom smartforms || Step 3: In Design Studio, check that the custom Smartforms show in the tree as per this Test Case's summary.

Title: Design Studio - Add hyperlink for opening applications
Description:
Open up any smartform in design studio.
 
Find a Display Text field or add one if there isn't one, look for the A:
In the properties select the Hyperlink button
Hyperlink Type = Go to Product
 
Go through each Product and check that the targets for each match the below (if these change over time please add a new image to this test case).
Steps: Step 1: See Summary for steps

Title: Scheduler Robustness
Description:
Suspended job

 
Change the Frequency
Job in Error State
Job is missing trigger

 
Next Run Time Change
Steps: Step 1: In Schedule Manager, create schedules for each of the jobs in Step 1, setting some of them to run every 30 seconds, and some of them to run every 5 seconds. || Step 2: Refresh Schedule Manager and wait until all of the jobs are Executing || Step 3: Open SQL Server Management Studio; in the Object Explorer panel, right-click on your database server, select restart, then confirm your decision | Expected: A short period of time after the SQL Server restarts, the SQL Scheduled Jobs should resume running (you will have to refresh Schedule Manager to confirm this) || Step 4: In SQL Server Management Studio, stop your SQL Server, wait for 1 minute, then start it in SQL Server Configuration Manager | Expected: As above || Step 5: Restart IIS in all of your app servers | Expected: As above || Step 6: Open Task Manager. In the Services tab, restart Aderant.JobAgent:{EnvironmentName} | Expected: As above || Step 7: In the Details tab of task manager, click end-task on Expert.Core.Services.exe, then start Aderant.JobAgent:{EnvironmentName} in the Services tab (N.B the above step is a graceful restart, this is a hard stop) | Expected: As above || Step 8: Right click a job while it has the status 'Executing' || Step 9: Edit one of the configurations of the job that does not relate to how it runs (e.g. change the Name field). You must start editing, make your changes and save, all while the job is still executing, so make sure that your job runs for long enough to give you time to do this. || Step 10: Wait until the job finishes (you will probably have to click Refresh to confirm this) | Expected: The change is not undone when the job completes || Step 11: Pick a job that is executing. While it is still executing, edit the job so that it is inactive. | Expected: The job should continue running, but the Status should be Inactive. When the job completes, it should stay inactive and not run again, it should not go back to Queued state. || Step 12: Select one of the SQL jobs and change the Occurrence to Weekly in Schedule Manager and tick multiple days || Step 13: Run this query in SQL Server Management StudioSELECT * FROM QRTZ_TRIGGERS WHERE JOB_NAME = '{JobName}' | Expected: The window will be similar to the screenshot in the summary of this test case || Step 14: Pick any active job, and get its trigger name from QRTZ_TRIGGERS. Run this query in SQL Server Management Studio to put the job into error stateUPDATE QRTZ_TRIGGERS SET TRIGGER_STATE = 'ERROR' WHERE trigger_name ='{TriggerName}' || Step 15: Go to System Monitor | Verification tab | Scheduled JobsNOTE: There will be no change in Schedule Manager as Schedule Manager only cares about the FWM_EXTENSION_POINT_SCHEDULE not QRTZ tables | Expected: The page will be similar to the screenshot in the summary of this test case || Step 16: Pick any active job, and gets its trigger name from QRTZ_TRIGGERS. Run this query in SQL Server Management Studio to produce an active job which has no triggerDELETE FROM QRTZ_TRIGGERS WHERE trigger_name = '{TriggerName}' || Step 17: Pick an active job and get its Schedule Uno from FWM_EXTENSION_POINT_SCHEDULE. Run this query in SQL Server Management Studio to suspend itUPDATE FWM_EXTENSION_POINT_SCHEDULE SET STATUS = 2, INACTIVE = 'N', SUSPENSION_REASON = 'This job is suspended' WHERE SCHEDULE_UNO = '{Schedule_Uno}' || Step 18: Go to System Monitor | Verification tab | Scheduled Jobs | Expected: The "Suspended Jobs" verification should fail || Step 19: Refresh Schedule Manager | Expected: The window will be similar to the screenshot in the summary of this test case || Step 20: Pick an active job and Run this query in SQL Server Management Studio to set the job to have a next run time that is at least a day in the pastUPDATE FWM_EXTENSION_POINT_SCHEDULE SET NEXT_RUN_TIME = '{NEXT_RUN_TIME}' WHERE SCHEDULE_UNO = '{Schedule_Uno}' | Expected: In System Monitor the "Unexpectedly Stopped Jobs" verification should fail || Step 21: Refresh Schedule ManagerNOTE: Schedule Manager shows time in current time zone, but the database stores it in UTC time | Expected: The window will be similar to the screenshot in the summary of this test case || Step 22: Stop the Background Jobs Agent || Step 23: Copy the attached dll into SharedBin || Step 24: Start the Background Jobs Agent | Expected: All jobs which try to run should be suspended, with a message explaining that they have gone into error state. In QRTZ_TRIGGERS the trigger should be in error state. In FWM_SCHEDULE_AUDIT there should be records for the jobs being put into error state.

Title: Expert Administration - Printer Configuration
Steps: Step 1: Open Expert Administration || Step 2: Go to System | Printer Settings || Step 3: Click Add button | Expected: Available Printer Selection window should pop up || Step 4: Click 'Add New' button || Step 5: Enter Printer Name, Network Path, and Location | Expected: The setting will be similar to the screenshot in the summary of this test case || Step 6: Select that Adhoc printer || Step 7: Click Install || Step 8: Click Test Page icon in the grid in one of installed printers | Expected: The correspondence printer should print out a test page || Step 9: Select a printer to disable || Step 10: Click Save | Expected: The disabled printers should not appear in printer list in Expert Billing and Expert Account Payable || Step 11: Click (x) button in the grid to remove installed printer | Expected: The printer should be removed successfully

Title: Expert Administration - Null check in Printer Setting
Steps: Step 1: Run those queries in MS SQL Server Management Studio to verify existing printers and associated locations in the environmentSELECT * FROM CMS_PRINTERSELECT * FROM CMS_PRINT_LOC || Step 2: Delete one Location record in CMS_PRINT_LOC using this query DELETE FROM CMS_PRINT_LOC WHERE LOCATION_ID = '{LocationID}' || Step 3: Go to Expert Administration | System | Printer Settings | Expected: The window should open normally without any issues

Title: 'Run Immediate' action works with a previously failed jobs
Steps: Step 1: This test assumes you are privilege level 0 in HBM_Persnland that you have rights to access Design Studio || Step 2: Open Design Studio | Expert Assistant | Jobs || Step 3: Click 'New Job' in the ribbon bar || Step 4: Enter the following details:Product: ExpertAssistantName: Sending Email Job With Wrong Query ResultCode: TESTFSMDescription: Sending Email Job With Wrong Query ResultScope: FirmIsActive: Yes || Step 5: Add a Query Activity || Step 6: Enter the following details:From: EmployeeWhere: Item.Code = "YOUR EMPLOYEE CODE (Find this in HBM_PERSNL)"Item.PrivilegeLevel = "1"Result:Create new variable with the name "QueryResult" || Step 7: On the left hand side, add a new lineActivity: EmailTo:  - Pre 82SP1: [QueryResult.Email] - 82SP1: QueryResult.EmailSubject: "Failed sending email"Body: Anything || Step 8: Create a schedule for that job and set it to run once || Step 9: Wait until it finishes || Step 10: Right-click and click Review on that job | Expected: The window will be similar to the screenshot in the summary of this test case || Step 11: Go to Design Studio and change the Item.PrivilegeLevel = "0" || Step 12: Right-click and click 'Run Immediately' on that job in Schedule Manager | Expected: Job should complete without any issues

Title: DB Maintenance Statistics Update Job
Description: Outcome Message
Steps:
Step 1: Update 2 records in TAT_TIME table by running this query with {TIME_UNO} in your database UPDATE TAT_TIME SET ENTRY_STATUS ='N' WHERE TIME_UNO = {TIME_UNO} || Step 2: Run this query to check how many records were updated  SELECT [name], [stat].[stats_id], [modification_counter] AS [rowmodctr]
         FROM [sys].[stats] AS [stat]
         CROSS APPLY [sys].[dm_db_stats_properties]([stat].object_id, [stat].[stats_id])
         WHERE [stat].object_id = OBJECT_ID('tat_time') AND INDEXPROPERTY([stat].object_id, [name], 'ishypothetical') = 0
         ORDER BY [stat].[stats_id] | Expected: The result should be similar to the one in the summary of this test case || Step 3: Execute this query to run the SPEXEC [dbo].[SP_CMS_UPDATESTATS] || Step 4: Search for [TAT_TIME] table in the outcome message | Expected: The message should be similar to the one in the summary of this test case

Title: Stopping core service on one app server is handled safely
Description:
Services window
 
 
[dbo].[Q_componentauditservice] queue location
Steps: Step 1: Log into one app server in a shared ITE environment (e.g. VMEXPMASTLB301 in @EnvironmentName) || Step 2: Open Services and stop ADERANT Background Job Agent (@EnvironmentName instance) | Expected: The window will be similar to the one shown in the summary of this test case || Step 3: Perform iisreset on app server || Step 4: Open SQL Server Management Studio || Step 5: Go to @EnvironmentName database | Service Broker | Queues | Expected: The window will be similar to the one shown in the summary of this test case || Step 6: Check [dbo].[Q_componentauditservice] queue | Expected: The queue should be still available and visible in SSMS || Step 7: Open Expert apps (e.g. Account Payable) | Expected: The apps should open successfully || Step 8: Close Expert apps || Step 9: Start ADERANT Background Job Agent (@EnvironmentName instance) again || Step 10: Reopen Expert apps (e.g. Account Payable) | Expected: The apps should open successfully

Title: Security rights for running summary stored procedures
Steps: Step 1: Users in DBR_CMSADM and CMSADM can run BillModel.RefreshWipArSummaryUsers not in those groups can't || Step 2: Add new Domain User (e.g. ADERANT_AP\TTQA1) || Step 3: Add this user in the Expert database using this queryCREATE USER [ADERANT_AP\TTQA1] FOR LOGIN [ADERANT_AP\ttqa1] WITH DEFAULT_SCHEMA=[CMSADM] || Step 4: Run this query to add that user in [DBR_CMSADM]EXEC sp_addrolemember 'DBR_CMSADM', 'ADERANT_AP\TTQA1' || Step 5: Run these queries EXECUTE AS USER = 'ADERANT_AP\TTQA1'GOEXEC billmodel.RefreshWipArSummary | Expected: The queries should complete without any issues

Title: Add additional application servers in a Load Balancing environment utilizing Deployment Manager
Steps: Step 1: Deploy Expert in a load balancing environment with one app server || Step 2: Click add server button in the ribbon bar in Deployment Manager || Step 3: Open Services and check the 4 newly added Aderant services in new app server. ADERANT Background Job Agent ({EnvrionmentName} instance)ADERANT DocuDraft Queue Manager Service ({EnvrionmentName} instance)ADERANT Prebill Workflow Service ({EnvrionmentName} instance)ADERANT Workflow Services ({EnvrionmentName} instance) | Expected: The window will be similar to the one shown in the summary of this test case || Step 4: Open some Expert Apps (e.g. Expert Assistant, Billing, etc) | Expected: Apps should be opened succesfully || Step 5: Open Deployment Manager and click 'Remove' button | Expected: Expert should be removed without any issues || Step 6: Turn on new query service and repeat steps 1-5 NOTE: How to turn on new query service 1. Open System Properties by searching system environment variables in Windows search box2. Go to Advanced tab > Environment variables3. Click 'New...'4. Add new variable with below valueVariable name = ENABLE_LIGHT_WEIGHT_PROXYVariable value = 15. If you run this test in your local environment then you need to restart IIS (TBC), otherwise you can skip this stepHow to turn off new query service1. Change the value of that variable to 02. If you run this test in your local environment then you need to restart IIS (TBC), otherwise you can skip this step

Title: Upgrade Customized Picklists and Page Definitions (from 8210 to 8220)
Steps: Step 1: Deploy 82SP1 || Step 2: Apply the attached gen files to your database || Step 3: Run Domain Wizard || Step 4: In Deployment Manager, run Apply Customizations and Deploy customizations.At this point check your Aderant. Query.dll. See that the customizations are added to the viewmodels. Also check your Database ExpertQuery views to see the customizations have been applied. || Step 5: Now remove your 8210 deployment, upgrade your database to 8220 and deploy 8220 binaries. (Note that PickList and PageDefinition have moved off the Case model and into their own models in 8220) || Step 6: In Deployment Manager, run Apply customizations and Deploy Customizations.Now check your Aderant. Query.dll again. The customizations should be added to the viewmodels. Also check your Database ExpertQuery views to see the customizations have been applied to the views. | Expected: New custom columns should be added to the Picklist and Page definition domain components Fixed bug (221508) in 8220 was: Customizations were not applied to the Views or Viewmodels at this point.

Title: EA - Expert Assistant Proxy data provider enhancement
Steps: Step 1: Make sure you do not have rights to proxy anyone. Open EA | Expected: There should be no proxy bar present in EA. || Step 2: Give yourself proxy rights to 5 users. Some of which have rights to approval tasks of workflows, some of which who don't. Make sure one of them also has workflow admin rights. Open EA | Expected: Should only see a combo box in the proxy bar (same as before). Switching between users using this combo box should swap the content in the workflow processes screen and the task inbox screen to show what the user being proxied can see. If the selected user is not yourself, the bar at the top should be orange; if the selected user is yourself, the bar at the top should be dark blue. || Step 3: Give yourself proxy rights to 25 users. Some of which have rights to approval tasks of workflows, some of which who don't. Make sure one of them also has workflow admin rights. Open Ea | Expected: Should see a search control in the proxy bar. You should be able to type and filter using it. The content in the search should be pinnable, recently selected should also show up at top.  Switching between users using this combo box should swap the content in the workflow processes screen and the task inbox screen to show what the user being proxied can see. If the selected user is not yourself, the bar at the top should be orange; if the selected user is yourself, the bar at the top should be dark blue. || Step 4: Remove everyone you can proxy as. Open EA | Expected: There should be no proxy bar present in EA.

Title: Domain Customization - Check duplicate custom columns cannot be added
Description:
Shouldn't be able to add column names that match an existing column name (minus the _) or matching any existing custom column name.
 
Warning message in Domain Customization Wizard

 
 
 
Error message in Deployment Manager
Steps:
Step 1: Create TWO custom column in HBM_MATTER. 1. That has the name _PARENT_CHILD and another which is a completely unique name. || Step 2: Go through all customization process || Step 3: Click Continue when receiving a warning message in Domain Customization Wizard | Expected: Warning message will look similar to the one shown in the summary of this test case. || Step 4: Check that only the column with the unique name is included after the warning in the Domain Customization Wizard window || Step 5: Complete customization process in Domain Wizard || Step 6: In MSSMS, type in the following sql and execute the query: update FCM_CUSTOMIZATION_METADATA set METADATA = ' Aderant.Matter.Model Matter.dmdsl Matter Aderant.Matter.Models 166176b2-230f-4f33-ba4e-4390d5822e63 _PARENT_CHILD HBM_MATTER
 MatterModel.Matter ' | Expected: In the messages window there should be a (1 row(s) affected) message || Step 7: Open Deployment Manager and click 'Apply Customization' || Step 8: Change the Log Level to Technical || Step 9: Deployment Manager can't complete customization process | Expected: Error message will look similar to the one shown in the summary of this test case || Step 10: Add the following in the CustomizationBuilder.exe.config under the closing of the startup tag. i.e. under . || Step 11: Click apply customizations again. This time the metadata validation will not care about the custom column having the same name as an existing column.

4. Reassign the approval tasks for those reports to same user (e.g. TTQA3) and make sure that the user doesn't belong to Administrator group

5. Open EA as a user in Administrator group with WorkflowAdministrators (can view, can't perform/approve) policy (e.g. TTQA4)

6. Check Review All option is not available in the right-click menu

9. Check Review All option is available in the right-click menu

10. Complete the task
Steps: Step 1: Open Expert Expenses as yourself || Step 2: Create at least 3 Expenses Reports and adding receipts to them. Check the Expense Reports window | Expected: Expenses window should look similar to the screenshot in the summary of this test case || Step 3: Reassign the approval tasks for those reports to same user (e.g. TTQA3) and make sure that the user doesn't belong to Administrator group || Step 4: Open EA as a user in Administrator group with WorkflowAdministrators (can view, can't perform/approve) policy (e.g. TTQA4) || Step 5: Check Review All option is not available in the right-click menu || Step 6: Click one of these tasks and a new window shows up without Complete Tasks button available || Step 7: Open EA as TTQA3 || Step 8: Check Review All option is available in the right-click menu

Title: Expert Admin - Logging configuration levels for the system generates a confirmation message and change expiration date accordingly

Infinite loadingUninstall the MSI | Expected: MSI is installed successfully . Authentication window open and can login succeffuly. No issues with Ad-In || Step 5: Remove Remote credentialRun ExpertDocumentManagementOfficeAddInPerMachineand,msi with instance.config-Enter credentials to Authentication WindowsVerify MSI installed successfullySanity on Add inUninstall the MSI | Expected: MSI is installed successfully . Authentication window open and can login succeffuly. No issues with Ad-In || Step 6: Login to remote end to add Remote credentialRun ExpertDocumentManagementOfficeAddInPerMachineand.MSI with instance.configVerify MSI installed successfully without loginSanity on Add inUninstall the MSI | Expected: MSI is installed successfully . Authentication window NOT dsiplayed. No issues with Ad-In || Step 7: Login to remote end to add Remote credentialRun ExpertDocumentManagementOfficeAddInPerUser.MSI with instance.configVerify MSI installed successfully without loginSanity on Add in ==> Not able to use Add in, infinite loading.Uninstall the MSI | Expected: MSI is installed successfully . Authentication window NOT dsiplayed. No issues with Ad-In

Title: Expert Launcher auto start in Citrix environment doesn't try to copy files
Description:
In a citrix environment often users won't have rights to update any local files. Expert Launcher is set to startup automatically at login.
Previously the autorun flag would cause Expert Launcher to first update its own local files.
This test is to prove that doesn't happen.
Steps: Step 1: Install the Expert Launcher from a shared environment || Step 2: Set up a local User level environment variableExpertLauncher_VmMasterITE_LaunchFromApplicationSource = TrueWhere VmMasterITE is replaced with your environment name | Expected: This will cause Expert launcher to no longer automatically update files. || Step 3: Go to your C:\AderantExpert\<environment> folderRight-click | Properties | Security | Advanced | Disable Inheritance | Remove all inheritance | Expected: This should mean no one has access to this folder anymore || Step 4: Still in Security add yourself and Deny Write to yourself. || Step 5: Try to launch an app from EA Pro | Expected: Confirm no files were copied into C:\AderantExpert\<environment> || Step 6: Restart your PC | Expected: Confirm no files were copied into C:\AderantExpert\<environment>

Title: Expert Launcher with tasks
Steps: Step 1: Install ExpertLauncher (if not already installed). Note: To do this, double-click on the ExpertLauncher.msi in the ExpertShare. There is no feedback to say it's been installed properly. Just assume it has been. || Step 2: In Security Manager, give yourself the FileOpeningWorkflowStarters module policy || Step 3: Open EA Pro || Step 4: Click on the Actions icon in the left pane, and then click on "Open New File" menu item | Expected: This will start a File Opening workflow || Step 5: Close the flyout || Step 6: Scroll down the dashboard till you find the Tasks file. Click on it || Step 7: Click on the Display Name of the File Opening workflow task assigned to you. I.e. Intake (blue font to show it's a link). || Step 8: Repeat steps 1 through 3 || Step 9: Select OTG Workflow from the Expert menu || Step 10: Click on the drop-down arrow in the search control and select 'Desktop Only Tasks'. Make sure it's ticked. || Step 11: Click on the Intake task || Step 12: Click on the 'Open Task' button (top right).

Title: Citrix - Mutexed applications can open on different sessions
Steps: Step 1: Log on to machine A as user A and machine B as user B || Step 2: Connect to a citrix on both machines (usually VMDVCTX301.ap.aderant.com) || Step 3: Open Time from both machines | Expected: Opens fine on both machines || Step 4: Open Expenses from both machines | Expected: Opens fine on both machines || Step 5: Open DS from both machines | Expected: Opens fine on both machines

Title: Citrix - Cross application communication happens on a user session scope
Description: We have several areas where applications communicate with one another.We must ensure that these do not go beyond the user session boundary, if it does, one users actions may influence the behavior of another users application.Each step in this test case describes common examples of where apps are talking to one another.
Steps: Step 1: Each one of these steps needs to be run on different user accounts connected to the same citrix server. || Step 2: Design Studio Deep LinkingOpen Design studio on both accountsOn one account, go to any app (web or smart app)Go to a smart formGo into customization mode and edit the form | Expected: The smartform should open up in the already open instance of Design Studio on the user account that opened it. || Step 3: Expert Task/Task InboxDeploy Expense approval workflowEnsure users have rights to approve expensesOpen EA and Expenses on both accountsKick off an Expense approval workflow on one accountGo to task inbox on an accountOpen the task | Expected: Task should open on the instance of expenses for the user that opened the task.

Title: Design Studio - Deep linking
Steps: Step 1: Open an instance of design studio || Step 2: Open an application with smartforms/grids || Step 3: Enable customization mode on the application || Step 4: Repeat steps 3-4 with various apps | Expected: All forms/grids should open in the same instance of design studio || Step 5: Edit the smartform/grid | Expected: Smartform/grid should open up in the very first instance of design studio.

Title: Use Expert Launcher in multiple environments

Title: Verify records in BEM_EVENT_SUBSCRIPTION should not go missing when unsubscribing Aderant.Workflow.TrackingRecordWrapper event
Steps: Step 1: Run this query to check Workflow Summary table before removing the eventSELECT COMPLETEDMILESTONE, PENDINGMILESTONE, * FROM WFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARY || Step 2: Check how many events in BEM_EVENT_SUBSCRIPTIONSELECT COUNT(*) FROM BEM_EVENT_SUBSCRIPTION || Step 3: Run this query to remove Aderant.Workflow.TrackingRecordWrapper event from BEM_EVENT_SUBSCRIPTIONEXEC MESSAGING.UnsubscribeFromEvent 'Aderant.Workflow.Tracking.TrackingRecordWrapper, Aderant.Workflow, Version=1.8.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=41b332442f1101cc', 'WorkflowReportingService', 'workflowreportingservice' || Step 4: Check again to check the number of event in BEM_EVENT_SUBSCRIPTION after we remove that eventSELECT COUNT(*) FROM BEM_EVENT_SUBSCRIPTION || Step 5: Open new FO workflow in EA || Step 6: Run this query to check Workflow Summary table. SELECT COMPLETEDMILESTONE, PENDINGMILESTONE, * FROM WFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARY ORDER BY LAST_MODIFIED DESC | Expected: A new record should be added with Null value in COMPLETEDMILESTONE, PENDINGMILESTONE columns || Step 7: Wait 10minutes, (11 to be completely safe)Check Aderant.Workflow.Tracking.TrackingRecordWrapper event by running this query belowSELECT * FROM BEM_EVENT_SUBSCRIPTION WHERE EventName LIKE 'Aderant.Workflow.Tracking.TrackingRecordWrapper, Aderant.Workflow, Version=1.8.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=41b332442f1101cc' | Expected: The Aderant.Workflow.Tracking.TrackingRecordWrapper event should appear back in BEM_EVENT_SUBSCRIPTION. || Step 8: Start another FO workflow in EA || Step 9: Run this query to check Workflow Summary table SELECT COMPLETEDMILESTONE, PENDINGMILESTONE, * FROM WFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARY ORDER BY LAST_MODIFIED DESC | Expected: The table should now display the milestones records are not NULL again

Title: Verify late bindings do not fail deployment when updated column is deleted
Steps: Step 1: Restore a database || Step 2: Drop [NO_CHARGE_PRORATE_TYPE] column in TAL_ACTION by running this scriptALTER TABLE [dbo].[TAL_ACTION]DROP CONSTRAINT [Name of constraint in your DB]GOALTER TABLE [dbo].[TAL_ACTION]DROP COLUMN [NO_CHARGE_PRORATE_TYPE]GO || Step 3: Alter [TimeModel].[Action] view by running this scriptCREATE OR ALTER VIEW [TimeModel].[Action]ASSELECT *FROM dbo.TAL_ACTIONGO || Step 4: Add that column back by running this scriptALTER TABLE [dbo].[TAL_ACTION]ADD[NO_CHARGE_PRORATE_TYPE] char(1) null || Step 5: Check that column is not appeared in [ExpertQuery].[TimeAction] by running this scriptCREATE OR ALTER VIEW [ExpertQuery].[TimeAction] ASSELECTrtrim([Action].[ACTION_CODE]) [Id],[Action].[ACTION_DESC] [Description],ISNULL(CASE [Action].[BILLABLE] WHEN 'Y' THEN CAST(1 AS BIT) ELSE CAST(0 AS BIT) END, 0) [Billable],[Action].[CURRENCY_CODE] [CurrencyId],ISNULL(CASE [Action].[INACTIVE] WHEN 'N' THEN CAST(1 AS BIT) ELSE CAST(0 AS BIT) END, 0) [IsActive],[Action].[MIN_TIME] [MinimumTime],ISNULL(CASE [Action].[MOVE_TIME_ENTRY] WHEN 'Y' THEN CAST(1 AS BIT) ELSE CAST(0 AS BIT) END, 0) [MoveTimeEntry],[Action].[RATE_MULT] [RateMultiplier],ISNULL(CASE [Action].[RETAIN_TE_HRS] WHEN 'Y' THEN CAST(1 AS BIT) ELSE CAST(0 AS BIT) END, 0) [RetainTeHours],ISNULL(CASE [Action].[TAXABLE] WHEN 'Y' THEN CAST(1 AS BIT) ELSE CAST(0 window | Expected: Each click of an i opens a new tab in your browser displaying a working relevant help page || Step 18: On the left hand navigation tree, expand Expert Assistant, Menus, Action
