Title: Verify workflows with rules are imported successfully
Steps: Step 1: Build a development workflow which depends on a system rule (for example the PrebillMarkupV2 template workflow). || Step 2: In Design Studio's package editor, drag the workflow into a firm level package, and export it. | Expected: Confirm that the package contains references to the system level rules, but not the rule themselves. || Step 3: Also export the workflow in a system level package using development mode. | Expected: Confirm that it still works as expected, with both the rule references and the rules themselves being in the package.

Title: Design studio- Search Box Text Wrapping
Description: This is a test case for testing a new customisation feature introduced in 82SP2EX0001.01.  Search box smart form items now have an advanced property for word wrapping. Typically when one types an entry into a search box, a drop down list will appear with most recently used items at the top, followed by other entries that contain the substring entered by the user.  When the word wrapping checkbox is not ticked (as it is by default), the primary text and codetext will appear on the first line, and secondary text on the second line, as can be seen in the following screenshot: When the word wrap checkbox is selected, for the search item, the primary text, code text, and secondary text are wrapped so if necessary they can span multiple lines, such as with this screenshot here:
Steps: Step 1: Open design studio | Expected: Application launches || Step 2: On the left hand side navigation tree, expand Expert Time ->  Forms -> Time Card -> Add New -> Add New Time Card | Expected: The smart form is opened in design studio || Step 3: Select the phase/task element | Expected: The element is selected, and on the right hand side has a panel for the element's properties || Step 4: Select advanced properties on the top ribbon | Expected: Properties window on the right has more properties available || Step 5: Tick the Wrap Search Item Text checkbox, and save the change | Expected: The form successfully saves the change || Step 6: Open Expert Time | Expected: Application launches || Step 7: Click 'Add New Time Entry' at the top of the Timesheet view. | Expected: A smart form will open for which one can enter time entry details || Step 8: Click on the phase/task search box, then click browse all on the window that appears | Expected: A list of phase/task actions can be selected || Step 9: Browse the list of phase/tasks, and ensure they are all of the form Primary Text / Secondary Text (Code Text) | Expected: Every entry should contain all of the Primary, Secondary, and Code Text, possibly spanning multiple lines || Step 10: Go back to design studio, and untick the Wrap Search Item Text checkbox for the phase/task element, then save the change | Expected: The form successfully saves the change || Step 11: Close and reopen Expert Time, click 'Add New Time Entry' at the top of the timesheet view once more | Expected: A smart form will open for which one can enter time entry details || Step 12: Click on the  Click on the phase/task search box, then click browse all on the window that appears | Expected: A list of phase/task actions can be selected || Step 13: Browse the list of phase/tasks, and ensure they are all of the form Primary Text (Code Text) Secondary Text , with Secondary Text on a new line. | Expected: Every entry takes up exactly two lines. If a phase/task description is too long, only the portion which can fit in the one line available is displayed

Title: Verify user is not able to access API without licence
Steps: Step 1: Install expert with API roles selected. | Expected: Expert should be installed with API. || Step 2: Go to IIS and Navigate to API home page URL | Expected: Sample URL for 822WS: https://vmcrt8220ws301.ap.aderant.com/Expert_Local/Apis/ClientMatter/V1 || Step 3: Fire postman and use the home page url and send a get request | Expected: Sample Get request:https://vmcrt8220ws301.ap.aderant.com/Expert_Local/Apis/ClientMatter/V1/clients/1User should not be allowed to access API and get receive below 403 - forbidden response."Insufficient rights to access API resource." || Step 4: Copy paste get request in the browser. | Expected: "Insufficient rights to access API resource."Should be received back. See screenshot in summary. || Step 5: Go to deployment manager and import licence. | Expected: Licence should be imported. Licence Attached. || Step 6: Wait for 10 minutes and Send the same GET request again. | Expected: 1. If user is added to admin group :User should receive response back with data.2. If user is not added to admin group :    A. User should get the same error back.    B. Add user to mattermanagementApi policy and user should get response back.Verify both of above scenario. || Step 7: Go to config manager and delete previously imported licence. | Expected: Restart IIS and send the request again. User should get the error back.

Title: API Customization 02: Verify user receives custom table data back in GET request

Title: API Customization 03: Verify user is able to update custom column and table data in PATCH
Steps: Step 1: Install expert with API roles selected. | Expected: APIs should be available for consumption. || Step 2: Create and apply customization.Create a custom int column.Create a custom bool column.Create a custom string column.Create a custom int column with length 1Create a custom table and link the table to client table.Ex: CUSTOMDOCTABLES": {"Id", "DOCDESCRIPTION", "DOCUNAME", "ISLEGAL"} || Step 3: Apply customization. | Expected: Customization should be applied and changes should reflect in swagger API home page. || Step 4: Send a PATCH request for a newly created client where there is no data in custom table. | Expected: Error message should be received:"Message": "Could not update a custom entity. The ID provided in a custom entity has either been deleted or never existed." || Step 5: Send a PATCH request for a client where some data exists in custom table.Note: You can send a POST request first to populate the table or insert data in table via SQL. For more details on how to send POST request look into POST request script. | Expected: 200 OK should be received in response. || Step 6: Verify data in updated column and table. | Expected: Data should be updated as per PATCH request.To verify either check DB or send a GET request for the client. || Step 7: Send a patch request and pass larger number than allowed widthEx: if you created int column testNum with width 1 in step one passtestNum = "10"  which is lengthh 2 | Expected: 400 Error should be received.

Title: API Customization 04: Verify user is able to update custom column and table data in POST
Steps: Step 1: Install expert with API roles selected. | Expected: APIs should be available to consume. || Step 2: Create customization and apply them via DMCreate a custom int columnCreate a custom string columnCreate a custom bool columnCreate a custom table and link it to client tableEx: CUSTOMDOCTABLES": {"Id", "DOCDESCRIPTION", "DOCUNAME", "ISLEGAL"} | Expected: Customization should reflect in schema on swagger home page. || Step 3: Send a POST request via Postman.Sample Request:https://vmcrt8220ws301.ap.aderant.com/Expert_Local/Apis/ClientMatter/V1/clients {  "Client": {    "BillingEmployeeId": 15,    "ClientStatusId": "OPEN",    "OpenDate": "2020-06-29",    "ResponsibleEmployeeId": 15,    "Code": "1461",    "FirstName": "Ellen",    "LastName": "Acain",    "CUSTOMINT": "2",    "CUSTOMBOOL": "True",    "CUSTOMDOCTABLES": [        {            "DOCDESCRIPTION": "description update via API 1",            "DOCUNAME": "doc update via API 1",            "ISLEGAL": "1"        }    ]  }} || Step 4: Verify response received in Postman. | Expected: 201 Created response should be received. || Step 5: Verify clientId received in response header. | Expected: Client ID can be used for verification in DB or send a GET request and compare data received via GET matches with data sent in POST.

Title: Verify error messages for API requests
Steps: Step 1: Install expert with API roles selected. | Expected: APIs should be available for consumption. || Step 2: Send a PATCH request with Content-Type = application/xml | Expected: Verify message 415 Unsupported media type:"Message": "The request entity's media type 'application/xml' is not supported for this resource." || Step 3: Send a PATCH request with Content-Type = "" | Expected: Verify message 415 Unsupported media type:"Message": "The request contains an entity body but no Content-Type header. The inferred media type 'application/octet-stream' is not supported for this resource." || Step 4: Send a PATCH request with "BillingEmployeeId": 2147483648, as this is int32 field. | Expected: Response 400 Bad request should be received."Errors": [        {            "Code": "INVALID_MODEL_STATE",            "Source": "updateClientRequest.BillingEmployeeId",            "Message": "Value was either too large or too small for an Int32."        }    ] || Step 5: Try to update a read only property via PATCH request.If no property found edit yaml and create a read only property. | Expected: Response 400 bad request should be received."Message": "Error in 'newClientRequest.Client': Property set method not found." || Step 6: Try to update int or float and pass string value in a PATCH request. | Expected: Request 400 bad request should be received."Errors": [        {            "Code": "INVALID_MODEL_STATE",            "Source": "updateClientRequest.BillingEmployeeId",            "Message": "Could not convert string to integer: test. Path 'BillingEmployeeId', line 9, position 32."        }    ] || Step 7: Try step 6 for a custom property. | Expected: 400 Bad request:"Errors": [        {            "Code": "Invalid_Custom_Property_Format",            "Source": null,            "Message": "Could not map a custom property. The provided value was in the incorrect format."        }    ] || Step 8: Send below request for client PATCH:{Client: null} | Expected: 400 Bad request: "Errors": [        {            "Code": "INVALID_MODEL_STATE",            "Source": "updateClientRequest.Client",            "Message": "Error reading JObject from JsonReader. Current JsonReader item is not an object: Null. Path 'Client', line 2, position 17."        },        {            "Code": "INVALID_MODEL_STATE",            "Source": "updateClientRequest.Client",            "Message": "Value not provided for required property Client"        }    ] || Step 9: Send a POST client request and do not send a required property. | Expected: 400 Bad request: "Errors": [        {            "Code": "INVALID_MODEL_STATE",            "Source": "newClientRequest.Client.BillingEmployeeId",            "Message": "Value not provided for required property BillingEmployeeId"        }    ] || Step 10: Send a POST and a PATCH request and pass 1 in a bool field. | Expected: Below message will change in future. Please update the script once this message is changed.  400 Bad request:"Errors": [        {            "Code": "INVALID_MODEL_STATE",            "Source": "newClientRequest.IsActive",            "Message": "Could not cast 1 to 'System.Boolean' when deserializing."        }    ] || Step 11: Send an  empty POST request. | Expected: 400 Bad request should be received. "Errors": [        {            "Code": "INVALID_MODEL_STATE",            "Source": "newClientRequest",            "Message": "Value for required parameter was not supplied."        }     ]

Steps: Step 1: In Visual Studio, create new SmartForm Library: - Pre 82SP2 : File>New>Project>(C#)>Expert>.NET Framework 4.6  >ExpertSmartFormLibary -Post 82SP2: File>New>Project>(C#)>Expert>ExpertSmartFormLibary || Step 2: Name: AdvanceSmartFormProjectEverything else can be left default. Click Ok | Expected: Window shown with Project name same as Name you entered || Step 3: Click Ok | Expected: New project created, and can be seen in Solution explorer, name should match to the name you given || Step 4: Add a SmartForm to the library by Right-clicking on project in Solution Explorer, select Add>SmartForm(Or Add> New Item>Expert>Expert SmartForm) Name: STAdvancedSFCategory:Select the category that you created for BASIC Smartform (eg. CustSmokeTestCategory) Click Ok | Expected: Smart Form created and Opened with Category and Name not editable || Step 5: Set Title: 'Simple Controls' Description: Advance smart form smoke test Press the Edit button located on smarform | Expected: a) SmartForm Wizard is launched. b) Name and Category should be disabled and should match to what you entered in step 4c) SmartForm Type: 'Single Form'. d) Package: Pre 80 SP3 - Select the same package as BASIC Smartform(CustSmokeTestPackage)Post 80SP3 - Package not required || Step 6: On smartform wizard Click Next, Display Columns default as 'Two' | Expected: Display Columns should be default as 'Two' || Step 7: Press the 'Preview'button' | Expected: The preview pop up should look like the attachment to this test called: 'AdvancedSFPreview.png' || Step 8: Finish the SFWizard without any other changes | Expected: SF is saved || Step 9: Back in the editor in Visual Studio, save the SmartForm | Expected: SmartForm saved || Step 10: Add custom controller logic: In Solution Explorer, right-click on the SmartForm in Solution Explorer and select 'Add Custom Smartform Logic' | Expected: CSharp file is created with name like 'STAdvancedSF.Custom.cs'. It will be listed in the Solution Explorer under the SF library project, at the same level as the SF itself || Step 11: Replace the code from custom controller file with SampleCustomcontroller file provided in the attachment(Namespace and Class name might need to be changed if you have used different names for category and smartform) (Note: if you getting error for using Aderant.Framework; you will have to add the reference manually, can be found in ExpertShare=Aderant.Framework.dll) | Expected: This replaces what was previously stored in SFW scripting points in IronPython controllers that are genereated for SmartForms. i.e. OnLoaded, OnValidate, OnDataChanged, OnChange || Step 12: Right-click on the SF Library, build, and re-generate all SmartForms (Note: if you getting error while building due to reference missing; you will have to add the reference manually, can be found in ExpertShare) | Expected: Progress bar indicates all SmartForms are re-generated || Step 13: Right-click on the SmartForm project and select 'Publish SmartForms to Local'. (EA must be closed unless open from CO or MSI install) | Expected: a)Message should be shown in VS output that "All smart forms in the project '***' have been published". A smartform assembly AdvanceSmartFormProject.dll(SmartForm library project name) should be created and copied into your local ExpertShare folder. b) Configuration added to Configuration Manager under path: Technical.Presentation.SmartForms.CustSmokeTestCategory.STAdvancedSF.ControllerFactoryType || Step 14: In Visual Studio, launch the Customization Guide from the Design Studio toolbar (the Aderant toolbar should be exposed in Visual Studio: View > Toolbars > Aderant) | Expected: Admin & Customization Guide is opened. Can navigate around the help, and content is relevant

Title: (Smoke Test) Customization End-to-End 04 - Consume SmartForms in workflow
Steps:
Step 1: Create workflow in Visual Studio (add the workflow to the same solution with your advanced SmartForm). This can be done by opening your project and right clicking on your solution in Solution Explorer,  going to Add -> New Project,  and adding a new Expert Flowchart Workflow project under Visual C# -> Expert ->Expert Flowchart WorkflowName: "WorkflowSmokeTestProject"Click Ok | Expected: Aderant workflow project properties window should be display. Name should be disabled and should match to name you given || Step 2: Category: "CustSmokeTestCategory"Product: "Expert Workflow"Description: "Workflow Smoke Test"Click Ok (Click trust if security warning shown) | Expected: Workflow project should be added to solution || Step 3: Add the following variables to the workflow by clicking the Variables tab on the bottom left hand corner of your Workflow.xamlx file with the Flowchart selected and then click Create Variable a) Client (type: Client(aderant.query.viewmodels.client)), default to: New Client(). b) Name (type: String). c) AcceptTandC (type: Boolean). d) StartDate (type: System.DateTime), set default to: DateTime.Now e) Quantity (type: Int32). f) Balance (type: System.Decimal). g) MoreInfo (type: String)Post 82SP2:h)  PRIORITY_LIST(type: Aderant.Query.ViewModels.PRIORITY_LIST(this custom Data provider is already been created in the ITE WS, need to create this if testing on non-ITE env)) || Step 4: Add a SmartForm Task activity onto the design surface Note : “SmartForm Task activity” option can be found after expanding the Toolbox (Clt +Alt +X ) > Expert > “SmartForm Task activity”. Smartforms can be added by dragging it on Workflow.xamlxNote: Restart VS if you get error while adding activity | Expected: SmartForm Task activity added to   Workflow.xamlx || Step 5: TaskName :"Single SmartForm Test"
Note that sometimes you may not see the UI like above. When that happens, close and re-launch Visual Studio.Click "Edit Security Plan" button and set Task Performers to yourself Click Edit Smartforms button | Expected: Configure Smartforms window should open || Step 6: Select the smart form you created in test 1,2,3 i.e. CustSmokeTestCategory.BasicSmartformCustSmokeTestCategory.STAdvancedSFV3SmartForm(if applicable)Note: If you can't find the smart forms you created, you might need to add Advanced Workflow License rights in Security manager to yourself
(Need to restart VS if encounter below error when load the form: Could not load type 'Aderant.SmartForms.CustSmokeTestCategory.STAdvancedSF20210125ControllerFactory' from assembly 'AdvanceSmartFormProject'.System.TypeLoadException: Could not load type 'Aderant.SmartForms.CustSmokeTestCategory.STAdvancedSF20210125ControllerFactory' from assembly 'AdvanceSmartFormProject'.) | Expected: All the variables should be mapped, and check that 'Show Title' is checked.(variables  can also be manually mapped if needed) || Step 7: Click save || Step 8: Copy the SmartForm task activity and paste below the first one and change the TaskName to "Single SmartForm - Check data" || Step 9: Connect lines from the play button to Single Smartform Test, and then connect the lines from Single Smartform Test to Single Smartform - Check Data.  This makes it so the tasks will execute sequentially. || Step 10: Mark WorkflowSmokeTestProject as startup project and Run workflow in Visual Studio by clicking on run button(Ctrl+F5) on VS Then click on start new in popup Run workflow window. | Expected: First task is created || Step 11: Then open Expert Assistant and double click on new task "Single Smartform Test" from task inbox | Expected: Single Smartform Test task should open || Step 12: Check name control in all SmartForms | Expected: Name control is required, required count on form = "3". Name control has prompt when there is no value, and it is not in focus: "What is your name?" || Step 13: Check tool tips in all  SmartForms | Expected: A tool tip appears when you hover over "Accept T and C" and "Quantity || Step 14: Check Start Date in all  SmartForms | Expected: Should only shown when Accept T and C checked. Date Picker control allows manual entry and use of picker, default date = today's date || Step 15: Check Quantity in all  SmartForms | Expected: Only allow values >= 0 and <= 30 (should get validation icon etc when outside this range). Task cannot be completed if value is outside the allowable range. || Step 16: Check Balance in all  SmartForms | Expected: Only allows 2 decimal places, and a "$"character is prefixed to any value entered after exiting the field || Step 17: Check More Info in all  SmartForms | Expected: More info - Spans BOTH columns. More info - Expands up to 5 rows if more than 3 rows of data is entered (afterwhich a scroll bar appears). More info - SpellCheck and Expansion codes are enabled. Test by F7 (SpellCheck) and "="for expansion codes || Step 18: Check Divider in all  SmartForms | Expected: Separates Client, Office, Display Name, and Department from the other fields above || Step 19: Selecting a Client in all  SmartForms | Expected: Populates the Office, DisplayName, and Department || Step 20: Check Department in all SmartForms | Expected: Data is displayed in format PrimaryText (Code) || Step 21: Check DisplayName in all SmartForms | Expected: Is a read only TextBox control (can highlight and copy text) || Step 22: Check Profit Center in all SmartForms | Expected: Is a searchbox, items in drop down come from the new ad hoc list you created. Check primary, secondary and code values for items. || Step 23: Post 82SP2:Check Priority List | Expected: Is a searchbox, items in drop down can be selected || Step 24: Enter/select values in all fields except 'Name' and press the 'Save & Close' button | Expected: Receive validation error prompt for missing data. Watch EventViewer as the task is saved. There should be ERROR log entries for the advanced SmartForm: 'OnValidate script for Advanced SmartForm' and 'OnDataChanged script for Advanced SmartForm' (there will be an OnDataChanged for each root level data item that was changed). 'ClientChanged' (if the Client was changed) || Step 25: Drag Approval Task to form , Select it, From side Bar, select Approval Choices . Complete and submit. do the same for Budgeting App chart | Expected: Approval Choices  pop up should be opened || Step 26: Re-open the task | Expected: All values that had been entered should still be there In Event Viewer, there should be ERROR log entries for OnLoaded... || Step 27: Check the tab sequence in all SmartForms by pressing tab and checking the order in which elements on the form gain focus | Expected: Default sequence should be down the first column and then wrap back up to the top of the second. || Step 28: Fill in the name field. Press the 'Complete' button and watch DebugViewer as the task is completed || Step 29: When the next task appears, check the data in all SmartForms | Expected: The data from the first task is still visible || Step 30: Complete the task and close the close Run workflow window

Title: (Smoke Test) Customization End-to-End 05 - Create customization package to Import to production environment
Description: Add Priority_List data provider customizationDownload priority_list_cust.gen file from attachmentOpen dbgen.exe from ExpertSource and  tick AdhocClick on Add and select the gen file you downloadedClick on Create and click on Process when readyClose the dbgen when completedOpen Domain Wizard from ExpertShare and select create new look upSelect the table _Priority_List from list and click NextPrimary Text: Priority_Code, Secondary Text: Priority_Description, Default Sort: Priority_Code, click next and FinishOpen Deployment manager and click Apply customization  button from Packages tab and follow the process until customization successfully applied For adding data to data providerINSERT INTO [dbo].[_PRIORITY_LIST]           ([PRIORITY_UNO]           ,[PRIORITY_CODE]           ,[PRIORITY_DESCRIPTION]           ,[EMPL_UNO]           ,[PRIORITY_VALUE])     VALUES           (1,'One','High Priority',100129,1),(2,'Two','Medium Priority',100129,2),(3,'Three','low Priority',100129,3)Register Data provider:Open Design studio and click New Button from ribbon Select Data Provider option from dropdownDisplay Name: Priority_List, Data Provider Type: Priority_ListSave and closeStep 5 Screenshot:
Steps: Step 1: Note: You will need an addition environment where you can import the customization package that you will create in this test, this should be on same build as environment you are running the customization smoke test.Post 82SP2:  Additionally this environment also needs to have Priority_List data provider. See summary for adding Priority_List || Step 2: PRE 80SP3: a) From VisualStudio toolbar, export customization package created in previous testsb) In Deployment Manager, import the same package to the same environment | Expected: -Package is exported - Zip file created and is output to location specified in export window-Package is imported - Check that a new module security resource is created for the workflow in Security Manager under: Framework.Workflow.StartProcess.SmartFormTest/Execute || Step 3: POST 80SP3:a) In DesignStudio, navigate to Expert System -> Packages and create a new packageb) Enter name - 'CustSmokeTestPackage'c) Using the Components window, add all the items you have created in previous tests:- Smartforms (CustSmokeTestCategory.BasicSmartForm, CustSmokeTestCategory.STAdvancedSFV3Smartform (if applicable)- Workflow (WorkflowSmokeTestProject)- Adhoc list("AdhocProfitCenterList" Which was created for Profit center)-  Data Provider(Priority_List)(if applicable) | Expected: -Packaging is available in DesignStudio-New Packages can be created-Customizations you created can be added to the package || Step 4: Export the package(Note: if package export fails then see bug 239569 or 225159 for work around) | Expected: Package is exported - Zip file created and is output to location specified in export window || Step 5: Re-Import the package by clicking on Import Package | Expected: Package is imported - Check that a new module security resource is created for the workflow in Security Manager under: Framework.Workflow.StartProcess.WorkflowSmokeTestProject Screenshot in summary || Step 6: Create a new module policy via Security Manager: Name: WorkflowSmokeTestProjectSecurityPolicyDiscription:  Security Policy for Workflow Smoke Test Project Package: -PRE 80SP3: Select Package 'CustSmokeTestPackage' -Post 80sp3: optional || Step 7: Check the Modules: Module:Framework.Workflow.StartProcess.WorkflowSmokeTestProject Add members Yourself, TTQA1, TTQA2 to it.Save and close | Expected: Module can be checked and members can be added || Step 8: Create a new Action Menu item to start the workflow in EA, which is secured by the resource for the workflow. (80 GA - 80 SP2): Use the Action WizardWorkflow Name: select your workflowSecurity Resource: Module:Framework.Workflow.StartProcess.SmartFormTest/Execute Package= 'CustSmokeTestPackage'  (PRE 80): Add to Configuration Manager Path: Technical>Applications>ActionsName: StartSmokeTestWorkflow Package: 'CustSmokeTestPackage' Value: (Copy from the attachment for this step) (POST 80 SP2): Use Design Studio and create an action under Expert Assistant -> Actions MenuName= WorkflowSmokeTestAction, Code=  WSActionUse 'Workflow' activity and select the workflow you created (WorkflowSmokeTestProject)Click the grey area above the workflow activity, then in properties go to Menu Item > Is Visible > Advanced, enter: IsAuthorized("Module:Framework.Workflow.StartProcess.<Workflow Smoke Test Project name goes here>/Execute")Save and close Action tab | Expected: (PRE 80 SP2) Action is visible in Configuration Manager under: Technical>Applications>Actions (POST 80 SP2) Action is visible in Design Studio under ExpertAssistant -> Actions MenuThe Action is also visible in Expert Assistant Actions menu for only the following users: Yourself, TTQA1, TTQA2 || Step 9: POST 80SP3: In Design studio, add the items you created in step 6: Security Policy & 8: Action to package you craeted "CustSmokeTestPackage" (Package can be found under System>Custom) || Step 10: Export the customization package again || Step 11: Import the customization package into another (production) environment with same build as environment where you created the packagePost 82SP2:  Make sure this environment have Priority_List data provider. See summary for adding Priority_List else import will fail || Step 12: In the production environment, launch EA as a user OTHER THAN: Yourself/TTQA1/TTQA2 | Expected: Action to start smoke test workflow is NOT available in the Actions menu || Step 13: In the production environment, launch EA as either Yourself/TTQA1/TTQA2 | Expected: Action to start smoke test workflow IS available in the Actions menu || Step 14: Start the workflow using the actionNote: if Smart form launched with error see bug attached 222216 | Expected: Ensure that the workflow starts, and that it behaves exactly the same as it did in the customization workstation

Title: Verify APIs are not accessible without HTTPs
Steps: Step 1: Remove API installation from WS if there is already one and go toIIS >> Default web site >> Bindings.. | Expected: Make note of  Https site binding and remove it. || Step 2: Fire up Deployment Manager and validate environment. | Expected: Validation should fail and error message should be received:Https binding is not configured on IIS site: Default web site || Step 3: Add Https binding back to IIS default web site. || Step 4: Install expert with API roles selected. || Step 5: Go to IIS >> Default Web Site >> Expert Local >> Apisand click on Browse *:80 (http) | Expected: User should getHTTP Error 403.4 - Forbidden || Step 6: Click on Browse *:443 (https) | Expected: User should be taken to API home page. || Step 7: Delete Https bindings again in IIS for default website and validate environment in DM. | Expected: Validation should fail and error message should be received:Https binding is not configured on IIS site: Default web site

Title: Verify reference returned in API response
Steps: Step 1: Install expert with API roles selected. | Expected: API should be available to use. || Step 2: Send a GET request via Postman | Expected: Verify response returned. || Step 3: Verify Header of response. | Expected: Aderant-Session-Id should be populated with session ID of the request. || Step 4: Go to System monitor and verify logs are present for session ID. | Expected: Logs should be updated corresponding to request.

Title: Verify user can do a GET request
Steps: Step 1: Install expert with API roles selected. | Expected: APIs should be available to use. || Step 2: Send a GET request | Expected: Sample get:https://vmcrt8220ws301.ap.aderant.com/Expert_Local/Apis/ClientMatter/V1/Clients/1 || Step 3: User should get response data back. | Expected: Response returned should match API schema on home page.

Title: Verify user can do a POST request
Steps: Step 1: Install expert with API roles selected. | Expected: APIs should install and available to use with Https || Step 2: Send a POST request | Expected: Sample:https://vmcrt8220ws301.ap.aderant.com/Expert_Local/Apis/ClientMatter/V1/clients{  "Client": {    "BillingEmployeeId": 15,    "ClientStatusId": "OPEN",    "OpenDate": "2020-06-17",    "ResponsibleEmployeeId": 15,    "Code": "1459",    "FirstName": "Ellen",    "LastName": "Acain",    "CUSTOMINT": "2",    "CUSTOMBOOL": "True"  } } || Step 3: Verify response received. | Expected: User should be able to successfully execute post request. 201 created should be received in response. || Step 4: Verify header tab in postman | Expected: Aderant-Session-Id should have session ID information.Location should have client ID returned for newly created client,Sample Location:https://vmcrt8220ws301.ap.aderant.com/Expert_Local/Apis/ClientMatter/V1/clients/100249

Title: Verify user can do a PATCH request
Steps: Step 1: Install expert with API roles selected. | Expected: APIs should install and be available for use via Https. || Step 2: Create and send a PATCH request and:Update a string columnUpdate a bool columnUpdate an integer column | Expected: User should be successfully able to send the PATCH request and get 200 OK back.Sample PATCH:https://vmcrt8220ws301.ap.aderant.com/Expert_Local/Apis/ClientMatter/V1/clients/100249{  "Client": {  "DisplayName": "Test Industries",    "RateLevelId": 2,    "IsActive": false,    "NarrativeMaximumCharacters": 2  }} || Step 3: Verify patch request data is updated in DB. | Expected: Verification can be done by:1. Query DB2. Send a GET request for same client and check response has updated data.

Title: Verify translated messages in API response
Description: Prerequisite:Go to entity manager and see available languages for user. Follow below if you need to add more languages:https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/TW/Shared Documents/8.2.2 Drafts/Expert Classic/Aderant Expert Classic (8.2 SP2) - Multilingual Option User Guide - December 2019.pdf#search=language messedit Update ISLOCALE to Y for all languages in HBL_LANGUAGE (update HBL_LANGUAGE set IS_LOCALE = 'Y')Double click and open messedit.exe in \Binaries\Expert Classic\ApplicationServer\Bin It will be open in english and generate and save msg file in englishUpdate Mesedit.ini >> Provide yourself access to mesedit via logmaint >> Open messedit.exe in one of the other available languages. By putting below command in Run (French in my case)C:\AderantExpert\Binaries_822\Expert Classic\ApplicationServer\Bin\messedit.exe FR EDITUpdate message by finding error codes. I updated ERR_CLIENT_CODE_FORMAT in expert entity manager group and generate language file. (French in my case)Verify updated msgs in DBCopy newly generated msg file to //Local/Sharedbin.You might need to restart IIS and Postman after this to use translated messagesBelow logic should be tested for translation:only parse valid language codes (languages codes have max of 3 letters)ignore regional codes (format for this is languagecode-regioncode, i.e. EN-US)ignore not supported languages - can find these in sql (Select * from HBL_LANGUAGE)select language that is supported and has the highest quality value
Steps: Step 1: Install expert with API roles selected. | Expected: APIs should be installed and available to use. || Step 2: Follow steps in summary to complete pre requisites if the environment is not setup for message translation. || Step 3: Go to entity manager and change users default language to EN || Step 4: Send a POST client request with " " in code field andCheck header tab and un-check Accept-Language header if it exists.{  "Client": {    "BillingEmployeeId": 15,    "ClientStatusId": "OPEN",    "OpenDate": "2020-06-29",    "ResponsibleEmployeeId": 15,    "Code": "14 61",    "FirstName": "Ellen",    "LastName": "Acain"  }} || Step 5: Verify response received. | Expected: Response should be in English language and should match the message setup in pre requisite.Sample:"Code": "ERR_CLIENT_CODE_FORMAT","Source": null,"Message": "Client code must not contain whitespace characters." || Step 6: Go back to entity manager and set language to another available language. Like FR || Step 7: Send the same POST request again and verify response received. | Expected: 400 response code should be received and message should be translated in French.Sample:"Code": "ERR_CLIENT_CODE_FORMAT","Source": null,"Message": "French: Le code client ne doit pas contenir d'espaces." || Step 8: Login to entity manager and update user default language back to EN.Go back to header section and add Accept-Language header and enter valuefr, en;q=0.5 | Expected: Response should be in French. || Step 9: Accept-Language = fr;q=0.2;*;q=0.6 | Expected: Response should be in english. || Step 10: Accept-Language = ch,fr;q=0.4 | Expected: Response should be in English. Make sure ch does not exists in DB as valid language. || Step 11: Verify language code is not case sensitive.Send a request where you pass language as FR and fr. | Expected: Same response should be returned.

Title: (Smoke Test) Customization End-to-End 03 - Create V3 SmartForm
Steps:
Step 1: Note: currently only works with 822 skip if you testing pre 822 || Step 2: Open Design studio, create new smartform by clicking on New and selecting From || Step 3: Product: Expert SystemSelect Do not attache smartform and click Ok | Expected: New form created with Product already selected || Step 4: Name : V3SmartFormDescription: V3 smart form smoke testProperties(show on right hand Panel enable from Ribbon if not shown): Column= 2 || Step 5: Click on Data Variables button from ribbon to add following variables || Step 6: Name: Name, Data Type: String, Source: Contract Variables.Name: AcceptTandC, Data Type: Boolean, Source: Contract Variables.
Name: StartDate, Data Type: DateTime, Source: Contract Variables.
Name: Quantity, Data Type: Int32, Source: Contract Variables.
Name: Balance, Data Type: Decimal, Source: Contract Variables.
Name: MoreInfo, Data Type: String, Source: Contract Variables.
Name: Client, Data Type: Client(View Model), Source: Contract Variables.Post 82SP2: Name: PriorityList, Data Type: Priority_List (View Model)(this custom Data provider is already been created in the ITE WS, see  summary for how to create this if testing on non-ITE env), Source: Contract Variables.Close after adding all the variables | Expected: All the variables should show in the list || Step 7: Click on Add button from ribbon to add following elements to form | Expected: All elements can be added || Step 8: TextBox: Add following Properties Prompt: "What is your name?" ,IsRequired: 1=1,  Name: Name,  Text:  Select Name from the  list,Label: Name || Step 9: Checkbox : Add following Properties ToolTip(Enable Advance Properties from ribbon if Tooltip not shown in properties tab): "Check this box if you accept the Terms and Conditions",Name/Is Checked: AcceptTandC, Label:  Accept T & C || Step 10: DatePicker: Add following PropertiesIsVisible: AcceptTandC=true,Name:/Date: StartDate, Label: Start Date || Step 11: NumericBox:  Decimal Places=0, Maximum=30, Minimum=0,  Tooltip="How many children do you have?" (freeform text) ,Name/Value/Label: Quantity || Step 12: NumericBox:Decimal Places=2, LeadingText=$,Name/Value: Balance, Label: Bank Balance || Step 13: TextBox(Advanced):Maximum Lines = 5, Minimum Lines=3,  Name/Text: MoreInfo, ExpansionCodesEnabled=True,Label: "More Info" , ColumnSpan = True, SpellChecking=True, || Step 14: SearchBox: Name/Data Provider/SelectedItem/Label=Client || Step 15: DisplayText: DisplayFormat = Standard, Name/DataProvider=Department, 
Value= Client.DepartmentId, Label=Department, || Step 16: TextBox:IsReadOnly='True', Name= DisplayName,Text= Client.DisplayName ,  Label= Display Name || Step 17: SearchBox: Name/Data Provider= Office,  Selected Item = Client.Office,Label=Office, || Step 18: SearchBox:Name= ProfitCenter,  Data provider =           Select AdhocProfitCenterList you already created it in Test 1 ,Selected Item ID= Cilent.ProfitCenterID, Label=Profit Center || Step 19: Post 82SP2: SearchBox:Data Provider: PRIORITY_LIST, Name/Selected Item= PriorityList, Label=Priority List || Step 20: Divider || Step 21: Arrange the order of the Visible Items using the UP/DOWN arrows or dragging element. Order should be: Name, AcceptTandC, StartDate, Quantity, Balance, MoreInfo, Divider, Client, Office, DisplayName, Department, ProfitCenter,PRIORITY_LIST | Expected: Verify all the added element can be seen in SmartApp Preview(can be enabled from ribbon bar) || Step 22: Save and close the form | Expected: smart form should save and can be found in navigation under System.Forms.AllForms

Title: SSRS setting for Existing SSRS deployment
Steps: Step 1: Deploy Expert with ssrs || Step 2: Make sure report is working by opening any report eg. Open General Lager app and open any report from robin | Expected: Report can be viewed || Step 3: Go to your ssrs web portal url eg. http://localhost/Reports/browse/ and Delete any folder under Folders eg. Local || Step 4: In deployment manager click edit and change/enter new  report server folder under report server section. Save changes || Step 5: Deploy ssrs again using Additional options | Expected: SSRS deployed || Step 6: Verify that ssrs report can be viewed Eg. Open General Ladger app and open any report from robin | Expected: Report can be viewed || Step 7: Verify SSRS_REPORT_PATH in RPM_REPORT table is update with new folder path | Expected: SRS_REPORT_PATH in RPM_REPORT table is updates

Title: Deployment Missing Test>A deployment with all the bells and whistles where every configuration is used
Description: As part of regression testing we will want to do at least one deployment which has all the optional features turned on, if possible. At time of writing, this would mean:All roles usedService call compressionSSRSEnhanced SecurityHTTP ProxyAnonymous SMTPCustom connection settings for the databaseFoundtime Application Pool identity user set

Title: Deployment Missing Test>A bare minimum deployment which only specifies mandatory fields
Description: Essentially, with this test you will do a deployment where we only fill in mandatory fields, and so wouldn't include SSRS, enhanced security, service call compression, etc. We want to verify that there are not any fields which we do not specify as being mandatory but actually are.

Title: Deployment Missing Test>Expert FoundTime Application Pool Identity User set with enhanced security off, as going by the tooltip that is the only time that the specified identity user will be used
Description: One of the manifest settings allows you to specify a FoundTime application pool identity user:When this is not specified the FoundTime application pool is called using the credentials of the service account user. As part of this test we wish to verify that firstly, we can deploy if we specify a different user , and secondly that the credentials of this other user is used when accessing the FoundTime application pool.

Title: Deployment Missing Test>SSRS Web Service URL and a Workflow On The Go Web Application URL specified as HTTP/HTTPS with enhanced security
Steps:
Step 1: We can specify a SSRS
Web Service URL and a Workflow On The Go Web Application URL.  We should test those URLs when they are
specified as both HTTP and HTTPS, with and without Enhanced Security turned on
and make sure things behave sensibly.

Title: Deployment Missing Test>HTTP Proxy with both enhanced security and without, with the proxy defined as HTTP or HTTPS.
Deployment Missing Test>Enabling service call compression does result in compression
Description: This test is used to verify that the enable service call compression checkbox is functional, and that the compression actually occurs.  If you use fiddler to capture the request you can see whether the body of the request is in plaintext:
Steps: Step 1: Deploy an environment with service call compression turned on | Expected: The environment can be deployed successfully when service call compression is selected || Step 2: Open an expert application, such as Expert Billing, while running a tool to capture web traffic such as Fiddler | Expected: Application launches,  and traffic is being successfully captured || Step 3: Identify a service call (that is not a query service call), such as ApplicationServices/Billing/BillingService.svc/Custom , and try to use an inspector to read the body of the request | Expected: The request is compressed. If using fiddler, it may explicitly tell you that the request body is encoded if you are using a newer release line. If using an older release line you will not be notified, but if you select the raw request body you will see the text is garbled outside the headers.

Title: Deployment Missing Test>Traffic is routed through the HTTP proxy
Deployment Missing Test>Expert FoundTime Application Pool Identity will use the specified user instead of the default service account user
Description: In deployment manager we are allowed to customize the name for the Expert FoundTime application pool, and the Identity user for the pool.  For this test we want to make sure that firstly, a user can change the name of the application pool, and secondly the user they specified is the user used with this application pool.
Steps: Step 1: Create a fresh deployment that requires you to use the new environment wizard. This can be done by trying to deploy with an entirely new expert database, or clearing the old manifest in deployment managers advanced options.\ || Step 2: Fill out the different fields as you usually would, except for when you specify the expert time connectors. Here you should specify a new name for Expert FoundTime Application Pool, such as ExpertFoundTime_Local2. Additionally, add your own login credentials for the Expert FoundTime Application Identity User and Password fields. || Step 3: Deploy as normal. || Step 4: Open IIS manager, select Application Pools, and find the FoundTime application pool, check the name and identity. || Step 5: Remove the deployment || Step 6: Go to the environment tab in deployment manager, and select edit on the ribbon bar || Step 7: Under Role Arguments, Expert Time Connectors, specify another FoundTime application pool name, and use another users credentials (Such as TTQA4) || Step 8: Deploy once more || Step 9: Check IIS Manager, and that the Application Pool name and Identity user has been updated

Title: Deployment Missing Test>The Workflow On The Go Web Application URL can be changed and still works with a non-default URL
Description: The Workflow On the Go Web Application URL property is used for workflow task notifications which link to Workflow On The Go. Sometimes instead of using a normal local address an organization will wish to use a separate external address thats resolved by DNS. For this test we wish to make sure that we can specify a different URL, and that URL is used on task notifications.
Steps: Step 1: Prior to deploying, change the  Workflow On The go Web Application URL to something other than default, e.g. instead of the end of the URL being OnTheGoWorkflow, make it OnTheGoWorkflow2. Make sure you record the original URL being used for testing purposes | Expected: The new value can be entered into the manifest, and no validation errors occur || Step 2: After making the change, deploy Expert | Expected: Expert deploys successfully with no errors occurring due to the change in the URL || Step 3: Open Expert Assistant, select Settings, Task Inbox, and make sure to set New task emails to on. | Expected: Expert Assistant can be accessed, and you are able to turn on new task emails. || Step 4: Create a new file opening workflow | Expected: Task email should be sent || Step 5: Continue with the workflow, making sure for each task you get an email. On the third task (Conflicts Approval) the email you receive should contain a hyper link to Conflicts Approval | Expected: The hyper link goes to the URL you specified in deployment manager. For the purposes of this test, it does not matter whether the link points to an actual working OTG address. || Step 6: Change the OTG url you specified to the original and correct location

Title: Deployment Missing Test>Can specify a Workflow Database Name that differs from the Expert Database Name, workflows use it, and Workflows can still complete OK
Deployment Missing Test>Can specify a Database Instance name and that instance is used
Deployment Missing Test>Custom connection settings work, like current language
Steps: Step 1: Modify an environment manifest so Custom Connection Settings has the value Current Language=Deutsch | Expected: No validation error occurs and the value is accepted || Step 2: Deploy the environment with the new setting | Expected: No errors occur || Step 3: Once deployed, connect to your database using SQL profiler, and open an application such as billing | Expected: Confirm that SQL profiler is correctly logging events || Step 4: Examine Audit Login events. | Expected: The Audit Login events has the line "set language Deutsch" for entries whose application name are part of Expert, for example Local_FrameworkServices_SystemMonitor  , and Local_FrameworkServices_Query. This line is not expected on Audit Login activities which are not expert, such as withSystem.Activities.DurableInstancing.SqlWorkflowInstanceStore

Title: Design Studio - Create new Action Menu
Steps: Step 1: Open Design Studio || Step 2: Go to Expert Assistant > Menus > Actions Menu || Step 3: Right click Add Menu Item > Create New | Expected: A new window to create new action menu should be opened || Step 4: Enter "UI Automation Test" in Name field || Step 5: Enter "UAT" in Code field || Step 6: Enter "This is for UI Automation Test" in Description field || Step 7: Change the activity to Email in Activity field || Step 8: Enter "ttqa1@aderant.com" in To field || Step 9: Enter "This is for UI Automation Test" in Subject field || Step 10: Enter This is for UI Automation Test in Body field || Step 11: Click Save & Run in the ribbon menu bar | Expected: No error in Log preview window

Title: Handshake QueryService > Customization Testing
Description: This test case examines Handshake QueryService's ability to handle two different customization scenarios.The first scenario, is a customized column/property on an existing entity. Specifically, on Matter.The second scenario, is an entirely new customized entity. Specifically, HSQS_TEST_ENTITY.The tests themselves imitate a WPF desktop application by creating a QueryService proxy, issuing a query against that proxy, and then reading data from the returned results.The above process confirms that the entire Handshake QueryService execution pipeline functions as expected.
Steps: Step 1: Deploy a fresh local environment using a DACPAC database. || Step 2: Using dbgen.exe, located in the ExpertSource\dbgen\ folder, create and process an adhoc UPD containing the two attached GEN files. Step 1: Connect to the machine/database. You may need to create a data source using the 'DataSrc' button. The connection login is the cmsdbo user details.Step 2: Create an adhoc UPD containing the two attached GEN files.Step 3: Run the adhoc UPD. || Step 3: Open DomainWizard from the environment's ExpertShare, using a user with PrivilageLevel = 1 and click 'Begin'.Complete the following steps:Step 1: Extend an existing entity [...]Step 2: Select the Matter table.Step 3: Select the Matter model.Step 4: Click 'Yes' on the dialog that appears, repeat Step 1 from above, and modify Step 2 to instead refer to 'HSQS_TEST_ENTITY'.Step 5: Select the Matter model. || Step 4: Open Deployment Manager, select the deployed environment, navigate to the 'Packages' tab, and click 'Apply Customizations.Note: There will be multiple pop-up dialogs during the Apply Customizations process. Click 'Yes' to all of them. || Step 5: Step 1: Download the attached script.Step 2: Open a new PowerShell ISE window (not standard PowerShell) as an Administrator.Step 3: Modify the <> content and then execute the following PowerShell:Import-Module C:\<Script Path>\CustomizationTest.ps1Invoke-Tests -Silent $false -ExpertSharePath 'C:\ExpertShare'Note: If the ExpertShare is not located at C:\ExpertShare, this will also need to be corrected in the PowerShell. || Step 6: If the previous step completes without errors, the Handshake QueryService Customization Test has passed.Notes:- Any errors during script execution should be raised as bugs.- At the end of this test, the machine environment variable 'ENABLE_LIGHT_WEIGHT_PROXY' will always be enabled with a value of '1'.

Title: German Date Format (DD.MM.YYYY) test for datetime fields
Description: Set up the format and region like so:
Steps: Step 1: Set Country or Region and Region Format to Germany as shown in summary | Expected: Country or Region and Region Format set to to Germany, date format shown on your machine should be dd.mm.yyyy || Step 2: Open Expert Time and Add a new time | Expected: Transaction Date format should be  dd.mm.yyyy || Step 3: In Transaction Date enter any other date in following format: dd.mm.yyyy | Expected: Date should change to the date you entered and format should be dd.mm.yyyy || Step 4: In Transaction Date enter any other date in following format: dd/mm/yyyy | Expected: Date should change to the date you entered and format should be dd.mm.yyyy || Step 5: In Transaction Date enter any other date in following format: dd-mm-yyyy | Expected: Date should change to the date you entered and format should be dd.mm.yyyy || Step 6: In Transaction Date enter "." | Expected: Date should change to today's date and format should be dd.mm.yyyy || Step 7: In Transaction Date enter "," | Expected: Date should change to Yesterday's date and format should be dd.mm.yyyy

Title: Expert Task > Testing Complete and Next button hide if Expert Assistant is not openning
Steps: Step 1: Note: If we test in ITE environments then this set up step can be ignored[Set up] Import File Opening Workflow Definition into your environment, using Deployment Manager or Design Studio. You can use pre-built workflows for the correct released version (\\svnas301\internal\team\ExpertCRT\Environments\Extracted Workflows). 1.  Extract the FileOpeningWorkflow.zip (from ExpertShare/Workflows/Templates). Don't put directly in the ExpertShare. May be OK as a child folder. If not, copy the folder some-where other than ExpertShare. 2. Open the Workflow.FileOpening.Template.sln (C:\ExpertShare\Workflows\Templates\Workflow.FileOpening.Template) in Visual Studio. Make sure you open Visual Studio as Admin (else you will have a SharedBin problem later on). Best to have Visual Studio to always open as Admin (in properties).3. Install Windows Workflow Foundation if prompted.4. [Optional] In the Aderant.Workflow.FileOpening.MatterIntake project, double-click on the Workflow.xaml to load it. Also, double-click on the Workflow.xamlx in the Aderant.Workflow.FileOpening.ContactEdit project to load it.5. If there is a problem with missing dependencies, make sure the reference path is set to C:\Expertshare for the project. If not, set it, then save all.6. Rebuild the solution.7. Launch Design Studio8. Expand Expert System and right-click on Packages > New Package9. Expand Expert Workflow > Workflows > Development and click on Packages in the left main pane. Drag the Contact Edit Workflow and File Opening Workflow into the right main pane to add to the package.10.  Enter a name for the package and save11. Export Package, and check the log that it was exported successfully12. Close Design Studio. 13. Open Deployment Manager then select the Packages tab.14. Import the package into your environment by clicking on the Import Package button in the ribbon bar, and select the package you exported. || Step 2: Navigate to the Expert Assistant Professional URL in the relevant browser. - Using CRT environment  https://vmcrt8220lb.aderant.com/Expert_VMCRT8220ITE/ApplicationServices/WebExpertAssistantProfessional/ https://vmexpmastlb.aderant.com/Expert_VMmasterITE/ApplicationServices/WebExpertAssistantProfessional/ - Or locallyhttp://localhost/Expert_Local/ApplicationServices/WebExpertAssistantProfessional/ || Step 3: Navigate to OTG Workflow > Actions > Open New File || Step 4: Fill required fields in the form || Step 5: Start a new Workflow || Step 6: Navigate to Expert Assistant Professional page || Step 7: Click 'Open Task' in notification message without EA opening | Expected: The 'Complete & Next' button should not appear in the Expert Task || Step 8: Open another task | Expected: Task should open || Step 9: Close the second task you opened | Expected: Task should close || Step 10: Repeat step 3 to 6 || Step 11: Click 'Open Task' in notification message with EA opening | Expected: The 'Complete & Next' button should appear in the Expert Task

Title: Verify an 803 workflow solution can be upgraded and run in latest expert
Steps: Step 1: 1. Open the 803 workflow solution in VS 2017 (or above) - It will fail to load2. In a text editor, open the .csproj of a template workflow that we shipped to you - E.g. C:\AderantExpert\Binaries\ExpertSource\Workflow\Templates\Workflow.Billing.Template.zip\Src\Aderant.Workflow.Billing.EditsApproval\Aderant.Workflow.Billing.EditsApproval.csproj3. Find the lines that look like this and copy them:   <PropertyGroup>    <VisualStudioVersion Condition="'$(VisualStudioVersion)' == ''">14.0</VisualStudioVersion>    <VSToolsPath Condition="'$(VSToolsPath)' == ''">$(MSBuildExtensionsPath32)\Microsoft\VisualStudio\v$(VisualStudioVersion)</VSToolsPath>  </PropertyGroup>  <Import Project="$(VSToolsPath)\WebApplications\Microsoft.WebApplication.targets" Condition="'$(VSToolsPath)' != ''" /> 4. In Visual Studio right-click on the project that has failed to load and click Edit .csproj 5. Find the line that looks like this:   <Import Project="$(MSBuildExtensionsPath32)\Microsoft\VisualStudio\v10.0\WebApplications\Microsoft.WebApplication.targets" />  6. Replace that line with the copied lines from the previous step 7. Save, close and reopen the solution 8. It should load successfully this time

Title: EA Settings- misc settings
Description: This is a test suite where we wish to test the correct functionality of all EA settings not covered by other tests
Steps: Step 1: Open EA,  Click Settings Button | Expected: Right hand side shows three option categories, Expert Assistant, Usability Settings, and Task Inbox || Step 2: Open Expert Assistant category | Expected: Options are visible || Step 3: Test enable/disable availability indicator | Expected: Disable hides the availability indicator on the left, enable makes it visible again. || Step 4: Enter text into Profile box, hit back button, then return to the Expert Assistant category options | Expected: Text can be successfully added, and is remembered after revisiting the option page || Step 5: Test the Start Expert Assistant in System Tray checkbox by first unticking it, then running EA, then come back to these options, tick it again, and restart EA once more | Expected: Setting is remembered, EA starts in sys tray when checkbox is selected, and is a detached window when it is not || Step 6: Go back to settings, and select Usability Settings || Step 7: Tick the "Use numeric keypad Enter as tab" checkbox, then open Expert Billing. Open up one of the advanced search pages, and hit the numpad enter several times. Close billing. | Expected: UI elements should be cycled through , the same as if a user was on the same screen hitting the tab key || Step 8: Return to the Usability Settings page, untick the "Use numeric keypad Enter as tab" tickbox, and tick  "Use numeric keypad decimal point as comma" instead || Step 9: Open billing again, go to an advanced search, and attempt to enter values in different search fields using the numeric keypad decimal point. | Expected: A comma will be entered into the fields instead of a decimal point, so long as it is a field that supports a comma being entered || Step 10: Go to the Task Inbox Settings || Step 11: Tick new task email, and reassign/escalate email || Step 12: Start a new task, reassign task to another user you have access to like TTQA4, log into that user and reassign it back to yourself | Expected: Three emails should be received, and it should show name of the person task is assigned to. || Step 13: Verify the email received. | Expected: Email should have task as attachment. || Step 14: Keep  EA opened and double click on attachment in email. | Expected: Task file should open task inbox in EA. || Step 15: Close  EA | Expected: EA should be closed. || Step 16: Double click on attachment again in the email received. | Expected: Task file should open EA and send you to the task inbox. || Step 17: Reassign one of the WF to yourself and close the EA | Expected: You should get new email with WF assigned to you || Step 18: Double click to open the WF from email | Expected: WF should open with Complete and  Complete and Next buttons shown on UI

Title: Add massive number of custom columns and tables
Prevent insecure deep linking in Expert Launcher
Description: Expert Launcher security changes. (Initial changes for BishopFox pen test). Further refactor and adding of tests will be done laterPrevent applications being launched that do not have valid certificates.If the application doesn't exist in the C:\AderantExpert\Local\Applications folder OR is out of date we will attempt to download it from either the Downloads folder or from the specified back up path. One we have downloaded it to memory we will attempt to validate the certificate. This is done by importing the cert. Any validation errors will be written to the Event viewer. Examples such as "Invalid Certificate. A certificate chain processed, but terminated in a root certificate which is not trusted by the trust provider."Prior to 1) occurring we will check that where the files will be downloaded from is a trusted zone.2) Prevent downloading from locations that are not trusted. If we are online we will confirm that the zone is either Intranet or Trusted otherwise an exception will be thrown.Both of the above conditions can be overridden using escape hatches. They are located under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Aderant\SecurityEscape hatch for 1) LauncherAllowUnsignedExecutables. If this value is not set or set to 0 in the Registry then we will perform certificate validation on the applicationExcape hatch for 2) AllowDownloadFromPotentiallyUntrustedZones. If this value is not set or set to 0 in the Registry then we will perform the check to confirm that the URL is from a trusted locationStep1:
Steps: Step 1: In downloads location (C:\AderantExpert\Local\Services\Downloads) you will need to create a new txt file called ExpertBilling.exe and name the actual Expert Billing with an _. Then you will need to try and launch ExpertBilling that is only a txt file by typing below in the browser: aderantexpert://localhost/Expert_Local/launch/ExpertBilling | Expected: Error about an invalid certificate as shown in summary. || Step 2: You will need to go into your Internet Options which you can get to by clicking windows and typing internet options. Click on Local Intranet --> Sites and uncheck all of the tick boxes so that none are selected. Go into Trusted sites and screenshot the websites in there so that you can add them later and then remove them​Before running the same thing (aderantexpert://localhost/Expert_Local/launch/ExpertBilling) in the URL you will need to go into C:\AderantExpert\Local\Applicationsand check how many items are there and then delete everything in here.​Then run the same thing in the URL (aderantexpert://localhost/Expert_Local/launch/ExpertBilling) | Expected: Verify fewer files are created due to they are only downloaded from trusted sources.

Title: Deploy without GMSA
Steps: Step 1: Open DM, choose to add a new environment. | Expected: Environment wizard should open. || Step 2: Proceed to step 2 of environment setup. | Expected: Instead of seeing "Enhanced Security" checkbox, you should see "Use Group Managed Service Account". || Step 3: Fill out GMSA details and finish environment set up. || Step 4: Go to environment detail page in DM. || Step 5: Under general section, look for "Enhanced Security" checkbox. | Expected: You should not be able to find it. || Step 6: Under general section, look for "Use Group Managed Service Account" checkbox. | Expected: You should be able to find it. || Step 7: Tick "Use Group Managed Service Account" checkbox. | Expected: You should see "Service Account User" and "gMSA Security Group" inputs. || Step 8: Uncheck "Use Group Managed Service Account" checkbox. | Expected: You should see "Service Account User" and "Service Account Password" inputs. || Step 9: Remove current deployment if there is one, then try to deploy both with and without GMSA checked | Expected: Deployments should be successful.

Title: Deploy without HTTPS
Steps: Step 1: Open DM, choose to add a new environment. | Expected: Environment wizard should open. || Step 2: Proceed to step 2 of environment setup. | Expected: You should be able to see "Disable HTTPS" and "Allow SSL Offloading" checkboxes both enabled. || Step 3: Tick "Disable HTTPS". | Expected: You should see a warning asking if you are sure to disable HTTPS. || Step 4: Choose "No" from the warning. | Expected: You should be able to see "Disable HTTPS" and "Allow SSL Offloading" checkboxes both enabled, and "Disable HTTPS" is still unchecked. || Step 5: Repeat step2 and choose "Yes" this time. | Expected: "Disable HTTPS" is checked and "Allow SSL Offloading" will grey out. || Step 6: Uncheck "Disable HTTPS". | Expected: "Disable HTTPS" is unchecked and "Allow SSL Offloading" becomes enabled again. || Step 7: Tick "Allow SSL Offloading". | Expected: "Allow SSL Offloading" is checked and "Disable HTTPS" will grey out. || Step 8: Fill out other environment details and finish setup. || Step 9: Go to environment detail page in DM and edit the newly created environment. || Step 10: Repeat step 3-7. || Step 11: Do a deployment with HTTPS disabled and another one which allows SSL offloading. | Expected: Deployments should be successful.

Title: Set manifest attributes correctly on upgrade of older manifest
Steps: Step 1: Deploy EX0006 a non-enhanced security environment with DM06. || Step 2: Remove the deployment and upgrade DM to the current build. || Step 3: Open the previous environment (Do not edit it). || Step 4: The Disable HTTPS checkbox should be checked. || Step 5: Deploy the environment and check that the workflow URLs in FWM_Environment table are set to HTTP:// || Step 6: Start a workflow and make sure it completes. || Step 7: Remove the environment and uncheck Disable HTTPs and redeploy. || Step 8: Check that the workflow URLs in FWM_Environment table are set to HTTPS:// || Step 9: Start a workflow and make sure it completes.

Title: Deploy with/without integrated security
Steps: Step 1: Open DM, choose to add a new environment. | Expected: Environment wizard should open. || Step 2: Proceed to step 2 of environment setup. || Step 3: Check "SSRS" section. | Expected: "Use integrated Security for SSRS" is unchecked by default. There are 4 input fields below it "SSRS Web Service URL", "Report Server Folder", "SSRS Username" and "SSRS Password". || Step 4: Tick "Use integrated Security for SSRS". | Expected: "SSRS Username" and "SSRS Password" should be hidden. || Step 5: Fill out  environment details and proceed to step 5 of environment setup. | Expected: "Use integrated Security for Database Connection" is unchecked by default. There are 2 compulsory input fields below it "Database Owner Username" and "Database Owner Password". || Step 6: Tick "Use integrated Security for Database Connection". | Expected: "Database Owner Username" and "Database Owner Password" should grey out. || Step 7: Add the environment and go to environment details page in DM. || Step 8: Toggle "Use integrated Security for SSRS" and "Use integrated Security for Database Connection". | Expected: Inputs should show or grey out as expected result from step 3 - 6. || Step 9: Do deployments of different combinations with/without integrated security of SSRS and database connection. | Expected: Deployments should be successful.

Title: Login with Valid credentials
Steps: Step 1: Open Any application || Step 2: In Login popup up, Enter valid AD credentials | Expected: Verify App  launch and can be used || Step 3: Close /Exit Application || Step 4: Open same application again | Expected: App launch without Login Popup up (No need to enter credentials) || Step 5: Open second different application and verify it launch without entering credentials | Expected: App launch without Login Popup up (No need to enter credentials) || Step 6: Close Open app again  after session expired and check user need to relogin | Expected: Login windows popup || Step 7: Login with valid credentials | Expected: App launch with no issues || Step 8: Logout of the app | Expected: Logout successful of the application

Title: Login with invalid credentials
Steps: Step 1: Open Application || Step 2: In Login popup up, Enter invalid AD credentials   (Wrong username email) | Expected: Error message is displayed || Step 3: In Login popup up, Enter invalid AD credentials   (Valid AD username with Wrong password) | Expected: Error message is displayed || Step 4: In Login popup up, Enter invalid AD credentials   (Enter username instead of email address) | Expected: Error message is displayed || Step 5: In Login popup up, Enter user which doesn't exist in AD credentials   (Enter username instead of email) | Expected: Error message is displayed

Title: Valid Login - multiple applications
Steps: Step 1: Open 2 applications as the same time || Step 2: When login windows popup, enter valid credentials | Expected: Verify both app can be used with a second login || Step 3: Logout from applications || Step 4: Open  first application When login window popup dont  enter credentials || Step 5: Open second app | Expected: User  cannot progress without entering credentials || Step 6: Enter valid credentials in Login window | Expected: Both applications are launched and can be used || Step 7: Logout from one application | Expected: On other App  popup appears with option to login or close the app || Step 8: Select logout/close from all open applications | Expected: All applications are close, session is expired || Step 9: Open  first application  , Verify you cannot progress without entering credentials  , Wait for 2-3 minutes and Enter valid credentials in Login window | Expected: Verify both applications are launched and can be used . If application cannot be launch due to timeout, should be a proper error message

Title: Login with different Users
Steps: Step 1: Launch first App and Login with User A | Expected: Token Identity is added for USerA || Step 2: Logout | Expected: Token Identity is removed for USerA || Step 3: Launch second App and login with User B (Different permission) | Expected: Token Identity is added for USerA || Step 4: Verify permissions are as expected for that role | Expected: Use can use app with UserB's permissions

Title: Offline scenarios
Steps: Step 1: Turn off internet connection  and launch Applications | Expected: Should get error that application could not be launched offline with no Identitiy token || Step 2: Enable Internet connection, launch application and login. Do few actions in app, then disable internet connection | Expected: Should be able to continue use application as long no internet connection needed, otherwise show error || Step 3: Enable Internet connection, launch application and login. Do few actions in app, then disable internet connection  and logout || Step 4: Enable Internet connection, launch Time application and login. Change to offline mode. then disable internet connection | Expected: Time app should continue work with no issues while offline

Title: Cancel login
Steps: Step 1: Pre condition - No Token cached || Step 2: Launch app, when login page popup , select cancel | Expected: Login popup should be closed. No access to app || Step 3: Launch app, when login page is popup, close popup | Expected: Login popup should be closed. No access to app || Step 4: Launch app, when login page is popup, select back button | Expected: Login popup should be closed. No access to app

Title: Importing lawpay AR cash receipt entry flatfile via generic importer
Description: This is a first pass test for integrating lawpay with Expert. At this point of time the strategy we will be taking is to generate a flatfile from data extracted from lawpay APIs to be used by generic importer to bring this data into Expert. Prior to running through this test some setup will be required for Generic Importer and Lawpay. Generic Importer.docx describes some steps for setting up Generic Importer, and LawPay-GI-V1-20220222.zip contains a package with instructions for setting up a lawpay task in GI.Screenshots for Steps:Step 2: Step 3:Step 4:Step 5:  Steps 6 & 7: Step 8: Step 9:Step 10:Step 11:Step 12:  Step 13:
Steps: Step 1: Confirm environment is setup for the test | Expected: Generic importer can run and has law pay tasks, configurations are setup under Technical -> Integrations -> Lawpay -> Test, design studio has an activity called LawPay Integration - fetch payments || Step 2: Open Design Studio, expand system, then jobs, right click jobs and add a new job. Give the job a suitable name and code, such as Law Pay Fetch Payments and LP001. Set the activity to Lawpay Integration - fetch payments. In the properties on the right hand side, set test mode to the value True.  Save the job. | Expected: The activity type exists, and the new job can be saved successfully || Step 3: Run the newly created job by clicking Save and Run in the ribbon | Expected: The job runs successfully || Step 4: Open generic importer,  select file, load configuration, and then pick the configuration file for LawPay. The location where the file will be written to is defined by the OutputDirectory configuration in Technical->Integrations ->Lawpay ->Test. | Expected: Task queue window appears || Step 5: In the task queue window, hit add, to add a new task. | Expected: Task specification window appears || Step 6: Click the three dots  next to task | Expected: Table lookup for task definitions windows appears || Step 7: Find the LAWPAYCR task code in the list of task definitions, select it, and hit OK | Expected: Returns to task specification window || Step 8: With the input radio button selected,  double click the word INPUT in the data grid | Expected: Input RecordSource window appears || Step 9: With the Entity RecordSource selected, hit the three dots next to the file path, and select the flat file. Hit open | Expected: Returns to task specification window || Step 10: In the task specification window, select the  Import radio button, then enter in the database details. Hit OK. | Expected: Return to the task queue window || Step 11: With your new task selected in the task queue window, select Go | Expected: Task will run. If you have ran this same flat file before, you might be notified and be asked if you wish to reprocess it. Hit OK if it does. || Step 12: Open app shell. On the left hand side tree, navigate through Accounts Receivable, then Receipts, then double click Cash Receipt Entry. | Expected: A cash receipt window session will open || Step 13: Click the three dots next to session ID | Expected: Table Lookup of Cash Receipt Session IDs will pop up || Step 14: Perform a search to find your cash receipt entry- most convenient way to do so is to sort by descending, and perform a search with the session or created columns selected, as the top entry should then be the most recent. Once found, double click it. | Expected: Returns to the cash receipt window session with the details of your cash receipt populating the window || Step 15: Double click the specific receipt in the grid | Expected: Cash Receipt Entry window pops up, with additional detail about the cash receipt. Fields should match what comes out of the flatfile.

Title: Email Delivery-  Expert Account Payable
Steps: Step 1: in ExpertAccountsPayable - Send Email using  Accounts Payable > Payments/Payment Schedules > Select a payment > Email Remittance Advices in the ribbon panel | Expected: Email is sent using Basic Auth, Verify Email has received correctly || Step 2: in ExpertAccountsPayable - Setup valid email addresses in Admin > Image Recognition > Accounts Payable > Image Sources and verify Image recognition feature can read it correctly | Expected: Email is sent using Basic Auth, Verify Email has received correctly || Step 3: Admin- Setup invalid email Address in Expert Admin-AP - Email for Remittance Advice Sender  feature | Expected: Setup is saved correctly || Step 4: in ExpertAccountsPayable - Send invalid Email using  Accounts Payable > Payments/Payment Schedules > Select a payment > Email Remittance Advices in the ribbon panel | Expected: Email is not sent, Verify Email has received correctly || Step 5: Admin- Setup email Address with no access in Expert Admin-AP (Exchange setting) - Email for Remittance Advice Sender  feature | Expected: Setup is saved correctly || Step 6: in ExpertAccountsPayable - Send Email using  Accounts Payable > Payments/Payment Schedules > Select a payment > Email Remittance Advices in the ribbon panel | Expected: Email is not sent, Verify Email has received correctly || Step 7: in ExpertAccountsPayable - Send Email using  Accounts Payable > Payments/Payment Schedules > Select a payment > Email Remittance Advices in the ribbon panel | Expected: Email is not sent, Verify Email has received correctly

Title: Email Delivery - Expert Billing
Steps: Step 1: Add valid email address in Admin > System > Email > Billing and enable feature | Expected: Basic Auth is enabled,  Email is setup correctly, || Step 2: Select  PreBill from Prebill list, and Right click-> Prepare Draft Bill, and select output file as Email. Fill with valid email details and select prepare drft | Expected: Draft Prebill is ready, email is sent  correctly. To,CC, has correct values. Email body has correct text, Attachments are added if applicable. || Step 3: Select  PreBill from Prebill list, and Right click-> Prebill, and select output file as Email. Fill with valid email details and select prepare | Expected: PreBill is ready,  email is sent correctly. To,CC, has correct values. The email body has correct text, Attachments are added if applicable. || Step 4: Select  PreBill from Prebill list, and Right click-> bill, and select output file as Email. Fill with valid email details and select prepare | Expected: Bill is ready,  email is sent correctly. To,CC, has correct values. Email body has correct text, Attachments are added if applicable. || Step 5: Select  PreBill from Prebill list, and Right click-> Draft pre bill Prepare, and select output file as Email. Fill with valid email details and select prepare | Expected: Draft Pre Bill is ready,  email is sent correctly. To,CC, has correct values. The email body has correct text, Attachments are added if applicable. || Step 6: Test the above scenarios with Only CC property populated for email | Expected: Draft Pre Bill is ready,  email is sent correctly. CC property has the correct value in email. The email body has correct text, Attachments are added if applicable. || Step 7: Test the above scenarios with Only to property populated for email | Expected: Draft Pre Bill is ready,  email is sent correctly.  TO property has correct value in email. The email body has correct text, Attachments are added if applicable. || Step 8: Test the above scenarios with for Bill with attachments | Expected: Draft Pre Bill is ready,  email is sent correctly. To,CC, has correct values. The email body has correct text, Attachments are added || Step 9: Run Ebill Status update job from Expert Scheduler | Expected: A scheduled job reads email messages from a set of Exchange mailboxes and updates bill information || Step 10: Setup Image recognition , and verify service reads email messages and attachments from an Exchange inbox for processing by the invoice recognition module. Once finished it can move or delete the message | Expected: Image recognition service can connect to inbox and process emails with no issues
