Title: Client Credential Flow OID mapping in Deployment Manager
Steps: Step 1: Setup new OAuth deployment with  OID mapping in Deployment Manager . Complete deployment | Expected: Deployment successful. Sanity test pass || Step 2: Upgrade DM with existing OAuth deployment | Expected: Verify OID is populated correctly in DM

Title: Grant Proxy to work groups
Steps:
Step 1: Launch Security Manager 
Go to users
Select a work Group
Select Proxy
Add user to the group
Select Ok | Expected: User is added to the  proxy work group. When selecting the same user permission (Users->UserA) you can verify group is added || Step 2: Launch Security Manager Go to users
Select a work Group
Select Proxy
Remove user to the group
Select Ok | Expected: User is removed from Proxy work group . When selecting the same user permission (Users->UserA) you can verify group is removed || Step 3: Launch Security Manager 
Go to users
Select a specific user
Select Proxy
Add work group  to the user's permissions
Select Ok | Expected: Proxy work group is added to user  . When selecting the same work group permission (Users->workGroup) you can verify user is added || Step 4: Launch Security Manager Go to users
Select a specific user
Select Proxy
removed work group  to the users permissions
Select Ok | Expected: Proxy work group is removed from user permission  . When selecting the same work group permission (Users->workGroup) you can verify user is removed || Step 5: Pre condition - Specific user is added to Proxy work group and TTQA2 is added to specific work group 

Launch Expert Assistant with TTQA2
verify you can Proxy as same specific user that is same work group | Expected: Proxy permission is enabled to users for users from same work group . Able to use EA actions and start workflows as a proxy user from work group || Step 6: Using Actions as a user from proxy work group || Step 7: Pre condition - Specific user is added to Proxy work group and TTQA2 is added to the specific work group . Then specific user is removed from work group.

Launch Expert Assistant with TTQA2
verify you can no longer  Proxy as same specific user once user is removed from the group | Expected: Proxy permission is disabled to users for users from same work group .

Title: Expert Launcher - Offline scenarios
Steps: Step 1: Make sure you have a remote deployment available that is NOT your current machine. You will need to have a way to disconnect yourself from the network - e.g. pulling out the ethernet cable in the office, or disconnecting from your VPN if working from home || Step 2: Create a launcher link to it for launching an expert application (e.g. aderantexpert://VMINF302.aderant.com/expert_jacobdacpac/launch/ExpertBilling ) || Step 3: Run the launcher link, and it will place files for the application in your local applications folder. C:\AderantExpert<EnvironmentName>\Applications | Expected: Apps launch successfully || Step 4: Confirm if you run the .exe file directly there it opens fine. Close the application || Step 5: Go offline (disable vpn/wifi/pull ethernet cable). Run the launcher link for your application | Expected: The application does not immediately error, and instead it does after a minute and a half with an error message such as "unable to download configuration files" || Step 6: Repeat step 5, but instead run the application .exe directly from your applications | Expected: Same as above

Title: EA - ExpertAssistant will sit in a disconnected state in systray if the user is offline, and can reconnect when the user goes online
Steps: Step 1: Make sure you have a remote deployment available that is NOT your current machine. You will need to have a way to disconnect yourself from the environment- e.g. pulling out the ethernet cable in the office,  disconnecting from your VPN if working from home || Step 2: If you haven't done so already, install Expert Assistant using the ExpertAssistantPerMachine.msi | Expected: ExpertAssistant.exe should now exist in C:\AderantExpert\<EnvironmentName>\Applications || Step 3: Run ExpertAssistant.exe | Expected: ExpertAssistant should be visible in the systray on the bottom right hand of the screen. If it instead popped up with the detached window, go to settings and make sure that EA is set to run from systray || Step 4: Make sure you can no longer connect to the remote environment using your preferred method (turning off vpn, wifi etc) || Step 5: Run ExpertAssistant.exe again | Expected: After a minute and a half of trying to connect, ExpertAssistant should become visible in the systray on the bottom right hand of the screen in a disconnected state || Step 6: Restore your connection so that you can connect to the remote environment again. Click on the disconnected systray icon for Expert Assistant | Expected: Expert Assistant should connect and the EA window should open

Title: Email delivery - SMTP - Workflow
Steps: Step 1: In Expert Admin: System->Email, setup SMTP for Default Email sender | Expected: SMTP is setup as default Email delivery option || Step 2: In SMTP section  enter smtp.dev.ap.aderant.com , port 25 and Save settings . Restart services to apply changes. | Expected: SMTP is configured for default email || Step 3: Use workflow task, to assign tasks to your user/emails. Verify email received correctly by SMTP, | Expected: System emails received correctly by SMTP || Step 4: Use scheduler, and run a job that will result with failure | Expected: System emails received correctly   by SMTP || Step 5: Enable Email summary activity and view it once sent | Expected: Emails received correctly   by SMTP

Title: Email Delivery - Exchange - Workflow
Steps: Step 1: In expert Admin: System->Emails, Setup Exchange as the default delivery option | Expected: Exchange is setup as default Email delivery option || Step 2: In Exchange section,  enter 0365 Default Exchange Credentials. and also make sure system email is configured as well. Select save change and restart expert services to apply changes     . Note- Exchange credentials should have the correct permission setting by IT/Helpdesk in order to be configured correctkt | Expected: Exchange is setup for defauly email delivery || Step 3: Use scheduler, and run a job that will result with failure | Expected: System emails received correctly   by exchange setup || Step 4: Enable Email summary activity and view it once sent | Expected: Email summary activity is received with no issues || Step 5: Use workflow task, to assign tasks to your user/emails. Verify email received correctly by exchange credentials, | Expected: System emails received correctly by exchange setup || Step 6: Select workflow task and approve /reject task, | Expected: System email is sent with task status by exchange setup || Step 7: In Expert Admin: System->Email, setup Default Email sender  as NONE. Restart expert services to apply changes | Expected: Emails are now should be disabled

Title: Test for Bugs 278298 and 278387- Application Crashes if User Has Too Many Proxies
Steps: Step 1: Make sure you have access to two separate test users who are P0, have rights to run the Expert Assistant, Time, Expenses, Billing, and EA Pro applications, and which do NOT have the proxy all users permission policies for those applications || Step 2: Go into security manager, then the users tab, search for ONE of your test users,  click on the  Proxy button,  and then go through and add at LEAST 100 users that the test user can proxy as.  Note that the bug will not trigger with any less than that. Click OK when you are done || Step 3: Open Expert Assistant | Expected: Application opens without crashing || Step 4: Select the employee data provider for proxying, and click browse all. Select a user on the list and confirm that it proxies as them | Expected: The list should contain the full list of users being proxied after clicking browse all, and should not be capped.  You can also successfully proxy as other users || Step 5: Repeat steps 3 and 4 with Time, Expenses, Billing, and EA Pro | Expected: All applications open, display the full list of proxy users, and you can successfully proxy as them || Step 6: Go back to security manager, go to your test user, and then click the Copy button.  In the Copy To field, select a work group that the other test user belongs to- e.g. QA Security Group | Expected: The proxy permissions from the test user should be copied over to the group || Step 7: Repeat steps 3-5, but open the applications using  the second test user | Expected: The applications should open, and they should be able to see and access all the proxy permissions they inherited from the group permissions

Title: SMPT Email Delivery  failures
Steps: Step 1: In Expert Admin: System->Email, setup SMTP for Default Email sender | Expected: SMTP is setup as default Email delivery option || Step 2: In SMTP section  enter invalid  Host address.Restart services to apply changes.  Try to send Email (By workflow/Scheduler) and verify error message | Expected: Error message is showing a user friendly error in log that explain the setup issue || Step 3: In SMTP section  enter invalid port Number and Save settings . Restart services to apply changes.  Try to send Email (By workflow/Scheduler) and verify error message | Expected: Error message is showing a user friendly error in log that explain the setup issue || Step 4: In SMTP section  enter invalid email for System Email And/OR Operation Email  . Restart services to apply changes.  Try to send Email (By workflow/Scheduler) and verify error message | Expected: Error message is showing a user friendly error in log that explain the setup issue

Title: Exchange Email delivery option failures
Steps: Step 1: In expert Admin: System->Emails, Setup Exchange as the default delivery option | Expected: Exchange is setup as default Email delivery option || Step 2: In Exchange section,  tick Office365 checkbox and  enter invalid Default Exchange Credentials. Select save change and restart expert services to apply changes | Expected: Should log error in log that explains setup issue || Step 3: In Exchange section, Enter invalid URI . Select save change and restart expert services to apply changes | Expected: Should log error in log that explains setup issue || Step 4: In Exchange section,  enter valid  0365 Default Exchange Credentials. but leave system email blank or invalid system email. Select save change and restart expert services to apply changes     . Note- Exchange credentials should have the correct permission setting by IT/Helpdesk in order to be configured correctkt | Expected: Should log error in log that explains setup issue

Title: Deployment with connector only mode
Steps: Step 1: In addition to regular deployment setup with Connector setup, add to  C:\AderantExpert\Install\DeploymentManager.exe.config the following keys:     <add key=""AllowDatabaseAlternateName"" value=""true""/>    <add key=""AllowApplicationServerOnlyDeploy"" value=""true""/> | Expected: Configuration file is updated || Step 2: Complete deployment | Expected: Deployment Completed successfully || Step 3: Select Remove Deployment | Expected: All files removed from Expert Share except :  instance.config & System Map

Title: Workflows- verify public data values in WFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARY
Steps:
Step 1: Pre condition - Workflow running on environment .                                                                 Run the following script: select
*
from WFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARY s
inner join WFM_ACTIVITY_EVENT_TRACK e on s.WORKFLOWINSTANCEID=e.WORKFLOWINSTANCEID and e.CUSTOMTRACKRECORDNAME='WorkflowReferencesTrackingRecord'
where
s.PUBLICDATAVALUE1 is null and
s.PUBLICDATAVALUE2 is null and
s.PUBLICDATAVALUE3 is null and
s.PUBLICDATAVALUE4 is null | Expected: No results should be found.  Public data values in  WFM_WORKFLOW_SUMMARY should not be null.

Title: (Sanity) EA Pro web
Steps: Step 1: Verify  web login is working | Expected: Login is successfull || Step 2: Verify Logout leads to correct page | Expected: Logout is successfull || Step 3: Verify all web pages opens without errors Including Case Admin | Expected: No errors opening pages || Step 4: Upload document, and Verify  'View In browser' Document Preview works | Expected: No errors opening doucment oreview || Step 5: Run following query https://<yourMachineName>/Expert_Local/FrameworkServices/WebQuery/WebQueryService.svc/ExtensionPoints?$filter=XX | Expected: Should not return verbose stack trace attached to message

Title: Expert Launcher - Launch Apps from Expert Assistant
Steps: Step 1: Precondition - verify Application folder of the enviroment is empty | Expected: Folder is empty || Step 2: Launch Expert Assistant | Expected: Expert Assistant has launched || Step 3: Open All expert App from EA Actions | Expected: Each app launched with no issues || Step 4: Setup Proxy on   Expert Assistant | Expected: Proxy user is setup || Step 5: Submit workflows with  Proxy user | Expected: Workflows launched as proxy user || Step 6: Launch App from EA Actions as proxy | Expected: App launched as proxy user setup with no issues

Title: Expert Launcher - Launch Tasks from EA Pro for user & Proxy users
Steps: Step 1: Go to EA Pro dashboard (Make sure to clear browser cache first) | Expected: EA pro dashboard is displayed || Step 2: Select Task section, and launch different tasks (BIlling, AP, Files Opening etc ) | Expected: For each task, App should display launcher popup and open the task with no issues || Step 3: Go to EA Pro Datshboard (Make sure to clear browser cache first) | Expected: EA pro dashboard is displayed || Step 4: Proxy as other user who has proxy permission (Setup in Security Manager App ) | Expected: Dashbnoard is displayed as a proxy user || Step 5: Select Task section, and launch different tasks (BIlling, AP, Files Opening etc ) | Expected: For each task, App should display launcher popup and open the task with no issues || Step 6: Go to EA Pro Datshboard   and remove Proxy setting , (Make sure to clear browser cache first) | Expected: EA pro dashboard is displayed || Step 7: Setup Proxy from Expert Assistant (Manage Proxy) | Expected: Proxy is setup || Step 8: Login to EAPro as proxy user ,  Select Task section, and launch different tasks (BIlling, AP, Files Opening etc ) | Expected: For each task, App should display launcher popup and open the task with no issues

Title: Expert Launcher with invalid HTTP certificate
Steps: Step 1: Setup invalid HTTP certificate and Launch Apps using launcher | Expected: Should get non-authorised error || Step 2: Use App with valid cerificate and while Apps open change to invalid certificate | Expected: Should get non-authorised error || Step 3: Setup invalid HTTP certificate , add thumbprint to registry : Computer\HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\ADERANT\Security\LauncherTrustedCertificateThumbprintList and Launch Apps using launcher | Expected: Whitelisted certificate should be trustable

Title: EA- Use launcher to launch APPs from Actions
Steps: Step 1: Open ExpertAdmin and check Configuration : Technical->Application->Actions: UseLauncherForEAActions is set to true (default) | Expected: Setting set to true || Step 2: While UseLauncherForEAActions is set to true, Launch all Apps from EA Actions and verify in logs that it use launcher for launching Apps | Expected: All Apps launch with no issues using launcher || Step 3: While UseLauncherForEAActions is set to true, Launch all Apps from EA Detached Actions and verify in logs that it use launcher for launching Apps | Expected: All Apps launch with no issues using launcher || Step 4: While UseLauncherForEAActions is set to true, Launch all Apps from EA MSI Actions and verify in logs that it use launcher for launching Apps | Expected: All Apps launch with no issues using launcher || Step 5: While UseLauncherForEAActions is set to false, Launch all Apps from EA Actions and verify in logs that it DOES NOT use launcher for launching Apps | Expected: All Apps launch with no issues without launcher || Step 6: While UseLauncherForEAActions is set to true, Launch all Apps from EA  Actions with proxy set and verify in logs that it use launcher for launching Apps | Expected: All Apps launch with no issues using launcher || Step 7: While UseLauncherForEAActions is set to false, Launch all Apps from EA Actions when proxy set and verify in logs that it DOES NOT use launcher for launching Apps | Expected: All Apps launch with no issues without launcher

Title: Launcher Updating Application folder files with newer version
Steps: Step 1: Uninstall Launcher and clear out the Applications folder.Install Launcher from the MSI.From EA Pro, launch Billing. | Expected: It should download everything and launch successfully. The FileHashCache.xml should be created with all the items that Billing downloaded. || Step 2: Close Billing and launch GL. | Expected: It should download a few more things and launch successfully. FileHashCache.xml should be updated to include the new things that were downloaded. || Step 3: Now import a package containing an updated DLL (we will need to make one of these) or Deploy newer expert binaries || Step 4: Launch Billing once more. It should download the updated DLL and should update FileHashCache.xml with a new hash value for that file. | Expected: It should download the updated DLL and should update FileHashCache.xml with a new hash value for that file.

Title: Service startup robustness
Steps: Step 1: Stop Aderant services manually in services managerStop SQL serviceStart each one of Aderant service and Verify Connection failed exception is logged | Expected: Connection failed exception is logged || Step 2: Start SQl serviceRefresh Service Manager and view Aderant services status | Expected: within 2 minutes services are restarted and recovered

Title: Privilege_Level & Admin group permission setup for system user
Steps: Step 1: Setup up service account  Privilege_Level to zero in the HBM_PERSNL table , and select Validate/Deploy | Expected: Privilege_Level will be set to 1 once validate steps complete || Step 2: Setup up service account  Privilege_Level to 1 in the HBM_PERSNL table , and select Validate/Deploy | Expected: Validate pass || Step 3: in Non GMSA DM config: Remove service account  from Admin Group, and select Validate/Deploy | Expected: Service account  from Admin Group once validate steps complete on local deployment, but will not be added on App server || Step 4: in GMSA DM config: Remove service account  from Admin Group, and select Validate/Deploy | Expected: Service account  from Admin Group once validate steps complete || Step 5: Add service account  to Admin Group, and select Validate/Deploy | Expected: Validate step pass || Step 6: Remove DBO setup o DB (or test on DB with no setup), and try to deploy | Expected: Validation message displayed on missing dbo configuration setup

Title: Custom connection settings
Steps: Step 1: in Deployment Manager , Add custom connection string : Encrypt=True;TrustServerCertificate=True and deploy | Expected: If you add custom connection settings in Deployment Manager for an environment they are also added to the ExpertWorkflowConnection connection string in the root web.config.

Title: Encryption Key Generator
Steps: Step 1: Using Regedit, Export the following registries from the environment and delete the  encryption keys: Computer\HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Aderant\Development\AENC2 , Computer\HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Aderant\Security\AENC2 | Expected: No encryption key in registry || Step 2: Open the Deployment Manager App | Expected: Encryption Key Generator window is displayed with no errors || Step 3: Select Cancel button | Expected: Encryption Key Generator window and DM are closed || Step 4: Open the Deployment Manager App  Generate new Encryption Key | Expected: New Key is created and added to Registry, DM app is launched || Step 5: Delete the  encryption keys: Computer\HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Aderant\Development\AENC2 , Computer\HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Aderant\Security\AENC2 | Expected: No encryption key in registry || Step 6: Open the Deployment Manager App and import previous exported keys | Expected: DM open successfully

Title: Display a warning dialog when opening an environment with sub-optimal security settings
Steps: Step 1: Open DM and select environment (or setup ) not integrated security  configuration | Expected: When an environment is selected/switched it shows a dialog with warning that summarizes what security settings should be improved || Step 2: Open DM and select environment (or setup ) with HTTP  configuration | Expected: When an environment is selected/switched it shows a dialog with warning that summarizes what security settings should be improved || Step 3: Open DM and select environment (or setup ) with non gMSA configuration | Expected: When an environment is selected/switched it shows a dialog with warning that summarizes what security settings should be improved || Step 4: Select Edit and fix one of the security configuration issues from previous step and select Accept button | Expected: Warning message should display  remaining security issues that recommended to fix

Title: Design Studio - Evaluate SqlQuery objects during Runtime
Steps: Step 1: Open Design Studio, Select Expert App from left Navigation (f.e. Expert Entity Manager) , Add a rule with valid query that has fixed variable for example :  Matter.ID = 45. Select first Save, Then select Save and Run | Expected: Both actions should pass with no issue || Step 2: Open Design Studio, Select Expert App from left Navigation (f.e. Expert Entity Manager) , Add a rule with invalid query that has fake object for example :  Matter.ID = [Client.FakeObject]. Select first Save, Then select Save and Run | Expected: Save should pass since format is correct, but Run should display error on runtime || Step 3: Open Design Studio, Select Expert App from left Navigation (f.e. Expert Entity Manager) , Add a rule with valid query that has valid object for example :  Matter.ID = [Client.ID]. Select first Save, Then select Save and Run | Expected: Both actions should pass with no issue || Step 4: Open Design Studio, Select Expert App from left Navigation (f.e. Expert Entity Manager) , Add a rule with a string parameter that is concluded from sql query that conclude from banned or reserved word. Select first Save, Then select Save and Run | Expected: Save should pass since format is correct, but Run should display error on runtime || Step 5: Open Design Studio, Select Expert App from left Navigation (f.e. Expert Entity Manager) , Add a rule with a string parameter that is concluded from a valid sql query . Select first Save, Then select Save and Run | Expected: Both actions should pass with no issue

Title: Security Manager- File System - Allow ACLs on arbitrary locations
Steps: Step 1: Open Expert Admin, Go to  System ->Environment Settings and Enable File Security feature. Save changes | Expected: File Security feature will be enable. Note- The script to update the new File Security settings in Admin will run only once user goes to the Environment Settings on the Home tab || Step 2: Go to Config tab, Open  Technical->Security, and verify File security is enabled and has a true value. Note- Since there is currently no Auto refresh when changing tabs in Expert Admin, you might need to refresh the Node Tree before you see the Security Node | Expected: EnableFileSecurity has true value in   Technical->Security || Step 3: Select Resource Tab - File, and add a new resource with local location file: \\<machine name>\Expert Imaging and select the save option (Ex: \\wsakl001458\Expert Imaging) | Expected: The resource path should show has a hierarchy in Security Manager. That is if a path is a child it should show as a child of the parent with selected default permission || Step 4: Select the File Policy tab, select <machine name> node and select 'allow all children' the read/Write/Delete permissions( or one of permissions. Select Save | Expected: Permissions are updated || Step 5: Add TTQA1 user to the File Policy, and Save changes. Go to Entity Manager/ AP and use the same Expert Imaging folder path | Expected: TTQA1 should now have access to the folder \\wsakl001458\Expert Imaging, but Other users should be restricted to all folder if they are not added to the policy..  Once the Permission is granted, all other paths not defined in File Security will be restricted to all users (Excluding Expert Share and Download folder which are allowlist) || Step 7: Select the File Policy tab, select <machine name> node and select 'deny children' the read/Write/Delete permissions( or one of the permissions). Select Save  . Go to Entity Manager/ AP and use the same Expert Imaging folder path | Expected: TTQA1 should now have Deny access to the folder \\wsakl001458\Expert Imaging.  Once the Permission is granted, all other paths not defined in File Security will be restricted to all users (Excluding Expert Share and Download folder which are allowlist) || Step 8: Select the File Policy tab, select <machine name> node and select 'Allow all  children' the read/Write/Delete permissions( or one of the permissions). Then add another Sub folder (Leaf folder) and deny permission to that folder. Select Save  . Go to Entity Manager/ AP and use the same Expert Imaging folder path | Expected: TTQA1 should now have access to the folder \\wsakl001458\Expert Imaging, except the specific subfolder that was denied.  Other users should be restricted to all folder if they are not added to the policy.  Once the Permission is granted, all other paths not defined in File Security will be restricted to all users (Excluding Expert Share and Download folder which are allowlist) || Step 9: Select the Resource Tab and delete Sub node , Select Save | Expected: Able to delete the node if File Security police is not active (No permission is enabled). If the policy is in use, an Error message is displayed. || Step 10: Select the Resource Tab and delete root node (parent) , select Save | Expected: Able to delete the root node and all children if File Security police is not active (No permission is enabled). If the policy is in use, an Error message is displayed.

Title: Web logout scenarios
Steps: Step 1: Login on EApro | Expected: Login successfully || Step 2: Logout via logout ribbon option | Expected: Successfully logged out and redirected to 'please close browser' screen(user/password screen on windows auth) || Step 3: Attempt to browse to the same app you just logged out of | Expected: Asked to sign in again via mfa, and can hit app home page (Will only see log in screen here on windows auth if incognito) || Step 4: Login to EAPro | Expected: Login successfully || Step 5: Complete any data provider search | Expected: Search result displateyed || Step 6: In browser tools, clear the '.openid' cookie , Than Attempt to fetch a result using the search dataprovider | Expected: Sign in dialog appears. New sign in tab will open. Once signed in, app page will refresh || Step 7: Login to EAPro | Expected: Login successfully || Step 8: Leave the web app for some time (approx 90min depending on environment), Attempt to fetch a result using the search data provider ) | Expected: App continues to work uninterrupted(or prompted to sign in again)

Title: Security Manager - Search tab should show new policies results even if there are broken permissions rows in FWA_Permisson
Steps: Step 1: To simulate broken permissions rows in FWA_Permission  Run script: declare @policyId uniqueidentifierselect @policyId = policyid from FWM_POLICY where POLICYNAME = 'EntityManager'insert into fwm_policyselect '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000','EntityManagerTemp',POLICYTYPE,CREATORID,TEMPLATEPOLICYID,'EntityManagerTemp',SOURCEFILE,OWNERID,PACKAGEID,ISDATA,ISACTIVE,getdate()from fwm_policy where POLICYID = @policyIdinsert into FWA_PERMISSION ([RESOURCERIGHTID],[POLICYID],[PERMISSIONTYPE],[ISBINDING],[ISDEFAULT],[ISTEMPLATED])select RESOURCERIGHTID, '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000', PERMISSIONTYPE, ISBINDING, ISDEFAULT, ISTEMPLATEDFrom FWA_PERMISSION where POLICYID = @policyId-- broken row for permission in policyinsert into FWA_PERMISSION ([RESOURCERIGHTID],[POLICYID],[PERMISSIONTYPE],[ISBINDING],[ISDEFAULT],[ISTEMPLATED])select '73D07AF7-5D10-4878-BB99-7EFBDAF14065', '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000', 1, 'N', 'N', 'N' | Expected: Setup completed || Step 2: Open Security Manager,. Add new  module policy and new data policy | Expected: New policies added successfully || Step 3: Select Search tab and verify new policies are listed in search results | Expected: New policies appears in search results || Step 4: For clean up  of broken permissions run script: delete FWA_PERMISSION where policyid in (select policyid from FWM_POLICY where POLICYNAME = 'EntityManagerTemp')delete FWM_POLICY where POLICYNAME = 'EntityManagerTemp' | Expected: Cleanup compleated

Title: Import Security policies
Steps:
Step 1: Remove policies from the database for SourceFile = 'Policies_CommonApplications.xml'  by running script: Delete FWM_POLICY
where  SourceFile = 'Policies_CommonApplications.xml' | Expected: Policies are deleted || Step 2: Open Deployment Manager and reimport CommonApplications.zip package from  Binaries\ExpertSource\Packages folder | Expected: Policies are reimported || Step 3: Check DB values for in FWM_POLICY for the reimported policies | Expected: The Rows should have isFile='N" || Step 4: Launch Security Manager and verify it displays default policies and it can be selected | Expected: Default policies are listed in Security Manager App

Enter a string of length over 8000 characters (a file with a string this long has been attached to linked bug)Attempt to save the client. | Expected: Able to save the client with no issues

Title: Expert Assistant - diagnostics Email
Steps: Step 1: Send email from Expert Assistant about box diagnostics button (not the logging screen). | Expected: Email is sent to recipient by setup email delivery option (Smpt/Exchange)

Title: Email sync - Found Time
Deploy / Validate / Remove buttons
Steps: Step 1: Select Validate button in DM, while no deployment applied | Expected: While validate flow is processed, Remove button and Deploy button are disabled || Step 2: Select Deploy environment (Any existing setup) | Expected: While Deployment , Remove button and validate button are disabled || Step 3: Select Validate button in DM, while no deployment applied | Expected: While validate flow is processed, Remove button and Deploy button are disabled || Step 4: Select Remove environment | Expected: While Deployment is removed , Deploy button and validate button are disabled

Title: IIS Settings setup - deployment
Steps: Step 1: Before deployment: Check system.webServer/security/authentication/windowsAuthentication setting, and verify authentication section is not locked | Expected: If enabled is set to false and authentication section is locked, then deployment will fail || Step 2: Check UseAppPoolCredentials  value after successful deployment (Expert_Local ->Configuration Editor -> system.webServer/security/authentication/windowsAuthentication ) | Expected: On Local /Single server value should  be false , on LB value should be true ( Since in LB service account must be used to decrypt incoming Kerberos data )

Title: Advanced options - Regenerate of manifest
Steps: Step 1: Open Advanced Option window of non deployed environment | Expected: Add Regenerate option is not displayed || Step 2: Open Advanced Option window of deployed environment | Expected: Add Regenerate option is displayed || Step 3: Select Add Regenerate button when no Manifest exists in install folder/Expert Share folder | Expected: Manifest file is generated in install folder and Expert Share folder || Step 4: Select Add Regenerate button again , when  Manifest exists in install folder  & Expert Share folder | Expected: Manifest file is generated and updated in install folder & Expert Share folder

Title: Environment Wizard  - Import
Steps: Step 1: Open DM, Select + Icon and Add new Environment with newly created DB | Expected: Environment Wizard flow has started || Step 2: Select Import button, and select environment file of existing environment (Exported from other environment) , Select Next | Expected: Environment Wizard is displaying configuration of existing environment, which can be edited if needed || Step 3: Finish wizard flow configuration | Expected: Environment Wizard flow window is closed || Step 4: Complete deployment | Expected: Deployment Completed successfully

Title: Schedule Manager - Large data  in FWM_SCHEDULE_AUDIT
Steps: Step 1: in  'FWM_SCHEDULE_AUDIT' Prepare different amount of data and rows , and run  sp_spaceused 'FWM_SCHEDULE_AUDIT' , Then Launch Schedule Manager | Expected: Measure the performance and behaviour for different loads   . Note : On client environment,expert 8.0 it is noticed  that  If the data is > 1GB, and the number of rows is >10,000, the amount of data takes too long to load and Schedule Manager times out

Title: Application Launch - Performance Test
Steps: Step 1: Measure each application launch time from Expert Share | Expected: Application launch time should be same or better, comparing to previous releases (Considering pre conditions of the tests are the same) || Step 2: Measure each application launch time from Launcher | Expected: Application launch time should be same or better, comparing to previous releases (Considering pre conditions of the tests are the same)

Title: Limited Roles Scenarios
Steps: Step 1: Deploy With Case/Web  only Role OR with Billing role but no office/expertTimeConnector | Expected: Microsoft.Identity.Client  file should be deployed to shared bin folder, and user should be able to send emails from Billing App || Step 2: Deploy without case selected as a roleAfter deployment, open a smartform with a dataproviderConfirm that the transaction type dp can be selected | Expected: Transaction type dp can be selected when case role is not deployed

Title: Message-to-Message service new encryption method
Steps: Step 1: In the Billing App, select an existing bill.Verify the evaluation rules and check the HTTP header accordingly in Fiddler/Debug View.Ensure that for the new HMAC encryption method, the header contains:SignatureDateOriginating UserIDConfirm that the evaluation rules complete successfully without errors.Repeat this step for various billing types with different rule types | Expected: The HTTP header for the new HMAC encryption method should include the following properties:SignatureDateOriginating UserIDEvaluation rules should complete successfully without any errors. || Step 2: After the deployment is complete, confirm that the user credentials configured in DM are successfully unpacked, and ensure that there are no issues accessing the services with these credentials. | Expected: User credentials should be unpacked correctly after deployment, allowing access to services without any issues. No errors in logs.

Title: Security Manager - Entity based security for Query Service
Steps: Step 1: Open the Entity tab and create a copy of the entity policy.Deny / Grant specific permissions for the entity in the policy.Add the user with p0 permission to the policy.Save the changes.Wait for 20 minutes (or until the IIS is reset).Open the Desktop app that uses that entity and verify that access has been limited according to setupOpen the Web app Page that uses that entity and verify that access has been limited according to setup | Expected: Desktop App & web app from the setup have limited access to the entity according to the setup permissions || Step 2: Open the Entity tab and create a copy of the entity policy.Deny / Grant specific permissions for the entity in the policy.Add the user with p1 permission to the policy.Save the changes.Wait for 20 minutes (or until the IIS is reset).Open the Desktop app that uses that entity and verify that access has been limited according to setupOpen the Web app Page that uses that entity and verify that access has been limited according to setup | Expected: Desktop App & web app from the setup have limited access to the entity according to the setup permissions || Step 3: Repeat the previous steps for different entity types & different Apps

Title: Schedule Manager- Prevent multiple adhoc triggers being created at once
Steps: Step 1: Select any job that takes awhile to execute , and Select 'Run immediately ' option 4-5 times  while it still running | Expected: Only one execution of the job will be triggered, and all others will be blocked. You can verify that but checking the triggeres entries In DB:  Select * FROM QRTZ_FIRED_TRIGGERSSelect * FROM QRTZ_TRIGGERS || Step 2: In Load Balance Environment, select any job and select Run  immediately ' option | Expected: The job is executed only once by one of the servers and not by both

Title: Expert Admin > System > Emails > Billing - Billing Emails with different Email Providers
Description: This test case tests all possible scenarios and combinations of email providers.There are three options when it comes to specifying the email providers for Billing actions (in System > Email > Billing): No Billing email specified - the actions will default to the email specified at the system level (System > Email) Only Bill Sender email specified - the other actions (e.g., Draft Bill, Prepare Prebill) will use the email specified in the Bill Sender. Email specified for each specific Bill actionNote that this excludes the Ebill Email Reader field - this will be covered in a separate test case: Test Case 289987: EBill Email Reader Email Provider (Exchange/O365)
Steps: Step 1: Prerequisites:- Set up email credentials in Expert Admin- Set up email formats for Billing- Set up DocuDraft || Step 2: Navigate to Expert Admin > Billing > Prepare > Bill/Prebill Email FormatAdd/Edit Email Bill/Prebill Formats | Expected: You can manually add/edit a format.Formats are added to TBM_FMT_EM (Bill) and TBM_FMT_EMP (Prebill). || Step 3: Ensure that the default file location has been specified in Admin app | Billing | Prepare | Docudraft Paths | Path to Output | Expected: The file is always created in the default location which must be a network shared location. || Step 4: --- Only System Email Specified --- || Step 5: In Expert Admin, navigate to System > Emails. || Step 6: Enter the following into available fields: AddressesSystem Email: @EmailOperations Email: "<your_email>@aderant.com"System Email ProviderEmail Provider:  @EmailProviderCredentials: Refer to Step 1Exchange URL (Exchange only): https://mail.aderant.com/EWS/Exchange.asmx SMTPAnonymous SMTP: YesSecurity: Start TLS (recommended)Host:- On-prem environment: "mail.aderant.com"- Sierra environment: "smtp.deltalegal.aderantcloudops.com"Port: 25 || Step 7: Open Expert Billing and navigate to the Prebill List grid. Select a prebill that is assigned to you and click @action in the ribbon bar. A SPOD displays. || Step 8: On the Output To field, select Email (Internal or External, if appropriate). Fill in the other required fields, and click Prepare Bill/Prepare Prebill/Draft Bill. | Expected: You will get a notification in the top corner once the job is done, and receive an email in your inbox. || Step 9: Check your inbox and confirm that you have received the email, and that all the specified details are correct. || Step 10: Repeat this with the other 2 email provider options, making sure to reset the services between || Step 11: ---- Only Bill Sender Email Specified ---- || Step 12: In Expert Admin, navigate to System > Email > Billing. Ensure that the "Use the System Email Provider for sending emails" checkbox is unchecked || Step 13: In the Bill Sender field, enter the following:Email Provider: @EmailProviderEmail Address: @EmailCredentials: See Step 2Click Save. || Step 14: If Expert Billing is open, close it and reopen it. || Step 15: Navigate to the Prebill List grid. Select a prebill that is assigned to you and click @action in the ribbon bar. A SPOD displays. || Step 16: On the Output To field, select Email (Internal or External, if appropriate). Fill in the other required fields, and click Prepare Bill/Prepare Prebill/Draft Bill. | Expected: You will get a notification in the top corner once the job is done, and receive an email in your inbox. || Step 17: Check your inbox and confirm that you have received the email, and that all the specified details are correct. || Step 18: Repeat this with the other 2 email provider options, making sure to reset the services in between || Step 19: ---- Bill Sender, Prebill Sender, Draft Bill Sender Specified ---- || Step 20: In Expert Admin, navigate to System > Email > Billing. Ensure that the "Use the System Email Provider for sending emails" checkbox is unchecked. || Step 21: In the Bill Sender field, enter the following:Email Provider: @EmailProviderEmail Address: @EmailCredentials: See Step 2Click Save. || Step 22: Repeat this for Prebill Sender and Draft Bill Sender, choosing the other two email providers. | Expected: The three actions will have three different email providers specified. || Step 23: If Expert Billing is open, close it and reopen it. || Step 24: Navigate to the Prebill List grid. Select a prebill that is assigned to you and click @action in the ribbon bar. A SPOD displays. || Step 25: On the Output To field, select Email (Internal or External, if appropriate). Fill in the other required fields, and click Prepare Bill/Prepare Prebill/Draft Bill. | Expected: You will get a notification in the top corner once the job is done, and receive an email in your inbox. || Step 26: Check your inbox and confirm that you have received the email, and that all the specified details are correct.

Title: Sending Emails to comma delimited Email addresses list Scenarios
Steps: Step 1: in Expert Admin ->System Workflow/Custom development setting, Enter few valid Email addresses with comma delimited, And select Save button. Open New File opening Workflow, Fill the form and assign the Task | Expected: Verify workflow email is sent to all emails on the list, and Emails were received || Step 2: in Expert Admin ->System Workflow/Custom development setting, Enter few valid Email addresses with comma delimited, And select Save button. Open a Task in Expert Assistant, and complete the task | Expected: Verify workflow email is sent to all emails on the list, and Emails were received || Step 3: Open Collection App-> Bill , Select Bill, Send Email to A group with multiple email addresses, with comma delimited | Expected: Verify workflow email is sent to all emails on the list, and Emails were received

Title: SignalR Connection
Steps: Step 1: Launch EAPro with Dev Tools Opens and check SignalR logs | Expected: On Dev tools you could see the log:  'SignalR state changed from: disconnected to: connecting " and later "SignalR state changed from: connecting to: connected" || Step 2: Open Fiddler and Launch EApro, Check SignalR logs | Expected: SignalR log  has  Authorization header and connect request return 200, and connection icon change to WebSocket || Step 3: Repeat the previous step with each of the desktop App | Expected: SignalR log  has  Authorization header and connect request returns 200, and connection icon change to WebSocket

Title: Expert Account Payable - EWS Adapter
Steps: Step 1: Complete setup according to attached document for EWS Adapter - AP section | Expected: Email setup for AP is set correctly, || Step 2: in ExpertAccountsPayable - Send Email using  Accounts Payable > Payments/Payment Schedules > Select a payment > Email Remittance Advices in the ribbon panel | Expected: Email is sent with no error. Verify Email has received correctly || Step 3: in ExpertAccountsPayable - Send Email tio invalid email address format using  Accounts Payable > Payments/Payment Schedules > Select a payment > Email Remittance Advices in the ribbon panel | Expected: Email is not sent, validation error is displayed || Step 4: in ExpertAccountsPayable - Send Email tio valid email address but with wrong Email adapter setup Accounts Payable > Payments/Payment Schedules > Select a payment > Email Remittance Advices in the ribbon panel | Expected: Email is not sent, user friendly error is displayed in log || Step 5: in ExpertAccountsPayable - Setup valid email addresses in Admin > Image Recognition > Accounts Payable > Image Sources and verify Image recognition feature can read it correctly . Send email to valid user account using image recognition. | Expected: Email is sent with no error. Verify Email has received correctly || Step 6: Send email to using image recognition with wrong Email adapter setup | Expected: Email is not sent, user friendly error is displayed in log
